job_description.0: You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.  Responsibilities • Collaborate with team leader and senior data scientists, as well as clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, problems and objectives. • Understand data structures and business and extract and integrate required data sources for analysis according to business requirements. • Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions, including undertaking data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, evaluation, deployment, and maintenance. • Collaborate with senior data scientists and team leader and clients to productise and pilot analytical models for production and insight per clients required. • Undertake cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders. • Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes.  Qualifications • Solid background, knowledge and capabilities in statistics, mathematics, computer science, informatics, computing, or closely relevant scientific field. • Experienced in data-driven analytics hands-on experience with deep know-how of predictive modeling, machine learning and data mining, and relevant modeling approaches and algorithms. • Demonstrated capabilities to develop and evaluate statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data-driven solutions to problems in new domains. • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL (data extraction and manipulation), expertise in SAS programming, and software development skills in one to several scripting languages (Python/R). • Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage with a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams. • Demonstrated capabilities to work effectively as a member of a data science project team. • Demonstrated experience for independent problem-solving and self-motivated innovation, education and services. job_description.1: International Tourism And Transport Company  ASX 200 Listed with 11,000+ employees globally  About Us  Competitive salary and benefits package  Kelsian Group Limited (Kelsian) is an ASX200 listed business with over 11,000 employees across Australia, Singapore, United Kingdom and United States of America.  At Kelsian Group Limited, we are more than just a company – we are a team of dedicated professionals committed to innovation, growth, and positive change. With a strong commitment to our employees and a vision for a brighter future, we're poised for continued success in the years ahead.  About the Role - Bridge the Gap between Data & Business Insights  We are on the hunt for a unique blend of technical prowess and business insight - a data professional who thrives on solving complex challenges and influencing key stakeholders. This position offers the opportunity to work hand-in-hand with our Group CEO and senior leadership team, directly addressing their most pressing data concerns. Additionally, you will work closely with our data team to play a pivotal role in furthering our long-term data agenda.  Reporting To • Group CEO (2 days a week) • D&A Lead (3 days a week)  Your Role Entails • Engage in consultations with business users to grasp their reporting needs and translate them into actionable solutions. • Collaborate with and influence other teams to encourage sound and practical data capture and reporting processes. • Design, develop, and deploy reports utilizing a range of tools, especially Incorta and Excel. • Dive deep into data sources, understanding their intricacies and ensuring their optimal use. • Empower and coach business users, enhancing their data literacy and promoting the use of the developed solutions. • Collaborate with the data team, contributing to larger projects. • Consistently create and update vital documentation, ensuring clarity and accessibility.  Essential Traits  What Sets You Apart: • Rapid adaptability to new tools and data sources. • An unyielding commitment to customer service. • Hands-on experience with BI toolsets (such as Incorta, SQL, PowerBI, Tableau). • Profound understanding of the art of science of data visualisation and metrics. • Demonstrated ability to manage time effectively amidst competing priorities.  Desirable Traits • Direct experience with Incorta. • Expertise in data modelling and architecture. • Fluency in BI-related languages (e.g. Python). • Familiarity with cloud technologies, particularly AWS. • Proven record of positively influencing, coaching, and guiding non-technical stakeholders.  Why Join Us  This is a unique opportunity to work directly with our most senior leaders, influence key business decisions, and be at the forefront of a data-driven transformation. With dual reporting lines, your work will have immediate visibility and impact, offering you a platform for unparalleled professional growth.  If you have a background in data and computer science, a consulting mindset, and are looking to make waves in a dynamic environment, we want to hear from you!  How To Apply  We are requesting your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the best person for this position.  Click APPLY and fill in as much information as you can in the track record section of the application, paying close attention to each question.  Applicants must have the appropriate work visa and must not have any restrictions to their entitlement to work.  Don't miss this opportunity to lead the charge in shaping our future. Apply today and be a part of something extraordinary!  Applications close by 5pm Monday 23 October 2023  Kelsian Group is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
job_description.2: • ASX Listed Energy Company - Adelaide Head Office • Competitive package + bonus + benefits + flexibility • Mid-size company: big enough for opportunities, small enough to get things done.  At Beach Energy, we are dedicated to advancing exploration and subsurface technologies and we are committed to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in our field, and we are now seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Exploration and Subsurface (E&S) team.  About the Role  You will play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights through data engineering techniques. Leveraging your expertise in SQL and Python, you will collaborate closely with our multidisciplinary team to engineer, integrate, analyse, and interpret data, contribute to decision-making processes, and drive the success of our exploration and subsurface projects.  Key responsibilities will include: • Utilising a strong skill set in working with SQL Server, including data manipulation, advanced SQL query-building, spatial geometry management, and CRS (coordinate reference system) management in datasets. • Developing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to automate data transformation workflows, addressing critical information needs and enhancing efficiency. • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and develop effective solutions using on-prem and cloud technologies. • Demonstrating competency in developing data models spanning from conceptual to physical, crucial for implementing business information workflows. • Managing and overseeing SQL databases, ensuring smooth operation, high availability, and optimal performance.  About You  Success in our multidisciplinary team environment requires effective collaboration. The ideal candidate should be a team player, capable of communicating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and working seamlessly with professionals from diverse backgrounds.  A solid foundation in SQL and Python is essential for this role. The candidate should demonstrate expertise in writing logical SQL queries and effective Python scripting according to the industry standards. Familiarity with data visualisation tools will be advantageous.  You will need: • Effective communication skills with the ability to understand business information requirements and present complex data insights in a clear and understandable manner. • Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills. • Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Spotfire, Power BI and ArcGIS Portal) is a plus. • Knowledge of geoscience concepts and terminology is desirable but not mandatory.  About Us  Beach Energy is an ASX listed oil and gas exploration and production company. Founded in 1961, our head office is in Adelaide, and we operate in several locations in Australia and in New Zealand.  Beach’s purpose is to ‘sustainably deliver energy for communities. That means we are committed to a just and sustainable energy transition whilst maintaining high health, safety, and environmental standards. See our actions and plans in our Sustainability Report.  How to Apply  Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.  Please submit your application, cover letter and updated CV by 19 October 2023.  For this opportunity you must be eligible to work in Australia.

job_description.4: • A position that's professionally rewarding | Commencing January 2024 • Access to Mentoring, Coaching and Industry Expertise • Full Time, 2-Year Fixed Term Graduate Program Opportunity. Requests for part-time hours may be considered.  About the Opportunity  As part of the Adelaide Economic Development Agency (AEDA), you will learn and develop on the job and through a tailored development program, while making a tangible contribution to our team and the City of Adelaide (CoA) more broadly. You will review macroeconomic conditions as well as activity levels in the city including consumer expenditure behaviour, foot-traffic, public transport usage, e-scooter trips, as well as parking and other indicators.  Some of the things you'll see yourself doing with us are: • Analysing qualitative and quantitative data using Excel or other programs such as PowerBI, Tableau, R, ai, etc. • Compiling high quality, robust and professional designed reports and briefing notes. • Assisting in producing or maintaining statistical models, and assisting in designing data visualisations. • Participating in and contributing to all graduate program projects, training, and other undertakings.  Why Our Graduate Program?  Our graduate program gives you a great opportunity to start building your career, while having our genuine impact on our City and our communities. As a capital city council, we have wide-ranging responsibilities, so you'll be exposed to many different industries. This includes everything from community wellbeing to urban planning, events to infrastructure, lifestyle experiences to heritage, economic development to climate action, corporate services and many more.  Apart from gaining valuable insight into what makes our community unique, you will also have access to a wide range of benefits such as: • Flexible work arrangements • A range of health & wellbeing offerings • On-site gym and chill-out areas • Social Club events where you get to connect with other colleagues  For more information about what it's like to work for the City of Adelaide, including the benefits, please visit www.cityofadelaide.com.au/careers  About You  To be successful in this role you will have: • Graduated within approximately the last 2 years or are expecting to graduate within approximately the next 6 months, with a degree in Economics, Data Science, Commerce, Mathematics or related field. • An understanding of economic indicators at a council level. • Ability to analyse data, find insights and present information concisely. • Well-developed verbal and written skills to be able to construct high quality written work/reports. • Strong organisational skills, the ability to successfully manage competing priorities, maintain attention to detail and meet deadlines. • A commitment to ongoing professional development, continuous learning, and to building your career.  About Us  Located in the geographic heart of Kaurna Country, the City of Adelaide celebrates its cultural heritage, unique natural surrounds and structures its footprint in a way that allows it to adapt to the changing needs of the community and a dynamic global landscape. Our focus is on our community's wellbeing and quality of life - investing in city improvements and on future planning, so we continue to design a liveable city where future generations can continue to live authentic and meaningful lives. This is an exciting opportunity to join our team and be a bigger part of our amazing city!  To find out what our people love about what they do please watch this video.  AEDA works closely with businesses, industry groups, the state government and other relevant organisations to deliver a range of programs designed to stimulate the city's economic growth. AEDA's focus is investment attraction, growing our visitor economy, residential growth, marketing the city as a whole and promoting Rundle Mall as Adelaide's premier shopping destination.  At the City of Adelaide, we thrive in an environment that is welcoming, inclusive and safe, and celebrates difference. We value and embrace our diverse perspectives and recognise the value diversity has in fuelling innovation and enabling brilliant experiences for our diverse community.  For Further Enquiries & How to Apply  All enquiries regarding this position will remain private and confidential and can be directed to Jordon Tomopoulos on 08 8203 7563.  Please submit a Resume, a copy of your academic transcript, and a Cover Letter expressing the skills, experience and qualities you can bring to this position addressed to Jordon Tomopoulos, Economic Research & Data Analyst.  Please review the position description prior to submitting an application by following the prompts to apply.  Applications close at 11.59pm, 15 October 2023.  Please be advised this is a full-time, two-year fixed term opportunity with a starting salary at the Level 3 Classification commencing at $77,210 11% superannuation.  We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, and people living with disability to apply.  We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive workplace. If you require assistance with our recruitment process, please call our People Services team on (08) 8203 7333.
job_description.5: If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?  What's in it for you?  We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.  You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  What We're Looking For  Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.  Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.  Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.  Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.  Run human centred design sessions with end-users.  Communicating and influencing stakeholders.  Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  Skills And Attributes For Success  Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.  Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.  Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.  Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems.  Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.  Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.  Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.
job_description.6: Join an organisation with strong values, a community focus and a great culture!  About the Team  The Lending Quality Team is responsible for reviewing the accuracy of all inputs to Credit Ratings and Security Ratings prior to approval and reviewing and providing coaching and feedback on credit submissions processed via the Business and Agribusiness teams. The focus of the team is a proactive measure to: • Support the Bank to ensure well managed portfolios are maintained. • Ensure ongoing quality of the non-retail portfolio; and • Generate a circle of continuous improvement through sharing of best practice.  About the role:  As the Lending Quality and Data Analyst you will be responsible for collating quantitative data of reviewed applications within the business customer portfolio and identifying trends for process and capability uplift opportunities.  Key responsibilities will include: • Providing feedback to the Lending Quality Coaches, your leader, and other key stakeholders in analysis by identifying and making recommendations to the broader business on opportunities to address capability gaps and education needs. • Developing insights and providing future strategies to key stakeholders based on findings and observations from the quantitative quality review data. • Advocating for changes and ensuring change is adhered to, this may be procedural, system or people related. • Completing remediation activities in line with the defined instructions provided to uplift the overall quality of data in the environment.  The data quality process is a governed activity enabling insights and trends across our business, detailing areas of focus to increase capability, unblock bottlenecks in teams and identify themes of focus for continuous improvement.  Does this sound like you? • Demonstrated experience in statistical visualisation and interpretation of data. • Strong strategic application of data and insights, with the ability to translate complex analytics into actionable insights. • Proficiency with using Microsoft Office products specifically advanced in Excel & Word. • Ability to develop and maintain relationships with Business Banking and Credit Risk team members, to provide an understanding of key risks identified within reviews and follow up that recommended remediation has occurred. • Critical thinking analysis and ability to communicate outcomes. • Ability to work as part of a remote team  About Bendigo Bank  With more than 160 years of history, we are proud of our position in the community with more satisfied customers than any other Australian bank. Every day, we work hard to bring our company purpose to life; feeding into the success of our customers and communities and not off it.  We're more than just a bank with banking products. We change the lives of customers and communities. Commercial actions with heart!  Our time is now. We are challenging the status quo and we're excited about our future!  Why us?  There's so much more to a career with Bendigo and Adelaide Bank than just banking.  Get real benefits, work life balance and flexibility. You bring your brilliant mind, and we’ll help you take your learning to the next level with on-the-job training and external development opportunities - we want you to shine. After all, YOU are the difference that makes us the better big bank.  We believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness, injury or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.  So, if you’re excited to be part of an organisation with strong values and a community focus apply now!
job_description.7: We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.  This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task. Requirements Full Professional Proficiency in English You must be living in Australia the last 2 consecutive years Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Australia Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance) Applicants must be 18 years or over. Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks. Why Join the TELUS International AI Community? Earn extra income Access to our community wellbeing initiative Remote work & Location Independence Be your own boss Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle Be a part of an online community
job_description.8: Careers that Change Lives  Join the Global Operations & Supply Chain organization as a Principle Advanced Analytics Analyst for the Supplier Transfer Optimization Program (STOP), an Enterprise-wide strategic program to strengthen Medtronics supply base excellence through strategic negotiation and transfers to preferred suppliers.  Through this program, you will help build a pipeline of supplier transfer activities that will improve supplier performance and quality while delivering margin expansion across Medtronic.  This role will partner with business stakeholders to understand and solve business problems. Primarily they are responsible for building insights and analytics while providing subject matter expertise, technical knowledge, and analytic product ownership.  They will create user workflows analytics and insights and bring them to life.  The role supports Centers of Excellence (COE) as well as tactical business users. The mission of this role is to contribute to the building of GO&SC INSIGHTS to drive for best-in-class practices and tools for Global Operations & Supply Chain.  The role will also need to work hand in hand with the Analytics Development Team & the Data Services Team to manage the creation and deployment of solutions that simplify our customers processes and generate insights that align with our customers goals.  This role requires you to be the user of your tools and generate insights to share with the business.  This role needs to provide excellent customer service in a way that helps our stakeholders perform at their very best. This role needs to empower our stakeholders to perform at their very best.  The role will move with decisiveness and courage, drive experimentation and calculated risk taking to create solutions that are simple and innovative that are the best possible for our stakeholders.  Furthermore, the role needs to seek out best practices, educate our stakeholders, and be an agent of change within the organization to educate and drive data-based decisions and workflows for our stakeholders.  Open to fully remote for the right candidate, but we prefer location near any US based Medtronic facility.  A Day in the Life • Lead ideation and creation of analytical solutions for STOP. • Capture requirements and enhance analytical processes as the primary business liaison. • Collaborate across cross-functional teams. • Drive development and deployment of analytics for productivity, decision-making, and competitiveness. • Ensure alignment with End-to-End supply chain focus and business objectives. • Support and drive analytics initiatives. • Promote adoption and usage of analytics tools. • Support tool training. • Ensure timely delivery of solutions. • Generate insights for business use cases. • Travel : Up to 25% or quarterly.  To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident in your applicant profile.  Must Have : Minimum Requirements • Bachelor's degree. • 7 years of supply chain and operations analytics experience (or 5 years with an advanced degree).  Nice to Have • SQL or Oracle Developer experience • PowerBI visualization experience. • PowerApps and Power Automate experience. • Agile environment experience. • Regulated industry experience (e.g., Medical Device). • Strong ability to influence and drive projects to completion.  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life.  We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team.  Lets work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  A commitment to our employees lives is at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create.  We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage.  Learn more about our benefits here ( .  This position is eligible for a short-term incentive plan. Learn more about Medtronic Incentive Plan (MIP) here .  The base salary range is applicable across the United States, excluding Puerto Rico and specific locations in California.  The offered rate complies with federal and local regulations and may vary based on factors such as experience, certification / education, market conditions, and location.  Compensation and benefits information pertains solely to candidates hired within the United States (local market compensation and benefits will apply to others).  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles : While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile.  The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role.  ADA-United States of America).  Min Salary  114000  Max Salary  171000  It is the policy of Medtronic to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and / or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.  In addition, Medtronic will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. job_description.9: • ASX Listed Energy Company - Adelaide Head Office • Unique Adelaide based accounting opportunity. • Competitive package and benefits  Beach Energy is an Adelaide based ASX-listed energy company pursuing an exciting growth strategy. We are seeking a tertiary qualified analyst with an interest in energy markets to join the Finance team responsible for Beach’s petroleum sales from existing production assets.  About the Role  Reporting to the Finance Manager (VIC/NZ), the Business Analyst will be responsible for Financial and Joint Venture accounting within the Beach Capital Portfolio, comprising Stay in Business expenditure within the Operations function and Capital expenditure within the Exploration & Subsurface (E&S), and Development functions. This will include the preparation and analysis of accounting statements, reports, and reconciliations for operated and non-operated Joint Ventures.  The role partners with the Senior Business Analysts within the Finance team, and the Project Services team to ensure alignment between project cost control and finance requirements. Additionally, this role encompasses development and stewardship of Capital financial governance, compliance policies and processes, including Asset Recognition and Capitalisation, Prepayments and Project Inventory.  Key Responsibilities will include: • Delivering timely and accurate monthly reporting of operated joint ventures, including review of contribution and other general ledger account reconciliations • Preparing account reconciliations supporting the balance sheet statements, including responding to audit requests. • Preparing and distributing expenditure statements for Joint Ventures and manage queries from JV partners. • Cash calling of external Joint Venture partners, in accordance with JOA requirements, including monitoring financial position of partners as appropriate and following up to ensure funds are received. • Coordinating Joint Venture audits requested by the non-operator Joint Venture partners. • Month end ledger close including the preparation and posting of accounting entries. • Maintaining fixed asset registers including governance of useful lives, depreciation, asset disposals and additions in SAP  About You  The person we are seeking will be an enthusiastic self-starter looking for variety within a role and development through exposure to experienced industry peers. An adept attention to detail, and an ability to work both independently and as part of a team.  You will also need: • Tertiary qualifications in accounting and CA/CPA qualified. • Experience covering joint venture and management accounting. • An ability to build relationships with a variety of stakeholders. • Capability operating under tight timeframes and pressure. • Strong interpersonal and communication skills including clear and concise writing skills. • Proven SAP experience.  About Us  Beach Energy is an ASX listed oil and gas exploration and production company. Founded in 1961, our head office is in Adelaide, and we operate in several locations in Australia and in New Zealand.  Beach’s purpose is to ‘sustainably deliver energy for communities’ and we are committed to producing the energy needed for a sustainable transition – one that supports the needs of societies today, and into the future. See our actions and plans in our Sustainability Report.  How to Apply  Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.  Please submit your application, cover letter and updated CV by 20 October 2023.  For this opportunity you must be eligible to work in Australia.
job_description.10: Job Requisition ID: 34768  Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best  Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career  Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts  We are seeking a talented Reporting & Insights Analyst with experience in Tableau and a passion for data to join our Client, Industries & Markets enablement team. This role can be based in any major city, and we offer excellent flexible working arrangements.  What will your typical day look like? As a Reporting and Insights Consultant, you will enhance existing, and develop new business performance reporting, in Tableau, for stakeholders across Deloitte, including senior executive leaders. Working with the wider team, you will independently translate business requirements into quantitative metrics, with our boarder team looking to you, as an expert on all things Tableau and data. You will answer the ‘Why’ and ‘So What’ for our internal stakeholders, investigating trends and outliers within large datasets.  About us At Deloitte, delivering impactful work and experiences to our clients is central to everything we do. We do this by being client issues-led, seamlessly integrating our capabilities to show up as one Deloitte, with relevance, impact and differentiation.  This role is internal facing and is part of the Client, Industries & Markets (CI&M) enablement team, supporting the CI&M Executive who oversee our go-to-market strategy and client interface for the Firm.  Enough about us, lets talk about you  You are someone with experience in gathering and analysing data sets to translate problems into actionable insights and recommendations.  With your commercial acumen, you are familiar with financial terminology and the reporting requirements of a business. Strong analytical capabilities and structured problem-solving skills are your strength, you can independently curate dashboard content and tell compelling data stories.  Specifically, you should have:  Demonstrated experience translating business problems into actionable dashboard views (from initial scoping to delivery)  Demonstrated experience developing dashboards in Tableau (12 Months + experience), and in building data models in excel.  12 months + experience working with varying levels of stakeholders and working with a business to develop/ mature reporting to meet asks.  Excellent communication skills with an ability to communicate at all levels.  Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
job_description.11: • Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM  face2face reference: 591408  Location: Nationwide - Remote  Hours: Full-time  Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline  Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super  About the role:  The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.  The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.  Duties: • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Required experience/skills: • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.  Desirable experience skills: • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment.  If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you.  Lisa Whitehorn  02 6199 5750  TeamICT@f2frecruitment.com.au  Excited about this role but don’t believe your experience perfectly matches all job specifications? Why not examine your transferable skills? If they position you as a strong, quality candidate, it’s well worth applying for the position. Submitting your resume has the added bonus of getting your name in the mix for opportunities we fill without even advertising. All you have to do is send your resume to TeamICT@f2frecruitment.com.au.
job_description.12: About us  Saab Australia is a defence, security and cyber solutions provider, specialising in the development and integration of major defence and security systems. For over 30 years in Australia, we have built a reputation for delivering complex systems integration projects that provide proven and advanced capabilities to keep us ahead of today's challenges.  From combat, communications, security and underwater systems, to mixed reality, cyber security and deployable health solutions, our extensive portfolio of products and services provide high-technology solutions for defence forces and civil industries across the globe.  Apply today to join our crew and deliver solutions with purpose.  The role  As part of our Maritime group, the Business Analyst will be response for developing processes, tools and systems to support EPA (Enterprise Partnership Agreement) and WAMA (Warship Asset Management Agreement) programs in consultation with key stakeholders. This role is directly responsible for implementing, improving and sustaining processes, methodologies, tools and training to others with skills to enhance project and program performance and reporting.  Further, the successful candidate will: • Consult with stakeholders, develop and maintain EPA and WAMA program level cost, schedule and risk reporting regime. • Develop, implement and manage processes, systems and tools support the EPA performance measurement and reporting framework. • Carry out detailed analysis of current processes, systems, tools and data integrity, identify issues and improvement opportunities and influence the uptake of improvements. • Conduct training for business system, processes and tools. • Ensure disparate information sources are validated, cohesively consolidated and aggregated to appropriate levels for management reporting. • Understand the customer, management and project leadership reporting requirements and develop fit-for-purpose management reporting dashboards using multiple system inputs and automated data gathering tools (where appropriate) for reliable and consistent reporting outcomes. • Investigate and assess opportunities to automate processes, developing professional, clear and concise business cases for management review to support improvement initiatives.  Flexible work arrangements such as hybrid work from home / office, 9 day fortnight and part time (0.8 FTE minimum) will be considered for this role.  About you  Your skills and experience will include: • Degree (or Certificate IV minimum) qualified in project management, IT, engineering or business. • Extensive business analysis experience within an engineering & project execution organisation, specifically within the defence or resources industries on complex major capital projects. • Demonstrated understanding and application of best practice business processes, including establishing and maintaining the performance reporting at a program level for the client/customer along with internal management stakeholders. • Strong acumen with Excel PowerPivots, database establishment and management and SharePoint development along with Power BI experience to establish robust and reliable performance reporting to support the program controls functions in reporting planning, scheduling, budget & cost management, risk and opportunity management. • Previous experience working within the Defence network system would be advantageous.  As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain a NV1 clearance or a minimum of a Baseline clearance.  Culture and benefits  We employ over 700 Australians and are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and enriching the employee experience.  By joining Saab, you'll be a part of a collaborative and supportive organisation, where your professional growth and work-life balance are emphasised. You'll work within an innovative and vibrant workplace, while having the opportunity to develop a long-term, fulfilling career.  For further information about at career at Saab, visit the page adjacent:  Applications  Click 'Apply' to submit your CV and cover letter in support of your application. You may contact our careers team at for a copy of the full position description. Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and in exceptional circumstances, the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement. We encourage applications as early as possible to avoid disappointment.  Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply. We also welcome applications from individuals with culturally diverse backgrounds.  Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans' Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.
job_description.13: !--Already done in event tracking js --!-- --!-- --  Job Opportunities  Analyst Job no: 512763 Work type: Fixed term - Full-time Campus: Adelaide HEO6, Planning & Analytics (HEO6) $86,360 to $93,285 per annum plus an employer contribution of 17% superannuation applies.  Fixed term, full-time opportunity available until November 2024, with the possibility of extension (maternity leave backfill).  Be part of a reporting team providing HR data to a broad range of stakeholders and analytics that contribute to organisational decision making and improvements.  The University of Adelaide is seeking to appoint an Analyst who is passionate about data, data insights, analytics and reporting. An individual who continuously pursues opportunities to improve data accessibility and accuracy.  Working under general direction, the Analyst is a specialist in statutory, strategic and operational reporting, responsible for statutory and strategic data submissions, workforce reporting, HR dashboard metrics and ad hoc reporting. The Analyst analyses and collates HR data and presents reports to enable decision makers to make informed choices in response to current and emerging business requirements. The role is based within the Planning and Analytics function with a close working relationship across the Human Resource branch, so those with HR experience are encouraged to apply.  To be successful you will need: • Demonstrated expertise in use of reporting tools and report writing. • Strong data analytics capability with advanced excel skills and confidence in interpreting and presenting complex data and insights. • Ability to scrutinise and interpret definitions for data collections. • Sound oral and written communication skills, with demonstrated ability to work collaboratively to develop creative solutions and achieve positive outcomes. • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to document and analyse existing business systems, processes, and workflows to recommend improvements relevant to the University environment.  Enjoy an outstanding career environment The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaboration - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.  It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. Our work’s cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.  Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.  We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal and family life.  In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.  Learn more at:
job_description.14: Could the skills you build here unlock doors anywhere?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.  The opportunity  Due to continued success and growth, an exciting opportunity exists for a Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager to join our highly regarded People Advisory Services team.  Our team works as a well-integrated national team, where you’ll have the opportunity to work with Australian-based and multinational clients across the country, therefore offering you the ability to work with large corporates, and a diverse range of industries. In this role, you will have access to training, coaching and support that’s available to help grow your career even further!  This role is open to various locations - Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, and Perth.  What’s in it for you?  As our Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager - your responsibilities will include: • Modelling of various Industrial Instrument (including Enterprise Bargaining Agreements, Industry Awards etc.) for wage compliance projects; • Modelling of superannuation and Pay-As-You-Go Withholding data modelling projects (including the preparation of superannuation guarantee charge statements and voluntary disclosure letters); • Liaise directly with clients and other regulatory authorities (e.g. Australian Taxation Office, Fair Work Australia etc.) in the delivery of data projects; • Work with different parts of the business in driving growth in the global mobility data analytics practice; • Preparing & presenting training seminars to both clients and team members.  What we’re looking for  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go. • Degree in Data Analytics/Commerce, or similar; • Between 1-5 years’ experience in a data analytics discipline (focused towards wage compliance and employment taxes remediation); • Experience with Alteryx at the intermediate or advanced level; • Experience with data visualisation software such as Power BI and Tableau; • Experience with SQL, Python, and other database/coding languages [preferred]; • Ability to lead and mentor junior members of our team; • Commitment to excellence in client service, with the ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.  What we can offer you • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment • Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness • Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.  EY | Building a better working world  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.
job_description.15: See job description for details  Join this global innovator in packaging solutions! Your new company  This reputable company based in Adelaide offers a collaborative environment and are currently seeking an experienced Data Engineer to join their dynamic team.  Your new role  You'll support the business with its Information Management processes (including data management, PowerBI report development, and user administration) and works across the business with subject matter experts and IT Teams to help turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions.  You'll be responsible for: • Gathering requirements and undertake analysis and subsequent report development using PowerBI. • Support existing reporting structures and platforms. • Support data improvement and integration opportunities across our systems • Understand business process and decision making. • Work with subject experts to document key process and reporting specifications. • Support process performance analysis and decision making with necessary reporting. • Work on highly complex, cross functional and enterprise IT and BI solutions. What you'll need to succeed  You will have demonstrated Data Engineering experience, with the ability to understand requirements, conduct analysis, testing and deliver solutions to all levels of the business. You'll will also have: • Experience in understanding data design and architecture principles. • Ability to engage and educate non-technical functions with Microsoft BI knowledge and data principles. • Ability to understand complex process and system relationships. • Ability to explore data and discover patterns, meaningful relationships, anomalies and trends. • Commitment to data quality and cleansing. • Commitment to continuous improvement and process excellence. job_description.16: This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Australia  "  edX, part of 2U Inc., works with respected universities and organizations to deliver innovative, skills-based training to a community of over 45 million learners around the world to support them at every stage of their lives and careers. edX delivers boot camps through an immersive learning experience with expert services and valuable resources. As of 2021, graduates have been hired by 6,700+ companies, including more than 62% of the Fortune 100.  The Job:  2U is seeking a Data Science professional who has a passion for making a difference. Our students have a diverse background, from working professionals to recent college graduates who seek to transition into careers in Big Data. Instructors will have a direct hand in changing the lives of our students.  This is a fully remote, part-time position.  Why teach with us?  Instructors, with the help of Teaching Assistants; lead classroom discussions, emphasize the meta-skills and core concepts, support students in their projects and challenges, and provide feedback to students. You don't have to have a ton of experience with teaching! You just have to be a lifelong learner, proven teacher or mentor, or love to help people change their lives to succeed.  What You Will Do: • Lead online lectures following a detailed lesson plan that includes an active discussion environment and project-based learning • Bring the learning experience to life by building community and enhancing relevance by drawing on your own industry experience • Translate complex subject matter in a clear and concise manner for a diverse range of learners or skill levels • Provide support and encouragement to students as they go through a life-changing experience • Create an engaging, positive, and inclusive learning environment for our students • Increase participant engagement using different facilitation tactics • Guide large and small groups of learners in an empathetic manner • Amplify student satisfaction by creating a positive classroom culture • Communicating timely with students and leveraging effective interventions by sharing resources  Skills & Requirements: • Bachelor's Degree Preferred • Minimum of 5 years of work experience in Data Science • Completion of background check with satisfactory results, determined at edX’s discretion, is required • Must have a laptop, camera, at least one additional monitor, microphone / headset, and reliable internet access. • A positive attitude • Ability to deliver lesson plans provided by 2U • Share your own professional experiences and industry insight with the students • Be able to infuse empathy, support, encouragement, and fun into the student experience  Proficiency in the following is required: • Python Programming - Python, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib • Databases - MySQL and MongoDB • Business Intelligence Software - Tableau • Advanced Topics - Big Data Analytics with Hadoop, and Machine Learning  Preferred but not required: • Front End Web Visualization - HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript Charting, and D3.js  Logistics: • 24-week program (this is a part-time commitment) • Class Schedule: M/T/TH • Class Times: 6:00 - 10:15pm (includes office hours and break) • Classes are taught live online  Perks: • Maintain your current career while teaching • Hone your skills by teaching and mentoring others • Expand your network by joining the thousands of industry professionals who make up our instructional staff • Experience the gratitude and fulfillment that comes along with teaching and giving back to the tech community  Hourly salary only: In Australia, the anticipated hourly salary for this role is $43.92/hr - $45.06/hr. Note: The final compensation for this position may consider factors including the geographic location where the work is performed (candidate’s assigned office) and prior work experience of the candidate. • 2U Diversity and Inclusion Statement*  At 2U, we are committed to building and sustaining a culture of belonging, respect, and inclusion. We are proud of the steps we’ve taken to bring together an employee base that embodies diverse walks of life, ideas, genders, ages, races, cultures, sexual orientations, abilities and other unique qualities. We strive to offer a workplace where every employee feels empowered by what makes us different, as well as by how we are alike.  2U is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or accommodations, please reach out to us at: ask2ubenefits@2u.com. • You must apply in your FULL LEGAL NAME* Your full legal name must be the EXACT name and spelling as listed on your government issued ID Card, birth certificate, name change order, adoption decree, naturalization or immigration documentation. Initials are not acceptable unless initials are part of your full legal name.  "This offer from "edX" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 77% flex score.
job_description.17: About Us  It’s an exciting time for Discovery Parks. Since our inception in 2004 we have experienced extensive growth. We currently own and operate over 65 Holiday and workforce Parks throughout Australia and employ over 1100 people. Discovery Parks has recently acquired Australia’s largest network of parks – Top Parks.  At the heart of Discovery Parks are happy people: happy customers and happy staff. We are building a passionate, adaptable, high performance team that works together to help our customers discover what matters.  The Role  Discovery Holiday Parks is embracing the new normal and is undertaking an historic transformation to build the Park and Digital Experience of the future. Accordingly, significant investment is being made into technology and business processes to develop custom attribution and predictive models focusing on customer behavior across our entire accommodation network. This is an incredibly exciting opportunity to use the latest Microsoft tools and technologies to drive actionable insights to add value to the business.  The Data Scientist will apply the latest data science techniques within the context of our customers and business, to improve customer experience and drive returns.  This role will require you to;  · Lead the team that provides customer insights to the business across the customer journey  · Apply your broad skill-set across data and analytics to understand business problems, create insights and provide practical solutions  · Provide business solutions and optimisation through various statistical and quantitative methods  · Provide statistical models to support predictive analytics and deliver non-technical presentations to all levels of the business as well as technical documentation to the wider team  · Identify and develop the capability to track detailed competitor data and leverage existing internal data to inform smart customer lead decision making  · Conduct investigative analytics reports to inform the customer journey experience  · Liaise closely with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders, you will have a collaborative personal style and be commercial as well as customer focused  Your Experience  A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Finance, Economics along with working knowledge of data science, analytics, or data engineering is essential to the success of this role.  To be successful in this role you will have proficiency and experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques combined with a high level of proficiency with programming languages used in data science. You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills which will be utilised when working across cross function teams and external stakeholders.  You will possess a high level of energy, self-motivation, autonomy, initiative, flexibility and attention to detail to be successful in meeting the business demands at Discovery Parks. Your naturally upbeat and open style will fit our cultural values. You will have a highly organised mindset with the ability to assess the urgency of work allocated to you by various stakeholders.  Discovery is a dynamic company with an energetic ‘market disrupter’ reputation. If you are passionate, adventurous, and ready to hit the ground running, we want to hear from you.  Discover more to life - APPLY NOW!  Prior to an offer of employment being made, candidates must provide authority for a Federal Police Clearance to disclose any criminal offences or charges.
job_description.18: Every child and young person deserves a great education.  We have a strategy that aims to unlock every child’s potential now and into the future, one that in partnership with learners, students, parents and the wider South Australian community will build a world-leading public education system. One that is equitable and prioritises learning and wellbeing.  Together we will make our education system the best it can be.  When our children and young people thrive, so do our communities and our state.  About The Role  The Data and Automation Analyst is responsible to the Assistant Director, ICT Projects for driving the strategy, planning, review and execution of comprehensive data and automation processes for ICT during migration from the legacy platforms to the cloud-based Education Management System (EMS) and ongoing. This will involve working closely with Finance, System Performance, Information Communications and Technology, EMS Project Team and schools and preschools to determine and perform activities required as part of the data (migration and integration) and automation process.  Why work with us  By Joining Our Team, You Will • Be part of a supportive and collaborative team environment. • Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge. • Enjoy work-life balance with flexible working arrangements. • Make a real difference in the lives of children.  Together, we can work towards building a stronger future for all students in South Australia.  Requirements  Experience with Data Analysis, migration, integration or automation (using RPA), moder and cloud based technologies. (Essential)  Special Conditions  The successful applicant is required to gain a Department for Human Services (DHS) working with children check (WWCC) prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every five years before expiry. The incumbent will be required to undertake RRHAN –EC (Responding to Risks of Harm, Abuse and Neglect - Education Care) Facilitator Lead (Masterclass) extended course or the online (Fundamentals) course which will be required to be updated every three years.  For all other Special Conditions please refer to the attached Position Descriptions.  Application Instructions  Applicants are required to submit a CV and a written statement of no more than 1500 words addressing the key competencies in the position description. In addition, applicants are required to fill and submit the attached Application Cover Sheet and Employment Declaration forms.  People of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent and/or those who have a disability are strongly encouraged to apply.  Applications must be made through the I Work For SA website.  Remuneration  We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for professional development and career advancement.  ASO7: $106,512- $115,137 per annum plus superannuation  Enquiries  Please direct your enquiries to Troy Mcmellon, Data and Automation Manager on Email: troy.mcmellon@sa.gov.au  Additional Note  This is a full-time (1.0 FTE) contract for two years.  Applications Close  15/10/2023 11:30 PM  Attachments  App Cover Sheet - PSAct.pdf  Position Description - ASO7 Data and Automation Analyst.pdf  VL233 Pre-employment declaration.pdf  Flexibility Statement  The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

job_description.20: Provide key insights for South Australia's commercial real estate markets Join an experienced Research team & grow your career Collaborative team culture with a diverse mix of work Adelaide | Land of the Kaurna people  CBRE Adelaide is seeking a research analyst to join their team. In collaboration with the wider research team you will partner with CBRE business lines and clients by providing an innovative range of research and analysis, serving as a trusted advisor across commercial and residential property markets in Australia and New Zealand.  Here's what you’ll achieve: • Collect, review, evaluate, & analyse data, using internal databases, external data and macro-economic, financial and demographic information, ensuring insight and meaning is captured • Assisting in the development and implementation of data management processes and data-based outputs/data visualisation products • Prepare regular research reports and presentations, and other market analysis, including one-off consultancy assignments and more tailored research pieces to drive thought leadership • You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with Head of Research, Directors, Sector Leads and business stakeholders to generate ideas and produce innovative research materials that best meet business & client needs.  About you: • Degree qualified with 1-2 years’ working experience in an economic, investment, policy or property research role • Interest in gaining exposure and building a comprehensive knowledge of commercial property markets • Ability to source data, analyse trends, create insights, and present results verbally, graphically and in writing • Strong numerical skills and knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint, with a keen interest in learning and using data analytics tools (Tableau, PowerBI) and sales database systems (especially Salesforce) • Excellent communication skills and enjoy a high degree of integration and collaboration with stakeholders within our business.  What’s in it for you?  People are the foundation upon which our success is built. Our company is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. Our people are free to expand their skills and knowledge to drive their careers and reach their full potential.  We value flexibility and our people work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their well-being, learning and performance. Our people benefit from a range of educational, financial, health and well-being benefits and programs, corporate partnerships and discounts, CBRE Cares Foundation, competitive leave offerings and paid volunteer days.  Can we inspire you to join us?  At CBRE, our unwavering commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion begins with you. We are strengthening our inclusive culture, so everyone feels safe, valued, & heard. Because when you belong, we all succeed. We welcome and encourage First Nations Peoples to apply.  If you are successful in progressing, you may be asked to complete a short video interview as part of the recruitment process.  We look forward to hearing from you!
job_description.21: Analyst Department : System Design Division : Forecasting  Reference number : 10889  A true forecasting role in the fast-moving energy industry - incredible career opportunitgy with PV & battery focus. This is your opportunity to bring your passion and expertise and contribute to Australia's energy future. Design, run and communicate the model's that everyone's talking about (strong modelling skills in R, Python & SQL a must). Attractive salary and performance incentives. Open to Bris/Syd/Melb/Adel/Perth with hybrid working arrangements.  Who is AEMO?  We are the Australian Energy Market Operator. AEMO's role is to design and operate a sustainable energy system that provides safe, reliable, and affordable electricity and gas today, and to enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians. All Australian governments are now committed to a net-zero economy for Australia by 2050, the first step of which is a net-zero energy system.  We are collaborating with industry and other stakeholders to engineer electricity grids that can handle 100 per cent instantaneous renewable generation by 2025, and changes to the gas system and markets to support biomethane and hydrogen. AEMO also plays a significant role in the east coast gas market, which has recently expanded to assessing if there is enough natural gas for customers, including electricity generators. The transition to a renewable energy system is occurring at a world-leading pace. It is an exciting, momentous time to be part of this mission.  About the role  AEMO's forecasting division is responsible for providing long and medium-term forecasts of Australia's energy supply and demand. The team is responsible for delivering critical data that underpins many of our major reports and reliability processes.  At a time when Australia is witnessing a once in a century transformation of the Energy Industry this is an incredible opportunity to be part of a bespoke, supportive, and high performing team. This role is available across multiple office locations, including Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide & Perth – in addition to offering flexible work from home arrangements.  What you will be doing  Reporting into the Manager, Sector Coupling and working within a team of four, your focus is on how distributed PV and storage develop over timeframes of up to 30 years. You'll be part of robust discussions on consumer needs, market evolution, and technological development.  We're seeking a strategically minded analyst with a strong interest in PV and storage. Your daily role involves diving into PV and battery technology and crafting and refining forecasting models. Solid programming skills, including R and SQL are essential. Attention to detail and collaboration skills are crucial. You'll work within a friendly, supportive team that collaborate to strategise and test internal and external viewpoints. You will also: • Be aware of and contribute to team understanding of industry trends. • Develop, maintain, and document forecasting models for components of the electricity and gas markets. This involves analytical, programming, modelling and data management skills, working with others within and beyond the team. • Interpret, validate, and gain insights from models, simulations, and ad-hoc datasets. • Communicate your results via writing technical reports using clear and concise language that is understandable to a diverse audience. • Have the ability to quickly and accurately complete analytical work within tight timeframes. • Mentor and support graduates and students in the performance of their tasks.  What you will bring to the role • Tertiary qualification in relevant disciplines (engineering, physics, mathematics, econometrics). • At least 3 years' experience in analysis and modelling of energy markets or a related field. • Experience working with Power BI and Excel, alongside R, Python, and SQL. • Experience within Australia's energy systems, particularly Australia's electricity markets, is desirable or a willingness to learn and an interest in energy systems. • Keen interest in data, energy markets, and the art and science of forecasting is well regarded.  Some of our employment benefits • Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options • Professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and formal learning • A full health and wellbeing program, private health discounts and other concessions • Free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility) • Up to 4 days volunteering leave per year • A comprehensive and professional Employee Assistance Program (EAP)  We are AEMO  At AEMO, our core values aren't just 'words on a wall' – we are a purpose-based organisation at the centre of our energy future, and we stand for integrity, inclusiveness, empowerment, and excellence.  As we continue to innovate and work on some world-first, ground-breaking projects, we need to attract the brightest people and provide opportunities to contribute, stretch and grow.  We actively encourage you to bring your whole self to work, so that together we can do better, be better, and love our work. For this reason, inviting difference and leading inclusively is a core part of our culture. We challenge ourselves to take bold actions to improve the experience for all our people, with a current focus on gender, flexibility, (dis)ability and our First Nation peoples.  If you would like to know more about working at AEMO, please check out our careers page for more information, or apply now. #joinaemo  For more information on the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) please refer to or visit one of our social media channels below.

job_description.25: OTE of $300,000 to $320,000 and is based Sydney base salary of $180,000.  Our client is a rapidly expanding Microsoft Solutions Partner dedicated to enhancing the potential of their workforce and fostering a data-driven culture within every organisation. They specialise in Data, Analytics and AI technologies that all sit within the Azure cloud, harnessing cutting-edge tools to develop solutions that empower businesses to achieve their objectives.  As a Business Development Manager, you will embark on a unique journey as a vital member of a high-achieving team. Your contributions will be highly valued, and you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the company's future. Your primary responsibilities will revolve around nurturing the company's growth, working closely with senior executives to strategise and implement GTM and cloud solutions.  To excel in this role, the ideal candidate will have a background in technical or management consulting closely aligned with our client's market offerings. You should possess at least 5 years of experience in solution sales or pre-sales, with an additional 2+ years of experience within a consulting firm. An existing professional network that can be leveraged to drive business growth is essential, along with a track record of working with medium to enterprise-sized clients.  This position primarily focuses on new business development, comprising 80% of your responsibilities, with the remaining 20% dedicated to account management of existing relationships. An ideal candidate would have a demonstrable technical background in cloud (ideally Azure) data, and analytics, along with experience in professional services and manages serivices. If you have previously sold into the Financial Services, Government, Healthcare, or Utilities sectors, it would be highly regarded.  Work with a team who cares about your success with an easy 2 stage interview process that can be completed within a few days. Our client offers a competitive remuneration package, including equity options for qualified candidates, flexible work arrangements, and a "work-from-anywhere" policy allowing up to 6 weeks of remote work per year.
