job_description.26: YOUR NEW EMPLOYER: Our client is prominent South Australian organisation, based in the Adelaide CBD which operate in the Insurance industry. They have hundreds of staff across South Australia and a small team of 3 focused on business intelligence solutions, reporting and data visualisation for the organisation. They are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to provide professional, value added insights and data interpretation to their business stakeholders.  YOUR NEW ROLE: You will have involvement with some of the following: • Design, develop deliver analytical assets using BI tools. • Design, develop deliver and maintain data ingestion, transformation and modelling and reporting processes using Power BI Service (Dataflows, Reports, Datasets and Dashboards). • BI Solution Testing. • Create technical BI documentation. • Provide consultation to stakeholders. • Provide end to end support of the Enterprise Reporting Framework. • Use Excel and Power Query Data Models.  ARE YOU A GOOD FIT? To be successful, you will be an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst who will have relevant tertiary qualifications, Power BI certifications and an SQL programming certification. You will be task oriented, have good time management skills and be willing to learn. You will be service oriented and have good communication skills. You will have the ESSENTIAL skills: • Power BI Desktop dashboard and dataset development experience (12 months minimum) • Experience with Power BI Dataflows • SQL development experience (12 months minimum) • Experience working within Australia  If you qualify for these essential criteria we strongly encourage you to apply. If you also possess any of the following that will be greatly received.  Ideally you may also possess some of the DESIRABLE skills: • Health Insurance Industry experience • Experience with Kimball Star Scheme data modelling methodology • Experience with Power Query and Excel to deliver power pivot reporting solutions • Experience with Crystal Reports & Crystal Server • Experience developing in Excel and VBA to produce reporting solutions  Please write a quick cover letter addressing briefly the Essential and Desirable skills and experience and if you have experience and if so how much in order to be considered for the role.  WHY APPLY? They are conveniently located in the Adelaide CBD. They have a well established and successful local business and they can train up staff members to develop within the organisation.  For more information email Erin or Manisha at
job_description.27: About the company: Adelaide Airport Ltd (AAL) is an internationally recognised and award-winning employer of choice in the dynamic aviation environment. The gateway to South Australia, Adelaide Airport is the fifth-largest airport in Australia and is committed to on-going developments that seamlessly connect the world to South Australia. It is an un-listed public company owned by long term superannuation funds.  As a major business centre, Adelaide Airport is executing its vision to be a globally connected, next generation hub offering a unique sense of place to its partners. The airport has recently completed a $200 million terminal expansion investment and has an exciting pipeline of future projects.  AAL employs a highly engaged workforce recognised for delivering exceptional outcomes. Identifying, supporting and encouraging leadership and innovation, AAL is a proven leader in sustainability, supporting diversity and inclusion and offering flexible workplace arrangements.  About the role: The Terminal Operations, Planning & Performance Specialist works within a high performing team that strives to improve and optimise the operational services and infrastructure within the terminal environment. The role is a key interface between long range terminal infrastructure planning undertaken within the Planning & Infrastructure team and seasonal/ day-to-day operations planning undertaken within the Terminal Operations team. This role is dynamic and requires an analytical, adaptable and effective communicator to provide insights that contribute to operational excellence and strategic decision making.  Responsibilities will include: • Use statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and areas of improvement to optimise efficiency & minimise delays. • Develop KPIs and performance metrics to assess the performance of services provided and infrastructure within the terminal environment. • Collaborate with various internal and external stakeholders to gather information, share insights, and coordinate operational improvements. • Communicate findings and recommendations to relevant stakeholders and present reports to management. • Leverage technology and data analytics tools to automate and streamline operational processes.  Key requirements to be successful in this role: • Proven experience in a relevant job field and/ or degree qualifications in Data Analytics, Finance, Commerce, Economics, Business, • Strong data analysis skills and ability to translate information into a digestible format. • Sound written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex analysis to a variety of stakeholders. • Ability to evaluate current operational models and identify improvement areas. • A customer-centric mindset with a focus on delivering a great customer experience.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. To apply please click apply or call Jess Della-Verde on 08 8216 3530 for a confidential discussion.
job_description.28: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  What if we didn’t focus on who you are now, but who you could become?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  We are seeking Technical Business Analysts at multiple levels to join our EY Data and Analytics team in our Melbourne, Sydney, Perth, Adelaide, Canberra and Brisbane offices.  What’s in it for you?  As a Technical Business Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: • Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data. • Be responsible for creating requirement specifications, analysing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating elicitation sessions, and digging around in the data when needed. • Designing and building reports – capture data requirements for the client and team • Creating requirements specifications, analysing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating workshop sessions, and using the necessary business analyst tools.  What We’re Looking For  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go. • Creating requirements specifications, analysing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating workshop sessions, and using the necessary business analyst tools. • Experience in engaging with and managing both technical and non-technical stakeholders • Working with SQL databases and database querying languages. • With programming skills such as Python and R. • Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches). • Hands on experience working technologies/platform e.g., Power BI, Microsoft suite, Jira/Confluence, Azure DevOps.  What We Can Offer You • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment • Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness • Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.  Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000AUD including 11% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
job_description.29: About the Role The Business Analyst contributes to the collection, synthesis and application of student load related information. This information is used in the IBM TM1 Student Load Forecasting Model. This system enables the Student Load Forecasting team to provide strategic information to meet internal requirements for load-related key performance indicators (KPIs), capacity planning, student offers process and to understand financial implications of anticipated student load changes.  Specific functions of this position include estimating student load and revenue for corporate planning processes, analysis of significant quantities of data, reporting results to a variety of stakeholders and overseeing the maintenance of the data in the University's student load forecasting data warehouse.  About the Business Intelligence and Planning Unit  The Business Intelligence and Planning Unit is a central unit reporting to the Chief Operating Officer. BIP contributes to corporate performance through supporting and improving processes and frameworks for management decision making. Its main functions are: • Supporting corporate planning and review and the University's indicator framework • The development of corporate information management and reporting through its Business Intelligence environment • Building institution-wide competency in the development, deployment and use of information to support decision making • Providing advice, information and support in relation to teaching and learning and research priorities, government reporting and quality assurance • Supporting UniSA's evaluation framework • Providing environmental scanning and market analysis Essential Skills and Experience • Degree with relevant experience in a finance or related discipline or equivalent skills and experience • Well-developed personal and written communication skills including the ability to prepare detailed correspondence and liaise with a diverse range of stakeholders on complex issues • Demonstrated experience in preparing reports and information for senior managers • Experience in the design, development, implementation and improvement of systems and processes to deliver a high-quality service Benefits  Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as: • Access to great personal development opportunities • Generous superannuation contributions of 17% • Flexible working conditions • Corporate health insurance • A variety of leave arrangements
job_description.30: Summary Job ID 603823 Job Type Part Time - Fixed Term Location Walkley Heights Categories Information Technology, Administration & Customer Services Advertised 15 Sep 2023 Cen. Australia Standard Time Applications close Apply Now angle-right Refer a Friend angle-right  Data and Reporting Administrator Apply Now angle-right  The DM Roads business provides a range of services in road network management. We assist road and intelligent transport systems (ITS) asset owners to extract maximum value from their assets and provide road networks that meet the demand of today's ever-changing environment. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 36,000 km of road.  This is a great time to join an industry leader that has built a trusted reputation on the quality of service and further develop your career on long term government contracts.  We have an opportunity for an experienced Data and Reporting Administrator to join our DM Roads business based at our Walkley Heights office. Responsible for providing vital support to the business by using data analysis and reporting to drive insights, enhance efficiencies and assist in maintaining a high level of contract compliance. This 12-month fixed term role is required for 3 days per week, with flexibility around which days and times to suit your lifestyle while working for an industry leader.  ABOUT YOU  You will be proficient in analysing data at a high level with the ability to collate data from various sources to generate complex reports to gain insight and determine strategies to improve data reliability, efficiency and drive decision making. The ideal candidate will have previous experience working in a fast-paced environment within the asset management/road maintenance construction industry.  Strong use of IT and software packages including advanced Excel with the ability to extract large volumes of data and form complex formulas. Experience in SQL desirable, but not essential. Advanced analytical and conceptual thinking skills using multiple points of data. Tertiary qualifications in Data Analytics, Data Science or similar preferred but not essential. Demonstrable use and interrogation of databases and advanced data mining skills. Ability to interpret complex problems and identify and implement process improvement and sustainable solutions. Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders through sound communication, collaboration and engagement.  WHAT WE OFFER  The unique opportunity to work in an organisation where Zero Harm of our people and the environment is at the forefront of all that we do. The ability to build your professional career in a multi-disciplined business environment. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture that promotes the skills and insights of all its people irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, ability, age or sexual orientation. Access to other Downer internal opportunities once your fixed term has ended.  For more information, please contact E: Cindy.DOliveiro2@downergroup.com. Applications will not be accepted via email. job_description.32: As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for identifying, defining and driving Fivecast products and features through a complete lifecycle  About The Role  As a Technical Business Analyst you will work within the Product Management Team in identifying, defining and driving Fivecast products and features through a complete lifecycle from inception to support. You will work with all areas of the Fivecast business, including Product Development, Engineering, Intelligence, Marketing and Sales to help execute the Product Roadmap.  You will develop a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and understanding of the customer’s problems and will work to define solutions to address them. They will also assist the Co-founder/VP Product Development with shaping the Product Roadmap and work on defining a go to market strategy for identified products and features.  For this role we are looking for someone who has worked on consumer facing web applications/products, can create such applications from scratch and also understand the competitive landscape, the market we are operating in and anticipate the market needs before they arise.  Requirements • Australian citizenship required- due to eligibility for NV1 defence clearance requirement for the role • Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or other related technical STEM fields • 5+ years experience in Product Management / Technical Business Analysis / Systems Engineering • Experience working on consumer facing, complicated Java web-apps or products • Ability to work with stakeholders to elicit requirements, including clients and other engineering team members • Ability to develop product specifications and meet deadlines • Strong organisation skills, detail orientated, and a collaborative team player with strong communication skills Qualities that make strong candidates: • Experience in technology sector working with defence and government clients • Understanding of analytic challenges in Defence and national security About Fivecast  Fivecast is a world-leading provider of cutting-edge digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.  As a growing start-up with over 100 people globally, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their career in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment. We are headquartered in Adelaide, Australia with teams in Canberra, Virginia USA, and London UK.  Our Work Environment and Culture  Our Adelaide based headquarters is a purpose-built tech hub centrally based in vibrant Hutt Street. We moved into this brand-new space in early 2023 to allow for continued collaboration, innovation & growth.  Our space has been specifically engineered for brainstorming, idea generation, random encounters across teams and to suit our casual, relaxed culture. This has been achieved through amazing features, including an arcade room, pool table, fully equipped kitchens with fruit and snacks, barista quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities (showers, lockers, bike storage, etc), as well as comfortable breakout spaces.  Fivecast has a connected work culture with team members taking advantage of our social clubs, local cafes, bars, pubs and sporting facilities for team activities. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.  Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience and believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.

job_description.34: About the ABC  The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.  Role Purpose  Develop and support the ABC’s digital data capabilities that provide data pipelines, aggregation & processing, data visualisation and data distribution services to ABC digital products and platforms.  Strengthen data engineering foundations within digital product and platform teams, enable experimentation and underpin the success of leveraging data in ABC digital products.  Key Accountabilities • Provide technical development skills within the ABC's Digital Product department, to develop secure and high-performance platforms and services. • Under broad direction, and in collaboration with colleagues, deliver high quality software development and produce best possible results on code quality, efficiency, system sustainability, scalability, and security within agreed time and budget requirements. • Create and maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation, including technical designs, product specifications, architecture details, support & operation guides, testing instructions and thought processes. • Adopt best engineering practices in the industry and share with other team members, to help foster the implementation of best data engineering practices throughout Digital Product teams. • As part of a digital product or platform team, continuously strengthen the architectural foundation of the data platform and drive the architectural improvements and best practices for data products. • Ensure separation of concerns and create layers of abstractions and re-usable data components where appropriate. Adopt service-oriented architecture when designing particularly complex systems and apply industry best practices where appropriate.  About You • Experience in software technologies such as dbt, AWS data services, Datahub, Apache Superset, PowerBI, content management systems, digital media publishing, digital content delivery and integration with APIs & diverse data sources an advantage. • Demonstrated experience in modern data analytics tech stack including real user monitoring, tag management, experiments & A / B testing, product feature pilot measurement, data integration and data anomaly detection. • Experience in developing complex, secure and high-performance data pipelines at scale. • Solid experience in one or more programming languages or frameworks such as Python, Golang, Typescript or Node.js; with ability to write clean, efficient and testable code. • Strong relational thinking and SQL skills. • Excellent planning and tasks prioritisation skills with the ability to work effectively under pressure and meet deadlines.  The following experiences, while not essential , would be advantageous : • Data transformation, storage and query technologies such as Trino, Iceberg, Databricks, Snowplow and Snowflake. • DevOps, Media and web experience • AWS services that support the modern data stack • Database performance optimisation  What’s In It For You?  Come and join the vibrant Digital Product department in the ABC. Our mission is to enable ABC’s digital future, where ABC transitions from a traditional broadcaster to Australia’s most trusted and valued digital media organisation.  Through harnessing our talents in digital, collaborating with our partners and delivering beyond expectations, we ensure the ABC not just remains relevant but thrives.  As a group of product and platform teams, we develop and maintain the ABC's audience facing digital products across mobile, connected TV, desktop, and smart speakers.  Whether it is staying informed of the latest breaking news, bringing some great TV on iview, streaming the Hottest 100 on the triple j app and website, or entertaining the kids with our ABC Kids app - the ABC's Digital Product offerings are some of Australia's most loved and most used platforms.  Your work will be appreciated by millions of audiences across Australia. We are an AWS shop; you will have the opportunity to work on the latest and greatest cloud technology.  You will have the chance to contribute to the solution architecture of our systems. We are an open and cohesive team where your voice will not get lost.  You can get a sneak peek into our product engineering world through our blog : https : / / www.abc.net.au / digital-product  We are committed to career development and invest in our people to grow and become leaders in their fields. Everyone in the Digital Product department has a designated budget for training and development.  We believe in flexible approaches to working and building self-organising and collaborative teams that offer friendly and supportive environments in which all team members can strive and grow.  For further information on this position please contact Jamie Nedved, Digital Talent Acquisition Lead via email nedved.jamie@abc.net.au  We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.  In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals.  The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.  For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to Life Page on ABC LinkedIn.  For more information on working at the ABC visit abc.net.au / careers

Ability to gather, validate, aggregate and interrogate data  Provide data analysis on financials, timeframes against schedules and program deliverables  Highly developed attention to detail and accuracy. job_description.36: About us  At Accolade Wines, our purpose is to enrich everyday moments. As one of the world's leading wine companies, our award-winning portfolio includes beloved brands such as Hardys, Grant Burge, St Hallett, House of Arras, Mud House, Jam Shed and many more. We are one of the largest wine producers in the world – we've been around since 1836, and our portfolio has won a total of 8,846 international wine show awards in the last decade, including recently winning 'supplier of the year'. About the role  The driving force behind our business is our people – we have over 1,500 staff across Australia, the UK, Europe, Asia, South Africa, New Zealand and the Americas, and every one of us is passionate about making the ordinary extraordinary through our amazing wines.  We are seeking an experienced Senior Finance Analyst – Inventory Costing & Optimisation to join our dynamic Supply Chain Finance team. In this role, you will be responsible for the accurate valuation for Australian and New Zealand bulk wine inventory, provide analytical insights into bulk wine costs and variances to budget, and reporting on finished goods inventory including obsolescence and write offs. As the Senior Finance Analyst, you will play a critical role in creating and maintaining reporting tools to monitor performance and identify areas for improvement.  This role will give you the chance to showcase your problem-solving and analytical skills and business partnering skills to collaborate with internal stakeholders across the business.  This role is based in our Adelaide CBD office, with the flexibility to work from home.  This role is full-time and permanent.  Key responsibilities include: • Be responsible for the accurate valuation of Australia and New Zealand bulk wine inventory in winemaking systems through month end procedures • Monthly bulk wine blend cost variance to budget analysis, working with winemakers to understand wine depletions for bottling/sales and blend cost history. • Monthly SMI reporting, working with Demand Planning and Commercial teams to forecast write-off risks and clearance options. • Monthly inventory write-off reporting with forward looking forecasts, helping the business to minimise write offs. • Play a key role in annual budgets for Bulk Wine and Finished Good standards COGS. • Take ownership of bulk wine costing requests from Marketing and Product Management teams in line with agreed SLA timelines for New and Existing Product Development. • Preparation of monthly GL reconciliations for key inventory balances. • Manage bulk wine purchase payment approval process. • Liaise with internal and external auditors for quarterly and annual audit requirements. • Other ad hoc projects and Power BI report building as required. What you'll bring: • Minimum 3 years experience in accounting and finance • CA/CPA professional accreditation, or working towards • Understanding of manufacturing accounting and standard costing principles, is preferred • University degree in accounting/finance • ERP system working knowledge (JDE preferred)  What you can expect:  Accolade Wines will provide the ideal climate and a hand-picked rewards package for you to make a difference in our successful and growing business.  You will also have access to: • Wine allowance and access to unique wine specials • Flexible working (Up to 2-3 days working from home) • Modern office located in the heart of the Adelaide CBD • Loyalty Leave • Accolade Wines Anniversary Day off • Go Beyond Day - making a different in your local community • Access to an extensive online learning library • Private Health Insurance Discounts • Annual Flu Vaccination Program • Employee Assistance Program • Various exclusive employee discounts  Want to find out more? Watch us in action here:  Sound like your kind of drop? Apply now. With respect, no recruitment agencies please.
job_description.37: Application closing date: Friday, 06 October 2023 • 11:59pm, Canberra time (in Canberra)  Estimated start date: Wednesday, 01 November 2023 (or ASAP thereafter)  Location of work: SA  Length of contract: Until 30 June 2024  Contract extensions: 2 x 12 months  Security clearance: Must have Negative Vetting Level 1  Rates: $120 - $150 per hour (inc. super)  DSTG is currently experimenting and building capability with Large Language Models (LLMs) and Computer Vision (CV) techniques at large scale for the purpose of assessing their applicability to the Defence context.  Existing initial demonstrators have shown great promise and DSTG is now in need of four machine learning engineers to further develop, accelerate and mature these capabilities.  Successful applicants will be working with leading-edge hardware and ML technologies, demonstrating the art of the possible and working toward bringing ML based technology into the Defence domain in support of Defence's mission and capabilities.  The Machine Learning Engineers will be required to work as part of an integrated team spanning ICT professionals and engineers, DSTG Researchers, Defence Operators and Analysts. They will work as part of a team designing and developing machine learning systems, implementing appropriate ML algorithms, conducting experiments and demonstrating outcomes and ML based opportunities to the Defence stakeholders. They will be working with DSTG data sets to create models, perform statistical analysis, to train and retrain systems to optimise performance with a goal to build efficient self-learning applications and contribute to Defence's advancements in artificial intelligence.  Essential Criteria • Experience in software development & machine learning. • Experience in the use of machine learning methods on multi-GPU platforms. • Extensive Linux knowledge. • Ability to communicate effectively and tailor presentation style and messaging to be relevant to a range of audience level of knowledge, skills and experience. • Sound interpersonal skills including the ability to work as a productive member of a team and communicate effectively with colleagues and clients across multiple organisational levels. • Effective written and verbal communication skills. • Respond strongly and positively to challenging work and deadlines.  Desirable Criteria • Hightly Desirable: Experience in the use and development of machine learning methods at scale within standalone or multi-GPU and multi-node configurations. • Hightly Desirable: Experience in MLOps and ModelOps software and associated engineering practices. • Hightly Desirable: Experience with best practice development methodologies and practices such as Agile, DevOps, and Configuration-As-Code. • Hightly Desirable: Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture. • Hightly Desirable: Knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms as applicable to the ML context. • Hightly Desirable: Ability to write code in Python, Java or R. • Hightly Desirable: Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn). • Hightly Desirable: Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills. • Previous experience within the Defence environment. • Familiarity with Defence IT security policies and concepts. • Security Clearances for Nominated Personnel.  How To Apply  Please submit your updated CV to demonstrate your suitability to the role as well as providing a 2-3 page response to the Essential & Desirable Criteria.
job_description.38: About Us  Saab Australia is a defence, security and cyber solutions provider, specialising in the development and integration of major defence and security systems. For over 30 years in Australia, we have built a reputation for delivering complex systems integration projects that provide proven and advanced capabilities to keep us ahead of today’s challenges.  From combat, communications, security and underwater systems, to mixed reality, cyber security and deployable health solutions, our extensive portfolio of products and services provide high-technology solutions for defence forces and civil industries across the globe.  Apply today to join our crew and deliver solutions with purpose.  The role  As part of our Maritime group, the Business Analyst will be response for developing processes, tools and systems to support EPA (Enterprise Partnership Agreement) and WAMA (Warship Asset Management Agreement) programs in consultation with key stakeholders. This role is directly responsible for implementing, improving and sustaining processes, methodologies, tools and training to others with skills to enhance project and program performance and reporting.  Further, the successful candidate will: • Consult with stakeholders, develop and maintain EPA and WAMA program level cost, schedule and risk reporting regime. • Develop, implement and manage processes, systems and tools support the EPA performance measurement and reporting framework. • Carry out detailed analysis of current processes, systems, tools and data integrity, identify issues and improvement opportunities and influence the uptake of improvements. • Conduct training for business system, processes and tools. • Ensure disparate information sources are validated, cohesively consolidated and aggregated to appropriate levels for management reporting. • Understand the customer, management and project leadership reporting requirements and develop fit-for-purpose management reporting dashboards using multiple system inputs and automated data gathering tools (where appropriate) for reliable and consistent reporting outcomes. • Investigate and assess opportunities to automate processes, developing professional, clear and concise business cases for management review to support improvement initiatives.  Flexible work arrangements such as hybrid work from home / office, 9 day fortnight and part time (0.8 FTE minimum) will be considered for this role.  About You  Your skills and experience will include: • Degree (or Certificate IV minimum) qualified in project management, IT, engineering or business. • Extensive business analysis experience within an engineering & project execution organisation, specifically within the defence or resources industries on complex major capital projects. • Demonstrated understanding and application of best practice business processes, including establishing and maintaining the performance reporting at a program level for the client/customer along with internal management stakeholders. • Strong acumen with Excel PowerPivots, database establishment and management and SharePoint development along with Power BI experience to establish robust and reliable performance reporting to support the program controls functions in reporting planning, scheduling, budget & cost management, risk and opportunity management. • Previous experience working within the Defence network system would be advantageous.  As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain a NV1 clearance or a minimum of a Baseline clearance.  Culture And Benefits  We employ over 700 Australians and are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and enriching the employee experience.  By joining Saab, you’ll be a part of a collaborative and supportive organisation, where your professional growth and work-life balance are emphasised. You’ll work within an innovative and vibrant workplace, while having the opportunity to develop a long-term, fulfilling career.  For further information about at career at Saab, visit the page adjacent: https://www.saab.com/markets/australia/careers/saab-life  Applications  Click ‘Apply’ to submit your CV and cover letter in support of your application. You may contact our careers team at careers.mailbox@au.saabgroup.com for a copy of the full position description. Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and in exceptional circumstances, the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement. We encourage applications as early as possible to avoid disappointment.  Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply. We also welcome applications from individuals with culturally diverse backgrounds.  Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans’ Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.
job_description.39: Full Job Description SRG Partners - Adelaide, Australia  SRG Partners is looking to expand their team by opening a position for a Corporate Analyst. Don’t miss this exciting opportunity to join an exciting boutique corporate advisory firm in Adelaide.  About Us  SRG Partners is a boutique corporate advisory firm focused on planning and connecting capital solutions with business strategy. SRG Partners help clients prepare for, create, and realise transformational opportunities. Our CFO Transformation Services ensure the ongoing business planning, reporting and funding needs of our clients are aligned to ensure transformational business growth opportunities can be realised. Our Deal Support Services ensure transactions can be planned and executed in order to maximise stakeholder value.  The Role  We are looking for an Analyst to join our team in Adelaide to deliver valuable Deal Support Services and CFO Transformation Services to a diverse range of quality clients. You will gain invaluable experience working within our clients’ business, gaining commercial experience, and assisting them in undertaking transformational corporate transactions.  As part of our Deal Support Services, you will be responsible for researching, analysing and interpreting data and assisting Lead Advisers with M&A, capital raising, valuations and financial modelling. You will perform financial and strategic analysis as required and you will regularly liaise with both internal and external stakeholders. You will interact with our client’s c-suite and present to boards as required. With exposure to a range of transactions for clients in a variety of industries, you will have the opportunity to participate in all stages of a transaction, working closely with the Directors.  Our CFO Transformation Services will give you insight into the operations of our clients, whereby you will assist in managing a finance team, assist with cash flow and working capital management, responsibility for the month end process and ensuring accurate financial reporting, preparing and presenting management and board reporting, assisting with the budgeting and reforecast process and attend meetings with the client’s c-suite and board.  By joining SRG Partners you will be taking the right step in your career.  Your experience and skills Minimum 3 years accounting related experience, preferably with a Big 4 accounting firm CA qualification (or near completion) Financial analysis skills Excellent written and verbal communications skills with advanced report writing skills Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Ability to work within a collaborative and inclusive workplace with a strong team spirit attitude Ability to build and maintain positive and trusting relationships with clients, other advisors and the broader business community Strong project management abilities Proven ability to deliver above and beyond client service. Next Steps  If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience and career goals, we want to hear from you.  Please send applications through to Belinda Seatree at bseatree@srgpartners.com.au
job_description.40: EY is a global professional services organization providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world, to help create wider economic and social benefits today, and a strong legacy for a better tomorrow.  Our Data & Analytics team are looking to hire a Technical Business Analyst.  Key Duties Of The Role Are  Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data.  Be responsible for creating requirement specifications, analyzing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating elicitation sessions and digging around in the data when needed.  Have knowledge and experience of all phases of software development including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, defect management  Have experience in business intelligence, data warehousing or advanced analytics projects  Essential Skills For The Role Are  Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders on data risks and controls discussions  Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)  Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or  analytics projects  The sponsored approver for this role is EY Business Solutions Pty Ltd.  Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.
job_description.41: LOCATION: Remote Work  SCHEDULE: Part-time  Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!  We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.  As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from the comfort of your own home.  What we're looking for: • A genuine interest in understanding business operations • Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels • Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment • A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis • Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools • A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques  Responsibilities: • Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources • Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights • Develop recommendations to address business challenges • Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights • Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives • Support the creation of project documentation  If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis!
job_description.42: Job Title: Business Analyst  Location: Adelaide, SA  Salary: $70,000 - $110,000 base + super, dependent upon experience  About the Company  Premier Group are currently partnering with a cutting-edge technology company specializing in 3D printing to transform the manufacturing space in a more efficient and sustainable way. With patented processes and tech creating quality product, their unique expertise and footprint have brought on very exciting projects and growth.  About the Role  As a Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making processes and supporting the growth and success of the business. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, gather and analyze data, and provide actionable insights that will inform strategic business decisions.  Key Responsibilities: • Data Analysis: Collect, organize, and analyze data related to projects, market trends, and competitor activities to identify opportunities and challenges • Market Research: Conduct market research to identify emerging trends, customer needs, and growth opportunities in the industry • Financial Analysis: Prepare financial models, forecasts, and cost-benefit analyses to evaluate the economic feasibility of new projects and initiatives • Performance Metrics: Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact projects • Business Strategy: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and refine business strategies, including product development, pricing, and market entry strategies • Reporting: Create reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders • Continuous Improvement: Identify areas for process improvement and optimization within the company's 3D printing and robotics operations  About You • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field • Proven experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role • Strong analytical and quantitative skills with proficiency in data analysis tools • Knowledge of the 3D printing and robotics industry is a plus • Excellent communication and presentation skills • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, innovative environment  Submit your CV to kickstart your application, otherwise please feel free to reach out to me at ktruong@pgrec.au for a confidential chat!
job_description.43: • One of the key requirements for this role is being open to relocating to various locations across Australia for client projects. Don't worry, we're here to help! We provide relocation assistance and support, and we'll also connect you with other friendly FDM Consultants who are based in your new location.*  Are you a recent graduate or End-of-Year Finisher looking to launch your career in tech?  Join our program for the chance to work with Australia’s leading companies including the top 4 banks, consultancies, insurance companies, retailers, and charities. Through our long relationships with FTSE100 client partners, you can add impressive names to your CV!  A career where you are encouraged to meet your potential  Junior Technical Analyst roles often involve high-profile projects in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and gaining first-hand exposure to business operations. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.  About This Role  If you are eager to take on a challenge and use your logical problem-solving skills to make an impact in the world of technology, then this is the role for you! Our program is designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to start and grow a successful career.  As a Technical Analyst, you will have the opportunity to apply your skills to innovative projects and make a real impact in a variety of sectors. You will be responsible for investigating and developing solutions for applications. It could be robotic process automation, quality assurance and IT infrastructure delivery for global businesses.  What will my time at FDM be like  Your journey will begin with training out of FDM’s award-winning academy. While interviews and assessments are done remotely, you now have the option to undertake training online or at our centrally located, 21st floor Sydney office in Barangaroo.  The 10-week industry specific training covers high-demand skills such as SQL, Unix; Excel/VBA, BA, Python, ITIL, Cloud and OS-Admin with the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout.  After successfully completing your training, you’ll step into an integral position with one or more of our industry-leading, multinational clients in Australia.  What we offer you: • A full-time employment contract with job security • Opportunities to work across Australia with relocation support where appropriate • Training is provided by industry experts, covering both technical and professional skills to ensure you are job-ready • Ongoing career support throughout your entire FDM journey, including professional development, mentoring, and social networking events with a community of peers • A chance to launch a career in one of the most in-demand tech fields  We ask you have the following: • Educated to a university degree level (bachelor or higher), no STEM degree required • Demonstrable interest and desire to work in technology • Ability to commit to completing our full 2.5-year graduate program • Ability to relocate to Sydney or Melbourne to support our clients. (Relocation package will be provided) • Eligible to work in Australia (Australian citizen or permanent resident)  There has never been a better time to start a career in tech – Apply Now!  About FDM  Our people are our passion. That's why we make your training and career growth our priority. We are a global professional services provider, focusing on IT. We are also one of the Australia's leading graduate employers, recruiting the brightest talent to become the innovators of tomorrow. With centres across Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific, and over 5,000 consultants placed on client site globally, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.  Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.
job_description.44: HomeStart Finance is seeking a Product Analyst to join us on a full-time basis in our Pirie Street office. This role is responsible for the provision of data analysis to support current and future products and fees, maintenance of product rules and delivery via loan calculators. The Product Analyst also helps develop customer-centric product improvement and design processes in order to develop and test product concepts and, in partnership with other teams, implement product change.  This is an exciting opportunity to make a direct impact in creating more opportunities for South Australians to achieve home ownership.  Duties & responsibilities: • Assist the Product Team Leader manage product BAU including analysis and input of multiplier reviews, fees, interest rates and loan pricing recommendations and indexation. • Provide timely and accurate analysis to management on product performance and relevance. • Develop a thorough understanding of customer needs within our target segments to define and iterate product features that overcome barriers to • home ownership within HomeStart’s risk appetite. • Assist the Product Team Leader manage product rules delivered • to customers via loan calculators such as the Calculation Engine including administration, definition, development of test cases and support as required. • Provide support with periodic reviews and risk analysis of builder partners performance. • Provide ongoing analysis of lending pipeline. • Assist in the provision of market analysis.  Essential criteria: • Financial services experience in a comparable role coupled with relevant tertiary qualification. • Some understanding of the legal and compliance environment. • Commitment to the delivery of quality customer service. • Sound understanding and application of research. • Advanced spreadsheet and data analysis skills. • Ability to solve problems with consideration to business needs. • Strong written communication. • Attention to detail and accuracy.  Benefits & Perks: • Annual salary increases • Up to 40% of time working from home • Up to 5 days wellbeing leave in addition to your 4 weeks annual leave • Supportive and diverse team • Centrally located, modern office in Pirie Street • Personal development opportunities & programs • Secure organisation currently undergoing enormous growth in lending volumes  About Us:  HomeStart is a unique South Australian organisation in the financial services sector, providing affordable home ownership solutions to the community. We take a proactive approach to addressing housing financing issues by creating innovative products which assist SA residents to overcome the barriers to entering the housing market, getting more people into home ownership.  With a workforce of over 130 employees situated in the Adelaide CBD with two small offices located in Salisbury and Morphett Vale, HomeStart is a recognised Employer of Choice.  To apply:  Applications for this role close at 5pm Sunday, 8 October 2023 and are only accepted via seek.com.au and are to include a cover letter, current curriculum vitae and include the name and contact details of three current professional referees.  If you wish to discuss this opportunity further, please contact Andrew Grove at andrew.grove@homestart.com.au.  All new employees are required to provide a satisfactory National Criminal History Record (Police Check) prior to commencement.  Please refer to HomeStart's career page at www.homestart.com.au for a copy of the position description and advice to applicants. You will also find testimonials from our employees about how they feel about working at HomeStart. Please note candidate screening and interviews may commence prior to the closing date of the job advert.
job_description.45: • Join an iconic Wesfarmers business, leaders in industrial & safety supplies • Bring your passion & expertise to this role and grow your career with us • Permanent full-time hybrid role offering work/life balance & fantastic employee benefits  OUR STORY  Blackwoods is Australia’s leading supplier of industrial and safety supplies. For over 140 years, we have supported businesses big and small with our range of over 300,000 products from the world’s best brands. From the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the railway and your local mechanic, we supply what our customers need when they need it, along with unparalleled expertise and service from our passionate team.  With a national footprint of over 50 branches and 6 Distribution Centres, our people are at the heart of everything we do. Being a part of the Wesfarmers group, also means that we have endless opportunities to make a difference, so join us, and let’s help more people build a better Australia.  YOUR OPPORTUNITY  Due to exciting growth in the business, we are looking for an enthusiastic National Sales Analyst to join our sales team based in any capital city (such as Macquarie Park NSW, Carole Park QLD, Regency Park SA and Scoresby VIC) to provide an exceptional level of service that supports our growing customer base.  This role is responsible for ensuring customer data alignment and/or key sales data including incentives and territory mapping is correct. This role will ensure data for all customer territory applications is aligned with Blackwoods systems, reducing errors, and facilitating clean order fulfilment.  Your key responsibilities include, but not limited to: • Ensure data alignment is maintained to support key sales hierarchy activity and reporting • Build excel models to support commercial decision making • Create and maintain robust suites of reporting that illustrate performance across multiple stakeholder groups • Drive functional Teams (primarily, Sales) understanding in how to utilise data and make commercial decisions • Engage stakeholders at all levels to ensure process around mapping and alignment can be actioned quickly  To be successful, you will have: • Ability to plan and schedule priorities, manage strict deadlines, work autonomously and adapt to changing situations • Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills • Strong written and verbal communication • Understanding and applying new technologies • Collaborative approach with the ability to build effective partnerships within own team and across the organisation  CULTURE & BENEFITS  A career with Blackwoods will offer you rewarding experiences and opportunities for growth and development. We have a diverse, inclusive, and safe workplace where our team members care about each other and enjoy building meaningful connections.  To ensure our employees feel valued, supported, and celebrated, we provide a range of employee benefits including: • Competitive salaries and incentives • Flexible work arrangements • A range of diversity and well-being initiatives • Ability to purchase up to 4 weeks additional annual leave • Team events, celebrations and development opportunities • Team member discounts on Wesfarmers products • Discounted offers from over 300 corporate partners • Generous Wesfarmers annual share plans • Attractive parental leave policy and more  NEXT STEPS  If you meet most of the criteria listed above and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please send your application today. We will be contacting suitable candidates as we receive them.  As part of our recruitment process and commitment to safety, you may be required to undertake background checks (which may include a police check, a pre-employment medical assessment; and/or drug & alcohol testing) as part of your application process.  Blackwoods also promotes diversity and inclusion across our workplaces and encourages applications from all backgrounds, including people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, the LGBTI+ community and people with disabilities.  Please note: All applications will be reviewed after 3rd October 2023.
job_description.46: • ‘Work where it works’ for you and your clients • Be part of a team where everyone belongs, and individuality is celebrated • Contribute to the financial wellbeing of our 2 million+ clients across Australia  The difference you will make at Insignia Financial  In the role of the Salesforce Technical Business Analyst, you will take an active and forward-looking approach to enhance project delivery. This includes providing leadership to analysts and collaborating closely with the Delivery Manager to ensure the successful execution of team activities and deliverables.  You Will Make a Difference By • Conducting in-depth technical analysis, addressing complex business requirements and processes • Serving as a pivotal link between stakeholders and the delivery team, taking charge of complex issues across various applications that involve multiple parties • Evaluating existing processes and systems, offering recommendations for process enhancements • Providing subject matter expertise and conduct business analysis for intricate projects • Developing position statements on complex subject matter inquiries • Assisting in Incident Management during Business as Usual (BAU) operations, identifying the root causes and facilitating defect remediation within stipulated SLAs • Providing comprehensive support throughout the end-to-end delivery process, including technical requirements, testing, and change management for planned releases and maintenance windows as needed  A Little Bit About You • Possess business and/or technology expertise, acquired within the Financial Services sector or other related industries • Extensive experience, with a significant portion dedicated to working with Salesforce • Hold tertiary qualifications or possess equivalent industry experience • Demonstrate prior experience in various business practices, with a particular focus on Financial Services, especially in superannuation and fund management • Expert in systems design, integration, and function/data analysis within specific business functions • Exhibit effective communication and interpersonal skills, crucial for effective stakeholder engagement, including the ability to conduct showcases • Adopt a proactive approach to problem-solving, critical thinking, and the identification of opportunities for improvement • Lead by example by embodying the culture and values that align with the expectations of the team and Insignia Financial  Life at Insignia Financial  From people just starting out, to those about to retire – every day we help more Australians secure their future. Helping our clients reach their financial goals sooner is our specialty. Few others can match the range of wealth management products and services we offer.  Insignia Financial is an ASX Top 200 company, and one of one of Australia’s leading wealth managers. We use our scale and expertise to invest in a future that’s better for everyone. We believe success comes from caring about people, consistent performance, and outstanding service. And we recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference: this applies to employees and clients alike.  Diversity and ensuring our people feel they belong is important to us, we take pride in putting our people, as well as our clients, first and value and celebrate diversity within all our teams.  We have a Women in Technology community which exists to bring together female and non-binary people within the tech world at Insignia Financial. This supportive forum is eager to progress and make change in the technology space – does this sound like you?  With many of us now working from home more than the office, we understand the importance of flexibility. As we work in a hybrid environment, you’ll ‘work where it works’ for you, your team, and our clients. We also offer varied and flexible leave offerings, including 12 weeks paid parental leave and an extra day of leave each year.  We encourage our people to have an impact on the broader community we serve through volunteering leave.  At Insignia Financial, it’s important to us that our people feel secure about their own money. We have an extensive financial wellbeing offering available to our people, including access to financial advice, mortgage, and insurance brokers, Will and estate planning services and more.  Join us and contribute to achieving our ambition of creating financial wellbeing for all Australians through living our Principles: be human, deliver what matters, stronger together, keep it simple and do what’s right, not what’s easy.  To apply  Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now".  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.  #AW
job_description.47: Job Description  Job Title: Commercial Analyst - Drakes Supermarkets  Location: Adelaide, SA  Almost 50 years since Roger Drake purchased his first supermarket in 1974, Drakes Supermarkets has now become the largest independent grocery retailer in Australia.  Drakes Supermarkets is a proudly Australian-owned and independent retail chain, committed to providing exceptional service and quality products to our valued customers. With a strong emphasis on community involvement and supporting local suppliers, they have grown to become a trusted name in the retail industry.  The Opportunity  As a Commercial Analyst at Drakes Supermarkets, you will be an integral part of business communicating key data insights around shrinkage, consumer behaviours, sales and profit of the fresh food departments to help the organsiation make data driven decisions that drive the business forward.  Key Responsibilities • Reporting Development, Modelling, Maintenance, and Enhancement: • Develop and maintain a comprehensive monthly reporting suite for Fresh Supervisors and Store Managers. • Understand the specific information needs of the fresh food management team and tailor reports accordingly. • Assist in the development of annual Fresh Food Department budgets for sales, wages, and gross profit. • Actively participate in the month-end close process and review Fresh Food Departments' profitability. • Implement procedures and reporting requirements to improve shrinkage within our fresh areas of operation. • Create insightful dashboards to monitor the performance of key Fresh initiatives such as 'Bakery Model,' 'The Little Kitchen,' and 'Store Concepts.' • Ensure transparent, visual and accurate Fresh P&L reporting. • Commercial Analysis: • Conduct quarterly analysis and benchmarking of Fresh Food Department • Provide analysis and support for new Fresh Food opportunities, contributing to robust business cases. • Collaborate with the Commercial Manager to coordinate and manage quarterly performance reviews with the Fresh Food Manager and Supervisors. • Analyse monthly performance data for Fresh departments and entities, identifying trends and improvement areas. • Work closely with Fresh Food Supervisors to identify budget shortfalls and develop action plans for improvement. • Identify underperforming Fresh Food Departments and devise strategies to enhance their profit performance. • Ensure optimal inventory levels in Fresh Food Departments, aligning with maximum days sales cover. • Perform a key Fresh Food operating expenditure analysis, including areas such as wages and freight. • Continuous Process Improvement: • Collaborate with Fresh Food Supervisors to implement profit improvement initiatives and track their effectiveness. • Utilise data to proactively highlight operational performance issues and work with the team to implement improvements. • Identify opportunities for terms improvement with suppliers, contributing to cost efficiencies. • Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the Finance Team, ensuring our financial reporting evolves to support Drakes' profitability. • Initiate initiatives to promote a cohesive one-team culture within the commercial analytics team and the wider Fresh Finance team.  Experience And Skills • * Proven experience in budget development and analysis. • Exposure to Data Visual Applications is essential to the success of the role. • Being able to translate and articulate the data to decision makers is imperative. • Background in the commercial retail or fast-moving consumer goods industry. • Demonstrated expertise in modeling and complex data analysis. • Track record of identifying, planning, and successfully implementing improvements.  Drakes Supermarkets is an equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.  For more details please contact Thilini Elkaduwa at EGM Partners for a confidential discussion.

job_description.49: Introduction:  Adelaide PHN is seeking an experienced professional with skills in data analytics, and experience in reporting, to join our team as Performance and Reporting Coordinator. This role is pivotal to understanding and sharing the impact of our work with funders and stakeholders, including the community we serve.  About Us  Adelaide Primary Health Network (Adelaide PHN) is an independent, not for profit, primary health care organisation based in Adelaide.  We aim to improve the health and wellbeing of the Adelaide community by coordinating and integrating health and community services and by working in partnership to identify local needs and create strategies in response to keeping people well and out of hospital; improving their experience AND their health outcomes – to deliver on our vision of ‘shaping the health system to deliver better outcomes for vulnerable people, and a healthier Adelaide’.  Why you should come work with us  Adelaide PHN offers a great range of benefits to our employees, including: • Competitive remuneration and work-life balance. • Access to generous not for profit Salary Sacrifice taxation benefits including up to $15,900 for living expenses and $2,650 for meal and entertainment. • Work from home opportunities. • Leave Loading • Additional paid leave between Christmas and New Year, in addition to annual leave entitlements. • Generous allowance toward professional development. • Family friendly and flexible working arrangements. • Collaboration with passionate likeminded professionals. • Free Employment Assistance Program.  Description:  The Role  Reporting to the Planning and Performance Manager, this role will lead the Adelaide PHN 12 month performance report and annual report, and work alongside the organisation and engage key stakeholders to develop, track, analyse and report on population health, service and organisational performance data.  The successful incumbent will provide and maintain accurate reports and reference materials for both internal and external audiences, covering key activities including Adelaide PHN’s process, regulatory and stakeholder reporting and interactions with the Commonwealth Department of Health, as well as identify as well as identify opportunities to streamline and improve internal and external reporting.  For more information, you can view the position description here (Seek, Indeed and LinkedIn applicants please go to our website)  Skills and Experiences:  About You  Using your knowledge gained from a public health, population health, social science, health promotion, planning, evaluation, public/health sector management or similar relevant field, along with at least 5 years experience in a similar data analysis and performance reporting role, the successful incumbent will have demonstrated experienced in advanced computer skills, experience with data systems and reporting tools.  You will have the technical skills to interpret and provide high level analysis, contemporary and robust knowledge of data governance, a commitment to continuous improvement and be a skilled communicator to engage the organisation on key deliverables. An understanding of organisation wide key performance indicators and specifically in the health industry is vital.  In addition to this, to be successful in this role you’ll need: • To be committed to the development, maintenance and improvement of data collection systems and management • Be highly organised and able to communicate across the organisation to achieve high quality reporting • Have the technical skills to interpret data requirements and calculate population health and service data accurately and consistently • Be flexible and able to manage change and competing demands • Work collaboratively in a diverse cross- functional work environment • Be able to convey complex information, simply  How To Apply  To apply please click on Apply - include in your application a maximum 2 page covering letter outlining your suitability for the role against the skills and experience required, together with your resume.  Applications will ONLY be considered when received through our careers portal.  To apply, you must have the legal right to work in Australia.  Applications close 12 noon Monday 9 October 2023. However, shortlisting for this position may commence earlier.  For further information about this role, please contact Donna Shotton, Planning and Performance Manager on 08 8219 5900 or dshotton@adelaidephn.com.au.  We believe that our people’s differences are what make us great. We value diversity in culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability status, neurodiversity or any other aspect which makes our people unique. We are on our journey to continuously work to call out inequality and bias and encourage real workplace inclusion and diversity.
job_description.50: Line of Service  Assurance  Industry/Sector  Not Applicable  Specialism  Assurance  Management Level  Senior Associate  Job Description & Summary  Genuine opportunities can be hard to spot. Unless you're someone who's used to finding needles in haystacks made of data. If you're one of those people, you also probably know that opportunities this good don't come along that often.  PwC is one of those places where opportunities create options.  We're a community of people united by the love of solving problems, and every solution we deliver cements trust with our clients. And that trust creates more opportunities to strengthen our relationships and fortify our culture.  More than just a number  Supportive team leaders elevate your success.  We lead differently, empowering our people to harness their human ingenuity, passion and latest technology to create a better tomorrow. We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change.  We know that when people from a variety of backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society. In Data Assurance, we care deeply about our people and the numbers. We celebrate having a culture where innovation meets passion. For us, it's about having an incredible team to solve important problems.  Feel confident in Assurance  What is assurance? A feeling of confidence.  It's what we strive to deliver to our clients as we work side by side to help solve the myriad of issues they face. This assurance, in turn, enables organisations to build and earn trust with their stakeholders.  Data has changed the world. Our clients need trusted advice on how to best gather, use and analyse their information. That's where we come in.  We offer a wide range of services, from data governance and data quality to large scale recalculation, visualisation, data collection and validation platforms, as well as advanced analytics. Our Data Assurance team works alongside clients in a multitude of ways. These may be complex recalculations of business process outcomes, developing bespoke solutions to specific problems.  We help transform external and internal audit approaches by embedding data analytics through the entire audit lifecycle and look to the future as algorithmic decisioning becomes embedded in operational areas.  We also help our clients establish the best controls, processes and structures to ensure that decisions are made on accurate information.  We often assure that information and data provided to regulators and third parties is accurate, complete and can be trusted. About you  You have a background in data analytics. You're skilled in data visualisation, data cleansing and manipulation, and you understand business and risk applications. If you have any previous experience in internal audit analytics, that's a big green flag for us  As a Senior Associate in our Data Assurance team, you'll make an impact through:  Building risk and compliance data analytics outputs using tools like Alteryx, ACL, R, Python, Qlik Sense, Power BI, and SQL Server.  Applying risk and compliance analytics to drive decision making for our clients, helping them to better manage risks, optimise processes and build trust with their stakeholders.  Working across multiple client projects, with a broad range of tasks across the data analytics life cycle, like ETL, data wrangling and cleansing, reporting and dashboarding. Compelling data-driven storytelling to communicate and help clients minimise risk and improve their processes and control framework.  Your New Benefits  Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance  Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends  Paid study (and leave), we pay all the costs and give you time off to study  No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day  Yearly bonuses, because who doesn't love to be rewarded for great performance  Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships  Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers  If you're looking for a team that values your work and solves meaningful problems, apply now  We believe the best work is human-led and tech-powered.  If you're keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. Maricruz Yangali is the Recruitment Manager for the role.  As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. job_description.52: You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.  Responsibilities • Collaborate with team leader and senior data scientists, as well as clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, problems and objectives. • Understand data structures and business and extract and integrate required data sources for analysis according to business requirements. • Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions, including undertaking data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, evaluation, deployment, and maintenance. • Collaborate with senior data scientists and team leader and clients to productise and pilot analytical models for production and insight per clients required. • Undertake cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders. • Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes.
