job_description.53: The role You'll be working under the Manager in Health Service Research, Analysis, and Modelling.  In this role, you'll use advanced data tools like Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Posit/R, Python, and SQL to make sure data flows smoothly between users and stakeholders.  Your job is to dig into big datasets, analyse data, and then share your findings in a way that makes sense.  You'll be a key part of making business intelligence products and improving the Planning Portal platform by adding up-to-date data, visuals, and dashboards. This will make it easier for people to access health service planning information.  Additionally, your role will extend to fostering service planning capacity and capability across the Department of Health and Hospital and Health Services.  Your exceptional communication and people skills will enable you to diplomatically consult with a diverse range of stakeholders, fostering open and respectful dialogue while ensuring compliance with contemporary HR principles and practices.  The successful personTo thrive in this role, you need to know about the health system, including key health priorities, challenges, and the unique health needs of different groups of people.  You should also be really good at using Power BI or similar software to create visual representations of important health data. In this job, you'll oversee building applications that show health information for the whole state to make decisions. It's important that you're skilled at getting and handling data from big datasets.  This means you should be great at analysing data and turning it into useful information that you can share with others.  You should also know how to use different tools for handling data, whether it's on a physical server or in the cloud. Some of these tools include Azure, SQL Server, R Studio/Posit Workbench, Power BI, and Qlik.  It's crucial that you can look at numbers critically and turn them into useful insights that can be presented professionally. Your job will also involve managing projects efficiently. This means you should be able to work well on your own and as part of a team.  You'll be responsible for making sure complex projects are completed on time and reach the goals that have been set.  Furthermore, your expertise should extend to utilizing both on-premises and cloud-based data integration tools, including Azure, SQL Server, R Studio/Posit Workbench, Power BI, and Qlik. You should be adept at critically analysing numerical data, transforming it into insightful information, and presenting it professionally.  Additionally, your role will require efficient project management skills, highlighting your ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a team, ensuring the successful management of complex, time-sensitive projects and meeting specified milestones. About usThe Department of Health is responsible for the overall management of the public health system in Queensland.  We are an organisation that strongly believes in the need to collaborate with people who value the goals of our organisation and who will thrive in our workplace. Working at the Department of Health is about making a difference.  Clinical Planning and Service Strategy (CPSS) is the division responsible for delivering clinical service strategy and planning, workforce strategy, planning, and leadership, mental health strategy and planning and precision medicine and research functions to improve health services available to the Queensland community, optimise health gains, reduce inequalities, and maximise the efficiency and effectiveness of the health system.  The Division collaborates with health system leaders, Hospital and Health Services, clinical networks, key healthcare service providers, research and academic organisations, State and Commonwealth agencies as well as non-government organisations and other divisions. Benefits • A fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment • Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading • Flexible working arrangements • Diverse work culture • Career training and developmentTo apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume and a cover letter (maximum two pages) outlining your skills and experience relevant for this role.

Due to continued growth, Mott MacDonald’s leading Advisory team is looking for a Digital Analyst to be based in our Brisbane office. job_description.56: Are you passionate about data analysis and intrigued by the world of gambling? Do you have a knack for uncovering valuable insights from intricate datasets? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst to join our clients dynamic team in Brisbane, Australia.  Our client is a pioneering and rapidly expanding gambling startup committed to providing innovative and responsible gaming experiences for users around the globe. Their team comprises talented individuals who share a passion for analytics, gambling, and data-driven decision-making.  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of their gambling products. Your responsibilities will include analysing extensive datasets, identifying trends, and delivering actionable insights to enhance our product development and user engagement. Your work will directly influence their strategic decisions and contribute to the success of their gambling offerings.  Key Responsibilities: • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define and refine data requirements. • Devise and implement data collection strategies to capture pertinent gambling metrics. • Analyse intricate datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and optimisation opportunities. • Create compelling and informative reports and dashboards. • Offer actionable recommendations for improving game design, user engagement, and monetisation. • Conduct A/B tests and experiments to measure the impact of changes. • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and gambling analytics.  Qualifications: • Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science). • Proven experience as a data analyst, preferably within the gambling or gaming industry. • Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R). • Strong familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). • Experience with gambling analytics platforms is a plus. • Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Strong communication and collaboration abilities. • Enthusiasm for gambling and a solid understanding of gambling dynamics.
job_description.57: Description  About the role  Here at Karmo, we’re on a mission to evolve the way we access private transportation. We have established product lines, an existing and growing customer base, and are experiencing a sustained growth spurt which is driving us to build a larger business with a variety of alternatives to traditional car ownership, placing Karmo in a prime position within the burgeoning mobility-as-a-service (MaaS) industry in Australia.  We are looking for a Business Analyst with a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a high attention to detail. As part of the role you will receive on-the-job training and you will be mentored and guided by the existing Product Management team. You will be working with the founding team and be part of the first 30 employees responsible for bringing the company’s vision to life by building bespoke systems that will take our company to the next level. As a profitable, funded startup, you will work directly with the CEO, COO, Product Management and Engineering teams on building our core software offerings. You will also work closely with our operations team, meet customers and suppliers, and generally be a key contributor in ensuring that we are building high-value, fit-for-purpose products.  Responsibilities • Performing requirements analysis through discussions with SMEs and stakeholders across all levels within the business • Validating business requirements and ensuring solutions meet business and customer’s needs and requirements • Documenting business requirements through Jira user stories and in confluence • Performing functional and usability tests of increments released by the scrum team • Actively participating as an embedded member of the scrum team  Australian working rights only  If you don’t meet all the requirements, you are still welcome to reach out to discuss this opportunity in detail.  What you’ll do day to day • Perform requirements analysis on upcoming features for our bespoke software products • Create high-quality user stories based on requirements • Work closely within the scrum team ensuring quality control is defined and conveyed prior to development commencing • Perform quality assurance of released increments  Your first 30/60/90 days at Karmo  First 30 Days  Meet the team and learn the business  Start performing requirements analysis, creating user stories, performing quality control measures and quality assurance  Start embedding as a member of the scrum team  First 60 Days  Commence working on our product (more detail to be provided as part of the interview process)  First 90 Days  Commence shipping MVPs and internal tools (more detail to be provided as part of the interview process)  About you  You possess: • Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail • A can-do attitude and the ability to work autonomously while still being a team player. Good interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal • Experience in creating process flow diagrams • Experience in conducting requirements validation and quality assurance of applications, websites, and SaaS products • Experience using Jira and Confluence (preferred, but not required) • Experience in Scrum (preferred, but not required) • 2 years’ experience in a similar role (preferred, but not required)  Karmo Work Style  You can expect to work from our Brisbane office 3 days per week so we can conduct high bandwidth team meetings / strategy sessions / general work. However, you can work from home on days where face to face work is not required (note: to provide you with the best onboarding experience and set you up for success, you can expect to be in the office more frequently during your first 1-2 months).  What we offer  There is a lot to be inspired by here at Karmo - we’re leading the charge on vehicle access over ownership whilst pushing heavily towards EV and carbon neutral fleets. With flexible work arrangements and a collaborative approach to building software and systems from the ground up, there is heaps of scope for career development and professionally fulfilling experiences. This role in particular will be closely mentored by our Product Managers with daily exposure and hands-on experience in Product, User Experience, and Engineering.  In addition, you can expect your package to include: • Competitive remuneration • A flexible, hybrid work environment as detailed above • Monthly Phone allowance • Yearly wellbeing allowance • Learning and development allowance

job_description.59: For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.  At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. job_description.61: About the Company:  Major Australian not-for profit, looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support the business through a Government Reform project with data analysis, calculations, complex modelling, insights and advice. You will be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data from various sources, and utilising advanced statistical and analytical methods to uncover valuable insights and create solutions that support business objectives.  About the Role:  As a Senior Data Analyst, initially you role will focus on providing support for the Government Reform project, through developing complex financial and operational models to help determine the implications of the reform on the business, and to inform strategic decision making. In the long term, your role will transition to providing complex analysis and insights to solve various business problems, including delving into blue sky problems.  Key Responsibilities: • Collect, analyse and interpret data from various sources, using advanced statistical and analytical methods • Develop and implement data analysis systems and applications, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, PowerBI • Provide specialist data analysis skills to uncover insights and develop solutions to support business goals • Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management, using clear and compelling visualisations and reports • Apply mathematical, statistical, and other advanced analytical techniques to solve complex business problems and generate actionable insights. • Create dashboards, reports, presentations, and other deliverables to communicate analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management About You: • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in a large business or Government • Proficient in SQL and at least one programming language such as Python or R • Experience in financial modelling, predictive analytics, and complex business models • Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills For more information on this opportunity please contact Olivia at BLACKROC for a confidential chat on 0468 918 176. Alternatively, if this isn’t the right opportunity for you but you’re interested in other opportunities in Brisbane, feel free to reach out. olivia@blackroc.co
job_description.62: • Power Platform • Data Verse • $875 per day  About The Client And Role  This state government department is seeking the services of a Senior Data Analyst to join this exciting program of work moving away from legacy apps to the Microsoft ecosystem. It is in an initial 9-month contract with probable extensions and has a flexible WFH policy although there is a blended onsite requirement.  Requirements • Demonstrated ability to interpret complex multi system data sets and to draw insights to inform individual and shared data models and architectures. • Advanced knowledge of data modelling concepts, and experience with database design (conceptual, logical and/or physical) and establishing shared data models • Experience with analysis and design of Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD’s) • Experience working with databases, data warehousing, and data visualization tools • Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in data analysis (Python and SQL) • Must be able to communicate complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner including exposure with interacting / contributing to architecture and information governance groups • Ability to solve complex data problems related to ERD’s, definitions, modelling, quality, and data analysis. Ability to identify potential roadblocks and develop quality solutions • Minimum of 5 years relevant work experience or training in data analysis, data modelling and establishment of relevant practices • Demonstrated ability to work effectively and independently and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team and work across multiple initiatives and varying stakeholder groups.  How To Apply  If this is you, please apply below with your up-to-date CV (in Word format). All suitable applicants will be contacted for a discussion; please ensure you have relevant visa’s to work in Australia. For a confidential discussion, please contact Julian Clauson on 07 3193 3222.  IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our PRIVACY POLICY.

Conducting and developing highly specialised analytic solutions by utilising various statistical, machine learning and computational methods.  Key Skills: • Experience in R or Python (potentially consider other programming languages) • Experience with Statistical Modelling • Experience across data science toolkits, including Tidyverse, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) • Experience and technical proficiency in one or more of the following fields: machine learning, graph analytic, natural language processing, computer vision, data visualisation and artificial intelligence. job_description.65: 10 Month Contract + 2 x 12 Month optional extensions Rates Negotiable (Market Value)Brisbane CBD + Caseldine Location with a 2-3 days per week WFH flexibility  Hudson is working with a large dynamic and innovative organisation in search of a Data Analyst to enhance the decision making processed and drive business success.  You will play a crucial role in supporting the team to enhance data quality, define data sources, build dashboards, and perform analytics. Your responsibilities will include analyzing data from the existing system, collaborating with vendors, and designing data migration processes. You will work closely with stakeholders to provide valuable insights and recommendations, contributing to informed business decisions.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES • Analyze data from the existing system to determine volumes for migration to the new application and identify data quality issues. • Liaise with vendors to map existing data to the requirements of the new system, utilizing templates for staging entities. • Utilize data warehousing and Power BI for effective data management and visualization. • Design and execute data migration processes, including the remediation of low-quality data, extract jobs, transformation processes, and migration audit logs. • Demonstrate proficiency with ETL/ELT tools to extract, transform, and load data from multiple sources into templates provided by the vendor of the new system. • Collaborate with the Lead Analyst to manage technical risks, issues, conflicts, and priorities, ensuring timely project completion.  QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics). • Proven experience in data analysis, data migration, and data interpretation. • Familiarity with data warehousing and Power BI. • Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT tools and the ability to work with multiple data sources. • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. • Problem-solving mindset and the ability to manage technical risks and challenges. • Attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring high data quality.  To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, please contact Harme Son through email on to discuss further.  Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.  Ref No: 232798  Reference number: BBBH232798 Profession:IT, Technology & DigitalData Analysts  Company: Hudson Australia Date posted: 29th Sep, 2023
job_description.66: 07th July, 2023  A2B is a renowned company known for its dispatch technology deployed globally and expertise in payments embraced by retailers and the taxi industry in Australia. We are the proud parent company of well-known brands such as 13cabs, Cabcharge, EFT Solutions, and Mobile Technologies International. With our class-leading and cutting-edge technology, we support professional drivers and passengers, serving 96% of Australia's 22,000 taxis, as well as taxis in 50 cities across North America, Europe, and New Zealand.  The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing complex data, identifying trends and patterns, and providing recommendations to improve organizational efficiency. They work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to develop analytical solutions that drive business growth and innovation. Strong technical, analytical, and business skills are required to effectively communicate complex data insights to stakeholders and facilitate data-driven decision-making. • Analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop analytical solutions that drive business growth and innovation. • Maintaining and improving data quality and accuracy.  About You • Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate, Power Platform Functional Consultant Associate, or similar certification. • Experience as a data analyst, with a specific focus on Microsoft technologies. • Highly skilled in Power BI data modeling (Star schema). • Experience with writing DAX queries and Power Queries. • Experience working in a Data Vault environment. • Experienced in statistical languages such as Python or R. • Solid understanding of data security, data classification, and access control measures. • Consulting experience is also highly valued. • Keenness for a fast-paced environment with opportunities to learn, grow, and be exposed to a variety of problems, clients, and technologies. • Prior experience working in Agile methodology and DevOps. • Advanced SQL skills (joins, stored procedures, views, functions, tables, and relationships). • Proficiency in Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Data Lake Storage • Excellent presentation, communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.  To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and how you can contribute to our organization's success.
job_description.67: This is a Technical Business Analyst - EY DnA role with EY based in Brisbane.  EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.  -- EY --  Role Seniority -Mid Level · A role for someone with some well-developed knowledge and skills they can bring to the role and team. Typically within 2-5 years of experience.  More about the Technical Business Analyst - EY DnA role with EY       As a Technical Business Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: • Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data. • Be responsible for creating requirement specifications, analysing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating elicitation sessions, and digging around in the data when needed. • Designing and building reports – capture data requirements for the client and team • Creating requirements specifications, analysing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating workshop sessions, and using the necessary business analyst tools. • Working with SQL databases and database querying languages. • With programming skills such as Python and R.     Please consider applying even if you don't meet 100% of what’s outlined     Key Responsibilities •    Data Analysis and Reporting - Analyze data to discover and communicate insights, and offer concrete recommendations for key stakeholders to make critical decisions •    Project Coordination - Coordinate people and processes to ensure the effective and timely running of a project •    Data Management and Visualization - Create and maintain the organization’s Business Intelligence tools, and present complex data in simple, visual ways for key stakeholders  Key Strengths •    Numerical problem solving - Works with numerical information and performs mathematical calculations to solve problems •    Attention to detail - Accurately identifies and rectifies discrepancies or errors that exists in information and deliverables •    Problem solving - Identifies problems and develops logical solutions that address the problems  Why EY is partnering with Hatch on this role.  Hatch exists to level the playing field for people as they discover a career that’s right for them. So when you apply you have the chance to show more than just your resume.  A Final Note: This is a role with EY not with Hatch.  We do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, cultural identity, disability, age, or any other non-merit factors. To put it simply, Hatch is for everyone.

job_description.73: • Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM  face2face reference: 591408  Location: Nationwide - Remote  Hours: Full-time  Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline  Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super  About the role:  The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.  The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.  Duties: • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Required experience/skills: • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.  Desirable experience skills: • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment.  If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you. job_description.76: S-DNI About the Company Compare the Market, yep, the one with the meerkats, is a high-growth FinTech company on a transformational journey that is focused on designing, building, and delivering the very best money, home loan, energy, insurance and health comparison and fulfilment product solutions in Australia. job_description.77: Data & Insights Analyst – Fundraising &  Marketing Salary: $90K - $100K + Super + Salary packing Location : Melbourne, Sydney or remote Opportunities to continually advance your Data Analytics career . We are seeking candidates with a strong background in proven data and data insights expertise. This role goes beyond merely aggregating data into basic tabular reports; it involves the ability to comprehend and present insights in a compelling manner. These insights will not only significantly impact the donor experience but also go beyond seeking new financial opportunities. We are looking for individuals who are actively dedicated to enhancing our business offerings. About the role... In this role, you will be tasked with pioneering innovative approaches to harness consumer behavioural data. Your goal is to derive descriptive and prescriptive insights that will guide optimal decision-making. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating interactive and automated dashboards that empower our fundraising team to make strategic decisions through proactive in-depth analysis and insights. Key responsibilities... Build and Provide insights for the individual giving team in fundraising. Develop subject matter expertise in the various channels used by the individual giving team. Engage with business users to consult and recommend best possible way to answer their business data questions. Provide rapid answers to business questions using a mix of queries and visualisations. Support ad hoc data requests from across business areas. Design and build reporting data models that support user self-serve reporting. Identify data to integrate with the warehouse to develop actionable insights to drive business decisions. Build customer segmentation analytics and campaign performance reporting. Proactively organising training and development activities for business to facilitate adaption. Design, build, test and present meaningful insights from a complex range of data. Skills and experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field. 1-2 years' experience working with fundraising teams Experience with data visualisation and querying tools such as Power BI and SQL. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes. Strong ability to work in T-SQL and DAX queries. Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Experience in developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualisations. Knowledge of fundraising and marketing analytics and metrics. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. More about the role... Furthermore, you will play a vital role in supporting the enhancement of consumer engagement strategies and product-specific initiatives. Leveraging technical solutions and advanced analytics, you will be at the forefront of developing ground breaking solutions for consumer profiling and segmentation. Through your work in extracting insights from diverse data sources, you will drive strategic and operational initiatives.  These initiatives will lead to increased revenue, improved efficiency, cost optimisation, and an elevated supporter experience, ultimately contributing to the organisation's success and sustainable growth. A little about our client...  Mission Australia, a renowned national charity with over 160 years of dedicated service, is on a mission to help vulnerable Australians find their path to independence. They are committed to tackling homelessness, supporting struggling families, addressing mental health challenges, and fighting substance dependencies. Mission Australia thrives on the support of everyday Australians, corporate partners, and a passionate team of professionals. Next step is to APPLY...  Ready to embark on an epic journey where your data skills make a real difference? Send us your application, including a cover letter and resume, send it through Beaumont People now Join Mission Australia and become a data wizard on a mission to end homelessness and help communities thrive Apply now and be part of something truly magical Don't tick all the boxes? job_description.78: We are looking for a seasoned and experienced Data Migration Specialist to join our consulting team based in Milton, Brisbane.  As a data migration specialist within a high growth SaaS software company, you will play a crucial role in the streamlining of client onboarding and implementations, and have a pivotal role in the accelerating growth of a platform that is improving the lives of families and care givers across the country.  You will work with clients on data migration planning, writing scripts to extract, transform and load data into our software platform and collaborate with a team of data engineers, API developers, test analysts and Business Analysts to deliver great client outcomes. As part of the process you will provide data quality and import success reports to clients and facilitate discussions with clients about how to bring their data into our software for optimal outcomes.  Key Responsibilities • Lead the design and implementation of data migration scripts and processes, data evaluations and analysis • Engage with client application teams to plan and execute the migration and upgrade projects, with the ability to multitask and work effectively during cutover • Ensure client success by executing successful migration and/or upgrade activities including to plan and execute, migration and/or upgrade projects across the application lifecycle and route to live/production • Lead the design and implementation of standard connectors that pull data out of competitive software products and transform it into the required structures for import to our platform • Partner with internal colleagues from the Security, Provisioning, Product Support to align business goals with implementation results. • Adhere to ISO27001 compliance requirements when handling sensitive client data  Skills and experience: • You are a technical, hands-on, motivated and collaborative individual and proven experience working with diverse teams of technical architects, business users, and IT teams • Additionally, you have a history of consulting with customer organizations on all phases of the data migration life cycle. • Experience in data migration projects for CRM, ERP and/or Payroll implementations, health care experience desirable • Technical experience regarding data models, database design, ETL development and data mining, Typescript and PHP • Experience and understanding of Data cleansing, extraction, normalizing, reconciliation and balancing experience as related to an ETL process • Strong knowledge of and experience with database technologies such as MS SQL, MySQL • Good communication and planning skills and proven track record of working in a consultative environment
job_description.79: Children & Youth Justice Systems Reform – Unify  ICT Contractor Position Description  POSITION TITLE:  Senior Data Analyst  LOCATION:  111 George Street, Brisbane  CLOSING DATE:  COB Friday, 4 November 2022  HIRING MANAGER:  Tania Vicary  POSITION CONTACT:  Director  Department overview  The Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs (CYJMA) recognise Queensland comprises communities of diverse cultural backgrounds who have varying needs and aspirations, and who rely on diverse industries for their livelihoods.  In response to this, the Department works in partnership across government, with local communities, non-government organisations and the private sector to achieve the best outcomes for Queenslanders.  By working with us, you will have the opportunity to work with staff from across the department to resolve complex issues and change life trajectories.  About Unify  CYJMA has commenced a four-year journey to implement a new contemporary and coordinated case management system for vulnerable children, young people and families. The Unify Program has been established to deliver this new system to support current and future child safety and youth justice needs through adaptable technology that can support changes to practice as reform occurs over time.  The program will be comprised of a series of joined up projects to provide new integrated and innovative legislation, practice and performance frameworks and business processes, enabled by technology and underpinned by a human-centered design approach.  The program focuses on three critical capabilities: • It is client-centric: supporting targeted, needs-based responses to children, young people, parents, families, carers and communities while delivering earlier and more effective interventions. • It is integration-enabling: designed around collaboration and information sharing, enabling connected and integrated responses to clients across government agencies and non-government partners. • It is data driven, enabling the effective monitoring of outcomes to improve the experiences of children, young people and families and ensures that future investment is directed to what works.  Purpose of the position  The purpose of this position is to provide high quality data analysis, mapping and modelling to the Unify program for the delivery of Child and Family and Youth Justice Products.  The position will be required to engage and work closely with a range of stakeholders to analyse data needs, gather and document requirements, and develop artefacts. The position will play a critical role in understanding the data required for migration, cleansing, viewing and ultimately reporting. In this role one has to work very closely with transactional systems business analysts to build logical/physical data models for the department’s business processes and manage common data model that satisfies requirements.  The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the capacity to work within a multi-specialist team and deliver to tight timeframes and deadlines (and rapidly changing priorities).  Key responsibilities • Undertake data mapping against an ICT solution and identify the delivery of data sets to support Product delivery • Understand business needs and processes to identify, analyse and document detailed data requirements • Work with business representatives to determine priorities and validate and justify the requirements • Participate in data extract, transformation and migration activities • Work with development teams and other skilled analysts to validate functionality against the data requirements • Provide timely, strategic and expert advice regarding data requirements, information requirements, business impacts, scope management, and project risks • Manage the delivery of work to a schedule and assist in the setting and managing of expectations • Use high level communication skills to negotiate, establish, and maintain networks and working relationships • Apply standardised templates, methodologies and processes for data analysis activities and related project documentation • Lead and work collaboratively with a wide range of staff at all levels • Contribute to business integration, change management, and testing activities • Actively manage a working environment supporting quality human resource management practices including employment equity, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety, and ethical behaviour.  Essential requirements  The applicant must demonstrate: • Demonstrated experience in data ingestion, cleansing, manipulation and modelling. • Experience in eliciting, analysing, specifying, documenting and validating the business data needs of stakeholders. • Data/reports development skills and experience relevant to the position • Understanding and experience working with applications that utilise complex relational architecture • Experience working within a large, complex multi-disciplinary organisation • High level of written communication and documentation skills • Proven effective communication and stakeholder engagement skills and experience • Proven ability to manage a large workload whilst maintaining high levels of accuracy  Desirable requirements • Data and ETL experience especially with Microsoft Azure Cloud Data Platform (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Profisee, Azure Data Verse) • Ability to write complex SQL scripts, queries, and stored procedures to extract and mine data. • Experience in developing complex reports, including consideration of complex business rules and data architecture • Knowledge and understanding of the public sector Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Environment. • See projects through to completion, monitoring project progress and adjusting plans as required. • Take personal responsibility for meeting objectives and progressing work. Demonstrate initiative and proactively steps in and does what is required. Commits energy and drive to see that goals are achieved. • Consults and shares information and ensures others are kept informed of issues. • Experience in agile projects methodology.  Deliverables • Document business data requirements and entity relationship at logical and physical levels and maintenance for business products • Develop a data dictionary, detailed data flow diagrams, specifications, and other project related artefacts and documentation as required by the project/program management leadership team. • Document and implement work package activities • Assist stakeholders with User Acceptance Testing  Acknowledgement  I acknowledge that consideration of employing a public servant for this role was carried out and there was no public servant available to fill the requirements of this position.
job_description.80: Brisbane or remote  Are you a talented Digital Analytics Analyst looking to make a significant impact in a growing organisation? We are currently seeking a dedicated individual to join our team based in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne.  Why join us? • State of the art offices with offerings like end of trip facilities, yoga and multi faith room, barista coffee, indoor gardens, and a multitude of spaces to encourage a collaborative culture, our workspaces are something we are extremely proud of. • A mature outlook on flexible work arrangements which allows you to truly balance work and life. We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
job_description.81: Brief Description  About Us:  At Auto & General (A&G), we provide great products and services to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protects customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, and Pet products as well as Roadside Assistance.  Our culture of ‘high performance with high integrity’ underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.  The Role  The Pricing Data Scientist will be responsible for undertaking advanced analytics and data science services to support the Pricing Team. This includes developing and implementing best practice predictive models, exploring the use of new or existing data assets, and providing expert support on process improvements. You will also need to provide advice and report on the impact of key Pricing decisions and operational activities on the portfolio.  To be successful in this role, the Pricing Data Scientist should have an appreciation of traditional Pricing approaches and understand the strengths and weaknesses of alternative approaches. They should be able to demonstrate an innovative approach to problem-solving and possess excellent communication skills that target a non-technical audience.  Accountabilities • Manage the end-to-end development and implementation of a range of predictive models that support the business to make better decisions. • Review the modelling process including data preparation, modelling, review, implementation and monitoring as well as make recommendations for continuous improvements. • Support the Actuarial Team’s approach to technical pricing by developing approaches for more efficient processing of external data, classification of assets or use of available information. • Evaluate and manage complex changes to models and their implications. • Create test plans, manage and sign-off testing for all business-wide IT changes that impact pricing.  Knowledge And Experience • 5+ years general insurance industry experience. • Experience with developing and implementing a range of predictive models for various purposes. • Proven analytical and problem-solving capability. • Clear understanding of statistical modelling techniques and, in particular, modern modelling techniques (e.g. machine learning). • Superior communication skills that include stakeholder management and development of high-quality board papers. • Familiarity with statistical software packages (e.g. SAS, R, SQL) is advantageous. • Degree qualified in mathematics, statistics, actuarial studies or similar.  Our Perks • Location – Our office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre - a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport. • Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You’ll receive a paid ‘ME’ day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year. • Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits. • Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar-match your donations to registered charities. • Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses. • Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products. • Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes. • Onsite facilities – There are excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers. • Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites. • Perks App - Access to an employee benefits and discounts app called ‘Perks’ offering your great discounts, offers and programs across a range of areas.  If you are seeking a new challenge and would enjoy the opportunity to work in a growing and changing business, click on the APPLY NOW button and submit your application.  Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all. • A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job_description.85: Could the skills you build here unlock doors anywhere?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.  The opportunity  Due to continued success and growth, an exciting opportunity exists for a Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager to join our highly regarded People Advisory Services team.  Our team works as a well-integrated national team, where you’ll have the opportunity to work with Australian-based and multinational clients across the country, therefore offering you the ability to work with large corporates, and a diverse range of industries. In this role, you will have access to training, coaching and support that’s available to help grow your career even further!  This role is open to various locations - Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, and Perth.  What’s in it for you?  As our Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager - your responsibilities will include: • Modelling of various Industrial Instrument (including Enterprise Bargaining Agreements, Industry Awards etc.) for wage compliance projects; • Modelling of superannuation and Pay-As-You-Go Withholding data modelling projects (including the preparation of superannuation guarantee charge statements and voluntary disclosure letters); • Liaise directly with clients and other regulatory authorities (e.g. Australian Taxation Office, Fair Work Australia etc.) in the delivery of data projects; • Work with different parts of the business in driving growth in the global mobility data analytics practice; • Preparing & presenting training seminars to both clients and team members.  What We’re Looking For  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. What We Can Offer You • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment • Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness • Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build. job_description.87: Use your specialist data analysis skills to uncover insights and develop solutions to support business goals. Olivia 0468 918 176 About the Company:  Major Australian not-for profit, looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support the business through a Government Reform project with data analysis, calculations, complex modelling, insights and advice. You will be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data from various sources, and utilising advanced statistical and analytical methods to uncover valuable insights and create solutions that support business objectives. In the long term, your role will transition to providing complex analysis and insights to solve various business problems, including delving into blue sky problems.  Key Responsibilities: • Collect, analyse and interpret data from various sources, using advanced statistical and analytical methods • Develop and implement data analysis systems and applications, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, PowerBI • Provide specialist data analysis skills to uncover insights and develop solutions to support business goals • Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management, using clear and compelling visualisations and reports • Apply mathematical, statistical, and other advanced analytical techniques to solve complex business problems and generate actionable insights. • Create dashboards, reports, presentations, and other deliverables to communicate analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management About You: • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in a large business or Government • Proficient in SQL and at least one programming language such as Python or R • Experience in financial modelling, predictive analytics, and complex business models • Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills For more information on this opportunity please contact Olivia at BLACKROC for a confidential chat on 0468 918 176. Alternatively, if this isn’t the right opportunity for you but you’re interested in other opportunities in Brisbane, feel free to reach out. olivia@blackroc.co

information, data cleaning and imports, and providing specific contact lists and reports to clients and stakeholders contained within the CRM and ERP databases • Design and develop reports and Information Technology practices and emerging trends in the development and implementation of information technology solutions • Analytical, conceptual, and innovative problem-solving skills • Start your career as a Data Engineer with the Data Engineer graduate internship program. Data Engineer Internship Responsibilities  Manage and analyse data to find trends for decision making Perform data acquisition from large-complex data sources using Python Support the Senior Data Engineer through different data extraction techniques Developing database schemas Work with Data Scientists to collect and analyse large data sets Work across multiple databases as a Data Engineering Intern  What you will learn in your Data Engineer Internship?  Develop your skills using OLTP databases, OLAP databases and ORMs and NoSQL databases Gain hands-on experience using extract-load data pipelines Experience using cloud platforms, DevOps, micro-services, and serverless architectures (ideally AWS) and deployments  How to apply for the Data Engineer Internship? What you'll be doing: • Consolidate data sources from multiple systems • Identify and remove duplicate data • Identify data that can be archived in line with business rules • Work with various SMEs to gather missing or incomplete data • Format data into the required .xls template(s) for bulk upload to system(s) • Provide clear, regular updates on progress and any barriers encountered • Assist with data analysis and validation to group course data into curricula sets based on role This is a hybrid role, working from the office (located north side of Brisbane) 3 days a week. job_description.91: • Seeking a Data & Insights Analyst for Fundraising & Marketing • Salary: $90K - $100K + Super + Salary packing • Location: Melbourne, Sydney or remote • Opportunities to continually advance your Data Analytics career.  We are seeking candidates with a strong background in proven data and data insights expertise. This role goes beyond merely aggregating data into basic tabular reports; it involves the ability to comprehend and present insights in a compelling manner.  These insights will not only significantly impact the donor experience but also go beyond seeking new financial opportunities. We are looking for individuals who are actively dedicated to enhancing our business offerings.  About the role  In this role, you will be tasked with pioneering innovative approaches to harness consumer behavioural data. Your goal is to derive descriptive and prescriptive insights that will guide optimal decision-making. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating interactive and automated dashboards that empower our fundraising team to make strategic decisions through proactive in-depth analysis and insights.  Key responsibilities • Build and Provide insights for the individual giving team in fundraising. • Develop subject matter expertise in the various channels used by the individual giving team. • Engage with business users to consult and recommend best possible way to answer their business data questions. • Provide rapid answers to business questions using a mix of queries and visualisations. • Support ad hoc data requests from across business areas. • Design and build reporting data models that support user self-serve reporting. • Identify data to integrate with the warehouse to develop actionable insights to drive business decisions. • Build customer segmentation analytics and campaign performance reporting. • Proactively organising training and development activities for business to facilitate adaption. • Design, build, test and present meaningful insights from a complex range of data.  Skills and experience • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field. • 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field. • 1-2 years’ experience working with fundraising teams • Experience with data visualisation and querying tools such as Power BI and SQL. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes. • Strong ability to work in T-SQL and DAX queries. • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. • Experience in developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualisations. • Knowledge of fundraising and marketing analytics and metrics. • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.  More about the role  Furthermore, you will play a vital role in supporting the enhancement of consumer engagement strategies and product-specific initiatives. Leveraging technical solutions and advanced analytics, you will be at the forefront of developing ground breaking solutions for consumer profiling and segmentation.  Through your work in extracting insights from diverse data sources, you will drive strategic and operational initiatives. These initiatives will lead to increased revenue, improved efficiency, cost optimisation, and an elevated supporter experience, ultimately contributing to the organisation's success and sustainable growth.  A little about our client  Mission Australia, a renowned national charity with over 160 years of dedicated service, is on a mission to help vulnerable Australians find their path to independence. They are committed to tackling homelessness, supporting struggling families, addressing mental health challenges, and fighting substance dependencies. Mission Australia thrives on the support of everyday Australians, corporate partners, and a passionate team of professionals.  Next step is to APPLY  Ready to embark on an epic journey where your data skills make a real difference?  Send us your application, including a cover letter and resume, send it through Beaumont People now! Join Mission Australia and become a data wizard on a mission to end homelessness and help communities thrive!  Apply now and be part of something truly magical!  Don’t tick all the boxes? That’s okay, we like thinking outside the box. We value skills, passion, and drive. So, if this job resonates with you, we want to hear from you!  If you would like to have a confidential chat, please contact Jack or Dean on 02 9133 9322 or email dean@beaumontpeople.com.au, using the subject line: Data Insights Analyst - Mission Australia enquiry via EthicalJobs.  Beaumont People believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way. We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to be made for your application to be assessed we would be more than happy to discuss how that can be arranged.
job_description.92: • Student Enrichment and Employability Development (SEED) • Exciting and challenging working environment with a great team culture. • Utilise your strong analytical and technical skills to build data sets that support business decisions and product improvements. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and develop reporting requirements. • Based at our St Lucia campus  About UQ  As part of the UQ community, you’ll have the opportunity to work alongside the brightest minds, who have joined us from all over the world.  Everyone here has a role to play. As a member of our professional staff cohort, you will be actively involved in working towards our vision of a better world. By supporting the academic endeavour across teaching, research, and the student life, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to activities that have a lasting impact on our community.  Join a community where excellence is at the core of our culture, contributions are valued and a range of benefits and rewards are available, such as: • 26 weeks paid parental leave or 14 weeks paid primary caregiver leave. • 17% superannuation contributions. • 17.5% annual leave loading. • Access to flexible working arrangements including hybrid working options, flexible start/finish times, purchased leave, and a condensed fortnight. • Health and wellness discounts – fitness passport access, free yearly flu vaccinations, discounted health insurance, and access to our Employee Assistance Program for staff and their immediate family. • On campus childcare options. • Cheap parking (from just $5 a day). • Salary packaging options.  About This Opportunity  The Data Analyst is responsible for analysing data sourced by and on behalf of the Student Affairs Division from across the University, in order to respond to the day-to-day needs of various areas of the Division. This position will undertake analysis to identify trends and opportunities for growth to support the student experience and will play a lead role in the development of annual divisional reporting.  Key responsibilities include: • Working in partnership to identify and develop divisional service metrics. • Collecting, collating, and interpreting data from existing data sources and providing support to develop new, and redevelop existing, data sets by contributing to specification design and quality assurance checks. • Undertaking analysis of data sets to provide well-informed briefings and reports, identifying trends and opportunities for service delivery improvements. • Streamlining data reporting ensuring that it meets the needs of Student Affairs and wider University stakeholders. • Maintaining awareness of relevant technology and software improvements that may benefit the collection, integration, presentation, and analysis of data within UQ to support programs and initiatives that enhance the student experience.  This is a full-time, continuing (permanent) position.  At HEW level 7, the full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $93,254 to $101,680, plus a generous super allowance of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be up to $109,107 to $118,966 annually.  About You • Completion of an undergraduate degree, with experience in a relevant area, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training. • Demonstrated ability to compile and manipulate complex data sets and proven analytical skills with the ability to leverage quantitative/qualitative trend data to draw conclusions related to the student experience provided by the division. • Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to design and produce clear, concise, and accurate advice and briefing papers on complex issues. A proven ability to be highly organised and self-managing, including a demonstrated capacity to establish work priorities, meet timelines and achieve project management priorities, work independently and accept responsibility. • Highly developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to develop relationships with key stakeholders and liaise, consult, and negotiate with staff at all levels, both internally and externally. • Awareness of issues related to the student experience, retention, and employability within higher education nationally. • Experience in the use of the Business Objects and/or Tableau data management tool.  In addition, the following mandatory requirements apply: • Work Rights: You must have unrestricted work rights in Australia for the duration of this appointment to apply. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment. • Background Checks: All final applicants for this position may be asked to consent to a criminal record check. Please note that people with criminal records are not automatically barred from applying for this position. Each application will be considered on its merits.  Questions?  For more information about this opportunity, please contact Paul Dwan at p.dwan@uq.edu.au. For application queries, please contact recruitment@uq.edu.au stating the job reference number (below) in the subject line.  Want to Apply?  To submit an application for this role, go to the UQ Careers portal and use the Apply button.  All applicants must upload the following documents in order for your application to be considered: • Cover letter addressing the ‘About You’ section. • Resume  Other Information  At UQ we know that our greatest strengths come from our diverse mix of colleagues, this is reflected in our ongoing commitment to creating an environment focused on equity, diversity and inclusion. We ensure that we are always attracting, retaining and promoting colleagues who are representative of the diversity in the broader community, whether that be gender identity, LGBTQIA+, cultural and/or linguistic, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, or people with a disability. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to recruitment@uq.edu.au  Applications close Monday 2 October 2023 at 11.00pm AEST (Job Reference Number - R-30511). Please note that interviews have been tentatively scheduled for 11 October 2023.

The successful candidate will have excellent attention to detail, with great organizational and communication  skills.Responsibilities:  • Input data into database accurately and in a timely manner  • Analyze and interpret data collected and enter the necessary information into the appropriate databases  • Ensuring accuracy of data by verifying information from multiple sources  • Develop and implement data entry processes for efficient data entry  • Compile, verify accuracy and sort information according to priorities to prepare source data for computer entry  Requirements:  • 2 years of data entry experience  • Experience using Microsoft Office suite  • Excellent keyboard skills with accurate data-entry skills  • Ability to work quickly and accurately with attention to detail  • Strong organization and time-management skills  If you think you have the skills and the experience to join our growing team, please submit your cover letter and resume. job_description.94: Job details  Position status Fixed Term Temporary Position type Flexible full-time Occupational group Project Management Classification AO7 Workplace Location Brisbane - North Job ad reference QLD/515376 Closing date 09-Oct-2023 Yearly salary Fortnightly salary Total remuneration Salary Other Job duration Until 31 October 2024 Contact person Heike Kolberg Contact details 0434 914 337  Access the National Relay Service  About the Procurement & Supply Chain Optimisation:  The Procurement & Supply Chain Optimisation (P&SCO) Portfolio builds on the foundational work undertaken in response to the COVID-19 pandemic to drive operational enhancements and realise further Queensland Health system-wide benefits.  What we are looking for: • Expert knowledge of world class warehousing operating models and processes in an environment of fast-moving inventory and related space utilisation, logistics and materials handling practices. • Well-developed ability to understand how supply chain processes and improvements contribute to organisational goals and ensure data analysis and recommendations are aligned with the broader business strategy. • High level of proficiency and skills in statistical and quantitative analysis and the use of data analysis tools and software to collect, clean and analyse large datasets to develop creative and innovative solutions to complex problems. • Demonstrated knowledge of data management and data manipulation techniques and high technical proficiency and competence in using data visualisation tools to create reports and dashboards, preferably in a warehousing environment. • Deep understanding of interrelationships between warehousing processes with other functions in a complex supply chain system such as purchasing, inventory, transport and logistics and an ability to connect data insights to business objectives and strategy. • Conceptual, problem-solving and analytical skills, to identify problems, propose innovative and practical data-driven solutions in a complex and dynamic environment with a focus on documenting analysis processes and findings. • Highly motivated to work effectively across functional teams, foster collaboration and build relationships across varied stakeholders by communicating confidently to a range of audiences and undertake effective consultation and negotiation processes. • Highly motivated and a demonstrated flexibility to work, including the ability to work autonomously or as a member of a team with due regard for goals, objectives and priorities.  Other role requirements: • While not mandatory, a relevant supply chain qualification would be well regarded. • Highly experience in the use of tools such as Microsoft Access, SQL, Power BI Microsoft Excel and Visual Basic which are vital in handling and analysing key data. • Proficient in the use of process modelling tools and has the fundamental understanding of industry recognised process notations such as Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) or Unified Modelling Language (UML). job_description.95: Accenture is a global professional services company. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person.  Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity.  Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.  Join Us  Experience : All levels  Start date : Staggered start dates apply  Location : ANZ  Salary : Remuneration package is negotiable based on experience  Do you have your head in the Cloud? • Combine the best of your ingenuity and Cloud technologies to build a better world and lead clients towards change. • Join us and do extraordinary things.  About you :  As a Data Migration Engineer, you will design and maintain data analytic road maps and data structures that support business and technology ambitions.  Naturally inquisitive and open to exploration of underlying data, finding valuable insights and work with functional areas to drive identified actions, you enjoy supporting a team and contributing and have the confidence to influence and communicate with stakeholders at all levels and comfortable working with ambiguity in complex environments.  Our team :  Accenture’s Modern Data Platforms practice covers the range of Data and AI skills across all domains of data governance & quality, cloud & traditional data engineering and visual insights & next generation user interfaces.  When combined with Accenture’s broader Strategy and Consulting and Technology businesses, we are able to bring together the unique end to end business changes through the application of Data and AI.  You will join our migration capability in the Modern Data Platforms team  About the role :  You will become an integral part of our Cloud First & Applied Intelligence team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on working alongside our industry, functional and technology SMEs with famous brands and household names to tackle some of the most tough problems in industry and the community.  In our team you will : • Work as a hands-on, authentic and committed Data Engineer to support clients across a range of industries. • Take responsibility for all aspects of data engineering from delivery planning, estimating and analysis, through to data architecture and pipeline design, delivery, and production implementation • Design and implement complex data solutions ranging from batch to streaming and data directed architectures, across cloud, on-premises and hybrid client technology landscapes • Provide technical thought to define data migration strategy and solution design using ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) methodology • Carry out root cause analysis of the problem and propose solutions. • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met • Drive engineering and architectural practices and standards • Develop end to end analytical solutions which will require transformation of complex data sets from multiple source systems, fix bugs, develop enhancements, address queries and requests from business and assist in data and integration tests.  We are looking for experience in the following : • Using tools and techniques such as Data Lake, SQL, Python / Pyspark (or other programming languages with the capability to learn Python), Git, AWS, ADO DevOps. • Data migration project experience • Strong hands-on experience in building data engineering pipelines. • Worked on delivering Data & Analytics solution on cloud platform, preferably AWS • Used cloud data services, such as S3, RedShift, Glue, Step Functions, Lambda  Desirable • Previous experience with high-scale or distributed RDBMS (Teradata, Netezza, Greenplum, Aster Data, Vertica), including metadata management, SQL development and performance tuning within these database environments. • Experience in addressing and implementing data quality solutions, data reconciliation framework and strong understanding and experience in building data lineage documentation, and Data Catalogues. • Experience with related / complementary open source software platforms and languages (e.g. Java, Linux, Apache, Perl / PHP, Chef)  Apply now to register your interest and have a chat about your current situation and career goals.  Your total rewards  Accenture Flex offers a Total Rewards package which includes compensation recognizing individual contributions and a range of benefits so you can build a coverage package based on your personal needs.  Base pay  We offer a competitive base pay based on your role, career level and skills.  Medical coverage and spending accounts  Employees have a choice of plans (PPO, EPO, HDHP) covering a wide range of medical services and prescription drugs. Use pretax dollars to pay for eligible health care and dependent day care expenses.  Dental and vision coverage  Employees can choose a traditional dental plan or a dental maintenance organization plan. A vision care plan is offered which covers an annual routine eye exam as well as frames, lenses, or contacts.  Life Insurance & Long-Term Disability  Accenture Flex provides you with a basic level of life, AD&D and disability insurance, and you have the option of purchasing additional coverage.  Paid Time Off (PTO)  PTO encompasses traditional vacation time along with paid personal time off and sick leave, providing flexibility for how, when and for what purpose time off is taken.  401(k) Savings plan  Employees are immediately eligible to contribute to a standard 401(k), a Roth, or an after-tax account through convenient payroll deductions and are always vested in their own employee contributions.
job_description.96: • Based in Milton, QLD • Career Development Opportunity • Industry Leader  Downer's Road Services business is one of the largest non-government owned road services businesses in Australia. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 36,000 km of road. An exciting career opportunity is available for Junior Machine Learning and Data Analyst to assist in the development and implementation of digital solutions including machine learning, artificial intelligence and MS Azure Power Platform for data collection, analysis and management. ABOUT YOU • An understanding of machine learning and object detection technologies with a desire to further develop in this area. Experience with Azure ML will be highly regarded. • Degree qualified in computer science or equivalent tertiary qualification with quantitative research experience. • A double degree with Civil Engineering is highly desired. • Programming machine learning/artificial intelligence for data capture and / or optimisation. • Sound knowledge of Python and SQL. • Developing with Power Automate, Power Apps and Power BI. • Preferable knowledge of road asset management concepts. • Preferable 2 years of industry work experience. • The ability to evaluate information quickly, identify key issues and formulate decisions. • Well-developed communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively with all stakeholders including operational teams. • Have a willingness and enthusiasm to learn road maintenance concepts and the application of workflow management systems.  WHAT WE OFFER • Highly supportive, team-orientated organisation • A strong commitment to Zero Harm environment for all our employees and visitors • Competitive remuneration with on-going training and support • A long-term career opportunity to work with an ASX listed company  At Downer, our approach to diversity is what sets us apart. We are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you're excited about this role and your experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. We do not accept applications via email but for more information, please contact: Melissa Edwards - Talent and Sourcing Business Partner P: 0418 261 964 E: Melissa.Edwards2@downergroup.com Notwithstanding the location of this position, all qualified Australian citizens and permanent residents from all locations are encouraged to apply.
