job_description.98: Are you passionate about outcomes for children and young people across Queensland?  We're committed to providing life-changing healthcare for children and young people for a healthier tomorrow.  About the Queensland Children's Hospital  The Queensland Children's Hospital (QCH), which opened on 29 November 2014, is Australia's largest and most advanced paediatric facility. Located in South Brisbane, the 359-bed hospital features more than 80,000 square meters of facilities spread across 12 levels.  As Queensland's single specialist paediatric facility, Children's Health Queensland's (CHQ) at the QCH is the hub of a dedicated network of paediatric services available at other Brisbane and Queensland hospitals. Expanding on CHQ's state-wide remit, the QCH also supports regional hospitals through telemedicine and outreach services. This means children and young people can access the services they need as close to home as possible.  The hospital precinct includes the Centre for Children's Health Research, the Children's Hospital Foundation, Ronald McDonald House South Brisbane (opened in 2016) and a new Adolescent Drug and Alcohol Withdrawal Service building.  Your Opportunity: • Manage a binational team of data managers and biostatisticians for a binational registry, the “Australia and New Zealand Congenital Outcome Registry for Surgery” designed to evaluate outcomes following paediatric cardiac surgery across Australia and New Zealand • Coordinate data collection, data validation and secure transmission for the dataset across all participating sites. • Manage, extract and prepare data for analysis for annual registry reports and regulatory requirements as well as publications. • Work with collaborators to establish clear data definitions and site-specific processes to ensure quality data is collected and transmitted.  What CHQ HHS can offer  Apart from contributing to the development of Australia's best paediatric health service, you will also benefit from a competitive remuneration package and a working environment which embraces professional development, builds capabilities and supports staff to maximise their health and wellbeing. Additional benefits include: • Up to 12.75% employer superannuation contribution • 17.5% annual leave loading • Salary packaging • Employee Assistance Program • Work/life balance, variety and flexibility  You can find out more about why it's so great to work at CHQ HHS here ( http://www.childrens.health.qld.gov.au/work-for-us/ ).  It is a mandatory condition of employment for this role to be: • vaccinated against, and remain vaccinated against, certain vaccine preventable diseases (VPD) as outlined in the Health Employment Directive NO. 01/16(PDF) ( https://www.health.qld.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0009/150120/hed-0116.pdf ) • Vaccinated against COVID-19 as outlined in the Health Employment Directive NO. 12/21(PDF) ( https://www.health.qld.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0022/1108453/hed-1221.pdf ) and the Queensland Health Human Resources Policy B70(PDF) ( https://www.health.qld.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0024/1108446/qh-pol-486.pdf ).
job_description.99: Business Intelligence Analyst  The Reporting and Business Partnering team is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the team and assist in building out the function and capability, including but not limited to digital automation and process improvement.  Your New Opportunity  We are in search of a skilled Business Intelligence Analyst to join our finance team, with a primary focus on automating existing reporting processes and expanding the internal analytics capability across our professional services firm. You will play a pivotal role in creating insightful reports that offer valuable insights to Partners and Managers, specifically related to profitability, clients, our people, and operations.  Responsibilities: • Collaborate closely with the Finance Manager - Business Partnering and Reporting, to understand technical reporting requirements and translate them into effective data models and PowerBI dashboards. • Implement ETL processes to gather, transform, and load data from different systems into a central data repository, simplifying report creation. • Utilise your technical expertise to create visually appealing and interactive reports and dashboards that align with design requirements to provide meaningful insights. • Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process improvements, supporting informed decision-making. • Help develop and nurture a roadmap for transitioning from prescriptive analytics to predictive analytics capabilities, in alignment with the firm's strategic goals. • Collaborate with the IT infrastructure team to ensure data models and reports are deployed appropriately at enterprise level, whilst adhering to data governance best practices and prioritising data security. • Support the integration of Power Apps to automate manual finance processes and enhance efficiency across the finance team. • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data warehousing and Power BI technologies, implementing best practices to continuously enhance technical delivery capabilities.  Skills and Key Requirements: • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics or a related field. • Strong knowledge of data warehousing concepts, database design, and ETL processes. • Expertise in building data models, Power BI reports, and interactive dashboards using SQL, DAX, Power Query, or M Query. • Demonstrated experience in integrating data from multiple sources and designing data pipelines for optimal performance. • Prior experience or familiarity with financial reporting requirements within a professional services firm is desirable. • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and reliability. • Eagerness to stay adaptable and embrace new methodologies as we expand our analytics capabilities. • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate and present technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.  Why BDO?  BDO offers professional development, collaborative culture, workplace flexibility, global career growth opportunities and an industry-competitive salary package.  We are committed to building your technical, advisory, leadership, and management skills, and balance work with promoting health, wellbeing, workplace giving and social activities. At BDO, we want you to enjoy what you do and the community of colleagues and clients you work with.  As a firm, we embrace an inclusive culture and value the difference and unique perspective of every individual. We are proud to be named an Inclusive Employer by Diversity Council Australia (DCA).  To submit your application please click Apply Now or for further information please contact Brett Beauchamp at Learn more what we offer at BDO.  IDEAS | PEOPLE | TRUST  #BDOCareers  #LI-BB1

job_description.101: Salary: $129k+ (9-day) or $168k+ (10-day) + 12.75% super  Energy Queensland (EQL) has two permanent opportunities for two Asset Maintenance Specialists focusing primarily on Data Analytics as part of the Transformer & Reactive Plant and Secondary Plant & Auxiliary Systems department located at either Rockhampton, Townsville, Toowoomba, Brisbane (Newstead). Both EQL and external candidates can apply.  About your new role:  As a data analytics professional at EQL, you will provide systematic advice on network asset performance. Your key responsibilities include monitoring and analysing asset performance and maintenance, planning program performance, and reporting findings and corrective actions to relevant parties.  You will also perform periodic asset performance analysis, maintain documentation, handle asset failure data requests, and ensure regulatory compliance. Identifying developing trends and engineering strategies will be critical to your success.  Why choose to work for us?  It’s an exciting time to join us and to be involved in the energy sector, so consider us for your next career move, where you will experience: • Secure employment backed by a strong collective agreement, with yearly EBA increases. • Strong 12.75% superannuation and the ability to earn more with salary sacrifice co- contributions. • Opportunities for skills and career advancement with access to ongoing training and leadership programs and the capacity to build and grow your skills. • Healthy work life balance with the option to WFH, two days per week and ad hoc as required. • A chance to give back with a paid employee volunteering program allowing our employees to support communities across QLD. • Support and guidance with access to a 24/7 Employee Assistance Program and a mentoring program for professional support and guidance. • A Safety-First culture, the safety of our people, customers & communities is a core priority. • Reward and recognition with an internal reward and recognition program that includes an annual celebration of excellence. • Diversity and Inclusion where all employees can contribute towards multiple diversity and inclusion initiatives across our business. • Grow professionally with full access to LinkedIn Learning. • Need wheels? Options available for novated leases for personal use.  About you:  You have a degree or equivalent experience in data science, business, or mathematics. You have demonstrated experience in line and substation maintenance practices. You have strong communication skills, work well in teams, and prioritise tasks.  You have demonstrated experience using SAP and Ellipse applications. You are highly proficient in programming languages such as Python or R. You are also willing to learn and have excellent problem-solving skills to approach business problems as data science tasks.  The job may require travel and non-standard working hours.  About us:  Even if you haven’t heard of Energy Queensland you might know our operational brands - Energex, Ergon Energy Network, Ergon Energy Retail and Yurika. As a group, we are growing rapidly and as part of the Queensland Energy and Jobs Plan (QEJP), actively helping to advance the energy transition towards net zero.  Energy Queensland is the group of electricity distribution, retail, and energy services businesses 100% owned by the state of Queensland. We deliver electricity across Queensland through our ‘poles and wires’ businesses Energex and Ergon Energy Network. Our retailer, Ergon Energy Retail sells this electricity to customers throughout regional Queensland. And these essential service activities are supported by a range of innovative products and services delivered through our Yurika brand.  How to apply  To shape the future of energy, visit our website and check out the "position description." Then, submit your application before 5.00 pm Monday, 9 October 2023.  If you have any questions or need assistance during the application process, please don't hesitate to contact the Resourcing Advisor, Alisha Benson on 0400 557 913 or alisha.benson@energyq.com.au  We value the differences individuals contribute to our workforce and encourage a diverse range of applicants to apply.  Click to view more information on diversity and inclusion at Energy Queensland, found here: https://www.energyq.com.au/diversity-and-inclusion
job_description.102: At CoreLogic, we are driven by a single mission—to make the property industry faster, smarter, and more people-centric. CoreLogic is the trusted source for property intelligence, with unmatched precision, depth, breadth, and insights across the entire ecosystem.  Our talented team of 5,000 employees globally uses our network, scale, connectivity and technology to drive the largest asset class in the world.  Join us as we work toward our vision of fueling a thriving global property ecosystem and a more resilient society.  CoreLogic is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive work culture that inspires innovation and bold thinking; it's a place where you can collaborate, feel valued, develop skills and directly impact the real estate economy. We know our people are our greatest asset. At CoreLogic, you can be yourself, lift people up and make an impact.  By putting clients first and continuously innovating, we're working together to set the pace for unlocking new possibilities that better serve the property industry.  Job Description: Who are you? Across Australia and New Zealand our geospatial capability continues to grow.  We are developers, data analysts, data architects and imagery specialists - and we are looking to add talent to our special team.  Using location intelligence, we provide a deep understanding of what is happening in and around a property to help our customers make better property decisions. What will you be doing? Maintain spatial assets and ensure that the data is fit-for-purpose and maintained to highest standards Work with key stakeholders to develop and maintain datasets for existing and new solutions Define best practice processes for supporting regular and ad-hoc data extracts, reporting and analytical outputs for spatial data Contribute to the development of data engineering solutions using SQL, FME and other geospatial technologies and libraries to enable the effective collection, cleansing, loading, querying and reporting of large spatial datasets Collaborate with SME's to define, research and propose geospatial technology tools, data and methodologies Develop processes to extract, transform, blend and enrich geospatial datasets from various sources Build and maintain FME Workspaces, SQL/Python scripts and procedures as required by the projects Design of solutions that align with the overall data architecture for the business Ensure documentation of all data processes and assets is kept up to date and is coherent Work effectively within an agile team environment to deliver robust, scalable and easily maintainable solutions Deliver solutions that ensure projects are delivered on-time, on-budget and to the quality standards Provide support and expertise as part of a project team to ensure project delivery Undertake analysis, projects or discrete pieces of work as directed Stay abreast of geospatial data and technology developments  What is the role? Collaborate with key stakeholders, product owners and managers and across all business functions to define, understand, prepare and assist as a SME with geospatial data requirements, solution feasibility and development Plan and implement geospatial data engineering/development efforts in accordance with the project scope, including budgeting, scheduling, risk analysis and provide solutions Maintain geospatial databases and processes with focus on automation with FME and other relevant technologies Create geospatial data from scratch or by adapting, transforming and enriching existing datasets Provide maintenance and support for the geospatial datasets to products, solutions and applications Ability to work autonomously while managing multiple tasks simultaneously  Are you the right fit?  You need to have: Excellent ability to make new and useful ideas work Excellent ability to communicate and work with technical and non-technical people Exceptional skills in partnering with clients/ staff and in developing and maintaining long term supportive relationships Ability to assess the effectiveness of processes and procedures, and recommend improvements Assist with the delivery of solutions end to end and ensuring customer outcomes are delivered Ability to work independently and as a contributing, collaborative team member Experience in driving agile ceremonies like sprint planning, retrospectives and backlog grooming across multiple projects 6+ years of relevant experience in geospatial  Job Qualifications:  Core Competencies: Excellent ability to make new and useful ideas work Excellent ability to communicate and work with technical and non-technical people Exceptional skills in partnering with clients/ staff and in developing and maintaining long term supportive relationships Ability to assess the effectiveness of processes and procedures, and recommend improvements Assist with the delivery of solutions end to end and ensuring customer outcomes are delivered Ability to work independently and as a contributing, collaborative team member Experience in driving agile ceremonies like sprint planning, retrospectives and backlog grooming across multiple projects  Required Skills and Experience: Minimum Academic Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent in GIS, Computer Science, Engineering or Scientific Discipline Minimum years of relevant work experience 6 years relevant experience in geospatial data engineering Required skills and competencies Bachelor's degree or equivalent in GIS, Computer Science, Engineering or Scientific Discipline A minimum of 4 years relevant experience in geospatial data engineering Experience in design, building and testing geospatial data solutions that are complex or large-scale working as a GIS Developer/Data Engineer or in a related technical role Advanced knowledge and experience with developing data pipelines using PostGIS, python, FME and other related geospatial tools and platforms Proficiency in data modelling, data integration and relational databases Experience with geospatial analytics Experience in working with geospatial data integration and geospatial problem-solving Experience with the spatial data management, including cloud and hybrid environments Experience working with FME, ESRI and other geospatial technologies for geospatial data processing, management and visualization  Desired additional skills and competencies Experience working in a cloud environment – AWS and GCP  Ability to present outputs using contemporary methods and communicate effectively with a range of audiences to transfer the knowledge gained and present ideas and solutions. Experience using Python or understanding of object-oriented programming concepts. Experience using FME Server for end-to-end automation of geospatial data pipelines and processes. Experience with ESRI platform in building and delivering geospatial data solutions.  What does success look like?  Key Performance Indicators are based on: Completion of commissioned projects on time and within budget Production processes running within expected timelines Focus on quality deliverables, ensuring 99% accuracy for production changes. All processes documented and in confluence. Identify process improvements, reduce wastage, automate where possible. Continuous improvement of processes and systems. Focus on improving customer experience. CORE Behaviors – Clients First, Ownership, Respect, Engagement  Core  Logic is highly collaborative and yes fun To support you at work, we offer some fantastic perks:  Opportunity for flexible working conditions that works best for you and the business CoreLogic has a culture of collaboration. We champion ownership, initiative and leadership and provide the guide ropes to get you there Free mindfulness tools, online health and nutrition courses Complimentary access to Australia's most comprehensive property research platforms including RP Data Exclusive employee-only market updates and access to the industry's best property experts Two community and volunteer leave days each year to support meaningful causes and our charity partners Modern offices in four convenient locations around Australia fitted with recreation rooms, chill out zones and sensational end of trip facilities Monthly social get-togethers and a globally recognised rewards platform and points system An inclusive and diverse working environment that celebrates cultural weeks and advocacy months  If this sounds like somewhere you want to work and you are seeking professional growth, don't delay, apply today- we 're looking for you Additional Information We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at CoreLogic.  We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. If your experience looks a little different from what we have identified and you think you rock the role, we would love to learn more about you  Core  Logic's Diversity Commitment:  CoreLogic is fully committed to employing a diverse workforce and creating an inclusive work environment that embraces everyone's unique contributions, experiences and values.  We offer an empowered work environment that encourages creativity, initiative and professional growth and provides a competitive salary and benefits package. We are better together when we support and recognize our differences.  Equal Opportunity Employer Statement:  CoreLogic is an Equal Opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining the best-qualified people available, without regard to race, colour, gender, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, family or carer's responsibilities, pregnancy, religion, political opinion, national extraction (place of birth or ancestry), social origin (class, caste or socio-occupational category), industrial activities (such as belonging to a trade union). CoreLogic maintains a Drug-Free Workplace. Please apply on our website for consideration.  By providing your telephone number, you agree to receive automated (SMS) text messages at that number from CoreLogic regarding all matters related to your application and, if you are hired, your employment and company business. Message & data rates may apply. You can opt out at any time by responding STOP or UNSUBSCRIBING and will automatically be opted out company-wide.  Connect with us on social media Click on the quicklinks below to find out more about our company and associates. About Us  CoreLogic is a wholly owned subsidiary of CoreLogic (  NYSE: CLGX), and is the largest data and analytics company in the world.  CoreLogic provides property information, analytics and services across Australia and New Zealand and is currently developing and growing partnerships throughout Asia.  With Australia's most comprehensive property databases, the company's combined data offering is derived from public, contributory and proprietary sources and includes over 500 million decision points spanning over three decades of collection, providing detailed coverage of property and other encumbrances such as tenancy, location, hazard risk and related performance information.  With over 11,000 customers and 120,000 end users, CoreLogic is the leading provider of property data, analytics and related services to consumers, investors, real estate, mortgage, finance, banking, insurance, developers, wealth management and government. CoreLogic delivers value to clients through unique data, analytics, workflow technology, advisory and geo spatial services. Clients rely on CoreLogic to help identify and manage growth opportunities, improve performance and mitigate risk. CoreLogic employs over 700 people at ten locations across Australia and in New Zealand. #J-18808-Ljbffr
job_description.103: Job details  Position status Fixed Term Temporary Position type Flexible full-time Occupational group Information Management/Library Classification AO6 Workplace Location Brisbane Inner City,Brisbane - North,Brisbane - South,Brisbane - East,Brisbane - West,North West Qld,Cairns region,Flexible,Logan - Beaudesert,Toowoomba region,Wide Bay,Darling Downs - Maranoa,Moreton Bay - North,Moreton Bay - South,Far North Qld,Townsville region,Mackay region,Rockhampton region,Gold Coast,Ipswich region,Central West Qld,South West Qld Job ad reference QLD/515054/23 Closing date 09-Oct-2023 Yearly salary Fortnightly salary Total remuneration Salary Other Job duration Until 31 March 2024 with possible extension Contact person Luke Nouwens Contact details Phone: (07) 4837 3437  Access the National Relay Service  You will be supporting the department in an important initiative curating business critical data and developing tools for enhanced compliance management and reporting.  You will work with colleagues across Water Resource Management to identify business and functional requirements. You will draw on your knowledge of data and databases using a variety of tools (including FME, SSMS and Power BI) and scripting languages (including SQL, DAX and M-Query) to aggregate, align and present data. You will apply your understanding of project management to ensure outcomes are delivered to agreed standards and timeframes and to keep project partners informed throughout the project cycle.  You will work within Spatial and Data Services, an innovative and collaborative team with a reputation for excellence in service delivery.  Key Duties and Accountabilities • Work with teams across Water Resource Management to identify business and functional requirements • Review, cleanse, aggregate and quality assure a variety of business-critical data sets • Establish data storage architecture to facilitate centralised data management and reporting • Use agile principles to develop, test and deploy a range of interactive tools and reports drawing on curated data sets to streamline and enhance existing workflows • Work with teams across Water Resource Management to support operationalisation of tools and change management • Develop support documentation and training materials • Other duties as directed and required.  Role requirements • Demonstrated experience in data modelling, programming languages (e.g., SQL,DAX, M Query) • Demonstrated experience developing data visualisations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau • Prior experience using FME is highly desirable  Applications to remain current for 12 months.  Job Ad Reference: QLD/515054/23  Closing Date: Monday, 09 October 2023  Further information  We are committed to building inclusive cultures in the Queensland public sector that respect and promote human rights and diversity.  Please ensure you download all attachments and follow the instructions on how to apply.  Documents  Before applying for this vacancy please ensure you read the documents below. • 515054 23 Role Description (Word, 5.63MB) •
job_description.104: Brief Description  About us  At Auto & General (A&G), we provide great products and services to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protect customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, Pet products as well as Roadside Assistance.  Our culture of ‘high performance with high integrity’ underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.  Purpose of the Role  The Reporting Analyst – Claims and Assessing will help to inform and support key performance objectives across the Claims and Assessing Division and Corporate Finance by providing insights and clarity.  Position Accountabilities  The Reporting Analyst – Claims and Assessing works within the defined procedures of the Corporate Finance team to improve visibility and insights on operational and finance data. • Help to provide clarity between operational measures and metrics and financial data. • Enhance existing reporting by adding further insights and commentary. • Work with the Claims and Assessing Division to ensure operational reporting includes relevant financial measures and metrics. • Adhoc reporting and data requests for the Corporate Finance divisions. • Help to define key measures and metrics and develop process documentation for key tasks. • Support the Finance Business Partnering team with planning and forecasting as required. • Take all reasonable directions from leaders to comply with the organisation’s workplace health & safety (WHS) protocols. WHS is everyone’s responsibility.  Qualifications And Experience • 2 years experience in an analytical role in a comparable organization environment. • An ability to understand and draw insights from complex data. • Delivering quality reporting outcomes. • An ability to work across the organization with stakeholders from different divisions • Written and verbal communication including developing requirements, solution and process documentation, facilitating meetings, building relationships and interacting with stakeholders within all levels of A&G • Ability to plan and organise by setting clearly defined objectives; manages time effectively; identifies and organises resources needed to accomplish tasks; and monitors performance against deadlines and milestones • Effective interpersonal skills with a high level of diplomacy and political awareness, to successfully consult on sensitive and contentious issues with internal and external stakeholders • Effectively analyse, provide recommendations, and follow through to outcomes • Experience in critical analysis and provision of high-level advice.  Our Perks • Location – Our office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre - a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport. Alternately, our North Lakes and Kawana sites have secure free parking and access to transport. • Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You’ll receive a paid ‘ME’ day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year. • Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits. • Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities. • Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses. • Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products. • Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes. • Onsite facilities – There are excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers. • Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.  If you are seeking a new challenge and would enjoy the opportunity to work in a growing and changing business, click on the APPLY NOW button and submit your application.  Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all. • A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
job_description.105: About the Role  JBS Australia is currently recruiting an experienced HR Data Analyst to join the Group People and Culture team. Based at Riverview (Ipswich) and reporting to the Group Manager – HRIS, this role will be primarily responsible developing and maintaining people analytics utilizing QlikSense. This role is ideal for someone who is keen to be in the driver's seat of design, developing people analytics from the ground up.  Your responsibilities: • Optimizing and streamlining data workflows and data models for People data • Developing and implementing the People Intelligence Dashboard which will include visualization of key people performance indicators and business metrics • Work closely with HR stakeholders to understand/document business requirements and translate them into solutions • Ensuring data quality and accuracy through understanding the HR processes, having structured data validation and testing • Documenting and assisting with developing the People Domain for Master Data Management • Deliver functional training to key stakeholders (as required) • Build new and maintain existing dashboards in QlikSense • Produce reports for audiences ranging from frontline supervisors to C-Suite executives • Work closely with HR leaders to assist with information requests and develop tools to make information more accessible  About You • Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field (economics, mathematics, finance, etc.) and/or background in Mathematics, Statistics • Experience in programming (Python, SQL) • Drive to develop structure processes and documentation • Experience with data modelling concepts • Experience with QuikSense/PowerBI/Tableau or other equivalent reporting platform • Familiarity with ETL processes and data integration concepts • Strong analytical skills • Excellent problem-solving skills • Strong technical writer • Curious about data and a drive to understand where it comes from • Self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and ask questions as needed • Knowledge of agile and user stories • Knowledge of master data management practices • Strong ability to coordinate and communicate between multiple stakeholders • Documentation skills in developing technical data diagrams, reporting specifications and testing  Why work for JBS Australia? • Heavily discounted meat products • Retail discounts with national partners • Health insurance discounts on Bupa Health and Medibank Private • Ongoing training and career development opportunities
job_description.106: Delivering Energy Today, Powering Your Tomorrow.  Elevate your career! Join us in this exciting newly created position as a Forecast Analyst. Reporting to the Retail Analytics Manager this pivotal role, will be the forefront of developing cutting-edge tools to supercharge CSE's demand forecasting services.  Duties include the below, but are not limited to: • Continuously improve existing load forecasting, models, databases and methodology • Maintain and regularly review market data and input assumptions. • Analyse and produce regular reports including assessments of forecasting accuracy and sources of variance • Maintain and regularly review data and assumptions • Develop reports to allow the Retail Business to accurately monitor retail related activities • Contribute to Retail Financial Performance analysis • Assist in documentation of processes, model description, assumptions, and verification to meet requirements as necessary, and ensuring ongoing compliance is demonstrable • Other ad-hoc analysis is a regular requirement of this role  What’s in it for you • An exciting time to join the Energy Industry with numerous new projects underway • Competitive salary and benefits on offer with 12.75 % employer superannuation and an annual incentive payment • Hybrid flexible working environment with brand new offices in Fortitude Valley close to the train station.  About You  To be successful in this role you will have the following skills and experience: • Degree level qualifications in Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, Commerce, or Economics • 3-5 years previous energy market experience is desirable • Intermediate or advanced IT skills including use Python, R , Oracle, SQL, Matlab, and other languages • Excellent communication skills – written and verbal • Data collation and analysis • High level of attention to detail  About Us  CS Energy is a proudly Queensland-owned and based company that provides competitively-priced and reliable energy to some of our state’s biggest industries and employers. With power stations and operations around the state we are providing jobs and opportunities for hundreds of Queenslanders. Our staff live in and are part of the communities in which we serve. We are proud to call Biloela, Chinchilla, Dalby and Brisbane our home.  Every voice is important to us  CS Energy is proud to foster an environment that builds respect, promotes inclusiveness, celebrates diversity and embraces the unique skills and qualities of all our employees. Reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process will be supplied to those who require additional support.  As part of the recruitment process, the successful applicant may be required to complete a number of background checks including; reference checks, pre employment medical, national police checks, right to work eligibility, verification of qualifications, and bankruptcy checks.  Job closing date: 20th October 2023  Energy is changing and so are we. Apply today!
job_description.107: Volunteer Data Analytics and Software Developer  Salary: Volunteer  Hours: Minimum fifteen hours weekly  Contract: Minimum six-month commitment  Location: Brisbane, Australia. Remote candidates are welcome to apply.  Why join THRIVE?  Looking for a role where you can be part of a collaborative, mission-led group? Hoping to build a network of global contacts and develop your teamwork skills?  When you become a volunteer at THRIVE, you’ll receive: • Free induction, training, and mentorship sessions • The opportunity to develop your presentation skills • Access to global connections (including VIPs) • Guidance and education from experienced volunteers • The chance to land a paid job  What is THRIVE?  THRIVE stands for The Holistic Regenerative Innovative Value Entity. As a not-for-profit for-impact initiative, we aim to place humankind on a more sustainable path and create a ‘thrivable’ future for all.  The THRIVE Platform is a free, web-based tool that uses the best-available science to address contemporary global challenges. The THRIVE platform uses machine learning to help guide countries, cities, companies, and individuals on their journey towards a more sustainable future.  THRIVE has excellent relationships with a variety of research groups, educational bodies, and UN-affiliated policymakers.  We use educational content and free software solutions to address some of the following global challenges: • Climate change • Loss of biodiversity • Deforestation • Social inequality • Pollution  By joining THRIVE, you will help to ensure humanity can face global issues effectively and sustainably.  The Role  We’re looking for a motivated, enthusiastic Data Analytics and Software Developer to join our friendly, global team.  Your experience will include: • Working with google ecosystem, including studio, sheets, apps (similar to js), and SQL • Identifying data sources, consolidating datasets, turning them into insights • Analysing data to find answers to specific questions • Developing and implementing SQL based queries on our existing datasets • Generating insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns • Preparing reports for project teams and the organisation including visualisations and storytelling  In this volunteer role, you'll learn how to develop your cloud knowledge, work in teams, and provide actionable insights, working amongst a dynamic international team who is informing and changing the world for the better.  Position Requirements • Bachelor's degree • Fluent in English (preferred) • A passion for sustainability • A collaborative team player mindset • Excellent communication and organization skills • Experience working in a fast-paced environment • Well-developed problem-solving abilities • Highly organized • The ability to handle multiple tasks to meet strict deadlines • Exceptional time management skills • Ambition and proactivity  At THRIVE, we’re looking for individuals who strongly align with our mission and vision for a thrivable future. If you’re looking for an opportunity to join a growing initiative that allows you to gain valuable experience while giving back to a worthy cause, apply now.  We’re strongly committed to equal opportunities and value diversity in our workforce.  Applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.
job_description.108: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  What if we didn’t focus on who you are now, but who you could become?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.  What’s in it for you?  As a Data Architect, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: • Design, develop and implement data collection, transformation, and data integration solution to create, coordinate and deploy data and analytics solutions • Create and present the solution design through a solution design document and finally estimate for complexity, effort and costs • Collaborate with solution design and business requirements teams to identify data requirements and influence project artefacts • Demonstrate technical expertise in modern AI, analytics, big data and associated technologies, cloud platforms, data quality, governance and architecture • Provide technical guidance as SME and hands on delivery team member across multiple clients and engagements • Lead technology consulting engagements, solution workshops and due diligence  What We’re Looking For  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go. • Relevant Data Experience in a similar role with responsibilities as listed above. • Solid experience on Enterprise Data Warehouse integration and reporting developing modern data platform solutions, data governance, architecture frameworks and processes. • On hands experience in Big Data technologies and Apache ecosystem technologies such as Spark, Kafka, Hive, and have experience building end to end data pipelines using on-premises or cloud-based data platforms. • Technical leadership and the ability to work with a wider group of architects, application teams and business teams to define and socialise architectural concepts and approaches  What We Can Offer You • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment • Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness • Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.  Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $150,000 including 11% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
job_description.109: Together, we can do great things  We shape leading experiences across office, retail and logistics.  We’re one of Australia’s largest property groups, managing $32 billion worth of assets across the country.  Our sustainable returns from investments come from focusing on what matters most to customers — a great experience and doing good. Every day, our people are driving positive impact for people, place and planet. They’re inquisitive, pioneering industry firsts and pushing new ideas to deliver exceptional outcomes.  This passion and expertise create an employee experience that puts wellbeing, flexibility and opportunity first.  Come join us.  The role  We have an new opportunity for a Business Analyst (6 month fixed term) to join the team supporting the delivery and optimisation of finance technology products.  As Business Analyst, you will work collaboratively with developers and business subject matter experts on the development, management and maintenance of these products, primarily involving Anaplan.  You will also support critical testing work on a project involving financial forecasting alongside the project lead.  This is a rare contract opportunity to gain valuable exposure to working with a top ASX50 property company with strong resourcing, systems and processes.  As a fixed term employee, you will have access to a range of our benefits including reward and recognition, retail discounts and learning and development opportunities.  What you will be doing • Working consultatively with business teams to understand requirements, requests, issues about the system/application • Working with the technical team to design solutions and translating these into functional specifications • Creating documentation including user stories, process maps, testing and acceptance criteria • Assisting with relevant system training and communication to the business • Working with and as a tester on project work which may involve writing test scripts, user story writing and documentation  What makes you stand out  We are looking for highly motivated and adaptable Business Analyst with experience in delivering technology related projects and knowledge of common agile product management, wireframing, testing and analytics tools (including JIRA).  You will be experienced in testing software applications with a sound working knowledge of finance products.  You would ideally have working experience with Anaplan and developing UI/UX solutions within a product management or an enterprise architecture environment.  Importantly, you will be a skilled communicator, able to influence, educate and build rapport with all stakeholders to be successful in the role.  What makes us stand out  We value our people • Enjoy flexible working arrangements and generous leave options. • Experience market-leading parental leave benefits including 22 weeks paid leave for either carer or childcare allowance once you return to work. • Embrace diverse and challenging career opportunities, supported by our dedicated Learning & Development Team committed to your growth. • Engage in comprehensive Wellbeing programs and benefit from market-leading policies and support tailored to diverse needs. • Be recognised by peers through nomination awards and take part in our generous Employee Referral Program.  We know the power of a great experience • Ranked within top 10 organisations globally by Equileap in its global report on gender equality. • Achieved number 1 real estate company in S&P Global Sustainability Assessment. • Earned a gold ranking in Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) for LGBTQIA+ inclusion. • Awarded our fourth consecutive Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citation from the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) in 2021-2023. • Accredited Family Inclusive Workplace™. • Committed to our second Stretch Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP).  Everyone counts  As an equal employer, we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, cultures, sexual orientations and gender identities. This includes Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQIA+ community, and people living with disabilities.  Let’s get started  If this sounds like you then we want to hear from you! Click on “Apply” to submit your formal application and Sherene from the Talent Acquisition Team will be in touch.
job_description.110: We are real. We care. We are bold. Together, we are stronger.  The Role  Are you a dynamic Business Analyst seeking a new challenge? Bentleys Qld and its related entities are on the lookout for someone like you to become an integral part of our Transformation Office (TO). If you have a passion for defining clear business outcomes and transforming business processes through the power of data and technology, we're eager to get to know you.  In this role, you'll report to the TO Process Stream Lead, and your contributions will support the compliance, implementation, and continuous improvement of the TO framework, policies, and processes. This is a 6-month fixed term contract, with possibility of extension.  You will engage in the following: • Evaluate and document 'as is' and 'to be' processes, systems and data • Coordinate and deliver multiple tasks and smaller scale projects in line with the TO framework • Identify and plan for interconnections between separate tasks and projects • Align strategic organisation goals, business outcomes and requirements with project deliverables • Define clear business and technical requirements, and plan and facilitate user acceptance testing • Carry out maintenance of operational procedures, templates and work instructions as required • Devise task and project budgets, delivery schedules, business cases, risk assessments, and benefits realisation plans • Manage stakeholder expectations by devising effective communication plans • Collaborate and support other Business Analysts on tasks and projects • Support the Senior Business Analyst and/or TO Process Stream Lead with ad-hoc administration tasks  About You  You will be analytical and detail-oriented with willingness to change perceptions/ ideas based on new information. You will demonstrate strong initiative, continuously seeking ways to enhance processes and contribute to the team's success. You'll have excellent interpersonal skills and establish and maintain positive relationships with colleagues, partners, and directors, communicating effectively and fostering a collaborative and supportive environment. • Tertiary qualification in Business, Finance, or Commerce (desirable) • Postgraduate studies in business analysis, project management or accounting (desirable) • Task or smaller scale project management experience • Business process analysis experience, preferably using an established discipline, e.g. BPM • Experience in requirements gathering and management through to user acceptance testing (desirable) • Experience in professional services is preferred (for example, could suit a current accountant/analyst with 2-3 years' experience)  About Us  Bentleys Queensland is a full-service advisory and accounting firm with 25 Partners/Directors and almost 200 staff operating across 3 offices. We have a history of over 70 years in providing professional and dependable support across business & strategic advisory, accounting, taxation, audit, international & investment advisory, risk & assurance, corporate recovery & insolvency, technology & innovation, self-managed superannuation, HR, finance & lending and wealth management.  How To Apply  Click the Apply button to start your application.
job_description.111: Deal Desk Analyst  LOCATION: Remote, Australia  POSITION SUMMARY  As part of the Bentley Deal Desk and reporting to the Manager, Deal Desk, the Deal Desk Analyst is focused on performing data analysis on—often irregular—accounts and opportunities. Working with Regional Directors and Account Managers, the Analyst develops offers, applying standardized commercial models and providing deal guidance regarding variations from standard. Ensures offers meet Bentley requirements and drive ARR growth.  RESPONSIBILITIES • Specializes in performing the data analysis • Conducts exploratory analyses to understand account usage and behavior patterns • Analyzes data from large disparate data sets, queries, and reports present in operational and financial systems and assigning context to business data • Provide and apply guidance (advice); define and present detailed commercial offers and options • Address governance requirements of stakeholders outside of Account Advancement (e.g., Financial Operations, Contracts, Legal) • Develop complex deal propositions • Implement methods and systems to increase individual and team efficiencies • Ensure Deal Desk products (e.g., advice, escalations/approvals, and program/campaign designs), are comprehensive • Ensure offers are executable by Financial Operations, Finance, Legal, and other accountable stakeholders, in accordance with defined programs and managing associated levels of discretion  ACCOUNTABILITY • Ensure commercial integrity (e.g., profitability, soundness of proposed variations from Commercial Programs' standard) of each assigned deal • Document deal parameters in Deal Desk systems (e.g., SharePoint, C4S) • Drive measurable increases in ARR, from deal intake through stakeholder approval • Convey financial impacts of recommendations; ensure full disclosure and reportability of specific deal outcomes  QUALIFICATIONS • Extremely effective communicator with exceptional presentation skills; capable of interacting with colleagues at every level and across every business line, enhancing process engagement from stakeholders • Facility with Microsoft Excel and analytics tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI) and demonstrated ability to summarize and present complex and detailed commercial information in narrative and presentation forms • Capable of driving matrixed resources to consensus in tightly constrained timeframes • Functional command—or ability to quickly develop same—of Bentley's commercial programs, especially as applied to the operation and interaction of organizations within Bentley • Bachelor's or master's degree in relevant discipline or equivalent combination of education and work-related experience • Requires sitting or standing at will while performing work on a computer (or any other physical requirements). The role requires communication with managers, peers, and other colleagues of the company in person, and by utilizing Microsoft Teams chat, calling, and meeting functions • This role does not require travel.  About Bentley Systems:  Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world's infrastructure – sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, mining, and industrial facilities. Our offerings, powered by the iTwin Platform for infrastructure digital twins, include MicroStation and Bentley Open applications for modeling and simulation, Seequent's software for geoprofessionals, and Bentley Infrastructure Cloud encompassing ProjectWise for project delivery, SYNCHRO for construction management, and AssetWise for asset operations. Bentley Systems' 5,000 colleagues generate annual revenues of more than $1 billion in 194 countries.  Equal Opportunity Employer:  Bentley is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers for employment all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, religion/belief, national origin, caste, age, or any other characteristic protected by local law or unrelated to job qualifications.
job_description.112: Lime Recruitment is currently working with a Queensland government department to recruit a Senior Data Analyst contract to 31/12/2023 with possible of extension based at Fortitude Valley and working from home.  As the Senior Data Analyst, you will support the provision of data matching activities to validate position and identity data across multiple authoritative sources such as SAPHR, Active Directory, Service Now and eDirectory across Queensland Health.  Key skills required: • Strong experience and skills in Microsoft SQL Queries, Power BI, Power Pivot and other reporting tools • Proven experience and understanding of data analytical methodologies and data interpretations • Previous experience in correlating and analyzing information from multiple data sources • Good understanding of Identities and relationships between positions and organisational units. • Strong communication and problem-solving skills  Preferred experience: • Experience in Queensland Health, Payroll portfolios, or other transferable similar area advantageous.  Queensland based candidates only please.  This position closes soon so APPLY NOW or for more information please contact Kate Gear on 0477 624 569 or email kate@limejobs.com.au. Lime Recruitment is Queensland owned and operated and is a Tier 1 preferred supplier to Queensland Government. For more information, visit www.limerecruitment.com.au.
job_description.113: Job Title: Business Analyst  Location: Brisbane, Sydney, or Melbourne. Hybrid working arrangements.  Location: Ideally Brisbane (Open to Sydney or Melbourne)  Work Arrangements: Hybrid Working Arrangements.  An ambitious and rapidly growing organization, is on a transformative journey to reshape its workforce planning, talent management, and payroll processes, among other core people systems. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst to join their Program Team and play a pivotal role in this large-scale program of work.  Key Responsibilities:  1. Process Analysis: • Facilitate workshops to understand and document current "as-is" processes across various business functions. • Collaborate with stakeholders to identify pain points and areas for improvement.  2. Systems Mastery: • Quickly become an expert in new applications and systems, understanding their capabilities and functionalities. • Translate this expertise into recommendations for business process enhancements.  3. Business-Technology Interface: • Serve as a bridge between business functions, technology teams, and support teams, ensuring seamless communication and alignment.  4. Data Analysis and Documentation: • Document and analyze the information and data required to support the transformation program. • Create comprehensive documentation, including quick reference guides and training materials.  5. Stakeholder Collaboration: • Work closely with the business to recommend "to-be" processes that leverage the efficiencies offered by the new systems. • Challenge the status quo and drive conversations to clarify project outcomes.  6. Training and User Support: • Develop training documentation and quick reference guides. • Provide training to new users to ensure a smooth transition to the new systems.  Requirements:  1. Systems Experience: • Mandatory experience with Payroll, Workforce Management (WFM), and/or Core HR systems and their integrations.  2. Communication and Collaboration: • Demonstrated excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with strong collaboration abilities.  3. Project Experience: • Experience working on complex projects/programs of work from end to end, ideally within a PMO environment.  4. Ambiguity Handling: • Ability to thrive in an environment with ambiguity and lead discussions to achieve clarity in project outcomes.  5. Interpersonal Skills: • Strong interpersonal skills to challenge the status quo and drive change when needed.  6. Organizational Skills: • Excellent planning, organizational, coordination, and time management skills.  7. Results-Oriented: • Proven ability to deliver exceptional results, both as part of a team and individually.  This is a unique opportunity to work on a complex program of work and bring/build your expertise while contributing to the transformation of the company's people systems. If you are a skilled Business Analyst looking for a challenging role with a dynamic and growing organization, I encourage you to apply.
job_description.114: About the Role  Due to an internal promotion, we're looking for a commercially minded and data-driven Finance Analyst to join our planning team on an 8-month contract. In this role, you will provide pivotal support to our Head of Planning with the provision of value-added commercial insights, business information, financial modelling and data analysis to assist key organisational stakeholders. You will demonstrate a love for business intelligence, with an exceptional track record in creating visually appealing and easy to understand dashboards to support leaders in making informed and timely decisions.  As the Finance Analyst, you will take ownership of the following key duties and responsibilities: • Financial and operating forecasting, analysis and scenario modelling • Sourcing data and undertaking analysis for business improvement opportunities • Assisting with budgets and annual forecasting • Creating and maintaining appropriate tools and materials for commercial analysis • Preparation and distribution of relevant business performance information to key stakeholders • Sourcing and managing data collection • Creating BI reporting dashboards & effective business partnering with key stakeholders to understand key output requirements.  About You  You will come from a commercial background with demonstrated experience in a complex, multi-dimensional organisation. You consider yourself a go-getter, love a good challenge, thrive on partnering with internal stakeholders and are a wizard at creating BI dashboards and reports.  As the Finance Analyst, you will bring to the role the following skills, experience and attributes: • Bachelors Degree in Business, Commerce or Finance • CA, CPA or CFA or studying towards is highly advantageous • Demonstrated experience with complex modelling scenarios • Advanced analytical and problem solving • Experience working with BI • Super user of Excel
job_description.115: Lime Recruitment is currently working with a Queensland government department to recruit 2 X Business Analyst contract for 12 months plus 3 x 12 month extension options based at Carseldine and working from home.  In broad terms, the responsibility of the business analysts is to gather and document current state information and become a subject matter expert to inform the transition to the new ECM solution through effective engagement with business representatives, project team members, and implementation partners. Activities include understanding current business processes and the touchpoints with documents, records and correspondence management content. In addition, to-be processes will be written once the new ECM solution is selected, and these roles will support developing full business cases and other project artefacts.  In this role you will: • Provide leadership and hands on business analysis skills to ensure the successful delivery of the assigned project deliverables. • Successfully complete documents for the business and user functional requirements to the agreed project standard and to schedule. • Consult, liaise and participate with clients, stakeholders and end users in relation to all aspects of the assigned project deliverables. • Manage the resolution of business-related issues, including the researching of policy, procedures, assessment of impacts, development of options and providing recommendations to project stakeholders. • Develop new business proposals, identifying business opportunities, preparing business cases and conducting system analysis. • Research, analyse and provide advice to guide the assigned projects.  DMS-R and CMP specific accountabilities: • Obtain input from and provide assistance to business areas for the current to future mapping including drafting process maps and use cases. • Provide input and assist supplier/s in designing and delivering the new ECM solution. • Define with the business and Information Technology Branch technical teams any necessary use cases to support ECM solution evaluations, proof of concepts, pilots and complete gap analysis against results. • Draft Transition to Support documents as per processes.  You will have: • 5-10+ years demonstrated experience working on enterprise level ICT projects in a similar capacity in a large, complex, government organisation. • Previous experience contributing to Information Management projects with a focus on high value, quality features and requirements. • Negotiation skills with business and technical groups and demonstrated ability to build consensus among many stakeholders. • Demonstrated attention to detail with strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills. • Demonstrated analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills. • Demonstrated proven ability to work in a team environment developing effective working relationships with team members. • Ability to be flexible and adaptable within a high pressure and changing environment and effectively manage multiple priorities. • Demonstrated skills in Visio (BPMN) and Excel.  Queensland based candidates only please.  This position closes soon so APPLY NOW or for more information please contact Cassandra Manthey on 0432 717 634 or email cass@limejobs.com.au. Lime Recruitment is Queensland owned and operated and is a Tier 1 preferred supplier to Queensland Government. For more information, visit www.limerecruitment.com.au.
job_description.116: More than 50,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office 're not just engineers.  We're a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet's toughest issues. Climate change.  The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.  Whatever your ambition, there's a path for you here. And there's no barrier to your potential career success. As a People Analytics and Reporting Lead at Worley you will form part of the global People Data, Analytics & Governance team within People Digital.  Some of the key day-to-day responsibilities will include: Providing People reporting, insights and analysis for the Chief People Officer and Group ExecutiveLeading the development of an emerging People reporting, analytics and insights team at WorleyManaging a small Worley Team and collaborating with Shared Service partners to deliver towards the People Reporting Strategy and RoadmapConsulting with internal customers regarding availability of global People data, including recommendation of appropriate data usage, existing data quality and risks associated with dataIdentifying trends and major findings from the data, developing detailed reporting, clearly articulating analysis findings and developing executive summaries to highlight analysis results for audience up to Group Executive levelResearch best-in-class HR analytics visualizations, industry themes and trends to provide guidance to the Business and ensure Worley is delivering reporting which meets industry standards and expectationsAggregating and correlating data from multiple sources in support of integrated, insightful findings to meet Business requirementsWith support of Subject Matter Experts and Business leadership in respective areas, developing specific recommendations and establishing criteria for KPIs to address Business focus areas, ensuring valid and reliable measures arebeing used to measure progress towards goalsIdentifying and implementing enhancements to report formats and processes, evaluating and updating criteria routinely and enhancing reporting to achieve continuous improvementImproving efficiency and effectiveness of reporting and distribution processes; ensure access model complies with applicable policies and proceduresCommunicating progress towards goals on Business KPIs, key milestones and success metrics, as determined by Subject Matter Experts, Business leadership and yourselfEnsure documentation, including Standard Operating Procedures, dictionaries and mapping reference materials, training resources and other supporting documentation is maintained and published on a regular cadenceDelivering global People analytics in accordance with accepted standards, ensuring compliance with applicable policies and proceduresAbout You:To be considered for this role it is envisaged you will possess a combination of work experience, skills and or qualifications in the following areas: Relevant experience in People Systems, Technology or Digital FunctionsUniversity degree in a related field Genuine enjoyment in developing a story with data and analytics; highly skilled in data visualization to communicate complex ideas simply and attractivelyAdvanced skillset in PowerBI (PowerQuery, DAX, Visualizations) and Excel (including PowerQuery)An ability to work independently and develop an approach/plan based on work assigned in terms of objectives, relative priorities and critical areas of focusProven experience in leading, building and developing a small teamComfortable dealing with ambiguity and a changing environment and leading others through thisExperience working in a regional or global team and comfortable with flexible working hours. There may be some regular calls outside of normal business hours to connect with the global team Worley recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to promoting fairness, equity and diversity in its workplace hence we encourage applications from people with a variety of experience and addition, we recognise that everyone's personal circumstances differ and thus understand the importance of offering flexibility in the working arrangements of our personnel. On this basis we will consider all types of engagements models, including part time and job sharing.  We offer, the ability to purchase up to 8 weeks leave, compressed work weeks, flexible hours, working from home and accrued flex days, to ensure that we attract and retain a diverse and dynamic workforce. You must have current unrestricted working rights for Australia for consideration and only those candidates with appropriate qualifications and experience will be contacted directly. Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Worley.  Make a real difference - witness the results - be a part of the Worley journey today!
job_description.117: 12 month maximum-term contract  On-site at Southbank in Brisbane, with some flexibility to work from home.  Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.  What you’ll be doing  The objective of the Business Improvement Specialist role is to support the review and simplification of end to end processes of all key Finance functions including, but not exclusive to, Month end close, Management reporting, Financial control, Procurement and Treasury. • Review and analysis of current Finance processes and systems using a logical, systematic and sequential approach • Ability to question current state, weigh relevance of information, understand interdependencies, evaluate alternative perspectives/ solutions and drive the implementation of improved end to end processes • Working with internal teams, including Finance Systems, Robotics, BI, Risk and Legal as required • Customer focus; anticipate and meet the needs of internal customers. • Develops and maintains effective working relationships, especially in challenging situations. Engages, inspires and empowers others • Develop clear business cases for change. Document new standardised processes for business application • Administration of concurrent project activity from ideation through to implementation and benefit realisation • Timely and appropriate governance and risk management in regard to program of work including the production or reporting artefacts, managing blockers  You’ll be great in this role if you… • Tertiary qualification in Business or similar • At least 2 years' experience in Business Analyst role, Project Management role or similar (ideally within Finance, not IT) • Excellent written and verbal communication skills: describes expectations, goals, requests, or future states in a way that provides clarity and promotes buy-in • Experience developing business cases for change • Advanced Excel, BI skills • Ability to recognise a wide range of potential difficult issues, problems or opportunities and develop strategies in achieving the best outcomes • Experience with applying timely and appropriate governance and risk management in regard to programs of work  We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to): • Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year) • A flexible, hybrid work style. Work from home or the office, adapt your location to suit your style and needs • One of Brisbane’s most admired head office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, and lunch options downstairs plus a 5-minute walk to the Busway, a rooftop restaurant and onsite gym (with a low membership fee) and South Bank Parklands just across the road • Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide • Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty and wellness services • Free counselling and access to a wellbeing app to support your physical, mental, social and financial health • Dress for Your Day’ – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you.  When everyone is included, everyone wins  We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.  Ready to apply?  We’re ready to hear from you. Apply now.
job_description.118: Are you a talented Business Analyst ready to make an impact? Our Govt Client is seeking for someone to help define and deliver solutions that align with business objectives.  As part of the project team, you'll be involved in various system support activities, from data cleansing and unit testing to user acceptance, training, and reporting. Your expertise in business analysis and strong problem-solving skills will be instrumental in delivering high-quality solutions that optimize our business processes.  Responsibilities: • Collaborate closely with the Project Manager and development team to successfully implement projects. • Work hand-in-hand with stakeholders and end-users to gather requirements and gain insights into business processes. • Partner with stakeholders on data profiling, cleansing, migration, and transformation solutions. • Identify and contribute to remediation plans for any inconsistent or unclear business practices that could impact project success. • Guide and collaborate with the development team and business personnel to create test strategies, plans, and test cases, and assist with execution. • Analyze system bugs, support requests, and enhancement needs, facilitating the prioritization of new development. • Document business and technical requirements, conduct analyses, build business cases, create knowledge bases, model business processes, and map data. • Leverage your experience to analyze data, run experiments, and construct impactful dashboards in Power BI to effectively communicate results and outcomes. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop user manuals and provide ongoing support to end-users.  Requirements: • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. • Familiarity with Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) and Azure cloud technologies. • Ability to analyze business requirements and translate them into technical solutions. • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. • Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to work both independently and as part of a team. • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a plus.  Join us and be part of a team that thrives on innovation and delivers impactful solutions to optimize business processes.  Apply now:  · For more information contact Kevina 03 9997 9408 or kevinac@halcyonknights.com.au
job_description.119: • 6 month daily rate contract • Paying between $900-$1050 • Flexible WFH arrangement ( Not fully remote)  Position Purpose  The Business Analyst (Trading) will work together with stakeholders across the business functions to: • Determine and document, scope and requirements for the development of work packages and projects within the ICT Portfolio – Trading. • Document business, process and system analysis support for the delivery of assigned projects. • Facilitate the end-to-end business analysis process (for requirements through to testing and implementation support), associated with assigned projects.  Trading projects include projects such as our strategic trading platform, new products offered to the market, changes to support renewable initiatives and improvements related to our large corporate customers. The role is part of a team with a broad area of responsibility, contributing to the success through adaptive delivery and an interesting workload with constant variety. The Business Analyst is seen as a key member of the team and together with the Project Manager own the successful outcomes of projects.
