job_description.157: Acknowledgement of Country  CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation Child Safety  CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs. View our Child Safe Policy. The Opportunity • Join CSIRO - Australia's National Science Agency! • Are you interested in transforming the abstract into the actual? • Outstanding opportunities to grow & develop your career . • Flexible work arrangements  CSIRO's Information and Technology (IM&T) business unit is continuing an ambitious program of work designed to support the organisation's strategy to 2024. Underpinning the program is a desire for staff to have seamless, secure access to tools, systems and processes that back the delivery of world-class science.  Members of the IMT Data Analytics Team are responsible for developing and supplying Business Intelligence and Analytics capability to staff in all areas of CSIRO. This requires expertise in relevant SAP technologies and a sound understanding of business operations, processes and information requirements.  As an Analytics Business Analyst, you will be passionate about Analytics and Data Storytelling. This opportunity will see you coordinating end-to-end solution delivery including client engagement, solution development, end-user education and service promotion. You will understand the technical capabilities of our platforms and apply these capabilities to solve line of business or research opportunities and problems. As part of an Agile Business Intelligence delivery team, you will also play an active role in quality assurance throughout the solution delivery lifecycle.  You will assist in delivering against our Data Analytics roadmaps and strategy, underpinned by our technical platforms including SAP BW/4HANA 2.0, SAP Business Objects, and SAP Analytics Cloud. Your duties will include: • Engage with business stakeholders, source system SMEs and data custodians to identify opportunities for the application of modern business analytics solutions • Gather business requirements and User Stories using contemporary techniques and approaches • Coordinate end-to-end solution delivery, working with team members, internal and external stakeholders to develop, implement, promote and support Analytics products • Facilitate User Acceptance Testing, data testing, and support business users and subject matter experts • Construct descriptive analysis and contribute to more complex data analysis for reports, analytic applications and ad-hoc requests • Adhere to the spirit and practice of CSIRO’s Values, Code of Conduct, Health, Safety and Environment procedures and policy, Diversity initiatives and Zero Harm goals  Location: Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney, Hobart (other locations considered)  Salary: AU$105,806k - AU$114,500k plus up to 15.4% superannuation  Tenure: Indefinite  Reference: 94160 To be considered you will need: Essential • Relevant tertiary degree or equivalent work experience • Proven experience working with clients to solicit business requirements and translate these into actionable solutions for technical delivery • Demonstrated ability to harness business analysis tools and techniques to deliver multi-disciplinary, complex projects • Experience in the development and delivery of business data management or data analytics products • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with an ability to facilitate client engagement and communicate and translate technical concepts to a diverse audience Desirable: • Experience working with Enterprise Data Warehouse development teams to deliver engaging Business Analytics solutions at scale • Experience using SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Business Objects or Microsoft PowerBI to develop Data Analytics dashboards and reports.  For full details about this role please review the Position Description Eligibility • Applications for this position are open to Australian Citizens only • Appointment to this role is subject to provision of a national police check and may be subject to other security/medical/character requirements. • The successful candidate will be required to obtain and maintain a security clearance at the NV1 Level. Flexible Working Arrangements  We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Diversity and Inclusion  We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish. About CSIRO  At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.  CSIRO is committed to values-based leadership to inspire performance and unlock the potential of our people.  CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs, whether we are undertaking research, engaging with the public or nurturing future scientists in person or online. Source – CSIRO Child Safe policy 2023  Join us and start creating tomorrow today! How to Apply  Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Applications Close  Sunday 1st of October 11:00pm AEST  Shortlisting for this role may take place as applications are received. We therefore reserve the right to close this vacancy once a suitable candidate has been appointed,  Please consider applying as soon as possible.

Data Analyst Managers analyse datasets with a variety of tools to research and solve organisational issues and identify trends and insights to support organisational outcomes. job_description.159: Applicants MUST be Australian Citizens and located in Canberra, Australia. Preference will be given to those already holding AGSVA clearance.  Our federal government client is seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst with a background in data & analytics.  The client team is looking for a motivated individual with experience working in multidisciplinary teams to deliver data centric products for a government organisation.  They are looking for an individual that has experience in the following areas: • Data analysis (SQL/Excel/PowerBI/Qlik) • Data modelling (conceptual and logical) • Agile ways of working • Working with business subject matter experts (SME’s) to understand and capture pain points • Presenting technical solutions clearly to stakeholders and executive • Drafting and delivering supporting business documentation, including: • Process maps • User stories • Data journeys • Data catalogues/dictionaries • Technical specifications • Impact assessments  They are looking for a candidate with exceptional communication skills who can lean into complex conversations and offer technical solutions that creates buy in from stakeholders with varying technical and non-technical backgrounds.  You will be joining a small product team led by a product manager, accompanied by a technical advisor and supporting business SME’s. You will be working alongside other product teams and technical delivery partners to collaboratively deliver digital products that support the client's digital transformation.
job_description.160: APS Level 6  Canberra, ACT; Sydney, NSW; Newcastle, NSW; Orange, NSW; Melbourne, VIC; Bendigo, VIC; Brisbane, QLD; Adelaide, SA; Perth, WA; Hobart, TAS; Darwin, NT  $94,332 - $103,731  About the Department of Employment and Workplace Relations  We enable access to quality skills, training and employment services to support Australians find secure work in fair, productive and safe workplaces – supporting individuals and our nation to prosper.  About Jobs and Skills Australia  Jobs and Skills Australia (JSA) engages, advises and assists the Australian Government and other stakeholders on decision-making on current, emerging, and future skills and workforce needs. Our vision is for the full skills potential of our nation to be realised, resulting in improved workforce participation, productivity, wages, and equity. We aim to be a catalyst in activating the potential of Australia’s human capital to meet present and future skills needs.  We have a diverse, inclusive, and professional team of specialists with skills in policy, data, stakeholder engagement, digital solutions, economics, and research, to reach and work with stakeholders.  Our work is enriched through tripartite engagement and collaboration with unions, business, employers, state and territory governments, and education and training providers from across Australia to provide critical advice to improve skills development, employment opportunities and economic growth.  JSA is an independent secondary statutory body situated in the Department of Employment and Workplace Relations (DEWR). The Interim Commissioner is accountable to the Minister for Skills and Training. Our enabling legislation is the Jobs and Skills Australia Act 2022 and the Jobs and Skills Australia Amendment Act 2023.  You can read more about JSA on our website: www.jobsandskills.gov.au  About the Skilled Migration and International Section  The Skilled Migration and International Section, Labour Market and Migration Branch, is a dynamic team, working on some key priorities for the Australian Government.  The Section is responsible for labour market analysis and research on migration. This includes the JSA Migration Labour Market Indicator Model (the JSA Migration Model) that informs advice to the Government on targeting migration to workforce needs, and to ensure that skilled migration supports the productive capacity of the Australian economy, while recognising that Australians have priority for local jobs.  The Section also coordinates JSA interests in and undertakes research on international economic and labour market matters (including monitoring global skill shortages) and analyses the labour market impacts of labour mobility commitments in free trade agreements.  The Roles  Reporting to the Director or the Assistant Director, the Senior Data Analyst / Economist positions in the Skilled Migration and International Section are:  Senior Data Analyst working in the project team responsible for the ongoing development of the JSA Migration Model and related labour market analysis, to support the implementation of temporary and permanent skill migration initiatives in the Migration Strategy.  Senior Economist working on international economic and labour market matters, including for the Australian Labour Market for Migrants and International Labour Market Update publications.  Duties and Responsibilities  Responsibilities at the APS6 level are:  Senior Data Analyst:  Perform research and analysis on more complex labour market issues associated with temporary and permanent migration, using a variety of data sources, methods, and models.  Contribute to the ongoing development of the JSA Migration Model, analyse output from this Model, and manage the relationship and access agreements with data owners.  Senior Economist:  Monitor and analyse reports on the international labour market and economy, initiate and manage internal research projects on these issues.  Analyse data extracted from an international data portal as input to departmental submissions and publications, comparing the Australian and international labour markets.  Manage the JSA subscription to the international data portal, including procurement and payment.  For both positions:  Contribute to the management of longer-term projects with support from senior staff.  Draft briefs, staff blogs, research papers, and fact sheets.  Provide advice on migration and labour market issues to stakeholders as a subject matter expert and represent the team at interdepartmental committees and working groups.  Supervise, mentor and build the capability of junior staff within the section.  Perform other ad-hoc duties assigned by the Director or Assistant Director.  How to Apply  Applicants are required to provide up to a two-page summary (no more than 1000 words) that outlines skills, knowledge, and experience and why you should be considered for this vacancy. You should take into consideration the position overview (including any detailed position specific requirements) when drafting your response. Where possible include specific relevant examples of your work.  The APS work level standards accommodate the diversity of roles across the APS and are structured to clearly differentiate between the work expected (i.e. responsibilities and duties) at each classification level.  In the eRecruit (the department’s online recruitment system) you will also need to:  upload a Curriculum Vitae  provide contact details for 2 Referees.  Eligibility  Citizenship - to be eligible for employment with the Department, you must be an Australian Citizen or, in limited circumstances, in the process of obtaining it.  Security Clearance - our successful candidate is required to hold, or have the ability to obtain, and maintain a Baseline security clearance.  Please refer to the Job Information Pack for more information about the role.  How to apply for jobs in the Australian Public Service (APSC Guide) Opens in new window  Job Information Pack Opens in new window
job_description.161: About the Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB)  The Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) is an independent Commonwealth Government statutory agency. The ATSB is governed by a Commission and is entirely separate from transport regulators, policy makers and service providers.  The ATSB's purpose is to improve safety of, and public confidence in, aviation, marine and rail transport through: • independent investigation of transport accidents and other safety occurrences • safety data recording, analysis and research • fostering safety awareness, knowledge and action. The ATSB is established by the Transport Safety Investigation Act 2003 (TSI Act) and conducts its investigations in accordance with the provisions of the Act. Under the TSI Act, it is not a function of the ATSB to apportion blame or provide a means for determining liability. The ATSB does not investigate for the purpose of taking administrative, regulatory or criminal action.  The Bureau's Commission is constituted by a full-time Commissioner/CEO and three part-time Commissioners. The ATSB's staff (approximately 100) includes about 60 aviation, marine and rail safety investigators. While the majority of staff are based in Canberra, we also have regional offices located in Brisbane, Adelaide, Melbourne and Perth.  The key duties of the position include About the role  The Data Recovery Analyst is a member of a small team of transport safety professionals who apply engineering science to the investigation and analysis of transport safety occurrences.  The Data Recovery Analyst provides technical support to the operations teams, in aviation, marine and rail transport modes, by assisting in the recovery, analysis and presentation of data from transport vehicles and supporting infrastructure. Traditionally, this data has been provided by dedicated recording devices (such as cockpit voice recorders, flight data recorders, voyage data recorders), however the increasing implementation and use of technologies such as quick-access recorders, digital engine control systems, embedded GPS devices, alongside personal electronic devices and video and audio recordings has provided a growing range of data sources from which evidence may be obtained. Where devices are damaged, this can include recovering binary data at the chip level, and associated interpretation and validation of binary data to engineering units.  In this role you will be responsible for: • Downloading data from a broad range of electronic devices. Devices may include all types of phones, various GPS devices, iPads/tablets, flight recorders (FDR, CVR), on-train data recorder and/or event recorder, and marine voyage data recorders. If the device has been damaged in the accident it will require dedication to extract the data ready for analysis. • Undertaking detailed analysis of the data recovered, in-line with ATSB processes, a prepare briefs or reports or presentations for the purpose of improving safety within various transport industries. • Working along-side or being mentored by senior ATSB investigators on an accident site or in the ATSB's technical facilities, using own subject matter expertise to contribute to complex safety investigation activities. • Ensuring data recovery and lab equipment (hardware and software) is procured and maintained to a high standard, and procedures are in place for the safe operation of all equipment, and the efficient and accurate recovery of data. • Undertaking project work to advance unique data initiatives for the ATSB, includes working collaboratively with external stakeholders and/or other government agencies. • Actively contributing to, and promoting the ATSB and APS values and culture, and the ATSB's promotion of transport safety awareness.
job_description.162: Do you like a challenge and want to be a key part of a high performing team who work to support infrastructure delivery for a growing city? Major Projects Canberra seeks the services of a suitably skilled and experienced data analyst who can also assist with the preparation of monthly reporting for executive audiences.  The reporting team plays a key role in supporting infrastructure delivery in the ACT by providing a range of vital information and intelligence to a wide audience including senior executives and external stakeholders. Reports are produced monthly, annually and ad hoc and are designed to facilitate informed decision making across the directorate and provide analysis and insights into project delivery, expenditure, forward procurement plans, market conditions, and contracting and tendering as well as undertaking statutory reporting. The Reporting team also plays a key role in supporting the development of MPC data policies and in supporting the activities of the Project Management Office in guiding infrastructure procurement and delivery policy for Major Projects Canberra, the ACT Government’s dedicated infrastructure delivery directorate.  Working to the Senior Director Reporting, you will have responsibility for the drafting of monthly reports, reviewing and testing report data and presenting reports that communicate issues and knowledge clearly and concisely. You will also be responsible for developing a reporting framework, using tools such as excel and Power BI to introduce efficiencies in how reports are created, and transitioning the framework to a documented and easily replicated set of regular tasks. You will also liaise frequently with stakeholders across MPC and government to leverage innovations in reporting and data management and analysis and to assist other MPC teams with data and reporting tasks.  To excel in this role, you will need highly developed skills and experience in ICT, data research, analysis, report presentation, strong communication skills and have an eye for detail.  The ACT Public Service supports workforce diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. As part of this commitment, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, culturally diverse people and those who identify as LGBTIQ are encouraged to apply.  Notes: A Merit Pool will be established from this selection process and will be used to fill vacancies over the next 12 months.  How to apply: Please submit no more than a two page written response addressing why you are best suited for this position and your experience against the Professional/Technical Skills and Knowledge, Behavioural Capabilities and Compliance Requirements/Qualifications outlined in the position description, along with a current curriculum vitae and contact details for two referees.  Applications should be submitted via the Apply Now button below.  #LI-DNI
job_description.163: Canberra ACT/ Sydney NSW  Hybrid Working arrangement  Must be an Australian and be able to obtain NV1 Clearance  Are you an experienced Data Developer looking for an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the public sector? We are seeking a talented individual to join one of the Federal Government agencies and play a pivotal role in driving positive change through effective data analysis and collaboration.  As a Data Developer you will have the following responsibilities: • Data Development Expertise: Bring your extensive experience, with a minimum of 3+ years in Data Development, to the team and contribute to the development and maintenance of data solutions. • Detailed Data Design: Perform detailed design based on high-level architecture, focusing on data integration utilising Azure cloud data services, including ADLS, SQL DB, data lake Synapse, and blob storage. • ETL Development: Develop complex ETL processes based on SSIS and customised coding in languages such as C#, .NET, or VB.NET. Utilise your development experience with Power BI, including stored procedures, DAX, functions, and views. • Azure Proficiency: Demonstrate proficiency with Azure data factory and Azure Event Hub while maintaining a strong understanding of DevOps or other version control systems. • Agile Collaboration: Thrive in an Agile environment, contributing to collaborative efforts and leveraging your exceptional communication skills, both written and oral.  In addition to the mandatory requirements, candidates with the following qualifications will be highly regarded: • Government Knowledge: Familiarity with government regulations, policies, and ethical considerations surrounding AI/ML technologies. Strong understanding of government systems, processes, and data sources is highly desirable. • AI/ML Expertise: Possess a strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, algorithms, and techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, natural language processing, anomaly detection, or reinforcement learning. Proven experience in developing and implementing AI/ML solutions, preferably within a government context. • Programming Proficiency: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++, coupled with experience with AI/ML libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn). • Data Handling: Experience in data pre-processing, cleaning, and visualisation techniques, as well as handling large-scale datasets and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark). • API Development: Experience developing and interfacing with Restful APIs or similar, especially in the context of Machine Learning solutions and Python development. • Big Data Expertise: Familiarity with Big Data architecture and the ability to work with large datasets effectively.  If you are a dedicated and experienced Data Developer with a passion for making a difference in the public sector, we encourage you to apply by Clicking the "apply" Button or Call Alvin on 02 6243 6415 to discuss further.  FinXL does not accept unsolicited resumes or appreciate unsolicited calls from recruitment agencies.  FinXL encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
job_description.164: Job Requisition ID: 34768  Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best  Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career  Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts  We are seeking a talented Reporting & Insights Analyst with experience in Tableau and a passion for data to join our Client, Industries & Markets enablement team. This role can be based in any major city, and we offer excellent flexible working arrangements.  What will your typical day look like? As a Reporting and Insights Consultant, you will enhance existing, and develop new business performance reporting, in Tableau, for stakeholders across Deloitte, including senior executive leaders. Working with the wider team, you will independently translate business requirements into quantitative metrics, with our boarder team looking to you, as an expert on all things Tableau and data. You will answer the ‘Why’ and ‘So What’ for our internal stakeholders, investigating trends and outliers within large datasets.  About us At Deloitte, delivering impactful work and experiences to our clients is central to everything we do. We do this by being client issues-led, seamlessly integrating our capabilities to show up as one Deloitte, with relevance, impact and differentiation.  This role is internal facing and is part of the Client, Industries & Markets (CI&M) enablement team, supporting the CI&M Executive who oversee our go-to-market strategy and client interface for the Firm.  Enough about us, lets talk about you  You are someone with experience in gathering and analysing data sets to translate problems into actionable insights and recommendations.  With your commercial acumen, you are familiar with financial terminology and the reporting requirements of a business. Strong analytical capabilities and structured problem-solving skills are your strength, you can independently curate dashboard content and tell compelling data stories.  Specifically, you should have:  Demonstrated experience translating business problems into actionable dashboard views (from initial scoping to delivery)  Demonstrated experience developing dashboards in Tableau (12 Months + experience), and in building data models in excel.  12 months + experience working with varying levels of stakeholders and working with a business to develop/ mature reporting to meet asks.  Excellent communication skills with an ability to communicate at all levels.  Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
job_description.165: Full Job Description Are you an experienced Data Analyst / Data Modeller seeking your next role?  We are looking for Data Analysts to register their interest for our current vacancy,  7-month initial contract, with 2*6months extension $75-$90ph + Super, based on experience & skill level Canberra / Brisbane / Sydney based, Federal gov client  As a Data Analyst / Data Modeller, you will: Possess the capability to analyze and evaluate datasets and prepare a current state analysis. Exhibit proficiency in utilizing Excel to store and analyze data, including working with formulas and manipulating data. Contribute to and participate actively in ongoing project reporting requirements. Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis as an integral part of the design process. Create and maintain pertinent project and design documentation. Validate and oversee data and reports to ensure consistency and accuracy. Collaborate with the team to adopt and implement recommended practices for complying with data and information management standards. Demonstrate problem-solving skills by applying judgment and critical thinking. Showcase previous experience in the government sector, including work within small teams.  Required Experienced: Familiarity with R and/or Python are desirable, in addition to experience with Azure Databricks Minimum 3-5 years of recent experience working across Business / IT environments as a Data Analyst / Data Modeller Proficient understanding of researching and analyzing both flat file and database datasets. Demonstrate expertise in utilizing Microsoft Excel to analyze data and consolidate findings, incorporating the use of formulas, pivot tables, and PowerQuery / PowerPivot. Exhibit experience in creating and maintaining pertinent project and design documentation, such as dataset catalogs, source to target mappings, use cases, and conceptual data models. Showcase a proven ability to effectively engage and collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders, working seamlessly as part of an agile, multidisciplinary government team. Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Our Hiring Process: Registration: Applying to this job ad will register you with our Talent Community, who will gather essential information about your skills and experience. Skill Assessment: We'll assess your skills and qualifications against our current client requirements as well as future job opportunities. Job Matching: Once we find a match, we'll connect you with our Talent Specialists who are looking for people with your expertise for our Clients. job_description.166: • Location: Canberra • Remote: Remote • Type: Contract • Job #16057  About the role  Our Federal government client is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate. This role has fully remote working arrangements available.  Key responsibilities • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Skills and experience • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders. • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting. • Ability to work in dynamic, highly collaborative environment, and online team setting, using a pro-active, results-oriented approach  Desirable criteria • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment. job_description.171: Closing date: 15/10/2023  Data Analyst • APS Level 5 • Ongoing • $80,328 - $84,688  Working within the Mint’s Sales Development Team, the Data Analyst plays a critical role by leveraging data to inform decision making, drive insights and support the achievement of the Mint’s organisational objectives. Reporting to the Sales Product and Project Manager, the Data Analyst works under limited supervision to provide market analysis and deliver evidence based advice. Through collecting, analysing, cleaning and interpreting data, the Data Analyst produces reports, forecasts and recommendations, contributing to how product sales are managed across the Mint. The Data Analyst undertakes risk assessments, using data to inform sales and production activities.  The Data Analyst manages key data related projects for the Mint, in particular developing and delivering the annual sales budget to inform key stakeholders of the planned revenue position of the Mint. They respond to ad hoc requests from senior managers and are responsible for gathering and analysing data at limited notice, requiring a high level of attention to detail. The Data Analyst leads a small team, including setting priorities, identifying opportunities for growth and managing individual and section performance. They regularly find ways to continuously improve processes and procedures to achieve strategic objectives.  The duties of this position include:  1. Undertaking collection and analysis of sales, production and competitor data, including:  a. cleaning, validating and interpreting data from a variety of sources;  b. conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis to identify trends, patterns and anomalies;  c. developing, implementing and maintaining budgets, databases and data extracts; and  d. using statistical and data visualisation techniques to present findings.  2. Developing high level, comprehensive reports, forecasts and dashboards to present data-driven insights and translate complex data into actionable advice or recommendations for the Mint.  3. Developing, implementing and tracking the annual sales budget to inform the planned revenue position of the Mint for key stakeholders including the Chief Financial Officer, Chief Executive Officer and the Treasury.  4. Responding to ad hoc reporting requests from senior management, government officials or other stakeholders, including quickly gathering and analysing data to address urgent information needs.  5. Collaborating and negotiating with internal and external stakeholders relating to complex operational and administrative matters, including sale and production of Mint products, costs, revenue and associated recommendations.  6. Providing tailored advice and guidance to the Customer Experience and Sales Managers relating to sales and production statistics, and managing stock allocation.  7. Undertaking risk assessments of sales and budget related data, identifying and reporting on risks as they arise and making relevant recommendations.  8. Supervising a small team including setting priorities, providing feedback, identifying development opportunities and managing performance.  9. Identifying opportunities for process improvement including defining new data collection and analysis processes, developing work instructions and creating efficiencies.  10. Representing the Mint at various internal and external forums.  11. Ensuring compliance with regulatory, departmental and Treasury reporting requirements.  Security clearance  This position requires a Baseline security clearance. The successful applicant will be required to obtain and maintain a clearance at this level.  Qualification  A bachelor’s degree or higher in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or a relevant field.  How to apply  The successful applicant for this position may be granted flexible office arrangements to allow them to work off-site. If these arrangements are put in place, the successful applicant may at times be required to travel from their location to the Mint’s premises in Deakin, ACT to undertake work onsite at their own expense.  Please submit your application by 11:30pm on Sunday, 15 October 2023. You will need to upload: • A current resume • A 500 word pitch that describes how your skills meet the requirements of the role as detailed in the position description.  Information on applying for a job in the Australian Public Service is available at the Employment page of our website.  Should you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Elisa Rodriguez on (02) 6202 6830.

job_description.174: Establish data-driven decision-making to optimize the online learning experience at the University UC Level 7, Salary Range $94,134 pa - $101,979 pa + 17% Super Full time, 3 years Fixed Term Opportunity    UC has curiosity, ambition and inclusiveness at its core. We challenge the status quo through the pursuit of excellence in teaching, learning and research. Our place-based commitment ensures that we visibly serve Canberra’s community and the surrounding region with impact on the nation. The University of Canberra is ranked in the top five universities globally for reducing inequalities (THE Impact Rankings, 2023).   The University of Canberra is undergoing an exciting time of transformation, growth and change. It is embarking on a transformational program to enhance student learning and increase student enrolments through the development of new capabilities and capacities. We will generate new online courses and develop a more flexible approach to delivering existing courses, both at our Bruce campus, our campus in the cloud and with our partners. The University is also undertaking a realignment in its support for learning and teaching, its curriculum development and its policy suite. This role gives you the opportunity to bring your skills and experience to influence and impact these important changes at the University.  We are currently seeking an Online Learning Analytics Specialist to join the University in support of a major strategic program to grow student numbers, the Education Transformation and Growth Program. Operating under broad direction and reporting to the Manager, Insights & Data Storytelling, the Online Learning Analytics Specialist will lead the development of a new capability focused on improving the experience and effectiveness of our online course offerings.  The Online Learning Analytics Specialist is a dynamic role within the Insights & Data Storytelling team at the University of Canberra, established to drive data-driven decision-making and optimize the online learning experience. This newly created position focuses on harnessing the power of learning analytics to enhance the quality of online education, improve student engagement, and inform instructional design strategies. The specialist will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather, analyse, and interpret online learning data, contributing to the university's commitment to delivering innovative and effective online education.  To be successful in this role, the preferred candidates will have experience as an analyst or a learning designer with exposure to data analytics. Existing knowledge of Canvas, Power BI, web and/or product analytics will be highly regarded. As a new capability in the team, the successful applicant will need to have initiative to drive, mould and design the framework to maximise the e-learning experience for our student with support from the Manager, Insights & Data Storytelling.   The University offers excellent conditions and benefits such as flexible, family-friendly policies, on site gym, on site medical services, a supermarket and childcare facilities.   Connected – A Decadal Strategy 2023-2032 sets a goal to be the national sector leader in equity, diversity, inclusion and access, and the ambitious goals of our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Strategic Plan are designed to ensure that our Indigenous students and staff flourish in a welcoming and culturally safe environment. UC encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups.   To be considered for this role all we want is your CV, no other documentation are required.  Please ensure you take the time to align you CV with the Position Description requirements. We want to understand how your skills and experience relate to the position you are applying for.    If you are initially shortlisted, you may be asked to complete an online one-way video interview. There will be a list of pre-set questions that will need to be answered within a stipulated time.   Working Rights: Applicants who wish to apply for this position should have valid working rights or eligibility to obtain a work visa for Australia.   For job specific information: Please contact Simon Hopkins - Manager, Insights & Data Storytelling - Simon.Hopkins@canberra.edu.au – 0423267173.  Recruitment and application questions: please contact the Talent Team on 0447 404 529 or email uctalent@canberra.edu.au   Closing Date: 11:55pm, Sunday the 15th of October 2023
job_description.175: Our federal government client is seeking individuals to fill the roles of Data Analyst and Senior Data Analyst for their esteemed project. • Contract lenght: 12 months contract | Work Environment: Hybrid • Location: Canberra, ACT | Sydney, NSW | Melbourne, VIC • Candidate must be Australian Citizen and be able to obtain a security clerance.  1. Data Analyst:  Role and Reponsibilities  The position will support the data extraction and summarisation of the internal system repository data required for decision making. The person has also a responsibility to support data analysis process for the Pricing Data and Reporting Unit. Candidates must have experience and strong writing and presentation skills to translate complex information into easily understandable language. • Extracting, cleansing, and summarising of data from internal / external sources. • Support data scrapping exercises with development of the automatization process. • Support market prices regression analysis and collaborate on pricing recommendations. • Support the Annual Pricing Review with summaries, statistical analysis, and presentation writing. • Support SDA quarterly report and analysis. • Update and maintain pricing performance dashboard and continuously work on enhancements. • Support design of statistical and mathematical models to undertake analytical work. • Undertaking ad hoc modelling requests and report production. • Collaborate with internal teams to escalate complex issues and ensure timely resolution. • Contribute to process improvement efforts to enhance the experience for all stakeholders. • Provide additional support across the Branch and Division when and where needed and undertaking specific initiatives when required.  Essential Criteria • Two years' experience with clean / transform / summarise large data sets. • Have demonstrated ability in tools such as excel/VBA and R or other programming language such as Python. • High level of skill working both autonomously and collaboratively in a team. • Detail-oriented, highly analytical, and able to work with large datasets. • Excellent Report Writing skills (including tables & graphics). • Ability to resolve issues with ease. • Ability to use good judgment and make sound decisions quickly. • Ability to work under pressure. • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and handle multiple priorities effectively. • Ability to maintain a positive attitude. • Goal oriented, innovative problem solver. • High enthusiasm, drive and a determination to be part of a growing and successful organisation. • Demonstrate a robust and resilient approach.  Desired Criteria • Understanding of contemporary issues of people with disability • Experience with dashboards development • Previous experience/exposure with data transformation projects.  2. Senior Data Analyst  Role and Reponsibilities  The position will lead the data extraction, collation and summarisation of the internal system repository data required for decision making. The person has also a responsibility to drive data analysis process for the Pricing Data and Reporting Unit. Candidates must have experience and strong writing and presentation skills to translate complex information into easily understandable language. • Data collation and data accessibility from internal and external sources. • Sing off data extraction and final outputs. • Keeping audit trail and change log of reports. • Improve data collation process by using VBA's or SAS direct output. • Organising knowledge sharing sessions around data limitations or extraction procedures. • Develop strong knowledge of internal systems (CRM and Salesforce). • Responding to ad hoc and other report production requests. • Update and development of pricing analyses to enable informed pricing decisions. • Designing statistical and mathematical models to undertake analytical work. • Development and maintenance of pricing performance dashboards • Effectively communicating (verbally and in writing) the progress of work responsibilities and outcomes of work undertaken. • Collaborate with internal teams to escalate complex issues and ensure timely resolution. • Contribute to process improvement efforts to enhance the experience for all stakeholders. • Provide additional support across the Branch and Division when and where needed and undertaking specific initiatives when required.  Essential Criteria • Proficiency in SAS and SQL. • Three years' experience with clean / transform / summarise large data sets. • Detail-oriented, highly analytical, and able to work with large datasets. • Have demonstrated ability in tools such as excel/VBA and R or other programming language such as Python. • High level of skill working both autonomously and collaboratively in a team as well as the ability to coach and mentor others. • Excellent Report Writing skills (including tables & graphics). • Ability to resolve issues with ease. • Ability to use good judgment and make sound decisions quickly. • Ability to work under pressure. • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and handle multiple priorities effectively. • Ability to maintain a positive attitude. • Goal oriented, innovative problem solver. • High enthusiasm, drive and a determination to be part of a growing and successful organisation. • Demonstrate a robust and resilient approach.  Desired Criteria • Understanding of contemporary issues of people with disability • Experience with dashboards development • Previous experience/exposure with data transformation projects. • Previous experience/exposure building statistical, or machine learning models related to pricing. job_description.176: Line of Service  Assurance  Industry/Sector  G and PS - Other  Specialism  Data, Analytics & AI  Management Level  Senior Manager  Job Description & Summary  About Us  The challenges facing business and society are complex and need new angles and fresh thinking. Your human ingenuity, passion and experience, combined with the latest technology, make these problems easier to tackle.  Together, we are a passionate community of solvers coming together in unexpected ways, creating new solutions for a new day. We're in the business of transformation.  To transform the future, we're building a diverse, ambitious team that champions imaginative ways to solve our clients' most important challenges.  A career in our Analytics Data Assurance practice, will provide you with the opportunity to assist clients in developing analytics and technology solutions that help them detect, monitor, and predict risk.  Using advanced technology, we're able to focus on establishing the right controls, processes and structures for our clients to ensure that decisions are based on accurate information and assure that information provided to third parties is accurate, complete, and can be trusted. How and where work gets done is being reimagined. It all adds up to The New Equation.  About the Opportunity  At PwC Canberra, we combine local and global expertise, public sector experience and people-focused purpose to help the federal government make life better for our communities.  As Senior Manager in our Canberra Assurance team you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.  Your impact will be seen by: Delivering crucial business insights to clients through data analytics and data visualisation  Providing business confidence through innovative use of data analysis and visualisation techniques to improve efficiency and quality of assurance processes  Helping businesses make sense of complex data sets and familiar with widely used analytics tools  Partnering with clients to enable them to understand the value in their data through analytics and visualisation  Assuring that information and data provided to regulators and third parties is accurate, complete and can be trusted  Supervising and coaching a team, to foster an environment of continued growth and development within the team.  Leading client projects, to help businesses make sense of complex data sets and given them the confidence they are doing things right  About you  You have 5+ years experience with demonstrated strengths in Data Science / Advanced Analytics, Data Management, Data Governance, Data Engineering, Data Modeling, Computing Engineering / Sciences, Applied Statistics / Mathematics, DevOps and/or Cloud Computing, underpinned by related degree-level or higher qualifications or other fields such as Business Informatics, Econometrics, Finance, Accounting, Commerce, Information Technology, Science or Engineering.  You are a confident senior data analyst and/or engineer with working knowledge of ETL, quality control and testing processes and/or robust data infrastructure design, implementation, test, integration, management and optimisation, as well as expertise in automation, visualisation and / or advanced analytics process automation, reporting digitisation / visualisation, advanced analytics data governance / transformation and/or data accessibility for real-time analytics . You are able to use widely used analytics tools i.e. Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Python, R, Alteryx, SAS, Power Automate, Power Apps, SQL and/or Azure. Experience in Assurance, Consulting and / or the public sector is highly desirable.  Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you're ready to help our Data Analytics team solve complex business issues, improve how systems work and provide confidence on the bigger decisions. You're collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment.  You're a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.  Please note this role is based in Canberra.  Due to the nature of the work, you must be an Australian citizen, eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Government issued security clearance. To solve important problems we need to aim for the inclusion of our diverse talent. We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change.  We know that when people from diverse backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society. If you don't think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we'd still love to hear from you.  Your New Benefits  Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance  Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends  Paid study (and leave), we'll pay all the costs and give you time off to study  No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day  Yearly bonuses, because who doesn't love to be rewarded for great performance  Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships  Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers  If you're looking for a team that values your work and solves meaningful problems, apply now  We believe the best work is human-led and tech-powered. If you're keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know  Shibanni Dave is the Recruitment Manager for the role.  As the team experiences a high volume of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. job_description.178: Data Analyst - Data Migration /Cleansing Project - NV1 - ACT Open to: Must have Negative Vetting Level 1  Location: Act -On-site or Hybrid  In this project you will be involved in the data migration from legacy systems, assisting with the go-live, and sustainment. Salesforce Service Cloud or Public Sector Cloud knowledge and experience are highly desirable. Responsibilities of the role will include, but not be limited to: • Develop an expert understanding of the data model, including validations, for the new Salesforce solution build by performing knowledge transfer from the build team. • Assist the data migration team with the preparation of the data migration mapping from the legacy SQL databases to the Salesforce data model. Duties include • Develop an expert understanding of the data model, including validations, for the new Salesforce solution build by performing knowledge transfer from the build team. • Assist the data migration team with the preparation of the data migration mapping from the legacy SQL databases to the Salesforce data model. • Assist the data migration team with merging, cleansing and validating of the SQL database data. Essential criteria • A strong understanding of entity-relationship database design concepts and demonstrated experience designing enterprise-level databases. • Demonstrated experience designing complex queries for SQL Server.. • Experience validating and cleansing data. • Experience migrating data between SQL Server databases. • Ability to work with a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment. • Experience with data migration patterns, processes, and/or tools. Desirable Skills • Salesforce Service Cloud or Public Sector Cloud knowledge and experience. • Experience with engaging with business areas to understand business process, data and requirements gathering.
job_description.179: Australian Citizens residing in Australia only respond. • Contract start 16 October 2023 to 12 months. • Australian Citizen, Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth role.  Send your responses to jobs@softtestpays.com  Overview  The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is responsible for the delivery of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). Since it was established, the NDIA has pursued a vision of optimising social and economic independence and full participation for people with disability. The Data & Analytics Branch supports the Agency by providing high quality data and reporting and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions.  Key Responsibilities • Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the organisation. Capture business requirements and identify underlying business needs. • Carry out analysis of present approaches and identify opportunities to enhance processes current and target state. • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business requirements. • Translate subject-matter expert and stakeholder discussion into process flows, procedures and business requirements. • Identify and document instances where existing business processes may be streamlined or improved or do not meet current or potential future business needs. • Develop, maintain and validate business requirements with stakeholders. • Input to the design and implementation of solutions that support the business processes and deliver business insight. • Liaise with management to coordinate process improvement project activities. • Workshop facilitation with business stakeholders to map out processes and elicit business requirements. • Practical Agile Delivery framework experience, developing Initiatives, Epics, User Stories and other documentation. • Ability to work with the business to identify business process issues, improvement opportunities and potential solutions. • Ability to gather, analyse and translate business data to meaningful insights.  Every application requires to address selection criteria as part of application submission.  Essential Criteria  1. Able to translate discussion into process flows, requirements and documentation.  2. Able to understand and capture business requirements relating to use / application of data to business problems.  3. Have experience in as is and to be process mapping.  4. Hands on experience with agile product development process for data products as well as developing detailed User Stories and UAC.  5. Intermediate skills with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, Powerpoint, Word.  6. Showcase good analytical and evaluating skills.  Desirable Criteria  1. Experience as a scrum master.  2. Experience creating wireframes.  3. Data analysis skills.  4. Experience working in data businesses.

Data / Systems Analyst requirements:  Work within a small team consisting of current staff and third-party provider staff, undertaking a range of activities across the development lifecycle including, any or all of the following: • Facilitating meetings with business users to elicit detailed requirements. • Liaise with technical staff to identify and investigate data sources. • Undertake data modelling/ mapping and ETL development . • Manage the Azure Synapse and Power BI environments associated with the Library Analytics Platform including release management activities, streamlining operational processes to enhance business intelligence capabilities in Azure cloud environment. • Undertake Power BI development to provide business users with actionable business intelligence. • Undertake problem investigation to identify root causes and develop actionable solutions. • Undertake and/or participate in Regression, Systems and User Acceptance testing activities. • Be self-directed, working under limited supervision, and reporting to the Technical Team Leader and Project Manager on activity status and issues as necessary.  Call Sarah Sanders on 0480 002 456 or email [email protected] for any further information.
