job_description.182: About the company:  Seeing Machines is the world leader in the field of Safety-AI and prides itself on developing technologies that save lives, for real!  Around the globe and at any time of the day, there are almost 1 million cars on the roads that are using state-of-the-art operator monitoring technology developed by Seeing Machines which provides real-time protection from distraction and drowsy-related driving events. Seeing Machines works with the world’s leading brands (eg. General Motors, Mercedes Benz, Qantas, Caterpillar, Toll) across multiple transport sectors of automotive, commercial road transport (Fleet), and aviation to enhance safety.  As a Business Analyst in our team, you will play a pivotal part in the discovery, design and collaborative problem solving for new features and the continuous improvement of our products alongside a dynamic and progressive Product Management team. This key role acts as a bridge to ensure feature discovery, design and implementation, meet the desired outcomes for customers and the business.  Key Responsibilities: • Contribute to feature discovery and design with product management, including leading on aspects of activities such: • Mapping current and future state user journey / service flows • Running co-design sessions • Liaising with development on technical constraints / systems process mapping • Input to concept prototyping with designs to test solutions • Documenting user insights and lessons learn in presentations and confluence • Lead on documentation of user stories during design and handover to development, including follow through end-to-end to release. • Document final user stories in JIRA as design flows are approved • Support handover from design to development • Lead as the point of contact for specific feature for delivery, quality and development.  Knowledge, Skills and Experience: • Relevant tertiary degree in computer science, product design or similar, or equivalent practical experience. • Excellent problem solving skills, using design thinking approaches to solve problems collaboratively, in a small multi-disciplinary team. • Ability to lead and facilitate workshops, co-design and ideation sessions, and customer and stakeholder interviews. • Ability to provide concise presentations on both quantitative and qualitative insights. • Technical understanding to work effectively with architects and development team to understand feasibility constraints and assess merits of different proposed solutions. • Ability to map both customer current and future state journey’s and system processes to ensure the feature roadmap is comprehensive and documentation enables effective delivery. • Demonstrated experience managing the delivery of digital product features from discovery to release, in a fast-paced, agile environment.  About you:  With demonstrated experience in a previous similar role, you will be a collaborative team member with a mindset that encourages different perspectives to solve problems. Your ability to adapt to changing circumstances will compliment your approach to taking ownership from start to finish to achieve outcomes. Lastly, you will have a growth mindset while being energised by the opportunity to learn and support others in your project team to do the same.  Why Seeing Machines: • We are inventive, innovative and collaborative and are making a real difference to safety on roads, all around the world • Work flexibly – we encourage our people to manage their work and personal lives to achieve a balanced outcome • We are global, Seeing Machines serves a growing market in the UK, Europe, Africa, North America, Latin America, and Asia Pacific • We are focused on employee support and understand the importance of our collective wellbeing. You will have access to our Employee Assistance Program any time you require it • We reward and recognise achievement. You will have access to our global benefits and reward platform.  For more information, visit: http://www.seeingmachines.com  Seeing Machines acknowledges Traditional Owners of Country throughout Australia and recognises the continuing connection to lands, waters and communities. We pay our respect to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures; and to Elders past, present and emerging.
job_description.183: Infinite Consulting is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our clients multi-disciplined team supporting a major Cyber Strategy program of work.  As the Requirements Analyst you will be responsible for eliciting and defining both business and technical requirements, facilitating stakeholder meetings, requirements workshops and aligning project outcomes with the business' outcomes and Cyber Strategy.  Ideally you will have 18 months' experience as a Business Analyst and will possess exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills. Prior experience working across Cyber and technical focussed projects will be a distinct advantage.  The successful candidate will need to demonstrate: • Experience analysing functional, business and high-level technical requirements for projects, reconciling conflicting interests, and determining how to translate strategic imperatives into requirements that support planning for project delivery • Experience working with multiple types of stakeholders across diverse or large organisations at varying levels of stakeholder seniority • Demonstrated experience creating high quality deliverables documentation encapsulating requirements • Demonstrated experience Identifying issues, risks and benefits of existing and proposed solutions and outlining business impacts • Prior experience working across Cyber and technically focused projects preferred This is an initial contract starting September/October 2023 through to 30 June 2024 with multiple extensions options thereafter.  It is essential that the successful candidate holds an active AGSVA NV1 or NV2 security clearance.  The position is based in Canberra and working arrangements are onsite 5 days per week, 8 hours per day.  If you are interested in finding out more apply today alternatively contact Symmone or Jeff in our Canberra office on 6257 8888.
job_description.184: • Income Management Data Section • National Office, Tuggeranong Position Description: The Income Management Data Section sits within the Income Management Policy and Data Branch. Using a range of data sources to monitor and evaluate the Income Management and enhanced Income Management programs, the Section also supports other Income Management business areas with their data requirements, informing policy and program development.  Additionally, the Section facilitates ongoing engagement with relevant States and Territories to develop data sharing arrangements for the delivery of enhanced Income Management to communities across Australia.  The APS6 Data Analyst contributes to complex reporting using research and data analysis skills to provide data insights and analytical evidence to allow effective reporting decision-making.  Successful candidates will help design and perform a variety of quality assurance tasks to ensure programme health is accurately assessed, reported and improved if required.  Please review the job pack for the full position description  Eligibility / Additional Requirements: To be eligible for employment with Department of Social Services (the department), you must be an Australian citizen. An applicant's suitability for employment with the Department will be assessed through a pre-employment screening process. This will include an identity and criminal history background check.  Eligibility to obtain an Australian Government Security Clearance: The suitable applicant must also obtain and maintain a security clearance conducted by the Australian Government Security Vetting Agency (AGSVA).  Applicants also must be able to establish their background as checkable to be considered eligible for a security clearance. Any gaps or periods of time spent overseas for 12 or more months (cumulative) that cannot be verified by an Australian referee is deemed uncheckable, rendering the applicant ineligible for a security clearance. Background history must cover 5 / 10 years (Baseline / Negative Vet 1 or Negative Vet 2) of employment, education, residential, criminal history and anything else specified by the AGSVA. The suitable applicant must be willing to disclose all relevant and required information to fulfil this process.  Type / Length of Vacancy: Ongoing / Non-ongoing  Contact Officer Name: Nathan Tran  Contact Officer Phone: 0422 546 517  Contact Officer Email: nathan.tran@dss.gov.au  Application Closing Date: 18-Oct-2023  How to apply: • Start your application by clicking the "begin" button. or  Department of Social Services
job_description.185: The key duties of the position include The Role APS 6 Data Analyst This role will leverage your understanding of statistics, Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and programming. You will work as part of a team to develop and implement new tools and methodologies that use AGO's data and GIS more effectively and efficiently. You will work with a range of stakeholders, including AGO's intelligence analysts, data scientists and capability managers, ensuring your analytics meet user requirements, are rigorous and consistent with AGO's system environment.  APS 6 Data Scientist This role will leverage your experience in Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (AI/ML), data analysis and automation, to assist AGO to derive deeper insights from larger volumes of data, and at a pace that enables decision advantage. You will liaise with a range of stakeholders to evaluate and implement AI/ML technologies that drive innovation and modernise AGO's analytic practices.  The additional payment is a Building Defence Capability Payment (BDCP) which enables Defence to provide a premium, in addition to the rate of salary otherwise payable under the Enterprise Agreement (EA) to some or all of the jobs within a critical occupation(s) or discipline within a workplace.  Applicants engaged into a BDCP position must consider the following. BDCPs provide remuneration in addition to the Defence Enterprise Agreement (EA). This arrangement is subject to meeting eligibility criteria and is subject to annual review. Should your performance fall beyond requirements or the eligibility criteria not be met, your eligibility for the BDCP may be reviewed and ceased. It may also be ceased should you change positions or the requirement for the BDCP is no longer necessary, as determined by Defence. Should the BDCP be ceased you will be advised and your BDCP additional payment will cease.  About our Team The Australian Geospatial-Intelligence Organisation (AGO) makes a critical contribution to protect the lives and safety of Australians at home and overseas by providing accurate and timely geospatial-intelligence to support decision makers at all levels.  The Data Innovation and Analytics Directorate (DIAD) is a team of highly motivated data specialists who provide analytical support to AGO's intelligence and production areas. Our vision is to transform analytic workflows, increasing automation and augmentation through the application of data science and machine analytics. We work closely with a range of stakeholders to understand their analytic requirements, and deliver new tools and methodologies that enable them to achieve more efficient and innovative outcomes.  We foster a data-driven culture that supports analysts to gain deeper insights from larger volumes of data. We provide opportunities for continuous learning and development, including funding for tertiary qualifications in machine analytics, and the opportunity to engage with industry and academia.  Our Ideal Candidate Successful candidates will be highly motivated, have strong oral and communication skills, with broad knowledge of geospatial data applications and analytical techniques. In addition, they will be able to work both individually and as part of a team, build and maintain productive working relationships with diverse stakeholders, and proactively address skill/knowledge gaps. They will be resilient problem solvers, willing to engage with ambiguity and are able to harness collective knowledge to optimise outcomes.  They will also possess some of the following: • Strong data analysis/science skills, including the ability to use, manage, manipulate and analyse data to produce evidence-based conclusions. • Intermediate to advanced python programming experience. • Intermediate to advanced GIS experience. • Strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical concepts simply and clearly. • Experience developing/delivering data-centric training. • Knowledge of machine-learning techniques and data processing frameworks. • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms, such as AWS and Kubernetes.
job_description.186: Location:  Canberra - Australian Capital Territory  Date Published:  26-Sep-2023  Job Reference:  BH-151548  Service Level Analyst - NV1  We are Fujitsu  We use technology to make happier lives. We are a global leader in technology and business solutions that transform organizations and the world around us. We have a long heritage of bringing innovation and expertise, continuously working to contribute to the growth of society and our customers.  About the role  We are looking for a Service Level Analyst with NV1 security clearance to be responsible for evaluating, monitoring, and improving the service levels within the Delivery and Operation department as part of the Service Design team. This role involves setting performance targets, analysing data, and collaborating with various stakeholders to enhance service quality and ensure the delivery of exceptional customer experiences.  About you  Responsibilities and Accountabilities:  Service Level Management: Define, develop, and maintain service level agreements (SLAs) for different services within the Delivery and Operation department.  Continuously monitor SLA performance and ensure compliance with established targets.  Identify areas where SLAs are not met and implement corrective actions to address issues.  Data Analysis: Collect, analyse, and interpret data related to service performance, including key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.  Generate reports and dashboards to communicate performance trends to stakeholders. Use data-driven insights to make recommendations for service improvements.  Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including operations, IT, and customer support, to align service level objectives with business goals. Engage with internal and external stakeholders to gather feedback and input on service performance.  Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization and efficiency enhancements.  Suggest and implement improvements to service delivery workflows to meet or exceed SLAs.  Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive documentation of SLAs, service catalogs, and operational processes.  Prepare regular reports for management and stakeholders, highlighting performance trends and areas for improvement.  Risk Management: Identify potential risks that could impact service levels and develop mitigation strategies.  Proactively address issues that may affect service quality. Service Design Alignment: Ensure that service level agreements align with the overall service design principles and strategies.  Collaborate with the Service Design team to incorporate SLA requirements into new service offerings.  Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in business, IT, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., ITIL) are a plus.  Proven experience in service level management or a similar role within the IT or service industry.  Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with data and metrics. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.  Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, data visualization tools). Knowledge of IT service management (ITSM) principles and best practices.  Detail-oriented with a focus on continuous improvement.  Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in business, IT, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., ITIL) are a plus.  Proven experience in service level management or a similar role within the IT or service industry.  Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with data and metrics.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.  Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, data visualization tools).  Knowledge of IT service management (ITSM) principles and best practices.  Detail-oriented with a focus on continuous improvement.  Why Fujitsu?  We are an organization with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity, equity and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.  We offer tailored career paths across our global organisation to support your professional and personal growth.  Our customers trust us. We have an excellent reputation across the region and globally.  Best in class reward and recognition programs – flexible work, volunteering leave and more.  We live our values of aspiration, trust and empathy, all day, every day.  As an inclusive employer, Fujitsu aims to recruit a diverse range of talents to help us achieve our purpose. In line with our diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, we welcome applications from women and gender diverse people; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; Māori and Pacific people; LGBTI+ people; people with a disability; culturally and linguistically diverse people; and veterans and emergency responders.  If you don’t tick every box in this job description, please don’t rule yourself out. Research suggests that women and other people in underrepresented groups tend to only apply if they meet every requirement. We focus on hiring people who value inclusion, collaboration, adaptability, courage, and integrity, rather than ticking boxes – so if this resonates with you, then please apply.  For Security cleared roles - PLEASE NOTE: Due to the inherent requirements of the role, candidates must be Australian Citizens and hold a minimum NV1 Australian Federal Government Security Clearance. The role will or will likely involve access to controlled technology, must satisfy additional restrictions and requirements as a consequence of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations and the Export Administration Regulations. As a consequence of these restrictions and requirements, applicants may be adversely impacted if they are not Australian citizens, are dual nationals, hold citizenship from proscribed countries or are not of Australian national origin. Please refer to Discrimination (Fujitsu Australia Limited) Exemption 2017 (No 1) Notifiable instrument NI2020-672 (ACT).
job_description.187: We are looking to connect with Business Analysts in the ACT who are interested in working as an embedded team member with our Government clients in both contract and ongoing roles. Contribute to a wide range of projects that aim to achieve strategic objectives, modernise business processes and provide reliable information to help decision-makers. • Do you adopt a human-centred approach to your work as a Business Analyst? • Do you have a keen eye for asking the right questions to uncover key requirements? • Can you cultivate stakeholder relationships, bridging business, technology, strategy and creative? • Are you happiest when working with large, agile teams delivering digital products and services, navigating through ambiguity?  We'd love to hear from you!  Who are Local Peoples?  Local Peoples is a strategic research and design studio based in Melbourne and Canberra.  Our mission is to design healthy, resilient and resourceful communities. We are proud to be a certified B-Corporation with a strong focus on our social, environmental and economic impact.  We work across brand and digital design, place and experience design,, content and community engagement. Our key partners include state and local government, social enterprises, universities and large commercial organisations. All are experiencing complex challenges right now and we believe that design research, thinking and delivery can help to solve these challenges and make positive change for people and the planet.  We produce www.mattersjournal.com , a publication and community of 100K+, which focuses on design-led social innovation and impact.  Benefits Of Working With Local Peoples • We are experts in team design and augmentation - supporting with the right skills and experience at the right time. • We are leaders in the human centred design space with diverse design skills across brand design, service design, User interface (UI) and User experience (UX) design, design research, communications and place design. • We are a certified B-Corporation and prioritise the social, environmental and economic impact of our work. • We are top tier talent who are experienced and incredibly passionate about supporting the impact of your agency and the public sector. • Our people always have the full support of the studio to call upon for design thinking, tools and tips, so you are not just getting access to one bright mind, but a collective of many with diverse and deep experiences.  Required Skills And Experience.  General • Business Analyst with 5+ years of experience working within Agile frameworks, particularly Scrum and SAFe • Experience managing discoveries, co-design activities (workshops, interviews etc), process modelling, journey mapping, user stories, management of requirements within a product backlog.  Business Requirement • Identifying business needs and making sure they are fully captured by planning, defining, and managing user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional and technical requirements. • Conducting business discovery and co-design workshops, interviews, and meetings with internal and external stakeholders/working groups. • Recommend effective business and ICT changes  Analysis and reporting • Extensive experience and highly developed skills in performing analysis of systems and business processes, process mapping, user stories, use cases, data migration source-to-target mapping, specifications, and wireframes. • A strong eye for detail and excellent data presentation skills. • An ability to describe the business impacts of current and proposed solutions, including risks and benefits. • Analysis and reporting on the results of new solutions implemented in business and IT processes.  Stakeholder management • Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with stakeholders, including the ability to act as the team's representative in meetings with business units. • Experience facilitating workshops, stakeholder interviews, presentations, product backlog management and user acceptance testing.  Documentation • The ability to design, manage, and refine business processes, user journeys, and other supporting documents as necessary. • Developing artifacts to support requirements definition, such as process models, operational concepts, prototypes, and insights derived from data. • Assisting in the development of training materials, user guides and standardisation documents in connection with the deployment of new systems.  Residency and Clearance • Hold a current ASGVA Baseline clearance or be able to obtain one. • Australian Citizen  This role is open to Canberra based applicants.

job_description.189: Analyse Australia's Cyber Defense and Empower Classified, Safety-Critical Cloud Regions  What You'll Do:  Analise and design an array of Vault mission-critical tools (SOC, NOC, CMDB, ITSM, MDM, Identity, VDI, PaaS, SaaS), supporting the backbone of classified cloud regions. Analyse requirements for highly classified environments of national significance, engaging with the next generation of government technology. Focus on reliability, situational awareness, and data management, anticipating challenges and driving proactive solutions.  Who You Are:  Passionate about serving your country in the digital realm, committed to making a significant impact on Australia's cyber defence. Knowledge about a large range of applications with an interest in security, integration and open source. A smart thinker able to solve problems and document standard operating procedures for the Operations team.  Why You'll Love It:  Collaborate with the brightest minds in the industry, pushing the boundaries of cloud technology in the public sector. Here's a glimpse of what you can expect: • Working from a state-of-the-art office • Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (depending on secondary or primary care responsibilities) • Up to 5 paid wellness days • Genuine investment in your personal and professional development • Above-average remuneration package • And much more
job_description.190: • Establish data-driven decision-making to optimize the online learning experience at the University • UC Level 7, Salary Range $94,134 pa - $101,979 pa + 17% Super • Full time, 3 years Fixed Term Opportunity     UC has curiosity, ambition and inclusiveness at its core. We challenge the status quo through the pursuit of excellence in teaching, learning and research. Our place-based commitment ensures that we visibly serve Canberra’s community and the surrounding region with impact on the nation. The University of Canberra is ranked in the top five universities globally for reducing inequalities (THE Impact Rankings, 2023).   The University of Canberra is undergoing an exciting time of transformation, growth and change. It is embarking on a transformational program to enhance student learning and increase student enrolments through the development of new capabilities and capacities. We will generate new online courses and develop a more flexible approach to delivering existing courses, both at our Bruce campus, our campus in the cloud and with our partners. The University is also undertaking a realignment in its support for learning and teaching, its curriculum development and its policy suite. This role gives you the opportunity to bring your skills and experience to influence and impact these important changes at the University.  We are currently seeking an Online Learning Analytics Specialist to join the University in support of a major strategic program to grow student numbers, the Education Transformation and Growth Program. Operating under broad direction and reporting to the Manager, Insights & Data Storytelling, the Online Learning Analytics Specialist will lead the development of a new capability focused on improving the experience and effectiveness of our online course offerings.  The Online Learning Analytics Specialist is a dynamic role within the Insights & Data Storytelling team at the University of Canberra, established to drive data-driven decision-making and optimize the online learning experience. This newly created position focuses on harnessing the power of learning analytics to enhance the quality of online education, improve student engagement, and inform instructional design strategies. The specialist will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather, analyse, and interpret online learning data, contributing to the university's commitment to delivering innovative and effective online education.  To be successful in this role, the preferred candidates will have experience as an analyst or a learning designer with exposure to data analytics. Existing knowledge of Canvas, Power BI, web and/or product analytics will be highly regarded. As a new capability in the team, the successful applicant will need to have initiative to drive, mould and design the framework to maximise the e-learning experience for our student with support from the Manager, Insights & Data Storytelling.     The University offers excellent conditions and benefits such as flexible, family-friendly policies, on site gym, on site medical services, a supermarket and childcare facilities.   Connected - A Decadal Strategy 2023-2032 sets a goal to be the national sector leader in equity, diversity, inclusion and access, and the ambitious goals of our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Strategic Plan are designed to ensure that our Indigenous students and staff flourish in a welcoming and culturally safe environment. UC encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities and people from culturally diverse groups.   To be considered for this role all we want is your CV, no other documentation are required.   Please ensure you take the time to align you CV with the Position Description requirements. We want to understand how your skills and experience relate to the position you are applying for.  To download the position description please copy and paste the below URL into your web browser which will redirect you to the University of Canberra website - https://uctalent.canberra.edu.au/cw/en/listing/  If you are initially shortlisted, you may be asked to complete an online one-way video interview. There will be a list of pre-set questions that will need to be answered within a stipulated time.   Working Rights: Applicants who wish to apply for this position should have valid working rights or eligibility to obtain a work visa for Australia.   For job specific information: Please contact Simon Hopkins - Manager, Insights & Data Storytelling - Simon.Hopkins@canberra.edu.au - 0423267173.  Recruitment and application questions: please contact the Talent Team on 0447 404 529 or email uctalent@canberra.edu.au   Closing Date: 11:55pm, Sunday the 15th of October 2023
job_description.191: For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.  At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.  As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.  With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.  So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you  Ideal Candidate • Fluent in English. • Excellent research skills. • Excellent local knowledge of your home country. • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia. • Analytical mindset.  Job Requirements • Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years. • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts. • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability. • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms. • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions. • All work must be of an independent nature.  Technical requirements to perform the work  Access to a laptop or computer which uses: - A logon account unique to you - Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed - Only one member per household may apply NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.  Benefits  · Work up to 20 hours per week. · Earn a competitive rate of pay. · Develop your research skills. · Avoid the long commute. · Work from the comfort of your home office. · Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours  Apply Online Today  This is a freelance, independent contractor position. Additional information: Remote Job: Fully in-personEmployment type: Part-time
job_description.192: • Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM  face2face reference: 591408  Location: Nationwide - Remote  Hours: Full-time  Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline  Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super  About the role:  The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.  The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.  Duties: • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Required experience/skills: • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.  Desirable experience skills: • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment. job_description.193: Company Profile Note: After Applying , Check your email Inbox or Spam Folder For Next Steps. Important : After Applying , Check Inbox or Spam Folder For Next Steps. The Associate Data Analyst position will provide assistance to Pack Health's operations and sales teams. They will support the development of a robust, best-in-class data model and identify innovative ways to drive better outcomes faster and more effectively. A strong desire to learn and a creative approach to problem solving is needed. Specific Job Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Ensuring success with external clients by : Ensuring deliverables (e.g., reports and presentations) are high quality Meeting with account managers to provide overviews of outcomes Managing project timelines to ensure timely delivery Supporting the development of a robust, best-in-class data model, by : Improving data processes to plug data gaps and improve quality Managing processes relating to data collection, cleansing, analyzing, and reporting Maintaining the data model and reporting to ensure ongoing quality (e.g., through KPIs) Identifying innovative ways to drive better outcomes faster and more effectively, by: Contributing to the development of Pack programs from a data perspective Contributing to the ongoing development of Pack Health's outcomes framework Interpreting data in order to draw conclusions for managerial action and strategy Using statistical techniques for hypothesis testing to validate data and interpret results QUALIFICATIONS Required Education: Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred) in statistics, biostatistics, analytics, or health informatics Skills: Experience with analysis software such as SPSS Experience with programming languages such as R, SQL Experience with data visualization such as Tableau, Looker Experience with healthcare data Have the ability to work collaboratively with teams within and external to the employer Must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams Powered by Webbtree

This position will work closely with a range of external implementation consultants and internal stakeholders to ensure a successful implementation of new software applications. job_description.195: An opportunity to leverage your ServiceNow experience & work closely with a major government client, across a 12 month contract, with possibility of extension.  This role will see your Business Application Analyst experience come to fruition, to support a high level of written and social requirements, including but not limited to effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders.  Skills & Experience needed • ServiceNow IT Service Management, IT Asset Management and IT Operations Management suite of products. • Application and reporting development experience to assist the ServiceNow implementation as a product owner and system administrator. • Technical implementation of enterprise service management platforms. • Business intelligence systems analysis and design, system integration and testing and data modelling using industry standard techniques. • Ability to translate analytical and technical information into clear and meaningful terms. • ITIL certification  Responsibilities include • Attending weekly meetings to review progress on current projects, a look ahead for the following week's key activities and deliverables and discuss any issues requiring escalation. • Submit a monthly project report. • Submit written and verbal reports to Stakeholders; and • Other reporting as required.  NEC Professional Services, is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and candidates from culturally diverse backgrounds.
job_description.196: The Reporting analyst will deliver objective, accurate, quality-assured and timely analysis and reporting that is critical to Northern Territory government agencies and meets national reporting obligations.
job_description.197: 18-month fixed term, full time appointment  Professional Level 6/7 Salary - $83,265 to $98,622 pa  Plus 17% superannuation and 6 weeks annual leave  Casuarina Campus, Darwin NT  Analyse and improve business processes in relation to the student experience at CDU  About The Position  As the Business Analyst (Student Systems), you will analyse and work to continually improve business processes and practices in relation to the student experience. Working closely with subject matter experts, University business units, stakeholders, and vendors in the elicitation of business requirements your duties will include: • Analysis of business processes and systems that impact on the way staff and students interact with student systems. • Business process mapping and implementing business process improvements across business units. • Problem identification, requirements elicitation and solution design • Incident management and coordination of user acceptance testing • Security, training, access, and support • Operating within an Agile project management environment that requires a broad understanding of ICT technologies, customer experience and business analysis methodologies.  About You  To be successful, you will require: • Demonstrated project management skills and commitment to continuous improvement of processes and personal drive and self-motivation. • Demonstrated knowledge of business process improvement methodologies and ability to apply them across teams. • Demonstrated experience in conducting training, testing, and ability to manage systems access requirements within a role-based security model. • Verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex processes or regulations, to provide clear information to customers and to communicate effectively with staff. • Written communication skills, with the ability to document business processes, guidelines and work instructions and develop training material for administrative staff. • Advanced level of technical proficiency in administrative systems and platforms, including the use of large corporate databases and MSOffice software. • Subject matter expertise in one or more fields of VET and/or HE student and academic administration and the legislation and regulation that governs it. • Experience in leading lean (or similar) business process improvement projects or programs of work.  To view the responsibilities of the role, please click on the: Position Profile.  Remuneration  Appointment to this role will be at Professional Level 6/7. The base salary will be in the range of $83,265 - $98,622 per annum. The total remuneration package will be in the range of $97,420 - $115,387 per annum, including 17% superannuation.  What’s in it for you? • An employer who values your contribution to building a bigger, better and stronger university • Work with a University committed to changing people’s lives for the better through training, education and research • Opportunities for professional development, paid study and career progression • An enviable lifestyle in the spectacular Northern Territory • Generous relocation assistance • 17% superannuation • Six weeks of paid annual leave • Up to 26 weeks of paid parental leave (primary care giver), in addition to government payments (eligibility criteria apply) • Recognition of prior service with another Australian University / NT Government for Long Service Leave (recognition applied to qualifying period only) • Ability to negotiate transfer of leave entitlements under the Public Employment (Mobility) Act 1989 • Free on-campus parking in designated areas • Employee Assistance Program • Salary Packaging opportunities  How To Apply  All applications must be received online via the ‘apply’ button and should include your resume and a cover letter outlining your interest in the role and relevant skills and experience.  For a confidential discussion about the position please contact Cara Gordon on 08 8946 6456 or email cara.gordon@cdu.edu.au  Adjustments can be made throughout the application and selection process, as well as during employment to support applicants and employees with disability. CDU’s Workplace Adjustment Policy and Procedure can be found at https://policies.cdu.edu.au/view-current.php?id=191&version=1. If you would like to discuss adjustments, please contact the Recruitment Team on 08 8946 6492 or email strategicrecruitment@cdu.edu.au.  Diversity and Inclusion  At CDU we actively celebrate our diversity. We innovate, embrace new ideas, and act with courage and kindness. We’re about what we can give to the world rather than what we take, and we believe in the transformative power of education. We work hard to make sure every member of our University community feels they truly belong. Understanding that it is through our focus on our people and leveraging our differences that will make CDU the most connected university in Australia, we are striving to ensure that our culture and our community are inclusive of all our staff, students and visitors. We are committed to maintaining a culture where everyone feels respected, safe, encouraged to speak up and supported in achieving their professional goals. Applications from First Nations people, women at all levels, culturally and linguistically diverse people, people with disability, neurotypical and neurodiverse people, LGBTIQ+ people, people with family and caring responsibilities and people at all stages of their careers are welcomed.  You make CDU. And we want you to be exactly who you are.  Applications Close: Monday 9 October 2023
job_description.198: Our NEC Professional Service team is seeking a Business Analyst who will be responsible for a full range of business analysis tasks including requirements analysis and validation and functional design aspects, developing user stories, participating in client workshops, utilising project toolsets such as Jira and Balsamiq and liaising with software developers, testers, vendors and clients. The Business Analyst will be part of a BA team integral to the development of a custom .NET Revenue Management System build including design, development, testing and implementation activities.  Responsibilities Include • Undertake an analysis of a revenue management business subject matter. • Participate in analysis and design related workshops to inform user story creation • Participate in other related workshops such as sprint planning and oversight • Utilisation of project tool sets such as Onenote, SharePoint, MS Teams, Jira and Confluence • Work closely with other BA's, software developers and project customer to clarify requirements and design aspects • Testing involvement both informally and formally such as SIT and UAT • Development of test cases and execution of these • Contribute to the development and review of project documentation  Skills & Experience • An understanding of As-Is and To-Be Business Process Mapping (including BPMN) concepts • Process design and re-engineering • Business impact and gap analysis • High level analytical and organisational skills with good attention to detail • Highly effective client liaison intrapersonal skills • Hands on experience in the end to end delivery of major business systems projects • Highly skilled in the use of BA related tools such as MS Visio and Balsamiq • Experience identifying and analysing complex legislative and / or regulatory requirements applicable to the relevant industry/work environment and their processes  Desirable Skills and Experience • High level understanding of SQL • High level understanding of probability and statistics • SQL Entity Relationship models • Use of Power BI data visualisation; python optional • Data analysis techniques  NEC Professional Services, is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and candidates from culturally diverse backgrounds.
job_description.199: BA required for development of custom .NET Revenue Management System build including design, development, testing and implementation activities. Government ICT Project Services organisation based in Darwin and delivering complex, high value, and / or high-risk ICT programs and multi-year digital transformation initiatives is seeking a Business Analyst who will be responsible for a full range of business analysis tasks including requirements analysis and validation and functional design aspects, developing user stories, participating in client workshops, utilising project toolsets such as Jira and Balsamiq and liaising with software developers, testers, vendors and clients.  The Business Analyst will be part of a BA team integral to the development of a custom .NET Revenue Management System build including design, development, testing and implementation activities.  The successful applicant will be required to be based in Darwin for the duration of the contract.  Key Duties and Responsibilities  • Undertake analysis of a revenue management business subject matter  • Maintain a professional relationship with project resources, and the project customer  • Participate in analysis and design related workshops to inform user story creation  • Participate in other related workshops such as sprint planning and oversight  • Developing user stories  • Utilisation of project tool sets such as Onenote, SharePoint, MS Teams, Jira and Confluence  • Work closely with other BA’s and software developers to clarify requirements and design aspects  • Work closely with the project customer to clarify requirements and design aspects  • Testing involvement both informally and formally such as SIT and UAT  • Development of test cases and execution of these  • Contribute to the development and review of project documentation  • Managing sensitive information and maintaining records in line with information management policies  Essential Skills and Experience  • An understanding of As-Is and To-Be Business Process Mapping (including BPMN) concepts  • Process design and re-engineering  • Business impact and gap analysis  • Workshop facilitation  • Workflow automation  • Work calmly in a sometimes ambiguous environment setting  • High level analytical and organisational skills with good attention to detail and ability to think laterally and conceptually  • Highly effective client liaison interpersonal skills  • Demonstrated experience in being able to provide a holistic, human centred approach to the design of digital products, defining their form, behaviour, and content, drawing on a range of skills encompassing user research; interface, interaction and information design; project and time management, technical writing and usability testing.  • Demonstrated experience working in a collaborative environment with high performing teams with high priority deliverables under tight timeframes, and balancing competing priorities.  • Hands on experience in the end to end delivery of major business systems projects  • Highly skilled in the use of BA related tools such as MS Visio and Balsamiq  • Experience identifying and analysing complex legislative and / or regulatory requirements applicable to the relevant industry/work environment and their processes  Desirable Skills and Experience  • High level understanding of SQL  • High level understanding of probability and statistics  • SQL Entity Relationship models  • Use of Power BI data visualisation; python optional  • Data analysis techniques  Personal Qualities required of Candidate  • High level social and written skills with the ability to effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders, including ability to translate complex analytical and technical information into clear and meaningful terms.  • Ability to work in a small team environment with members of diverse cultures and backgrounds and differing skill sets.  • Self-starter with high personal drive and a positive attitude.  • Disciplined and accountable for supporting and maintaining work outputs.  • Behaves in a respectful and professional manner, maintaining high integrity and transparency at all times during the project.  • Excellent problem solver and critical thinker.  • Promotes strong teamwork and collaboration by engaging stakeholders and team members in a favourable light. Deliverables  • High quality user story development  • Execution of required test cases  • High accuracy of Business Requirements related documentation  The successful candidate will be required to be based in Darwin for the duration of the contract.
job_description.200: About Alooba  Hello! We are Alooba - a skills assessment platform for analytics, data science & data literacy. Our customers use us to better understand their people and their job candidates. We are like the ‘Moneyball’ of hiring, helping businesses focus on the things that matter and removing those that don’t. The result? A fairer, cheaper, faster and more accurate hiring process that focuses on the skills needed for the job. Our vision is to create a world where everyone can get the job they deserve. Can you help us achieve that?  Our culture is very important to us. We value no-nonsense people who use common sense to get sh!t done and make it happen. You’ll put our users first, and focus on improving our product and yourself every day. You’ll be able to straddle the need to work very fast and push stuff live, while maintaining a high standard and taking care of the details. You really must care, and this can’t just be ‘a job’ for you. And when work time is over, it’s party time!  Our hiring process always starts with a fair, skills-based quiz on our platform, customised for the role. This will help us both understand your skills, ensure everyone is treated fairly and you’ll get a chance to see what you’ll be building. If you ace the quiz, you’re guaranteed an interview. No matter what happens, you’ll see your score at the end of the quiz.  We are, genuinely, an equal opportunity employer. We also don’t care about things that traditionally appear on job ads like ‘years of experience’, university qualifications etc.  The Role  We currently have a small team of remote developers, however we’re looking to set up our core development office in Sydney at Fishburners. We’re looking for a set of strong senior software engineers to help bring our product to the next level, with a major overhaul of the system architecture, using a service oriented approach and expanding our feature set.  You should have experience building well structured systems and are keen to work in the fast paced startup environment with a drive to do whatever it takes to make it happen. As we are still a small company, you will have a direct impact on the success of the business. You will be the driving force behind the implementation of the features and functionalities you’ll be working on.  You will work directly with the CTO, founder and a small team of developers to build out our assessment platform to be an enterprise grade web application to serve our small but growing user-base spread across the world.  Our application is built with PHP (Laravel/Lumen), PostgreSQL, and React.js and is running on AWS. We are looking for capable people that can help expand our product and build it to scale with our users. You will be responsible for designing, developing, testing and maintaining the application and supporting services.  Responsibilities • Take ownership of features and functionality and see it through from conceptualisation to productionisation • Design and develop highly scalable, and maintainable code • Design and develop system database schemas and RESTful API interfaces • Thoroughly test new functionalities and existing systems • Manage infrastructure as code and utilize CI/CD pipelines  Benefits • Unlimited opportunities to grow your skill set in a fast-paced startup environment. • No corporate bureaucracy, red tape, endless meetings and other big company nonsense - work directly with the CTO and founder on a daily basis. • 5 days paid learning leave per year. • Competitive salary and share options. • The chance to get in early on the next big thing, and leave your legacy.  Must Have Requirements • A can do attitude • Attention to detail • Ability to understand and interpret user needs • Good problem solving skills • Solid understanding of Object-Oriented Programming principles and patterns • Solid understanding of Relational Databases and SQL • Strong communication skills  Nice to Have Requirements • Experience working at a start-up • Working knowledge of PHP • Working knowledge of PostgreSQL • A good understanding of internet security best practises • Experience building RESTful APIs and integrating with 3rd party APIs • Experience with Docker and CI/CD pipelines • Experience managing AWS services • Frontend web development experience using HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and React.js  Job Types: Permanent, Full-time  Salary: $90,000.00 – $140,000.00 per year  Work Remotely: • Temporarily due to COVID-19  COVID-19 Precaution(s): • Remote interview process
job_description.201: • Data curious with a technical mind, including the ability to engage with all levels of our business • Advance excel skills and programming experience developing business intelligence tools, including Microsoft Excel, Python, R, SQL and Power BI. • Strong analytical, problem solving and reporting skills  Salary range from $109,612 plus super  At Hydro Tasmania, we’re leaders in renewable energy, powering Australia with clean hydropower. We really care about making a difference for better, but it’s a big job and we can’t do it alone. Which is right where you come in.  We are passionate about diversity and inclusion and welcome applications from qualified candidates of all ages, cultural backgrounds, abilities and genders. There’s a place for you amongst us to belong, and we welcome you to speak to us about any special requirements you may have to give you the best opportunity for success.  About You  The Data Analyst will be someone who seeks continuous improvement and innovation. You operate with a view to progress the business by acting reasonably and efficiently when dealing with decision making. It's imperative that alongside developed technical ability you also possess a strong ability to communicate effectively to reports, peers and colleagues. You will be able to engage stakeholders at all levels and demonstrated a strong collaborative approach.  A flexible, proactive and self-starter attitude will be essential, along with the ability to work to deadlines you will have a passion for driving best practice and enjoy streamlining processes. Your flair for presenting data in a convincing and easy to understand format assists you in comfortably communicating your work with a broad range of stakeholders. Agile and resilient, you can quickly adapt to shifting priorities. You will ideally hold a degree in a relevant discipline, coupled with several years experience working in a similar role and advance experience with data analysis and exposure to various software programs.  About The Role  You will support the business by providing technical and analytical support to our forecasting activities, delivery of information and data services supporting the business’s financial and operational activities. You’ll work collaboratively with a broad range of stakeholders across our business, establishing and maintaining stakeholder relationships. As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for; • Constructing PowerBI reports and dashboards connected to enterprise data systems to effectively distil data into actionable insights • Utilise data analytics and models to held change ways of working and reduce business waste • Work with Commercial Finance to manage data integrity and add value to financial trading analytics • Constructing PowerBI reports to replace and automate existing excel models • Excellent analysis and problem solving skills • Can do attitude with a willingness to learn • Great communication & attention to detail • Ability to work autonomously and eager to learn from others • Ability to build sound relationships with stakeholders and business partnering experience based on trust  Further information can be found on the attached Position Description: PD - FIN - Data Analyst - HT4 - September 2023.pptx  What You’ll Get Back  This is an opportunity to grow your career and redefine your role in tomorrow’s industry landscape. We offer truly flexible work that suits you, a competitive remuneration package, and the rare opportunity to play a role in Australia’s renewable energy transformation while enjoying the – lifestyle Tasmania has to offer.  If you want to make a difference for better  Please attach your resume and a cover letter outlining what skills and experience you will bring as soon as possible. We will be running an agile recruitment process and will engage with suitable candidates as soon we have reviewed their applications.
job_description.202: You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.  Responsibilities • Collaborate with team leader and senior data scientists, as well as clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, problems and objectives. • Understand data structures and business and extract and integrate required data sources for analysis according to business requirements. • Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions, including undertaking data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, evaluation, deployment, and maintenance. • Collaborate with senior data scientists and team leader and clients to productise and pilot analytical models for production and insight per clients required. • Undertake cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders. • Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes.  Qualifications • Solid background, knowledge and capabilities in statistics, mathematics, computer science, informatics, computing, or closely relevant scientific field. • Experienced in data-driven analytics hands-on experience with deep know-how of predictive modeling, machine learning and data mining, and relevant modeling approaches and algorithms. • Demonstrated capabilities to develop and evaluate statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data-driven solutions to problems in new domains. • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL (data extraction and manipulation), expertise in SAS programming, and software development skills in one to several scripting languages (Python/R). • Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage with a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams. • Demonstrated capabilities to work effectively as a member of a data science project team. • Demonstrated experience for independent problem-solving and self-motivated innovation, education and services.  Powered by Webbtree
job_description.203: Hydro Tasmania has been at the forefront of clean energy innovation for over one hundred years. We are Australia’s largest producer of clean energy – generating hydro and wind power – and the largest water manager in the country. Hydro Tasmania has 55 major dams, operates 30 hydropower stations and has built some of Australia’s largest wind farms. We also sell energy in the National Electricity Market through our retail business Momentum Energy, and deliver our expertise internationally through our consulting business Entura. Hydro Tasmania at a glance * Hydro Tasmania is Australia’s leading renewable energy business. We generate hydropower in Tasmania and trade electricity and energy-related environmental products (such as Renewable Energy Certificates) in the Australian market. * Hydro Tasmania is the largest water manager in Australia. * We own and operate King Island’s Huxley Hill wind farm and two diesel power stations on Bass Strait islands. They’re good examples of innovative use of combined renewable technologies. * We’re owned by the Government of Tasmania and currently employ over 800 people. We have assets worth around $4.8 billion.

job_description.205: APS6 Data Analyst  As an APS 6 Data Analyst, you’ll use your expertise in data analysis, modelling techniques and business knowledge to address business problems and support data-driven decision making.  You’ll use a variety of tools, languages and technical knowledge to research, extract, analyse and interpret data and results with a strong commitment to quality assurance, re-usability and curation of data sources and solutions. You’ll be accountable for organising your workflow and make decisions concerning your work area and team plans. job_description.207: • Analyse data and reporting to identify key insights & trends • Full-time, permanent opportunity (Hybrid working – mix of work from home & the office) • Location Agnostic  The Role  As Senior Analyst, Enablement, you will support the Member Office, principally across all aspects of the Enablement team including remediation, regulatory, people (eg CPS 511 and FAR), finance and audit matters to provide insights based on analysis of reporting and help to ensure all practices are in line with policy and regulatory requirements.  Key Responsibilities • Coordinate and attend regular meetings to discuss remediation, regulatory, finance and audit matters • Support the development and co-ordination of Member Office and in particular the Enablement team key activities and processes. • Analyse data and reporting to identify key insights from a Trustee perspective and assist in sharing such insights to the Board, Committees and other stakeholders. • Collate and support the preparation and review of relevant board and board committee papers and provide appropriate recommendations (under Manager’s guidance) as per Member Office remit. • Build effective relationships with stakeholders, fostering trust and expanding the knowledge and importance of the Trustees’ role. • Support the RSEL Boards to fulfil their fiduciary obligations by advocating for member best interests . • Assist with the preparation of reports as required. • Asist with the setup electronic filing systems and agreement registers to track and manage agreed milestones and/or key dates. • Other responsibilities as directed by the Senior Manager or GM, Enablement.  To Be Successful In This Role You Will Possess • Experience in financial services/ superannuation/ wealth industry • Experience with regulatory requirements as they relate to superannuation funds (including SIS Act, Corporations Act, associated regulations, prudential standards and regulatory guides). • Well developed communication, presentation and influencing skills combined with strong relationship and stakeholder management. • Experience working with remediation, incidents and breaches. • Proficiency in business software use including as a minimum Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word. • Strong attention to detail. • Ability to prioritise and navigate environments undergoing significant change. • Collaborative, engaging and motivated to work in cross functional multi-disciplined teams • Understanding of conflicts of interest management • Exemplary behaviours.  Benefits • In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company • A professional, supportive and friendly culture • A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits  The Business  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The Insignia Financial group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. Over the decades, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX: IFL).  To Apply  Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on “Apply Now.”  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.

We are a diverse and inclusive workplace and understand the importance of flexible working arrangements. Talk to us about what flexibility could look like for you. Hours per fortnight 73.50 (minimum 58.80 hours, by negotiation) Duties The purpose of the role is to:  Contribute to the day-to-day operations of the accounting section as well as undertake complex accounting tasks such as financial reporting requirements, including financial statements and taxation reporting. Contribute to the development and application of policies, procedures, guidelines, and systems to support internal controls, taxation compliance and external financial reporting for the Department; and  Provide advice, analysis and technical support on contemporary financial management and processes and maintain effective relationships with Business Units and external stakeholders. Essential Requirements Pre-employment  The Head of the State Service has determined that the person nominated for this position is to satisfy a pre-employment check before taking up the appointment, promotion, or transfer. The following check is to be conducted: Conviction check for Crimes involving Dishonesty.  Desirable Requirements  A Bachelor's Degree in business or similar relevant to the duties to be undertaken, as provided by a university with membership of the Australian Society of CPAs or the Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand or other professional accounting body. job_description.210: About The Role  In this role, you will become a trusted and relied upon financial analyst whose primary objective is to elevate the team's expertise in regulatory financial modelling. By aiming to foster a deeper understanding of financial regulations and their impact on the organisation's operations and overall financial position. This capability empowers the team to offer invaluable insights into the commercial and financial dimensions of regulatory compliance, ultimately enhancing the quality of regulatory reporting and decision-making processes.  Concurrently, there is a focus on enhancing the team's corporate and financial modelling, a pivotal component in supporting TasNetworks strategic decision-making. Financial models serve as indispensable tools for forecasting, conducting scenario analyses, and evaluating the financial ramifications of strategic objectives. Additionally, the role provides support for vital team-managed processes, encompassing treasury and debt management, and extending assistance to the Investment Governance Committee, which oversees the businesses major investment decisions. This also includes creating, reviewing and refining models using a DCF approach for potential new deals for the business.  Furthermore, data gathering and validation are central to the role's responsibilities and are essential for providing meaningful and insightful analysis.  Lastly, the role encompasses the development and upkeep of a comprehensive long-term financial model, which serves as a strategic compass for long-term financial planning and decision-making.  About Us  At TasNetworks, we are proud to be the leading provider of electricity transmission and distribution services in Tasmania. With our unwavering commitment to safety, reliability, and customer satisfaction, we deliver a superior electricity supply to over 285,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers. Our core values and forward-thinking approach make us the trusted brand for all your energy needs.  By joining TasNetworks, you will experience the difference of a company that puts customers first, values safety above all, unifies in the face of challenges, and embraces diversity and forward thinking. Together, we are powering a bright future for Tasmania.  About You  To be successful in this role, it is imperative to embody TasNetworks' Core Capabilities, which form the cornerstone of all positions within the organisation.  Having a solid foundation in business, commerce, accounting, or a related professional field, coupled with a demonstrated period of relevant experience, is essential.  Proficiency in Excel, including the ability to construct intricate financial models, is crucial. Moreover, a deep understanding of valuation techniques pertaining to the evaluation of future investment opportunities, including mergers and acquisitions, is highly valuable.  Success in this role hinges on possessing robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, allowing for the transformation of data and complex analysis into comprehensible insights that facilitate informed decision-making processes. This also includes the ability to summarise data efficiently in order to present to various stakeholders across the business, including executives and board members.  What's on offer  This is a full time permanent opportunity based at our Lenah Valley Office in the South of the state. At TasNetworks we want to power a bright future for our people, our community and our customers. We offer a supportive work environment where safety is at the heart of everything we do. We offer our team excellent benefits including • Great professional development opportunities • Flexible work arrangements • Paid volunteer days • Free onsite parking • Onsite gyms (or gym rebate if unavailable) • All the equipment you'll need to be successful  We are proud to be work180 accredited, check us out  How to apply  If this role and working at TasNetworks is of interest we look forward to hearing from you. TasNetworks is an Equal Opportunity employer and is committed to responding to every applicant. We encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and mature aged people. Please ensure you attach a cover letter outlining how your skills and experience are aligned with this role, and an up to date resume. For more information about this opportunity and to acquire a position description, please click  Applications close 11:59pm Sunday 15th October 2023  For further information about the role, please contact  To be eligible for this position, you are required to have Australian citizenship, permanent residence or a current valid visa that allows you to fulfil the requirements of this role.

This firm provides financial research data, insights, and trading analysis to corporate clients in investment firms. During your Financial Analyst/Trader Internship, you will work with some of Australia's most experienced finance executives. Get one-to-one career guidance from leading finance managers too during your 12 weeks of Internship. Financial Analyst/Trader Internship Roles and Responsibilities?  Analyse global equity, foreign exchange and derivatives markets. Rotate through our divisions of responsibility and provide ideas to grow and improve the business. Research, propose ideas and solutions, and present findings to the Senior Management Team. Assist in creating performance reports, specifically for financial reporting. What you will learn during the Financial Analyst/Trader Internship?  Essential Financial Market Software Systems used for financial analysis projects. Hands-on finance experience with exposure in the understanding of analytics and reporting. Skills in Project Management to assist in data and analytics reporting projects.
