job_description.228: AVBC, through its Sustainable Practice Committee, works to achieve a coherent approach on post-qualification practice matters including collection of data for evidence-based regulation and quality assurance.  The Challenge  Currently, each veterinary jurisdiction in Australia and New Zealand has its own separate registration database, resulting in  • Duplication and multiplication of effort and expenses,  • Insufficient resources to recruit specialised technical support for a future-proof, secure, robust database,  • The inability for a member of the public to find a general or specialist registered veterinarian without having to search several (or all) of the individual state and territory databases,  • Extra administrative burden on veterinarians wishing to move between jurisdictions of primary practice, and  • Inability to consistently monitor workforce trends, carry out forecasting and develop evidence-based regulation.  Desired Outcome  AVBC aims to create a single national database of registered veterinary professionals, which will build cohesion and consolidate professional standards pertaining to registration while data only relevant to individual veterinary boards is locally retained. The Business Analyst will work closely with AVBC personnel and be responsible for interpreting and translating stakeholder priorities into a blueprint for this new national veterinary database.  Methodology  These services may include zoom workshops, eliciting and documenting business requirements, writing user stories and acceptance criteria, developing system documentation, process mapping, planning and co-ordination, and supporting business process change. This role will analyse and interpret barriers to progress, and present solutions.  Working Arrangements  Business Analyst is a 6-month to 12-month position and flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.  Role Accountabilities and QualificationsKey Responsibilities  • Analyse and document the existing business process using a range of analysis tools and techniques (including BPMN). Use case scenarios.  • Create and refine user stories/personas in conjunction with the product owner and stakeholders.  • Facilitate workshops and engage with stakeholders to understand application requirements and elicit functional and non-functional requirements.  • Document process models, detailing current state processes, and develop and propose future state processes.  • Help to identify manual and inefficient processes and seek to solve and innovate to make these more efficient.  • Perform gap analysis by comparing current capabilities to stakeholder requirements.  • Ensure all documents are written using clear and concise language, and clearly represent identified needs, opportunities, and processes.  • Conduct research and analysis of systems in similar sectors.  • Identify project delivery dependencies, issues and risks, assist with mitigation strategies, and escalate where  necessary.  Highly Desirable  • 3 years of Business Analyst experience  • Demonstrated ability to facilitate workshops effectively to elicit requirements and develop and implement new processes.  • Proven track record in communicating requirements both verbally and through user stories. Requirements should have logical and clear acceptance criteria that are easily understood by developers, testers, and stakeholders.  • Knowledge of BPMN software and drawing tools (e.g., MS Visio) and an understanding of professional regulation/legal processes would be highly regarded.  Person specification  Applicants must have the right to work in Australia.  Education and training  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, or a related area, plus at least three years of relevant experience in Business Analysis.  Demonstrated Skills and Experience  • Demonstrated experience in business analysis, data analysis and reporting in a complex organisational environment.  • Experience in dealing with a wide range of people in a professional manner.  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to relate well to a range of people.  • Ability to work autonomously.  • Excellent self-management skills, including time management.  • Strong oral and written communication skills.  • Excellent IT systems and applications skills including experience using MS Visio.  • Experience with, or an understanding of, regulated professions would be helpful.  Personal Qualities  • Initiative.  • Commitment to providing an excellent client-oriented service.  • Commitment to self-development and improvement.  • Integrity and the ability to maintain confidentiality.  • Methodical, co-operative and flexible.  • Willingness to work in a small team environment.  • A sense of humour and the ability to take and accept responsibility for actions.  If you are interested in this position, please send a CV and cover letter addressing the key role responsibilities to comms@avbc.asn.au
job_description.229: Company Description  illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion leverages its consumer and commercial credit registries to provide end-to-end customer management solutions to clients in the financial services, telecommunications, utilities and government sectors.  Job Description  Your new role and how you’ll make a difference  Are you ready for your next career move in finance and want autonomy and freedom to develop your experience quickly across all areas of the P&L.  FP&A at illion operates through an integrated business partner approach, working with the business to provide commercial insight into historical and future results that will enable the management team to make better business decisions. This is done through closely collaborating with business partners to understand the core drivers of business performance and develop relevant metrics and timely reports that measure, monitor and report on performance.  This key role within finance will also work with financial and non-financial systems (e.g. TM1, Great Plains, Salesforce and proprietary systems) to create integrated KPI and finance reporting for management and the board. You will need to be willing to get your hands dirty in systems interrogation and report building to be successful.  The value-add things you’ll be doing • Support the Head of FP&A and GM Finance by working with key stakeholders to understand key business drivers of sales, revenue and opex and use this knowledge to identify future opportunities and issues so that appropriate action can be taken in advance • Identify trends and model future impacts and outcomes • Ad-hoc financial analysis where required • KPI reporting and interpretation as leading and lagging indicators of financial performance • Sales and Revenue reporting by Customer & Product • Assist the business to understand and interpret the financial information in the system and reports to enable management to plan, evaluate, control and enhance performance of their areas of responsibility in the business. • Support the business in the use of the system through developing relevant, system driven dashboard and management accounting reports that can be readily accessed and understood by the business managers. • Preparation of the monthly management pack.  Qualifications  The experience and qualifications you’ll need to be successful • Cognos TM1 experience highly regarded • Budgeting & Forecasting Experience • Great Plains Experience • Salesforce.com experience • Budgeting & Forecasting Experience • Sales and technology business partnering • 2+ years business partnering/finance experience with exposure to planning and forecasting • CPA, CA or equivalent • Cognos TM1 experience or similar highly regarded • Able to explain complex finance concepts and data in simple, commercial terms • Advanced excel skills including financial modelling • Ability to analyse large data sets and translate the data into meaningful messages, action items and communications (verbal, written and numerical)  Additional Information  Some of our perks • Flexibility and Remote Working Options • Gifted Leave, Purchased Leave, Public Holiday Swap and Paid Volunteer Leave • Paid Parental Leave • Novated Leasing and Corporate Discounts (ie. Health Insurance) • Education Assistance and dedicated time for professional development as part of your role • Free Employee Assistance Programme, Free Flu Shots and Subsidised Gym Memberships.  illion’s values  Wonder what if  We wonder on many levels. About ideas. And about how others see them. We listen with curiosity. Obsess the numbers. And embrace new ways to make data, make a difference  We’re good eggs  Everything we do is built on integrity. We hold ourselves to high standards. And higher principles. We act with good intentions. Taking every opportunity to be that little bit better.  Human. Kind  People are the hart of our products, processes and culture. Our relationships are a gift. We’re inclusive. Measuring the impact of our actions on other’s first. Kindness and humanity prevail.  We all add up  We work wonders when we work together. Our diverse perspectives and backgrounds make us greater than the sum of our parts. We’re one team, where every single one of us counts.  How to Apply  To apply, please click “Apply Now” button and we will be in touch shortly.  Due to the sensitive data that illion works with, employment at illion is subject to employees having full working rights for Australia and/or New Zealand and successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.  Here at illion, we value diversity and inclusion and believe that we are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. By joining illion you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates a diversity of cultures, skill sets, educations and opinions. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.
job_description.230: If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.  What's in it for you?  As our Data Analytics Associate, you'll build our analytics capabilities for our digital audit and innovation initiatives. You will be using your data analytics and ETL capabilities to support external financial audits, whilst also working with the wider assurance digital team to build new solutions and transform existing capabilities. In return for helping us build a better working world you can expect excellent career opportunities within a dynamic and collaborative environment.  You will deliver results by using data analytics to deal with large, disparate volumes of data to assist your client group gain critical insights. Your ability to evaluate, identify and extract data from complex IT systems will ensure success in this role. You will have a chance to work with the ASX top 50 listed clients and the latest data systems to enjoy a truly rewarding and successful career at EY.  Some everyday responsibilities include: • Helping clients to identify and extract required data from complex IT systems • Be first point of contact for your projects and providing guidance to other team members • Using analytical and visualisation software to access, transform, integrate, analyse and visualise client data to help solve real problems and identify opportunities through identification of anomalies and unusual patterns and trends in data • Delivering results by using automated data analytic solutions to deal with large, disparate volumes of data, to gain critical insights quickly • Assisting in the development of additional analytic capabilities within the Assurance Digital team, including building tools around emerging technologies (e.g. blockchain, cyber, artificial intelligence)  What we're looking for  We are looking for people with a mix of Business, Accounting and Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) skills. Here's our 'wish list' but don't worry if you don't tick all the boxes. We're interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go. • Tertiary education qualification(s) in Business, IT or STEM related disciplines • A minimum of 1 years' experience in a data analytics role • A passion for working with data and learning new methodologies, applications and skills for analysis • Experience with using Alteryx, Monarch, Tableau, Spotfire or PowerBI to access, transform, integrate, analyse and visualise client data • Experience with Databases such as Microsoft SQL or Oracle SQL • Ability to adapt to a constantly changing and growing business environment  What we can offer you • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at • Discover how, when and where you can work at • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at • Understand how our benefits can support you at  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders - past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at  Apply now... we're over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we're ready to welcome yours.  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we're committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The minimum salary for this role is $78,000 inclusive of superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.  The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.  EY | Building a better working world  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.
job_description.231: Firstly, what we offer you!  Highly flexible work environment (including WFH)  Store discounts, and free 7-Eleven Coffee  Bonus & incentive program  15 weeks paid parental leave  2 days paid volunteer leave per year  Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning  Social club, Open committee with regular events  We are human centred organisation and our people are at the core of everything we do. This is a true place to learn and grow whilst developing your career.  Through our agile structure, we enable our employees to drive their own work with a lot of autonomy, and have fun along the way!  The role  As a Data Analyst in our Supply Chain Logistics chapter, you will utilise your Power BI experience to create high quality reports, and provide insights to drive continuous improvement of our complex supply chain solution. • Create Power BI reports • Facilitate the connection of data sources • Recommend best practice report building and inform tools to generate insights • Drive cultural change on the value of quality reporting • Provide insights and analytics to optimise supply chain solutions • Drive a continuous improvement culture  What’s in your toolkit? • Experience working with Power BI and sound analytical sk • End to end supply chain knowledge, including an understanding of supply planning, logistics operations and inventory control • Ability to build positive relationships with internal & external stakeholders • Strong communicatio skills and abaility to deliver complex messages and reporting insights • Experience in a complex retail environment would be adventageous  Don’t worry if you don’t tick all the box’s for this role, we encourage you to still apply.  At 7-Eleven our people are at the heart of everything we do. The rich diversity that every individual brings makes the ordinary moments extraordinary for everyone.  We are committed to creating a workplace that fosters inclusion and celebrates diversity, where every single 7-Eleven team member feels heard, valued, and respected no matter who you are or what diverse characteristics reflect your unique identity.  To find out more about our current opportunities follow us on LinkedIn or view our careers page.
job_description.232: Work options: Hybrid  The purpose of Customer Insights and Reporting team is to support the entire OnePass business by enabling more sophisticated uses of data across OnePass and our partnering Divisions. This team is responsible for establishing a self-service reporting capability within the business, for designing, building and maintaining reports to support management and operational decision making, and for responding to ad-hoc analysis needs. This team is also responsible for designing advanced analytical solutions to business or customer problems and working with domain teams to deploy these solutions.  What You’ll Be Doing  We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting complex data sets to extract valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making. Your expertise in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and data visualisation will contribute to the success of OnePass by identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven initiatives and deliver actionable recommendations. The ideal candidate is passionate about data, possesses strong analytical skills, and is comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment.  Key Duties And Deliverables • Acquire and cleanse large and diverse data sets from various sources to ensure data integrity and quality. • Apply statistical techniques and data mining methods to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets. • Conduct exploratory data analysis and identify trends, patterns, and correlations. • Create clear and concise visualisations, dashboards, and reports to present data-driven insights to stakeholders. • Develop interactive dashboards using data visualisation tools to facilitate understanding and exploration of data. • Collaborate with team members to create automated reports and streamline data analysis processes. • Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the effectiveness of business processes and strategies. • Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations based on data analysis findings. • Work closely with stakeholders to define and track performance metrics aligned with business objectives. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements and provide analytical support. • Translate complex data findings into actionable insights and recommendations. • Contribute to strategic planning by leveraging data insights to identify business opportunities and risks. • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with data governance policies. • Develop and implement data validation procedures to identify and resolve data quality issues. • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in data analytics and data management.  Key Relationships  Reports To  Reporting and Analytics Lead  What you will need • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline. • Proven work experience as a Data Analyst or similar role in a product-driven organization (3+ years) • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data querying from databases. • Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. • Experience with statistical analysis, A/B testing, and data modelling techniques. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail. • Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences. • Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence decision-making. • Familiarity with product management methodologies and product development lifecycle. • Knowledge of web analytics and tag management tools (e.g., Google Analytics/Adobe/Tealium) Equipment / Technology used • Corporate Office desktop operating environments • Snowflake • Kafka • Google Analytics • Power BI • Tealium • Confluence & JIRA • Miro & Murali  Why OneDigital? • Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things. • You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life. • Culture of comradery and collaboration - OneTeam • Plus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed. • We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.  Team Benefits – just to name a few!  To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include: • Access to the latest technologies • An annual budget for your learning and development (this includes learning of your choice, certifications and more) • Extended parental leave (16 weeks for primary carers), and paid volunteer days • Flexible working – we balance working together with working flexibly • People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small • Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards.  Next steps  If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date.
job_description.233: About Us : Renaissance Info Systems is a technology and digital recruitment agency, connecting contract and permanent professionals with clients across Asia-Pacific.  We aim to differentiate ourselves through our level of responsiveness, and our understanding that comes from being an IT recruitment agency from the IT Industry. Our recruiters balance sophisticated and simple inter-personal techniques to assure a strong candidate network.  Know More : http://www.reninfo.com.au  Job Title: Data Analyst/Data Engineer  Essential Requirements/Key Selection Criteria • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a Data related field, and at least 1 years of relevant experience in data analysis, data migration, or IT and data projects. • Intermediate skills and knowledge in interpreting data and migrating documents through following set processes. • Demonstrated ability to understand and execute an existing process whilst monitoring or reporting progress of an activity, as well as identifying and escalating any issues or improvements.. • Demonstrated understanding of SharePoint and document version control, SQL, ETL and Data Migration processes • Strong interpersonal skills including oral and written communication skills. • Strong attention to detail, initiative and the ability to work unsupervised, working on large projects with multiple work streams and deadlines.  Able to respond quickly to change and adopt a flexible/ innovative approach to problems and opportunities  Regards,  Reshu Seth  E: Reshu@reninfo.com.au  M: +61 0478 487 026
job_description.234: Strategic Intelligence Analyst and Data Custodian, Forensics and Information Management Branch • One (1) ongoing role in the Forensics and Information Management Branch, Corporate Services Division • Salary $105,479 plus 11% superannuation, VPS Grade 5 • Based in Melbourne CBD or Ballarat, with flexibility to work from home  What we offer  The State Revenue Office is the Victorian Government's revenue management agency, administering a range of taxes, duties, levies, grants and subsidies.  We aim to develop our people to achieve great outcomes for the Victorian community. We offer flexible working arrangements and a workplace culture that is rewarding and productive, where contributions are valued and recognised, expectations are clear, and treatment is fair and equitable. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing an inclusive, accessible and safe working environment.  Find out more about working at the SRO at sro.vic.gov.au/careers, or via our LinkedIn page.  The opportunity  The Strategic Intelligence Analyst and Data Custodian is responsible for undertaking complex research and analysis projects in areas relating to compliance with State Legislation, organisational compliance, strategic and tactical intelligence, and policy development. The position requires a person with a record of achievement in complex data analysis in the public or private sector.  Reporting to the Compliance Analysis and Data Quality Manager, you will be responsible for: • Undertaking high level analysis and research tasks relating to organisational compliance and revenue issues and prepare associated research papers and reports. • Consolidating data inputs and the receipt and dissemination of data to internal and external stakeholders. • Producing daily and monthly branch and divisional reports and monitoring and analysis of revenue collections against forecasts. • Providing expert analytical advice to senior management on revenue collections and matters under investigation. • Providing information to Treasury and other internal and external stakeholders relating to revenue collection matters and providing timely and appropriate responses to information/reports sought.  Who we are looking for  To be successful in this role, you will have: • Demonstrated record of achievement as a senior analyst, preferably in a tax or revenue field, enabling the translation of data insights into actionable business strategies. • Demonstrated ability to analyse complex datasets, extract meaningful insights, and make data-driven decisions through advanced analytical techniques. • Profound understanding and application of statistical methodologies and techniques, and the ability to apply them effectively to solve real-world problems using specialised analytical software packages. • Demonstrated ability to effectively plan, coordinate and manage work activities both in a team and independently with minimal direction. • Strong verbal and written communication skills to present findings, explain methodologies, and collaborate with cross-functional teams.  How to apply  Submit an application via the ‘Apply now' button by 11.59pm on 24 September 2023. You will need to upload a cover letter addressing Key Selection Criteria 1, 2 and 3 in the position description and a resume.  More information  You can find out more about this role via the position description. You can also contact James Harrison, Compliance Analysis and Reporting Manager, Forensics and Information Management Branch on 03 9628 6863.  If you need a copy of this advertisement in an accessible format, email HRServices@sro.vic.gov.au.  Please note, as part of our selection process, we conduct pre-appointment checks including those related to references, identity, qualifications, work history, work visa, and police record history.  This role may be subject to a probation period.
job_description.235: Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences (Science & Technology) SEEK's portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities.  We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation. Life at SEEK SEEK's purpose is at the centre of everything we do.  Our SEEK , which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity.  SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Place to Work 2023 In Tech (third year in a row). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.  Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues.  The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting. Job Description About the role  As a Senior Data Scientist you will provide technical and project leadership to an established Machine Learning / Data Science capability driving global SEEK growth.  You will add value by creating data analytics and machine learning assets that influence or automate important business decisions, by bringing new technical and delivery capability to the team, by breaking down big rocks into small rocks in Agile fashion to enable team productivity, and by liaising with Product Managers, Engineers, and partners company-wide to remove impediments.  Your breadth and depth of expertise will enable your highly engaged colleagues to grow, and your experience will help the team understand the best time to use and not use each capability. You are motivated by science, i.e.  , you:  think of the simplest practical model that closes a knowledge gap; design experiments; learn from the data; provide predictions that matter; and refine your models and hypothesis as needed. You are continuously learning and growing and so is the team. You will demonstrate success through enriching SEEK's ability to make great data-driven decisions quickly.  You will consistently demonstrate technical leadership that advances the team's ability to deploy state-of-the-art decision capabilities that produce great outcomes for the health of the jobs marketplace. The Team  TheArtificial Intelligence Platform Services(AIPS) is structured into cross-disciplinary squad with members from Data Science, Strategy and Engineering who work together to research, design, build and support end-to-end machine learning based products delivering direct value to hirers and job seekers. AIPS has a matrix structure where your direct line manager will act as a coach and technical mentor, but your day-to-day activity will be determined by the squad priorities  Key accountabilities include: Forming clear data addressable problem statements from current business problems Gathering, validating, and understanding data relevant to the problem statement Designing and building data transformation pipelines and machine learning algorithms to solve the business problem Working with product management and other business stakeholders to review and iterate data products to fit emerging market trends Evangelising appropriate ML methods and explaining them, and their associated benefits and limitations to team members from Engineering and Strategy  Qualifications Skills and experience A MSc or PhD qualification in Computer Science, Computational Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field  Professional experience in one of the following programming languages:Large scale development using Python, R, SAS, Go, C/C++, or Java using Git, CI/CD, etc.  Strong background in: Statistics and Machine Learning Algorithms and data structures  Good communication and interpersonal skills Experience with Agile methodology Depth in Natural Language Processing, Optimisation, Discrete Event Simulation, or another specialised Data Science domain  Additional Information Perks and benefits Permanent Perks  At SEEK we offer: Annual Performance Bonus Plan Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role. Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave Support for parents with 14 weeks paid primary carers leave and 2 weeks paid leave for partners The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year  Here at SEEK we pride ourselves on harbouring a flexible and inclusive working environment.  Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist. For this role, only those candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered.  SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees. Find out the average salary for a Data Scientist acrossAustralia #J-18808-Ljbffr
job_description.236: See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you!  At Iress, we make things happen  We believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. More than 10,000 businesses and 500,000 people use our software, from the world’s most iconic financial services brands to advice firms of all sizes, banks, insurers, investment managers, traders and brokers. Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 2,000 people across Australia, The United Kingdom, Africa, Canada, France, New Zealand and Asia.  Build your career at Iress!  Ensuring internal and external compliance of third party exchange and contributed data is a top priority.  The Goals Of The Data Compliance Team Are To • Set the standards and drive changes across the Iress products to be in compliance. • Facilitate the growth of Iress revenue • Support the business with regards to data contracts, markets data cost trends etc • Minimise any monetary or reputational risk to Iress.  Some of the awesome things you’ll be involved with: • Driving changes to process and internal systems to ensure entitlement, royalties billing and reporting is compliant • Prepare monthly exchange reporting and submit in a timely manner. Ensuring Iress maintains a strong relationship with third party data providers. Update process procedure documents when reporting policies changes. • Conduct regular royalties billing reviews to ensure the correct invoicing and payments for products and services that Iress and Clients are using. • Ensuring consistency and standardisation of naming conventions across data products, entitlement and billing systems. • Assessing the impact of monthly exchange product/licensing/royalties billing changes and communicating with internal stakeholders to drive changes where appropriate  What You Will Bring • 4+ years’ experience with exchange/data vendor management or data compliance • A university graduate with a first or second degree in financial services area or equivalent in industry experience • Understanding of market data terms and common policies • Prior experience with Iress products a plus  Why work with us? • 8 additional paid days per year to extend your weekends • Hybrid working • Generous cash bonus for every successful referral • Annual Profit Share when Iress meets its annual profit targets • Starting school leave - 8.5 days of leave to assist your children with the transition to school • Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work • 3 days’ paid leave per year to participate in charity initiatives • Discounted health insurance premiums • Access to learning and development programs through Udemy  Iress is committed to fostering a welcoming and inclusive culture. We strongly believe that diversity is what makes our teams and our products succeed. Our people have different experiences, skills, perspectives and beliefs and everyone’s uniqueness is valued and celebrated.  Our hiring decisions are never based on sexual orientation, race, gender identity, religion, disability, citizenship, marital or family status and age. Even if you feel you don’t meet all of the requirements of the role, we would still like to hear from you!  We’re also proud to be globally recognised as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer that promotes and supports all women in the workplace.  For more information about what we do, our people and values, pl  ease visit our website - https://www.iress.com/join-us/careers/  Employment Type  Employee  Time Type  Full time
job_description.237: About The Role  An exciting opportunity to join BOQ as a Senior Data Management Analyst during our transformation journey. By joining the digital bank of the future, you will be able to make a difference with integrity and empathy, overseeing the successful and effective analysis of the data quality capability adding significant value to our organisation.  As a Senior Data Management Analyst, you will be working closely with the Group Technology Team that consists of Business Analysts, Developers and Testers. Reporting to the Manager of Data Management, you will be responsible for supporting the execution of data initiatives that enable our bankers to have access to trusted, governed and easily available data which supports their needs.  In this role you will ensure data management practices are conducted in line with statutory, regulatory, audit and risk expectations. Furthermore, you will support operations of the Data Management Framework which includes data principles, policy, standards, and guidelines ensuring their pragmatic and beneficial application to data platforms and the wider data ecosystem. You will also be involved in conducting awareness and training initiatives to create a measurable uplift in data literacy and data handling skills across the bank.  About You  As an experienced data management and analytics professional, you will be a collaborative outcome and people focussed individual who thrives on working in a fast-paced environment. You will have 6+ years of experience working in enterprise data platforms (Data Warehousing, Data Analytics Data Governance or BI) with an ability to manipulate and analyse large amounts of data using SQL queries and map data from source to target.  Alongside your experience working with third party vendors and developing lasting relationships to ensure success, you will have a strong understanding and practical experience in data quality, data management/governance frameworks and methodologies.  About Us  BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.  BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.  BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.  Since 2021 BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).  Our Benefits • Flexible working arrangements • Discounted financial products • Salary sacrificing options • Paid parental leave with no minimum • Paid volunteer days • Purchase annual leave • Discounted private health insurance plan • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) • 5 employee diversity network groups focusing on: First Nations Reconciliation Council, Proudly ME (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career • BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index  How To Apply  To apply for this role please apply via our Careers Page.  The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.  If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.  Please no agency applications.
job_description.238: MECCA Brands is experiencing growing demand for customer data analysis to support the delivery of our long-term digital roadmap. As a result, there is an exciting opportunity for a customer focused and analytically minded Customer Data Analyst to join our team as we build out personalisation, digital engagement and behavioural marketing at scale.  The Role You Could Play  Reporting to the Customer Data Enablement Lead, the Senior Customer Data Analyst needs to deeply understand the power of data to lead the delivery of considered customer data solutions as part of personalisation initiatives and larger strategic programs of work. We are looking for a passionate data nerd well-versed in using data to transform customer interactions in marketing, sales and digital experience and familiar with marketing technology transformation, automation and process change within an organisation.  As a key member of the team, you will be working on a variety of analytical challenges in support of enabling omnichannel customer experience initiatives. You will leverage data from internal and external sources to build and measure segmentations, find groups of customers to grow, reactivate or acquire for the business and close the loop through the enablement of customer journeys and test & learn initiatives.  As a key member of the team, you will contribute to the development of data capabilities and products that enable omnichannel customer experience initiatives. You will collaborate extensively with internal teams to gather requirements and utilise your understanding of MECCA's data to advise on and develop solutions to grow existing customers and reactivate and acquire for the business.  What You Will Bring  You will utilise your expertise in data analysis, to shape the use of customer data at MECCA to deliver value to business and our customers. As we are going through a period of transformation, including continuous improvement of a new tech stack, you will need to be passionate about new technologies and willing to learn and apply new data manipulation and analysis tools. As the team grows, you will be passionate about empowering others with data and driving this through coaching and documentation.  You will also need to have: • Strong experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in Retail • Experience in managing marketing technology platforms to deliver personalisation • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to explain complex information in simple terms • Strong SQL skills and manipulating datasets • Ability to deliver ideas from inception to execution, particularly as part of a cross-functional and collaborative team • Adaptability and proven ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment  Your Life At MECCA  Whilst we are singularly focused on our #CustomerFirst mantra, we know that wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team that is guided by our MECCA values and motivated each and every day to be solutions focused, innovative, collaborative and adaptable, and have a bit of fun along the way!  Some of our other team member benefits include: • Professional development programs and first-class digitised learning offering • Health and well-being initiatives • Reward and recognition programs • Access to bonus and incentive programs • Quarterly product allowance • Unlimited 40% discount  There are also so many other ways in which you’ll be made to feel part of the MECCA story as we love to celebrate, surprise and delight our team along the way.  To learn more about life at MECCA Brands, follow us on LinkedIn at MECCA Brands or @lifeatmecca and for all current opportunities, visit www.mecca.com.au/careers
job_description.239: Data Scientist • Multiple roles available • $81,000 - $153,500 p.a + 15.4% Super • Additional Leave and other benefits available Our Client is a Federal Government entity seeking a number of data scientist professionals and Leaders to join their team, working across numerous unique projects that can result in impactful changes. • PLEASE NOTE: the successful candidate must be an Australian Citizen and able to obtain a Baseline Clearance if successful.  Your New Role As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for analysing high volumes of unstructured and structured data and applying advanced data science techniques to extract valuable insights and you may develop junior staff in their capabilities at the EL1 and 2 levels. Conducting and developing highly specialised analytic solutions by utilising various statistical, machine learning and computational methods.  Key Skills • Experience in R or Python (potentially consider other programming languages) • Experience and technical proficiency in one or more of the following fields: machine learning, graph analytic, natural language processing, computer vision, data visualisation, advanced statistical modelling and artificial intelligence. Interested to learn more? Please hit APPLY to submit a copy of your updated CV, or reach out to Simon at with a copy of your resume, to discuss the role in more detail.  Don't tick all the boxes but believe this could be the next step in your career? Great Please apply and we look forward to seeing your resume. We don't expect you to tick every box, as the next step in your career should also provide you with an opportunity to learn new skills too At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background. skills Python - R - Machine Learning - Data Science qualifications • Relevant IT Qualifications - Relevant IT Experience education Associate Degree/Diploma
job_description.240: Our client is a leading Australian electricity retailer that is focused on accelerating Australia progression to 100% renewable energy. They are transforming the way Australian businesses buy their electricity. They have set out to find new and better ways to bring their customers’ energy costs down and put the power back into business’ hands.  Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to: • Managing of incoming analysis queries; • Extracting data from different sources; • Analysing and interpreting large datasets to identify key metrics and support customer Proposals; • Supporting in providing the right solutions to the customers through analysis of their historical consumption patterns; • Being in regular contact with Account Managers and Sales staff; • Being up to date with changes in the energy market including forward and spot price movements, supply/demand fundamentals, network tariffs, regulations; • Developing actionable insights, reports and proposals to communicate to stakeholders in a precise and compelling manner; • Providing accurate data and liaising effectively with external or internal stakeholders (i.e. Business Development Managers, Sales staff, Operations team, Finance team) as required; • Leveraging of feedback provided by internal stakeholders to develop new reports and tools; • Working with the team on continuous improvement process and reporting outputs.  About you: • Tertiary qualification in relevant field (eg Finance, Engineering, Economics, Business or Mathematics); • Previous experience with C&I energy users is preferable; • Understanding of wholesale energy markets is highly regarded; • Advanced Microsoft Office particularly Excel; • Analytical mindset and results orientated; • Strong organisational and time management skills; • Collaborative approach and experience in working efficiently within cross-functional teams; • Flexible, with a proactive attitude.  Benefits within the company: • Join a rapidly expanding business where your contributions matter. • Embrace a 50/50 flexible work environment that promotes work-life balance. • Unlock opportunities for internal career growth and enjoy the benefit of an employment assistance package.  If you are keen to join a growing business where you can really make a difference, learn, and progress, this role is for you. We are looking for individuals who are energetic and positive.  Sounds like you are the perfect match? If you're interested, please hit “APPLY”.
job_description.241: Job No.: 655946  Location: The Alfred Centre  Employment Type: Full-time  Duration: 12-month fixed-term appointment  Remuneration: $78,255 - $89,888 pa HEW Level 05 (plus 17% employer superannuation) • Amplify your impact at a world top 50 University • Join our inclusive, collaborative community • Be surrounded by extraordinary ideas - and the people who discover them  At Monash , work feels different. There’s a sense of belonging, from contributing to something groundbreaking – a place where great things happen.  We value difference and diversity , and welcome and celebrate everyone's contributions, lived experience and expertise. That’s why we champion an inclusive and respectful workplace culture where everyone is supported to succeed.  Learn more about Monash .  The Opportunity  We have an exciting opportunity for a Technical Officer to join the Department of Neuroscience at Monash University.  You will be responsible for neuroimaging research and collaborating with a dynamic team of experts including clinical, neuroscience, image analysis, radiology, informatics, and experimental experts. The Technical Officer will provide data analysis and curation, machine learning model development, quality assurance, and support for an array of clinical neuroscience research endeavours focused on neurodegenerative diseases.  The successful candidate will have demonstrable data handling and processing experience (preferably in neuroimaging or other 3D/4D biological or imaging data types) and should possess a tertiary qualification in software or biomedical engineering, computer science, data science, neuroscience, or a computation-focused field. Experience utilising machine learning and deep learning algorithms in research or industry, particularly in healthcare will be highly desirable.  Diversity is one of our greatest strengths at Monash. We encourage applications from First Nations people, culturally and linguistically diverse people, people with disabilities, neurodiverse people, and people of all genders, sexualities, and age groups.  Join the pursuit of our purpose to build a better future for ourselves and our communities – #ChangeIt with us.  Monash avidly supports flexible and hybrid working arrangements. We have a range of policies in place enabling staff to combine work and personal commitments more easily .  Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to How to apply for Monash Jobs '.  Enquiries  Ian Harding, Research Fellow - Department of Neuroscience, +61 3 9905 9283  Position Description  Closing Date  Friday 27 October 2023, 11:55pm AEDT  At Monash University, the health, safety and wellbeing of our staff, students and visitors is our top priority. In accordance with the Pandemic Orders issued by the Victorian Government Health Minister, we require all staff working or placed in healthcare facilities to be fully vaccinated (boosted) against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine in order to attend these locations.  For the latest information on COVID-19 at Monash, please visit our website .  Supporting a diverse workforce  Monash University recognises that its Australian campuses are located on the unceded lands of the people of the Kulin nations, and pays its respects to their elders, past and present. job_description.242: Overview The Insights & Analytics Lead delivers enterprise-wide reporting and analytics solutions and leads the team of insight analyst and data scientist who will report to them. This role interprets requirements from clients and business users to design and develop insightful analytics and reporting solutions, as well as providing expertise and guidance to internal and external clients in large analytical projects. This requires a mix of data-related skills, particularly data manipulation, data analysis and data visualisation. In this role you lead a team and you are responsible for overseeing reporting and insights standards, client training and developing a consistent approach for dashboard  Key Accountabilities and main responsibilities Strategic Focus • Present ideas, results and recommendations to clients and internal stakeholders • Conduct research and benchmarking activities to inform improvement measures and define process improvement opportunities. • Champion analytics, visualisation solutions and best practice • Lead the creation of data visualisation standards across the team, enhancing organisational capabilities in data visualisation and associated techniques  Operational Management • Create and manage regular reports / dashboards, reporting on relevant trends and performance. Prioritise business and information needs, challenging conventional operating models to improve business performance. • Execute complex analytical tasks that provide actionable results to business users • Lead Client Translations of Data Science products • Provide a framework for the Client Training capability for the team • Develop a consistent approach for dashboard design taking into consideration client outcomes (client desires/needs) • Design, develop, and implement innovative and appealing user-friendly reports and dashboards in Power BI or Tableau • Contribute to the development of the data analytics self-service capability • Executing against the Data and Analytics roadmap, including optimisation of the existing capability as well the introduction of new capabilities • Identification and implementation of continuous improvement initiatives • Determining business needs and drivers through stakeholder consultation and collaboration • Execute complex analytical tasks that provide actionable results to business users. • Work to truly understand the business of your customers; understand their strategic goals and key issues, and then proactively identify how their data and your product can help them achieve their objectives • Keep up to date with latest trends and best practices in data analytics and data visualisation tools • Strong interpersonal skills to engage with people at all levels of the organisation and build strong relationship and trust with clients and internal stakeholders.  People Leadership • Lead a team of Reporting, Analytics and Data scientists  Governance & Risk • Adhere to all aspects of the Link Group Code of Conduct and Ethics Policy • Follow development guidelines adhering to documentation, source control and production releases  Experience & Personal Attributes • Strong data visualisation skills including the ability to deliver clear, targeted and impactful data visualizations and report user experience; • Tertiary qualification in statistics, mathematics, economics, physics, engineering, computer science or a related discipline • Minimum 5 years experience in an analytics role • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy. • Experience with use of relational databases, SQL (or similar language) and data mining • Knowledge of advanced statistical software packages, such as, Python, R, SPSS • Understanding of predictive/analytical modelling techniques, theories, principle and practices • Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI or other data visualisation tools • Solid written and verbal communication skills • Experience communicating analytical results to clients and non-technical stakeholders  Desirable • Skills with of advanced statistical software packages, including usage of Python or R • Understanding of predictive/analytical modelling techniques, theories, principle and practices • Tertiary qualification in statistics, mathematics, economics, physics, engineering, computer science or a related discipline
job_description.243: • Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM  face2face reference: 591408  Location: Nationwide - Remote  Hours: Full-time  Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline  Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super  About the role:  The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.  The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.  Duties: • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Required experience/skills: • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.  Desirable experience skills: • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment.  If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you. This new role will see the successful candidate to continue to maintain a safe, effective and efficient kitting and logistics operations with a strong focus on data collection and process improvement. job_description.245: About The Role  The Data and Analytics Lead is a strategic role responsible for actionable, high impact analytics and insights that enable an irresistible experience for our people, and continuously drive achievement of our People Plan and business goals.  This is a brand-new role in the People team - the successful applicant will have agency over the tools we use and how we will quantify and analyse the range of data applicable to getting the most out of the People team and its initiatives. • Collect, analyse and interpret large and multiple datasets related to the People team and the wider business to identify trends, patterns and insights • Create standards, frameworks and visualisations that continuously measure our People Plan and EnergyAustralia’s people experience, along with the impact on employees, leaders and business performance • Partner with OD to analyse Engagement feedback and other sources to provide insights that drive meaningful action • Work with the People & Talent Business Partners to understand insights, add value to specific business units and aid people strategy decision making • Share data insights in P&C forums & help build capability and understanding of data across P&C - Help the P&C team to become data analytics savvy • Define and implement the right digital architecture to enable people analytics  Be a Success In This Role  To be successful in this role you must have experience wrangling varied data sets, using visualization tools and don’t necessarily need to come from an HR background – Customer & Insights, Economics or Finance professionals who think they are the right fit, should apply.  Some Of The Competencies We Are Looking For Are  We are looking for the right person with the right attitude more so than the individual who ticks all of the requirements. • Experienced in predictive modelling, statistical analysis and advanced analytics techniques • Relevant tertiary qualifications or analytics certifications - relevant work experience is also acceptable • Proficient in data analysis and visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI • Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to effectively engage, influence and challenge senior stakeholders, develop collaborative relationships and communicate to diverse audience. This is important, you will join a wider team of excellent communicators • Good consultancy skills and ability to partner with the business to understand and articulate stakeholder needs • Additionally, bringing a continuous improvement mindset  How To Apply  If you’re ready to ‘light the way’ towards your next career move, click the 'Apply’ button to submit a confidential application. For any questions, please reach out to Jock Clydesdale, Talent Acquisition Partner @ jock.clydesdale@energyaustralia.com.au  Why Us  At EnergyAustralia, we are committed to providing an inclusive culture so our employees can bring their whole selves to work and have a sense of belonging. As an employee you can enjoy such benefits as: • Awarded Winner 2022 Best Place To Work List • Energise Program - flexible working that is team centric enabling all individuals to agree and succeed together • Excellent company culture, down-to-earth and friendly organisation - be authentic, bring your whole self to work! • State-of-the-art Melbourne office, stunning views only 3-4 minute walk from Southern Cross station • Inhouse Café and Onsite Tech Bar  We’re committed to providing an inclusive culture so our employees can bring their whole selves to work and have a sense of belonging. From our PRISM network that creates a positive culture for LGBTQ+ employees to our Reconciliation Action Plan that has commitments to strengthen relationships

job_description.248: • Competitive salary + super + bonus • Impeccable career development opportunities • Work life balance and hybrid working (3 days in the office)  Why Intellihub?  Intellihub's growth is exponential and we're here to make a true impact. We put our people first and our talented, dedicated, and passionate workforce delivers innovative metering and data solutions that maximise digital and new energy services. We are deeply committed to promoting equal opportunities for all our employees and a positive, safe and balanced workplace for all.  Your new team  Data & Analytics Engineering team is part of the IT Delivery and Software Engineering team within the CIO Group. Its main responsibility is to design, develop and support Intellihub’s data platform and solutions to underpin product and service delivery and sustainable business growth. The Data and Analytics teams supports all parts of the business in Australia and New Zealand and is accountable for all facets of the software delivery cycle include vendor and internal delivery.  Your new role  The Data & Analytics Platform and Operations Lead reports directly to the Data and Analytics Engineering Manager, and is responsible for operating Intellihub’s new Enterprise Data platform and supporting all data solutions within it. You will also be responsible to ensure the design and implementation of the platform are maintainable, cost optimised, and secure.  You will work closely with our data engineering team and architects to drive delivery of the highest priority projects and ensure the right level of quality. As part of the leadership team within Data and Analytics, the role will also be a key contributor to defining our Data and Platform strategy.  The role will be accountable for building out the Data & Analytics platform and operational practices, associated principles, standards, templates, and processes as well as the require governance and review forums.  About You • Proactive, positive, flexible and resilient. • Experience in Agile Program Increment / Scaled Agile Framework, Backlog Grooming to enable continuous delivery. • Tertiary qualified with a degree in Information Technology or Engineering, or a related discipline • Strong cloud D&A platform expertise (AWS preferred). • Strong platform implementation experience with DevOps and agile delivery (code management, CI/CD, modular design, IaC). • Good understanding of ITIL framework and ITSM principles and processes. • Extensive expertise in Data and Analytics operational roles and demonstrated experience running production operations in Data platforms. • Strong focus on stakeholder engagement and customer service. • Experience in understanding TCO with cloud enabled data platform and practices to enable cost optimisation with automation and scheduling.Passionate in building and leading high-performance teams. • Proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities in a fast-paced Agile environment.  Submit your application today. We can’t wait to speak with you!  If you have any further questions, please email Chelsea our Talent Partner at careers@intellihub.com.au  No Recruitment Agencies
job_description.249: The Opportunity  Due to an exciting growth phase, Centric is seeking a Junior Research Analyst to join our Investment Platform. This is a full-time, permanent opportunity, flexible on location for the right person.  The Investment team is a dynamic part of the Centric Group. The team is responsible for multiple investment components that are delivered to dealer groups and other external partners including trustee and administrative. A key area of the teams responsibilities is model portfolios / managed accounts where we provide asset allocation and investment blending targeting specific investment objectives.  The successful candidate will learn how an investment is likely to perform and how sustainable it is. You will participate in our sound portfolio-management strategy by providing the necessary data for our decision-making process.  What does a typical week look like? • Performance reporting for portfolios, sectors and individual funds, • Quantitative analysis on respective listed and unlisted investments, • Adviser and client materials, • Preparation of recommendations for Investment Committee purposes, • Investment administration as required (compliance/risk checks etc), • Liaise with external investment and fund managers.  The natural progression of this role is into an analyst role, where you would be involved in fund manager research, macroeconomic research, and portfolio construction amongst other things.  Let's Talk About You  The successful person will possess the following skills, experience and attributes: • Relevant Tertiary degree in Finance/Business/Economics/Investments, • CFA or relevant industry qualification (highly regarded), • Relevant working experience within financial planning, investments, etc. • Solid understanding of financial set-up, procedures, statistics and economics • Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills • Demonstrated background in working with others to achieve common outcomes and/or goals, • Stay focused and use time effectively to achieve goals by ensuring outcomes are the primary focus of actions, • Ability to display original thinking and creativity  The Perks • Dynamic working environment – work from home and/or office, great flexibility to work around your family, lifestyle or personal commitments • Work with a collaborative, fun team • Beautiful office facilities with quality, ergonomic equipment • Access to Employee Assistance Program and online learning, supporting a healthy work-life balance • Career development opportunities based on your preferences as the business is rapidly growing  Why Centric?  Centric is a comprehensive online wealth management platform providing advisers and investors the ability to manage their wealth easily and efficiently. Through the platform, clients have a full view of their assets and liabilities in one place, even if they're held outside Centric.  Offering access to competitive investment products including Centric Super, Centric is a dynamic way to design and manage portfolios for investors at all life stages, also enabling reporting and access for aligned professionals such as accountants.  With over $3 billion in FUM and backed by FNZ, Centric offers a flat administration fee and full pricing transparency, together with healthy cash rates and a low cost to trade. Designed for advisers through extensive consultation with advisers, the Centric team is passionate about delivering a quality platform and experience, enabling advisers and their clients to thrive.  Next Steps?  Apply now – we can't wait to hear from you Please note, you will be directed to our careers page to apply.  Please note:  Only candidates with valid work rights within Australia in which this position is based will be considered.  This role is being managed by Findex Talent Acquisition and we will not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from Recruitment Agencies.
job_description.250: Role : Data Engineer  Location : Sydney/Melbourne/Brisbane  Job Type- Permanent  Job Description:  MUST Have :: DATA Engineering skills (SQL, Data Migration, ETL tools) - experience with NETEZZA, along with Oracle RDS, Redshift, SAS. • Worked as Technical Lead / Data Engineer in area of Data Warehousing/Business Intelligence • Very hands on heavy on quickly learning Data Application, Data Analysis, Scripting, Data Transformation and Reconciliation. • Data Migration experience if possible • Must have experience working as DWH modelling, developer, or analyst for 8+ years • AWS Redshift, Netezza and Data Modelling is a MUST • Must have led a team for minimum 5 people • Must have good collaboration and communication skills • Performance optimization skill and code review skill is a must • Good to have reporting skills like Cognos, Tableau , ThoughtSpot etc. • Should have experience in working on various detail designs (HLD and LLD). • Good to have Unix Shell Scripting Knowledge • Additional Skills Control M, Bit bucket/ Source Tree, Jenkins • Should have experience in Cost estimates for development and technical tasks break down • Should have good exposure to DBFit like ETL testing tools for test driven development • Should have experience in DataStage and DB2 flex  Interested candidates can send their updated resume to anoop.redhu@carecone.com.au or reach me @ M: +61 2 8880 6489.
job_description.251: About the Company The Client is a multinational with multiple global and APAC-based entities under its umbrella. They are forming a new Data & Analytics Team to help centralise their data to enable their APAC organisation to become more data-driven in their decision-making.  About the Role As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in centralising the organisation's APAC data from disparate systems to a Cloud Data Lake before moving on to working Advanced Analytics solutions. Leveraging your experience in Master Data, Cloud and ETL, you will initially establish a high-quality data lake to improve Reporting solutions across the business. Once those initial building blocks are in place, the organisation will then start Advanced Analytics and Data Science projects. Long-term, you will be empowered to help define the Data Roadmap and will be encouraged to explore and suggest new technologies to expand Data capabilities.  Duties • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines for ETL processes within cloud environments. • Oversee Azure Cloud infrastructure and services including: Data Factory, Data Lake, Synapse, Databricks, Apache Spark. • Integrate a wide range of disparate source systems and databases to the centralised Azure data lake. • Collaborate with internal business stakeholders to understand different systems (ERP, CRM etc.) and the organisational data uses to build a high-quality data lake. • Consult with internal colleagues to understand business logic • Support future Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning projects. • Promote the utilisation and understanding of Master/Metadata while driving its development. • Lead best practice in data handling and storage methods.  Skills & Experience • Experience working commercially with Cloud Technology (AWS, GCP or Azure) and on-prem data warehouses • ETL, data migration and/or integration experience (SSIS, stored procs., ADF etc.) • Master data concepts and tools • Experience with data architecture concepts and dimensional data modelling concepts • Python and SQL experience • Ability to seek solutions and passion for learning new technologies • Bonus: CI/CD, Power BI, Bicep and/or ML concepts  Company Culture The organisation is proud of their culture and are excited to be investing in a new Data and Analytics function to increase innovation. The team is made up of diverse professionals from a variety of backgrounds and the company culture promotes strong tenure across the organisation.  Benefits • Competitive compensation package • Opportunities for professional development and advancement including training • Collaborative and dynamic work environment • Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools and opportunity to explore and implement more of these  How to Apply If you are a forward-thinking Data Engineer with a passion for driving data-driven solutions, please apply and suitable candidates will be contacted for a further conversation.
