job_description.254: We have a fantastic leadership opportunity available within our Group Data Analytics team to drive and lead our analytics agenda, delivering high quality reporting and analytics solutions that provide insights to business functions and support data-driven decision making.  Why join us? • We have a supportive, transparent and inclusive team • JB Hi-Fi and The Good Guys are multi-award winning, iconic retail brands with a rich history in the Australian retail market • We support vulnerable members of our community by making donations to our ‘Helping Hands’ and ‘Doing Good’ workplace giving programs. Every dollar our team donates is matched and together we have donated more than $33m to our charity partners. • We offer generous team member discounts across The Good Guys and JB Hi-Fi • You will have exposure to ongoing training & development opportunities from day one • We offer fantastic long-term career opportunities across the broader JB Hi-Fi/The Good Guys group  About The Role • Leads the application of data and insights and demonstrates value from reporting and analytics solutions. • Ensures reporting and analytics solutions are aligned with strategic objectives and business functions. • Highlights gaps and opportunities in existing reporting and analytics solutions in comparison to business process and industry best practices. • Leverages JB Group Data Analytics platforms to deliver actionable insights and trusted reporting capability. • Ensures reporting and analytics solutions align to the Data Analytics strategy and integrate with the existing data platform architecture. • Increase self service capability of insights with Data Citizens. • Lead the design and implementation of Data Visualisation and Communication standards within the team. • Manage, monitor, and communicate on the status and resolution of issues relating to reporting and data visualization solutions. • Instil a passion within the team for building automated, fault tolerant and reliable reporting and analytics solutions maintaining a consistent high level of currency. • Drive a culture of innovation and analytical thinking within the team and across the business. • People Management with a focus on team development, growth, capability, and culture aligned to Data Analytics Team principles.  About You • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., software engineering, computer science or data science) and a minimum of 7 years of commercial experience. • Working Experience and Certifications in both Azure Cloud and Data Fundamentals inclusive of a role-based certification track in Data Analysis and Power BI. • Strong stakeholder, influencing and negotiation skills. • Commitment to continuous self-development and agile learning. • Ability to manage time and workload effectively which includes planning, organising, road mapping, and prioritising requirements alongside analytics product owners and stakeholders. • Strong people skills and demonstrated experience improving team capability, process, and agility. • Working knowledge of modern data platforms, architectures, reporting and analytics platforms. • Strong Experience in developing Data Visualisations and Paginated Reporting solutions within Power BI. • Experience in the application of Governance principles such as data quality, metadata collection and management, identity and access management, and data security and privacy in accordance with PII and PCI regulatory compliance.  JB Hi-Fi Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a work environment that promotes diversity and inclusion. If this opportunity excites you (even if you feel that you don’t meet 100% of the criteria) – please don’t hesitate to apply!

job_description.257: Does the freedom to enable a new platform with data using the best technology and playing a leading role in the digital transformation of an ASX-listed company with 5,000 staff and offices in 30 countries interest you? Inviting Talent to understand and explain the phenomena around data and help us make informed decisions.  You will implement advanced analytics solutions that improve business outcomes, such as digital engagement and student conversion, better customer experience, marketing campaign optimisation and to improve Data Engineering practices across IDP.  This is a full-time permanent opportunity. We invite applications from Talent with full working rights in Australia to apply for this role based out of our head office in Melbourne.  Responsibilities Include  Pipeline • Develop accurate and production-ready models that enable IDP to focus effort on the right opportunities • Suggest changes to process and core systems to improve accuracy of predictions • Suggest changes regarding interventions to improve conversions • Continuously iterate and innovate existing products to stay relevant and ahead of the competition • Work with global marketing and call centre teams to run experiments and identify new revenue generation and cost reduction opportunities  Engineering • Collaborate with engineers at offshore teams on existing IDP architecture patterns • Develop appropriate incremental engineering patterns specific to Data Science applications  Essential  What we're looking for • Minimum two years experience in a similar role with a proven track record of delivering business value using advanced analytics • Knowledge of marketing analytics, including customer segmentation, propensity scoring, and campaign optimisation • Ownership of goals - ability to focus on the goal of a piece of work and find a way to make it possible • Strong SQL skills – ability to write advanced SQL from problem statements worded in business language by collaborating with various SMEs, building their own knowledge as they go. • Python (or any other programming language) – 1-2 years coding experience • Strong communication skills – ability to question, probe and demonstrate understanding a problem, and to propose/check a possible solution to that problem • Curiosity – keen to understand how IDP works and how this shows in the data– how students, clients and counsellors feel and behave.  Desirable • Experience with AWS • Post graduate qualification in statistics, data science, computer science or mathematics. • Accountability for the full scope of Management Accounting functions in a Technology context including Budget, Forecasting and Actuals analysis.  About Us  An ASX100 business with a 50-year heritage, IDP is a pioneer in international education services. Our core business lines include student placement to Australia, US, UK, Canada, Ireland and New Zealand institutions, English-language testing and training.  We are on a mission to build the world's leading platform and connected community to guide students along their journey to achieve their lifelong learning and career aspirations.  As a co-owner of IELTS, we deliver the English test that is trusted by more governments, universities and organisations than any other. We also operate English language teaching schools in Southeast Asia.  We are innovators, driven by the needs of our customers and deep data insights. Our 5,000 team members based around the world understand that our services change lives – not only of our customers, but their wider communities.  As the global leader in international education, we have focused on building trusted human relationships for more than 50 years.  In recent years, our investment in digital technology and customer research has enhanced these personal connections, enabling us to deliver global success to more students, test-takers and our partners.  Proudly customer-first, our expert people are powered by global technology. Together, we offer unmatched services, helping local dreams become realities, all over the world.  And best yet, at 50, we are just getting started.  More About Us  We are evolving rapidly. This is an exciting time to join us as we transform the way people access global education and opportunities, through leveraging innovative technology and a creating a connected world.  With our core business in student placement, digital marketing, English-language testing, and training across a global network, we are a global leader in the international education sector.  At IDP, our people are always at the forefront of what we do. We strive to provide workplaces that are truly diverse and representative of the communities that we work in, so our people feel empowered to bring their best and authentic selves to work. We are focused on continuing to build a culture of inclusion and belonging by providing a safe work environment where all our people are encouraged to excel, be agile and creative, and seek new ways to solve meaningful problems.  If you share our passion for creating great customer experiences and thrive in an innovative culture, then join us today.  Why join us.  Be part of our story, as we support you to create meaningful and rewarding experiences, grow your career with purpose, and celebrate as a global team.  If you identify as a member of an underrepresented community, we encourage you to apply, even if you feel you do not meet all the criteria, but have relevant skills, experience and capability that will enhance the role. At IDP, you can be yourself, be seen, heard, valued, and celebrated every day for your meaningful contributions. If you require any adjustments, let us know.  Some Other Benefits Include • Work in our new 6 green star office, featuring creative collaboration zones and a focus on health and wellbeing. • Professional development programs to grow your career. • Two paid volunteer days every year to support our local communities. • Stay energized with free fresh fruit and barista onsite.
job_description.258: The opportunity  They Have An Exciting Opportunity Available For a Junior Data & Reporting Analyst To Join The Agency’s Case Management Support Team In Assisting With  Our client is a community focused federal government agency. • Data collection & analysis • Data cleansing • Systems Administration  Labour Hire hourly rate spanning an initial 12 months, with the opportunity to extend. APS5 level role paying an hourly rate of $55.24 + Superannuation, to be based out of our client’s Richmond or Geelong location.  On offer is 2 days working from home, with 3 on site, hours expected are an average of 37.5 hours across a 5-day working week.  About The Role  The APS5 Case Management Support Officer is a team membership position and is accountable for organising their workflow and making independent decisions relating to an area of responsibility. The position will be required to provide policy advice within an area of specialisation with advice based on policies and legislation.  Responsibilities Will Include • Researching and drafting responses for complaints, Ministerial and other documents as required. • Analysing and assessing AAT Applications received by the Agency. • Managing the requests for medical and functional assessments. • Preparing and filing Tribunal documents as required for AAT Applications received by the AAB within strict time frames. • Assessing and responding to risk from processes, including in terms of privacy considerations and priority.  About You • Australian citizenship is a requirement to be eligible for this position • Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel experience • Data collection & analysis • Data cleansing • Systems Administration • Time management  Nice to haves • Data visualisation • Experience with Power Query • Experience with other Microsoft Applications such as Power BI, Power Automate & Access  APPLY  Submit your resume, or for further information please contact liam.lasslett@talentinternational.com or call on +61 3 9236 7780
job_description.259: About the Role Your work will complement the established research and education strengths of the school which range from the applied to the theoretical. You will also have a strong commitment to teaching and the supervision of research students. Teaching will occur within the School of Mathematics and Statistics undergraduate and postgraduate programs and the applicant will have the opportunity to teach mathematics and its applications to a variety of audiences.  Your responsibilities will include: • The conduct of research and contribution to knowledge through scholarship, refereed publications and presentations. • Active application and success in obtaining external research grant income to support that research • Proactive development of subject materials and delivery, including the use of modern technology and online resources as appropriate • Development of curriculum in mathematics and/or statistics in both undergraduate and postgraduate levels  Who We Are Looking For We seek an individual who possesses the potential for research excellence in mathematics or statistics, with the ability to engage in research collaborations, secure research funding, and effectively teach both undergraduate and graduate-level mathematics or statistics courses.  You will also have: • A PhD or equivalent research higher degree in mathematics, statistics or a closely related discipline • The ability to interact well with other academic staff and to contribute to the administration of a large school • Clear potential in graduate student supervision • Demonstrated ability to develop, administer and see through to completion appropriately designed research projects with limited supervision  For further information regarding responsibilities and requirements, please refer to the attached PD.  This position requires the incumbent to hold a current and valid Working with Children Check to ensure the University provides a safe environment for everyone.  Your New Team – School of Mathematics and Statistics The University of Melbourne's School of Mathematics and Statistics is one of Australia's leading mathematics and statistics schools. It has achieved this status through the high quality of its research and teaching programs. The School offers a wide range of subjects to undergraduate and postgraduate students and is involved in aspects of community life that impact on the interests of the School and the discipline.  The School of Mathematics and Statistics has a total of 90 continuing teaching and/or research staff; 37 research only staff and consultants; 19 academic specialists and 16 support staff. In 2023, there were 143 Research Higher Degree and 189 Coursework Master of Science students and over 13,000 undergraduate students. Seven members of the School staff and one Emeritus Professor are members of the Academy of Science. The school currently hosts one ARC Centre of Excellence and one ARC Industrial Transformation Training Centre, and has hosted four ARC Laureate Fellows, thirteen ARC Future Fellows and twenty-four DECRA Fellows.  What We Offer You In addition, we offer the opportunity to be part of a vibrant community and enjoy a range of benefits, including generous leave provisions, salary packaging, health and well-being services and discounts on graduate courses. For more information, check out our benefits page  About the University of Melbourne We're tightly connected with the community, both at home and abroad. We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on LinkedIn.  We are dedicated to ensuring barrier free and inclusive practices to recruit the most talented candidates. If you require any reasonable adjustments with the recruitment process, please contact the email address listed at the bottom of the page.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants We aspire to be the University of choice for Indigenous Australians, with unprecedented investment to attract, nurture and retain Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students and staff. Tangible support through a range of programs and initiatives will ensure that you personally succeed and flourish while at the University of Melbourne.
job_description.260: We are looking for a talented and experienced manager to lead a high-calibre and growing team in planning, implementing and managing the ACMA's data governance lifecycle. Your mandate encompasses the full range of data governance activities including data quality, privacy, security and compliance policies, supporting analytics, data usage and metadata management.  You will be in your element managing a multi-faceted change plan which will include: • providing data governance support for the progressive deployment of advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and machine learning • an evolving 'hub-and-spoke' model with a focus on building data governance capability at all levels of the organisation • embedding and integrating data governance into a fast-paced whole-of-Agency digital transformation program • working across government to promote and support data sharing opportunities.  You will thrive working in close partnership with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.  This role is perfectly suited for a hands-on and pragmatic senior leader with great people skills and who is motivated to apply their deep subject matter expertise to lifting organisational capability.  To be eligible for employment with the ACMA, applicants must be an Australian citizen.
job_description.261: Who are we?  LMG is the largest aggregator across Australia and New Zealand supporting a community of over 6,000 brokers and advisers. Proudly family-owned and led, LMG supports businesses operating under their own brand or the Loan Market brand, and partners with over 65 banks and lenders. The business has grown rapidly, reaching a $350 billion loan book and helping more than 300,000 customers in 2022.  We're not a conventional company with a lot of rules and hierarchy, and we don’t intend to become one. We're a big company with a start-up attitude. Our success is based on hiring outstanding people and accepting nothing less than being the best at what we do.  About the role:  As a data modeller in the BI & Analytics team, you will be responsible for leveraging large and complex data sets to build robust, reusable and optimised data models for use across the organisation. You will have broad technical skills of developing strategic models to support a wide range of use cases for analytics, business intelligence, self-service, machine learning models and other data driven projects.  This is a hybrid role (2 days in the office per week) that can be done from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane.  Key responsibilities: • Typical activities may include creating standardized logical and physical data models, using best practices, to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy. • Establish and advise on processes that support the application of appropriate modelling including designing and documenting mappings, ensuring all new development conforms to the agreed data model design, and assisting in enabling self-service • Work closely with the business and BI analysts to surface enriched enterprise-level views enabling data driven decisions. • Demonstrates a focus on continual self improvement, across both the technical and business aspects of delivering high quality data enrichment solutions • Provide support to data quality and data validation through analysis of data and assisting in understanding the meaning of data • Help drive continuous improvements to data quality procedures and a consistent approach to how data quality is measured, monitored and reported. • Ensure Data Governance standards are incorporated at the implementation level  To succeed in this role you will bring with you: • Minimum bachelor's degree qualification in engineering, technology or quantitative discipline • Proven advanced experience with Cloud based Technologies and Databases, with GCP and Snowflake experience advantageous. Strong experience in SQL, dBT • Strong data and technical background demonstrating innovation, initiative and a passion for data • Confidence in collecting, collating and interpreting business requirements in order to produce quality outcomes • Experience working with product managers, platform owners and different stakeholders to gather data requirements and provide solutions  Our benefits -  6 ‘Me’ days per year  16 weeks paid parental leave & up to 52 weeks paid superannuation  Paid Fertility Treatment leave  12 days personal leave  Paid Study leave  EAP  Hybrid work policy  Wellbeing and L&D programs  Religious and cultural swap leave  Option to purchase additional annual leave  LMGPerks! Thousands of dollars of savings and discounts with the biggest international and local brands.  Paid volunteer day  Employee referral program  Public transport annual pass loans  At LMG, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is essential to our success. We're committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported, regardless of their race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, age, or any other aspect of their identity. We recognize that diversity brings a variety of perspectives and experiences that are essential to fostering innovation and driving business success. As an inclusive employer, we strive to create a culture where everyone can thrive and bring their best selves to work every day.
job_description.262: Want to be part of a MedTech startup working on cutting edge technology? Want to contribute to a groundbreaking, live product with real world impact? Let me tell you about Cyban…  About Cyban  Cyban is advancing the way brain injuries are detected and managed through the creation of their patented, non-invasive medical device which monitors brain oxygen and pressure levels. Their Brain Pulse Monitor delivers accurate results quickly to enable confident clinical care at every stage of the patient journey and helps hospitals to save costs and free up valuable resources.  Cyban’s first product for use in patients with Acute Brain Injuries is close to launching after significant clinical trials in patients with some of the world’s most well-known and regarded institutions and a successful round of funding. This is the perfect time to join the team and be part of something meaningful!  About the role  Cyban is looking for a passionate and highly skilled Data Scientist to join their team. Working closely with their team of data scientists, research scientists, and engineers, you will play a pivotal role in developing innovative algorithms to extract valuable insights from complex biological waveforms. Your work will directly impact the development of production ready advanced medical technologies, improving patient care and outcomes.  What will you be doing?  Algorithm and Model Development for Clinical Outcomes • Leverage your expertise in Machine Learning (ML) and data analysis to design, develop, and optimise statistical models and algorithms for biological waveform data and clinical outcomes. • Utilise advanced techniques such as deep learning, ensemble models, and time-series analysis to improve data accuracy and interpretability. • Extract relevant features, identify trends, anomalies, and predictive biomarkers, while regularly evaluating and fine-tuning model performance to enhance algorithmic efficiency.  Data Exploration and Visualisation • Conduct in-depth exploratory data analysis to identify patterns and relationships within biological waveform datasets. • Visualise findings in a meaningful and interpretable manner, enabling stakeholders to gain insights and make informed decisions.  Research Advancements • Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in signal processing and ML algorithms, methodologies, and tools. • Continuously explore and evaluate emerging technologies and techniques that could enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of data analysis.  Documentation and Reporting • Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processing steps, model development processes, and experimental results. • Prepare reports and present findings to internal and external stakeholders, communicating complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.  What skills and qualifications are we looking for? • Bachelor’s or post-graduate qualifications in a related field e.g Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Neuroscience. • You have a minimum 3 years commercial or industry work experience in Data Science or a related field, alongside your academic studies or research. • Proficient in Python and have experience in other languages e.g R or MATLAB. • Skilled in statistical analysis and ML frameworks, with a solid understanding of time-series analysis, signal processing techniques, and feature extraction methods. • Experience or strong interest in health or medical-related technology, with an understanding of relevant physiological and clinical concepts. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, able to dissect and understand complex datasets and extract meaningful insights. Proficient in statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to validate findings and ensure the robustness of models. • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively articulate and present technical concepts to diverse teams and medical professionals.  Plus, bonus points for: • Experience in getting ML models into production • Familiarity with biological waveforms and experience working with processed physiological time series data from medical devices (e.g., PPG, ECG, or EEG sensors) • Familiarity with languages like C++ and C, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)  This is a hybrid role within a dynamic start-up environment, where priorities and requirements may evolve rapidly. At Cyban, they believe that success comes through recognising the value of their people and fostering an environment of respect and openness. They work with a sense of urgency and purpose and continuously endeavour to understand the perspectives and needs of those who will use their products.  Sounds exciting? Want to know more?  Apply now or reach out to Cass at affix: cass.galliott@affix.com.au

job_description.264: Role : Azure Data Engineer (ADF, Synapse, Databricks Expert)  Location: Melbourne, Victoria, Australia  Experience: 5+ Years  Job Summary:  Highly skilled and experienced Azure Data Engineer with expertise in Azure Data Factory (ADF), Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Databricks.  Person will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions on the Azure cloud platform and collaborate data analysts,and customer stakeholders to ensure the availability, scalability, and reliability of data. Have a deep understanding of Azure services to become a key contributor to data-driven initiatives.  Key Responsibilities:  • Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, ensuring data ingestion, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes are efficient and reliable from sources including but not limited to Parquet, CSV, database, JSON,API.  • Optimize data processing workflows in Azure Synapse Analytics  • Working knowledge Snowflake and data constructs  • Collaborate with analysts to tune data pipelines using Azure Databricks.  • Debug, Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline anomalies, proactively identifying and resolving issues.  • Automate data engineering processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual interventions.  • Stay up-to-date with Azure cloud services, data engineering best practices, and emerging technologies.  • Attend daily customer call and be proactive in resolving Customer queries  Qualifications:  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology.  • Proven experience as a Data Engineer with expertise in Snowflake,Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Data bricks.  • Expertise in writing writing optimized SQL queries.  • working knowledge of CICD  • Knowledge of finance industry/Domain is good to have  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.  • Relevant certifications (e.g., Snowflake, Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer) are a plus.  LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/amara-ramya-sree-ab655a206/  If you have a CV, click apply to be immediately considered. Email : ramya.s@manvision.net  If you don’t have an up-to-date CV, reach out to me, Ramyasree.
job_description.265: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  What if your most rewarding experiences couldn’t be captured by a resume?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world. This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors. • As this is an expressions of interest advertisement, please allow some delay in us getting back to your application*  What’s in it for you?  As a Data Engineer, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: • Be able to clearly explain data and analytics strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders • Responsible for developing batch ingestion and data transformation routines using ETL tools or other ingestion techniques • Responsible for developing real-time ingestion and data transformation routines using Kafka and similar technologies • Responsible for migrating data from legacy data platform to cloud data platform • Present data in graphs, charts, tables, etc. and designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.  What We’re Looking For  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go. • Configuration and coordination of data pipelines across projects • Data pipeline development, including Azure Data Factory, AWS Kinesis and/or Spark • Migration and transformation of large complex data sets from legacy systems like Teradata to cloud platform using Azure tools and other ETL tools like DataStage • Data and Reporting Platform development on environments using technologies such as Microsoft Azure, SAP BW, Teradata, PowerBI or Cognos • A strong background in coding with possible experience with Python, SAS, SQL and/or R • Project delivery toolset experience in one or more batch ETL tools (such as DataStage, Informatica, Microsoft SSIS, Azure Data Factory or Talend) and/or open-source data integration tools (such as Kafka or Nifi)  What We Can Offer You • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment • Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness • Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.  The minimum salary for this role is AUD $90,000 inclusive of 11% superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
