job_description.267: About Us : Renaissance Info Systems is a technology and digital recruitment agency, connecting contract and permanent professionals with clients across Asia-Pacific.  We aim to differentiate ourselves through our level of responsiveness, and our understanding that comes from being an IT recruitment agency from the IT Industry. Our recruiters balance sophisticated and simple inter-personal techniques to assure a strong candidate network.  Know More : http://www.reninfo.com.au  Role: Data Migration Engineer with SharePoint experience  Location: Melbourne  Key accountabilities –  • Data Analysis and Migration  > Using existing processes, migrate unstructured documents from existing SharePoint on-premise implementation to the future state SharePoint online attachment store.  > Understand the underlying related structures from the future state models including relationships and dependencies, to ensure accurate data and linkages with structure (record data).  > Work with business units, data analysts and IT staff to plan, develop/extend and coordinate data migration activities as required.  • Stakeholder Engagement  > Collaborate with internal and external developers as well as subject matter experts to establish the data profiles ETL process and business requirements.  > Manage stakeholder expectations and conflicts accordingly.  > Act as liaison between the business units, technology teams and project teams.  • Other  > Meet performance measures as defined.  > Demonstrate company values in professional interactions with other staff, representatives of financial firms, complainants and members of the community and other stakeholders generally  > Develop constructive and cooperative working relationships with others and maintain them over time.  > Collaborate with other members of the team to continuously improve service delivery and effectiveness of outcomes.  > Understand and operate in compliance with all applicable company policies, procedures, systems, approach and guidance documents, legislation and Company guidelines.  > Perform other duties or functions that could reasonably be expected of this role.  Essential Requirements/Key Selection Criteria  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a Data related field, and at least 1 years of relevant experience in data analysis, data migration, or IT and data projects.  • Intermediate skills and knowledge in interpreting data and migrating documents through following set processes.  • Demonstrated ability to understand and execute an existing process whilst monitoring or reporting progress of an activity, as well as identifying and escalating any issues or improvements.  • Demonstrated understanding of SharePoint and document version control, SQL, ETL and Data Migration processes  • Strong interpersonal skills including oral and written communication skills.  • Strong attention to detail, initiative and the ability to work unsupervised, working on large projects with multiple work streams and deadlines.  • Able to respond quickly to change and adopt a flexible/ innovative approach to problems and opportunities.  Eligibility :  Must have full work rights in Australia/ New Zealand  Visa Sponsorship : No  Contact Person Details :  Prachi Jhala  Recruitment Consultant    : 0480333128    : prachi@reninfo.com.au
job_description.268: Business Intelligence Developer - Move to Data Engineer - $155,000 - Melbourne  Talent Insights are working with a company who are recognised as being an employer of choice for Victoria. This is an amazing opportunity to progress into a Data Engineering position in approximately one and half years. Working with a well known FMCG Company and within a specialist Data & Analytics team, this is a key role supporting the data infrastructure and contributing to the development and overall delivery of the organisation's data strategy.You're passionate about BI, System Integration and an expert user of Microsoft BI/Azure Data tools. You understand the value of data to help solve business problems and responsible for solution design/development/deployment/documentation of data and business intelligence requirements.  What you will be doing: • Technical hands-on team member whose primary responsibility will be design, build and operationalise data solutions within Azure and on-premise environments. • Development of data models, flows, datasets and views that are efficient and meaningful representations of data. • Optimise the data integration platform, ensuring optimal performance, data availability, accessibility and integrity. • Engage in cross-functional understanding, peer review, team developing, technical feedback, multiplatform joint efforts, agile delivery, and risk mitigation strategies • Collaborate with broader business users to understand and translate requirements into scalable data solutions, as well as troubleshoot and diagnose issues. • Develop data integration, load routines, data consolidation mechanisms and other artefacts necessary to implement best practice ETL/ELT type integrations. • Identify, design and implement internal process improvements, automating manual processes, optimising data delivery and re-designing infrastructure for scalability  What we are looking for: • Data design and implementation, expert SQL scripting and best practices skills • Expert experience in Microsoft BI stack (MS SQL, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI, OLAP) • Solid experience in Azure Data Platform with data engineering workload (Azure Synapse, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure DevOps) • Experience developing multi-dimensional and tabular models (DAX, MDX) • Skilled in object-oriented programming and script languages (C#.NET, VB.NET, Java, Python, Perl, R) • Skills in API driven data integration, REST/SOAP • Strong experience with data migration planning and execution • Demonstrated experience in retail oriented architecture, integration and/or data architecture highly desirable • Streamsets knowledge & experience highly desirable • Apparel21, Qlik Sense, Adobe, Mailchimp, Jedox knowledge a bonus • Experience in design, solutioning, code review and quality assurance of output products • A result oriented and ownership mindset to drive deliverables and completion • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, positive can-do attitude  If you're interested in discussing this opportunity further or would like a more general chat about your career in Data, get in touch and we can arrange a time. Email me in the first instance on stephen@talentinsights.com.au
job_description.269: • Melbourne, Victoria | RACV Head Office • Fixed Term, 12 Month | Hybrid Working • A Competitive Salary | Discounts on Selected RACV Products  Great things start here  RACV is an organisation that’s broader and bigger than you think – beyond the trusted roadside assistance and insurance lines, and significant portfolio of Travel and Leisure experiences, RACV is also one of the biggest installers of Solar energy in Victoria, and it’s a much broader organisation outside of the RACV brand and outside of Victoria with numerous Australian and international subsidiaries and associates. At its core, RACV is the largest member organisation in Victoria, and we’re trusted to be there for our over 2 million members.  About the Opportunity  As the Data Strategy Leader, you will play an integral role in delivering the data and analytics strategic roadmap and will be responsible for uplifting Home and Energy business performance by leveraging analytical models and insights to drive commercial outcomes.  Delivering high-quality opportunity proposals, you will play an integral role in growing the Home & Energy customer base and lifetime customer value as well as undertaking robust commercial sizing and collaborate with product leaders to shape these opportunities into pragmatic and executable quarterly planning initiatives.  What you’ll need to be successful • 3+ years' experience in an analytics and insights, commercial or product role. • Tertiary qualification in commerce, data analytics, statistics, or similar • Possess exceptional commercial, numerical, financial skills. • Experience in using analytical tools and propensity models. • Experience in developing high level business cases. • Possess highly developed Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Tableau skills. • Have exceptional ability to synthesise data from multiple sources and generate commercially valuable and actionable insights. • Be a critical thinker with a natural comfort and talent for structured problem solving and quantitative analysis. Strong attention to detail with an ability to interrogate data to find new insights. • Have strong commercial acumen and the ability to link business needs to insight requirements.  The RACV difference  Our culture is one of continuous improvement, delivering with speed and sophistication. We possess a curious mindset and we always ask why, who, when and how. We are passionate about our members and customers.  Application process  You can learn more about the RACV at racv.com.au/about-racv/our-people/work-at-racv.  Submit your CV via the link below.  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police checks as a condition of employment.
job_description.270: What’s in it for you?  A leading Australian multi-asset broker is looking for a market analyst for their Melbourne office. This is a rare opportunity for an analyst who would like to grow their media presence and profile within the markets. This organisation is committed to delivering well-researched, considered and targeted investment insights, with a strong focus on quality over quantity. They offer a lively, team-based and professional environment with a competitive remuneration package  What will you be doing?  Working closely with the marketing and sales teams you will produce daily market analysis, writing concise and clear reports for clients and internal teams. You will also be covering breaking news utilising their state-of-the-art video production studio and hosting both webinars and seminars to share your knowledge of the markets and educate clients on the global markets.  What is required to apply for this role? • Understanding of trading strategies and the global markets (CFDs, Shares, Forex, Commodities, Cryptos, and Indices) • Ability to write content that inspires traders to consider new opportunities in the global markets • The ability to explain complex financial topics in a simple yet engaging manner • High level of confidence as a speaker, often in front of a live audience • Familiar with social media channels • Minimum 3 years of experience in financial derivative trading (as a market commentator or trader) • Minimum of bachelor’s degree • The ability to think critically, independently and with attention to detail • You must be fluent in both Mandarin and English
job_description.271: This high profile government body is currently seeking a Data Engineering & Architecture Lead to support current initiatives and help design target state data architecture, strategy, and integration for a key Program of work.  To secure this newly created role you will have a background in Data Engineering and Architecture at a leadership level, with extensive experience in complex legacy architecture where you have assisted the company in modernising this through Data Transformation i.e.: transformation from legacy systems to modern i.e.: CRM etc.  Key activities • Lead the production of domain specific architecture material (both for current and target state) such as models, designs, patterns, and solutions and ensure it is consistent and complimentary to other architecture domains • Develop architecture documentation for initiatives/projects focusing on the data domain • Maintain oversight and signoff on intermediate and detailed design and changes to existing solution data architecture as required • Deliver and discuss domain architecture, solution architectures and recommendations to stakeholders • Create and capture accurate and complete records of the business activities related to this position, in accordance with approved policy and procedures • Development of target state data architectures and data models for complex systems (conceptual, logical and physical), including legacy to modern stack  Skills, Knowledge And Experience • Extensive demonstrated experience in setting and managing enterprise data projects and standards, including data engineering and analytics experience • Deep expertise in Big Data/ Analytics systems, specifications, and solution architectures • Experience designing and implementing high-performing data/analytics solutions with both traditional and model data warehousing and Big Data technologies • Strong communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders • Experience in creating and embedding data governance • Broad experience and understanding across: • Data and information management in context of analytics and reporting • Data migration and transformation (ETL, ELT, including on-prem to cloud) • Analytical software and languages e.g. SAS, R, Python • Traditional database and emerging technologies e.g. SQL, DB2, OLAP/dimensional, NoSQL, non-structured data etc. • Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Oracle Cloud)  Apply now to secure an interview or contact Josh D’Monte on 9236 7723 for a confidential discussion.
job_description.272: Australian Citizens residing in Australia only respond. • Contract start 16 October 2023 to 12 months. • Australian Citizen, Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth role.  Send your responses to jobs@softtestpays.com  Overview  The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is responsible for the delivery of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). Since it was established, the NDIA has pursued a vision of optimising social and economic independence and full participation for people with disability. The Data & Analytics Branch supports the Agency by providing high quality data and reporting and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions.  Key Responsibilities • Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the organisation. Capture business requirements and identify underlying business needs. • Carry out analysis of present approaches and identify opportunities to enhance processes current and target state. • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business requirements. • Translate subject-matter expert and stakeholder discussion into process flows, procedures and business requirements. • Identify and document instances where existing business processes may be streamlined or improved or do not meet current or potential future business needs. • Develop, maintain and validate business requirements with stakeholders. • Input to the design and implementation of solutions that support the business processes and deliver business insight. • Liaise with management to coordinate process improvement project activities. • Workshop facilitation with business stakeholders to map out processes and elicit business requirements. • Practical Agile Delivery framework experience, developing Initiatives, Epics, User Stories and other documentation. • Ability to work with the business to identify business process issues, improvement opportunities and potential solutions. • Ability to gather, analyse and translate business data to meaningful insights.  Every application requires to address selection criteria as part of application submission.  Essential Criteria  1. Able to translate discussion into process flows, requirements and documentation.  2. Able to understand and capture business requirements relating to use / application of data to business problems.  3. Have experience in as is and to be process mapping.  4. Hands on experience with agile product development process for data products as well as developing detailed User Stories and UAC.  5. Intermediate skills with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, Powerpoint, Word.  6. Showcase good analytical and evaluating skills.  Desirable Criteria  1. Experience as a scrum master.  2. Experience creating wireframes.  3. Data analysis skills.  4. Experience working in data businesses.
job_description.273: An exciting opportunity is available for a dynamic and energetic CRM and Data Specialist to join Melbourne’s leader in prestige Real Estate. The successful candidate will drive CRM & Data innovation, strategy and execution across Marshall White’s digital platforms, serving as a crucial conduit across the business while enabling insightful and targeted success.  About Us  Marshall White is a prestige real estate agency servicing Bayside, Boroondara, Manningham, Port Phillip, Stonnington & the Mornington Peninsula. We pride ourselves on our values and providing expertise and an exceptional experience to get the best outcomes for our clients while growing your successful career in the process.  About You  The role calls for an individual who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and at times high-pressure environment. Rewarded for balancing speed and accuracy, this position will deliver excellent growth opportunities for some seeking to springboard their career. The successful candidate will need to be able to work both independently and within a team environment. This varied output will see the successful candidate coordinating Marshall White’s business needs and priorities including and assisting with development, implementation, continued optimisation and operational CRM/Data training and most importantly our regular reporting.  Reporting to the Head of Marketing and Chief Commercial Officer, the position will sit within the Marketing Department and support internal stakeholders to achieve a range of growth and retention metrics. The role has one direct report, our highly skilled, long-term CRM & Data Analyst.  We have a People first approach so let’s lead with our Values:  #Teamwork  Working together toward common goals in a collaborative and inclusive manner.  #Accountability  Working with urgency and a commitment to be successful from an individual perspective and a company perspective.  #Integrity  Being open and honest in all our dealings and always maintaining the highest integrity. Inspiring trust from others in the way we behave.  #Learning  A commitment for continuous improvement in how we work, to take risks outside our comfort zones and gain knowledge when we make mistakes.  #Support  To be supportive of each other and demonstrate respect for differences in opinion, always fostering open communication.  Your day-to-day activities will include • Manage and execute the business’s end-to-end CRM and data analysis campaigns • Continually audit processes and improve business efficiency and strategic results across multiple channels (Website, Direct Mail, Email, SMS etc.) • Identify and deliver innovation in the CRM and data analysis output • Champion and enhance the use of Marshall White’s CRM and data platforms • Manage the prioritisation of workflow for the CRM team, incl. management of one direct report; CRM & Data Analyst • Conduct weekly stakeholder updates and sprints, supporting quarterly sprints and reviews • Create and distribute clear, regular reporting to internal stakeholders with action-focused insights • Build business dashboards and reporting tools used for generating actionable insights • Enable targeting identification to assist Marketing in addressing customers with relevant and personalised offers leveraging analytics and big data solutions. • Support the Commercial, Sales and Marketing/Digital teams to be change agents within the business through the execution of ideas • Maintain healthy relationships with internal stakeholders and software suppliers • Support sales agents with CRM, Learning & Development and data-related inductions • Provide system support to all business units on CRM and associated industry software and tools • Complete daily data admin tasks and software management  To be successful in this role, your experience and skills ideally will include: • 5+ years’ experience translating CRM & Data into insights • Understanding of software, applications, data, and integration is essential • Google Analytics, Google Tag • Ability to learn and champion the following basic CRM software -Box+Dice, Campaign Track , Yellowfin • Proficient in interpreting data analysis • High level of verbal communication and presentation skills • Excellent English writing ability to translate data to laymen’s terms • Energetic and ability to self-manage priorities and problem-solving • Ability to learn new topics quickly and think creatively • Implementing technology and digital strategies  Benefits of Joining our team • Enjoying working within a dynamic and rewarding environment • Competitive salary, fun social events, and an inclusive work environment • Learning and development including internal and external training programs to build your career skills • An inclusive and diverse workplace centred on health, wellbeing and growth  Please note: only short-listed candidates meeting the required criteria will be contacted.  A Note to Recruiters: We have this role in hand; there is no need to approach us.
job_description.274: About the Role  As part of the wider Performance team, your role is to provide internal actuarial and analytics advice to the senior leadership team. This includes developing and maintaining actuarial models, preparing and reviewing reports (Board, AVR, FCR, ICAAP), developing monitoring tools, supporting with budgeting and underwriting, and providing business insights through AI/ML modelling techniques.  Key responsibilities – • Provide internal actuarial advice to the organisation • Work closely with external actuaries to review current processes, implement standard changes, negotiate reinsurance contracts and improve internal capabilities • Build analytical models to support internal decision making • Deliver insights into performance issues through data analysis, forecasting, dashboards, and financial reporting • Build and maintain analytical, actuarial, and financial models to guide business decisions • Create and test data integrity controls and triage architectural inefficiencies • Support the creation and maintenance of policies, standards, governance, processes, systems, and reporting to ensure ongoing data integrity interpretability • Assist with data governance to ensure records are in accordance with privacy, regulatory, fair trading, and competitor rules • Act as a mentor for a junior analyst to support the delivery of the Data and Analytics strategy  About You  You will have a strong understanding of data processes and technologies, actuarial methods, and machine learning algorithms. You are proficient using a broad range of analytical tools and are confident navigating these platforms to deliver data insights and business solutions. You are a true team player, happy to get stuck in across multiple different projects to deliver strategic outcomes and to share your knowledge to increase analytical acumen across the business.  You will have – • Significant actuarial experience for an Australian general, health, or life insurer • Demonstrated experience in actuarial modelling and financial analysis and reporting • The ability to interpret and translate complex data into concise reports and visualisations for non-technical audiences • A strong understanding of data-centric technology (e.g. Azure, SQLServer), programming languages, and statistical software programs (e.g. Python, R, Power BI, Tableau) • Strong problem solving, organisation, planning and project management skills • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a coaching and mentoring mindset • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline (fully or nearly qualified actuaries strongly encouraged to apply) • Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency  About MIPS  MIPS is a not-for-profit membership organisation that provides indemnity insurance and other benefits to over a quarter of Australia's doctors as well as dentists and other healthcare practitioners. Our 2023 ambition is to be an industry leader recognised for protecting healthcare professionals whilst they are caring for others.  MIPS benefits include - • Hybrid working • Centrally located CBD offices • Study support and membership allowance • Employee reward & recognition program • Retailer discounts and novated leasing • Ongoing professional development opportunities • Collaborative and supportive environment • Wellbeing initiatives and social events
job_description.275: About The Company  We are committed to building inclusive, integrity and diverse teams  At DiDi, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That‘s why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Employment and advancement decisions at DiDi are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.  We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that’s how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we’re a part of.  Didi Chuxing (“DiDi”) is the world’s leading mobile transportation and convenience platform. The company offers a full range of app-based transportation and life services for over 550 million users across Asia, Latin America, Australia, and Russia, including Taxi, Express, Premier, Luxe, Bus, Designated Driving, Enterprise Solutions, Bike Sharing, E-bike Sharing, Automobile Solutions, Food Delivery, and Payment. Tens of millions of drivers who find flexible work opportunities on the DiDi platform provide over 10 billion passenger trips a year.  DiDi is committed to collaborating with policymakers, the taxi industry, the automobile industry, and communities to solve the world’s transportation, and environmental, and employment challenges with localized smart transportation innovations by leveraging its AI capabilities. By continuously improving user experience and creating social value, DiDi strives to build a safe, inclusive, and sustainable mobile transportation and convenience ecosystem for cities of the future.  DiDi uses technology to improve mobility in our world. As such, we always look for people from every background who want to support our vision, through equal opportunity and nondiscriminatory, fair and impartial treatment, completely free of prejudice related to race, nationality, religion, gender, ethnicity, age, political affiliation, sexual preference, marital status, disabilities or family responsibilities.  For more information, please visit: www.didiglobal.com/news  About The Team/role  We are seeking a BI to play a crucial role in our business for future growth. In this role, you will report directly to the ANZ Operations Director, leveraging your expertise to transform our data analysis in the Australia & New Zealand Region into business insights. You will also be dedicated to making direct business impact with internal stakeholders like operations, product, tech, with daily data monitoring, and special project analysis.  In this role, you'll be...  Responsibilities: • Perform data analysis tasks, which will include operation and marketing campaign performance design and review, and will cover mechanical, programming, database disciplines. • Writing and maintaining Hive and Python script to generate business dashboard and automatic email report. • Writing and maintaining Hive and Python script to collect driver information automatically and validate this information through government’s public API. • Writing and maintaining Hive and Python script to collect driver information from different sources and format it into one consistent format, forward the info to the related party with detailed history records, which finally form a coherent reporting system. • Reviewing, writing and revising program code to meet operation and business requirement, diagnosing and correcting errors in existing database and product logic. • Manage and analyze large volumes of complex data through advanced digital analytics information systems that require SQL, Python etc. • Understand the BAU projects that ANZ BI team managing, which include various reporting system based on Tableau, Excel, DataE, Insight. • Use SQL, Excel, and other tools to help prepare supporting data as backup of other team’s output when there is a need. • Use SQL, Apollo, Tag-system to provide insight from data perspective for cross functional teams on initiating the business action plan for city launch, which assist whole ANZ business. • Use Excel, Python, DataE, Tableau to address ad-hoc analysis of business issues to better support Operating team in guiding the driver and rider on boarding process. • Make judgments in all of the department he attends. The line manager will review and approve all judgments  Requirement: • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Data Science, or Computer Science. Master's degree is preferred. Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in data analysis. • Proficiency in using common analysis and modeling tools such as strong proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Excel, SQL, R/Python, and familiarity with experimental design and evaluation methods. • Experience in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning techniques is highly desirable. • Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple priorities.  We're eager to be in touch because you have...  You'll love working at DiDi because...  We create user value  We strive to always create valuable experiences for our users in everything we do. Our focus is to always innovate new experiences that are safe, pleasant and efficient.  We are data-driven  We are strong believers in making informed decisions, that’s why we are data-driven. We can better navigate the business landscape strategically by analyzing valuable metrics.  Win-win Collaboration  Success is a team sport. When we work to help our partners and colleagues win, we win, too. While keeping everyone's best interest at heart, we communicate with candor and execute with excellence in all we do.  We believe in integrity  Integrity is at the very core of our business. We are people who always want to do the right thing. Our intentions are sincere, we speak our minds and listen to each other.  Growth  We always strive to do better. That means venturing beyond our comfort zones, learning from our mistakes, and helping each other grow.  Diversity and Inclusion  Diversity is one of our biggest strengths. Our differences are what make us distinct. We respect each other and believe in equal opportunities for all.  We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams  At DiDi, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That’s why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Employment and advancement decisions at DiDi are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.  We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that’s how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we’re a part of.
job_description.276: Our Networks & IT team  We believe it is people who give purpose to our technology. So we're committed to staying close to our customers and providing them the best experience, and delivering the best tech on the best network. Because our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. And, for you, that means incredible opportunities to be challenged, to innovate, and grow your career.  We fully embrace flexibility and choice at Telstra and it's as unique as you. We believe every role can flex in some way and encourage you to work where, when, and how you are most engaged, safe, and productive. Talk to us about how a role could be flexible for you!  The Role  This is an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineering Chapter Lead to use their expertise and capabilities to build and manage Telstra's data environment as well the design, development and delivery of data products throughout its lifecycle.  You will be a critical team member to drive the data governance, quality assurance, metadata management, and data lineage tracking. We design and implement efficient data pipelines for ingestion, curation, cataloguing exposing data and maintaining data quality standards.  You will be a part of a chapter who can design scalable and robust data architectures, incorporating data modelling, data warehousing, data lakes, and hybrid cloud architectures. Our focus is on creating architecture solutions that can handle large volumes of data while ensuring reliability and scalability.  Key Responsibilities • Lead a Data & AI Architecture Chapter providing people leadership whilst performing chapter 'operate' functions • Contribute to Mission related work • Develop and execute against target state data architecture, roadmap and transition plans, leveraging best practice, emerging trends and technology to enable the business. • Data modelling of acquisition, extraction, transformation, movement, delivery, replication, federation, virtualization and operational • Contribute to planning and delivery activities, including identifying resource capacity and resource capability to drive operational performance outcomes. • Use your deep domain expertise to build capability to define the target state architecture for data solutions, identifying opportunities for efficiencies and ensuring investment alignment across the organisation  Key experience and expertise you would bring to the role would include: • Experience working in enterprise data platforms (Data Warehousing, Data Governance and Quality, Analytics or AI) • Strong understanding of Data Discovery, Data wrangling, TEL and manipulation • Strong understanding and practical experience in data quality, management and governance frameworks and methodologies • Strong understanding of Data visualisation and Ad hoc data quality remediation • Practical experience in one or more of: AI and Analytics, Data Architecture, Data Engineering, preferably in the context of a significant program of work such as a data warehouse program or transformation program  Our perks & benefits: • Flexible working. Wherever you live, choose where, when, and how you work so you can be at your best. • 16 weeks paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers • Professional development program • An epic (free) Telstra mobile phone plan • Laptop/Device allowance renewed every 2 years • Purchased Annual Leave scheme • Discounted Telstra products and services • There when life happens. From Pandemic Leave to Compassionate Leave, we give you time to spend away from work when you need it most. • Pay for performance. We recognise outstanding contributions through our generous incentive programs  If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!  ___________________________  We're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce in all its forms. We encourage applicants from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds and applicants who may be living with a disability. We also offer flexibility in all our roles, to ensure everyone can participate.  To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment process, visit tel.st/thrive.
job_description.277: See job description for details  Excellent Senior Data Analyst opportunity (Cloud Tech Stack) • Senior Data Analyst with experience in Snowflake cloud preferred • Finance Industry experience preferable • Flexible Work Arrangement (2 days in office) • Australian PR or citizenship mandatory Your new company You will be joining a leading financial services company that provides innovative solutions to clients across various sectors. The company is based in Melbourne and has a strong reputation for delivering high-quality outcomes and excellent customer service.  Your new role As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting data from various sources, such as financial reports, market trends, customer feedback, and operational performance. Do data mapping using Genesys Cloud (Telephony Vendor) as the source (raw data) and transform the data or create data mapping rules to create the data in conformed stage. You will use your analytical skills and tools to provide insights and recommendations to support business decisions and strategies. You will also prepare and present data visualisations and reports communicating your findings and suggestions to stakeholders. Work with Data Engineers in the project to explain the rules, so that they can engineer the mapping and deliver the outcomes. Work with reporting BA / BI Manager and Business users to assist creation of BI reports.  What you'll need to succeed To be considered for this role, you will have: • A degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field • At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the financial services industry • Experience with SQL, previous exp with Genesys is a bonus but not a requirement • Knowledge of cloud such as snowflake also a bonus • Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, or other data analysis tools • The ideal candidate needs to demonstrate the ability to produce very detailed data mapping documents, source to target mapping. • Strong stakeholder management, communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment • Attention to detail and accuracy What you'll get in return In return for your hard work and dedication, you will receive: • Competitive salary package • Supportive and dynamic team culture • An opportunity to work on challenging and rewarding projects • Chance to enhance your skills and career prospects Call to Action If you are interested in this role and meet the above criteria, kindly apply with your resume. Alternately, you can directly email me your resume at Kanika.Behl@hays.com.au #2812524
job_description.278: Company Description  Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.  When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.  Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.  Job Description  Sr Data Analyst, Managed Services  Melbourne (Australia)  About the role:  Do you want to be a part of Visa’s fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand? Do you enjoy delivering and getting things done? Do you want to make positive impacts for customers and accelerate the pace of innovation in the payments industry? If so, Visa Managed Services (VMS) is the team for you.  The VMS team is all about delivery, implementation, and execution. We create squads of delivery consultants to embed within our clients’ organizations to help them deliver better results, faster.’  If you're a Data Analyst who loves data, create insights, solve challenging business problems and want to use your skills for the greater good… then we have the perfect role for you!  Why join us: • This role will support a key strategic client in Australia helping them deliver on their bank-wide, large-scale simplification agenda. • Visa Managed Services is our fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand – we’ve grown 10x in less than 2 years – and always have fun projects on the horizon to sink our teeth into • We get to work with incredible people every day. We’re a team of intrapreneurs who work hard, have fun, and get stuff done. • We are a people business where the people are our product. As a result, all our people leaders are 100% dedicated to ensuring a positive employee experience. We attract top talent and are manically focused on developing and retaining that talent at Visa. • We are committed to building a diverse team with an inclusive culture that reflects the communities we work in • We’re a global company and VMS is a global focus area for Visa. Once established in our Australia team, you’ll have the opportunity to explore roles focused on scaling our VMS business around the world. • We support flexible working options and industry leading compensation & benefits.  Join us and make a difference today.  What you will be doing:  Ideally based in Melbourne but with hybrid work options, you will develop and maintain dashboards to understand the performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. Your responsibilities will include transforming data for use in creation, maintenance, and automation of the dashboards. You will work closely with the Data Delivery Lead, Product Consultant and Client Portfolio lead to build dashboards, generate insights, solve business problems using customer and transactional data.  In this role you will: • Explore our clients’ data infrastructure and systems, analyse various datasets, perform data analysis, finding patterns and generating valuable insights to support critical business initiatives and present them back to the business teams. • Build dashboards to visualize insights and understand behaviour of customers or understand performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. • Perform ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. • Producing written communication, visualizations and presentations for leadership and other key stakeholders.  What you will bring:  Key competencies: • Solution-mindset – Applying creative problem-solving techniques and championing a client-first approach to customer insights when opportunities and challenges arise to meet specific business objectives. • Active Contributor to Team Success – Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style. Able to work effectively in a matrixed organization. • Tenacity – Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently. • Building Strategic Work Relationships - Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management • Driving Execution – Motivated by delivery and with a high attention to detail.  What you will need to be successful: • Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level. • Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred. • Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred. • Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred. • Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling) • Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred. • Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights. • An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly.  You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At Visa a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.  What will also help: • High performance delivery focus with a high attention to detail • Strong communication skills to make complex concepts accessible for business stakeholders. • Ability to influence and collaborate at all levels without relying on hierarchy. • Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, flexible style and able to work effectively across multiple teams. • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. • Outcome orientated, persistence to challenge the status quo and deliver customer results. • A Growth mindset, constantly striving to learn and develop. • Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management • Innovation minded with high problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor. • Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently.  Why Work with us: • We are known for offering industry-leading compensation. • We have state of the art offices in Melbourne, Sydney, and Auckland • We provide world class benefits including: • Mental health and wellbeing resources to all employees • Generous annual leave plus carers leave, parental leave, baby bonding leave, and pregnancy loss leave, among others • Paid volunteering leave & employee referral program cash awards. • Ability to work from another location for up to 1 month each year. • Global company with global opportunities. We can share endless stories of how we’ve supported our employees to accelerate their career progression and pursue opportunities in other geographies around the world.  This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.  Qualifications  • Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level. • Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred. • Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred. • Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred. • Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling) • Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred. • Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights. • An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly.  Additional Information  Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
job_description.279: As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting roll out of data governance framework, lead development and automation of finance and business intelligence reports using Tableau and Power BI and implement strong controls for gas and cylinder stock management across terminals.
job_description.280: Job Description  Location: Melbourne | CBD  Job type: Full time  Organisation: Victorian School Building Authority  Salary: $129,379 - $173,138  Occupation: Asset Management and Planning  Reference: VG/DE/VSBA/20013928  The role of the Department of Education is to support Victorians to build prosperous, socially engaged, happy and healthy lives. It does this by supporting lifelong learning and healthy development, strengthening families and helping to equip people with the skills and knowledge for a 21st century economy and society.  All VSBA staff have a shared responsibility to meet the same service standards outlined in the VSBA Customer Service Charter.  Our goal is to make every interaction with the VSBA a positive one for our customers, colleagues and key partners regardless of our individual role or team.  The Principal Data Analyst role is responsible for leading data analysis and management work to support the implementation of the Government's Pre-Prep Reform. As well, this role will be critical in supporting the continued successful roll out of Three-Year Old Kindergarten.  The role sits within the Early Childhood Infrastructure Planning - State Projects Branch and will be part of the leadership team of the Branch. This role will also work closely with the Early Childhood Infrastructure and Planning - Sector Partnerships Branch.  This role will be responsible for working with teams across the Branches, VSBA and Department to support critical functions needed to develop and embed data systems and processes to deliver the infrastructure needed for Pre- Prep and Three-Year-Old Kindergarten. This role will have a high degree of autonomy and will be self-motivated and driven to produce results through collaboration.  Key components of this role include program and project planning, data analysis and management, and reporting. Some policy development will be required. An ability to develop and deliver key data systems and process will be key. In addition, the candidate will have excellent stakeholder engagement skills, which will be required to build and maintain strong relationships. Candidates will have proven data analysis, program/project management and implementation experience, preferably relating to supporting delivery of complex projects and programs. Early Candidates will also be able to demonstrate their ability to lead, and work confidently and constructively with stakeholders to ensure the successfully delivery of the Reform.  The successful candidate will have proven abilities to:  Establish and oversee the management of data/information management systems and processes to monitor and track the implementation of the Reform, as well as critical infrastructure projects, ensuring the accuracy and currency of information and updating information as required.  Work collaboratively across the Branches to incorporate all key data and information into reports, briefs, correspondence and other critical reporting and governance processes.  Build relationships across the Department and with other stakeholders.  Work with management to implement a culture of continuous improvement.  Candidates will have significant experience with a range of data/information management tools, systems and processes, such as Excel, Power BI, Microsoft Access, etc, proven leadership experience, preferably relating to complex government programs in a government setting. Candidates will also be able to demonstrate their ability to work confidently and constructively with stakeholders.  The executive team in Early Childhood Infrastructure Planning - State Projects Branch in the VSBA are committed to growing our staff, and the successful candidate will have the support they need to deliver and expand on their current skill set.  Applications must include a resume and a Cover letter that responds to each of the Key Selection Criteria (no more than 3 pages). For more details regarding this position please see attached position description or contact Jess Spiers for a confidential discussion.  For more details regarding this position please see attached position descriptions.  The Department values diversity and inclusion in all forms - gender, religion, ethnicity, LGBTIQ+, disability and neurodiversity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. For more information about our work, working for the Department, diversity and inclusion, and our employment conditions visit the Department website , HRWeb and our Diversity and Inclusion page  Applicants requiring adjustments can contact the nominated contact person  Information about the Department of Education and Training's operations and employment conditions can be obtained from the following websites: www.education.vic.gov.au and http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/Pages/default.aspx.  Applications close Monday 23 October, 2023
job_description.281: About the Opportunity:  Kinetic IT have recently partnered with a major Federal Government department to provide Enterprise Service Management and provide a comprehensive range of IT Service Management and SIAM practices across the organisation!  We are now on the lookout for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team to further enhance our service integration and management capabilities.  About you:  Your expertise in data visualisation and continuous improvement recommendations will ensure our stakeholders will be making informed decisions, identifying opportunities for improvement and driving continual service enhancement within the SIAM ecosystem. You will play a vital role in collecting, analysing and presenting performance data to support data-driven decision making. You will also be supporting root cause analysis during major incidents and assisting in trend forecasting and SLA compliance analysis.  Day to day your duties will include: • Ensuring data accuracy, completeness and consistency within the SIAM ecosystem • Cleaning and pre-processing of data, ensuring it is ready for analysis. • Creating reporting frameworks (dashboards, scorecards and periodic reports) to present performance data to senior leaders • Root cause analysis • Designing of data collection methods to gather performance data from various service providers and create a comprehensive view of service performance.  Sound like a role for you? You’ll need some of the following: • Hold ACTIVE status & maintain a minimum Government Security Clearance • Experience with data analytics in an ITIL-aligned enterprise environment • Experience in ServiceNow and ServiceNow dashboards and reporting solutions • High level technical writing (for processes and framework design), reporting and documentation skills. • Cognos reporting • Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Data Tools and/ or Visual Studio Reporting Services • Microsoft Power Pivot, Excel, Performance Analytics • Experience performing data extraction from data warehouses. • Experience writing SQL Queries  The Kinetic IT Difference • Flexible working, paid parental leave, and other benefits tailored to your individual goals. • Regular fun company and social events – Sundowner, Family Fun Day, Quiz Night and End of Year Party • Vendor Exam Support, ITIL V4 Training and Communities of Practice groups • Dedicated professional development reviews every 6 months, with monthly follow ups • An open and supportive culture where we respect all people and individuals, and everyone has a voice  About KineticIT  We are recognised market leaders in the delivery of high-quality technology solutions to large public, private, and government organisations. As an Australian-owned company, we take a lot of pride in delivering exceptional service that exceeds our customers’ expectations and positively contributing to our industry and community. We hire for the long term and have a strong focus on training and developing our employees. Everyday our amazing 1,300+ crew come to Kinetic IT not just to work but to be challenged, grow and be part of something bigger.  Check out more at kineticit.com.au  How To Apply  First, check out our website Kineticit.com.au. If you like what you see then, click on the ‘Apply’ button or contact our careers account on careers@kineticit.com.au and quote ‘data analyst’
job_description.282: We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analyst for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.  This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.  Requirements Full Professional Proficiency in English You must be living in Australia for the last 2 consecutive years Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Australia Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance) Applicants must be 18 years or over. ID verification must be attached when submitting your application.  Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.  Why Join the TELUS International AI Community? Earn extra income Access to our community wellbeing initiative Remote work & Location Independence Be your own boss
job_description.283: About the role  Job Title: Data Analyst - ANZ Plus  Location: Melbourne preferred  Blended Working Model • Work in an agile way to innovate and deliver quality outcomes at pace • Be a part of our Australian Business Transformation, and work with people who are passionate about redefining banking for the future • Join a progressive organisation with the people and policies you want  At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Data Analyst to join our Data Enablement chapter within our Australian Business Transformation. Your mission is to derive compelling insights and identify opportunities to shape the direction of our customer experience. You will be working within a cross functional team and driving end to end delivery of insights.  Your key accountabilities will include: • Work with agile teams on identifying analytical opportunities • Curating and modelling data to ascertain customer and business value • Visualising outcome and presenting compelling opportunities to stakeholders  What will your day look like • Embedding within Agile teams you will be individually accountable to ensure that quantitative analysis is performed across a number of customer and business driven use cases • You will be working with key product owners to formulate details hypotheses to work on which will fundamentally change the direction of the squad • Working with data will be a key part of the role including the need to discover, identify, curate and model the data appropriately to drive insights • All insights will need to be presented back to key stakeholder and will require the development of interactive reports and dashboards  What will you bring?  We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.  But back to some of the skills – • Strong BI expertise, Visualization, Tableau highly advantageous • Data Discovery against business objectives • Definition of Metrics and Translation to data Model • Data Modelling, able to design data model /concept and understand the solution architecture in Cloud infrastructure • Requirements Gathering / Gap Analysis: Business consulting interaction, Documentation • Data manipulation: translation, prototyping, problem solving • Technical data expertise: strong SQL – Big Query/Cloud highly advantageous  You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.  So, why join us?  There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.  But it’s not just our customers who’ll feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.  We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements.  You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.  To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 43011  Job Posting End Date  October 19, 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)
job_description.284: We are seeking a confident Workforce Data Analyst to join our knowledgeable team at University of Melbourne in Melbourne.  Growing your career as a Full Time Workforce Data Analyst is an unparalleled opportunity to develop excellent skills. If you are strong in planning, strategic planning and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Workforce Data Analyst at University of Melbourne today! Workforce Data Analyst Job no : 0059331 & 0059315 Location : Parkville Role type : Full-time;  Continuing Department : Human Resources - Office of the Provost Salary : UOM 7- $102,338- $110,780 p.a. plus 17% super Provide insights and analytics for the University's workforce Fantastic opportunity to join a highly motivated, supportive and inclusive team 17% super, generous leave benefits, 25% discount on courses for you and your family, and a flexible hybrid work environment! About the Role Make a positive impact on the heart of the University of Melbourne's workforce in an opportunity rich environment by maintaining and improving datasets and workforce information throughout the University.  Join the quest to shape our culture and practices by being a part of a "community of practice" of reporting colleagues across the university in central functions, such as IT, Finance and Student Services.  Workforce Data Analyst responsibilities include : Sources and pragmatically stages data from HR systems to support a range of business reporting requirements Reviews staged data on a regular basis to ensure its continued and ongoing relevance to end user processes Maintains contemporaneous documentation around data supporting key reporting processes and artifacts including necessary definitions, transformation rules and purpose Engages with the WorkDay ERP Program to support cut-over of data and reporting processes Workforce Reporting Officer responsibilities include : Delivers regular and ad hoc reporting to University stakeholders Reviews and regularly updates standard reporting artifacts for University stakeholders Co-ordinates the delivery of regular Workforce reporting for external stakeholders (eg.  WGEA Reporting) Supports HR stakeholders in their understanding of, and ability to interpret workforce and service reporting and metrics Who we are looking for Are you skilled at juggling tasks, working with integrity and implementing order and consistency?  We are looking for someone who is great with data and great with people, who can communicate with a diverse range of stakeholders Essential Skills include : Tertiary qualification / s in a relevant discipline, and / or demonstrated equivalent professional experience Demonstrated experience in developing and delivering reporting and / or pragmatic data solutions, ideally related to HR and / or workforce information Experience working in the higher education sector or a similar regulatory environment will be highly regarded Experience working with confidential HR, OHS and organisational data with respect for information privacy.  Demonstrated experience with a range of reporting tools and solutions. Ideally MS Office Applications (including Excel and Power BI) Ability to create and maintain documentation regarding technical processes at a level that can be understood and referenced by non-technical users Workforce Data Analystwill also have : Experience with native reporting capabilities of modern and legacy HRIS.  Superior Excel skills are essential. Familiarity with Oracle / PeopleSoft and WorkDay systems highly regarded Workforce Reporting Officerwill also have : Experience with cloud-based HRIS reporting such as WorkDay would be highly regarded For further information regarding responsibilities and requirements please refer to the attached PD.  To ensure the University continues to provide a safe environment for everyone, this position requires the incumbent to hold a current and valid Working with Children Check.  This role requires current valid work rights for Australia. Your new team - "Human Resources" This function is responsible for developing the people strategy to support the University's strategic plan and is accountable for the performance and delivery of the Human Resources function across the University.  It provides policy, industrial relations, governance and other critical advice and guidance ensuring that the University is compliant and cohesive whilst creating a culture that attracts and retains talent.  The function is also responsible for creating and maintaining a safe workplace where people can thrive and do their best work.  What we offer you! In addition to working in an opportunity rich environment, you will be part of a vibrant community and a enjoy a range of benefits including generous leave provisions, salary packaging, health and well-being services and discounts on graduate courses.  For more information check out our benefits page! The University of Melbourne We're tightly connected with community, both at home and abroad.  We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research.  Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on . Be yourself We value the unique backgrounds, experiences and contributions that each person brings to our community.  For more information please visit our Diversity and Inclusion page. We encourage and welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds.  We are dedicated to ensuring barrier free and inclusive practices to recruit the most talented candidates. If you require any reasonable adjustments with the recruitment process, please contact us at hr-talent .  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants We welcome and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.  We recognise that reconciliation is central to our purpose. For more information please visit our our Reconciliation page.  Join Us! If you feel this role is right for you, please apply with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest and experience.  Please note that you are not required to provide responses against the selection criteria in the Position .
