job_description.285: Description  We are currently seeking a motivated and experienced Data Analyst on a permanent, full-time basis to review data to identify key insights, and solve problems and be able to communicate this information to various stakeholders across the organisation.  The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.  Key duties of the role include: • Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality. • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. • Work with management to prioritise business and information needs. • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.  Requirements  What you can bring to the role:  Essential: • Tertiary level qualification/s in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. • At least three years of experience in a Data Analyst role. • Proven analytical skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization. • Strong SQL, SSRS and Power BI skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools. • Current National Police Certificate (or ability to acquire). • Applicant must be based in Australia.  Desirable: • Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques. • Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, Javascript, and ETL. • Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages including Excel, SPSS, and SAS. • Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.  Benefits  What We Offer: In return for your dedication and expertise, we offer: • * Competitive remuneration and benefits • Attractive pay incentives, along with not-for-profit salary packaging. • The chance to engage in purposeful work within a values-driven organisation. • Long-term job security in an industry resistant to economic fluctuations. • A thriving, positive organisational culture that prioritizes well-being. • Abundant prospects for personal and professional growth through learning and development initiatives. • Discounted health insurance.
job_description.286: Position overview Reporting to the Manager Technical Capability and Capability the primary responsibility of the Data Analyst is to continue to build, expand and maintain the existing data analytics platform. The Data Analyst will work with structured and unstructured data and has experience working with and integrating data from a variety of sources, including Google Analytics, Survey Monkey, YouTube, Channel Management System (CXOne) and other internal systems, to generate accurate and insightful data analysis and visualisation reports using PowerBI, advanced Excel or Power Apps. Working with internal data owners to primarily source data, develop and maintain reports that inform the development of education resources and measure the effectiveness of those education resources. In addition, the Data Analyst will provide insights into Channel Management System data to develop and implement efficiencies in the Building and Plumbing Technical and Regulatory Team and perform other data analysis functions to inform the implementation of new regulatory tools. Who we are looking for • experience in delivering insightful analysis & Power BI reporting solutions on the Azure platform • proven excellence in analytical thinking and the translation of complex unstructured and structured data into informative visuals, reports and actionable insights. • demonstrated ability to be pro-active, professional, customer-focused, organised, and self-managed to deliver a consistently high level of output and service in a deadline and fast-paced environment.  VBA Commitment We value diversity and inclusion in all forms - gender, religion, ethnicity, LGBTIQ+, disability and neurodiversity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. We're hoping to find a broad range of experiences, and people from all backgrounds and communities to join us at the VBA. We invite you to talk to us about any preferences or adjustments you may need to either our recruitment process or the role itself. If you identify as a person with disability, please let us know how we can provide additional support to your application. If this is you, please don't hesitate to get in touch via recruit@vba.vic.gov.au. We value and encourage flexibility for all, and so we support all our roles to be worked flexibly in some way, including part-time, to support a diverse, adaptive, and high-performing workforce. We encourage you to discuss flexible work options with the hiring manager during the recruitment process. Working at the VBA - what you can expect • A hybrid working model • Challenging work and a continuous learning environment • Flexible work options including part-time, compressed work schedules, flexible start and finish times, and purchased leave options. • A competitive salary, 11% superannuation  How to Apply We require you to upload: • A detailed copy of your resume • A cover letter outlining your relevant experience and how you feel it aligns to the role.  Applications Close: Midnight 18th October 2023  Important information • Only electronic applications submitted via careers.vic.gov.au will be accepted. • Candidates deemed suitable from a selection process may be considered for identical or similar vacancies within 6 months.
job_description.287: About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.  Get to Know our Team:  The Supply Equity Platform (SEP) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SEP team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including resource and product optimization. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce high quality results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SEP offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.  In this Role, you’ll get to:  • Manage complex analytics processes and algorithms to ensure their continued smooth operation, identifying root causes and debugging them where needed. • Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organization. • Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at improving the operations of our automated systems (e.g. root cause detection, anomaly detection, performance analysis). • Develop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting them. • Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving resource and product optimization.  What you’ll Need to Succeed: • A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping. • Either Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive programming experience. • Experience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must). • Have working experience in Python for data analysis. • A basic understanding of statistics and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations. • The ability to visualize and understand complex data flows, pipelines, and processes.  It’s Great if you have: • Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark. • Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality.  #sanfrancisco #newyork #seattle #boston #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #paris #london #tokyo #dhaka #vienna #edinburgh #manchester #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #singapore #ENG #IT  Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.  We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .  To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
job_description.288: About the Role  An exciting opportunity to join BOQ as a Senior Data Management Analyst during our transformation journey. By joining the digital bank of the future, you will be able to make a difference with integrity and empathy, overseeing the successful and effective analysis of the data quality capability adding significant value to our organisation.  As a Senior Data Management Analyst, you will be working closely with the Group Technology Team that consists of Business Analysts, Developers and Testers. Reporting to the Manager of Data Management, you will be responsible for supporting the execution of data initiatives that enable our bankers to have access to trusted, governed and easily available data which supports their needs.  In this role you will ensure data management practices are conducted in line with statutory, regulatory, audit and risk expectations. Furthermore, you will support operations of the Data Management Framework which includes data principles, policy, standards, and guidelines ensuring their pragmatic and beneficial application to data platforms and the wider data ecosystem. You will also be involved in conducting awareness and training initiatives to create a measurable uplift in data literacy and data handling skills across the bank.  About you  As an experienced data management and analytics professional, you will be a collaborative outcome and people focussed individual who thrives on working in a fast-paced environment. You will have 6+ years of experience working in enterprise data platforms (Data Warehousing, Data Analytics Data Governance or BI) with an ability to manipulate and analyse large amounts of data using SQL queries and map data from source to target.  Alongside your experience working with third party vendors and developing lasting relationships to ensure success, you will have a strong understanding and practical experience in data quality, data management/governance frameworks and methodologies.  About Us  BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.  BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.  BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.  Since BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).  Our Benefits Flexible working arrangements Discounted financial products Salary sacrificing options Paid parental leave with no minimum Paid volunteer days Purchase annual leave Discounted private health insurance plan Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 5 employee diversity network groups focusing on: First Nations Reconciliation Council, Proudly ME (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index
job_description.289: Infosys Consulting is the worldwide management and IT consultancy unit of the Infosys Group (NYSE: INFY), a global advisor to leading companies for strategy, process engineering, and technology-enabled transformation programs.We partner with clients to design and implement customized solutions to address their complex business challenges, and to help them in a post-modern ERP world. By combining innovative and human-centric approaches with the latest technological advances, we enable organizations to reimagine their future and create sustainable and lasting business value.A pioneer in breaking down the barriers between strategy and execution, Infosys Consulting delivers superior business value to its clients by advising them on strategy, process optimisation, and IT-enabled transformation. To find out how we go beyond the expected to deliver the exceptional, visit us at www.infosysconsultinginsights.com Infosys Consulting – is a real consultancy for real consultants.RequirementsWe have an opportunity available for a Data Analyst - Energy Solutions - Consultant / Senior Consultant to join our Team.Role: Data Analyst - Energy SolutionsLocation: MelbournePermanent or Fixed Term contract – 12 months with Possible extensionsRequirements: • Understanding and supporting the data needs of the business designer and product owner. • Data analysis and exploration : Perform upfront discovery of the data hub and determine if the data is accurate and reliable for the use case. Consider how to get the data into Datahub if it is not already there. • Define the data requirements for the delivery team. • Collaboration with the data engineers and reporting teams for the delivery of prototypes and proofs of concept. • Identify and lead the resolution of data-related issues.Must have skills:Knowledge of relational databases, AWS services, data modelling, data integration, understanding of data warehousing concepts, Oil and gas industry knowledge, proficiency in Excel, ETL processes, data governance, data security etcDesirable : Energy trading & shipping (T&S)BenefitsWe welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills, and personality. We believe that employing a diverse workforce is the right thing to do and is central to our success.We offer you great opportunities within a dynamically growing consultancy. You will elaborate and deliver best practice solutions and will be able to further develop your solution design, implementation, and project management skills. At Infosys Consulting you will discover a truly global culture, highly dedicated and motivated colleagues, a cooperative work environment and interesting training opportunities.
job_description.290: Join a collaborative team and deliver great employee experiences.  Experience Hybrid working arrangements in a flexible environment  Permanent role based in either Melbourne or Sydney  We're REA  REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.  With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.  Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women.  Where the team fits in  The Data and Insights Analyst sits within the People & Culture team, headed up by Mary Lemonis,  Chief People and Sustainability Officer. From building management capability and the next  generation of leaders, to creating a diversity and inclusion strategy which is mainstreamed and  embedded into everything we do – the People & Culture team is all about making REA Group a great place to work. Supporting our multi-national business with HR processes, policies and systems to meet the needs of our people around the world, the team works to build high engagement with our impressive offering of programs and benefits.  What the role is all about  We are looking for a technically focussed Data and Insights Analyst who is passionate about People data and insights. You’ll be supporting the People & Culture team with key employee life cycle activities related to our specialist functions of Remuneration, Payroll and Work Health and Safety. You’ll contribute your subject matter expertise and work with a wide a range of activities and stakeholders.  Working closely with our Remuneration Manager, managing job evaluations, equity administration and cyclical rem processes like year end reviews and market data submissions, ensuring an efficient process, up to date information and fit for purpose solutions  Reviewing and supporting current WHS processes and policies, and determining what potential efficiencies can be made using technology and effective collaboration with key stakeholders  Assisting with payroll reporting, in particular making the best use of our new payroll reporting functionality in the Ramco payroll system.  Using modelling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, identify, and analyse data.  Who we’re looking for  Intermediate to advanced Excel skills  Super strong attention to detail  Strong background and demonstrated experience in reporting and analytics, data science, continuous improvement  General problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively  Work productively in a fast-paced environment  Relevant qualification associated with data and analytics will be preferable  Data Analytics - using modeling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, identify, and analyze data.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the sensitivity to understand audience needs and adapt style accordingly  Translating business requirements into clear, concise, testable and accurate user stories & process flows;  Time management and prioritisation  Experience working with HR/ People analytics  Experience with Workday & Ramco is advantageous but not essential  Broad knowledge and understanding of people management principles and practices  Ability to work independently and cooperatively with business and technical resources  The REA experience  The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.  We offer:  A hybrid and flexible approach to working - https://rea.to/hybrid-working  Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers  Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing  Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity.  Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life  Performance recognition programs because hard work should never go unnoticed  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe teams with diverse ideas and experiences are more creative, more eﬀective and fuel disruptive thinking - be it cultural and ethnic backgrounds, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other identity or lived experience. We know diverse teams are critical to maintaining our success and driving new business opportunities. If you've got the skills, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.  If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?
job_description.291: Company Description  illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion is headquartered in Melbourne with offices in all major metropolitan cities across Australia and New Zealand. Our team work with leading brands in our region to bring data & analytics to life!  Job Description  Your new role and how you’ll make a difference  Our Data and Insights Analysts are charged with the fulfilment of Data Services requests within our Service Level Agreement, as well as maintaining systems and information that provide our customers with the most optimum data specific to their needs! Qualifications  The experience and qualifications you’ll need to be successful • Customer service focus, high standards and ethical values. • A desire to contribute to the long-term strategy of service quality within illion. • Experience with Python or R Languages • SAS experience, SQL experience • 1-3 years of experience in a related field and Tertiary qualification, i.e. Business / Mathematics / Science / Engineering / IT tertiary degree. • Experience with Python or R Language  Additional Information  Some of our perks • Flexibility and Remote Working Options • Gifted Leave, Purchased Leave, Public Holiday Swap and Paid Volunteer Leave • Paid Parental Leave • Novated Leasing and Corporate Discounts (ie. Health Insurance) • Education Assistance and dedicated time for professional development as part of your role • Free Employee Assistance Programme, Free Flu Shots and Subsidised Gym Memberships.  illion’s values  Wonder what if  We wonder on many levels. About ideas. And about how others see them. We listen with curiosity. Obsess the numbers. And embrace new ways to make data, make a difference  We’re good eggs  Everything we do is built on integrity. We hold ourselves to high standards. And higher principles. We act with good intentions. Taking every opportunity to be that little bit better.  Human. Kind  People are the hart of our products, processes and culture. Our relationships are a gift. We’re inclusive. Measuring the impact of our actions on other’s first. Kindness and humanity prevail.  We all add up  We work wonders when we work together. Our diverse perspectives and backgrounds make us greater than the sum of our parts. We’re one team, where every single one of us counts.  How to Apply  To apply, please click “Apply Now” button and we will be in touch shortly.  Due to the sensitive data that illion works with, employment at illion is subject to employees having full working rights for Australia and/or New Zealand and successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.  Here at illion, we value diversity and inclusion and believe that we are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. job_description.296: Apply Job no: 8MGGX Luxury Escapes is one of the world's fastest growing travel businesses, reaching up to 6 million subscribers each month with exclusive limited time offers at 'insider' prices. Here at Luxury Escapes, our mission is to delight our customers with incredible deals for the world's best holidays. We are a collective of forward-thinking people, driven to challenge the travel industry and ourselves to bring ever better travel experiences to our customer community. Our award winning employee experience is king here having been recognised as "One of the Best Places to Work' by the AFR in both 2021 and 2023, with weekly events, monthly recognition programs and significant professional development opportunities we do what we can to make you look forward to waking up every day! We are now seeking a highly skilled and analytical Senior Data Analyst who will be support our marketing activities. Playing a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making, measuring marketing campaign effectiveness, and optimizing marketing strategies; your expertise in data analysis and reporting will be instrumental in supporting our performance marketing initiatives, enabling Luxury Escapes to maximize ROI and achieve business goals. Please note, it is essential that you have extensive commercial SQL experience to be successful in this role. You will be responsible for: Become the SME for Luxury Escapes' customers and performance marketing channels including conversion data, customer journeys, funnel analysis, and attribution as well as the modern data and analytics technology stack with emphasis on Google Analytics, AppsFlyer, Snowplow, Tableau and Looker (Data Studio). Collect, clean, and analyse marketing data to extract valuable insights and identify trends. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) for marketing campaigns. Provide regular performance reports to stakeholders, highlighting key findings and actionable recommendations. Conduct A/B testing and multivariate analysis to optimize ad creatives, targeting, and bidding strategies. Analyse user behaviour across marketing channels to identify opportunities for conversion rate optimization. Track and report on funnel performance metrics, including acquisition, activation, retention, and revenue. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement strategies for improving funnel efficiency. Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data governance processes and performing regular data audits. Generate actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making. What we are looking for: Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. A postgrad degree would be highly regarded . Commercial experience as a Data Analyst or similar role within the performance marketing domain. Strong analytical skills with expertise in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization using tools such as SQL, Python, R, or Excel. Proficiency in data visualization tools: Tableau, Google Looker (Data Studio). Experience with performance marketing platforms, such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, or Adobe Analytics. Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Please note we use SQL extensively, so require excellent SQL skills What's in it for you? Competitive remuneration package First class health and well-being program including annual vaccinations, yoga, meditation, gym discounts a, daily breakfasts and lunches provided 4 days a week. Fun working environment: Friday afternoon onsite gatherings (wine included!) and monthly celebration & recognition programs Discounted travel, birthday leave and a whole lot more! If this sounds like you and you feel you have the skills and experience to meet the requirements of the role, please apply online today! At Luxury Escapes we embrace diversity in our people and make hiring decisions based on experiences and skills. We do not discriminate based on gender identity, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. You'll find a collaborative, inclusive, and respectful workplace here at Luxury Escapes, and we are proud to celebrate who you are. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments during the interview process. We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant. job_description.297: About Cbus  Created by workers, for workers, Cbus Super is one of Australia’s most successful Superannuation funds. For almost four decades we’ve proudly represented those who help shape Australia, hard-working individuals who deserve to make the most of their retirement, no matter the industry. As an award-winning fund we’ve been recognised for the benefits provided to our members and our innovative investment approach. All while staying committed to our member first ethos as a proud Industry Fund.  About the role  The (Senior) Data Governance Analyst role sits within the Data Governance team and is responsible for collaborating with a range of internal & external stakeholders to understand their information needs and ensure Cbus’ data assets meet and/or exceed those needs within an acceptable level of cost and risk.  The Data Governance team has developed a framework to ensure Cbus’ data assets are well managed in accordance with policies, practices & techniques and meet the availability, quality, & security needs of all stakeholders. The (Senior) Data Governance Analyst plays a key role in helping the team bring the framework to life, embed it into the organisation’s change management & business-as-usual processes, and drive a strong data-centric culture.  In your role you will work with internal & external (business & technical) stakeholders to identify critical data, profile data, investigate data quality anomalies and issues and provide input into improving data quality.  You will also be responsible to work with the data governance team & projects to define, implement, & maintain metadata and reference data, and support users of the data catalog.  To be successful you will have approximately 5 years working in a similar role, with a strong knowledge and understanding of data management. You will have demonstrated experience working with data governance tools & technologies such as Alation, Bigeye, etc and possess strong SQL skills. Knowledge of / demonstrated experience using modern data management solutions such as Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, DataGrip, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, will also help you succeed.  As a person you will be very analytical, love solving problems and enjoy working collaboratively and being part of a team.  Belong at Cbus  We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. We believe that, with diversity of perspectives and experiences, you get better teams and outcomes. We’re looking for people of all genders, races, nationalities, orientations and of all abilities to join us.  We’re keen to hear from you  If you've read through the requirements of this role and you feel like you haven’t fully met the criteria, we would still encourage you to apply. We're aware of accessibility barriers when it comes to applying for a job and we want to help. If you require assistance with your application, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team via careers@cbussuper.com.au  Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website, cbussuper.com.au/careers  Applications Close: 13th October 2023  This is a full time position based in Melbourne  Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team. Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.

EY | Building a better working world  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

job_description.302: Good call. We’re an exciting new digital enterprise with big ideas, supporting some of Australia’s most trusted and iconic brands focussed on making lives better for people all around Australia. We’re well on our way towards bringing the best of digital and data possibilities together to create more personalised shopping experiences for customers across our retail brands. Why? Because we want to make life more effortless for all Australians.  We’re continuing to bring the best talent and skills under one roof, working together and across disciplines to build amazing experiences for our customers. We continuously feed off each other’s insights, talents and capabilities, because we are a business that thrives on open collaboration and a shared vision of positive, fun and rewarding experiences.  In this role, you'll get to • Identify the key actionable insights through the analysis of data and translate this into clear business relevant recommendations and presentations. • Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics-based decision making. • Apply appropriate analytical methods and techniques in an agile, pragmatic way that reflects the needs, constraints and KPIs of the business (e.g. time, cost, quality, data availability). • Serve as a trusted advisor by cultivating relationships with stakeholders and across various Leadership teams to deliver ad-hoc insights and by building repeatable reports and so the value from becoming a data driven organisation. • Contribute to the direction, development and implementation of the data and analytics strategy, roadmap and knowledge base within OneDigital and broader analytics teams within Wesfarmers divisions.  Relationship & KPIs • Collaborate with stakeholders in Analytics, Digital / Ecommerce, Marketing, Commercial, Technology, Data Engineering and Data Science teams to deliver valuable solutions to key business problems. • Serve as a trusted advisor by cultivating relationships with stakeholders to improve their understanding and knowledge of analytical techniques and outcomes. • Effective communication with key stakeholders around the delivery of key projects.  Delivery • Design and implement new analytics solutions, to meet business needs.  Innovation • Source, develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques.  To shine on day one, what you need to have: • Analytics professional with a proven track record (1-2 years) in the development and business use of digital analytics technology and working with large & complex data sets. • Track record in designing and delivering data driven and/or analytics solutions that are actionable. • Proficiency in SQL and digital analytics (e.g. Google BigQuery, Tealium). • Ability to engage and influence business users in the opportunity and benefit from data driven decisions.  It's a bonus, but not required, if you have: • Experience with BI visualisation tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau). • Experience with Python. • Experience in big data analytics and technology. • Proficiency in DAX and Power Query. • Familiarity with web architecture including tag management, data layers, analytics tracking, and corresponding data flows.  Why OneDigital? • Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things. • You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life. • Culture of comradery and collaboration - OneTeam • Plus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed. • We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.  Team Benefits – just to name a few!  To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include: • Access to the latest technologies. • An annual budget for your learning and development (this includes learning of your choice, certifications and more). • Extended parental leave (16 weeks for primary carers), and paid volunteer days. • Flexible working – we balance working together with working flexibly • People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small • Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards.  Next steps  If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date. For brief enquiries please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner at sprasad@wesdigital.com.au
job_description.303: • Data Analyst role within Swinburne University • Full time, ongoing position at our Hawthorn campus • Attractive and competitive total remuneration package  About the Role The Information Technology team at Swinburne University of Technology are looking for a Data Analyst to join their team  The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting data to support decision-making processes, optimize operational efficiency, and create valuable data products within the university.  The purpose of this position is to support the collection of data from business applications, perform the verification, curations and structuring of the data to align to an enterprise perspective, and subsequently enabling self-service business analytical capabilities and the support of more detailed, scientific, and statistical data analysis. Ultimately the position will enable key business decision making to optimise, grow and transform the overall capabilities of the university.  The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate experience with data warehousing, dimensional modelling, ERD model knowledge, SWL, and cloud experience.  About You To be suitable for this role you will need to have experience in the below key accountabilities: • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in an educational or research environment • Experience with and knowledge of modern lakehouse architectures • Experience in distributed cloud-based data platforms such as Snowflake or Databricks • Strong knowledge of data analysis and data modelling. • Proficiency in SQL for data manipulation • Experience with any ETL tool such as Matillion, Fivetran, Trifacta, etc. Qualifications • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, Statistics, or a related field with at least 4 years subsequent experience; or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education and training • Relevant data platform certifications (e.g. Snowflake Certification) About Swinburne University of Technology Swinburne Horizon 2025 draws upon our understanding of future challenges. With this new strategic plan, we choose to build Swinburne as the prototype of a new and different university – one that is truly of Technology, of Innovation and of Entrepreneurship, and proud of it. We are committed to a differentiated university proposition in education and research, so that:  • Every Swinburne learner gets a work experience  • Every Swinburne graduate gets a job  • Every Swinburne partner gets a tech solution  • Swinburne is the prototype of global best practice  The achievement of our 2025 moon shots depends on our capacity to work collectively, always, as One Swinburne.
job_description.304: Your new role  Reporting to the Senior Manager Data Science within the Data Strategy, Analytics & Insights department, the Data Scientist is responsible for conducting highly skilled analytics to deliver on high value prioritised use cases across the Fund (including Operations, Investments, Member, Risk etc).  This role will work across the Fund to: • Develop, innovate and deliver advanced analytics (e.g. Predictive, Econometric and Optimisation models) • Act as an incubator for advanced analytics with a focus on areas of lower maturity and/or high strategic value • Partner with Analytics Enablement and Technology to deploy and automate the execution of models in production environments • Ensure proactive consideration of how analytics can support the Fund to make strong, strategic decisions • Support a Fund wide process for analytics use case identification, prioritisation and planning • Provide input and support for recommendations and prioritisation of data activities and initiatives for the Fund • Support a 'Data and Analytics Hub / Centre of Excellence' which aides Business Units in the achievement of their analytics requirements (incl. guidelines, support repositories etc)  What you'll need • Experience in analytics, insights or data roles • Strong track record in delivering predictive, optimisation and econometric models that improve business outcomes and performance • Advanced written and oral communication/ interpersonal skills with the ability to present ideas, perspectives and issues to senior management • Excellent problem solving, analytical and research skills, with a strong attention to detail • High levels of initiative with the ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously with conflicting priorities • Advanced stakeholder management expertise and experience working with multi-disciplinary teams • Deals with ambiguity and is flexible to adjust as requirements and resources shift • Deep experience in using advanced analytical techniques (and when to use them) including: - Econometric (Autoregressive Distributed Lag) • Predictive (Neural Networks, GBM, Random Forest, XGBoost\ • Strong understanding of experimental design and measuring uplift and causal impact • Advanced programming skills in R and/or Python • Advanced SQL skills • Visualisation tools including Tableau and/or Power BI • Advanced use of MS Office products: Excel, Word and PowerPoint  What next  AustralianSuper is committed to colleague development, and we support our people with ongoing learning, coaching and training, as well as career opportunities across our expanding global organisation. We offer generous leave entitlements and promote a blended working environment in which all roles can flex, and we're happy to discuss what this looks like for you.  We are committed to supporting our diverse workforce in a way that is inclusive and embraces diversity in all its forms. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process or the role, please let our recruitment team know.  At AustralianSuper, our purpose will empower you to reach your true potential  Progress, powered by purpose.
job_description.305: Data Scientist/Data Analyst H/F - Melbourne  CDI  Melbourne, Australia  Conseil  Publiée le 21/08/2023  Annonces similaires  Data analytics in the energy and climate space is growing at an incredible rate. Blunomy is growing the team to support the energy industry through its digitisation, decentralisation and decarbonisation transition and to support operability and planning in Australia and around the world.  We are looking for someone passionate about energy and data analytics to do-well-and-do-good by delivering data science products to better the energy market. As an analyst, you will work on projects under the supervision of project managers. In this setting, you will be exposed to the diversity of current energy challenges, leveraging your data and analytical skills to address them.  Example projects  We are always growing the products we deliver but over the last 12 months we have delivered: • Load forecasting: model and predict the evolution of the load on the electrical network. Use machine learning, data analytics and a fair amount of software development to forecast long-term energy consumption, daily energy profiles and Distributed Energy Resources (Electric Vehicles, Battery, Solar PV). • PV connections approval tool: dynamically model the energy network bringing together power flow modelling and machine learning to determine the PV hosting capacity of the local area. Used in production to approve hundreds of PV connection requests a day. • Vegetation management using LiDAR: collect three‑dimensional images of the local network gathered by drone or helicopter. Use machine learning and geometric models to detect and manage vegetation near powerlines. • Bushfire risk modelling: model and compute the network‑related bushfire risk based on fault ignition likelihood. Calculate the consequences of bushfires such as property damage or agricultural loss. • Low-Voltage network mapping: identify errors within the current mapping of the low-voltage network, especially targeting customers whom connection to the network has not been properly recorded. This was performed using outlier detection with out-of-bag predictors.  Depending on the objectives, projects will entail tasks of varying nature. Your first focus will be on projects requiring data analytics capabilities.  Why work for Blunomy?  You will be joining a passionate group of professionals, aligned in our mission to move towards a decarbonised, circular and inclusive economy. As we are currently in a stage of significant growth, you will be much more than a ‘cog in the machine’, with the ability to make a real and lasting impact across the business. We are focused on finding the right people to journey with us, and to those who do, we offer: • Attractive salary packages • Ability to participate in the company bonus scheme • Hybrid working environment, based in either Melbourne or Sydney • Ability to be part of a global team • Ongoing learning and development opportunities • Weekly team lunch/breakfast • Access to our health and wellbeing platform, Moka Care  Profil recherché  About you  We are looking for a motivated and talented person. The right person will have some of the following and a willingness and ability to learn the rest: • You are passionate about the energy transition and climate change, with a strong interest for energy, environment and/or sustainable development • An undergraduate degree or a postgraduate in a relevant discipline such Computing Science, Statistics, Maths or Engineering • 1-3 years experience in data science or software development will be highly regarded. • Knowledge of statistical and machine learning concepts and algorithms • Experience with the data science tool kit: • Python or R • Source control (such as Git) • software engineering and app development skills • Knowledge of cloud computing (such as Azure, GCP, AWS) • parallel computing (such as Spark or Dask) is a plus • Consultant tool kit: • good oral and written communication • client engagement skills • an ability to work to project timelines • Languages: Fluency in English is mandatory. • To be eligible to apply for this position, candidates must be either an Australian citizen or have working rights in Australia.  Location: Melbourne CBD  Salary: Depending on experience  Work type: Full Time, starting ASAP  Annonces similaires  Recevez chaque jour les nouvelles annonces qui correspondent exactement à votre recherche.
job_description.306: At Vanguard, we are looking for a top-notch Data Analyst to join our team and help us make the most of our data. Our ideal candidate is an analytical problem-solver who can turn data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations. To be successful in this role, you must have exceptional technical skills and a passion for data-driven decision making.The successful candidate will have a degree in a quantitative field, such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, and a minimum of 4 years of experience in data analysis. In addition, you will be expected to bring a deep understanding of data analysis principles, methods, and tools. You must also possess the ability to communicate complex data in an easy-to-understand manner, both verbally and in writing.We’re looking for someone with a positive attitude and a desire to take on new challenges. If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we’d love to hear from you.  Responsibilities: Analyze large datasets to identify trends and extract meaningful insights Develop and implement data analysis and reporting strategies Use data visualization and reporting tools to communicate data findings Utilize programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, etc. to build data models and perform statistical analysis Collaborate with other departments to identify data sources and ensure accuracy of data Generate reports, dashboards, and other data-driven documents Develop and implement data security protocols to protect confidential data Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends in data analysis and data management  Vanguard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
job_description.307: Melbourne Asset Management Permanent  The Senior Data Service Analyst role sits within the Data as a Service Client Delivery team and is responsible for support and delivery of Data as a Service.  The role performs day-to-day oversight of Data as a Service-related reporting services that are produced by the offshore hub location.  The Senior Data Service Analyst will interact directly with Australian-based clients to ensure a high-quality service delivery experience, by responding to client queries and resolving issues.  The Senior Data Service Analyst will work on service optimisation and change management tasks for designated clients, and prepare and participate in service review meetings, workshops, and system demonstrations.  Areas of responsibilities  Service Delivery • Support the delivery of all data as a service product to Australian clients. Develop and maintain relationships with clients to ensure provision of high level of service • Oversight responsibilities for Data Service activity based in our global operations hub, and/or in AU • Technical contact point for clarification and resolution of reporting queries received from the hub location or the client, and main point of contact for resolution of issues with IT support teams.  Projects & Change • Support client change control aimed at developing, extending, or improving the existing service received by the client • Support new activity setup and onboarding activities • Help define business specification documents, create test & implementation plans, support and maintain project governance documents  Contributive responsibilities • Deliver service to our clients accurately and on time, thus reinforcing and building client relationships, leading to new business opportunities • Ensure operational risk is captured and addressed, securing our functional capabilities  Technical skills and experience • Experience working within the middle office, investment and performance analysis, or fund accounting environment • Understanding of data system architecture and systems such as MapR, Hadoop, and AB initio • Strong practical understanding of Data Certification and the controls required to ensure accurate and complete data delivery • Strong practical understanding of ABOR and IBOR with multiple instrument types, including derivatives and how they should be treated within investment accounting and performance measurement  Qualifications • Tertiary qualification • Industry-specific qualifications such as CIPM, CFA, etc desirable.
job_description.308: Data & Insights Analyst - Fundraising & Marketing • Salary: $90K - $100K + Super + Salary packing • Location: Melbourne, Sydney or remote • Opportunities to continually advance your Data Analytics career. We are seeking candidates with a strong background in proven data and data insights expertise. This role goes beyond merely aggregating data into basic tabular reports; it involves the ability to comprehend and present insights in a compelling manner. These insights will not only significantly impact the donor experience but also go beyond seeking new financial opportunities. We are looking for individuals who are actively dedicated to enhancing our business offerings.  About The Role…  In this role, you will be tasked with pioneering innovative approaches to harness consumer behavioural data. Your goal is to derive descriptive and prescriptive insights that will guide optimal decision-making. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating interactive and automated dashboards that empower our fundraising team to make strategic decisions through proactive in-depth analysis and insights.  Key Responsibilities… • Build and Provide insights for the individual giving team in fundraising. • Develop subject matter expertise in the various channels used by the individual giving team. • Engage with business users to consult and recommend best possible way to answer their business data questions. • Provide rapid answers to business questions using a mix of queries and visualisations. • Support ad hoc data requests from across business areas. • Design and build reporting data models that support user self-serve reporting. • Identify data to integrate with the warehouse to develop actionable insights to drive business decisions. • Build customer segmentation analytics and campaign performance reporting. • Proactively organising training and development activities for business to facilitate adaption. • Design, build, test and present meaningful insights from a complex range of data.  Skills And Experience • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field. • 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field. • 1-2 years’ experience working with fundraising teams • Experience with data visualisation and querying tools such as Power BI and SQL. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes. • Strong ability to work in T-SQL and DAX queries. • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. • Experience in developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualisations. • Knowledge of fundraising and marketing analytics and metrics. • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.  More About The Role…  Furthermore, you will play a vital role in supporting the enhancement of consumer engagement strategies and product-specific initiatives. Leveraging technical solutions and advanced analytics, you will be at the forefront of developing ground breaking solutions for consumer profiling and segmentation.  Through your work in extracting insights from diverse data sources, you will drive strategic and operational initiatives. These initiatives will lead to increased revenue, improved efficiency, cost optimisation, and an elevated supporter experience, ultimately contributing to the organisation's success and sustainable growth.  A Little About Our Client…  Mission Australia, a renowned national charity with over 160 years of dedicated service, is on a mission to help vulnerable Australians find their path to independence. They are committed to tackling homelessness, supporting struggling families, addressing mental health challenges, and fighting substance dependencies. Mission Australia thrives on the support of everyday Australians, corporate partners, and a passionate team of professionals.  Next step is to APPLY…  Ready to embark on an epic journey where your data skills make a real difference? Send us your application, including a cover letter and resume, send it through Beaumont People now! Join Mission Australia and become a data wizard on a mission to end homelessness and help communities thrive! Apply now and be part of something truly magical!  Don’t tick all the boxes? That’s okay, we like thinking outside the box. We value skills, passion, and drive. So, if this job resonates with you, we want to hear from you! If you would like to have a confidential chat, please contact Jack or Dean on 02 9133 9322 or email dean@beaumontpeople.com.au  Beaumont People believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way. We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to be made for your application to be assessed we would be more than happy to discuss how that can be arranged.

job_description.310: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you.  And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?  What's in it for you?  We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities.  Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.  You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  We are open to candidates located in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth or Canberra for this role.  What we're looking for • Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation. • Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. • Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models. • Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard. • Run human centred design sessions with end-users. • Communicating and influencing stakeholders. • Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  Skills and attributes for success • Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data. • Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it. • Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority. • Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems : Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.  Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage. Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools ( Alteryx and Daraiku).  What we can offer you • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at • Discover how, when and where you can work at • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at • Understand how our benefits can support you at  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders past, present, and emerging.  Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at  Apply now we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process.  We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at om or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2).  Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.  EY Building a better working world

Working with internal data owners to primarily source data, develop and maintain reports that inform the development of education resources and measure the effectiveness of those education resources. Who we are looking for  experience in delivering insightful analysis & Power BI reporting solutions on the Azure platform proven excellence in analytical thinking and the translation of complex unstructured and structured data into informative visuals, reports and actionable insights. demonstrated ability to be pro-active, professional, customer-focused, organised, and self-managed to deliver a consistently high level of output and service in a deadline and fast-paced environment. job_description.313: Job Title Senior Strategic Research Analyst  Job Description Summary A newly created national role providing direct input into the national thought-leadership agenda. As the research expert in the property industry, you will work with the wider research team and business to identify research topics of interest and relevance. Undertake detailed data collection and analysis, report writing and where required, contributing to client presentations.  Job Description  You will also be responsible for: • Liaising with National Head of Research to develop thought-leadership agenda. • Source and collect data to provide deep data analysis to reveal key strategic insights, required to meet the national thought-leadership agenda • Demonstrate the company’s leading position in the property industry by providing original, detailed insights across the commercial real estate sector • Identify opportunities for cross-selling multiple business units & service lines within individual research outputs • Liaise with wider marketing team to develop go-to-market strategies for research content • Assist senior managers on producing their thought-leadership outputs  To be successful in this role you will have: • Deep knowledge of the Australian commercial property markets and knowledge of industry-specific trends is essential • Significant knowledge of research methodologies and data analysis, coupled with a degree in a quantitative analytics disciple such as Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Quantitative Geography. • Significant experience with managing and analysing large datasets and knowledge of latest data analysis methods • High level of oral presentation and writing skills and ability to convey complex analysis to non-expert audiences • The ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders  Why join Cushman & Wakefield?  As one of the leading global real estate services firms transforming the way people work, shop and live working at Cushman & Wakefield means you will benefit from; • Being part of a growing global company; • Career development and a promote from within culture; • An organisation committed to Diversity and Inclusion  What’s Next…  To be What’s Next as the Senior Strategic Research Analyst with Cushman & Wakefield - click the apply link, upload your current resume and complete your application. job_description.314: About Tabcorp  Tabcorp is Australia's leading gambling entertainment company, renowned for our world-class brands including TAB, Sky Racing, and MAX. It’s an exciting moment in our history – a new era of Tabcorp. We’re bringing industry-leading products and services to our customers, leading with integrity, and creating value for our shareholders and industry partners by breaking into new horizons.  What You'll Do  As a Senior Digital Analyst you’ll join our Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence which is a game-changing hub of innovation and insights that is tasked with developing cutting-edge data and analytics solutions that tackle complex business challenges head-on.  Your role will be to partner with our Digital and Product teams to champion digital data analytics, support major digital initiatives and deliver insights that improve performance and create leading products and services. Therefore, you will: • develop digital insights leading to new and improved app and website features; • partner with developers on Adobe and Google Analytics initiatives; • drive digital engagement and growth through personalisation and tagging strategies; • analyze data to identify trends, understand user journeys, improve conversion funnels, and identify drop-off / pain points for customers; and • lead A/B Testing to evaluate effectiveness of digital marketing, web/app changes and conversion rate tests.  What you’ll bring  As a Senior Digital Analyst, you’ll have demonstrated experience in digital analytics role where you have developed a range of skills and experiences including: • strong experience developing strategies to drive digital engagement and growth across websites and apps; • experience in data analytics and exposure to website and mobile app development processes; • strong experience with Adobe Analytics or equivalent software (such as Google Analytics); • experience partnering with a range of stakeholders including product teams and software developers; and • ability to write and develop specifications for web and app tracking implementation.  Beyond technical expertise, you’ll be a passionate and attentive self-starter with a proven ability to deliver results. Operating in our fast-paced, flexible, and team-oriented environment, you'll need excellent communication and relationship management skills to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical audiences.  What You'll Get:  By joining our dynamic team, you will not only be part of redefining the future of our industry but will also enjoy a range of rewards and benefits, including: • Hybrid working environment, offering flexibility and work-life balance. • Comprehensive leave types, including cultural leave, volunteer leave, and 18 weeks of parental leave for all new parents. • Access to The Arena, a comprehensive health and well-being app that supports you and your family's mental and physical health.  Next Steps:  Apply today by clicking on the link above. For any queries, please contact Mark Harrison at mark.harrison@tabcorp.com.au.  Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you require assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au.  Please note that while all roles require background checks, certain positions may require successful candidates to apply for and obtain specific licenses from state-based gambling regulators. This process will involve additional background checks, potentially including providing fingerprint information.
job_description.315: About CPBJH JV  CPBJH JV brings together two of Australia's leading construction partners, CPB Contractors and John Holland, with unparalleled expertise in large-scale and complex project management, civil construction, traffic management and tunnelling.  The West Gate Tunnel is a partnership between the Victorian Government and Transurban. The Joint Venture has been chosen as the contractor for construction, which began in early 2018 following planning assessment.  About the Project  The West Gate Tunnel Project is a city-shaping project that will deliver a vital alternative to the West Gate Bridge, provide quicker and safer journeys, and remove thousands of trucks off residential streets. The project will include: • Widening the West Gate Freeway from eight lanes to 12 between the M80 Ring Road and Williamstown Road; • Building a 2.8km eastbound tunnel and a 4km westbound tunnel under Yarraville; • Constructing a bridge over the Maribyrnong River providing an alternative to the West Gate Bridge; • Constructing an elevated road along Footscray Road to the Port of Melbourne; • Major new cycling and pedestrian paths.  Gender Diversity  We aim to maximise the potential of all our people. This means having an inclusive culture that values and sustains diversity and a work-life balance. To achieve this, we are focused on: • Embedding flexible work practices • Providing development opportunities for our women • Leaders championing and supporting our females to succeed • Actively looking to attract and promote women into non- traditional roles and putting support structures in place to help them succeed.  Your Opportunity  We are currently seeking applications for an experienced Safety Strategy, Systems and Innovation Coordinator to support the Health and Safety team.  Your key responsibilities will include: • Develop, improve and maintain Power Bi data management software • Develop new dashboards using advanced Power Bi system knowledge • By using existing database systems and Power Bi, define new ways to extract and present project data • Assist with the analysis of safety, health and project data. • Help shape and lead strategic initiatives to improve safety by analysing trends and identifying risks to project delivery. • Assist in developing, implementing, and managing an innovative safety system to enhance workplace health and safety. • Conduct in-depth quarterly analyses of project data to identify trends and focus areas, providing comprehensive reports and recommendations to senior management. • Schedule, monitor, and report on project safety activities and other Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) deliverables. • Collaborate with project clients and business units to share health and safety initiatives and insights. • Coordinate and facilitate the One HSE Culture Survey Program, analyzing trends to develop and implement cultural initiatives. • Maintain a safety dashboard to monitor project performance. • Coordinate and ensure the completion of external assurance activities, such as CPB Global Actions. • Provide support in other safety, health, and environmental areas requiring compliance and governance considerations. • Ensure consistent application of project health and safety systems through site reviews and support for safety and operational personnel. • Assist the Health and Safety Administrator during work overflow periods.  Desired Skills: • Advanced system knowledge of Power Bi including back end dashboard development (essential) • Proven application skills using data management systems (ie; Power Bi, SharePoint) • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills • Stakeholder Relationships: Build and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders, fostering collaboration. • Data Analysis: Possess highly developed analytical and quantitative skills to evaluate complex data and offer recommendations. • Communication: Strong written and oral communication skills to engage with individuals on various issues. • Data Proficiency: Proficient in data analysis and reporting. • Versatility: Experience in working with individuals at different organizational levels. • Adaptability: Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines while remaining flexible.  In return, we offer rewarding careers, genuine opportunities to develop and grow, and a workplace culture that values and recognises effort and contribution.  If you are interested in these roles and meet the above requirements, please apply below.  CPBJH JV is committed to equal employment opportunity (EEO) and actively seeks to remove barriers people may face in gaining a successful position on the West Gate Tunnel Project. We value diversity in our team and people who share our values of authenticity, respect and excellence are encouraged to apply.
job_description.316: The Hospital  The Royal Children’s Hospital’s (RCH) Vision is “A world where all kids thrive”.  RCH is a cornerstone member of the Melbourne Children’s Campus, partnering with Murdoch Children’s Research Institute, The University of Melbourne Department of Pediatrics and The Royal Children’s Hospital Foundation.  RCH has cared for the children and young people of Victoria for more than 150 years since it was founded in 1870. A full range of paediatric and adolescent health services are provided plus tertiary and quaternary care for the most critically ill and medically complex patients in Victoria, Tasmania, southern NSW and other states around Australia and overseas. The Hospital has more than 6,000 staff, a budget of $850M, 12 wards and 350 beds. Annually, the RCH has 300,000+ Specialist Clinic appointments, 90,000+ Emergency Department presentations and 20,000 elective surgeries.  The RCH is committed to the Child Safe Standards .  RCH enjoys high employee engagement and is committed to staff safety and a positive culture through enactment of our Compact.  For further Information on RCH is available here .  Job Title: Data Analyst Grade 6 – Decision Support Unit • Excellent employee benefits including salary packaging • Hub of medical precinct in Parkville, Melbourne • Flexible work options available  About The Role  This is a permanent full time position at 1 .0 FTE / 80 hours per fortnight within the Decision Support Unit. You will be responsible for report and extract development along with maintenance and analysis tasks primarily using Epic’s Clarity database and Decision Support’s enterprise data warehouse. You will work with the RCH Departments to understand and support the hospital’s reporting and data extraction requirements.
