job_description.318: SEEK's portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities.  We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation. Life at SEEK  SEEK's purpose is at the centre of everything we do Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity.  SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Place to Work 2023 In Tech (third year in a row) We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.  Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues.  The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting. Job Description  Are you a data analytics enthusiast with a passion for driving business impact through insights? If so, we want to hear from you.  As a Senior Analyst within the Market Data & Customer Analytics team at SEEK, you'll be at the forefront of our well-established data analytics function, driving customer-focused insights for Marketing and contributing to critical strategic initiatives across the organization.  This is your opportunity to be part of an exciting phase at SEEK, where customer data analytics and insights are shaping the future of employment in Australia & NZ.  Responsibilities include:  Collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders, including other data/analytics teams, to drive targeted solutions aimed at increasing Marketing and Business ROI. This includes customer behaviour and portfolio analysis, campaign design, CRM enablement, and data asset development.  Lead projects to develop scalable data analytics solutions that support Marketing and broader customer insight needs, from strategy and design to execution and continuous improvement. Maintain and execute regular outputs with a high degree of reliability and accuracy, championing a program of continuous improvement.  Provide analytical expertise and support to enable stakeholders to confidently use analytic techniques and team outputs, identifying and leading learning opportunities. Qualifications Substantial experience in a senior role in Data Analytics, preferably within a Marketing or commercial environment. Strong strategic application of data and insights, with the ability to translate complex analytics into actionable insights.  Highly proficient in SQL, R, Python, SAS, or similar programming languages and experience working with large-scale data platforms (e.g., DWH/relational databases, AWS/Azure). Proficiency with BI and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, QlikView). Ability to manage multiple priorities and resolve complex situations independently. Comfortable collaborating and building strong, credible relationships across business units.  Additional Information  At SEEK we offer: Annual Performance Bonus Plan Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role. The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year Access to a wide range of discounts on things such as health insurance, fitness, food, travel, accommodation plus many more Frequent events including sports days, family and friends' day, hackathon, and trivia  Here at SEEK we pride ourselves on harbouring a flexible and inclusive working environment. job_description.320: Analytic Partners Recognized as a Leader by The Forrester Wave, Marketing Measurement & Optimization, Q3 2023 Report "Analytic Partners dominates with data-driven marketing insights."  We are the Commercial Intelligence industry leader and the first to do it! We help brands use data to drive business growth, and we do this using a combination of technology and expert guidance that helps companies make the best possible decisions. Our Commercial Decision Platform GPS-Enterprise is the machine that turns data into actionable insights and our ROI Genome is our proprietary intelligence layer comprised of 20+ years of Analysis, Insights, and Learning. We measure the impact of Product, Sales, Operations, Customer Data and outside factors such as competitors, economic changes, seasonality, consumer mobility, and more to deliver impact. Our customers drive business growth by leveraging our technology and expert analyst!  We're growing fast, with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Miami, Broomfield, Charlottesville, Dallas, Dublin, London, Paris, Hamburg, Munich, Sydney, Melbourne, Singapore, and Shanghai.  What we value in you: • Bachelor's degree or above (ideal areas of study: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing) • Recent graduates and those with 1-3 years of internship or professional work experience across any combination of advanced and predictive analytics, marketing analytics, and analytic techniques for marketing, customer, and business applications. • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel • You demonstrate analytical principles, strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Experience working independently on analytical tasks, building, and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures, and data sets. • Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics. • Experience using data to solve business questions and drive business solutions. • You bring strong written and verbal communication appropriate for a professional work environment.  What you'll be doing: • Collect and analyze data related to consumer behavior, market trends, and campaign performance. Using proprietary tools and techniques to prep, mine and format customer data, analyze, produce models to develop insight dashboards and customer presentations. • Develop and maintain statistical models that predict consumer behavior, campaign performance, and other key metrics. • Collaborate as part of a team to drive analyses and insights, walking customers through dashboards and developing narratives that explain results and aid in more informed decisions and improved business performance.  Our Leadership Values For Marketing Science Analysts and Company Culture: • Results Driven Anticipates roadblocks and appropriately seeks assistance to plan around them. • Effective Communication Considers the audience and communicates appropriately. • Accountability & Integrity Actively looks to offer ways to contribute during downtime. • Creative Collaboration Builds relationships with team and contributes regularly. • Harnessing Innovation Seeks opportunities to try out new approaches  Our values and culture here: Our differentiator is - Our People! We hire the brightest talent and develop them into leaders. We foster a culture of PEOPLE, PASSION and GROWTH. People: We value our people, clients, and partners Passion: We love what we do Growth: Unlimited growth means unlimited potential AP is a client-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers.  As a woman-owned and led company, this has meant supporting a meritocracy where everyone has opportunities to achieve their best and ensure we foster an environment of diversity, equity, and inclusion. In practice this means we will not only work to recruit a diverse workforce, but also maximize the full potential of all of our people. You can read more about our commitment to DEI here  Additionally, Analytic Partners participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  #LI-Hybrid  Apply for this job
job_description.321: Job Requisition ID: 34768  Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best  Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career  Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts  We are seeking a talented Reporting & Insights Analyst with experience in Tableau and a passion for data to join our Client, Industries & Markets enablement team. This role can be based in any major city, and we offer excellent flexible working arrangements.  What will your typical day look like? As a Reporting and Insights Consultant, you will enhance existing, and develop new business performance reporting, in Tableau, for stakeholders across Deloitte, including senior executive leaders. Working with the wider team, you will independently translate business requirements into quantitative metrics, with our boarder team looking to you, as an expert on all things Tableau and data. You will answer the ‘Why’ and ‘So What’ for our internal stakeholders, investigating trends and outliers within large datasets.  About us At Deloitte, delivering impactful work and experiences to our clients is central to everything we do. We do this by being client issues-led, seamlessly integrating our capabilities to show up as one Deloitte, with relevance, impact and differentiation.  This role is internal facing and is part of the Client, Industries & Markets (CI&M) enablement team, supporting the CI&M Executive who oversee our go-to-market strategy and client interface for the Firm.  Enough about us, lets talk about you  You are someone with experience in gathering and analysing data sets to translate problems into actionable insights and recommendations.  With your commercial acumen, you are familiar with financial terminology and the reporting requirements of a business. Strong analytical capabilities and structured problem-solving skills are your strength, you can independently curate dashboard content and tell compelling data stories.  Specifically, you should have:  Demonstrated experience translating business problems into actionable dashboard views (from initial scoping to delivery)  Demonstrated experience developing dashboards in Tableau (12 Months + experience), and in building data models in excel.  12 months + experience working with varying levels of stakeholders and working with a business to develop/ mature reporting to meet asks.  Excellent communication skills with an ability to communicate at all levels.  Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite

job_description.324: We are currently seeking a motivated and experienced Data Analyst on a permanent, full-time basis to review data to identify key insights, and solve problems and be able to communicate this information to various stakeholders across the organisation.  The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems • Work with management to prioritise business and information needs • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Requirements  What you can bring to the role:  Essential: • Tertiary level qualification/s in analysis, and visualization • Strong SQL, SSRS and Power BI skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools • Current National Police Certificate (or ability to acquire) • Applicant must be based in Australia  Desirable: • Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques • Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, Javascript, and ETL • Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages including Excel, SPSS, and SAS • Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment  Benefits  What We Create client-specific performance benchmarks and KPIs. • Generate regular and ad-hoc reports tailored to each client's needs. Develop custom dashboards that visualize key performance metrics and enable clients to track progress easily. • Evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, including digital advertising, email marketing, SEO, and social media. Provide recommendations for campaign optimizations based on data analysis. • Translate data insights into actionable recommendations for clients to improve their marketing strategies. • Collaborate with other teams within the agency, such as account management, creative, and digital marketing, to align data analysis with overall marketing strategies. • Present data findings and recommendations to clients in a clear and compelling manner, including regular performance reviews and strategy meetings. Working on key Insights Analysis projects, you will be responsible for building trusting relationships with key stakeholders fairly quickly. As such, stakeholder management skills and the ability to liaise effectively with them needs to be a strength in the right person.  To be considered, we seek: • 5+ years of proven skills in Data Analysis, Data Mining, with Insights and Visualisation generation skills. • Bring with you experience in SQL coding, Python, and strength in Power BI & other visualisation tools. • Deep understanding across various BI / data analytics tools and approaches across all data lifecycle stages. • Strong business acumen with some experience on Customer Facing products, incl. working with Customer Intelligence Insights & Business Performance insights would be highly advantageous. • Proven experience in providing recommendations to stakeholders in a manner appropriate to the audience at hand.  This is a uniquely blended role requiring someone to bring their technical skills as well as client relationships management skills together in this role.  If this sounds like you, please send through your updated CV for a confidential discussion. job_description.331: Are you driven by the opportunity to work for a thriving regional Szkola Podstawowa committed to organisational excellence?  Are you ready to apply your knowledge and background to exciting new challenges and learn from the best?  The Szkola Podstawowa is on the hunt for a dedicated and detail orientated Data Analyst to collect, assess and report accurate economic and social data to drive strategic decision making and aid in achieving our performance objectives.  But enough about us, let’s talk about you  We are in the market for an experienced Data Analyst who will facilitate the delivery of the Szkola Podstawowa economic strategies and plans through research and data analysis to enable strategic decision making. You will be expected to support the development of business cases for identified projects that aim to attract and develop new and existing investment opportunities in Melbourne You will also support the implementation of initiatives developed under the Szkola Podstawowa Strategic Community Plan, Corporate Business Plan and the Szkola Podstawowa Economic Development strategies.  What you will bring to the team  You will have a demonstrated understanding of economic development principles and practice and be experienced in analysing, manipulating, summarising and interpreting data, statistics and factors affecting business and economic growth. You will have proven experience in undertaking cost benefit analysis of major investment projects and working across multi-functional teams. Your comprehensive analytical skills and the ability to convert meaningful insights into written reports and presentations will be second to none. Most importantly you understand that your role is all about helping the Szkola Podstawowa source, transform and interpret data into actionable metrics to optimise business.  Imagine a future with us  The Szkola Podstawowa is one of the main cultural ambassadors and project leaders for Melbourne. We not only support and empower local businesses, create local jobs and opportunities but foster innovation and creativity in enterprise whilst considering the impact to our beautiful environment. We are woven by waterways (gabi), a city with a village heart (mandjoo koort).  At the Szkola Podstawowa, we look out for one another; prioritise respect, are fair, look after your development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted and achieve their full potential. Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. At the Szkola Podstawowa you will find unrivalled opportunities to succeed and realise your full potential.  The finer details  This fulltime fixed term Level 7 position attracts a competitive remuneration. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, identity, experience, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.  Applications for this position are open until a suitable pool of candidates is received. This means the vacancy may close without notice. If you are interested in this position, we highly recommend you apply as soon as possible.  Why work with us?  You will be working for the Szkola Podstawowa, an employer of choice and one of Western Australia’s fastest growing local authorities. Our vision at the Szkola Podstawowa is “Woven by waterways, a Szkola Podstawowa with a village heart” and all our employees instil the values of connected, integrity, excellence, courage and innovate.  There are many advantages in working for the Szkola Podstawowa, including:  A fair salary – enjoy great work conditions including salary sacrificing options.  Access to free staff parking and less than 50 mins to Melbourne by train and car.  Superannuation Guarantee Contributions (SGC) payments with matching additional contributions made by the Szkola Podstawowa in accordance with the Szkola Podstawowa Enterprise Agreement.  Health & wellbeing initiatives, including free recreation centre membership.  Discounted medical insurance.  Learning and Development opportunities to fuel your amazingness and take your career to the next level.  Flexible working hours including 9-day fortnight, 19-day month and working from home options.  Transparent performance framework: approach your work with confidence in how you're tracking, working to professional development plans agreed on by you and your line manager.  Generous leave entitlements: provisions for many forms of leave; including annual, personal/carers, parental, study, cultural, domestic violence, compassionate and bereavement leave.  Employee Assistance Program support: you are encouraged to use this free short-term, confidential counselling service if you're experiencing emotional stress, relationship problems, conflict with others or personal issues. It is also available for financial counselling and retirement planning.  A vibrant Employee Reward & Recognition Program  Did we mention Study Assistance, a social club, corporate uniform and much more!  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $5,122.89 – $8,750.71 per month  Benefits: • Employee mentoring program • Health insurance • Professional development assistance • Profit sharing  Schedule: • 8 hour shift • Afternoon shift • Day shift • Shift work • Weekend availability  Supplemental pay types: • Bonus • Performance bonus  Ability to commute/relocate: • Melbourne, VIC: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)  Work Authorisation: • Australia (Preferred)  Work Location: In person
job_description.332: The Company Our client is a multinational Facilities Management company employing over 15,000 people on 4 continents. A successful, fast-growing business providing long-term, tailored solutions to clients in the retail, health, early education and commercial sectors, their unique approach has quickly made this thriving business a leader in its field and a sought-after Employer of Choice.  The Role and Responsibilities Based within the Energy division and helping to support energy and sustainability initiatives this is a brilliant opportunity for an experienced Data & Reporting Analyst to manage and maintain high quality reports and perform data analytics.
job_description.333: The Senior Analyst role reports to the Head of Portfolio Analysis and works alongside the analytical teams covering the Physical Markets, Trading and Origination functions. You will be responsible for developing and running sophisticated models to optimise AGL’s wholesale markets positions covering electricity, gas, renewables and other fuels, and covering all time frames. The role will also support the Physical Markets, Trading and Origination analytical teams to support commercial deals and manage decisions.
job_description.334: Firstly, what we offer you! • Highly flexible work environment (including WFH) • Store discounts, and free 7-Eleven Coffee • Bonus & incentive program   • 15 weeks paid parental leave • 2 days paid volunteer leave per year • Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning • Social club, Open committee with regular events   We are human centred organisation and our people are at the core of everything we do. This is a true place to learn and grow whilst developing your career. Through our agile structure, we enable our employees to drive their own work – with a lot of autonomy, and have fun along the way!  The role  As a Data Analyst in our Supply Chain Logistics chapter, you will utilise your Power BI experience to create high quality reports, and provide insights to drive continuous improvement of our complex supply chain solution. • Create Power BI reports • Facilitate the connection of data sources • Recommend best practice report building and inform tools to generate insights • Drive cultural change on the value of quality reporting • Provide insights and analytics to optimise supply chain solutions • Drive a continuous improvement culture  What’s in your toolkit? • Experience working with Power BI and sound analytical sk • End to end supply chain knowledge, including an understanding of supply planning, logistics operations and inventory control • Ability to build positive relationships with internal & external stakeholders • Strong communicatio skills and abaility to deliver complex messages and reporting insights • Experience in a complex retail environment would be adventageous  Don’t worry if you don’t tick all the box’s for this role, we encourage you to still apply.  At 7-Eleven our people are at the heart of everything we do. The rich diversity that every individual brings makes the ordinary moments extraordinary for everyone.  We are committed to creating a workplace that fosters inclusion and celebrates diversity, where every single 7-Eleven team member feels heard, valued, and respected no matter who you are or what diverse characteristics reflect your unique identity.  To find out more about our current opportunities follow us on LinkedIn or view our careers page.
job_description.335: Company Description  Who we are:  FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners.  At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage.  We’ve tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.  Job Description  This is an excellent opportunity for a Data Analyst looking to: • Join a growing organization • Discover a Full Time permanent Opportunity • $65,000 - $75,000 plus super  The Systems Analyst is part of the Data team whose purpose is to unlock the power of data for both clients and internal stakeholders. They play a key role in identifying, analyzing and providing insights across a range of subjects that adds value to the business.  Working within a team of 3 this role is part of a larger cross functional Technology team of 60 and growing. You can expect to leverage your skills working on some exciting projects across our I broker and Summit applications collaborating with other teams across execution, operations, technology, finance, compliance and more.  Key responsibilities include but are not limited to: • Preparing, analysing and reporting results from various projects and BAU work. • Using data analytics and visualisation tools, such as Microsoft SQL, PowerBI / Tableau • Identifying and interpreting trends and patterns in complex datasets while also assessing and improving data quality. • Supporting financial statement and performance audits, general audit planning processes and developing models to validate financial and system datasets. • Promote and educate the use of data across the business.  Qualifications  Required: • Skills working with data analytics and visualization tools • A strong understanding of data and its application • Excellent verbal and written communication skills • Background in clearing & settlement.  Bonus points for: • SQL and/or python skills • Experience working with Tableu • Having done a similar position  Additional Information  What are the ingredients to our secret sauce?  That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love!  Benefits: • A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees • 16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leave • A flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home • An inclusive and diverse working environment for all • Prioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologists • E-Vehicles – Salary Sacrifice  Ready to apply?  If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply".  Alternatively : • To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend" • For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careers • Any additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au  Please note : • Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)
job_description.336: Currently on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst based in Melbourne for a client in the health and wellness industry. You’ll be joining a team working with Snowflake, Airbyte, dbt, Tableau, and AWS, as they build their data platform. You don’t need to be a guru with all these tools - as they’re open to necessary training but you will be exposed to them. First and foremost we’re looking for a weapon on SQL with great stakeholder engagement.  Senior | Data Analyst | Hybrid (2 days in office) | Melbourne | $130,000 plus super  Responsibilities:  Develop data models and simplify complex data sources. Identify growth opportunities and user behavior insights. Create actionable dashboards for stakeholders. Collaborate with users and stakeholders to gather requirements.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics. 3+ years of data analysis experience. Strong analytical and SQL skills.  If you’re passionate about Data and you’re keen on impacting millions of lives through actionable insights, we’d love to hear from you.
job_description.337: We are on the lookout for an expert Data Engineer to join our amazing team at Synechron in Melbourne. Growing your career as a Full Time Data Engineer is a terrific opportunity to develop competitive skills. If you are strong in project management, teamwork and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Data Engineer at Synechron today  Overview  We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to join our dynamic and innovative team.  In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable and efficient data pipelines and workflows, as well as working with a wide range of technologies and platforms including HDFS, Airflow, Spark, Scala, Hive, Apache Kafka and HBase. Responsibilities  Developing, constructing, testing and maintaining data architectures Analyzing and interpreting large data sets Aligning data access and presentation to business requirements Using a range of programming languages and data analysis tools Using data to increase efficiency and illustrate/achieve business goals Building tools for easier data access and interpretation Conducting data analysis and preparing reports Testing and deploying advanced data analysis tools and techniques, such as algorithms and machine learning  Requirements  You are:  Experienced with Databases: Oracle, Postgresql, Sqlite Bringing advanced SQL skills to the team Proficient in Scala, Python; you have test frameworks experience (both in Scala and Python) Experienced with Git Experienced in Apache Spark & ETL processing Well-versed in tools like Hive, Yarn, MapReduce Familiar with the Apache Airflow platform Highly skilled in Hadoop Able to build and run Docker containers  Experienced in IDEs: Intellij, PyCharm, optionally VSCode  Experienced in O/S: Ubuntu  It would be great if you also had: Apache Kafka experience  We Can Offer You  A highly competitive compensation and benefits package A multinational organization with offices in 17 countries and the possibility to work abroad Laptop 4 weeks of paid annual leave Superannuation benefits Extensive training opportunities, focused on skills, substantive knowledge, and personal development On-demand Udemy for Business for all Synechron employees with free access to more than 5000 curated courses? Coaching opportunities with experienced colleagues from our FinLabs and Center of Excellences (CoE) groups Cutting edge projects at the world's leading tier-one banks, financial institutions and insurance firms A flat and approachable organization  An excellent working atmosphere: regular drinks, sports activities, offsite weekends with a young, dynamic team A truly diverse, fun-loving and global work culture  Diversity & Inclusionare fundamental to our culture, and Synechron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.  Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiative 'Same Difference' is committed to fostering an inclusive culture – promoting equality, diversity and an environment that is respectful to all. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce helps build stronger, successful businesses as a global company. We empower our global workforce by offering flexible workplace arrangements, mentoring, internal mobility, learning and development programs.  All employment decisions at Synechron are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to the applicant's gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Benefits of working as a Data Engineer in Melbourne: • Excellent benefits • Company offers career progression opportunities • Attractive package
job_description.338: Salary/Day Rate: $600 – $700 per day:  Short Description: 3-6 Month Contract available for an experienced Data Analyst for a Top ASX Listed Global organisation  Role Description  Contract Data Analyst required for a Top ASX Listed Global organisation. The role will run for a provisional 3-6 months and offers a competitive contract daily rate, flexible working environment and a great company culture.  Key Skills required include:  R and/or Python programming languages  Proficiency with some of the following libraries: Tidyverse, Plotly and RShiny in R and Pandas, Numpy and Scikit-Learn in Python  Experience using and understanding machine learning modelling techniques  Experience building R Shiny dashboards would be highly desirable  Experience / knowledge of database management languages such as SQL  Cloud based exposure in any of the following environments: AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform  Experience with visualization products such as, PowerBI, Tableau or Qliksense  Date Posted:  Posted 4 months ago  Location:  Melbourne  Job Title:  Data Analyst
job_description.339: A new role = A new way to win together  You belong at Coles Group where we look ahead, have a plan, and are up for the challenge. We learn and grow by taking career-defining opportunities and this one may just be your next.  Senior Data Scientist  If you’re looking for a fresh start, you’ve come to the right place. We’re a large and iconic portfolio of trusted Australian brands – which means there are always exciting challenges and career opportunities waiting for you.  As the way we shop continues to evolve, our Digital team keeps us at the cutting edge. Driven by our innovative, inclusive and forward-thinking culture, we’re constantly looking at ways to reinvent the shopping experience for our customers and build the next generation of digital retailing.  Part of the broader Digital team, Advanced Analytics are responsible for the development and support of applications across multiple enterprise platforms including Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, Risk, Safety and Legal.  As part of the Advanced Analytics team, you will be participating in the delivery of projects in line with best practice to deliver solutions and services to stakeholders. You will bring the use of Advanced Analytics solutions within Coles by researching new techniques in areas of prediction, regression, machine learning, text mining, mathematical optimisation etc to identify new opportunities for future solutions, and translating complex mathematical techniques into commercial concepts.  What you’ll be doing • Act as a technical expert in one or more areas of Advanced Analytics • Design and drive technical solutions for the different initiatives across Coles • Research new Advanced Analytics opportunities in areas of prediction, regression, machine learning, text mining, mathematical optimisation etc to identify new opportunities for future solutions. • Participate in the delivery of Advanced Analytics projects and techniques in line with best practice.  Good things you’ll need • Analytics professional with a proven track record in advanced analytics / data science / Measurement science and/or Econometrics • Track record in designing and delivering AA solutions • Key analytical techniques, e.g. regression, clustering, decision trees, machine learning, text mining, mathematical optimisation etc. • Be an expert on one or more technical areas • Analytical applications -R, Python, Scala, Hive, Spark, SQL, Excel • Productivity applications - Git, Jira, Confluence • Masters or PhD degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Econometrics, Applied Statistics, Physics, Engineering or related field. • Business and commercial acumen • Good scientific research skills, • keep updated with industry development and best practices • regular literature review  Take your next step into something bigger, apply now  With us it’s not about the discounts (although you do get those), it’s about joining a team where your wellbeing and professional development is invested in and celebrating your contributions is the norm. And because everyone leads unique lives, we offer flexible work including work from home, additional leave and parental leave entitlements.  We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that’s just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.  We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. Find out more in the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site.  Job ID: 32936  Employment Type: Full time
job_description.340: Full Job Description Function Data & Analytics Type Fixed Term Salary AU$90000.00 - AU$100000.00 per annum Data Analyst 2 Year Fixed Term Contract, Full Time $100,000 package (including NFP salary packaging benefits) As the Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the development and delivery of the end-to-end data migration process in collaboration with a multi-disciplined team of technical and non-technical stakeholders. You will be working with the Consumer Technology Transformation team who are undertaking the 'CMS Optimisation' program. The organisation  It can be a challenging world for young people and families to navigate, and they need help. You will be working for an organisation whose purpose is to support people of all walks to live the life they choose with independence and to help them to enjoy their lives. Empowering individuals with information, skills and tools are fundamental to this organisation's success. This is an organisation with 300 staff supporting over 700 services. Values that run through the core of this organisation are to be imaginative, respectful, compassionate, and bold.  As the Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the development and delivery of the end-to-end data migration process in collaboration with a multi-disciplined team of technical and non-technical stakeholders. You will be working with the Consumer Technology Transformation team who are undertaking the 'CMS Optimisation' program of work to review, consolidate or replace fit for purpose Consumer Management Systems (CMS').  Key responsibilities  Use business intelligence tools to identify, collate, consolidate, transform and store sources of data for migration. Object orientated scripting to clean, validate, transform and load existing into new applications &/other database structures. Act as an ICT subject matter expert (SME) to provide advice, recommendations and requirements on technical components, stages, and steps to deliver project objectives. Define data migration strategy and solution design using ETL (Extract-Transform-Load).  Skills required  Experience using tools such as, ETL tools (SSIS), SQL server, Access, Excel, Visual Basic/VBA and Relational database. Previous experience with CMS optimisation and data migration. Strong and effective written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate complex technical concepts, issues, and terms to a range of non-technical stakeholders. Proven high level critical thinking and analytical skills including ability to propose solutions to complex problems.  Apply Now This organisation supports diversity, a flexible working week and autonomy for its people. To find out more, please forward your CV via the 'apply' process. We look forward to hearing from you.
job_description.341: As a Data Analyst Intern, you will become part of the Data Science team and support a range of data-driven and reporting activities. This company is seeking talented Data Analyst Interns to support projects using Python, Machine Learning, and AI. You will also gain experience using predictive analysis tools and techniques. Your Internship as a Data Analyst will see you working with a range of company and client data and using ETL tools and PowerBI to create dashboards. This opportunity is suited to graduates wanting to start their career in Data Analytics.  Data Analyst Internship Duties • Performing data migration & data analytics under supervision from the Chief Data Scientist • Statistical modelling using R and Python • Data extraction, cleaning, and wrangling using the latest data science techniques • Prepare concise data reports and data visualisations for stakeholders that will help in decision-making processes • Present data using PowerBI and Tableau to highlight trends and findings • Designing and developing relational databases for collecting data  What you will learn on your Data Analyst Internship • Gain hands-on practical experience in Python, PowerBI, and SQL • Learn AWS integration for large-scale projects • Build high-powered visualisations using Tableau and PowerBI • Enhance your core Data Analyst skills through real-world projects using Python, Machine Learning & Deep Learning capabilities  How to apply for this Data Analyst Internship?  To be considered for this Data Analyst Internship, you need to be a member of the CSA Internship Academy. To learn more about doing an Internship and to book a free Career Counselling and Internships phone consultation, click the button below. Career Training, Mentoring & Internship Program Management fees apply to become a member of the CSA Internship Academy.  Click Apply to get started.
job_description.342: Exciting initial 6 months contract opportunity offering attractive and competitive daily rates  Your new company  You will be joining a leading private sector organisation that provides innovative solutions for various industries. This organisation has a strong reputation for delivering high-quality services and products to its clients, and is constantly looking for ways to improve its performance and efficiency.  Your new role  As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting data from various sources, such as surveys, databases, reports, and web analytics. You will provide actionable, data-driven business and insights by combining data manipulation capabilities, business acumen and technical or operational knowledge with analysis.  You will partner with data engineers and data owners from the business to define and build simple data models and integrate existing tools to automate data ingestion, data manipulation, quality control and data analysis.  What you’ll need to succeed  To be considered for this role, you will have: • A degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field • Demonstrated hands-on experience carrying out data analysis, data mining and insight generation in complex, fast-paced environments. • Proficiency in using data analysis tools and software, such as SQL, Python, R, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc. • Applied knowledge of data analytics tools (e.g. business intelligence applications) and approaches across all data lifecycle stages. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to handle complex and large datasets • Strong business acumen, including planning and performance management knowledge and customer intelligence • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills • A proactive and collaborative attitude, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team  What you’ll get in return  In return for your hard work and dedication, you will receive: • A competitive salary package that reflects your skills and experience • A flexible work arrangement that allows you to balance your personal and professional life • A supportive and friendly work environment that fosters learning and development • An opportunity to work on exciting and challenging projects that make a positive impact on the organisation and its clients  Call to action  If you are interested in this role, please apply online with your resume and cover letter. Alternatively, you can contact Suniva Rego on 0386168477 or email suniva.rego@hays.com.au with your updated resume. #2813968
job_description.343: About the role • Be part of a fun, knowledgeable and high-achieving team • International and diverse work atmosphere • Excellent learning and development opportunities  Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands VIC 3008 Role Type: Permanent, Full-time  This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions, the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner, in order to be appointed to the role.  Internal Audit is seeking to expand its Data Analytics capability and capacity to enhance risk insight and assurance coverage. The purpose of this role is to contribute to and execute Internal Audit’s Data Analytics strategy, partner with individual audit teams to deliver assurance and consulting activities, establish continuous monitoring across key business risks and controls, develop innovative Group wide and Divisional dashboards, undertake targeted business data interrogation, and embed data-analytics driven culture in Internal Audit.  What will you bring?  To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following: • Experience demonstrating technical expertise in data analytics, ideally across both banking industry and consulting, as well as with internal audit, risk or similar experience. • Strong understanding and delivery across the analytics lifecycle i.e. exploratory data analysis, data modelling and design, data wrangling, data quality, hypothesis testing, data visualisation and dashboard design. • Technically proficient with hands-on experience in tools such as Qlik, Python, KNIME and SQL • Exposure to React, Big Data / Machine Learning Techniques (such as GCP ML) would be an added bonus • Strong problem solving and quantitative analysis skills • Good verbal and written communication skills, as well as good listening and interpreting skills • Develops and maintains good relationships with stakeholders • Constantly delivers on assigned goals and strives to better these goals despite obstacles, setbacks or uncertainty • Qualifications in Data/Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Information Systems or other related fields  So, why join us?  We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter.
job_description.344: Required Skills: SQL / Teradata / shell scripting  Roles and Responsibilities: • GIT Bash • Shell Scripting· • Strong SQL coding · • Jenkins· • UNIX environment· • Control-M  Attitude· • Collaborative & Persuasive, • Self-motivated, Committed, • Always-on learner· • Delivering high quality, fit for purpose.  Additional skills:· • Mainframe general knowledge, • OPC, OMCS, File-aid etc · • COBOL (would be handy with upgrade project, but understand not likely to have COBOL and key skills above)· • JCL· • Endevor· • Python  Domain • Banking experience must  Job Types: Permanent, Full-time  Salary: $90,000.00 – $93,900.00 per year  Schedule: • 8 hour shift  Work Authorisation: • Australia (Preferred)
job_description.345: If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?  What's in it for you? We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.  You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  What we're looking for: Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation. Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models. Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard. Run human centred design sessions with end-users. Communicating and influencing stakeholders. Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  Skills and attributes for success: Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data. Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it. Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority. Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems. Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data. Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage. Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.
job_description.346: Bulla Dairy Foods is one of Australia's oldest family-owned dairy companies, proudly making dairy products in country Australia for six generations. We are dedicated to making products with more care, craftsmanship and passion from only the freshest milk and cream.  We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Master Data Analyst to join our IT team. With the option of being based at either our Derrimut or Colac site, you will work closely with the Business Process experts to ensure data quality, compliance and operating procedures are adhered to with relation to Master Data management. Additionally, you will provide support by monitoring and analysing master data, key data, and master relationship data within the organization.  Your key responsibilities will include: • Managing master data in SAP and other systems. • Work closely with the business to ensure alignment of master data rules and procedures • Ensure the high quality of master data in key systems as well as maintaining the processes to support the data quality • Identify areas for data quality improvements and help resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies • In collaboration with subject matter experts and data owners, define and implement data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable. • Manage, analyse, and resolve data issues and manage revisions needed to best meet internal and customer requirements while adhering to Bulla data standards • Assist in the creation and implementation of data standards and guidelines on data ownership, coding structures, and data replication to ensure access to and integrity of data • Conduct data cleaning activities for better management and quicker access  To be successful in this role, you will be degree qualified in Business or IT and have a minimum of 2 years' experience in managing Material Master Data in SAP.  You will have: • A demonstrated understanding of data analysis and validation techniques in SAP environment • Attention to detail and accuracy in managing data in the system • Ability to create supporting documentation including (Master Data process documents, Data Standard Documents, Data flow diagrams etc.) • Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment and use team work to resolve problems and issues within and outside of our direct accountabilities • Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills • Strong communication skills (written, verbal & interpersonal) • Strong stakeholder management skills • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills • FMCG and dairy industry experience would also be highly regarded.  What we can offer you! • Great cultural environment in a proud, Australian family-owned business • A variety of benefits including a Short-Term Incentive Program, corporate clothing, delicious take-home product allowance, and free on-site parking at all our sites • Ability to work remotely in line with the needs of the role  This is a unique opportunity to truly make your mark & contribute to the success of the iconic Bulla Dairy Foods brand. If you think you have the ability to successfully drive improvement in an SAP environment, please apply now to join our team! Employment Type: FULL_TIME
job_description.347: At PointsBet, we have only built a fraction of what we have imagined.  Launching in Australia in 2017, PointsBet are dedicated to providing our customers with the ultimate betting experience. We're on a mission to make racing and sports betting easier to understand, fun to use and faster. After some recent business changes, PointsBet Australia is about to head into a exciting stage of it's journey and as we continue to grow, we're looking for a Junior Data Scientist to play an integral role in supporting PointsBet’s continued growth and success.  As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for analysing large amounts of raw data to help inform PointsBet's marketing activity. A key focus of the role surrounds optimisation of promotional performance and marketing investment. Responsibilities will also include support of a range of machine learning models on customer segmentation to inform CRM activity.  To create efficiencies in the decision-making process, the junior data scientist will also build automated reporting which will enable the business to track performance in real time.  What you’ll own: • Build and improve customer valuation models, including models to help optimise promotional spend • Build predictive models and deliver data-driven insights for customers and marketing functions of the business • Ad-hoc data queries relating to performance and health of the business, in relation to client quality, promotion performance and efficiency of marketing spend • Work closely with stakeholders to help drive business decisions • Solve business problems using a wide variety of data science techniques • Collaborate closely with leads and team members in the Data Science team • Build reports to understand shifts in customer behaviour that affect business performance • Communicate or present data modelling findings with the broader team, and document modelling techniques for sharing across the business  The skills we seek: • Proficiency in SQL, Python or R highly regarded • Experience building statistical/machine learning models • Good understanding of statistical analysis and probability. • Experience in wagering applications highly regarded • Ability to produce dashboards (Power BI experience desirable) • Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to liaise with different stakeholders around the business to collaborate on projects  The PB Perks! • PointsBet Flex Program – Filled with Hybrid Working, Work from Anywhere weeks, Sabbatical Leave to name a few. • PointsBet Day – Get your PointsBet anniversary off. • Annual Bonus Scheme – We reward great work, earn even more on top of our competitive salary packages. • Parental Leave – 18 weeks for Primary Carers and 4 weeks for Secondary Carers. • Daily breakfasts, sporting event tickets, a range of wellness programs.  So you don’t tick every requirement on the job description but are still interested? Please apply anyway! We are built different at PointsBet, because we think different. We promote diversity of thought and would love to hear from a wide range of applicants as we believe that any unique skillset adds value to the team. Once you're in the door, your talents will be fostered, with 42 Australian promotions in 2022 alone, we are truly committed to growing talent at PointsBet!
job_description.348: Company Description  illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion leverages its consumer and commercial credit registries to provide end-to-end customer management solutions to clients in the financial services, telecommunications, utilities and government sectors.  Product Analysts are responsible for assisting Product Managers in maintaining a competitive and customer-oriented product suite, supporting the complete product lifecycle for a range of products targeted across organisations risk life stages.  This position works in partnership with a variety of stakeholders across the business including Business Analysts, Project Managers, IT Developers, Sales, Data, Finance and Customer Support to develop, implement, monitor and support of Products.  Job Description  Assist in managing the End-to-End Product lifecycle of key products, including: • Research and analysis to help inform product decisions. • Monitor customer usage, behaviour and trends, developing a deep, data centric knowledge of our customers. • Track product performance against revenue goals, industry standards and competitors, liaising with other business units to gather information. • Identify and define product features, gaps and user journeys, focusing on customer needs. • Help maintain the enhancement backlog, balancing customer needs with competing business priorities. • Work closely with Business Analysts to understand, analyse and document business requirements and acceptance criteria, clearly articulating the ‘why’ and ensuring the product vision is captured. • Attend project stand-ups and meetings, providing context and clarification on product requirements and objectives. • Participate in UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and PVT (Production Verification Testing) activities.  Qualifications • Using data to support decision making. • Experience working in both agile and waterfall environments. • Tertiary qualification in a business or quantitative discipline. • Competency to perform basic SQL queries (Microsoft SQL Management Studio). • An adequate understanding of database structures. • Confident use of Microsoft Office – Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word. • Analytical capability and problems solving – using data to inform decisions. • Strong relationship and influencing skills – to deliver outcomes and satisfy customer needs.  Additional Information  Some of our perks • Flexibility and Remote Working Options • Gifted Leave, Purchased Leave, Public Holiday Swap and Paid Volunteer Leave • Paid Parental Leave • Novated Leasing and Corporate Discounts (ie. Health Insurance) • Education Assistance and dedicated time for professional development as part of your role • Free Employee Assistance Programme, Free Flu Shots and Subsidised Gym Memberships.  illion’s values  Wonder what if  We wonder on many levels. About ideas. And about how others see them. We listen with curiosity. Obsess the numbers. And embrace new ways to make data, make a difference  We’re good eggs  Everything we do is built on integrity. We hold ourselves to high standards. And higher principles. We act with good intentions. Taking every opportunity to be that little bit better.  Human. Kind  People are the hart of our products, processes and culture. Our relationships are a gift. We’re inclusive. Measuring the impact of our actions on other’s first. Kindness and humanity prevail.  We all add up  We work wonders when we work together. Our diverse perspectives and backgrounds make us greater than the sum of our parts. We’re one team, where every single one of us counts.  How to Apply  To apply, please click “Apply Now” button and we will be in touch shortly.  Due to the sensitive data that illion works with, employment at illion is subject to employees having full working rights for Australia and/or New Zealand and successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.  Here at illion, we value diversity and inclusion and believe that we are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. By joining illion you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates a diversity of cultures, skill sets, educations and opinions. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

Victoria (VIC), Cobram, Regional Victoria, Shepparton & Goulburn Valley, North East VictoriaBusiness Analyst Moira Shire Council is looking a motivated, customer focused individual to provide business systems maintenance, project management, and application support for Council's corporate information systems.
