job_description.350: Our culture believes in Powering Your Potential. We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.  We believe in flexibility for you to explore your passions while making an impact through meaningful work within our inclusive workforce. That’s what #LifeAtCummins is all about.  IT Data Manager  Description  IT Data Manager  We are looking for an experienced IT Data Manager to join our team in Scoresby, Melbourne.  In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways: • Define the Data Strategy for a large organisation moving to S/4 HANA. • Represent the project team in enterprise data governance council and master data management forums. • Extract insights from data by identifying relationships and patterns. Using a suite of data exploration and data visualization techniques (such as Predictive and Statistical Modelling) to understand the underlying structure of the data and enable sound conclusions upon model building. • Partner with data engineers on building data infrastructure & data scientists for analytical / machine learning models to generate predictive insights used in solving business questions. • Provides expertise and leadership, coaching and direction of data analysts across the organization. • Lead data cleansing, archiving, validation, transformation, and migration of data from legacy ERP to SAP.  To be successful in this role you will need the following: • Degree qualified in IT, data analytics or a relevant field. • At least seven years’ experience in Data Management and Big Data Analytics. • Experience in SAP data migration and data models. • Experience in S/4HANA Embedded Analytics preferred. • Experience working in a large complex organisation.  Compensation and Benefits • Competitive and attractive Salary Package on Offer • Hybrid Working Model & Free Onsite Parking • Comprehensive Cummins product training provided • Income Protection continuance insurance • Discounts with select private health insurance, PC software/hardware and a range of vehicles • Annual remuneration review • Participation in an annual variable compensation (bonus) program • Employee Assistance Program available to employees • Paid Parental leave (Conditions apply)  At Cummins, we are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, colour, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.  We are proud to be recognised as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for All Women. Click here (link to our work180 page: https://work180.com/en-au/for-women/employer/cummins-australia/jobs ) to check out our Benefits  Job SYSTEMS/INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY  Primary Location Australia-Victoria-Melbourne-Australia, Scoresby, Distributor RO BR 900  Job Type Experienced - Exempt / Office  Recruitment Job Type Exempt - Experienced  Job Posting Oct 5, 2023, 3:37:15 AM  Unposting Date Ongoing  Organization Distribution Business  Role Category Hybrid - Potential for Partial Remote  Relocation Package Eligible  Req ID: 2300077W
job_description.351: About Future Fund  The Future Fund is Australia's Sovereign Wealth Fund. Our purpose is clear: we invest for the benefit of future generations of Australians.  Decision making is our commercial competitive advantage. Our organisation is home to ambitious, high-performing people who are driven to do meaningful work, grow professionally, support their peers and colleagues, and contribute to the future success of our organisation.  Our ‘One team, One purpose’ philosophy underpins our unique culture and the way we work together. This philosophy extends into all aspects of our organisation and guides how and why we do what we do.  The Opportunity  An exciting opportunity awaits an experienced Senior Analyst to join the IDM Data Operations team. This role is aimed at supporting the Overlays investment team, for whom you will manage upstream investment data management activities. Your in-depth understanding of data analysis, management, tools, models, and the data lifecycle, coupled with your expertise in derivative products (including their valuation and trade life cycles) along with proficiency with the Aladdin platform, will be invaluable in managing investment data for this specialised domain.  Your primary focus will be on daily delivery of data into the Aladdin OMS and ensuring that trading data is both timely and accurate for our Overlays investment team. Key stakeholders to this role are the Overlays team and Investment Operations teams, your ability to drive meaningful and successful relationships with stakeholders is key to success. Your innovative and proactive approach, along with strong statistical skills, will drive data-driven solutions to enhance their experience with the data.  If you are an ambitious professional with a proven background in data analysis and possess expertise in derivative products and lifecycles, along with proficiency in the Aladdin platform, we invite you to apply.  Key Responsibilities  Data Management and Technical Support: Investigate and resolve technical issues related to trades, monitor trading activities, and provide technical expertise on the Aladdin derivatives system. Collaborate with investment teams and technology to ensure accurate processing of trades and settlements. Enhance processes through Aladdin platform improvements.  Operational Service Delivery: Oversee outsourced partners, ensuring high-quality service delivery to downstream consumers. Monitor data delivery, certification, and exception management. Implement market data requirements, drive data quality improvements, and proactively develop solutions to enhance operational efficiency.  Partner and Provider Management: Support oversight of partner delivery, prioritize and manage data service requests. Monitor partner services/products in line with solution parameters. Assist in project and product management of data-related initiatives, fostering effective partner relationships.  About You  1. Technical Proficiency: A strong grasp of the Blackrock Aladdin system, coupled with expertise in derivative securities, trade lifecycles, and market conventions. 2. Analytical Acumen: Proficiency in quantitative analysis and problem-solving, enabling the development of data-driven solutions and insights. 3. Effective Communication: Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders, convey information, and influence decisions. 4. Professional Attributes: A commitment to professionalism, accuracy, and quality in tasks, along with a proactive, innovative, and adaptable mindset to navigate a dynamic environment.  Life at Future Fund  Our approach to building an inclusive culture is aimed at facilitating impactful, effective and objective decision making. We continue to deepen our understanding of the lived experience of underrepresented groups within our industry.  To continue to expand our knowledge, we actively encourage you to apply to this role and contribute to our collective Purpose. We are better for our differences and support our people in bringing their authentic selves to work. It not only benefits our teams, it means you can focus on what matters most, being you.  Learn more about life at Future Fund by visiting our LinkedIn Life page.
job_description.352: About the Role  This is a Senior role that supports the Productivity and Automation team within the Operations Area. You will be responsible for the initiation, design, development, and delivery of a wide range of operations-related dashboards (Power BI), analytics, measurement, research, and evaluation projects.  What you will do: • Work quickly in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment • Work with a wide range of stakeholders including external vendors, business SME's, technical SME's and the project team and can understand the different needs of each group of stakeholders • Interrogate databases, including tables and fields to understand and communicate linkages • Perform analysis to respond to queries and provide answers in relation to the data • Work across several different source systems with different database structures • Performing data analysis tasks such as building reports, identifying trends, and making recommendations based on findings • Analyse and define new process improvement opportunities to support continuous improvement and business outcomes; providing advice to stakeholders, on ways to improve the efficiency and reliability of data products and services • Short-term goals: focuses on retention metrics and active metrics  What you will bring: • Tertiary qualifications or relevant experience in Data Analytics, IT, Science, Statistics, or Business in IT • Ability to understand complex data sets from a wide variety of source systems • Minimum of 5 years experience working on data analysis and complex data management projects, particularly in the area of master data management • Master knowledge in using SQL, Excel and other tools and techniques to understand the data structures and associated data. • Master knowledge with Python, R language, or SPSS, Power Bi, Tableau and other relevant reporting tools is preferred • Internet product work experience will be preferred • Advanced mathematical and statistical skills • Utilise advanced and complex analytic techniques and methods to achieve desired outcomes • Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills and attention to detail. • Persuasive communication skills, both in writing and in person • The ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines • Critical and objective thinker with strong, cross functional problem-solving skills • Bilingual in English and Mandarin is required  What you'll get in return  We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent service while allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. You will be a part of an amazing diverse team that values growth and development. You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help and support others.  Job Types: Permanent, Full-time  Salary: $100,000.00 – $135,000.00 per year  Schedule: • 8 hour shift • Day shift  Application Question(s): • Are you a Chinese and English speaker? • What is your expected salary? • How many years of relevant experience do you have?
job_description.353: Hi! And thanks for stopping by!  We’re MYOB, a business management platform designed to unleash the potential of businesses across Australia and New Zealand! As the #originalstartup, our roots are in finance and accounting software, but today we are so much more. We help our Aussie and Kiwi customers unleash their full potential, giving them the tools to Start, Survive and Succeed: all in the one place.  We’re always on the hunt for those who bring a different perspective, diversity of thought and the drive to make our culture even better. Take your career to a new dimension at MYOB.  About the Team  Our Unified marketing team is here to drive un-believe-able results for the business. They create demand in market for MYOB and engage AU & NZ businesses when it matters most to either acquire or retain them. They’re dedicated to delivering value for our customers by understanding their business pain points, and needs and ensuring we deliver them value at every stage of their journey.  Are you passionate about utilising data to drive strategic marketing decisions? Do you have a curiosity for extracting insights from complex datasets and turning them into practical recommendations? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our marketing team as a Marketing Performance Analyst.  About the Role  As a Marketing Performance Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our marketing team by analysing data, tracking program performance, and providing strategic insights. Your focus will be on optimising channel effectiveness, enhancing marketing program outcomes, and contributing to the overall success of our marketing efforts. Reporting to the Marketing Analytics and Performance Manager, you will collaborate with various team members across the organisation, including marketing leaders, cross-functional teams, and external partners.  Key Responsibilities  - Conduct in-depth tactical data analysis across marketing channels, identifying areas for process improvement and implementing metrics from engagement to conversion across segments.  - Mine and analyse data from multiple sources to track the performance of marketing programs against key performance indicators, offering insights to drive optimisation.  - Monitor and analyse performance throughout the marketing and sales funnel, pinpointing opportunities for enhancement.  - Collaborate with marketing, sales, revenue operations, and finance teams to contribute to quarterly and annual forecasts and performance modelling.  - Develop and implement regular reporting and data visualisations to communicate insights to senior leaders, enhancing self-serve analytics across the marketing function.  - Stay up-to-date with the latest web analytics tools and technologies, making recommendations for new tools that can improve web performance monitoring.  About You  - Deep understanding of data analytics across multiple channels.  - Strong operational experience in systems, processes, and technologies.  - Profound understanding of B2B marketing and sales strategies.  - Proven experience in website analytics, preferably in e-commerce or digital marketing environments, with expertise in Google Analytics, including configuration and reporting.  - Proven experience with various data platforms and tools, including Google Analytics, Microsoft Power BI, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce or HubSpot), Microsoft Excel, and SQL for data analysis.  - Ability to extract insights from extensive data volumes to inform customer acquisition and retention strategies.  - Prior experience in creating dashboards and reports to convey findings to diverse audiences.  - Familiarity with business databases and data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) is desirable.  Skills and Competencies  - Commercial savvy and business insight.  - Proficiency in data analysis and insights generation.  - Effective communication and collaboration skills.  - Passion for getting results through data-driven decisions.  - Ability to work successfully in a cross-functional team environment.  Our Culture & Benefits  Our values have stood the test of time. If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued, and your ideas can make a difference, come to a place where Your Work Matters.     See what it's like to work at MYOB and what we're all about.     Do your best work in a flexible work environment, right down to financial assistance to set up your home office…it’s called Flexperience, and it’s designed by you and your team!     Our partnership with Smiling Mind helps support the wellbeing of our team members and customers     Drive your own learning via conferences, in-house training, LinkedIn Learning, study assistance and a strong focus on leaders creating a learning environment     A multitude of leave options including up to an additional four weeks of purchased leave, generous parental leave, domestic violence leave, transgender leave, volunteer leave, study leave, plus more!     Communities built around ‘Wellness’, ‘Belonging’ and the ‘Planet’ where you can make a meaningful contribution     Access to best-in-class discounts and vouchers from leading retailers, and a lot more.  We are proud to be a Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to responding to every applicant.  MYOB are an equal opportunity employer and we champion diversity. Don’t meet every single requirement of this role? Still apply! Research tells us that that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply unless they meet every single requirement. At MYOB we believe that the right hire is someone who makes an addition to our culture, rather than someone who fits in and conforms to our status quo. Moving to ‘Culture Add’ means adding team members who not only value MYOBs standards and workplace culture, but also bring an aspect of diversity that positively contributes to MYOB. So, if you’re excited about this role, or about MYOB, we’d still love to hear from you!
job_description.354: About ViVi  Vivi is the only wireless screen mirroring and digital signage tool designed for education. We enable K-12 organizations to realize more value from their existing investments in display technology and student devices, by providing more consistent and reliable experiences for students, teachers and staff to connect, communicate and collaborate.  Vivi exists because we all had that one teacher who changed our lives, who went above and beyond to serve as a role model and sage. They guided discussion, connected with their students on a personal level, were just as engaging and entertaining as they were educational, and they created a dynamic learning environment by constantly involving students.  Personalized learning environments have been proven to deliver better educational outcomes for individuals through increased participation and engagement. To successfully create such an environment requires a fluid, visual dialogue between teacher and student. This is why Vivi exists.   Vivi is used by over 500,000 teachers and students in more than 90,000 classrooms around the world and is setting out to disrupt the enormous education industry with our high-growth, ambitious, and creative team.  What You’ll Be Doing • Building and maintaining production level data pipelines using various tools such as AWS Glue, Python, Lambda etc. that populate business critical dashboards as needed • Performing data analysis as required, and promptly preparing reports with the findings/results • Building custom analyses, reports, dashboards using tools in Vivi’s BI stack • Building/maintaining components of the Data Warehouse as per the Architecture using CI/CD • Implementing the BI Data Quality Framework • Supporting the business stakeholders with ad hoc BI and data requests • Working with internal customers, Engineering, Product and support teams to prioritise requests and reports • Identifying opportunities to establish/improve the processes and practices • Creating relevant documentation as required  About You • You have 2-5 years’ experience in a similar role, working on cloud data pipelines • Knowledge of AWS or Azure Cloud technologies • Knowledge of the following would be ideal – Power BI, Python, SQL, Postgres, Excel • Excellent analytical skills • Excellent communication and presentation skills • Excellent documentation skills • Exposure to the Atlassian suite of tools, e.g. Jira and Confluence • Exposure to agile working practices • Comfortable in a fast-paced start-up environment  What We Can Offer You • Career progression – we offer each employee an annual $1000 L&D budget to assist with furthering their skills • Wellness program – including wellness days off and subsidised ClassPass subscription • Give back to the community with our Volunteer program • Birthdays off each year  Vivi is an equal opportunity employer. This means we are committed to recruiting, training, compensating and promoting our employees regardless of Race, Color, Ancestry, National Origin, Religion, Creed, Age, Disability, Sex, Gender, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Gender expression, Medical condition, Genetic Information, Marital status, or Military or Veteran status. As an education technology organization, we are dedicated to reflecting the diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion found in our consumers, employees, and partners. Inclusion is at the heart of what we do, from the way we craft our job descriptions, to the values we champion daily.
job_description.355: Bonfire isn’t just another digital marketing agency. We deliver results for our valued customers – businesses whom we see as partners, that have a real-world impact on their bottom line.  Our focus and passion for data-driven outcomes have cemented our position as one of Australia’s leading digital performance agencies. Return on investment (ROI) is the foundation of everything we do.  We work with REIWA, Water Corporation, Furniture Bazaar, CurtainWorld, and many more iconic brands.  We have a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Operations team. This is a hands-on technical role that will suit a self-motivated analytical mind with experience and passion for solving complex multi-faceted problems using data.  Reporting to the General Manager – Business Operations, you will be responsible for working with internal stakeholders to translate complex business questions into abstract analytical models which you will then implement, explore, interpret, and visualise using our best-practise modern data stack.  Most days your role will involve: • Meeting with members of our leadership team to translate their business intelligence problems into actionable reporting solutions • Building elegant, modular, extensible data models with Data Build Tool (dbt) using SQL • Querying our Snowflake data warehouse using SQL to answer ad hoc questions • Building beautiful dashboards and reports to power insight analysis across all of our internal functions (Operations, Customer Service, Finance etc) using Power BI and ThoughtSpot • Deep diving into our Snowflake data warehouse to uncover unheralded insights into the performance of our clients digital marketing  Occasionally your role will involve: • Working directly with clients to resolve interesting questions they might have about their digital marketing data • Supporting in the development and implementation of data pipeline and automation projects • Helping educate all Bonfire employees on data-driven analysis and methodologies  You’re likely to have the following qualities: • You’ve got experience working in similar hands-on analytical roles • You’ve got formalised training, probably a university degree, in a field relevant to the role at hand, or can make a strong argument why you don’t need one • You can write complex SQL statements in your sleep • You may not have had direct experience using Data Built Tool (dbt) but you’ve always wanted to learn • Data is a hobby and a passion as well as a profession, you’re always using data in your personal life and building personal projects using data • You can confidently explain what a Google Analytics session is and how marketing attribution works • You might have worked with Snowflake as a data warehouse, or if not, you’ve definitely worked with similar column-orientated storage like Google BigQuery • You’re a veracious learner, and revel at the opportunity to learn a new skill or platform • You celebrate wins, and analyse the opportunities that come from misses • Though you’re highly analytical, you’re also an excellent communicator and enjoy distilling complex concepts in the clearest, most concise fashion possible  What we can provide you:  We have an excellent office environment located in the heart of Subiaco, and an unparalleled agency culture.  While our way of working is like a well-oiled machine, we have a strong innovation orientation. You will have access to the latest software and programs to hone your craft, and the benefits that come with a collective mindset geared towards continual improvement.  We have strong values (we created them together as a group), we have a talented team with a genuine focus on high performance – and a growing, profitable business with all the benefits that come along with it.  What else can you expect at Bonfire? • Excellent work-life balance, with a strict ‘no agency hours’ approach, flexible start and finish times and work from home options • Ongoing training and professional development • Wellbeing program including an Employee Assistance Program • Great café-style coffee, cold pressed juices, kombucha, snacks and fresh fruit • Regular opportunities to socialise and celebrate our success  To get to know us better visit: https://www.bonfire.com.au/work-at-bonfire/.  Interested? Apply via the link with your resume and cover letter. Please note you will be redirected to an external site.
job_description.356: Data Analyst  Are you a Data Analyst who is keen to bridge your technical skills with a passion for Sport? Are you interested in developing your technical skills whilst enabling the next generation of Western Australian Olympians and Paralympians to achieve their goals?  About WAIS  The Western Australian Institute of Sport (WAIS) is the peak high-performance sporting organisation in Western Australia. WAIS has a proud history of Olympic, Paralympic and World Champions who have accomplished amazing achievements within sport and in life. WAIS enables and supports WA athletes to achieve success on a national and international level. Our culture of Striving for Excellence is lived through the behaviours of athletes and staff that demonstrate Passion, Integrity, Quality and Teamwork.  WAIS is proudly supported by the State Government and is a member of the National Institute Network who collectively support National and State Sporting Organisations to deliver the National High Performance Sport Strategy.  About the role  The Data Analyst supports the delivery of the sports intelligence strategy with skills in scripting, querying and analytics to deliver timely and accurate insight to stakeholders.  The Data Analyst will be part of the Performance Systems and Analytics (PSA) team which is a newly formed team in the Western Australian Institute of Sport (WAIS). WAIS supports Western Australian athletes perform at the highest levels through providing coaching, training environment and support services (including medical, sports science, coaches, and other service providers. The role of data analyst is key to support the Performance Systems and Analytics team deliver the WAIS sports intelligence strategy.  This position entails a multifaceted scope, affording you the opportunity to acquire and cultivate skills through practical experience. Core duties will include the following:  · Organisation Intelligence: Build and maintain reports, dashboards and intelligence solutions for stakeholders  · Data management: Maintain current and future processes and standards on the data platform  · Data ingestion: Build and maintain sustainable ingestion solutions for new external data sources  · Organisational Data Literacy: Assist in creating organisational data literacy, culture and trust in data solutions  · Communication with stakeholders  The role is based out of the WAIS High Performance Service Centre in the Mt Claremont Sporting Precinct and may require domestic travel.  About you  We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst with proven technical abilities to support the work of the Performance Systems and Analytics Team.  Experience and qualification requirements:  · Experience with SQL, Python and dashboarding tools (Power BI, Tableau etc.)  · Database management  · Ability to translate stakeholder requirements then design and implement relevant solutions  · Data visualisation, reporting and communication  · Familiarity with sports analytics frameworks  · Ability to work with a multidisciplinary team  · Passion for sport and sports performance  Desirable:  · Experience with Fusion/Smartabase  · Experience with Azure  · Data engineering experience  · Power BI experience  Next steps  To apply, you must create an account via our career’s portal and apply https://wais.elmotalent.com.au/careers/default/jobs  Please submit a one-page cover letter along with your resume and experience against the Position Description found on our careers portal.  Applications will close on 4th September 2023, at 5pm AWST.  Please note, shortlisting of candidates will commence prior to this date and applicants are encouraged to apply at your earliest opportunity.  This is a full-time, maximum term contract. The anticipated salary is from $80,570 - $86,797 + superannuation and will be negotiated with the successful candidate.  Please note, only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview.  For further information  For role related queries please contact Kawther Sidhoum, HR Advisor, via email ksidhoum@wais.org.au  Building System Capability  At WAIS, we offer career opportunities for people who share our ambition and passion for high performance sport. From graduates to expert professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as we grow. We would love you to be part of our journey.  Apply today.
job_description.357: • Hybrid working combining Perth office-based and work from home • Supportive and inclusive workplace fostering strong collaboration • Newly created role with significant business exposure  Want a better job?  You'll find it at Alinta Energy.  We're making energy better for our more than 1.1 million customers – and we're making work life better for our 1,000+ people too.  We believe in better At Alinta Energy, we're a friendly bunch working to be the best energy company. Our culture is collaborative, and our passion drives positive change for people and the planet.  Over the past decade, we've evolved from a Western Australian residential gas retailer to one of Australia's largest energy retailers, generators, investors, and developers with infrastructure across Australia and New Zealand.  Help us make energy better  About the role:  Alinta Energy are looking for a collaborative Data Analyst to join their Trading & Portfolio Management team based in Perth. Specifically, you will be providing support to our customers as well as our business by transforming raw data into meaningful insights that contribute to future data and system enhancements.  In this permanent full-time role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams in providing assurance over financial data and ensuring alignment across systems and processes, through establishing frameworks, control reporting and regular risk-based testing and analysis.  In this role, you'll be: • Supporting in the overall of scoping, planning, delivery of financial assurance • Developing and executing control reporting, dashboards and other methodologies to easily assess the accuracy of systems and processes • Proactively contribute to the continuous improvement of the function, highlighting opportunities to enhance ways of working, processes, and automation • Developing a strong understanding of the operational systems, their interdependencies and operational use to ensure accuracy and compliance for the business and our customers • Demonstrating daily personal behaviour that uphold Alinta Energy values.  Ideally, you'll bring to the role: • A relevant tertiary qualification in Commerce, Data Science, Computer Science, or other relevant numeric discipline • Experience in a data, assurance, or commercial role • Working knowledge of SQL is essential and the ability to learn programming languages such as Python and R. • Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau • A strong sense of collaboration and a passion for problem solving.  This is a fabulous role with great exposure to the business so understanding the importance of establishing strong business relationships will be paramount to your success.  Enjoy better benefits - check out our careers page for more information  One the best things about Alinta Energy is we discover better together. If you like the sound of that, and you're a match for the role, we'd love to talk to you.  Alinta Energy. That's better.  Alinta Energy is a 2023 Circle Back Initiative employer. We commit to respond to every applicant.  If you application progresses, we will need to complete background and pre-employment checks, such as immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, qualification checks, and additional checks for roles related to finance.  We look forward to hearing from you.  Click 'Apply' to submit your application. Closing date: 4 October 2023 LinkedIn#LI-KT1
job_description.358: We are looking for a creative Data Analyst to join our diverse team at Ventia in Perth. Growing your career as a Full Time Data Analyst is a great opportunity to develop competitive skills. If you are strong in decision-making, teamwork and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Data Analyst at Ventia today  About the role  Ventia's Defence Base Services (DBS) team are seeking an experiencedData Analystto join their Finance team based in Perth WA.  Due to the diverse nature and geographical spread of our business, we may also consider other candidates who reside in Melbourne, Sydney or Adelaide. About you  Reporting directly to the (DBS) National Alternate Proposal Governance Manager you are an experienced Data Analyst who can provide practical data & analytics to enable the delivery of long-term sustainable change and improvement across the DBS contract.  This role is integral in providing quantitative and qualitative analytics to help the business produce benefits that lead to strategic outcomes and influence key business decisions. As a Data Analyst you are responsible for managing the master data, developing reports and troubleshooting data issues. You are adept in translating project requirements into custom-formatted data reports.  The ideal candidate for this position can complete life cycle data generation and outline critical information for each program of work.  Therefore, you are someone with a keen eye for detail and have a thorough understanding of data analysis and visualisation tools and systems.  Key duties, but not limited to: Technical review and endorsement of Estate Upkeep Alternate Proposals Build analytics tools that utilise the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer requirements, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics Assemble large & complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability Create data tools for data analytics team and operational managers that assist them in building and optimising our product into an innovative industry leader Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems  Skills and experience: In addition to your formal qualifications and experience, we seek to employ people who possess: 2+ years of experience in a Data Analytics role Degree qualified in IT, Engineering or Finance Strong Data visualisation and storytelling skills in both Power BI and Excel Analytical experience in a Finance division (Management or Financial Accounting Reporting, Balance Sheet Reporting, Reconciliation) or demonstrable understanding of these concepts not essential but would be considered favourably Ability to source data through data systems and databases (SAP BW, SQL etc). SQL experience advantageous but not essential to this role In depth understanding of relational database management systems Strong problem solving and diagnostic skills Strong business and commercial acumen An ability to successfully engaging stakeholders from various levels of the business High level of detail  Other special conditions  The incumbent to this position must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Defence Security Clearance up to a level of negative vetting 1 (secret). As a result of this requirement the incumbent is preferred to be an Australian Citizen. This position requires a National Criminal History check and a valid Australian driver's licence.  Benefits  Ventia offers you a flexible, supportive and inclusive work environment where you matter.  In addition, you will find a stimulating and rewarding working environment where we take our peoples careers seriously and help them to learn and grow.  This role comes with the added security of being offered as a permanent position with consideration of future flexible working requirements. How to apply  To apply please click on the 'Apply' button to complete your application.  No matter who you are, we encourage you to apply for the job that's right for you.  We are keen to increase diversity across our business, so our workforce reflects the diverse communities in which we work. Our current focus is on employing more women at all levels of our organisation. Benefits of working as a Data Analyst in Perth: • Learning opportunities • Advancement opportunities • Competitive salary
job_description.359: Advisory Services Salary: Level 7, $128,077 - $136,891 per annum + Super (PSCA 2022) Position number: 022574 Work type: Fixed Term - Full Time Location: Perth CBD Closing date: 2023-10-13 4:30 PM (YYYY-MM-DD) Attachments: - -  You can view and print these PDF attachments by downloading .  This is a fixed term, full time vacancy available for a period of 12 months with no possible extension.  This role offers: • Flexible working arrangements • Career pathway opportunities • Learning and development opportunity programs  About the role  The Advisory Services Directorate is responsible for the high-level coordination and oversight of the Departments operational activities including policy and legislative reform, providing advice to government, building collaborative work arrangements within the Justice portfolio, public sector and broader community.  The Directorate assists with projects and investigations of strategic significance, business improvement initiatives and provides support and advice to the Director General on highly sensitive and confidential issues that impact on the whole of the Department.  The Principal Data Analyst is responsible for: • Conducting and/ or overseeing the provision of data analysis to support the Director Generals office. Work collaboratively with other business areas to deliver outputs that align with the Department and Governments objectives. • Monitoring quality and accuracy of statistical information ensuring consistency with the Department's strategic requirements. • Represents the Legal Assistance Branch on internal or external committees, working parties and workshops as required. • Supports the operations of the Legal Assistance Branch by assisting staff as required, including coaching and mentoring team members to develop and enhance their capabilities.  Eligibility  To be eligible for a permanent appointment to the Western Australian public sector it is essential that you are an Australian citizen or have permanent residency status in Australia. To be eligible for a fixed term appointment you must have documentary evidence of your entitlement to live and work in Australia for the duration of the contract.  All employees are required to undergo employment screening, which includes a National Criminal History Check and other checks that may be relevant to the position requirements.  About us  When you join the Department of Justice, you become part of a people-focused organisation, working hard to make our community a fairer and safer place to live. We offer many different employment opportunities in locations around Western Australia. You will have a chance to make a real difference to your local communities and to the lives of those you work with.  How to apply  Please ensure you review the attached JDF for further information about the requirements of the position. This information will assist you with the preparation of your application. For more information about the recruitment and selection process and other benefits, please refer to the Job Applicant Pack.  We require you to submit: • A current comprehensive CV including the contact details of two referees and; • A statement no more than 3 pages addressing all the Job Related Requirements and Role Specific Criteria contained in the JDF . Please provide examples to support your claims.  Please ensure you allow sufficient time to submit your application, as late applications will not be accepted.  To submit your application, click the " Apply for Job " button at the bottom of this page. Emailed applications will not be accepted.  Equity and Diversity  The Department of Justice is committed in building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of Aboriginal Australians, people with disability, youth, and other diversity groups. People with disability will be provided with reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace.  Aboriginal job seekers may contact the Aboriginal Workforce Development Team on or call (08) 9264 1700 for culturally appropriate application advice.  Subsequent Vacancies  Applicants found suitable but not recommended for this vacancy, may be considered for subsequent similar vacancies in the Department of Justice for a period of twelve (12) months, in accordance with Part 5 (General Appointment) of the Commissioner's Instructions No. 2: Filling a Public Sector Vacancy and Commissioner's Instructions No. 39: Interim Arrangements to Fill Public Sector Vacancies.
job_description.360: The Data Analyst is an integral role within the SPS Division specializing in the analysis of contractual obligations, KPIs and monthly reporting.  Our Company  Pacific Energy is one of Australia’s leading producers of sustainable distributed energy. We’ve been servicing remote townships, utilities and the mining industry for more than 40 years, delivering customised systems that integrate solar, wind, gas, diesel and battery storage systems.  Our dedicated team of experts and complete in-house capabilities mean we can deliver world-class projects from beginning to end, safely and on time.  We’re proud to be Australia’s largest remote power station builder and operator, with 48 sites nationally and more than 40% of our energy portfolio now powered by renewable and hybrid systems.  At Pacific Energy, we know the importance of a clean energy future. That’s why our organisation is driven by some of the industry’s finest engineers, electrical contractors, production specialists and project managers. Join us and help pave the way to a cleaner, brighter future.  Our Role  Our office in Perth is currently looking for a Data Analyst to work within the Service, Products and Stand-alone Power Systems Division, specializing in the analysis of contractual obligations, key performance indicators (KPIs), and monthly reporting on operational Renewable Energy assets and power stations.  This role will work closely with the Contract Manager and other internal stakeholders to provide actionable insights derived from financial, CRM, CMMS, and ERP systems data.  The Data Analyst will utilize tools such as Power BI, Power Query, and Excel to Export, Transform & Load (ETL) data into meaningful models and reports that drive business decisions for clients, managers, and teams.  Key Responsibilities  Position’s Duties Include But Are Not Limited To • Contractual Analysis: Review and analyse contractual obligations and KPIs defined by the Contract Manager related to operational Renewable Energy assets and power stations. • Monthly Reporting: Generate monthly reports focusing on the performance and status of energy systems designed, constructed, and/or owned by the Group. • Data Integration: Assist in the analysis, reporting, and forecasting of data from financial, CRM, CMMS, and ERP systems. • ETL Processes: Collaborate with internal subject matter experts to Export, Transform & Load data into useful data models and reports. • Data Visualization: Utilize Power BI and Power Query to create compelling visualizations that communicate complex data in a straightforward manner. • Stakeholder Communication: Present findings and insights to the Contract Manager, clients, and internal teams to inform and drive business decisions. • Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data by implementing and following best practices in data management. • Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analytics tools and techniques. • Responsible for compliance with OHS policies, ensuring workplace compliance, and reporting hazards and near misses. • Foster a workforce culture of excellence, innovation, honesty and teamwork. Selection Criteria: • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, or related field. • 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the Renewable Energy sector. • Proficiency in Power BI, Power Query, and MS Excel. • Additional skills in Python, SQL, VBA, R, or similar languages would be advantageous. • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. • Excellent interpersonal and communications skills • Excellent communication and time management skills, conflict resolution abilities and confidence dealing with a wide range of people, from tradespeople to customers/stakeholders and supervisors. • Understanding of OHSE requirements. Additional benefits include: • 9 Day fortnight (optional) • Salary continuance insurance • Employee Assistance Program (EAP), accessible to all employees and their families • Retention bonus scheme • Additional paid days off exceeding annual leave • Employee referral program We are an Equal Opportunity Employer  At Pacific Energy, we celebrate the richness and depth that diversity brings. We know that it’s good for our people, our customers and the solutions that we bring to the table. That’s why we strongly encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations and gender identities to apply. We’re always learning, so please let us know what adjustments we can make to our recruiting processes to better support you.  For more information visit www.pacificenergy.com.au/ or follow Pacific Energy on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/company/pacific-energy-pty-ltd
job_description.361: About Our Client  Our client is a data consulting firm with offices in Australia, London and the USA, who work with a range of clients across utilities, resources, government and finance-sector clients.  You will be embedded with one of their utilities clients, working in parallel to a couple of other consultants in there (but also quite independently), as a key contributor to their data and analytics function.  You'll be supported with on-the-job training and have access to salary increases against your performance, as well as opportunity to move through formal training and certifications, in support of your success.  Job Description  You will be responsible for: • Analysing business processes, collecting business requirements, assisting with specification of solutions. • Sourcing, restructuring, manipulating, and modelling data to support decisions around clients' commercial issues. • Supporting client understanding of analytical insight through creative presentation of data visualisations. • Documenting implemented solutions and processes, providing guides and trainings for users. • Ensuring all data management and processing is undertaken in adherence with internal policies. • Building relationships within the business, working towards common objectives.  The Successful Applicant  To be considered for and successful in this role you will: • Arrive with 2+ year's experience in a similar role, and be ready to expand your level of responsibility and autonomy • Be able to demonstrate your commercial acumen, in delivering insights (not just analysis), to drive decision making within an organisation • Ideally offer some programming experience in R or Python • Be competent to build meaningful dashboards and reports that meet business requirements • Offer good foundational skills in Excel, SQL, Power BI (including DAX)  What's on Offer  In return you will: • Align with a data specific consulting firm, who will support your success in this role, and your ongoing development within the organisation more broadly • Develop your skills in basic data engineering • Pick up some experience in cloud technologies including Snowflake • Get to access formal professional development opportunities • Work in an autonomous role with a reasonable degree of responsibility / the ability to make your own decisions
job_description.362: About Us  Fortescue is both a proud West Australian company and a global green solutions business. We are recognised for our culture, innovation and industry-leading development of infrastructure, mining assets and green energy initiatives.  Our Opportunity  Work Location: Fortescue Centre & Bennett St • Fortescue’s Perth office is located on the traditional lands of the Whadjuk Noongar people.  Roster: Monday to Friday  The Data Scientist is a critical role within the Data Analytics for Health and Safety team at Fortescue, responsible for leveraging data-driven insights to enhance health and safety initiatives. This role requires expertise in Python, machine learning, deployment in AWS using SageMaker, as well as proficiency in Snowflake and SQL for data access and analysis. Additionally, this role includes components of the Analytics Engineer role, such as automation using SQL/Snowflake and reporting using Power BI and Streamlit.  Key Responsibilities • Utilize SQL and Snowflake to access, query, and analyze operational and safety data. • Explore and clean data to identify trends and patterns relevant to health and safety objectives. • Develop and implement machine learning and deep learning models to predict safety-related outcomes and support decision-making. • Utilize Python libraries and frameworks for machine learning and deep learning tasks. • Deploy machine learning models into production using AWS SageMaker, ensuring scalability and reliability. • Monitor and maintain deployed models for optimal performance. • Implement data automation solutions using SQL/Snowflake, including the development of stored procedures and tasks to streamline data workflows. • Create data visualizations and reports using Power BI and Streamlit to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders. • Collaborate with the Visualization Engineer to enhance data storytelling. • Collaborate with health and safety stakeholders to understand their data needs and align data science solutions with organizational objectives. • Document data science methodologies, model development, and deployment processes. • Share knowledge and best practices within the team.  Qualifications And Experience • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field. • Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and deep learning. • Experience with machine learning model development and evaluation. • Proficiency in SQL and experience working with Snowflake for data access, analysis, and automation. • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to derive actionable insights from complex data. • (Beneficial) Deep learning expertise, including working with neural networks and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch). • (Beneficial) Demonstrated experience with model deployment in AWS using SageMaker or in a cloud environment. • Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical stakeholders. • A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.  Our Commitment  Fortescue is deeply committed to providing a safe culture that builds respect, fosters inclusiveness, and values diversity. We celebrate individual strengths and team members from all backgrounds are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. Our global workforce drives and promotes an inclusive culture, both within our organisation and throughout the communities we interact with across the world. Diverse backgrounds include First Nations Peoples, people with differing abilities, LGBTIQ+ community, gender, neurodiverse, cultural diversity, all age groups, and those with an intersectional or multiple diverse characteristics. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.  https://fortescue.com/careers  Internal Candidates / Current Contractors please apply via Success Factors Careers Portal. For further information on how to apply please visit the Fortescue Hub.  Fortescue reserves the right to close applications early should a suitable pool of candidates be identified. Fortescue will never contact you to ask for payment of any kind, whether directly or through a third party.
job_description.363: Company Profile  Important : After Applying , Check Inbox or Spam Folder For Next Steps.  This position is the Department's lead Data Analytics position and will develop and analyze data while ensuring its quality and accuracy. Your ability to present the data will be paramount in helping the department make informed, data-driven decisions. You will frequently be asked to provide research and analysis support to members of the leadership team.  DUTIES PERFORMED TO SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENT'S VISION: • Analyze data, ensure quality and accuracy, and present the data in ways that help the department make better data-driven decisions. • Report to the Division Director of Administration and work closely with the Leadership Team on the Department of Revenue Transformational and Operational Dashboard reporting. • Assist with the collection of data and transferring it to graphic visual design. Work extensively with Human Resource Data analytics, reporting, structure, and design. • Responsible for Human Resource storyboard and dashboard metrics. • Provide guidance and leadership to all DOR Data Analytic positions in Tableau dashboard reporting. • Coordinate quarterly divisional operational dashboard presentations to the department leadership team. • Coordinates and organizes the monthly Department Operational Dashboard report data and presentation. The Department's Operational Excellence dashboard includes transformational initiatives, operational dashboard and organization health data. • Prior to the beginning of each fiscal year, this position will organize meetings for department leaders to identify transformational initiatives for the upcoming fiscal year. This position will design the dashboard for approval and monthly presentations thereafter. This position will create the data capture source for the transformational initiatives reporting. • Assist new Tableau users as they learn and development visual analytics. This includes creating workbooks, using tooltips, mapping, filters, data links, and efficient use of data sources. • This position will hold regular Tableau user group meetings to share knowledge and/or pass on State Tableau information. • Track and request access to the Tableau server when necessary.  CORE COMPENTENCIES NEEDED:  Accuracy Analytical Thinking  Computer Literacy Assertiveness  Effective Writing Self-Motivated  Attention to Detail Clear Communication  Problem Solving Skills  QUALIFICATIONS: • Experience using Tableau is required. • Knowledge of basic research methods and analysis, computer information systems, and statistical software. • Ability to perform basic queries and analysis of data. • Bachelor's degree and 1-2 years of relevant experience and/or appropriate certification. job_description.364: Posted date 09 October 2023  LocationPerth  Discipline IT Other  Reference3922  $70 000 - $120 000 + Super depending on knowledge & experience  Central Perth Location  Permanent  Are you a data professional with a keen interest in both data engineering and analysis?  About the role:  You will join a small analytics engineering team built on mutual respect, high trust, and low management. You can expect to develop DBT models to build data-cleaning pipelines, maintain documentation, work with cross-functional teams, and build custom dashboards to monitor real-time data pipelines.  Experienced Required:  2+ years experience in Data Analytics/ Engineering  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience  Proficient in:  SQL  Python, PySpark  Statistical Data Analysis  DBT  Snowflake, AWS  A modern visualisation tool  About the client :  Our client exists to give more people the opportunity to reshape how the market research industry interacts with people’s data. You will join the core team that forms the backbone of their game-changing platform.  As a global tech business with operations in the US, Canada, and South America, your code will help better define and understand commercial data from multiple source points.  You will be joining a brilliant team that puts data privacy at the forefront of their purpose coupled with some of the smartest ML engineers around.  While their current transaction scale is admirable (roughly over 100 million transactions per year) they look to double, triple, and quadruple this over the next 18 months, if you want to see the purpose of data behind purchasing decisions, build with them!  If you don’t tick every box above, we would still encourage you to apply. They are building a diverse team whose skills balance and complement one another.  Our client believes face-to-face interaction is invaluable for effective skills transfer and development. You MUST be based in Perth or in the process of relocating, and comfortable going into the office to be considered for this role.  If you are interested in having a conversation please feel free to apply or should you want more information you can contact Jaydene d'Offay on +61 8 6146 4468  Jaydene d'Offay  Email Jaydene  (08) 6146 4468
job_description.365: About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.  Get to Know our Team:  The Supply Equity Platform (SEP) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SEP team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including resource and product optimization. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce high quality results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SEP offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.  In this Role, you’ll get to:  • Manage complex analytics processes and algorithms to ensure their continued smooth operation, identifying root causes and debugging them where needed. • Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organization. • Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at improving the operations of our automated systems (e.g. root cause detection, anomaly detection, performance analysis). • Develop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting them. • Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving resource and product optimization.  What you’ll Need to Succeed: • A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping. • Either Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive programming experience. • Experience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must). • Have working experience in Python for data analysis. • A basic understanding of statistics and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations. • The ability to visualize and understand complex data flows, pipelines, and processes.  It’s Great if you have: • Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark. • Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality.  #sanfrancisco #newyork #seattle #boston #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #paris #london #tokyo #dhaka #vienna #edinburgh #manchester #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #singapore #ENG #IT  Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.  We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .  To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
job_description.366: One of our Global Client is hiring IT Data Analyst to join their fast-paced technology team.  PERSOLKELLY brings together the legacy and experience of four organisations that shaped the staffing landscape over the past century: Kelly Services, who pioneered the modern temporary help industry in 1946; SKILLED, who crafted the staffing industry in Australia in 1964; Programmed, the leading provider of operations and maintenance services across Australia and New Zealand; and PERSOLKELLY, the largest workforce solutions provider in APAC.  One of our Global Client is hiring IT Data Analyst to join their fast-paced technology team.  Your main duties and responsibilities will include:  We require a Technical Business Analyst for 3 months to assist with the following scope of work:  Migration to a new Workforce Planning Application  Timesheet data analytics and reporting  Workforce Planning Solution Migration  Determine if the proposed workforce planning application meets functional and performance requirements. If not, work with key stakeholders to select an appropriate tool.  Work with key stakeholders to identify and make changes to functions, data fields, and data model in the workforce planning tool to meet essential requirements.  Design data model and migrate from current spreadsheet into new workforce planning application  Conduct training sessions on how to use the new tool.  Timesheet Data Analysis & Reporting  Using data from our timesheet tool, design a set of timesheet reports that provide insight into:  Timesheet compliance  Timesheet booking accuracy  Hours planned vs actual per program/project/function variance report  Direct vs Indirect hours  Skills & Experience Required • Systems Solution analysis and implementation experience • Data Analytics and reporting using Power BI  If interested in this role please apply today or alternatively send your resume to Neema Mehra, neema.mehra@persolkelly.com.au . Please note that due to the high volume of applicants only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  Who are we  At PERSOLKELLY, our passion is - and always has been - putting you first.  We propel our people forward by supporting their careers in fresh ways, backed by our expertise and capability.  We're committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experience and perspectives.  We welcome and encourage women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.  So it's over to you. If you would like to join our team, please APPLY now.  To learn more about working with PERSOLKELLY, we encourage you to visit our website.
job_description.367: Job DescriptionGraduate Data Analyst, Perth PKC10578 £23,631 - £24,176 Fixed Term (until 31/10/2025) Carpenter House, Perth PH1 5GB You will join the Council's Data Services team, to work on our Data and Analytics programme – a key part of the Council’s Digital Strategy. The team provides a wide range of data and analytics services: •Platform management and support services for our analytics platform - MS Power BI and GIS platform - ESRI ArcGIS Enterprise •Data engineering services, building data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Safe Software FME, used to manage the flow of data in the Council’s corporate data platform •Data custodianship services including data quality management, improvement and distribution of spatial and non-spatial datasets to both internal and external users (via our Open Data platform) •Data analytics services, building and managing reports, dashboards, web maps and other apps based on the needs of the Council and our partners •Training, support and advisory services for service and system users •Awareness raising, producing high-quality publications illustrating the value of data and analytics to the organisation You will provide general assistance across our service portfolio, and depending on your skills, experience and professional interests, be given opportunities to undertake a more specialist role, for example Power BI development, GIS, data engineering or data custodianship. We are proud of our track record of providing an excellent and professional service. Our success is in part due to a shared ethos where everyone is involved, and has the opportunity to progress quickly as their skills and experience develops. You will have excellent technical, analysis, communication and time management skills, capable of hitting the ground running and quickly become a productive member of the team. You will have a creative, positive attitude; an awareness of data and analytics technologies and methods; and an informed, professional approach. You must be able to communicate fluently orally and in writing, and should have good organisational and facilitation skills. You will have some data visualisation knowledge and an interest in innovative techniques designed to inform and influence decision making. Knowledge and experience of some of the following technical areas would be an advantage. However training and opportunities to learn will be provided. •Analytical problem solving skills •Communications skills including the ability to translate technical concepts in to non-technical language •Data management with understanding of approaches to data governance and data quality improvement •Data modelling and cleansing skills •Data visualisation and storytelling •Logical and creating thinking skills •Statistical methods and data analysis skills •Spatial data management and analysis using GIS •Basic database design for both transactional and analytical purposes •Basic data engineering concepts •Analytics and GIS technologies, for example Microsoft Power BI, ArcGIS Enterprise, or Tableau  The Individual You must have a Degree in a data or analytics related discipline. For further information on the role or any questions please contact Ewan Walker When completing your application for this post, please ensure you provide current contact details (including e-mail addresses) for two referees, one should be your present or most recent employer. However, if you are an existing employee of Perth & Kinross Council, you are only required to provide reference details for your current employer.  At PKC our values and behaviours influence our work and support us in the delivery of the Perth and Kinross Offer. In your application, and should you be invited to interview, you will be asked to describe situations that support the criteria required in the role and which also demonstrate our values and behaviours. Find out more about PKC and you could soon be joining our team! Please APPLY ONLINE. Facilities are available at all public libraries in Perth and Kinross. If you have a disability and require reasonable adjustments, please call 01738 475555 to discuss. As part of our safer recruitment measures, Perth & Kinross Council carries out rigorous checks on the right to work in the UK, qualifications, employment history, including references, and fitness to undertake the post. Some jobs may have been traditionally carried out predominately by one gender, but we would encourage you to apply if you meet the requirements, irrespective of your gender. A healthy work life balance is important to Perth & Kinross Council and we provide supportive management and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve a healthy work life balance. You will have access to training and support for continued professional development. Perth & Kinross Council welcomes applications from former armed forces personnel/reservists. Many of the skills picked up during your military career could be transferred directly into a role with local government.  What we can do for you  If you are successful in a role with Perth & Kinross Council, you will have access to a range of benefits to help your physical, mental and financial wellbeing.  Find out more about working for Perth & Kinross Council and living in one of the most scenic areas of Scotland Jobs, careers and employment.  Proud member of the Disability Confident employer scheme Disability Confident About Disability Confident A Disability Confident employer will generally offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria for the job as defined by the employer. It is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high-volume, seasonal and high-peak times, the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non-disabled people. For more details please go toDisability Confident.
job_description.368: VCID No. 851792  This is a Fixed Term Full Time appointment until 30/6/2024 with the possibility of extension(s).  The Clinical Planning Unit is expanding and is currently advertising several other positions in addition to this one: • Project Officer – Level 5 • Senior Project Officer – Level 6 • Senior Clinical Planning Officer – Level 7 • Project Manager – Level 8  WA Health is committed to eliminating all forms of discrimination in the provision of our service. We embrace diversity and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities.  WA Health supports flexible working practices within the context of a quality health service. WA Health is committed to a smoke free environment across all buildings, grounds and vehicles.  WA Health is committed to growing the Aboriginal workforce as a part of WA Health’s Aboriginal Workforce Policy. As a measure to achieve equality, Section 51 of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 applies to this position. Aboriginal people are encouraged to apply.Eligibility to Apply: Australian citizenship or permanent residency is an essential requirement for applicants to be considered for permanent positions in the public sector.  Other Conditions: WA Health engages staff in positions of trust and responsibility. WA Health policies require applicants to undertake criminal records screening and integrity checking as part of the appointment process. Referees may also be asked to comment on an applicant’s integrity and past demonstration of ethical behaviour.  Whilst this selection process will initially be used to fill the above vacancy, it may also be used to fill other "similar" vacancies throughout the health service. In addition to this, should the successful applicant decline or vacate the advertised vacancy, then the next most suitable applicant may also be selected from this process. Both of these options remain valid for a period of twelve (12) months from when the authorised delegate endorses the recruitment decision.  Position Profile: The Senior Data Analyst provides the WA Stroke Services Programme (WASSP) with timely and accurate reporting, modelling, forecasting and analytics for key stakeholders including health executive, government and the public and private health service providers. In this role you will undertake high level research and analysis of quantitative and qualitative information, develop models and business intelligence reports for the WA health system to meet the System Manager requirements of the WASSP across specialty areas, including stroke quality care and the WA Statewide Telestroke Project. You will also provide strategic and technical advice on data collection and analysis processes to enhance decision making.  Employee Benefits: In addition to the great salary our employees enjoy an amazing range of benefits which may include (in line with operational requirements): • 11% employer contributed superannuation into a fund of your choice. For further information click here. • Access to salary packaging arrangements • Professional Development Opportunities and Study Leave/assistance • Flexible working arrangements • Flexible leave arrangements  Selection Criteria: Please see the attached Job Description Form (available online at www.jobs.health.wa.gov.au).  For Further Job Related Information: We encourage you to contact Brooke Baxter on 0402 309 579.  If you experience difficulties while applying online, please contact Employee Services on 13 44 77 for immediate assistance during business hours.  Application Instructions: Applicants are requested to apply online (www.jobs.health.wa.gov.au).  Applicants are advised to write a statement addressing the selection criteria and provide a detailed curriculum vitae which summarises your experience and how you are able to meet the position requirements. These documents should be complete and ready to attach prior to applying online. Please ensure you allow sufficient time to complete the online application process as you will be required to answer various questions and attach your documentation.  Lodgement is system generated. Any submissions on, or after, 4:00pm will not be accepted.  LATE OR EMAIL APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.
job_description.369: • Opportunity to work on our high profile and complex Defence contract  • Full time position with the possibility to enhance your career and work with a high-performing team  • Perth Based – close to public transport  • Incredibly supportive team and managers   Ventia are seeking to engage a Graduate Data Analyst to join our Defence Base Services (DBS) contract working as part of the Project Delivery team. This is a full-time permanent position based in our East Perth office and is an excellent opportunity for a newly qualified or soon to be graduate to enhance your career and work with a high performing team who are incredibly supportive.  Administrative duties form a large part of the day-to-day operations of this role, specifically in the review, processing and submission of proposals to Defence and the improvement and maintenance of automations behind them, with each proposal requiring a critical eye and attention to detail. You will work closely with the contract to develop and improve processes and systems, interpret and validate data and analyse results using statistical techniques to present recommendations to the business unit and identify areas of cost mitigation and revenue raising. In addition, this role provides you with the freedom to suggest improvements to increase efficiencies and reduce administrative burden.  Due to the multiple internal and external interactions, the successful applicants will be able to communicate effectively across various departments.  As result we seek to employ people who will succeed in this role, therefore, you will ideally have:   • Australian Citizenship and be able to obtain and maintain a suitable national police clearance • Recent Graduate qualification – seeking education over experience • Bachelor’s degree in commercial or finance related discipline – Anything analytical • Previous VBA/VBS (Excel Macro’s), SQL, Power BI experience – essential • Previous SAP, Python experience – Highly regarded but not essential (training provided) • Excellent communication skills • Strong ability and focus to learn • Self-motivated and proactive with a critical eye and high level of attention to detail • Strong analytical skills with the ability to meet tight timeframes • An ability to develop and maintain excellent working relationships with multiple operational managers and support function representatives as well as a high-profile client  Ventia’s Defence Base Services (DBS) contract supports Defence estate support services and facilities management. Across all states and territories, we deliver a range of estate, living, and base support capability including asset management and maintenance; ranges and training area management; airfield management; land management and environmental services; project management; firefighting and rescue services; hospitality and catering; domestic services; and transport services.   Ventia is enriched by the diverse experiences, talents and cultures that our people bring to the organisation, while celebrating and respecting the communities we operate in. We are committed to providing a safe and positive environment that provides equal opportunities for individuals of all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGTBQI+, Women, Veterans and spouses and people with disabilities.   If you enjoy a challenge and would like to be part of our dynamic, growing, and exciting company, apply now.   Position Reference Number: 155362
job_description.370: Company Profile  Note: After applying check your email inbox or spam folder for next steps.  Are you looking to kick-start your career in the business intelligence and data analytics sector? We are searching for someone that will want to own the technical design, development and delivery of business intelligence systems, reports and analysis for a growing division in Australia. If this sounds like you, we have an excellent career growth opportunity for a graduate to join our team in our Perth office.  Please note this is a part-time role (20 Hours a week)  We Will Count On You To  Assist in the collection, collation, analysis and reporting of data.  Providing key statistics to the business to assist in the measurement of results, identifying trends and/or patterns etc.  Report Generation using Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Excel.
