Create unique solutions to business problems using data available internally or sourcing data from external sources.  Use data to support and influence critical business decisions.  Work with internal teams to generate regular and ad-hoc reports that can help them with their decision making.  Create and manage automated reports.  What You Need To Have  Have a qualification in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, or a related field.  Have strong problem-solving skills and solution orientated.  Have excellent attention to detail and strong written and verbal communication skills.  Confident liaising with various business stakeholders.  Showcase time management and prioritisation skills.  Be numerically confident and able to translate numbers into insights and action.  Be motivated through achieving results.  Thrive working as part of a team in a challenging and demanding environment.  Passionate about data, analytics and problem solving.  Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (Pivot table, vlookup etc.)  Exposure to SAP will be highly regarded but not essential.  What We Offer  A competitive remuneration package and employee benefits  Flexible working arrangements designed to suit individual circumstances and family needs  Birthday and study leave  Wellness Days to allow you to focus on your own physical and or mental wellbeing  A workplace where you can access 2 weeks additional leave each year so you can take that extra break with family or friends  We applaud your need to give back to the community and give you 2 paid volunteer days each year to support one of our-affiliated charities  A collaborative and fun culture  A vibrant office space at our HQ in Hells Kitchen (Coming Soon)  Plus, so much more  What are the next steps?  Note: After applying check your email inbox or spam folder for next steps.  Powered by Webbtree
job_description.371: If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?  What's in it for you?  We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.  You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  What We're Looking For  Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.  Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.  Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.  Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.  Run human centred design sessions with end-users.  Communicating and influencing stakeholders.  Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  Skills And Attributes For Success  Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.  Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.  Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.  Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems.  Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.  Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.  Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.
job_description.372: Product & Service Delivery Direct | Data Analysts  Mission  On behalf of our client, a High-Profile Global Service Provider to the Oil & Gas industry, Brunel is seeking a Data Analyst on an ongoing basis. Interested candidates must reside in Perth.The Data Analyst is responsible for delivering safe, efficient, and reliable PSD to customers. The Data Analyst identifies opportunities to improve service delivery, implements standard work, and manages risk during service delivery. This person monitors the well to provide timely and factual information to our customers; maintains sensors, equipment, and data acquisition equipment; and delivers high quality data to the customer at the wellsite.  Brunel is a recruitment and flexible workforce solution provider which connects talented people with opportunities throughout Australasia and around the world. We specialise in highly skilled roles across a variety of technical, professional, trades and craft disciplines, pairing candidates with industry-leading projects and organisations on a contract, permanent or secondment basis.  Operating in Australasia since 2001, Brunel has major bases of operation in Perth, Sydney, Brisbane and Port Moresby, which are further backed by the strength and reach of a truly global network spanning 44 countries, 100 offices and 45 years of successful operation.  Brunel is proud to be equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates.  Responsibilities  These responsibilities are activities that correspond to the metro stops and key processes: • Perform service • Prepare field deliverables • Remove and secure resources • Deploy and position resources • Prepare resources • Verify resources • Capture field data • Obtain customer acceptance of delivery • Evaluate and reconcile resources • Implement risk response • Prepare final job deliverables • Deliver and archive final job deliverables • Prepare job invoice supporting documentation • Verify and prepare resources at product line location  Additional Responsibilities • Ensure job deliverables are accurate and delivered on time • Monitor, record, and process well data and parameters, ensuring the integrity and reliability of well data • Compile the End of Well Report, ad hoc reports requested by customers and daily reports • Interact with personnel and customer representatives from other service companies professionally at thewellsite • Maintain confidentiality of customer well data • Identify opportunities to improve the service delivery process • Participate in job risk analysis and continual improvement programs • Wear PPE and observe HSE policies • Maintain the required safety training  Experience & Exposure • Field • PSD • Operations Integrity  Job Type: Full -time  Salary : $70,000 - to $75,000 per year  Job Types: Permanent, Full-time  Salary: $70,000.00 – $75,000.00 per year  Schedule: • Monday to Friday  Ability to commute/relocate: • Perth, WA 6000: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)  Work Authorisation: • Australia (Preferred)  Application Deadline: 26/08/2022
job_description.373: Position Title  Data Analytics and Reporting Manager  Agency  Western Australia Police Force  Salary  Level 7, $128,077 - $136,891 p.a. (PSCSAA 2022)  Location  Perth  Unit/Division  State Intelligence and Command  Branch  Data Science and Analytics  Work Type  Permanent - Full Time  Position No.  223655  Closing Date  2023-10-17 4:00 PM  Position Title  Data Analytics and Reporting Manager  Branch  Data Science and Analytics  Location  Perth  Work Type  Permanent - Full Time  Closing Date  2023-10-17 4:00 PM  Salary  Level 7, $128,077 - $136,891 p.a. (PSCSAA 2022)  Agency  Western Australia Police Service  Company Information  Description  You don’t have to wear a uniform to make a difference in the Western Australia Police Force!  The WA Police Force Data Science and Analytics Division supports operational and tactical policing and assists investigators with solving crime faster and keeping the WA community safe.  We are looking for an enthusiastic and talented Manager to join the WA Police Force in their data journey by leading the Data Analytics and Reporting unit within the Data Science and Analytics Division. If you have a passion for solving problems and want to lead a team that is working with exciting and diverse data sources in the latest cloud and cutting-edge technologies then apply now!  About The Role  The Data Analytics and Reporting Manager is an outcomes focused leader who will grow and develop the team and drive innovation that will provide exceptional data analytics and services for the WA Police Force and the WA community. You will join a dynamic group of individuals who are leading the way in enabling WA Police Force to not only use data to facilitate informed decision making in all aspects of the business but also to solve crime faster and keep the community safe.  In this role you will lead the Data Analytics and Reporting unit to deliver data centric products and tools that positively contribute to delivering data driven insights in a policing environment.  Key Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To • Leads and provides subject matter expertise in relation to the development, review and implementation of new data-centric products to meet corporate reporting, statistical and analytical needs • Drive change and set strategic priorities for the Data Analytics and Reporting unit • Ensures thorough governance processes, that the design, analysis, and implementation of data analysis practices are fit for purpose to enable the efficient and effective use of data resources to meet the Agency’s need for information products for corporate business intelligence, statistics, performance management and operational needs • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders • Work collaboratively with data engineers and data scientists, project managers to deliver high quality solutions • Ensures there is a collegiate culture focused on delivery, excellence and mutual support • Lead the exploration of new approaches for data analytics and reporting  The successful applicant will be required to work 75 hours per fortnight.  SPECIALIST PRE-REQUISITE  It is a requirement that the position holder is successful in obtaining and maintaining a NEGATIVE VETTING LEVEL 2 security clearance for the duration of their appointment in the position. Only Australian Citizens are eligible to hold and maintain the NEGATIVE VETTING LEVEL 2 security clearance. Any applicants who are currently not an Australian Citizen must be aware that this is an essential requirement to fulfil this position (please refer to the attached position description). Whilst there is nothing to preclude applicants from applying for the position if they have not yet been granted Australian Citizenship, applicants who are successful should be aware that they cannot be appointed unless they are in the process of applying for Australian Citizenship and are eligible to receive a waiver.  APPLICATION PROCESS  Please ensure you complete, sign and scan the Integrity Check Consent Form (refer attached) and submit it along with your application (the Integrity Check Consent Form is not required for current WA Police Force employees).  Applicants are asked to provide a cover letter outlining why you are suited to the role in no more than three (3) pages.  Applicants are also required to submit a comprehensive Curriculum Vitae (CV). Your CV should provide enough detail (dot points are sufficient) to allow the selection panel to assess your skills, experience and qualifications relevant to the Key Accountabilities of attached Position Description Form.  Whilst applicants are not required to address the Essential Work Related Requirements of this position as a separate document, it is important that applicants are able to satisfy the ‘context’ requirement in relation to Technical Leadership and Capability and Leadership and Management within the CV and cover letter. These are integral requirements to the role(s) and will hold considerable weighting when determining whether an applicant is competitive.  The CV must also include the names and contact details of two (2) referees who can comment on the applicant’s ability to satisfy all of the Essential Work Related Requirements. Applicants should nominate at least one immediate (most contemporary) supervisor/manager unless exceptional circumstances exist.  Please note: For applicants deemed suitable, all Essential Work Related Requirements listed in the Position Description Form will be assessed at some stage during the selection process.  Other Conditions  Whilst this selection process will initially be used to fill the above vacancy, it may also be used to fill other similar vacancies throughout the metropolitan area. In addition to this, should the successful applicant decline or vacate the advertised position, then the panel may select another suitable applicant from this selection process. Both of these options remain valid for a period of twelve (12) months from the initial date of the appointment.  Integrity and criminal checks will be conducted if the recommended applicant for a position is not a current WA Police Force employee. Any relocation costs associated with appointment to these positions may be the responsibility of the successful applicants.  SUBSTANTIVE EQUALITY & WORK HEALTH & SAFETY (WHS) STATEMENT  The WA Police Force is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal Australians, young people, people of diverse sexualities and genders, people with disability, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and women to apply for positions within our agency. The Department also promotes flexible family friendly work practices.  Throughout the recruitment process we provide reasonable adjustments to allow people with a disability to participate effectively. Reasonable adjustments can also be made available to assist you in the job, if you are successful in gaining employment.  WHS is a vital component within the WA Police Force. Safety is a partnership between the employer and their employees and it relies on all of us working together to ensure that everyone is safe in their working environment, which enables them to go home safely. We incorporate safety in every part of our business and it is an integral part of the decision-making process.  The WA Police Force has a duty of care to ensure employees are not adversely affected by alcohol or drugs in the workplace. The effect of alcohol or drugs can impact on the health and/or safety of the individual or others, and this behaviour is not aligned with the WA Police Force Code of Conduct. As a result, a testing regime has been established as an important way of providing assurance to the community that the expectations they hold for all members of the WA Police Force are being met. Regular testing of all employees for alcohol and drugs aims to ensure the health, welfare and safety of all personnel and promote community confidence in the WA Police Force.  FOR FURTHER JOB RELATED INFORMATION  Please contact Janelle Baily on telephone number (08) 9223 3231.  SUBMITTING YOUR APPLICATION  Applicants are requested to apply online. To apply online, you must have a valid email address and be ready to attach your comprehensive electronic resume, integrity check form (if required) and any additional attachments as requested in the “APPLICATION PROCESS” section of the advertisement. Please select the “APPLY FOR JOB” button at the top/bottom of this advertisement. Should you encounter any problems lodging your online application please contact Police Staff Selection and Deployment on (08) 6229 5772 during business hours (8am to 4pm, Monday – Friday), prior to the specified closing time.  FAXED, LATE OR PRO-FORMA APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED  Application packages and the Position Description Form are attached below.  Attachments • PS-223655 Data Analytics & Reporting Manager, L7.pdf • PSVU INTEGRITY CHECK APPLICATION & CONSENT FORM (18 AUG 2023).docx • job application package.pdf
job_description.374: Job Requisition ID: 34768  Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best  Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career  Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts  We are seeking a talented Reporting & Insights Analyst with experience in Tableau and a passion for data to join our Client, Industries & Markets enablement team. This role can be based in any major city, and we offer excellent flexible working arrangements.  What will your typical day look like? As a Reporting and Insights Consultant, you will enhance existing, and develop new business performance reporting, in Tableau, for stakeholders across Deloitte, including senior executive leaders. Working with the wider team, you will independently translate business requirements into quantitative metrics, with our boarder team looking to you, as an expert on all things Tableau and data. You will answer the ‘Why’ and ‘So What’ for our internal stakeholders, investigating trends and outliers within large datasets.  About us At Deloitte, delivering impactful work and experiences to our clients is central to everything we do. We do this by being client issues-led, seamlessly integrating our capabilities to show up as one Deloitte, with relevance, impact and differentiation.  This role is internal facing and is part of the Client, Industries & Markets (CI&M) enablement team, supporting the CI&M Executive who oversee our go-to-market strategy and client interface for the Firm.  Enough about us, lets talk about you  You are someone with experience in gathering and analysing data sets to translate problems into actionable insights and recommendations.  With your commercial acumen, you are familiar with financial terminology and the reporting requirements of a business. Strong analytical capabilities and structured problem-solving skills are your strength, you can independently curate dashboard content and tell compelling data stories.  Specifically, you should have:  Demonstrated experience translating business problems into actionable dashboard views (from initial scoping to delivery)  Demonstrated experience developing dashboards in Tableau (12 Months + experience), and in building data models in excel.  12 months + experience working with varying levels of stakeholders and working with a business to develop/ mature reporting to meet asks.  Excellent communication skills with an ability to communicate at all levels.  Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
job_description.375: TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com  We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analyst for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.  This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.  Requirements Full Professional Proficiency in English You must be living in Australia for the last 2 consecutive years Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Australia Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance) Applicants must be 18 years or over. ID verification must be attached when submitting your application.  Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.  Why Join the TELUS International AI Community? Earn extra income Access to our community wellbeing initiative Remote work & Location Independence Be your own boss  Interested? Click the link to apply to: https://lnkd.in/gDGnB4zT
job_description.376: • Databricks Data Analyst 3-6 years’ experience, Data Bricks Mandatory. • Any of AWS, Azure, Python, Pyspark an advantage • Databricks, Datawarehouse, Lakehouse • Databricks engineer – Consultant 3-5 years  Job Type: Full-time  Work Location: In person
job_description.377: Have you ever considered a challenging, exciting and progressive career working for one of the most certified tech consultancies in Australia?  Who We Are  Akkodis, we thrive on solving complex problems and building a smarter future; we power digital transformation and accelerate innovation with our cross-industry technology and digital engineering consulting, talent services and skilling. We're passionate about our work and committed to creating  and implementing cutting-edge solutions that drive industry progress. Our culture is built on honesty, respect, fairness and inclusion, and we're looking for innovative and talented individuals who share these values to join us on this journey.  The Role  Participating in projects being managed as incremental, iterative and adaptive (Agile) or predictive plan driven the Akkodis consulting Business Analyst role focuses on ensuring client value is delivered for assignments. This Business Analyst is leveraging past business analysis experiences to recognise and support stakeholder change journey required. This Business Analyst role is seeking to develop within an organisation providing consultancy services and build their breadth and/or specialisms within industry domains, types of delivery assignments, or techniques and methods used.  Responsibilities • Undertake business analysis as part of a project delivery team or individual consulting assignment across range of industry and clients. • Investigate business situations where there is some complexity and ambiguity. • Adopt holistic view to identify and analyse problems and opportunities. • Engage and collaborate with stakeholders. • Conduct analysis and identifies recommendations for improvements. • Follow agreed standards, applying appropriate techniques to elicit and document requirements to appropriate level. • Demonstrate good stakeholder management skills and provides constructive challenge to stakeholders as required. • Demonstrate business analysis competencies and Agile mindset. • Help develop and enhance customer and stakeholder relationships.  Skills & Experience  Required • Between 3 - 5 years' experience undertaking Business Analyst roles delivering outcomes. • Has awareness of project management delivery styles and where/how it applies to business analysis delivery. • Ability to select appropriate requirements and engagement technique/s based on the nature of the assignment. • Experience in defining and managing scope, requirements definition and prioritisation activities for small-scale changes and assists with more complex change initiatives. • Ability to model current and desired scenarios to facilitate understanding and decision making. • Ability to analyse and design business processes to identify alternative solutions to exploit new technologies and automation. • Experience creating acceptance criteria related to requirements, features and user stories. • Experience in applying standard data modelling and design techniques, based upon a detailed understanding of requirements. • Sound documentation and communication skills.  Desirable • Experience in participating in managing change activities. • Ability to translate concepts into outputs and prototypes and captures user feedback to improve designs. • Capability in dealing with problems and issues, managing resolutions, corrective actions, lessons learned and the collection and dissemination of relevant information. • Participation in study groups and/or courses to gain understanding of BABOK®, Agile, Design Thinking, Business Data Analytics and Product Ownership Analysis  Certifications • Professional recognition of your Business Analysis competency via certification (not training course), e.g. IIBA Certification of Capability in Business Analysis™ (CCBA®), ACS Certified Technologist, BCS International Diploma in Business Analysis, or equivalent.  Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of our dynamic organisation. If you have what it takes to thrive in this role and want to know more, please reach out to Tanya at tanya.saluja@akkodisgroup.com  Why Work for Us?  Joining Akkodis means being part of a dynamic community of engineers that's at the forefront of tech innovation. You'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies:  Whether your interests lie in systems engineering, software development, data platforms or any other tech discipline, we have a role that will suit you. You'll get to collaborate with talented expert colleagues from around the world who share your enthusiasm and passion for technology. We offer a  flexible and supportive work environment, and we're committed to helping you grow and achieve your career goals. If you want to make a real difference, Akkodis is the place for you.  Akkodis is a commercial brand under which both AKKA and Modis entities operate.  "Akkodis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds".
job_description.378: LOCATION: Remote Work  SCHEDULE: Part-time  Are you an aspiring data analyst seeking an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience while working with a prestigious Management Consulting firm? TalentKompass Deutschland, a leading Human Resources company based in Germany, is searching for a highly motivated Data Analysis Intern to join our esteemed client. This remote position offers a unique chance for someone who is passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.  As a Data Analysis Intern, you will work closely with the analytics and consulting teams, where you will be responsible for a range of tasks, including data collection, data cleaning, and statistical analysis. You will have the extraordinary opportunity to learn from experienced professionals who will provide mentorship and guidance throughout the internship. With this internship, you will gain valuable experience in data analysis, data visualization, and teamwork – all essential skills for a successful career in this field.  Responsibilities: • Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support consulting projects • Assist in the development of data models and statistical analysis to identify trends and insights • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data • Create data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or Power BI • Present findings and insights to the consulting team and contribute to project reports • Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for data-driven solutions • Support the team with general administrative tasks as needed  Requirements: • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills • Proficient in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English • Familiarity with data analysis principles and practices • Ability to work independently and as part of a team • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously • Knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques is a plus • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus  At TalentKompass Deutschland, we are committed to helping our interns develop their skills and reach their full potential. Our client is a reputable Management Consulting firm that will provide invaluable experience in a competitive industry. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to grow your career in data analysis – apply now!
job_description.379: The Company  Seequent builds world-leading subsurface software, helping create a better understanding of the earth to ensure a better world for all.  We are constantly evolving at the forefront of technology to transform how geo-professionals work, eliminating barriers to understanding by connecting software, teams, and the tools they need.  Every day, our customers in over 100 countries work to develop mineral resources more sustainably, design and build better infrastructure, protect the environment, source renewable energy, and help resolve historical challenges such as groundwater contamination and ageing infrastructure.  Our integrated earth modelling, geo-data management, and team collaboration software enables them to see a more complete picture of the earth: because with more understanding comes better decisions – for people and the planet.  Headquartered in New Zealand with global reach, Seequent is the specialist subsurface software company within Bentley Systems. Together, we are helping build a more resilient world.  We’re a high growth, people-centric success story.  Seequent is a Bentley Systems company, working together to build a better future.  The Role  We are seeking a talented Data Analysis Engineer to join our passionate team. This newly created role is testament to the growth and success of our Imago product, and we are looking for an exceptional candidate to contribute to its continued development. (Imago is one of Seequent’s latest additions to the product portfolio, you can read a bit more about it here)!  As a Data Analysis Engineer with Seequent, you will have the opportunity to use your Python skills to improve and maintain datasets and deployments. You will get to work with exciting geoscience data sets and play your part in delivering top-notch solutions to our global customers.  If you are interested in this unique opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation and are keen to learn and grow with our team of highly collaborative, technical experts, we would love to hear from you!  Please note, this role is to be based hybrid from our Perth office.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to: • Use Python to profile, improve and expand geoscience datasets • Automate and streamline analytics workflows and deployments • Help deliver high quality, user-friendly solutions that exceed our customers' expectations • Create and maintain high quality datasets and code  This role could be a good fit for you if you have: • A genuine interest and enthusiasm for working with vast geoscience data sets, unlocking their potential to drive meaningful insights • Experience utilising Python for data migration, curation, and QA/QC tasks/analysis • A qualification in quantitative science, mathematics, computer science or a related field • Commercial software development experience and a desire to build products that make real impact • Exceptional interpersonal skills to develop and build sustainable working relationships • Tenacity, persistence, and enthusiasm for problem solving and continual learning • A team player mindset, with the ability to motivate and collaborate with your team  Research shows that some individuals, particularly women and underrepresented groups, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single criterion. If you don't think your experience perfectly aligns, or you don't tick all the boxes, please don’t rule yourself out! Seequent are committed to hiring a diverse team and encourage individuals of all background and abilities to apply.  Why you will enjoy working with us..  You will be joining a highly skilled, highly productive team of technical experts who are passionate about what we do. We are a friendly, intelligent, and supportive bunch and are looking forward to you bringing your expertise to the team. Our wider team is geographically diverse and from multi-disciplines, so even though you will be Perth based you will have opportunity to work with colleagues from across the globe.  Inclusion + Diversity  In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience.  If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.  How To Apply  If this sounds like the role for you, apply today with a covering letter and CV.
job_description.380: Please be advised that scheduled maintenance is to be undertaken on Saturday 23rd September 2023 from 2 AM to 5 AM (AWST) and the system will be unavailable during this window.  Convenience Buttons:  Data Analyst  Position Number: PSC18084 Level / Salary: Level 5 $96,307 - $105,254 pa PS CSA Agreement 2022 Work Type: Permanent - Part Time, Permanent - Full Time Location: West Perth Closing Date: 2023-09-26 4:00 PM  About the Commission  Here at the Public Sector Commission, we’re on a mission to create an innovative and future fit public sector for all Western Australians.  Our work supports and guides more than 160,000 public sector staff, helping them and their agencies to run efficiently and with integrity to deliver services to nearly 2.8 million people across our state. Although we are a small agency, working here means you can make a big difference.  Find out more about .  About the role  Do you have a passion for using data to support reform and decision making?  You will be joining a team which recently delivered the 2023 WA Public Sector Census, implemented a new sectorwide workforce data collection and reporting platform and are currently exploring an innovative approach for streamlining access to agency workforce data.  Our data role includes data acquisition, analysis, quality assurance, data management and data governance/oversight.  You will be contributing to quarterly and annual workforce data collections, analysis and reporting, and the development of publications such as the State of the Sector report.  We welcome all degree types and value diverse work experience. We look for people who share our dedication to business improvement and bringing data to life to help shape the future of the WA public sector.  Conditions  You require a current satisfactory National Police Certificate before appointment.  We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating an equitable and diverse workplace. We encourage people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from diverse backgrounds to apply. This helps us ensure the public sector workforce is inclusive and diverse, and is allowed under Section 66R of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984.  We provide flexible work and leave arrangements, and a range of additional employment benefits to enable staff to balance their work and other commitments.  How to apply  Have a look at the attached job description form (PD) to help you prepare your application, then apply by uploading the following: • CV that clearly outlines your employment history, skills, experience, and achievements relevant to the work-related requirements outlined in the PD • Contact details for 2 work recent referees, 1 being your current line manager. • Copy of your qualification/s (if applicable). Select the ‘Apply for Job’ button at the top or bottom of this advertisement – emailed applications won’t be accepted.  Closing date Tuesday, 26 September 2023 4:00 PM AWST. Late applications will not be accepted.  If you are having difficulty submitting your online application, please telephone RAMS Helpdesk on 1300 733 056 for assistance.  If needed, we may choose to conduct a candidate search to supplement the field of applicants.  If you are found suitable but not recommended for this opportunity you may be considered for similar vacancies in accordance with Commissioner’s Instruction 39: Interim Arrangements to Fill Public Sector Vacancies.  Further information  Need further information about the roles or if you have any access needs that may require adjustments to allow you to fully participate in the recruitment process, or need alternative methods of communication, telephone or email Jelena Colic, A/Manager Data Analytics and Reporting on (08) 6552 8747 or  Government of Western Australia
job_description.381: • Permanent Full time opportunity • Big opportunity to work with generative AI, Machine Learning, Automation, process automation within the bank • Together, we can help build the bank of the future for our customers  Do Work that Matters  We’re a bank that does things differently. We believe it's our responsibility to do more for our customers so that you can spend more time doing the things that matter to you.  At Bankwest you’ll be able to tackle your job in the way that allows you to work at your best, discover more about yourself than just your aspirations and form bonds with like-minded people who make coming into work worthwhile.  Our technology team plays a critical role in delivering the brilliant experiences that make our customers’ lives easier, leveraging world-leading technologies to personalise our customer interactions and make all engagements smoother and faster. We have a high performing BA community, using best practices and working in an agile environment to deliver best outcomes for our customers.  See Yourself In Our Team  This role is accountable for designing and delivering our approach to analytics and data sciences (including machine learning and artificial intelligence). This includes partnering with other teams to set the strategy for analytics and transform data into actionable and/or automated insight that improves decision-making and performance  Responsibilities: • Lead a team of technical Analysts and Senior Managers, ensuring clear strategic direction, empowering, and coaching team members to progress and achieve. This includes building a high performing, diverse and inclusive team committed to delivering business value in collaboration with business stakeholders. • Strategic Leadership: Provide strategic direction and leadership as a member of Digital and Data’s Leadership Team. Work with the broader business to ensure we have a clear and value-focussed approach to analytics that is embedded within our broader business planning processes. • Collaboration: Build trusting relationships with key stakeholders across the business and engage continuously across operations and functions to ensure an aligned vision and strategy for Analytics. Provide advice on solving business challenges using data driven analytical approaches. • Empowerment: Work proactively to continuously address any challenges or roadblocks and empower your team to deliver and achieve. • Industry Scanning: Actively stay across emerging approaches to Decision Science solutions to enable best practice. • Managing Talent: Leverage the best expertise and manage demand peaks inclusive of Mastercard and Deloitte resources. • Effectively manage all risk by understanding the Bankwest risk framework to meet and exceed regulatory requirements.  We’re interested in hearing from people who possess: • Leadership: You should have strong people leadership skills, proven in a technical field. • Translation and Problem Solving: You should be able to easily translate between our business and technical analytics teams, and have the ability to present technical concepts to a non-technical audience. Take ownership in delivering recommendations and insights to mid to senior level executives that drive decisions and actions. • Collaboration: You will need to be an effective collaborator with strong stakeholder engagement and influencing skills, bringing together diverse teams to solve problems. • Technical: We have good technical teams, however, ideally you will have some technical knowledge of Advanced Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence application within Financial Services. • Relevant tertiary qualification such as a bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Maths or similar. • Strong people leadership capability including coaching, development, and performance management of analytical teams. • Strong business acumen and understanding of organisational issues and challenges. • Experience with driving strategy and planning activities. • Familiarity with the trends and opportunities in business intelligence, analytics, machine learning or artificial intelligence. • Demonstrated competency in development of effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems. Bring thought leadership to the team, helping to define and leverage new methods to problem solving, identifying solutions for our customers to improve their financial wellbeing.  What's in it for you? • Flexible working programs • A highly diverse and inclusive team culture that promotes collaboration, innovation and psychological safely • Group health fund • Ongoing development and career progression opportunities  We operate in a hybrid working environment, meaning a blend between being in one of our offices and working remotely.  If you're interested in joining the team, apply now!  If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.  We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.  Advertising End Date: 22/10/2023
job_description.382: We are hiring an ambitious Data Engineer to join our dynamic team at Hays in Perth. Growing your career as a Full Time Data Engineer is an incredible opportunity to develop exceptional skills. If you are strong in cooperation, planning and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Data Engineer at Hays today  WA State Government organisation is looking for a Data Engineer to join their team ASAP. Your new company Your new company is a state government organisation are an integral part to WA's society's wellbeing. Your new role  You will be responsible for providing data services for the Data Science and Analytics Division, with the purpose of provisioning data to support the use of statistical and operational information for data science, analysis and reporting.  The Data Engineers in Data Services unit use the latest cloud based ETL solutions and high-performance computing to implement large scale data integration and emerging analytical platforms such as Azure Synapse and Graph databases.  You will be apart of the delivery of data engineering projects, including gathering end-to-end requirements, data analysis, data engineering activities and data validation with stakeholders. What you'll need to succeed  Experience of the Azure data platform, or those that have experience designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud data platforms. Leading the design, implementation and maintenance of data platforms, including data warehousing, data storage, data pipelines and ETL/ELT concepts Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex data issues The ability to collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other internal and external stakeholders to identify and integrate data needs from various sources and develop data models that support business objectives Experience with Neo4j graph databases, Graphaware Hume, Azure Synapse pipelines and Spark Notebook, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Server, Postgres, Docker and Azure App Services would be beneficial A qualification in a quantitative subject (such as data science, computer science, engineering or information technology) or professional experience in a relevant field is desirable;  What you'll get in return Opportunity to gain experience with a State Government organisation Strong company values and culture 6-month contract  What you need to do now If you're passionate about this role, click 'apply now' or for more information and a confidential discussion or to find out about other opportunities in Technology contact Ben Swindells at Hays onShow phone numberor email BenView email address on  At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.  SA Licence number : LHS 297508  Benefits of working as a Data Engineer in Perth: • Company offers great benefits • Advancement opportunities • Advantageous package
job_description.383: Full Job Description Location: Perth Office - CBD, WA, AU  6 Sep 2023  We currently have a wonderful opportunity for a Data Analyst at our Perth Head Office, on a 12-month contract basis.  This is a unique and exciting time to be a part of the Tech & Data Services team at Western Power. We are at the forefront of the energy transition in leveraging existing and new technologies, including microgrid, stand-alone power systems (SPS), battery storage solutions and incorporating increased levels of renewable energy such as roof top solar into the energy system. We're transforming the electricity network ensuring a cleaner, brighter and more resilient energy supply for the next generation.  We're also working hard on enabling the decarbonisation of the energy system by converting more of our energy consumption to electricity, including electric vehicles (EVs) as well as other initiatives to enable industry sectors to reduce emissions by making the switch.  The transition to the energy system of the future is reliant on innovation in the Tech & Data Services space. Longer term, we’ll be focusing on the establishment of foundational services, provided in an efficient, reliable and highly accessible manner. We will apply a lifecycle management approach to these services, so we are accountable for the strategy, implementation and ongoing operation of our products.  We support Western Power’s objectives through fit-for-purpose data so the business can extract maximum value from our assets in any work location. We need your support to ensure appropriate techniques and tools are used to deliver solutions to the business that they can use to generate insights that yield better & faster decisions, using data they can trust and understand. Keep reading if you’d like to learn more!  As a Data Analyst at Western Power you will: The purpose of this position is to provide technical business and data intelligence support and coordination of everyday data operations and governance activities. This role supports both the Data Operations and Analytics Area level data projects and activities, as well as, the day to day activities of the team. The team builds, operates, maintains and provides functional support for data solutions used by the business and externals. Work aligns to our enterprise data management and governance frameworks and is supported by a large area of data engineers, data scientists, solutions architects geospatial specialists and information architects to name a few.  This position also provides targeted technical analysis to support area and business decision making and expertise to support investigations into new technologies and innovative data management and governance solutions.  We are seeking someone with experience and attributes that include:  Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business-related discipline or an equivalent combination of relevant significant experience and/or education/training. Demonstrated knowledge, understanding and application of information change management principles Proven commitment to continuous improvement of data, systems and processes Proven capability to analyse data and formulate solutions using Business Intelligence tools (Qlik (preferable)or other Industry standard tool), Geospatial Information Systems (desirable), and Database skills and tools Highly developed time management and multitasking skills, with a proven commitment to ongoing professional development Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly for customer contact Strong coordination and project management skills are preferable Process and business analysis skills would be advantageous.  We believe that Tech & Data is the best place to be in Western Power because it’s not often that you get the chance to establish a whole new capability within a large organisation in WA. Everyone in the team is passionate about making it work and making it work well; we’re a hands-on, conscientious bunch, and always look for opportunities to improve. Tech & Data Services is the ‘engine room’ but we’re not just stoking the boilers, we’re developing the machine.  At Western Power, we strive to deliver exceptional value through:  Valuing empathy and psychological safety for everyone. Building trust through transparency, mastery and reliability, prioritising continuous improvement. Leading honest and respectful conversations. Developing a strong understanding of our business and how it operates. Employee Network Groups - First Nations, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse, Diverse Sexualities and Genders, Women, and People with Disability - which celebrate and communicate the diversity of our workforce and connect diversity and inclusion to our broader business activities. Flexible work arrangements that support part time work, flexible working hours and working from home arrangements. Professional Development opportunities including training initiatives and study assistance.  Important information  We are committed to our Disability Access and Inclusion Plan 2021 - 2027 and ensuring that people with disability have equal opportunities to gain and maintain employment with Western Power. It is strongly encouraged that people with a disability who meet the inherent requirements of the position description apply for this role.  We are also proud to have launched our Innovate RAP in Mar 2022 (Reconciliation Action Plan). Our Innovate RAP outlines our commitment to the Reconciliation journey in WA.  Our recruitment process requires that all candidates who progress to the pre-employment stage must hold a police clearance issued within the last six months.  Join us and play a part in powering the future of Western Australia and click apply!
job_description.384: VCID 852826  Hello! Are you… A data specialist? A team player? A programming guru? Interested in transforming data to make informed decisions? Interested in contributing to the health of Western Australia?  This is an exciting time for the Healthcare Quality Intelligence Unit as we are looking for adaptable, resilient and enthusiastic people to join our growing team.  About The Healthcare Quality Intelligence Unit  The Clinical Excellence Division is the focal point for clinical policy development, engagement with the clinical workforce and health research.  As a unit in the Clinical Excellence Division, the Healthcare Quality Intelligence Unit (HQIU) provides analysis to support front line clinical staff to improve the quality of patient care. Our team delivers value to patients and clinicians by using data to provide information about quality of patient care. It is critical that this information is built from a solid data platform.  Your new role  We are seeking enthusiastic and suitably experienced individuals for the roles of Principal Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist.  As a Principal/Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for developing data engineering pipelines, applying machine learning, implementing data science models and constructing data visualization products to support Healthcare Quality Intelligence Unit projects. As part of a technical team, you will utilize services and tools such as Snowflake, SQL, Databricks, Python, R and Power BI.  Our team is involved in the full data lifecycle to extract, transform, organize, analyse and visualise data to deliver solutions to our stakeholders. This involves a passion for learning new technologies, and our team has flexibility in the technological stack and languages used. We are looking for someone with experience working on large linked datasets, cloud services, has a passion for data and can apply their technical skills to the role.  For further details, please view the Job Description Form (JDF) found above which provides a full statement of duties for this role.  If you would like further information about this role and the amazing team you are working with, we encourage you to please contact Peter Li, Lead Quality Analyst on 08 6373 2282.  Job Category  These are Fixed-Term Full-Time appointments with the possibility of extension(s).  If you are successful in a place in the pool, you will be eligible for direct appointment for opportunities equivalent to the skillset and specified level until 31/12/2024.  Why should you join our team? • Being part of a team that is working with data to improve patient care • Being part of a team that delivers on innovative solutions • We encourage continuous professional development and upskilling • Being part of a team culture that thrives in collaborating with other teams to achieve shared goals • Working within a multifaceted team to learn of different approaches to the same problem  In the Healthcare Quality Intelligence Unit, we believe the best services come from a workplace where varied perspectives and experiences are welcomed and encouraged. We are committed to eliminating all forms of discrimination in the provision of our service and embrace diversity, encouraging applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people with disabilities and members of our LGBTQIA+ community.  Benefits Of Working With Us  In addition to a competitive salary, we offer you a range of benefits, which may include (in line with operational requirements): • 11% employer contributed superannuation into a fund of your choice. For further information click here. • Professional development opportunities and Study/Leave assistance • Flexible working (including working from home) and leave arrangements • Discounts with corporate partners • Salary Packaging Benefits  Are you ready to join our team?  To be eligible to apply for this role, you are required to: • Undertake a criminal record screening, a pre-employment health assessment and integrity check, as part of the appointment process. We may ask referees to comment on your integrity and past demonstration of ethical behaviour.  How To Apply  To apply for this position, please apply online at www.jobs.health.wa.gov.au  In Your Application You Should Provide The Following • A Curriculum Vitae (CV) that clearly shows your experience relevant to the role • Statement demonstrating your knowledge, skills and experience relevant to the responsibilities of the role, addressing all selection criteria as outlined in the JDF (no more than three [3] pages) – please note there are templates attached to this advert we encourage you to use • The name and contact details of two professional referees with one referee preferably being your current line manager  Please indicate in your application the classification level or levels that you would like to be considered for. If you are applying for both levels, please direct your response to the higher level. You are not required to submit two applications.  Please ensure you have saved your documents in one of the following formats .doc, .xls, .pdf, .rtf or .ppt. Please be aware that .docx or .xlsx files are not accepted formats.  Please ensure you give yourself adequate time to submit your application and upload your attachments.  If you experience difficulties while applying online, please contact Employee Services on 13 44 77 for immediate assistance during business hours.  You must have a current, valid email address to apply and will be used to communicate with you.  WA Health is committed to growing the Aboriginal workforce as a part of WA Health’s Aboriginal Workforce Policy. As a measure to achieve equality, Section 51 of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 applies to this position. Aboriginal people are encouraged to apply.  Thank you for taking the time to apply for the role in our team and we hope to see you at the next stage.

job_description.386: WesTrac is an equipment solutions company and one of the world's leading Caterpillar Dealerships with a rich history of supporting thousands of customers across the mining and construction industries in Australia. At WesTrac our primary focus is our people. We know that our success is the result of more than 4,000 talented people working together to achieve amazing outcomes.  Reporting to the Analytics Lead, the Business Intelligence Analyst uses analytical techniques and data visualisation tools to develop reports and dashboards that provide trends and insights to evaluate and optimise business performance.  The role will work cross-functionally with internal and external customers using data to solve business problems and to deliver valuable insights to support decision-making and generate actions that improve business processes.  Location: Perth Precinct (Perth Airport, WA)  Roster: Monday – Friday, 8.5-hour days  To be successful the following is required: • Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Business, Finance, or related field • Previous experience developing complex data visualisations and reports • Strong interpersonal and written communication skills • Proficient in coaching and mentoring self-serve report developers within the business • Highly organised, methodical, detail-oriented, with exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities • Proven ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently, prioritise effectively, and manage time efficiently • Expertise in business intelligence, data modeling, and BI tools • Advanced proficiency in Power BI and analytical techniques/tools • Intermediate to advanced SQL knowledge • Intermediate to advanced DAX query skills in Power BI • Demonstrated experience with row-level security/security layer models in Power BI • Responsible for design methodology and project documentation  What we offer: • Opportunity to get a $3,000 referral bonus as part of our Recommend and Spend program • Job security with a consistent pipeline of work • Unrivalled training and development via The WesTrac Institute • Free and secure onsite parking • Fantastic team environment and inclusive work culture • Made for More Rewards program with discounts at retailers like Woolworths, Caltex, Apple, Crown, Qantas and many more • Paid parental leave, discounted health insurance, income protection insurance, and salary sacrifice options  If you are interested in taking your career to the next level with WesTrac click the 'Apply' button today  Relocation and Visa sponsorship assistance for candidates on the skilled occupation list may be available to candidates in Australia and Overseas, dependant on the role.  WesTrac Pty Ltd is committed to achieving a diverse and engaged workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from female, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island candidates.  WesTrac is an endorsed employer for women via WORK180 - who have reviewed our policies, processes, and initiatives to certify that we are an organisation that supports diversity, inclusion and equality. job_description.387: Aug 10, 2023  Information & Communication Technology  Contract  Perth, Western Australia  Full-Time  PySpark & Databricks Data Engineer (mid- level/senior) • 6 month contract • 800- 1100 per day • Must be based in Perth  Be part of an advanced data engineering team on a consulting project using your data pipelining and real time data streaming experience.  Benefits • Hybrid working 3 days in the office • Long- term contract • Opportunity to develop with new technology and career progression  What aspects of this job will improve your life?  You will be working in the data engineering team on large sets of data. This project will require data ingestion and building data pipelines. Not only will this significantly improve your career profile within the data engineering space but it will also offer you the ability to take these skills back to the data market in the future. Perhaps more importantly, the high visibility internally will offer you a high level of empowerment & self-actualisation.  About the role  You will work closely with an onshore and offshore team .The end goal of this position is to deliver exceptional data pipelining and data ingestion and help the business get more value from their customer data.  Duties • Building data pipelines with PySpark and Databricks • Ingesting large sets of data with big data tools • Using Python for programming • Work with other data engineers • Deliver a data solution for the business  What is required • Must have data engineering experience for at least 3 years • Must have used PySpark for building data pipelines • Must have Python experience • Desirable to have experience with ADF and Azure devops • Excellent communication skills • Commercial experience required  Company & culture • Australian based & owned company • Already established data & technology team • Collaborative environment  If you are interested in this position please apply here or contact Laura Nailard at Precision Sourcing to organise a time to speak laura @precisionsourcing.com.au
job_description.388: About Us  Fortescue is both a proud West Australian company and a global green solutions business. We are recognised for our culture, innovation and industry-leading development of infrastructure, mining assets and green energy initiatives.  Our Opportunity  Location: Perth, WA  Roster: Monday to Friday  We are looking for a data engineer to join our Energy Operations department and take charge of our data pipeline and data integration projects. You will work closely with engineers and subject matter experts to ensure that our data is reliable, accurate and accessible for the business. You will also design, develop and maintain data solutions that meet the needs of our stakeholders and support our strategic goals.  Key Responsibilities • Administer and optimize our data pipeline, including data ingestion, transformation, validation, storage and delivery • Lead data integration initiatives across different sources, systems and platforms, using various tools and technologies. Currently our department's main data platforms include Osisoft PI and Snowflake. • Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists and business users to understand their data requirements and provide them with relevant data sets and reports • Implement data quality checks, data security measures and data governance standards • Perform wrangling of unstructured data sets to standardise and align them for ingestion and aggregation across the business • Troubleshoot and resolve any data issues or incidents • Research and evaluate new data technologies and trends to improve our data capabilities  Qualifications and Experience • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related field • At least 3 years of experience in data engineering, database administration, or related roles • Proficient in SQL and at least one programming language (Python, Java, Scala, etc.), for the purpose of data structuring and wrangling. • Experience with semi-structured data wrangling • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills • Excellent communication and collaboration skills  Our Commitment  Fortescue is deeply committed to providing a safe culture that builds respect, fosters inclusiveness, and values diversity. We celebrate individual strengths and team members from all backgrounds are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. Our global workforce drives and promotes an inclusive culture, both within our organisation and throughout the communities we interact with across the world. Diverse backgrounds include First Nations Peoples, people with differing abilities, LGBTIQ+ community, gender, neurodiverse, cultural diversity, all age groups, and those with an intersectional or multiple diverse characteristics. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.  www.fmgl.com.au/jobs-at-fortescue  Internal Candidates / Current Contractors please apply via Success Factors Careers Portal. For further information on how to apply please visit the Fortescue Hub.  Fortescue reserves the right to close applications early should a suitable pool of candidates be identified. Fortescue will never contact you to ask for payment of any kind, whether directly or through a third party.
job_description.389: Aim to get your IT job within 2 to 6 months with our voluntary PROFESSIONAL CAREER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM.  The successful intern would get exposure to the following duties:﻿﻿ • Assist in gathering raw data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, or APIs. • Perform data cleaning tasks to ensure data accuracy and consistency, which may include handling missing values and removing duplicates. • Work on data analysis projects under the guidance of senior data analysts or mentors. • Create clear and concise data visualizations, charts, and dashboards to present findings and trends. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and managers, to support data-related projects. • Participate in team meetings and discussions to share insights and contribute to data-driven decision-making.﻿  Benefits of the Voluntary Professional Career Internship Program: • Hands on industry exposure to bridge the gap between education and employment with flexibility on a part time basis. • There is a high potential for securing a job following the completion of the internship for the right talent. • The placement fee is the lowest possible and is only charged if a successful placement is secured; there are no registration fees. • You will have the opportunity to work alongside professionals in your industry, expanding your network, competencies, and career growth. • This internship offers a wealth of knowledge and transferable skills that you can gain, and the host company will provide you with a work experience letter.  ﻿﻿GET AN INTERNSHIP WITH A GUARANTEE OF SATISFACTION OR YOU DON'T PAY !
job_description.390: $85,551 to $92,301 pa (HEW 6)  Ongoing, Full Time, Joondalup Campus Open to candidates with relevant work rights FINANCE AND BUSINESS SERVICES CENTREJOONDALUP CAMPUS$85,551 to $92,301 p.a. (HEW 6)  FULL TIME, ONGOINGOverviewThe Resource Planning Team within the Finance and Business Services Centre has the responsibility to:  Lead the development and execution of the University Student Load, Operational and Capital Budgets. Lead development the annual fee setting. Lead the provision of course and unit (activity based) costing information and analysis. Deliver high quality, value-add, strategic financial advice, management services and business support. Deliver high quality, value-add information on student load, including budgets, forecasts, analysis, and advice.  This role, under the direction of the Manager, Business Insights, is responsible for providing support in student load planning, data analysis and modelling.  The ideal candidate will have:  Qualifications: A qualification in a relevant field with at least 2 years' experience in a similar role  Experience:  Prior experiences working in an analytical role of querying data and creating models, forecasting, and providing insights through data interrogation. The ability to develop realistic models. Experience in preparing dashboards and visualisation that provide useful information for the users. Experience of using Cognos BI, Excel and Powerpoint to intermediate level. Experience of TM1 and Tableau is preferred.  You will also demonstrate personal attributes that are congruent with the University's values of Integrity, Respect, Rational Inquiry Personal Excellence and Courage. Benefits & RemunerationThis full-time, ongoing position attracts remuneration of $85,551 to $92,301 plus 17% University superannuation contribution. ECU supports a work/life balance for staff. Benefits such as flexible working arrangements may also be negotiated to meet your personal circumstances. job_description.391: Back to job search  Junior Data Analyst  Location Wembley Salary: Up to £25,000 per annum Job ref: 073651 Published: about 7 hours ago  Leyland SDM specialises in paint, tools, plumbing, electrical, woodwork & DIY materials. We have 33 high street stores across London, supported by our central support team and distribution centre in Wembley. We are currently on an exciting journey and have some very ambitious growth plans.  What is the role about?  The Junior Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Data Analyst in providing up-to-date, accurate and relevant data analysis for the organisation. You are responsible for collecting and analysing numerical information for further presentation using diagrams, tables, charts, graphs, and reports as appropriate. The data analyst will be able to identify trends and report findings to senior members of the business.  What will you be doing? • Use statistical methods to analyse data and generate useful business reports. • Support the Data Analyst in working the management team to create a prioritised list of needs for each business segment. • Collect and organise data from various sources, ensuring data quality and accuracy. • Use data to create models that depict trends in the business. • Produce regular business reports. • Create dashboards and analytical tools.  What Skills & Experience will you need to have? • Problem solving abilities • Logical and methodical approach to work • Excellent IT skills • Able to interpret and analyse data • High attention to detail • Proactive and self-motivated • Excellent maths skills • Able to work to strict deadlines • Good written and spoken communication abilities  How will performance in the role be measured? • Timely production of accurate data • Delivery of simple solutions to business reporting needs • Working collaboratively with other departments • Working in partnership with Data Analyst  On top of an attractive salary we have an excellent benefits package on offer: • Hybrid working • Generous bonus opportunity • 33 days holiday a year (includes public holidays) • Generous Company Pension contributions • Up to 20% discount in Leyland SDM, plus discount across other Grafton Group brands • Health Cashplan - claim money back on everyday healthcare needs and treatments (Dental, physio, prescriptions to name a few) • Share saving scheme into our parent company, the Grafton Group • Enhanced Maternity/ Paternity Leave • Travel allowance • Paid time off for Volunteering • Company sick pay • Life assurance • Cycle2work scheme • 100's of retail discounts available through our flexible benefits portal  If this sounds like an opportunity too good to miss, we want to hear from you!  Click Apply now.
job_description.392: • Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM  face2face reference: 591408  Location: Nationwide - Remote  Hours: Full-time  Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline  Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super  About the role:  The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.  The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.  Duties: • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Required experience/skills: • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.  Desirable experience skills: • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment.  If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you. job_description.393: WesTrac is an equipment solutions company and one of the world’s leading Caterpillar Dealerships with a rich history of supporting thousands of customers across the mining and construction industries in Australia. At WesTrac our primary focus is our people. We know that our success is the result of more than 4,000 talented people working together to achieve amazing outcomes.  Reporting to the Digital Excellence Manager the Digital Analyst is responsible for gathering business requirements for translating into process and digital business solutions to enhance capabilities for the Client Solutions Team (CST). You will have the ability to analyse complex data and present results in formats that are easily understood by non-technical audiences.  The Digital Analyst will also be involved in a range of projects, with a focus on employee and customer experience, which will contribute to sustainable and scalable growth.  The position requires a process orientated approach, with a strong attention to detail led by an inquisitive and investigative mind. We are a high performing outcome focused team that leverages emerging technologies, placing a high importance for ongoing personal and professional development.  Location: Perth Branch, Reid Road with flexible working options available (combination of working from home and office based)  Roster: Monday to Friday, Permanent Full Time or Permanent Part Time (4 days per week)  To be successful the following is required: • Experience developing Power BI dashboards, dataflows, datasets, data cleansing, transformation and modelling • Experience with Power Platform (PowerAutomate and/or PowerApps) • Experience in Microsoft SQL Database • Experience working with cloud platform such as Databricks highly regarded • Experience (intermediate to advanced) with Microsoft 365 suite • Ability to conduct thorough detailed data analysis and investigatory work • Ability to access data programmatically via API and API integration • Knowledge of Python desirable  What we offer: • Opportunity to get a $3,000 referral bonus as part of our Recommend and Spend program. • Job security with a consistent pipeline of work. • Unrivalled training and development • Fantastic team environment and inclusive work culture. • Made for More Rewards program with discounts at retailers like Woolworths, Caltex, Apple, Crown, Qantas and many more. • Paid parental leave, discounted health insurance, income protection insurance, and salary sacrifice options. We offer a wide range of IT services in Security, infrastructure, and Systems Integration to a diverse customer base throughout Australia, New Zealand, SE Asia, and Europe.
