Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.  Domain knowledge of Mining Industry is mandatory.

job_description.422: Our client is a software development company based in Perth, WA and are engaged in providing services in cloud technologies to their customers. Your role will be working on an upcoming project in a team of developers for our client based in UK. The Role: • Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. • Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies. • Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems. • Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. • Performing requirements analysis. • Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts. • Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. • Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports. • Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff. • Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff. • Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency. • Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. • Performing user acceptance testing. • Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance. • Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures. • Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. • Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. • Managing competing resources and priorities. • Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects. Skills and Experience:- Degree in relevant field, plus at least 5 years of post-qualification related employment experience. Preferably 5-10 years experience Evaluating business processes, predicting requirements, designing and implementing solutions. Analysing business processes and communicating feedback to other team members and management. Planning and monitoring projects with regular check on requirements. English language fluency. job_description.423: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  What if we didn’t focus on who you are now, but who you could become?  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.  What’s in it for you?  As a Data Modeller, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: • Lead, develop and maintain data taxonomies, data models, schemas and definitions across all lines of business while working closely with Data Architects and various system stakeholders • Advise and implement leading industry practice data modelling production, storage, and consumption standards, elaborate and champion best practices for data modelling and evolving practices like schema driven development, schema DevOps and modern data modelling techniques • Build and maintain strong relationships with our key architects and stakeholders across clients and internal EY service lines • Understand and document how data is, or will be used, and its implications on people, processes, products and technology • Contribute and evolve EY’s data modelling frameworks, standards and best practices  What We’re Looking For  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go. • Data modelling using techniques such as Schema driven modelling, Data Vault, 3rd Normal Form, Kimball (5+ Years) • Broad domain experience including Financial Services (Banking, Insurance), Defence, Health and Logistics, with the ability to link the dots across industry data sets • Understanding of traditional Data Modelling principles (Kimball, 3NF, Data Vault, etc.) • Ability to translate business requirements to technical requirements from Conceptual to physical data models • Ability to translate high level design into specific implementation steps  What We Can Offer You • Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment • Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility • Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness • Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits  Acknowledgement of Country  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.  Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000AUD including 11% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
job_description.424: Australian Citizens residing in Australia only respond. • Contract start 16 October 2023 to 12 months. • Australian Citizen, Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth role.  Send your responses to jobs@softtestpays.com  Overview  The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is responsible for the delivery of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). Since it was established, the NDIA has pursued a vision of optimising social and economic independence and full participation for people with disability. The Data & Analytics Branch supports the Agency by providing high quality data and reporting and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions.  Key Responsibilities • Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the organisation. Capture business requirements and identify underlying business needs. • Carry out analysis of present approaches and identify opportunities to enhance processes current and target state. • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business requirements. • Translate subject-matter expert and stakeholder discussion into process flows, procedures and business requirements. • Identify and document instances where existing business processes may be streamlined or improved or do not meet current or potential future business needs. • Develop, maintain and validate business requirements with stakeholders. • Input to the design and implementation of solutions that support the business processes and deliver business insight. • Liaise with management to coordinate process improvement project activities. • Workshop facilitation with business stakeholders to map out processes and elicit business requirements. • Practical Agile Delivery framework experience, developing Initiatives, Epics, User Stories and other documentation. • Ability to work with the business to identify business process issues, improvement opportunities and potential solutions. • Ability to gather, analyse and translate business data to meaningful insights.  Every application requires to address selection criteria as part of application submission.  Essential Criteria  1. Able to translate discussion into process flows, requirements and documentation.  2. Able to understand and capture business requirements relating to use / application of data to business problems.  3. Have experience in as is and to be process mapping.  4. Hands on experience with agile product development process for data products as well as developing detailed User Stories and UAC.  5. Intermediate skills with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, Powerpoint, Word.  6. Showcase good analytical and evaluating skills.  Desirable Criteria  1. Experience as a scrum master.  2. Experience creating wireframes.  3. Data analysis skills.  4. Experience working in data businesses.
job_description.425: • 3 and 9 month contracts • Education and Construction • Functional and Technical BA roles available We are working on multiple Business Analyst roles (both functional and technical) with a number of organisations across Perth. Responsibilities • Develop standard data views, complex data models and BI reports and dashboards to provide insight to stakeholders on benchmarks and trends. • Design, and develop data pipelines in Azure platform or Databricks. • Conduct complex data analysis, prepare data for modelling and combine data from different sources. • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met. • Conduct training sessions related to business and performance reporting.  Skills • Experience in building an end-to-end data pipeline for manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large structured and unstructured datasets. • Experience in tools like Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python and SQL • Experience working with BI tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, SAP), Python, R, modern ETL tools, machine learning, data lakes, and data streaming  How To Apply  If you are interested and possess the right experience, please apply now via the link below. job_description.428: At RAC WA, we are committed to improving the lives of our members. We are currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Analyst to join our team and drive the identification and development of opportunities that enhance our members' current experiences and future needs.  This position will be offered as a permanent full time basis  What will you be doing? • Ongoing identification of gaps or unmet needs for members in relation to mobility and home requirements. • Conducting research on major trends, market analysis, and competitor research to identify potential mobility and home services related commercial opportunities. • Developing and adapting prototypes, testing and evolving potential opportunities to determine future member, commercial, and strategic value at an accelerated pace. • Producing high-quality business cases, feasibility analysis, project scope, and project requirements documentation, project planning, and project delivery. • Developing and maintaining strong, effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.  What are we looking for?  To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need • Tertiary qualifications in Business, Innovation, or a similar field. • Significant experience as an Analyst in business development with commercial expertise. • Demonstrated experience in market scanning of external trends and intelligence analysis, effectively synthesising business insights into commercial opportunities. • Demonstrated experience working with new product development processes, including exposure to human-centered design and/or agile innovation techniques. • Demonstrated experience establishing and working in small, multidisciplinary, entrepreneurial, and adaptive teams of internal and external resources.  What can we offer you? • Competitive compensation and generous discounts on home, contents and car insurance plus free roadside assistance • Join a dynamic team dedicated to improving the lives of our members. • Flexible working arrangements coupled with ongoing opportunities for professional growth and development. • Member benefits and an active Social Club  If you are passionate about driving innovation and have a strong background in business development and analysis, we want to hear from you. Apply today to be part of a team that is shaping the future of mobility and home services for our members.  Please note: We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as RAC reserves the right to close this vacancy without notice.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. We encourage people of all abilities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, diverse cultures and backgrounds, LGBTIQ+ identities, and all age groups to apply.  RAC is committed to flexibility. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact . • Please click here to apply.
job_description.429: • Highly commercial, immediate start role|Opportunity to become permanent  About Our Client  My client is a large, global business with a well recognised brand here in Perth.  Job Description  Reporting in to the Financial Controller, you will be responsible for the following; • Understand and document the work flows from various Operational and Commercial systems through the data inputs into the financial ledger • Provide finance support to commercial activities as nominated by the Financial Controller • Display the ability to understand, reconcile and improve these data flows such that the data is correctly reflected in the General Ledger • Interpret statistical and accounting information to oversee and interrogate operating results • Identify opportunities for process improvements, including validating these opportunities against existing structural weaknesses and cost requirements • Assist with overall system and business analysis and user support • Responsible for the analysis and resolution of system and operational issues • Model current business processes and identify opportunities for process improvements • Identify issues, risks and benefits of existing and proposed solutions, outlining business impacts  The Successful Applicant  To be successful in this role, you will ideally and most recently have work in a similar role with a systems and project focus. You will be an experienced and qualified accountant who has stepped in a systems accountant or process improvement position. Ideally you will enjoy working across multiple business units and providing commercial and technical insight across all departments.  What's On Offer • Immediate start position • Opportunity to become permanent down the line • Competitive rate / salary • Fantastic team culture and environment  Contact: Adelle Huntley  Quote job ref: JN-042023-6022428
job_description.430: • ‘Work where it works’ for you and your clients • Be part of a team where everyone belongs, and individuality is celebrated • Contribute to the financial wellbeing of our 2 million+ clients across Australia  The difference you will make at Insignia Financial  In the role of the Salesforce Technical Business Analyst, you will take an active and forward-looking approach to enhance project delivery. This includes providing leadership to analysts and collaborating closely with the Delivery Manager to ensure the successful execution of team activities and deliverables.  You Will Make a Difference By • Conducting in-depth technical analysis, addressing complex business requirements and processes • Serving as a pivotal link between stakeholders and the delivery team, taking charge of complex issues across various applications that involve multiple parties • Evaluating existing processes and systems, offering recommendations for process enhancements • Providing subject matter expertise and conduct business analysis for intricate projects • Developing position statements on complex subject matter inquiries • Assisting in Incident Management during Business as Usual (BAU) operations, identifying the root causes and facilitating defect remediation within stipulated SLAs • Providing comprehensive support throughout the end-to-end delivery process, including technical requirements, testing, and change management for planned releases and maintenance windows as needed  A Little Bit About You • Possess business and/or technology expertise, acquired within the Financial Services sector or other related industries • Extensive experience, with a significant portion dedicated to working with Salesforce • Hold tertiary qualifications or possess equivalent industry experience • Demonstrate prior experience in various business practices, with a particular focus on Financial Services, especially in superannuation and fund management • Expert in systems design, integration, and function/data analysis within specific business functions • Exhibit effective communication and interpersonal skills, crucial for effective stakeholder engagement, including the ability to conduct showcases • Adopt a proactive approach to problem-solving, critical thinking, and the identification of opportunities for improvement • Lead by example by embodying the culture and values that align with the expectations of the team and Insignia Financial  Life at Insignia Financial  From people just starting out, to those about to retire – every day we help more Australians secure their future. Helping our clients reach their financial goals sooner is our specialty. Few others can match the range of wealth management products and services we offer.  Insignia Financial is an ASX Top 200 company, and one of one of Australia’s leading wealth managers. We use our scale and expertise to invest in a future that’s better for everyone. We believe success comes from caring about people, consistent performance, and outstanding service. And we recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference: this applies to employees and clients alike.  Diversity and ensuring our people feel they belong is important to us, we take pride in putting our people, as well as our clients, first and value and celebrate diversity within all our teams.  We have a Women in Technology community which exists to bring together female and non-binary people within the tech world at Insignia Financial. This supportive forum is eager to progress and make change in the technology space – does this sound like you?  With many of us now working from home more than the office, we understand the importance of flexibility. As we work in a hybrid environment, you’ll ‘work where it works’ for you, your team, and our clients. We also offer varied and flexible leave offerings, including 12 weeks paid parental leave and an extra day of leave each year.  We encourage our people to have an impact on the broader community we serve through volunteering leave.  At Insignia Financial, it’s important to us that our people feel secure about their own money. We have an extensive financial wellbeing offering available to our people, including access to financial advice, mortgage, and insurance brokers, Will and estate planning services and more.  Join us and contribute to achieving our ambition of creating financial wellbeing for all Australians through living our Principles: be human, deliver what matters, stronger together, keep it simple and do what’s right, not what’s easy.  To apply  Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now".  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.  #AW

The Data Engineer will be responsible for building, maintaining, and optimising our data and data pipeline architecture, as well read more... Click here to view more detail / apply for Data Engineer
job_description.432: About The Role  Reporting to the Head of Applications & Integration, the Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist provides companywide analytical and technical support for business intelligence activities. The position is responsible for the development, maintenance, and improvements of the BI environment and aligning it with business requirements and priorities.  The key elements of this new role are the responsibility for leadership of the BI strategy and for maintaining the Regis BI Reporting and Analytics platform in line with business requirements and priorities.  Duties & Responsibilities • Working with the IT Team to launch new reporting capabilities • Critically evaluating and screening data, plus profiling to identify any issues • Developing new data processes and reports • Developing leading analytics for health, financial and other data • Overseeing the data warehouse, including the collection and utilization of all data • Extending knowledge of Business Intelligence to provide ongoing refinement of processes to improve operations  Skills & Experience • Understanding of BI technology trends and issues, inclusive of Power BI and SSRS • Knowledge of Web applications architecture and its key components • Experience in database administration and data warehousing • Solid background in SQL development/support (SQL server, TSQL, SSIS) • Basic MS SQL Server DB Administration • Basic Windows Server Administration • Ability to produce quality technical documentation (Requirements and Design Documents) • Experience with Release and Change Management Process Cycle • University degree in a related field  Why work for us? • With national support and local care, you'll be part of a team that truly cares. • Enjoy a flexible working environment to balance your life and wellbeing. • Career pathways and opportunities across Australia, including entry-level roles. • Strong professional and clinical development programs including Graduate Nurse Program, Student Placement, Traineeships, and Study Assistance Programs. • Employee discount and benefits programs. • Reward and recognition programs including our Annual National Care Awards.  Ready to apply?  If you're ready to make a difference in the lives of others, we want to hear from you!  About Regis  Regis offers a diverse range of care options including residential aged care, home care, retirement living, day therapy and day respite. Regis is one of the largest providers of aged care in Australia and cares for more than 7,000 residents and clients each year.  To work in residential aged care, you will need to provide satisfactory background checks, supply a NDIS worker screening clearance, COVID and flu vaccinations, and certification proof.
job_description.433: Senior Consultants- Azure Data Factory or Databricks - Microsoft Data & Analytics  A leading Australian based Data & Analytics Professional Services consultancy is looking for multiple Consultants of all levels for their Perth practice. You must have Australian Citizenship  What's In It for You  A competitive permanent salary package with the opportunity to work with large enterprise clients in many verticals including financial services, utilities, government and more!  The role  This role is the epitome of the archetypal IT business consultant where you will apply your proven Azure Data Factory or Databricks and Azure development expertise within top ASX 500 style organisations. You will be working exclusively on high level projects and will utilise the Microsoft Fabric technologies, Data Factory & Power BI as well as Databricks. You will become a key member of the team assisting with the growth of the Perth Practice.  The skills needed  The ideal candidate for this true technical consulting role will have some or all of the following experience: • Microsoft Platform knowledge of Azure Fabric, the Microsoft Data Cloud stack and on prem Microsoft BI technologies • Azure Data Factory experience • Databricks experience is an advantage • Power BI experience • Ideally previous Professional services experience with Data consultancies • Previous on prem SSIS, SSAS (tabular and modular) and SSRS, Power BI experience • High level client liaison skills • Documentation (business focused, technology focused and project focused)  As mentioned salary levels are excellent and remuneration will match your experience.
job_description.434: To solve important problems we need diverse talent. Our people use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be champions of change. When people from diverse backgrounds, with different points of view, work together, we create incredible value - for our clients, our people and our society.  Our Deals Data & Analytics team embeds Data and Analytics across the Deals platform. We deliver Pre Deal - working with our M&A Lead Advisory business to help unpick trends. Deals Execution - working with Financial and Commercial Diligence teams to get deeper into data. Post Deal - working with our Deals clients to maximise their value from their investments, blending technical skills and strategy to advise top ASX organisations, not-for-profit companies and private clients with spectacular results. And our team is expanding. We're looking for a Data Analyst to extract insights and bring data to life within our vast community of solvers.  Use the know-how you've gained in your hands on experience of cleaning, joining and manipulating data. You will have a working knowledge of and experience of data structuring and modeling (data warehouse design, T-SQL, DAX etc); data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau/PowerBI) and data transformation tools (e.g. Alteryx). With new problems to solve, you'll have plenty of support and opportunities to grow. We work from anywhere, so your strong communication skills and team ethos will get a workout. You'll learn plenty as you develop scripts, functions and workflows in a workplace that’s human-led and tech-enabled.  As an expert in Data & Analytics, you’ll solve problems like being able to navigate data and provide creative alternative solutions to its problems. You will be able to work autonomously at times, problem solve and be able to articulate each step of your work with the Deals team and clients. In our Deals Data & Analytics team, you’ll also use your tertiary qualifications in business, economics, technology or similar to: • Extract tangible insights for our clients to bring data to life in the context of a client’s investment decision • Develop combinations of scripts, functions, and workflows to manipulate data in order to analyse it • Set up analytics packs / dashboards using visualisation tools for analysis, and working collaboratively with our clients or our pwc engagement teams to create meaningful analysis • Drive adoption of data and analytics capabilities across the Deals business more widely • Mentor and developing junior staff members and members of our offshore team  It’s time to move forward. And upward.  You want to grow, reach new heights and move up the corporate ladder.  We’ll give you a career-boosting role that: • Helps you learn and grow with our internal Academy, study support, and partnerships with Udemy and Coursera • Has competitive and transparent salary packages with the opportunity for yearly bonuses and promotions • Is strong on growth and reward • Provides strong mentors, meaningful work and plenty of networking opportunities • Gives you the chance to explore, with overseas secondments and our Together Anywhere policy that lets you work up to 4 weeks from anywhere in Australia • Helps you prioritise your life outside of work, with lifestyle and wellness stipends up to $500 a year  We're an inclusive bunch, and we try to make life easier - for our clients, our teams and our communities. If you need reasonable adjustments when applying, just let us know.  Karen Jeavons is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experiences high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.
job_description.435: • Use your Applied Analytics Skills to lead a NFP to success • Hybrid Setup • 6 week short term project | ASAP Start  Sick of travelling into the office every day? Fed up with the increased cost you’re spending on fuel?  Why waste time and money, when you could have a flexible hybrid arrangement?  What a nice change, huh?  Not only this, but enjoy the satisfaction of knowing that your data insights will directly impact this Non-For-Profit’s mission for the positive; to upskill and coach individuals to sustain small businesses, and provide support to Indigenous communities.  If you want to use your data insights experience to make a real change in the community, step right up.  Your New Gig  This Non-For-Profit is continuously growing, and as an Applied Data Analyst, you’ll be joining for 6 weeks, as a key player in a project to promote business process improvement.  You’ll be working on multiple business problems, however you’ll have a significant focus on leveraging and analysing data surrounding the customer journey. You’ll need to identify and communicate key insights and areas of attrition to leaders, with the goal to minimise customer drop-out rates and help overall lead conversion.  If you’re a lover of data who likes to get hands-on and dig deep to find the “why”, then this is the fun bit!  You won’t just be reporting your insights, you’ll be a part of the problem-solving process. You’ll be brainstorming hypotheses, testing them with different processes and solutions, and delivering your insights accordingly.  If you’re not an expert in extracting data – no worries, you’ll be working with a Business Analyst who will provide you with the necessary data to get the job done.  As a result of your work, you’ll help this organisation deliver its services to hundreds more in need.  If you happen to also utilise the Six Sigma methodology, this will help. If not, they’ll coach you through it!  Next Steps  If you have a CV, click apply to be immediately considered.  If you don’t have an up-to-date CV, but are still keen, let’s have a further chat.  Contact me, Olivia Ellerman via one of the following channels:  LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/oliviaellerman/  Email: oellerman@rarekind.com.au
job_description.436: Looking for experienced business and data analysts to work in a branch of passionate and hard working policy and technical experts, seeking to better use data and business analytics to improve the way DVA delivers important services to our clients.  A range of positions are available in Sydney and Canberra across the EL2, EL1, APS6 and APS5 levels. Experts in other Australian cities able to work remotely will also be considered.  Applicants must be Australian citizens or permanent residents. Applications must be made through the DVA jobs portal. More information is available at https://dvajobs.nga.net.au/cp/index.cfm?event=jobs.home  Application deadline 12th October 2023.
job_description.437: The Company  Join a leading energy company that's driving sustainable solutions worldwide. With a rich history spanning decades, this industry pioneer is at the forefront of innovation. Collaborate with top talent on cutting-edge projects, making a tangible impact on global energy challenges. Be part of a team committed to shaping a more sustainable future, where your skills and passion can thrive! Progressive, passionate and proud to drive the best outcomes, their people matter to them.  The Role  This is a 6 month contract role where you will perform the pivotal role of the Data Analyst. You will collaborate with the demand planning team to manage forecasts within the Demand Planning system, ultimately elevating the forecasting accuracy to new heights. The role focuses around the oversight of statistical forecasts and then through collaborative efforts with our sales, marketing and supply chain teams, you will actively respond to shifts in demand and supply dynamics. As the Data Analyst / Demand Planner you will be responsible for;- • Construct intricate PowerBI reports connected to Enterprise data systems to effectively distil data into actionable insights • Utilise statistical forecasts to respond to shifts in demand and supply dynamics • Delve into sales data to reveal emerging trends and provide actionable insights for strategic interventions • Construct PowerBI reports to replace and automate existing Excel models • Effectively business partner and liaise with sales, marketing and supply chain teams • Establish and maintain healthy stakeholder relationships  About You  The Data Analyst will be someone who seeks continuous improvement and innovation. You operate with a view to progress the business by acting reasonably and efficiently when dealing with decision making. It's imperative that alongside developed technical ability you also possess strong ability to communicate effectively to reports, peers and colleagues. You will be able to engage stakeholders at all levels and demonstrated a strong consulting acumen. You will have a track record in building and leading successful teams and delivering results on time and accurately. A flexible, proactive and self-starter attitude will be essential. Along with the ability to work to deadlines you will have a passion for driving best practice and enjoy streamlining processes.  Skills and Experience  To excel in this role, you must possess the following: • 2 years of experience working in PowerBI data analysis or 3 years experience working with PowerBI and demand planning • Able to conduct data analysis and create a PowerBI report/dashboard • Highly involved in the supply chain industry • Demand planning experience is highly desirable • Excellent analysis and problem solving skills • Can do attitude with a willingness to learn • Great communication & attention to detail • Ability to work autonomously and eager to learn • Ability to build sound relationships with stakeholders and business partnering experience based on trust  What's On Offer • On-the-job training will be provided • Highly attractive salary package • 2 days WFH policy • Diverse role with a supportive & collaborative team environment • Career development and growth opportunities • Western Sydney Location - Great public transport links  Apply Now  To submit your application, click on the "Apply Now" button or for more information please reach out to Seb Newton at ManpowerGroup  Seb Newton Recruitment Consultant Let's Connect  ManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Please indicate your preferred method of communication in your resume and please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments should you be contacted for an interview.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.  By submitting your resume and other personal information with this application you are consenting to this information being collected in line with our privacy policy. Follow the link to learn more - www.manpowergroup.com.au/privacy-policy  State: QLD, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHL-02026-D5L4Q. State: QLD, LHL-02014-Y5F6D. State: SA, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHS 288856
job_description.438: • Experience Hybrid. Work from the office or home in a rhythm that suits you • Permanent role based in Sydney or Melbourne.  We're REA  REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.  With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.  Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women.  Where the team fits in  REA is evolving how it leverages data and technology to deliver benefits for customers. After the acquisition of Hometrack Australia in May-18 (recently re-branded into PropTrack). Since this time the business has continued to grow, underpinned by an expanding set of services and capabilities we bring to our customers.  PropTrack’s commercial team is the face of the PropTrack business with its customers. The Data Analyst role sits within the Client Analytics function within the commercial team. The Client analytics team has become an important, unique and in demand offering of PropTrack in market, as a result we are now looking for an experienced data & analytics professional who can interface with our customers to help consult and solve analytical problems.  What the role is all about • Liaising and working collaboratively with PropTrack’s customers to help solve analytical business problems. • Working with customers on tasks from a wide breadth of analytical domains including modelling, data mining/analysis, reporting and data visualisation. • Presenting complex analytical outputs and results to all levels of an organisation. • Working with commercial leads and account managers to support client requests and working across a wide range of teams within REA to service these requests. • Bringing domain expertise to help in the design and build of new products and solutions to support PropTrack’s property analytics products, platforms and custom solutions in line with the growth strategy • Building a deep understanding of PropTrack’s products and enabling clients to optimise and make the best use of PropTrack’s current data analytics products and platforms (eg AVM, HTV, HPB). • Building deep relationship with key stakeholders within the Financial Services clients (Senior Management to analyst levels)  Who we’re looking for • Technical knowledge- Understanding of common analytical techniques such as sampling and experience of working in a data-rich environment with data mining techniques and predictive analytics, with use of tools such as SQL, R, Python. Knowledge in common data visualisation tools such as tableau is also high desirable. • Domain Knowledge - A deep understanding of several or all of the following: data analytics, the property market, property data, property valuations, home lending and retail banking. • Commercial orientation – Commercially savvy, able to bring the best outcomes for the benefit of PropTrack business and clients alike. • Creative and analytical thinker - An ability to work through complex problems collaboratively, and to find practical and viable solutions to meet client needs and wants. • Client Focus - A mind-set that is always client first, and a proven track record in managing customer experience initiatives. • Relationship Influencer – the ability to build strong relationships with peers within in organisations, to solve problems and perspective of clients for mutually beneficial outcomes.  The REA experience  The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.  We offer: • A hybrid and flexible approach to working - https://rea.to/hybrid-working • Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers • Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing • Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity. • Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life • Performance recognition programs because hard work should never go unnoticed  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe teams with diverse ideas and experiences are more creative, more eﬀective and fuel disruptive thinking - be it cultural and ethnic backgrounds, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other identity or lived experience. We know diverse teams are critical to maintaining our success and driving new business opportunities. If you've got the skills, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.  If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?
job_description.439: WiseTech Global is a world-leading software company building software for the global logistics industry. We are united in our mission to create breakthrough products that enable and empower those who own and operate the supply chains of the world. More than 18,000 logistics organizations use our software solutions, including 24 of the top 25 global freight forwarders and 41 of the top 50 global third-party logistics providers.  We’re an engineer-led company focusing on building secure, scalable products. Therefore, data analytics is critical to the function of the international supply chain.  As a Sydney or Melbourne-based data analyst, you will be responsible for designing and building data models to enhance analytics and performance reporting and optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams.  About the role:  By joining the team, you will be responsible for analyzing available data sources and giving recommendations on data integration and processing, building data models for predictive and prescriptive analytics, investigating, and interpreting data, and building prototypes for analytics reports.  If you are self-directed and are comfortable supporting the data needs of the business, systems, and products - this role is for you!  Key responsibilities: • Communicating with stakeholders to understand and write technical and business requirements for use cases. • Statistical analysis of data in multiple data sources, creating data profiles. • Identifying and implementing data quality control processes that prompt correction in the source systems where required. • Developing data models, flows, datasets, and views that are efficient and meaningful representations of data. • Designing reporting solutions and building prototypes. • Communicating and coordinating effectively with data owners, product people, and other stakeholders to ensure models and results are well understood and incorporated into their business processes. • Developing and implementing testing plans for data transformations, maintaining data definition and technical documentation. • Driving awareness and providing expertise on the use of analytics tools and concepts, providing training and effectively communicating with multiple stakeholders. • Analysing existing data governance and privacy requirements and identifying areas for improvement.  To be successful in this role, you will have: • 2-6 years of commercial experience in a similar role • Strong understanding of business analysis methodologies and techniques, including requirements gathering, process modelling, and documentation • Experience of working with notebooks • Deep understanding of databases • Experience in Data Design work • Expertise in Microsoft BI stack (MS SQL, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI, OLAP) • Experience working with SQL and visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI, • Basic Python skills • Experience with Statistical Modelling • Practical knowledge of data warehousing concepts • Knowledge of Data Governance concepts, industry best practices, and principles • Solid SQL experience, authoring complex queries and DDL, working with execution plans • Basic knowledge of machine learning (E.g. Spark ML or Python ML)  Before you apply:  From time to time, WiseTech Global may use external service providers to assist us with assessing applications, including background checks, on our behalf. Accordingly, by applying for this role and providing your personal information to WiseTech Global, you consent to WiseTech Global providing this information to our external service providers who are required to treat such information with strict confidentiality in line with privacy and data protection laws and regulations.
job_description.440: As the leading European Union bank, and one of the world’s largest financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence in the region since 1860, BNP Paribas offers a wide range of financial services for corporate, institutional and private investors spanning corporate and institutional banking, wealth management, asset management and insurance.  We passionately embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all employees are valued and encourage applicants of all backgrounds, including diversity of origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion applicants who may be living with a disability. We have a number of internal employee networks in place to empower our staff to act and challenge the status quo.  • BNP Paribas PRIDE is highly active in favour of the LGBTQIA+ community • BNP Paribas MixCity which fosters better representation of women at all levels of the organization • Ability, the mutual aid network for employees with a disability or a disabling or chronic illness • BNP Paribas CulturAll which celebrates diverse backgrounds  BNP is committed to financing a carbon-neutral economy by 2050. The Group is a founding member of the Net-Zero Banking Alliance and has set up its own Low Carbon Transition Group to support its clients through their energy transitions.  https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/  More information  You must accept the "Social media and content sharing cookies" to see this content. Cookies settings  You must accept the "Social media and content sharing cookies" to see this content. Cookies settings  Award Obtained BNPP has won Top employer Europe award in a 10th consecutive year Position Purpose • The role of the Data Analyst sits within the Data Governance team whom are part of the Business Change Management (BCM) division of BNP Paribas. The Data Analyst’s primary objective is providing the business with data analytics and solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners. • The Data Analyst will report directly to the Head of Data Governance and work within a matrix structure, delivering into projects that are managed across all platforms. They communicate with internal and external stakeholders including business stakeholders in operations, product and coverage, Paris and London branches for global projects, standards, vendors and consultants.  Key Responsibilities  Business & Data Requirements • Engage stakeholders to establish a common understanding of the business and data needs • Identify and correctly translate business needs into business requirements and data solution requirements • Clarify and elicit business requirements, proactively identifying additional requirements not explicitly provided, obtaining missing information and resolving conflicting information among the needs and requirements • Ensure data requirements are consistent with the business requirements. Where possible relate deliverables and their acceptance criteria to the requirements • Validate data requirements with stakeholders to ensure they are based on an understanding of the stakeholder needs, expectations, constraints, and interfaces  Data Solution Design • Gain a firm understanding of the impacts of the solution on People, Process and Technology. • Engage stakeholders to ensure a common understanding of (and commitment to) all aspects of the project including objectives, scope, risks, benefits and any element they may be providing Gather all the necessary inputs and review to fully understand the requirements, specifications, applicable standards etc. • Document the current (as-is) business process design if this does not already exist • Document the to-be business process design and identify how the implementation of the data solution will benefit the business  Data Quality and Integrity • Liaise with the business to identify data inconsistencies and provide the capability to identify these items in advance • Lead and/or undertake data quality activities and initiatives where required. Ensure appropriate tools and techniques are used for data analysis tasks and deliverables. • Encourage peer reviews and feedback sessions within the community. • Personally review a selection of the deliverables generated by the community.  Engage and contribute to a Data analysis community of practice, which includes: • Establishing regular community meetings with all data analysts to provide group mentoring, discuss concerns and issues, and implement actions for continuous improvement. • Perform reviews of deliverables produced by the community’s business analysts and provide feedback and constructive critiques. • Formalise standards and consistency around business analysis deliverables and encourage the community’s adherence to these standards.  Alteryx Designer/Gallery/Power BI Implementation: • Using the analysis, requirements gathering and stakeholder workshops mentioned above, create Alteryx workflows or Power BI Dashboards that align with the correct business outcomes and optimise business process and introduce operational efficiencies • Ensure that developed workflows meet the standards of Data Governance and Analytics teams and can be scaled to run on the Alteryx Gallery • Create consistency amongst existing workflows and ensure that the user experience is maintained across the data governance and analytics gallery and standards are set for future developments  Competencies (Technical / Behavioural)  Technical • 3+ years analysis experience • Experience in an Information Technology & Change capacity in the Financial Services Industry • 3+ years of Alteryx Designer/Gallery or Power BI experience is essential • Experience in custody or back-office administration for the funds management industry • Familiarity with analytical capabilities such as Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx • Thorough knowledge of Investment administration platforms such as HiPort • Excellent working knowledge of relational databases, be able to confidently write SQL • Experience in dealing with large data sets and knowledge of HiPortfolio and Data Warehouse’s. • Strong analytical ability to analyse, summarise and explain large data sets through verbal, written and visual forms. • Identifying efficiency opportunities, writing business cases and creating POC’s that will add business value through the implementation of Alteryx • Assist in developing the governance and framework to ensure operational readiness of new business technologies • Excellent analytical skills, able to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, work well in a demanding and dynamic environment to meet overall objectives. • Project management skills; experience with Agile, scheduling and resource management. • Ability to motivate cross-functional, interdisciplinary teams to achieve tactical and strategic goals.  Behavioral • Accountable: Want someone who is accountable for their actions. The Business analyst must be accountable for their estimates and for tracking their actions against the relevant plans as well as outlining issues as they arise • Attention to detail: Ensures accuracy and implements processes to ensure quality of output. Ensures high personal standards in all areas of work. • Problem solving: gathers and analyses information and uses it to develop effective solutions to difficult problems or situations • Client Focus: Complete commitment to provide professional, intelligent and timely responses to internal and external clients’ needs and to changes in the market. • Communication: Write, speak and present information effectively, relevantly and in a timely fashion • Negotiation & conflict resolution: Negotiates or mediates sound agreements in situations where there is disagreement or differences in interests • Innovation: Develop and implement original ideas, approaches and solutions to typical, unusual or difficult situations or problems • Collaboration and team work: Develops and maintains a good working relationship with others. Provide support to other team members and seeks the same from others. • Strategic thinking: Understands the business, and anticipates business needs, reflecting this in the approach to current solutions • Pro Active: Must be someone who can see a need and be willing to assist in meeting that need even if it falls outside the word specific area of their job description. Want a team player who realizes the importance of delivering the business solution and is willing to assist with this  Specific Qualifications Required • Degree qualified in IT, Business, or related discipline; and / or relevant work experience in a similar role.
job_description.441: Innovating. Empowering. Delighting. Join the Intuit Australia & Rest of World team as a Staff Business Data Analyst to delight small businesses & accountants through QuickBooks and our ecosystem of attached products.  Intuit HQ is based in Mountain View California where we have been in operations since 1983. We are proud to share that Intuit has consistently appeared in Fortune’s top 50 Best companies to work for over the last 5 years. We believe in the power of the individual. The power to do more. To make more. To be more.  The Data Analytics team is looking for a talented Staff Data Analyst to drive GTM initiatives across the Australian & Rest of World businesses. You should be a driven fast learner and high achiever with a passion to continuously learn, grow and deliver well in a high performance and flexible hybrid working environment characterized by speed, collaboration, creativity and fun.  As a Staff Analyst, you will work closely with our GTM Teams to develop insights, lead experimentation, and drive key business results. You will take complex concepts and communicate them to both technical and non-technical leaders in order to effect change for our customers. You will be an instrumental leader in shaping the strategy, working across Marketing, Sales, Intuit AI and Data Engineering to drive an integrated plan to grow and scale our Advisor business.  This is an amazing opportunity to join our passionate team using cutting edge technology and the newest trends in analytics to innovate and challenge the way things are done. You’ll be exposed to some of the brightest minds in the tech industry around the globe and empowered to make your own mark!If this sounds like you and you’re ready to join our growth journey, we’d love to hear from you! Responsibilities  This role is a critical partner, leading data and analytics for complex strategic businessinitiatives. • You will be responsible for working across functional groups, self generating hypotheses via data and clearly communicating subsequent insights to senior leaders that drive business impact in a fun team environment. • You will use your business domain knowledge in combination with data and analytics to lead projects, including market/category insights, experiment design, creating dashboards, measuring business results, and analysing customer behaviour. • You will also utilise multiple analytics tools and techniques based on business requirements. Analytics expertise includes (but are not limited to) performance variance testing, funnel/journey reporting, marketing attribution models, A/B and multivariate testing, ROI measurement, statistical analysis,segmentation,and ML modeling (supervised and unsupervised). • You will also rely on strong abilities to access data from various sources, such as relational databases, distributed data sources and, third party data capture tools. • You will create analysis using visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau) to share customized insights with business and analytics partners. • You can prototype data sets used in reporting and analysis. You can also use knowledge of A/B testing to design, implement, and interpret test results using common frameworks. In addition, you will keep a pulse on emerging technologies (such as data exploration, data modeling, visualization and testing) and statistical methods that would make your work more scalable or more efficient for Intuit. • You will marshal resources and seek commitment across multiple functions (such as business stakeholders, data and analytics experts, and IT infrastructure partners) to achieve measurable business outcomes across Marketing, Sales and Operations. • You will also be expected to coach fellow analysts and stakeholders on their craft to help build a great data community and data-driven leaders.
job_description.442: About Us  Big Red Group is the leading experience network in ANZ. A powerful connector that provides experience partners with quality customers and the industry with trusted intelligence and comprehensive support.  Australian owned, Big Red Group operates respected consumer experience brands RedBalloon AU/NZ, Adrenaline and Experience OZ alongside an expansive range of B2B channels and a suite of industry products and services to support experience partners with growth and capability.  With a purpose to 'shift the way people experience life' Big Red Group are on a journey to shift the tide of consumption. Encouraging people to choose 'stories over stuff' at every opportunity. And, on track to deliver an experience every second by 2030.  The Role:  We currently have an opening for a Senior Data Analyst in our centralised data team supporting our marketing teams. This person will play a key role in enabling the marketing teams to make data informed decisions and drive growth.  What will I be doing? • You’ll work closely with Product when we build new features to ensure we are measuring the right things and build a better product that customers love to use. • You’ll support our Marketing team to understand how our marketing is impacting performance and help us to improve the way we spend our marketing dollars. • You’ll be the driving force behind our experimentation agenda by analysing how successful the experiments were and work closely with the Product team to suggest new testing opportunities. • You’ll dive into the data to support our personalisation and website optimisation teams create great customer experiences that influence our metrics that matter. • You’ll be an integral part of the team and will help to improve digital & data literacy across the business.  What are we looking for? • A keen interest in web analytics and trends in digital marketing • Experience working with web data. eg. GA, Segment, Snowplow • Experience working with performance marketing data eg. Google Ads, Facebook Ads • Experience with SQL & Data Warehouses. Eg. Snowflake, Bigquery Redshift • Experience with Reporting or Visualisation Tools eg. Tabluea, Power BI, Looker etc  What else would be of interest? • Experience with the full modern data stack • Experience with data modelling tools eg. dbt, stored procedures, Airflow • Experience with statistical analysis eg. A/B testing, T-Tests, regression • Experience with Statistical Programming eg. Python,  Why work for us? • Our dedication is to provide a workplace you choose to return every day. • Community - ESG commitment, paid community days, Fast Company 'Brands that matter', weekly Community Lunch in our offices, Volunteering • Connection - organised experiences, quarterly roadshows, offsites, social & sports events • Investing in you - 30 days work anywhere, Leadership Development, Talent Academy's, Mentors, Paid Parental Leave, Wellness support • Your Workplace - Hybrid flexible, Sydney & GC offices, 2022 AFR Best Place to Work, 2021 Australian Employer of choice, Top 20% most engaged workplaces in Australia
job_description.443: Join our dynamic and fast-growing real estate company as our Data Analyst!  We are a leading organisation in the real estate sector with an extensive franchise network across the country. Our company values excellence, teamwork, and innovation, and we are committed to fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.  We are seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our team to play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and enhance operational efficiency. You will work closely with various teams within the organisation to gather, analyse, and visualise data and provide valuable insights that inform business strategies.  Responsibilities include: • Identify data sources and gather relevant data from various internal systems and external sources. • Clean, validate, and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency, addressing any data quality issues. • Utilise statistical techniques and advanced analytics to extract meaningful insights from complex data. • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data, offering insights that support decision-making processes. • Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganising data in a readable format. • Analysing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organisation and the industry. • Preparing reports for the CEO & Head of Growth. • Provide consolidated franchise performance reports on gross numbers via CRM data. • Preparing final analysis reports for stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends.  The successful candidate will have: • Proven experience as a data analyst or in a similar role, with excellent data interpretation. • Knowledge of the real estate industry is a bonus, with the ability to understand industry-specific trends and concepts. • Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively and contribute to a positive work • environment. • Detail-oriented with an eye for accuracy and consistency. • Proactive and self-motivated with the ability to take initiative and drive projects forward.
job_description.444: How will I help?  As a Analyst within the Advanced Analytics team you will be responsible for creating and presenting analytical insights, analysing the performance of Brand & Marketing campaigns and identifying and understanding patterns and trends, to inform decision making for senior stakeholders within the leadership team. ?  Key Responsibilities Include:  Establish and sustain data pipelines for new and existing econometrics models, which includes sourcing, pre-processing and engineering data assets across the wider bank. ? Effectively translate complex modelling results into clear, actionable business insights. The findings should inform and help influence marketing strategy. ? Continually refine and adapt the existing models to ensuring its ongoing accuracy and robustness. ? Identify and leverage new statistical modelling opportunities to produce new insights for marketing and enhancing strategic decision-making capabilities.  What's in it for me?  At Westpac, we're going through significant changes, and this is an exciting opportunity to work closely with us through the next phase of transformation.  You'll play an important part in driving the future of a business that has been around for over 200 years and in return, we'll support you in the development of your career.  With continuous opportunities to learn and grow in an inclusive environment backed by a fantastic team of passionate and knowledgeable people, you'll be empowered to thrive with us.  Whatever shape your family takes, we offer generous paid and unpaid parental leave for your nominated primary and support carers. This includes leave to organise adoptions, surrogacy, and foster care arrangements.  And we continue to pay your super contributions while you take all the time you need to get your new family settled. What do I need? Statistical Programming experience in Python and/or R? Experience as a data analysis with strong capabilities (Teradata, SQL, Excel, Adobe Analytics). Detailed problem-solving skills. Data visualisation experience across Data Visualisation (PowerBI, Tableau, ThinkCell)? The ability to assist and create presentations with strong communication skills.  What's it like to work there? We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills.  As an equal opportunity employer, we're proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs. How do I Apply? Start here Just click on theAPPLYbutton. Please ensure you have spoken with your People Leader before applying.  As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.  Our people are our highest priority, and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants. #J-18808-Ljbffr
job_description.445: Avant is Australia’s leading medical defence organisation with a proud heritage of protecting Australian medical professionals for over 130 years.  Avant now represents 82,000 health practitioners and medical students across every state and territory, delivering market leading products and services to meet their professional, personal and practice needs. Building on this heritage, our vision is to be the most trusted professional partner in supporting doctors throughout their lives and careers.  As a mutual organisation, owned by members and run purely for their benefit, our members are at the centre of all we do. As well as providing products and services to our member, we play a broader community role by advocating for improvements in the healthcare system and in quality, safety and professionalism in medicine, through delivering education and research activities.  About the role:  Avant is implementing an integrated business-led data governance function that bridges the divide between business and IT, modernises processes and will be essential to ensuring we meet our strategic imperatives.  This role, reporting to the Data Governance Manager, will act as an advisory and consultative function to assist the business in identifying Critical Data Elements (CDEs) and addressing their data governance requirements.  You will support the implementation of the organisation's Data Governance Framework and standards across business functions, to build trust and value in their data. Confidence in facilitating workshops and initiating, influencing and maintaining positive productive relationships with stakeholders will be essential for success.  Within the role, you will assist Data Owners and Data Stewards understanding and alignment with the Data Governance Framework, policies, practices and regulatory obligations and guidelines relating to data such as CPG235, the privacy act, CPS230.  Key accountabilities: • Support the development, implementation and embedment of the data governance framework, including policies, standards, processes and metrics • Collaborate with key stakeholders across the business, and act as a SME, to ensure understanding and alignment Data Governance framework and regulatory obligations, standards and guidelines relating to data such as CPG235, privacy, CPS230 • Ensure consistency in data governance and management practices across Avant by maintaining a Business Glossary, Data Catalogue and Data Dictionary. • Advocate for better use of data across Avant and contribute to improving the data literacy across the business with knowledge sharing, upskilling others, facilitating governance forum meetings and assisting with projects • Coordinate and lead data quality remediation efforts, championing the management and resolution of data quality issues with operational business leads  To be successful in this role you will have: • 5+ years experience across data governance, data management or data analytics space, including implementing relevant frameworks, policies and standards • Experience in a regulated environment (financial services or insurance essential) • A solid understanding, and experience with Data Management concepts and best practices such as DCAM / DMBOK • Working knowledge of different data governance & management tools and processes • Experience working with customer data • Strong stakeholder management and ability to comfortably work and interact with senior stakeholders across a number of business divisions and domains  At Avant, our people are the centre of everything we do for our members. We offer a range of benefits and opportunities to enable you to make a difference, learn, and grow in your career.  For further information, please contact Sue Allen, Talent Acquisition Specialist on 0429 404 856.

Responsibilities : Tracking Tech Stacks + Organizational Structure Tracking Employee + Department Headcounts Tracking Pre / Post-Employee Departures Talent + Skills Mapping + Matching Qualifications Successful Data Research Analysts will have professional Boolean Search + Boolean Logic + Semantic Search experience.  Requirements : Professional experience with the following : Phrase search, Advanced search filters, Wildcard search, Proximity search, Natural language search, Search engine advanced syntax Ability to work in a 100% commission-based performance-driven environment Ability to produce 100+ profiles per week Additional Information A human will review your application and make a decision ASAP.
