job_description.447: Xpert Consulting Pty Ltd (trading as Novon) is a large Sydney based IT Services business. We operate a number of Technology centric brands including Novon , our IT Services business focused on delivering Data Transformation Services for clients large and small.  Role for a Technical BA with data management experience on a large data transformation project.  As Novon grows our Business Consulting Practice is continuing to expand and we have another opportunity for an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join our growing on-site team.  To be a part of our expert team we are searching for Business Analysts who have a strong passion for data, problem solving, delivering high quality solutions for our customers. Your first assignment within the Novon team will be working for one of our key customers who have a high profile project to uplift their enterprise data platform from on-prem for their Data.  This role will include a focus and drive for data remodelling, working closely with Product Lead, Architects and Engineers to map technical design solutions.  To Be Successful  Extensive Business Analysis skills in a Data environment  Experience working on large data/integration projects  Ability to document source data identify issues/inefficiencies in current state  Knowledge of data warehouse and data modelling principles and schema  Work very closely with senior stakeholders to design solutions  Who we are: Novon are a growing consultancy headquartered in Sydney. We are focused on building our expertise around Data, Integration and Business Consultancy and are technology agnostic ensuring that our customers get the best solution for their business. This is an exciting time to join the team, with many opportunities for you to develop outside of your comfort zone and help build a best in class consulting organisation.  Why work at Novon?  Interesting and diverse projects with customers such as large retail, investment and neo banks, transport, and government  Locally based projects for locally based consultants  Meritocracy – you are valued for how good you are and what you do, not your tenure  Regular check points and social events (currently remotely) and monthly team meetings  Value sharing knowledge and helping to build other skills and experience.  Help you grow both technical and consulting skills.  We live our values of Be Innovative, Be Humble, Be Yourself.
job_description.448: Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3 Remuneration: $122,850 - $139,559 Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ437308 Location: Cumberland Hospital  Where you'll be working Western Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) is responsible for providing primary and secondary health care for people living in the Auburn, Blacktown, and The Hills Shire, Holroyd and Parramatta Local Government Areas (LGAs) and tertiary care to residents of the Greater Western Region. We are committed to our vision of 'better health services for the people of western Sydney and beyond' and to the delivery of health care or related services in line with our core values of collaboration, openness, respect and empowerment.  What you'll be doing The primary objective of the position is to provide business analysis expertise to translate business data into meaningful insights to support informed decision making by developing innovative data analytics solutions.  The major focus of the position is to work closely with stakeholders as a project lead to manage development projects end-to-end and document and review current processes, gather business requirements, undertake business data analysis and identify opportunities for process improvement.  This role is required to liaise with stakeholders and system owners to understand reporting and analytics needs and document objectives and reporting requirements. The role also involves maintaining functional relationships with all stakeholders to gather information, understand stakeholders interests and manage expectations.  A key focus of this role is to utilise and improve agile project management framework and processes and implement change management initiatives to drive improvements in health services and patient outcomes  This role incorporates project management skills, business analysis skills, change management skills to design and implement analytics solutions.  An important responsibility is to develop and manage the implementation of HL7 (FHIR) real time data sets and other data assets for use in advanced analytics solutions.  Benefits of working for Western Sydney Local Health District • Paid Allocated Day Off (ADO) every month, in addition to your annual leave • Salary Packaging - lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees) • Meal entertainment lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees) • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional counselling and coaching service that offers confidential, short-term support for work-related and personal issues, which you and your immediate family can access • Managers Support - Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional consultative service for all managers, HR or senior staff that is confidential and unlimited for people management support • Fitness Passport - permanent employees and their immediate family members can sign-up for this affordable membership which allows access to an extensive range of gyms, pools and fitness services from multiple providers across NSW, • Generous leave conditions in accordance with NSW Health (State) awards Recognition of prior relevant service may be considered toward commencing salary • Leave may be transferrable from other public sector agencies in accordance with leave mobility provisions  People with disabilities who meet the selection criteria are encouraged to apply; and where required, WSLHD will implement reasonable adjustment consistent with industry standard.  Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal job applicants by providing information about applying for roles in NSW Health organisations. For more information, please visit Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.  Westmead hospital car parking allocation model is changing. There is a waitlist for parking for new staff commencing at Westmead Hospital. This does not apply for staff with disability.  Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.  Selection Criteria: • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or advanced degree in related discipline and/or relevant experience. Recent experience working across data or analytics focused roles utilising a consultative approach to solving business problems using PRINCE2 Agile methodology. • Strong knowledge and practical experience in working with Information Strategy, Data Governance & Architecture, Big Data & Analytics, Information Lifecycle Management, Business intelligence visualisation initiatives and experience developing software solutions is a key requirement for this position. • Strong analytical skills including the ability to analyse and interpret health information, experience in data modelling and a background of hands-on experience with ETL, database management, BI dashboards and application development. Significant experience delivering analytics and/or business intelligence projects utilising innovative thinking and the latest technology in data and analytics. • Demonstrated organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise competing demands and achieve results with a customer focused approach. • Proven application of problem-solving skills to address complex health data and analytics challenges. Proven ability to work with data architects, analysts and engineers to deliver solutions that deliver high value insights to business performance. • Demonstrated excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with extensive experience in engaging senior business stakeholders to communicate complex data and analytics concepts and ideas. • Proven effectiveness coaching and advising stakeholders, users and staff on the project management methodology, whilst always fostering a performance based and customer focused work culture. • Proven capacity to develop, implement and promote Business Analytics Services Corporate initiatives, including the capability to plan, manage change, improve performance and project manage.  Need more information? 1) Click here for the Position Description 2) Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact David Pryce on  Applications Close: 17th October 2023
job_description.449: We're seeking an experienced senior technical business analyst to join a large Datawarehouse (DWH) to the cloud migration program.  Based in the enterprise technology division this exciting position is an initial 12-month engagement starting in October 2023. A hybrid working model is supported with some days in the office required.  Key Experience: • 5+ years’ experience in a Senior Technical Business Analyst position • Experience migrating or/and involved in an implementation of an enterprise DWH to the Cloud (essential). • AWS or Azure experience is preferred • Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage with stakeholders of both technical and non-technical natures. • Experience working in Agile and Waterfall methodologies  Does this sound like you? If you have DWH and Cloud migration experience in the capacity of a Technical Business Analyst, please apply and we’ll be in touch
job_description.450: As a Sales Data Specialist you will be at the forefront of our sales analytics efforts. Your primary responsibility will be to collect, clean, and analyse sales data, providing critical insights to drive decision-making and improve sales performance. You will work closely with our Revenue Analyst to ensure data accuracy and support data-driven strategies. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive revenue growth and enhance the effectiveness of our sales operations.
job_description.451: • Part time (0.8 FTE 4 days per week) fixed term 12 months (working from home) • Opportunity to work on the development of a publicly accessible, real-time database to track developments in digital/internet policy and regulation across multiple countries • HEO 7, Base Salary $104,633 - $113,992 pro rata + 17% superannuation  About the opportunity  The Data Scientist works with the International Digital Policy Observatory, a collaboration between USyd, UNSW and UTS, on the development of a publicly accessible, real-time database to track developments in digital/internet policy and regulation across multiple countries, in order to advance the capabilities of Australian regulatory agencies, industry stakeholders and civil society to track and respond to international developments. You will apply, advise in the use of, develop and implement data science algorithms and statistical methods, to support interdisciplinary research opportunities and multistakeholder engagement, involving the use of software tools and data acquisition over Applications Programming Interfaces.  Your key responsibilities will be to: • provide data science support for projects undertaken through the International Digital Policy Observatory on behalf of the research team • support activities in the form of software application for data science and open data initiatives in alignment with FAIR Guidelines • support the identification and dissemination of research opportunities amongst the research team • develop an open software capability of use to industry, policy makers and others engaged in Australian digital policy and regulation.  Working remotely is available for this position.  About you • an appreciation of modern data science methods and familiarity with statistical or machine learning techniques • an understanding of modern data software and tools, from cloud computing to the many existing commercial products used for data analytics • demonstrated ability to organise and prioritise work, sometimes under pressure with competing priorities and sometimes limited supervision • demonstrated knowledge of modern data-centric programing languages including one of Python, R, and development languages including one of C++ or Java • excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with sound negotiating and conflict resolution skills and a demonstrated level of tact and discretion in dealing with day to day internal and external operational matters. • To keep our community safe, please be aware of our COVID safety precautions which form our conditions of entry for all staff, students and visitors coming to campus.  Sponsorship / work rights for Australia  Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  Australian Temporary Residents currently employed at the University of Sydney may be considered for a fixed term contract for the length of their visa, depending on the requirements of the hiring area and the position.  Pre-employment checks  Your employment is conditional upon the completion of all role required pre-employment or background checks in terms satisfactory to the University. Similarly, your ongoing employment is conditional upon the satisfactory maintenance of all relevant clearances and background check requirements. If you do not meet these conditions, the University may take any necessary step, including the termination of your employment.  The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.  How to apply  Applications (including a cover letter, CV, and any additional supporting documentation) can be submitted via the Apply button at the top of the page.  For employees of the University or contingent workers, please login into your Workday account and navigate to the Career icon on your Dashboard. Click on USYD Find Jobs and apply.  For a confidential discussion about the role, or if you require reasonable adjustment or support filling out this application, please contact Rae Hao, Recruitment Consultant, on 8627 0063 or by email to rae.hao@sydney.edu.au.  © The University of Sydney  The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.
job_description.452: • Permanent position - flexible with location! • Small supportive team environment where input is valid with hybrid / flexible work arrangements • Upskilling and career progression • Save on everyday purchases as part of the VenPerks; amazing discount saves at over 450 retailers, Australia-wide: Woolworths, Coles, Booking.com and Expedia - just to name a few!  Based in Brisbane, QLD or Melbourne, VIC we are looking for a talented Data & Performance Analyst to support our Defence Maintenance Contract. We are also open to applications from candidates that reside in Ventia managed Defence sites (*For more information on these sites please see the bottom of the ad).  This role will see you responsible for providing support to the Operational Excellence Team and Regional Operations in the analysis and reporting of rate of effort data, quality audits and operational / contract deliverable reports.  Responsibilities will include but are not limited to: • Working as part of a data team to collectively deliver data insights through dashboards and reports. • Responding to client needs and facilitating resolution in a timely and customer-focussed manner. • Support continuous improvement initiatives to drive efficiencies and best practice methodologies.  About You • Intermediate Microsoft suite package. • Microsoft Power Platform applications, PowerBi, SAP or similar ERP systems databases - desirable, • Experience working within Maintenance or Defence or similar - highly desirable. • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills. • High attention to detail and accuracy. • Demonstrated time management skills, multi-tasking skills, basic financial skills, and people skills.  You must be an Australian citizen and able to maintain a Defence Security Clearance.  What We Offer You  Ventia have partnered with some reputable organisations to be able to offer discounts on Health Insurance, Banking (new home loans, credit cards, everyday bank accounts), flights & accommodation, car hire, car leasing and much more, we also offer the following: • A flexible, supportive, and inclusive work environment where you matter. • We take our people's careers seriously, helping them to learn and grow. • There's nothing more important to us than keeping our people and the public safe.  About the contract  Defence Maintenance Contract (DMC) - Maintenance services provided by Joint Logistics Command play a significant role in supporting Australian Defence Force units preparing for and returning from operations and exercises. Our services will help ensure the availability and safe working order of Defence assets.  The contract includes repair and maintenance of some of Australia's newest and most advanced equipment including surveillance systems, marine craft, light armoured vehicles, and protected mobility vehicles. It also includes operation of a 24/7 nationwide vehicle and equipment recovery service.  About Ventia  Ventia is a leading infrastructure services company, operating across Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of assets that are critical to our local communities.  We pride ourselves on working smart, safely and sustainably, harnessing the latest technologies and brightest minds. With a diverse and proud heritage, we have a track record of delivering essential services to the communities in which we operate.  Diversity  We acknowledge the importance of our people's diverse experiences, talents, and cultures. Embracing diversity and creating inclusion is a key component of our talent strategy. The creation of a diverse, inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential and enhance our success.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply for this vacancy.  How to apply  If you are looking to expand your career with a business that rewards and values its employees, please apply below by clicking on the apply now button. • Amberley, Bandiana, Darwin, Edinburgh, Guildford, Moorebank, Puckapunyal, Railway East, Townsville.  Position Reference Number: 154964  Job Segment: Data Analyst, Security Clearance, Database, ERP, SAP, Data, Government, Technology
job_description.453: Description  About Ashurst Risk Advisory:  Ashurst Risk Advisory was created to respond to client demand and is designed to provide risk expertise that complement the firm's core legal services.  With dedicated teams of legal and risk professionals working side by side, it brings together the technical expertise and critical thinking required to operationalise laws and regulations and help clients to achieve their goals.  After successfully establishing the division in Australia in 2020, our now 100 strong team have developed a market leading reputation and in October 2022 expanded into the UK. To find out more please visit www.ashurst.com  About the role:  As a result of exponential growth our Data & Analytics team is looking to hire a Specialist (equivalent to a Senior Consultant in Big4 consulting) with demonstrated experience in Data Governance.  On a daily basis we work in close collaboration with teams across the Risk Advisory practise and legal teams to focus on how data can be used to deliver a best in class legal led consulting service. We combine our skills to design and deliver data-driven risk management solutions across a vast array of domains from privacy to security to financial crime to name just a few. Some of our work includes: • Assessing the maturity of data governance frameworks • Designing, implementing and embedding data governance frameworks to demonstrate compliance to data management obligations and the adequate management of data risk • Designing and implementing data quality frameworks • Working with clients to document the flow of data from the point of consumption to the point of capture • Supporting clients in the implementation of a data governance tool • Building data pipelines, reporting and governance controls to enable clients to provide and consume data through data sharing agreements • Working with clients to understand their business and data from the bottom up to drive data driven regulatory responses in relation to compliance breaches and remediation activities • Developing algorithms to identify compliance and regulatory risks in client data and use those insights to both proactively alert upon and manage and mitigate those risks using data driven solutions.  Please review the job description attached to the role on our careers site for more detail on the role and what we can offer you.  About you: • You're excited about using your data talents to help solve a diverse range of client problems with new, unique and inventive solutions, and assist in the growth of a unique and 'first to market' practice • You have experience in designing and implementing data governance frameworks • You have experience in documentation of data management policies • You have experience in implementation of data quality frameworks • You have experience in identification of Critical Data Elements, and documentation of data lineage • You have proven experience bringing high quality value to clients through developing data strategies, embedding data governance frameworks, driving insights through analytics and reporting, or creating AI/ML-backed solutions. You're also comfortable clearly communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders • You're passionate about collaborating with a multi-disciplinary team from across the firm, and have a desire to learn and grow daily • You approach challenging problems with both confidence and humility to put forward your ideas but also empathise with alternate view points • It's desirable if you're experienced and comfortable with the common tools in this space. We use a combination of Alteryx, SQL Server, PowerBI, Tableau and Python but no worries if you're not an expert in these; experience with other common analytics tools is also fine  What makes Ashurst Risk Advisory a great place to work?  We are a team devoted to collaboration, diversity, transparency and innovation. Our vision is to create a unique culture in the consulting market based around teamwork and a structure that offers everyone a voice and the encouragement to help us build the practice. Our ambition is to hire a highly diverse team combining various personalities, cultures and professional backgrounds, and offer them the opportunity to directly deal with clients, take responsibility for business development, drive their careers, and help us in defining our strategy, culture and processes.  We offer award winning Learning & Development and Diversity & Inclusion programs, and a range of benefits including, subsidised gym membership, discounted health insurance, complimentary health and wellbeing support programs, study support, annual bonuses, flexible working, and 26 weeks parental leave, to name a few. We are also committed to delivering positive impacts to our communities through our Social Impact programme, with a strong emphasis on working with First Nations people through our pro bono practice.  #Hybrid

job_description.455: Senior Data Scientist  145,000 - 150,000  Sydney  My client is an Australian boutique tech business, delivering solutions across a number of areas including environmental based initiatives.  They offer a great hybrid working arrangement (up to 4 days WFH) with diversity at its core. They have a highly collaborative team environment. The nature of the work is innovative with the opportunity to explore new solutions and methodologies to achieve the best outcome.  As the Senior Data Scientist, you will have accountability for end to end model development, from design to production and will harnessing a number of supervised and unsupervised models to do , including, but not limited to neural networks and random forests.  Key Accountabilities • Development of models using Machine learning or AI to achieve commercial insights and outcomes • Manipulating large structured and unstructured data sets working time series data, climate and geospatial data using Python • Partnering with internal ad external stakeholders to identify new approaches and solutions to enhance value • Coaching and developing more junior data scientists within the team  Your background • Proven experience in developing and running models in production at scale in a commercial environment. • Prior experience building, improving and understanding supervised and unsupervised models: neural networks, including LSTM networks, random forests. • Experience with Python (including NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, etc.) • Experience of working with climate and geospatial data highly advantageous, however not essential.  If you are interested, APPLY NOW or contact Celine Chie on 02 9270 2631 to discuss in confidence.  Reference Number: BBBH54688_169519371247470 Reference Numbe:  Contact Details: Celine Chie

And it's our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those 'what ifs' a reality. Suncorp places a strong emphasis on harnessing the potential of its data for business improvement through the Analytics, Data Science & AI Centre of Excellence.  This centre pursues a two-fold mission : firstly, by developing and integrating Data Science & AI initiatives into Suncorp's operations at scale, and secondly, by supporting strategic leaders and the broader data science community within the organization.  The Data Scientist role involves working on complex Data Science and AI initiatives that generate substantial business value, potentially including informal leadership responsibilities.  These initiatives span from prototypes to scaled data science assets integrated into core business processes. ? What you'll do Contribute to best practices and thought leadership within the Data Science & AI community Assist with the development of models and algorithms for optimal performance and risk management Be a part of our evolution of Suncorp's Data Science & AI ecosystem, including platform integration Work on technically complex AI projects with significant business impact Prototyping to fully integrated, scaled data science assets in core business processes Scaling AI initiatives and supporting data science endeavours company-wide ?  What you'll bring 2+ years of experience in Data Science, AI, or related fields is required Ability to discern current and emerging best practices, differentiating hype from efficacy Ability to use Python or large language models Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.  g., data science, machine learning, statistics, actuarial, engineering, mathematics) is mandatory Commitment to team and Suncorp Data Science & AI community success Pragmatic approach balancing technical excellence with resource constraints Proficiency in holistic data science solution design, integrating technical expertise with innovative approaches Skill in solving analytical challenges without prior patterns Knowledge and practical experience in applying diverse Data Science and AI techniques for financial services solutions Versatility across various work modes, from rapid innovation to project delivery What we can offer you A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as banking and insurance products Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave Prioritise your work / life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council
job_description.458: Job Description Flexible Location: Melbourne or Sydney 12 Month Fixed Term Contract  An opportunity for an experienced Senior Warehouse Solution Analyst to join our Retail & Consumer division, where you will provide specialised analysis, warehouse design and commercial due diligence to support the development of distribution and logistics solutions for new customers and existing warehouse operations.  Key responsibilities include: Lead and undertake warehouse design projects across a diverse range of industries Provide analytical support for warehouse design projects across a diverse range of industries Operational process flow design Provide data analysis, interpretation and insight Customer requirements gathering and analysing Cost modelling of warehouse operations Commercial data reporting and presentation Support BD team with tender preparation by providing necessary information in relation to the solution design and presentation.  Qualifications  To be successful in this role, you will need: 5 years+ working in a logistics or supply chain function. Knowledge of supply chain applications and operations of warehouse layouts and design Experience leading low-complexity projects Commercially and financially astute Knowledge of statistical methodologies Ability to appreciate the balance between commercial, operational and functional requirements Ability to work in a high pace environment, meeting deadlines and working simultaneously on multiple projects are important. Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel Degree in Engineering or Logistics Management or a related discipline from a recognised tertiary institution.

You will work with the sales team to develop client relationships and deliver data science solutions for customers across a variety of industries. Ideal candidates enjoy day-to-day data science problem-solving mixed with high levels of customer interaction.  Main requirements:  4-5+ years of real-world business experience  Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models  Strong customer interaction skills  Excellent organizational, communication, writing and interpersonal skills  Desire to enhance skills in areas of machine learning and quantitative decision making  Familiarity with a variety of technical tools for the manipulation of datasets  Up to 50% travel  Desired skills:  Experience with machine learning techniques  Fluency with scripting (Python / R)  Experience with Hadoop and related Big Data technologies  A tertiary degree in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, Data analysis)  Experience in any of the following would be great:  Distributed Systems  Cloud Computing  SAS  CRM  Machine learning  Data Mining  If this role appeals to you, don’t wait – APPLY NOW! job_description.460: Bluefin Resources has partnered with a renowned and prestigious university to seek a Senior Business Data Analyst for an initial 12-month contract. This role is pivotal as it involves contributing to a substantial ERP transformation project.  Position Purpose  The Senior Business Data Analyst will work on the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Program as part of the Information Technology Unit (ITU) and Operations Division. The successful candidate will ideally have end-to-end ERP delivery experience (including ERP System Integrator evaluation and selection experience) as a Senior Business Data Analyst or equivalent.  The Senior Business Data Analyst will work closely with internal and external senior stakeholders to drive the scoping, planning and execution of data initiatives (including but not limited to data quality assessments, data cleansing and mastering, and data extraction / transformation / loading / validation). As it is anticipated that a Systems Integrator (SI) will be appointed to deliver the new ERP platform, this role will work in conjunction with SI leaders and project teams to provide input, detailed review, and validation of deliverables produced by the SI.  The ERP program aims to deliver an integrated and standardised suite of business applications across the university, with significant change improvements and impacts to People (HR) and Finance business processes across the People and Finance Units within the Operations Division, as well as all Faculty, Research and Academic business areas.  Selection Criteria • Advanced SQL, data quality assessment and data migration experience (Min 5 years) • Extensive ERP implementation (Oracle or Workday) functional (finance and people) working experience (Min 8 years) • Experience in business analysis, process mapping, designing, and recommendations for process re-design using tools (Min 2 years) • Experience producing high quality documentation of business analysis and data discovery (Min 5 years) • Experience with Power BI including DAX (Min 2 years) • (Preferred) - Basic python data analysis skills (Min 2 years)  What's Available:  This opportunity commences as a 12 month contract, with a strong likelihood of extensions. The role is based in Ultimo, Sydney but offers the flexibility to work from home (WFH).  You'll collaborate with a team of dedicated individuals and contribute to a meaningful and fulfilling project where your impact will truly matter.  If you wish to be considered for this position, please submit your application online along with your most up-to-date resume. Alternatively, you can reach out to Lee Bartlett at 0410 744 438 for a more in-depth discussion.  IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.  http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

preferably Cloud Native Database(s) including Snowflake, Redshift and BigQuery. • Expertise in multiple relevant topics such as data warehousing, master data management, data security, information design, analytics and data science, and knowledge management • Knowledge of data management best practices, processes, tools, standards, and methodologies • Experience with Business Process Mapping and Data Flow and Data Lineage (preferable) • Knowledge of metadata management and related tools • Knowledge of mathematical foundations and statistical analysis and outstanding problem solving skills  Next Steps  If you would like to express interest in role, please click on the APPLY button now. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way.  And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. Overview of the Role:  This is your time to looking for a Sales Operations Analyst to support its Sales Strategy and Operations team in APAC. If you have a strong analytical and problem-solving mindset, are passionate about technology and changing the world and have a strong desire to create business impact through automating complex processes, this is a fantastic opportunity The APAC Sales Operations Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting the APAC Business Unit.  This role is a hybrid of traditional jobs in strategic planning, sales operations, finance, and sales analytics - requiring a mix of data analysis, sales optimization and business operational support.  This role will support the APAC sales organization and be directly involved in driving the continued success of Salesforce by supporting our growth strategy.  Sample projects range from the strategic to the tactical initiatives including supporting day-to-day operations, quarterly forecast process, territory planning, and reporting automation.  Deliverables include detailed analytic models, custom performance analysis, building an automated, scalable reporting infrastructure, and packaging findings into presentation-ready content for Salesforce executives. The role requires interaction and trust with various areas of the organization and provides exposure to senior executives.  The successful candidate will have relentless curiosity, strong problem solving skills, great interpersonal skills, and possess a passion for automating everything manual and creating innovative analysis to identify opportunities.  Responsibilities: Automate reporting and build dashboards for analysis using Tableau  Contribute to the weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecast process  Assist in developing and delivering presentations for senior executives  Support strategic initiatives such as fixing weak business areas and identifying areas of opportunity and long term strategic planning  Preferred Qualifications: 2+ years of experience in a sales strategy, data science, management consulting, finance, or product management organization  Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, synthesize information, and develop solutions  Professional experience creating Tableau dashboards. Certifications are a plus  Proven knowledge with analytics programming languages and/or database management languages including but not limited to Python, R, or SQL is a plus  Experience presenting insights to executives and non-technical audiences around analytics  Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . job_description.463: We are on search for two highly skilled Data Migration Testers to join our Migrations team located in either Melbourne or Sydney Australia!  The Migration team plays a crucial role here at FNZ, with accountability for managing the end-to-end delivery lifecycle for all Data Migration projects across the business.  Within this role you will collaborate with the wider team to ensure that the process of evaluating data before it’s moved from a source to a target system to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.  Ensuring Migration delivery is executed to a superior standard, given the complexity of the data migration aspect and the sensitive nature of the data, quality assurance is a critical component of this.  What you’ll do  Responsible for the testing and verification of our Migration process, working both independently and within a team to analyse, determine and execute internal testing requirements  You will identify and define test scenarios, test cases, and data requirements  Collaboration with the data migration team to address data migration-related defects will also be part of your responsibilities  Reviewing data mappings and architectural documentation to create and execute effective test cases  Liaise with IT development teams and test analysts to ensure that testing specifications are delivered to the highest quality  Discuss, understand, and document client data with stakeholders  Defining test coverage to minimise business risk  Generate clear and concise summaries on defects, communicate these defects to developers as well as manage and review the defect resolution process  Identify areas for test automation and develop automated test scripts as required  Our ideal candidates will have  Must have worked on major data migration projects as a Test Analyst please ensure that this is fully outlined within your resume and / or cover letter  Able to create and execute test plans using data mappings and architectural documentation  Data validation through database SQL queries  Hands on experience in ETL testing, SQL and Jira (Xray)  Minimum of 4 years testing experience within a Data migration environment  Python experience desirable  Confident, and able to take initiative given client and delivery-focused environment  Strong communication skills, confident in dealing with internal and external clients  Why should you join us?  We offer a competitive salary package and along with generous employee benefits including, 20 days annual leave plus an additional 6 days company leave following 12 months consecutive employment, full health and life insurance cover, 26 weeks Paid Parental Leave, global career opportunities, referral bonuses and more!  About FNZ  FNZ was founded with a mission to use cutting edge technology to open up wealth for end investors and business partners. That means making wealth management more accessible and personalised for all people, not just high net worth.  We believe everyone can create a better life by saving, investing, and managing their money well.  FNZ has created wealth’s growth platform a global, end-to-end wealth management platform. We have merged a modern adviser and end investor experience with sophisticated investment administration and business operations.  The platform includes app integrations, providing access to third-party, FNZ-delivered, or customer proprietary solutions.
job_description.464: • Join the Asset Modelling group at Ausgrid as we embark on our exciting transformation journey! • Permanent Full Time | $172,014-$181,807 + 15.5% Super + 1 Monthly Day Off! • Based at our Sydney CBD office | Hybrid Working  Just imagine a future where households and businesses can generate their own energy and sell it back to the grid, ultimately connecting communities and empowering lives. Are you ready to play your part in an evolving industry?  Ausgrid is on an exciting transformation journey and now is the time to be a part of something big. We are proud to service Australia’s east coast, as a leading business in energy distribution, delivering a safe and reliable electricity supply to more than 1.8 million homes – that’s over four million Australians relying on us every day.  Our vision is simple; for our communities to have the power for a resilient, affordable net zero future.  We take pride in knowing that the work we collectively achieve today, will transform the world tomorrow. We value a culture of working and living safely, being customer focussed, commercially minded, collaborative, honest, accountable, and respectful. Our values are not just initiatives driven by leaders; they define the way we work.  Meet our team!  In a world where you spend more hours a week with your work colleagues than your family, it is important to us that you thrive in the team you are in! Energise your career as part of our Asset Modelling team at Ausgrid!  By joining our dynamic Asset Modelling team, you'll be undertaking recognised (award winning) industry-leading analysis supporting our replacement programs and maintenance initiatives, all while driving growth, optimising asset and network performance, and facilitating the transition to a sustainable, net-zero future.  Take the helm in an exciting role that combines cutting-edge modelling, innovative solutions, and thrive in a team with the passion for shaping the future of our industry.  Your new role  As a Data Scientist at Ausgrid, your role is to develop processes that utilise advanced data science techniques and modern systems to analyse data and draw insights to realise business benefits and optimise the balance between asset risk, cost and performance and support the development of models that result in real world outcomes.  Alongside a high performing team of Analysts and Engineers, you will be analysing and forecasting the performance of millions of assets, through billions of calculations and integrate modern and advanced data science techniques to support the development and integration of statistical and financial models used to provide insights and facilitate risk based, and whole of life asset management decision making.  Responsibilities including but not limited to: • Integrate modern and advanced data science techniques to support the development, integration and documentation of asset life and financial models using statistical analysis techniques to assist in asset management decision making and whole of life analysis. • Undertake research and prepare functional and technical specification documentation that enables the development and production of appropriate software, technology solutions, business processes and data models to enable an efficient, repeatable and scalable implementation of these models in Ausgrid’s IT environment. • Maintain an expert level currency in quantitative and probabilistic analysis techniques and the practical application of theoretical principles to asset maintenance, replacement and the optimisation of whole of life decision making. • Provide leadership in the creation and development of innovative individual asset and portfolio level cost benefit initiatives in support of the Company Purpose objective. • In-depth understanding of data integrity issues to allow for built in levels of confidence in modelling and assurance to both internal and external stakeholders. • Establish detailed data specification documentation to define, compile and utilise asset master and transactional data to understand and optimise the balance between asset risk, cost and performance and support the development of models that align to asset class strategies and asset management objectives. • Work with stakeholders across all functions and business units to identify opportunities for leveraging company data, and model output(s) to drive optimal business solutions. • Develop processes that utilise advanced analysis techniques and modern systems to analyse data and draw insights to realise business benefits. • Prepare business cases, presentations and detailed documentation to support the introduction of new work methods, technology, models, datasets and business processes. • Provide technical expertise in the development of data architectures, models and enhancements. • Import, manipulate, conflate, and extract spatial and non-spatial data to support business objectives.  Spark our interest!  Our hiring decisions are not only based on your experience and skills, but we also take into consideration your passion, attitude, and alignment to our core values.  The successful candidate will be degree qualified (Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Spatial or Computer Science, Engineering, Finance or Economics) and able to energise us through their skills, demonstrated expert knowledge and experience in various statistical, data mining and machine learning techniques along with their strengths and weaknesses for practical implementation. You will have strong problem solving skills and demonstrated ability to critically analyse systems, processes and software tools and identify appropriate integration strategies and implement solutions, as well as: • Knowledge and experience of statistical computer languages (SAS, Python, SQL, R or equivalent) used to manipulate and transform data into information and enable useful insights to be drawn from large/small and/or technical data sets. • Experience working with and creating data structures and architectures. • Demonstrated ability to mine and analyse data, processes, and technology solutions. • Preparation of business cases, briefs and presentations and detailed documentation to support the introduction of new work methods, technology, models, datasets and business processes. • Ability to liaise with a variety of stakeholders. • High attention to detail and demonstrated personal initiative. • Skills in financial evaluation and optimisation of investment decision making. • Ability to manage multiple tasks and/or projects and prioritising activities. • Demonstrated ability to work both as part of a team and independently. • Strong communicative abilities including written and verbal presentation, negotiation and persuasive skills, and able to deal effectively at senior levels in large organisations. • Ability to create and prepare automated reports (PowerBi, SAS Visual Analytics, or equivalent) that provide validation of model inputs and forecast outputs and assurance to key business stakeholders.  Desirable • Post graduate qualifications in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer and/or Data Science, Finance, Economics or other related business discipline. • Experience and understanding of asset management principles and demonstrated experience in optimising asset risk, expenditure and performance. • Experience in spatial data analytics. • An understanding of electricity networks and related assets. • Experience in monitoring costs and financial impacts across work activities, projects or programs of work.  Grow with Ausgrid  To continue building on our rich heritage, we actively invest in our people’s development through secondments, onsite training, mentoring circles, e-learning, Australian Graduate School of Management programs (UNSW) and study assistance.  It is through our investment in our people that the average tenure across the business is 14 years and our current turnover is sitting at a market competitive rate of just 3.9%.  Ausgrid Perks  Revel in more than just a competitive salary! Our employees enjoy a dynamic range of market leading support and safety services, wellbeing programs, corporate discounts, and flexibility arrangements in many forms.  Our people are paramount to the continued success of Ausgrid, therefore celebrating great work is important to us! It’s not just the big wins that count, we have provided our employees the opportunity to applaud peer successes daily through our Amped Recognition Program. But let’s not forget the major milestones! For those ready to exceed expectations, anticipate a nomination for a CEO award at our formal end of year Award gala.  Belonging at Ausgrid  To deliver the best possible service to our customers we strive towards a workforce that reflects the diverse community that we serve. Ausgrid is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce and we encourage applications from women, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, people with disabilities, people from the LGBTQIA+ community and First Nations people.  Interested, but unsure if you’re the right match? At Ausgrid, we aren’t looking for perfect! If you would like to discuss the opportunity in more detail, please contact the dedicated Talent Advisor for this opportunity on – recruitment@ausgrid.com.au FAO Laura Brown – Senior Talent Advisor.  If you require support with your application/reasonable adjustments for the interview process, we want to hear from you.
job_description.465: Jobs - Job Details - Data Scientist  Careers at Suncorp  Take the next step. Be part of something bigger at Suncorp.  Data Scientist  Job No: 668173  Sydney - Inner Suburbs & CBD, Brisbane - Inner Suburbs & CBD, Melbourne - Inner Suburbs & CBD, Various  Permanent Full Time  IT  Pay Band 4 • Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne Location • Full-time Permanent position • 60% WFH + flexible working locations  We're never just satisfied with how things are – because we know how things could be. And it's our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those 'what ifs' a reality.  Suncorp places a strong emphasis on harnessing the potential of its data for business improvement through the Analytics, Data Science & AI Centre of Excellence. This centre pursues a two-fold mission: firstly, by developing and integrating Data Science & AI initiatives into Suncorp's operations at scale, and secondly, by supporting strategic leaders and the broader data science community within the organization.  The Data Scientist role involves working on complex Data Science and AI initiatives that generate substantial business value, potentially including informal leadership responsibilities. These initiatives span from prototypes to scaled data science assets integrated into core business processes.  What you'll do • Contribute to best practices and thought leadership within the Data Science & AI community • Assist with the development of models and algorithms for optimal performance and risk management • Be a part of our evolution of Suncorp's Data Science & AI ecosystem, including platform integration • Work on technically complex AI projects with significant business impact • Prototyping to fully integrated, scaled data science assets in core business processes • Scaling AI initiatives and supporting data science endeavours company-wide  What you'll bring • 2+ years of experience in Data Science, AI, or related fields is required • Ability to discern current and emerging best practices, differentiating hype from efficacy • Ability to use Python or large language models • Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g., data science, machine learning, statistics, actuarial, engineering, mathematics) is mandatory • Commitment to team and Suncorp Data Science & AI community success • Pragmatic approach balancing technical excellence with resource constraints • Proficiency in holistic data science solution design, integrating technical expertise with innovative approaches • Skill in solving analytical challenges without prior patterns • Knowledge and practical experience in applying diverse Data Science and AI techniques for financial services solutions • Versatility across various work modes, from rapid innovation to project delivery  What we can offer you • A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave • Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as banking and insurance products • Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs • Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave • Prioritise your work/life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council  Advertised: 05 Oct 2023 AUS Eastern Daylight Time Applications close: 26 Oct 2023 AUS Eastern Daylight Time  Don't job_description.466: • Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM  face2face reference: 591408  Location: Nationwide - Remote  Hours: Full-time  Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)  Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline  Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super  About the role:  The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.  The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.  Duties: • Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation. • Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners. • Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development. • Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques. • Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.  Required experience/skills: • Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality. • Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data. • Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes. • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders • Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.  Desirable experience skills: • Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design. • Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data. • Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields. • Experience operating in a policy environment.  If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you. job_description.467: How will I help?  As a Analyst within the Advanced Analytics team you will be responsible for creating and presenting analytical insights, analysing the performance of Brand & Marketing campaigns and identifying and understanding patterns and trends, to inform decision making for senior stakeholders within the leadership team.  Key Responsibilities Include: • Establish and sustain data pipelines for new and existing econometrics models, which includes sourcing, pre-processing and engineering data assets across the wider bank. • Effectively translate complex modelling results into clear, actionable business insights. The findings should inform and help influence marketing strategy. • Continually refine and adapt the existing models to ensuring its ongoing accuracy and robustness. • Identify and leverage new statistical modelling opportunities to produce new insights for marketing and enhancing strategic decision-making capabilities.  What's in it for me?  At Westpac, we're going through significant changes, and this is an exciting opportunity to work closely with us through the next phase of transformation. You'll play an important part in driving the future of a business that has been around for over 200 years and in return, we'll support you in the development of your career. With continuous opportunities to learn and grow in an inclusive environment backed by a fantastic team of passionate and knowledgeable people, you'll be empowered to thrive with us.  Whatever shape your family takes, we offer generous paid and unpaid parental leave for your nominated primary and support carers. This includes leave to organise adoptions, surrogacy, and foster care arrangements. And we continue to pay your super contributions while you take all the time you need to get your new family settled.  What do I need? • Statistical Programming experience in Python and/or R • Experience as a data analysis with strong capabilities (Teradata, SQL, Excel, Adobe Analytics). • Detailed problem-solving skills. • Data visualisation experience across Data Visualisation (PowerBI, Tableau, ThinkCell) • The ability to assist and create presentations with strong communication skills.  What's it like to work there?  We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we're proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.  How do I Apply?  Start here! Just click on the APPLY button.  Please ensure you have spoken with your People Leader before applying.  As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.  Our people are our highest priority, and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants.

job_description.469: As a Data Analyst in the Client Tax team , you will be responsible for supporting the client deliverable process by using data mining and data analysis skills to reconcile accounting data to tax data. We have different data views that we have to maintain for our client investment portfolios that serve different purposes. Our client portfolios may contain hundreds of lines of assets with thousands of lines of transactions going through in any given month for which many pieces of data are collected and / or generated. Different pieces of this data are used for different client requirements, however elements of this data must reconcile each month.  Working within the Fund Services division of Investor Services, you'll work close with the Tax and Accounting teams to understand their data needs and help solve data discrepancies by developing a deep understanding of our core platforms.  Our client base includes large industry superannuation funds and managed investment trusts based in Australia. The firm's Securities Services business has experienced significant growth recently due to a number of major wins and is now Australia's largest by Assets Under Custody.  Job responsibilities • Resolve monthly reconciliation breaks between tax and accounting records that involves deep analysis into large data sets, within set SLAs • Develop a deep understanding of the key team reporting requirements that help drive their data needs • Problem solve the data issues that arise from various processes that are run • Understand key processes and their potential impact to our data • Develop efficient ways and make use of available tools that enable faster data investigations • Establish and evolve the SOPs (standard Operating Procedures) for the reconciliation investigation processes that enable better transfer of knowledge • Improve processes and document • Build relationships with key internal stakeholders • Provide key input into projects as required which could include new technology, enhancements, or new products • Pass on knowledge and train others on data analysis  Required qualifications, capabilities and skills • Some understanding of tax and accounting concepts • A minimum of years' experience in a data analysis role • Strong excel skills plus experience with other tools such as Alteryx  Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills • Experience in the Funds industry is preferred

job_description.471: Design, extend & enhance data analytics, risk, order & trade capture systems in a dynamic & innovative environment. Great firm, excellent $ attached!  • Build & enhance cutting edge (trading, market) data analytics & risk platforms. • Python (Dask, Spark), C++, Hadoop, SQL/PostgreSQL, Kubernetes, AWS. • Exceptional company culture salary and benefits, Creative, Innovative firm.  Company / Team Our client is one of Australia's leading international proprietary trading firms! They have a global presence and have distinguished themselves by maintaining world class technology in an innovative and collaborative environment. They offer a range of benefits and culture that is truly unique in the Australian and even global market and due to ongoing growth, they are now looking for a like-minded Python developer to join their highly technical team.  Role You will be responsible for the design, development and testing of real-time signal generation and trade execution applications. This will see you work closely with other teammate developers and the wider business to collaborate on designing high quality, reliable / best in class solutions. The company offers a real team-centric approach to its development, so you will be able to contribute quickly to both coding and design ideas for a cutting-edge system working in the global derivatives marketplace. Requirements: • A deep knowledge of Python & experience building complex, high performance systems. • Ability to design /develop relational databases, make schema changes stored procedures (SQL/PostgreSQL). • Design / code web based apps in Python, JavaScript, HTML5/XML. • Experience delivering real-time, trading / market data, risk related systems. • Hadoop, AWS/S3, scale out frameworks (Dask, Spark). • Comfortable with Test Driven Development (TDD) and Agile Methodology. • Unix / Linux Scripting Skills. • A technology and/or finance focused degree / diploma. • DevOps, CI/CD tools (Kubernetes) • Hardware Tuning Experience (Desirable). • C++ Development Experience (Desirable). • Derivatives market knowledge (Desirable)  This role would be suited for people coming from a Web Development, Quant-Developer, Algo-Trading, Analyst Programmer, Software Engineer or Coder background from a complex environment. job_description.472: • $585 Daily INCL Super (+ laptop + training) • 12 month contract - Flexible Hybrid WFH & WFO - Sydney CBD • Global FinTech SaaS - Platform expertise ; GMP, GA4, Adobe, BigQuery Looking to join a progressive, positive and inclusive team?  Our client is the 3rd largest FinTech (SaaS) in the world and is seeking an enthusiastic Marketing Data Analyst to join their highly regarded & innovative Performance Marketing Team.  What Your Exciting Days Will Look Like • Work closely with the Performance Marketing, Mar-Tech Automation & DevOps teams to develop a holistic reporting infrastructure • Conduct deep-dive analysis on key campaign metrics across the marketing funnel; performance, market trend, audience behaviour etc • Provide recommendations to optimise future digital advertising performance to exceed business KPIs (new customer acquisition) • Map customer journey touchpoints to understand the path to conversion, and leverage attribution models to highlight each channel's value • Develop & implement concise reports & data visualisations to communicate insights to senior leaders & the broader marketing & sales teams internally What you'll bring to the team: • Advanced expertise in Quantitative data analytics within digital media advertising • Advanced experience in reporting & building dashboards that bring the customer journey to life through visual data storytelling • Platform expertise with a history of laying the necessary tracking and measurement foundations for high-quality analysis, i.e. GA4, BigQuery, GMP, CM360, DV360, SA360, GSC, Adobe, Relational databases, CRM, etc. • Experience in omnichannel campaign tracking and commercial measurement metrics (MER, nCAC, MROI, etc) • Ability to understand and draw insights from different performance attribution models • Compelling communicator with the ability to explain the ‘what’, the ‘why’ and the ‘now what' to key internal stakeholders and leadership • In-house or agency experience - a bonus if you've supported FinTech, Accounting, B2B, and/or E-comm  What's Next? job_description.473: Apply • 6 month role • Delivery of innovative solutions to information and reporting needs when raised by stakeholders • Sydney CBD location  The purpose of the Data Scientist role is to support Business to achieve high performance and maximise profitability for the Claims Contracts division. Working closely with stakeholders, the role provides data reporting and analytic support to drive the financial performance of the Claims Contracts business.  The role will provide quality performance and financial reporting, remuneration and opportunity analysis, pricing & financial support to enable the Business to: • effectively deliver against current financial objectives, while meeting or exceeding the needs of our customers; • achieve industry leading claims performance and maximise remuneration; • grow the portfolio and improve profitability.  What you'll do (not limited to): • Build performance reporting using complex data structure • Leveraging good understanding of the remuneration model and portfolio/scheme performance to provide regular performance reporting that drives and improves portfolio performances. • Communicate remuneration results & key drivers that impact portfolio performance. • Challenge and analysis of claims performance using data analytic to enable improvements of portfolio performance. • Work closely with Claims Team to identify poor performing segments that warrant a deeper investigation of drivers of performance where needed • Develop and improve performance reporting to meet requirements under new contract with icare.  What you will bring: • Highly experience in dealing with complex data structure and data analytics, data scientists skills preferred • At least 3 years' experience in using either SAS, SQL or R , Excel and any data analytic tools • Relevant general insurance or Personal Injury Claims business experience is preferable • Strong data analytic and programming skills desired • Degree in Business, Commerce, Statistics, Actuarial or other relevant field is mandatory.  What's in it for you: • Competitive salary package • Discounts of up to 25% on our various Insurance, Banking & Superannuation products • Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance • Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing) • We offer support and various programs for our people: (Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program, Facilities for nursing mothers, Company share options, Social club, Years of Service Recognition).  What you will love about working with us:  Better outcomes for customers takes innovation, care and a laser focus. As part of the Suncorp Group, we're the go-getters working at the heart of some of Australia and New Zealand's most trusted names in banking and insurance to deliver just that - and then some. Here, you'll be equipped with all kinds of support and opportunities to make an impact, because our commitment to brightening lives extends to all our incredible people too. And in an organisation that measures success through the results we deliver for our customers, communities and each other, you'll thrive knowing you're making a genuine difference along the way. job_description.474: At TMGM, we believe that data is the lifeblood of our business. We are seeking an experienced and visionary Head of Data and Analytics to lead our data and analytics team, transforming raw data into valuable insights, driving informed decision-making, and contributing to our company's success.  As the Head of Data and Analytics, you will lead our data team responsible for managing the operational data of the entire group, as well as analyzing customer transaction data. You will be responsible for establishing and maintaining databases tailored to our company's growth needs and providing critical reports to various functional departments to support strategic decision-making.  Key Responsibilities:  Data Strategy and Leadership: • Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy to align with business objectives. • Provide leadership and guidance to the data and analytics team.  Data Analysis: • Analyze large-scale datasets to extract valuable insights and trends. • Create advanced data models and algorithms to support decision-making.  Reporting and Visualization: • Develop and maintain reports and visualization tools for various stakeholders. • Ensure timely delivery of accurate and actionable reports.  Database Development: • Establish and maintain databases to support the company's growth requirements. • Ensure high performance, availability, and security of databases.  Data Governance: • Develop and enforce data governance policies and standards to maintain data accuracy and integrity.  Team Management: • Lead and mentor members of the data analysis and reporting team. • Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment.  Stakeholder Collaboration: • Collaborate with various functional departments to understand business requirements and provide data-driven solutions. • Communicate insights and recommendations to senior leadership.  Continuous Improvement: • Identify opportunities to optimize data analysis processes and tools. • Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging trends.  Requirements • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, statistics, information technology, or related field; advanced degree preferred. • 10+ years or more of experience in data analysis, reporting, and data modelling. • Proficiency in data visualization tools and technologies. • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. • Proficient in programming languages and data technology. • Prior leadership experience with the ability to manage and motivate teams. • Excellent communication and presentation skills. • Collaboration skills to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels. • Experience in data governance and data quality management.  Benefits  Fostering a collaborative, open environment that's conducive to employee success is the #1 priority at TMGM. • Growth Opportunities - We value your growth as much as we do ours, so we include educational and career growth opportunities at every level. • People-First Values -We believe building a great company happens by hiring great people. Our employees' job satisfaction always comes first. • Shared Success - We offer revenue share opportunities for the right people, allowing our employees to share in company success. • Worldwide Team - Our worldwide team means you'll work with others from all over the globe and gain international experience.

job_description.480: Employment Type: Permanent Full Time  Position Classification: Health Mgr Lvl 1  Remuneration: 81581 - 108532 full time equivalent base salary range (excludes super, leave loading and salary packaging)  Hours Per Week: 38  Requisition ID: REQ436037  Sydney Children's Hospitals Network is the largest paediatric health care entity in Australia. We care for thousands of children each year in our hospitals and in their homes - with one purpose in mind - to help young people live their healthiest lives.  Click here to learn more about our Network  What you'll be doing  This dynamic and fast paced Data Analyst role, which is part of the Costing and Analytics Team, will be responsible for the provision of data and analysis to support the clinical & non-clinical functions of the Network, such as Activity Based Funding (ABF) analysis (e.g. unwarranted clinical variation), key performance indicators (KPIs), clinical service planning, and clinical redesign projects.  Components include: • Comprehensive understanding of data related concepts, including relational database theory & SQL programming. • Provision of accurate, timely & relevant data analysis, interpretation and reports to internal & external stakeholders. • Evaluate and benchmark SCHN performance. • Measure and report against Service Level Agreement (SLA) KPIs. • Develop an understanding of ABF and clinical costing principles and processes.  Overall, the team is responsible for the Activity Based Management, Patient Level Costing, Reporting and Analytic functions for the Network, which supports SCHN staff in the use & interpretation of data results used in the decision making processes for the organisation.  Selection Criteria • Relevant tertiary qualifications in health informatics, information management, Computer Science/Statistics, or related field; or equivalent extensive experience. • Experience in SQL, (preferably SSMS (SQL Server Management Studio), or advanced skills in MS Access) and MS Excel/VBA, with a demonstrated high level analytical skills using multiple data sources and the ability to manipulate large amounts of data. • Highly developed analytical and numerical skills. Experience using R and python would be an advantage, but not necessary. • Ability to simplify complex concepts & interpret information by explaining in simple terms and contextually apply results to solve business problems to influencing & negotiate successful outcomes. • Excellent interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to employ a variety of communication skills (both in written & verbal form) tailored to the audience. • Solid work ethic. Able to self-direct, prioritise workload, meet deadlines & manage expectation with minimal supervision, escalating issues as required. • Able to innovate & think laterally to proactively prove & evolve work effort & contribution.  SCHN is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity - we acknowledge the vibrancy that a diverse workforce brings to enhance both our workplace culture and our service delivery to children, young people and their families and carers. We encourage all suitably qualified applicants to apply. If you identify as an Indigenous Australian or as a person with a disability, please contact us if you would like some more information about our recruitment process.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. We recognise the value of Aboriginal staff providing health care to Aboriginal children and families that access the services we provide at the Sydney Children's Hospitals Network. Aboriginal job applicants are encouraged to visit the NSW Health Aboriginal Recruitment tool, Stepping Up to assist in preparing your application.  All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course (2 doses) of a COVID-19 vaccine which has been approved or recognised by the Therapeutics Goods Administration (TGA). New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health, or provide an approved medical contraindication certificate (IM011 immunisation medical exemption form) certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW.  Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations.  Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.  Need more information?  1) Click here for the Position Description  2) Find out more about applying for this position  For role related queries or questions contact Micheline Maddaford on micheline.maddaford@health.nsw.gov.au  If you are Aboriginal or Torres Strait islander wishing to apply for this role and want to speak with an Aboriginal person/representative from the Sydney Children's Hospital Network please contact Wayne Dargan on 0486012545.  For technical support please contact the customer services team on 1300 679 367 and select option 3.  Applications Close: 19/10/2023
