job_description.482: Take a quick look at how you can get the most out of the new experience. Senior Data ScientistSave Share job Date posted Aug 24, 2023 Job number 1612086 Work site Up to 50% work from home Travel 0-25 % Role type Profession Research, Applied, & Data Sciences Data Science Employment type Full-Time OverviewOur SharePoint Data Science team is actively looking to hire a Senior Data Scientist to join our team.  The SharePoint Data Science team's charter is to foster a data-driven culture, ensuring that all key product decisions are informed by data.  Our team works closely with PM, engineering, marketing, user research, design, and business leaders to identify opportunities for improving the customer experience and accelerate our business's growth in support of this mission.  We analyze historical data to understand salient trends, deliver standardized views of business performance, develop models to predict performance, recommend actions to be taken, and run experiments to prove that desired outcomes are being achieved. Our product space includes SharePoint, Viva Connections, Viva Topics, Viva Amplify and Microsoft Syntex .  This is a unique opportunity to bring your knowledge of enterprise software offerings, as well as your understanding of data science methods and best practices, to help Microsoft deliver the best experience possible for our customers and partners.  You will be joining a group of experts on the front lines of synthesizing vast customer purchase and engagement behavior data sets into targeted recommendations for addressing real-world business challenges at scale. Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.  As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals.  Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. QualificationsRequired Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 5+ years data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 3+ years data-science experience (e.g. , managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)  OR Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 1+ year(s) data-science experience (e.g. , managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results) OR equivalent experience.  Preferred Qualifications  5+ years leveraging passion for and understanding the need to deliver the right business impact by working with stakeholders to turn business problems into data analysis questions and unearthing deep insights from data. Have a track record of innovative thinking and problem-solving skills using Big Data. Have the ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data. 5+ years leveraging the practical uses of statistics ( i.e. experimentation, statistical modeling) Professional experience with large-scale computing systems like Hadoop, MapReduce, and/or similar systems. 5+ years of professional experience in SQL, R, Python, or related tools for large-scale analysis. Ability to convince others of their ideas and communicate complex analysis & insights to a non-technical audience.  Data Science IC- The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $112,000 - $218,400 per year.  There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $145,800 - $238,600 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation.  Find additional benefits and pay information here: Work cross functionally to translate business problems into ones that can be solved and informed by data analysis. Have curiosity and apply analytical skills to dive deep into data to find key insights that impact the business. Develop models of usage, user behavior & business behavior to make recommendations and influence the product road map. Work with other teams across Microsoft to develop key metrics to achieve business outcomes. Be a champion of AB testing. Design, execute and analyze experiments to prove product change attribution. Utilize tools like SQL, R, Python to execute analyses.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. Industry leading healthcare Educational resources Discounts on products and services Savings and investments Maternity and paternity leave Generous time away Giving programs Opportunities to network and connect Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. job_description.491: The role  As a Market Analyst, you will be required to: • conduct surveillance and technical analysis to identify, investigate and take action against signs of market misconduct such as insider trading, and market manipulation • undertake monitoring and surveillance using surveillance and database systems to interrogate large data sets • undertake work with varying levels of complexity and sensitivity and make sound regulatory judgements • proactively identify emerging issues and systemic risks and develop strategies to address them • undertake complex research and provide advice on derivative trading regulatory issues • provide subject matter expertise and advice on policy issues relating to trading in derivative markets • engage with market intermediaries to ensure their compliance with the law, Australian financial service licensee obligations and ASIC's market integrity rules • assist with enhancement of surveillance functionality and team processes • participate in multi-skilled project teams, including actively sharing knowledge with other team members where appropriate  About you • Relevant tertiary qualification(s) • Demonstrated technical understanding of the Australian financial system and knowledge of ASIC's regulatory function • Understanding of the role of surveillance and enforcement relating to ASIC's Market Integrity Rules, the Corporations Act and Australian Financial Services Licensee obligations • Financial markets experience in fixed income, currency and/or commodities • Demonstrated analytical, investigative research and presentation skills • Experience in providing strategic and technical advice on matters relating to the conduct and regulation of markets and intermediaries • Professional experience from within a front office or risk management role will be highly regarded • Experience working with large data sets and trade surveillance functionality will be highly regarded
job_description.492: Are you passionate about utilising data analytics to drive business decisions and enhance customer experiences? Do you want to be a part of a company that believes in "progress for humanity" and is committed to providing the best in modern mobility solutions?  About the Role:  As a Data Analyst in the Digital, CX, CRM & Marketing team, you will play a crucial role in supporting and assisting the organisation with data-driven insights and reports. Your focus will be on delivering high-level and detailed visibility on key metrics related to digital, campaign, CRM, and customer experience touchpoints. Your expertise in data storytelling will help guide business decisions and optimize existing customer touchpoints, web development initiatives, and Conversion Rate Optimisation (CRO) efforts.  Key Responsibilities: • Develop an overarching reporting framework for digital, campaign, CRM metrics, and customer experience touchpoints. • Support the creation of BX (Brand Experience) and CX (Customer Experience) touchpoints reporting & insights framework. • Educate stakeholders on data, insights, and reporting, ensuring its successful implementation across the organisation. • Create reports and set up dashboards using Business Intelligence tools, integrating relevant data sources. • Collaborate with agency partners to leverage Google 360 data stack and the Customer Data Platform (CDP) for data-driven insights. • Identify and drive the implementation of additional data connections into the CDP across technology stacks. • Lead Digital and CRM stakeholders and agency partners in establishing and maintaining an overarching reporting & insights framework. • Develop a strategy to aggregate reports on standard website metrics and user testing to improve website CRO. • Review campaign performance agency reports and generate customer behavior insights and conversion funnels to measure media impact. • Collaborate with stakeholders across the business to optimise Customer Experience (CX) and engagement funnel touchpoints.  Key Skills and Requirements: • University degree in Data Analytics & Insights, Marketing, Digital Marketing, CRM analytics, or a related field. • 3 - 5 years of experience in Digital, web, and CRM data analytics and insights generation. • Excellent experience with Power BI or related Business Intelligence platform and building dashboards from scratch. • Experience or understanding of setting up a framework for leading and lagging Digital and CRM indicators and metrics. • Proven understanding of digital, CRM, and media customer touchpoints and their measurements. • Strong ability to deliver data-driven insights and compelling data storytelling. • Excellent skills in planning, prioritisation, and identifying new customer segments. • Ability to work in complex stakeholder and agency environments.  Desired Experience: • Utilisation of marketing tech stack including Power BI and Salesforce CRM/ Marketing Cloud and Google Analytics (360) experience • Conducted analysis of channel and social media performance • High-value customer products industry experience (B2C).  To Apply:  Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and achievements. APPLY NOW! For further information please contact Sharon Henderson on 0413 13 11 24

job_description.494: VGW is a fast-growing technology company and creator of market-leading online social games. With offices across Australia, USA, Canada, Malta and the Philippines we are on a mission to be the biggest gaming company in the world!  We have a brand new role for a BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team.  As the BI Analyst you will support the BI team's ability to be proactive by leading the creation of data assets to be used as building blocks for our newly developed framework and promoting the BI team's policies and procedures across the organisation.  Note: This is a hybrid role to based in either our Sydney or Perth office location.  Key responsibilities will include: • Support the creation of the new target state framework and governance for end-to-end reporting, tooling integration and self-service BI products • Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy by updating and classifying terms and metrics • Create new reports and retrofit existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI-related products to the new state • Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW’s Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation • Create supporting documentation that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across VGW • Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework and governance • Work closely with business users to understand their data and reporting needs • Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve • Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW’s Data Catalog and BI’s new processes and procedures  What you will bring to the role: • A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence. • 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries. • Business acumen • Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams. • Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques  About VGW  VGW has been disrupting the online gaming world since 2010 and we're only getting started. We've assembled an incredibly talented global team who bring their passion, energy and expertise to build games that people love.  At VGW, we have a modern approach to getting work done and a focus on creating an environment where amazing people can do amazing work. That means giving you the flexibility you need, providing spaces that will keep you comfortable and finding opportunities for you to keep learning and growing.  Find out more at www.vgw.co  If you want to join a team that does things differently apply today and we look forward to seeing what you can bring to our team.  Why VGW?  We are on a huge mission to become the biggest gaming company in the world. As we grow to meet this goal, we need talented people rich in diversity to propel us forward. We truly believe the right mix of diversity and authenticity will be our winning hand.  We are committed to creating a diverse, engaging and inclusive culture for our people to shine, with a workplace that honours your experiences, perspectives, unique identity and passions. For those reasons, we encourage you to browse our employment opportunities and apply today. Please let us know of any accommodations you may need during the application process.  Privacy Policy
job_description.495: Job Description  Job Title:  Senior Data Scientist - Mathematical and Statistical Modeling with Bayesian Optimisation Expertise  About Us  Join a trailblazing leader in the world of programmatic advertising, dedicated to delivering highly targeted and effective advertising solutions to their clients.  We are seeking a skilled and passionate Data Scientist with expertise in mathematical and statistical modeling, as well as Bayesian optimisation and diagnostics, to join this dynamic team. If you are enthusiastic about harnessing data-driven insights, Bayesian optimisation, and diagnostics to optimize programmatic advertising campaigns, we want to hear from you!  Job Description  As a Data Scientist specialising in mathematical and statistical modeling, with a focus on Bayesian optimisation and diagnostics, you will play a pivotal role in refining our advertising strategies through data analysis and predictive modeling.  Key Responsibilities • Utilise mathematical and statistical modeling techniques, including Bayesian optimisation, to analyse large-scale advertising datasets. • Develop predictive models to optimise programmatic advertising campaigns, including ad targeting, bidding strategies, and ad creatives, while leveraging Bayesian techniques for efficiency. • Collaborate closely with data engineers and analysts to gather, clean, and preprocess advertising data. • Assess and validate the accuracy and reliability of predictive models, using Bayesian diagnostics for model evaluation. • Translate complex modeling insights, Bayesian optimisation results, and diagnostic findings into actionable recommendations for campaign optimization. • Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders using data visualization and clear reports.  Qualifications • Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or related disciplines. • Demonstrated experience (3+ years) as a Data Scientist or similar role with a specific focus and expertise in Bayesian methodology and diagnostics. • Proficient in programming languages such as Python, SQL etc • Strong command of data analysis and machine learning libraries (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch). • Understanding of statistical concepts and techniques, including A/B testing, attribution modeling, and customer segmentation. • Ideally experience with programmatic advertising platforms, tools, and technologies, though not mandatory. • Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to tackle complex, open-ended challenges. • Excellent communication and collaboration skills for effective teamwork with cross-functional teams. • Detail-oriented with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.  Benefits • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. • Flexible work hours and options for remote work. • Professional development opportunities and training programs. • An innovative and collaborative work environment. • The chance to work on cutting-edge programmatic advertising campaigns that impact the industry.  If you would like to hear more about this position or other Data Science related opportunities, please call Greg - 0487848404 or email me your resume greg@theonset.com.au

You can send me your resumes/referrals at supriya.thorat@itbility.com.au  Experience  • Proven experience with logical and physical data modelling in complex environments - spanning Hadoop, No SQL and Teradata  • Experience leading Data Modelling teams delivering to multiple complex programs  • Familiarity with Data Modeler tools  • Financial Industry experience is highly regarded.  • Agile development methodology  • Experience as a data analyst user and a range of reporting tools an advantage. Working with business user representatives to translate their requirements into robust data structures in the EDW and Data platforms. The role will also need to support the overall Westpac data management agenda of data lineage transparency and data quality enhancement.  Few more points:  Data Modeler with Banking domain experience will be added advantage.  Metadata management and data cataloguing experience • Experience in Azure is good, not mandatory  All candidates should have full working rights in Australia.  Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for this role.  To apply, please submit your resume ASAP for immediate consideration or email supriya.thorat@itbility.com.au
job_description.497: About Us  Endeavour Group was created in 2020 through the restructure and merger of the Woolworths Group drinks and hospitality businesses. With a strong track record of growth, combined these businesses form the leading customer franchise in drinks and hospitality in Australia.  United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’, we are a 28,000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally, including leading brands such as Dan Murphy’s, BWS and ALH Hotels.  Endeavour Group separated from Woolworths during calendar year 2021 and is well-positioned as an ASX Top 50 Company. Join the team at an exciting time in their evolution!  About The Opportunity  This is a 12 month fixed term contract.  As part of the Data Governance & Privacy team, this role will play a critical part in implementing a robust data governance framework across Endeavour Drinks Group.  With an increasing focus across the group on the use of data to empower decision making and uplift revenue, this role performs a critical function to ensure better understanding, quality, and governance of data.  Drive the delivery of data governance across Endeavour and work with the data governance & privacy team to develop and execute a strategic road map to ensure our data is safe and trusted.  A day in the life of a Data Governance Analyst @ Endeavour ... • Create and conduct governance processes to measure data management and data quality maturity across various domains • Create, update & support policies, standards, and processes related to data management, quality, access, and security are followed in all environments. Create repeatable data management processes within Data Governance & Data Ingestion space • Work with stakeholders to understand, prioritise, and document business and technical needs, and to ensure alignment with DG strategy • Support the implementation of a new data lineage, metadata & reference data management framework and technology solution in partnership with IT. Utilise this solution to identify, initiate and champion improvements in data quality, sustainability and security. • Support the requirement to ensure Endeavour data assets are classified, certified and prioritised to enable our community of users to trust the data they use in their decision making processes. • Work to uplift the group-wide Endeavour data culture and capabilities, alongside other members of the data and Analytics team, • Contribute to the management of a portfolio of data governance initiatives for Endeavour. This includes the development of concepts, business cases, project planning, and delivery. • Improvement in Endeavour data governance framework capability maturity assessment. • Stay abreast of regulatory change and how this may impact on data governance and assist in appropriate responses across Endeavour • Data governance adoption and embedding (governance forums attendance, deliverables, outcomes). • Strength of critical relationships with the group data governance team and Endeavour Stakeholders. • Project initiatives delivered on time, within budget, to agreed scope, with positive stakeholder feedback  What You'll Need To Succeed • 5+ years of experience in a data governance analyst and/or project management role in a data or risk related role within a large organisation or consulting firm. • Experience in implementing frameworks, policies, processes, and transformational agendas in large organisations. • Hands on experience using data governance tools including; Collibra or Ataccama is an added advantage. • Hands-on experience managing enterprise cloud data platform including; GCP or Azure (bigquery, data loss prevention, data catalogue & cloud IAM) an added advantage • Demonstrated experience working in an Agile project delivery model environment. • Eagerness to work in a fun, dynamic, and fast-paced environment. • Exposure to data governance, data information security practices, and cloud databases.  What's in it for you? • Excellent remuneration package and flexible working in every sense. We value our people • Everyday Rewards plus card - access exclusive employee discounts across Woolworths, BigW and Endeavour Group brands (BWS, Dan Murphy’s etc) and 50% off food at ALH venues. • Our innovative ways of working include headspace mornings once a month (no meetings company-wide), opportunity to partner alongside bright minds and genuine investment in leading technologies • Paid learning & development opportunities • Career progression to help you realise your potential. As our business grows so do the opportunities for our people • Access to our Endeavour Group Employee Share Scheme! • Wine education: Bronze, Silver & Gold certifications • Work with an industry-leading team and be a part of one of the most exciting retail transformations in Australia  Grow with Endeavour Group  Bring your spark. Tap into our spirit. That’s the power of Endeavour.  If you want to experience the diverse spirit of drinks and hospitality businesses, here you can tap into Australia’s leading brands including Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH, Pinnacle Drinks, Endeavour X and more.  If you have a passion for connecting people with products they love, here you can join an industry that’s deeply embedded in the way Australians socialise, unwind and celebrate.  If you want access to a breadth of career opportunities, here you can enjoy a path that travels between diverse roles and businesses within the Group.  If you’re already asking ‘what’s next for me’ and our industry, here you’ll thrive.  If you want to bring your full self to doing fulfilling work, here you’ll find a culture that’s welcoming, inclusive and responsible.  If you are looking for flexibility, here we encourage our team members to work in ways that meets their work / life commitments and supports their wellbeing.  Come grow with Endeavour where we are passionate about our purpose of creating a more sociable future together, and leaving a positive imprint on our team members and the communities we serve.  If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.  You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au #EDG #EGL  Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Duties • Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion. • Analysing current and past financial data • Looking at current financial performance and identifying trends • Preparing reports on the above information and communicating the insights of these reports to the wider business • Suggesting budgets and improvements based on the above information • Developing financial models and providing financial forecasts • Developing initiatives and policies that may improve financial growth • Exploring different investment opportunities • Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary. • Consulting with the management team to develop long-term commercial plans • Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets. • Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines. • Helping develop reports and analysis. • Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata. • Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements. • Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization. • Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems. • Generating reports from single or multiple systems. • Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports. • Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems. • Training end-users on new reports and dashboards. job_description.501: We are looking for a talented and experienced manager to lead a high-calibre and growing team in planning, implementing and managing the ACMA's data governance lifecycle. Your mandate encompasses the full range of data governance activities including data quality, privacy, security and compliance policies, supporting analytics, data usage and metadata management.  You will be in your element managing a multi-faceted change plan which will include: • providing data governance support for the progressive deployment of advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and machine learning • an evolving 'hub-and-spoke' model with a focus on building data governance capability at all levels of the organisation • embedding and integrating data governance into a fast-paced whole-of-Agency digital transformation program • working across government to promote and support data sharing opportunities. job_description.503: Prior experience as an analyst or data scientist, working directly with database-level data, whether formally or self-taught.  The company is seeking a Data Scientist to build with us and our community. Come contribute to our growing body of tools, research, and IP that make blockchain and crypto data more accessible.  Who You Are  You love data and stats. You know some formal statistics, ML, and data exploration techniques, even better if you’ve done network analysis.  You love crypto and DeFi, know the difference between hodling, staking, and yield farming, and you have used both Ethereum and other chains.  You are self-directed. You are insatiably curious. You can be counted on to work through a project, commit and go deep while seeking help when you need it, and propel it forward without hand-holding.  You are fastidious and meticulous in your work. You will put in the time to make an order from chaos. You’ve looked into the eye of Sauron and lived to make a graph. You don’t mind doing the “grunt work” to build up to the full picture, or go as low as it takes? Muckraking? More like fun-making.  You're creative and you aren't afraid to be wrong.  ❄️ You are super comfortable in SQL-like databases (we use Snowflake)  ®️ You are intimately familiar with R for analysis, exploration, and model-building. And you have an opinion about data. table vs dplyr. Python is OK too, but we have a lot of R code, so you need to be comfortable there.  ️ You take pride in your code. It's readable, functional, and reproducible. You commit regularly for all the right reasons.  You can describe a complex problem (or solution) in a way that doesn't put people to sleep and doesn't leave them scratching their heads.  What You'll Work On  Work directly with the company's community, our internal analytics & data platform teams.  Collaborate with other data scientists and analysts to explore, visualize, and validate our data.  Work closely with our marketing team to share what we learn with the world, and educate anyone who wants to learn more.  Support the efforts of our product teams to help transform our apps into more data-driven, web3-connected, powerful experiences for our growing base of thousands of users.  Desired Experience  Experience with Crypto/Blockchain is a requirement.  Prior experience as an analyst or data scientist, working directly with database-level data, whether formally or self-taught.  At least 2 years in a formal data science role, ideally working primarily in R  Experience working with product & marketing teams, developers, and data engineers  Make sure to follow us here to get our most live jobs https://www.linkedin.com/company/cryptorecruit  Cryptorecruit are the worlds leading specialist recruiter for the blockchain/Cryptocurrency industry. We recruit positions from CEO,CTO, Project Manager, Solidity developer, frontend and Backend Blockchain developers to marketing/sales and customer service roles. Please browse our website and at www.cryptorecruit.com to search all our job vacancies.
job_description.504: Why join us? • #1 performance agency in APAC according to Campaign Asia and voted Australia's best Performance Agency by AOY awards 2022 • One of the largest global performance marketing agencies, 3,000+ experts in 68 countries to connect with • Access to progressive leave policies such as Leave+, birthday, anniversary, and leading parental leave policies • A hybrid working model with opportunities for global transfers, internal secondments, and travel. • Reprise for Good: 2x paid volunteering days per year for all APAC team • L&D programs for leadership development, technical courses, and certifications • Wellness programs including access to an EAP and wellness coaching • Agency perks, early finish Fridays, culture club, breakfast, health and wellbeing initiatives.  As the Analytics Manager you will have a key influence in delivering Reprises Analytics Product offering. You will deliver best in class analytics and statistical principles to obtain and collect data across key platforms including Excel, Big Query, GA4, GA360, GTM and Adobe Analytics. This role will partner with our Performance Directors, and our other Product (Craft) teams, to ensure that our clients receive comprehensive data collection plans, streamlined tagging implementation services, strategy analysis and data visualisations to meet their strategic objectives.  About the role: • Work with the Analytics Lead to design and deliver innovative solutions for clients from scoping to execution • Implementation and testing of tags through tag management platforms (GTM) and providing recommendations around the best practises • Ensure client’s data is reliable, actionable and valuable across client business • Managing project timelines and work with Performance Directors to ensure timely and quality work is delivered to clients. • Keeping up to date with industry trends and providing internal POV (Point of View) pieces • Lead client engagement to scope analytical solutions including but not limited to custom measurement frameworks, attribution modelling, predictive modelling, dashboarding, etc. • Leverage statistical models to analyse and determine media/marketing and business performance projections to inform business investment decisions • Assisting in new business pitches/presales activities • Design and deliver with the Analytics Lead, internal training & development programs so that we’re leveraging efficient/best practice usage of analytical tools. • Closely collaborate with other crafts (products) like SEO, Media, and Marketing to make a stronger business impact.  About you: • 3+ years proven experience as a data analyst in a commercial environment • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy • Essential experience in GA360, GA4, GTM (Google Tag Manager), Google Data Studio • Big Query and GCP experience will be an additional advantage. • Good to have thinking around attribution and modelling (beneficial but not required.) • Experience with implementing, auditing, and using GMP (Google Marketing Platform) stack. • Experience with Adobe Analytics, SQL, R and/or Python is beneficial though not necessary  Who we are:  Reprise Digital is the world’s largest performance marketing network. We provide comprehensive digital solutions by reimagining performance marketing in line with customer behaviours so that our audiences are interacting with personalised and dynamic content.  Reprise Australia is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.
