job_description.506: About Blunomy:  Blunomy is an international strategy consulting firm, dedicated to accelerating the move towards a regenerative society that is decarbonised, circular and inclusive. We do this by partnering with those in the energy supply chain, as well as financial institutions, business and entrepreneurs to ensure the transition of their resources from brown to green.  We have been operating since 2007, previously trading as Enea Consulting, and continue to expand our international team of Blunomists. Our high performing, multidisciplinary team are based across 6 offices: Melbourne, Sydney, Paris, Singapore, Hong Kong and London. We come from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences, are open minded and focused on the future, united by shared values and are passionate about sustainable development and energy access.  We are looking for a passionate, engaging and ambitious Manager, Data Science to join our team in either Melbourne or Sydney. We invite all of those who want to break the mold to join us to get change done!  About the role:  Data analytics in the energy and climate space is growing at an incredible rate. Blunomy provides data-based solutions to support the energy industry, financial institutions and supply chains through their digitisation, decentralisation and decarbonisation transitions. Our tools support improved energy market operability, automation and planning. We are also developing digital solutions that better measure impact and transition speed, to help decarbonise financial resources.  We are looking for someone who is passionate about energy, climate change and data analytics to do-well-and-do-good by delivering data science products to crack transition challenges. As a Manager, you will be responsible for: • Identify and pursue new business opportunities for the data science team • Managing the end-to-end delivery of the project • Engaging and communicating with the client • Anticipating and managing project risks, timelines, and budget • Managing and leading analysts and senior analysts  In this setting, you will be exposed to the diversity of current energy challenges, leveraging your data and analytical skills to address them. We are always growing the products we deliver but over the last 12 months we have delivered: • Load forecasting: model and predict the evolution of the load on the electrical network. Use machine learning, data analytics and a fair amount of software development to forecast long-term energy consumption, daily energy profiles and Distributed Energy Resources (Electric Vehicles, Battery, Solar PV). • PV connections approval tool: dynamically model the energy network bringing together power flow modelling and machine learning to determine the PV hosting capacity of the local area. Used in production to approve hundreds of PV connection requests a day. • Vegetation management using LiDAR: collect three‑dimensional images of the local network gathered by drone or helicopter. Use machine learning and geometric models to detect and manage vegetation near powerlines. • Bushfire risk modelling: model and compute the network‑related bushfire risk based on fault ignition likelihood. Calculate the consequences of bushfires such as property damage or agricultural loss. • Low-Voltage network mapping: identify errors within the current mapping of the low-voltage network, especially targeting customers whom connection to the network has not been properly recorded. This was performed using outlier detection with out-of-bag predictors.  Depending on the objectives, projects will entail tasks of varying nature. Your first focus will be on projects requiring data analytics capabilities.  About you:  We are looking for a motivated, experienced and passionate person to join our growing team. The right person will have some of the following, and a willingness and ability to learn the rest. • You are passionate about the energy transition and climate change, with a strong interest for energy, environment and/or sustainable development. • Familiarity with Australian energy sector policy, regulation and commercial trends and market dynamics • Knowledge of key industry players and competitors, and demonstrated experience in business development, with a proven track record to identifying, pursuing and winning new opportunities within the sector. • Background in data science or data analytics • Bachelor or Master’s degree in a relevant discipline such Computing Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Energy Systems or Engineering • Functional skills: good verbal and written communication, networking skills, critical thinking, comparative analysis and synthesis capabilities, respect of time constraints, intellectual rigor, curiosity, open mindedness, empathy and team spirit. • Technical skills: strong analytical skills, efficient use of MS Excel and PowerPoint. • Project management skills: proactive, autonomous and flexible attitude, organisational, planning and time management skills, proven experience of stakeholder engagement and management, both external and internal as a leader and builder of teams. • Fluent in English  To be eligible to apply for this position, candidates must be either an Australian citizen or have full working rights in Australia.  Location: Sydney CBD (Hybrid)  Salary: Depending on experience  Work type: Full Time, starting ASAP  Application Process:  In your application process you will be asked the following questions: • Do you have full working rights in Australia? • How many years experience do you have working in the Australian electricity sector? • How many years experience do you have in data analytics roles? • How many years experience do you have in technical sales/business development? • Do you have (consulting) project management experience? If so, how many years? • What are your salary expectations?
job_description.507: EY is a global professional services organization providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world, to help create wider economic and social benefits today, and a strong legacy for a better tomorrow.  Our Data & Analytics team are looking to hire a Technical Business Analyst.  Key Duties Of The Role Are  Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data.  Be responsible for creating requirement specifications, analyzing requirements, creating visual models, facilitating elicitation sessions and digging around in the data when needed.  Have knowledge and experience of all phases of software development including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, defect management  Have experience in business intelligence, data warehousing or advanced analytics projects  Essential Skills For The Role Are  Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders on data risks and controls discussions  Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)  Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or  analytics projects  The sponsored approver for this role is EY Business Solutions Pty Ltd.  Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.
job_description.508: • Analyse data and reporting to identify key insights & trends • Full-time, permanent opportunity (Hybrid working – mix of work from home & the office) • Location Agnostic  The Role  As Senior Analyst, Enablement, you will support the Member Office, principally across all aspects of the Enablement team including remediation, regulatory, people (eg CPS 511 and FAR), finance and audit matters to provide insights based on analysis of reporting and help to ensure all practices are in line with policy and regulatory requirements.  Key Responsibilities • Coordinate and attend regular meetings to discuss remediation, regulatory, finance and audit matters • Support the development and co-ordination of Member Office and in particular the Enablement team key activities and processes. • Analyse data and reporting to identify key insights from a Trustee perspective and assist in sharing such insights to the Board, Committees and other stakeholders. • Collate and support the preparation and review of relevant board and board committee papers and provide appropriate recommendations (under Manager’s guidance) as per Member Office remit. • Build effective relationships with stakeholders, fostering trust and expanding the knowledge and importance of the Trustees’ role. • Support the RSEL Boards to fulfil their fiduciary obligations by advocating for member best interests . • Assist with the preparation of reports as required. • Asist with the setup electronic filing systems and agreement registers to track and manage agreed milestones and/or key dates. • Other responsibilities as directed by the Senior Manager or GM, Enablement.  To Be Successful In This Role You Will Possess • Experience in financial services/ superannuation/ wealth industry • Experience with regulatory requirements as they relate to superannuation funds (including SIS Act, Corporations Act, associated regulations, prudential standards and regulatory guides). • Well developed communication, presentation and influencing skills combined with strong relationship and stakeholder management. • Experience working with remediation, incidents and breaches. • Proficiency in business software use including as a minimum Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word. • Strong attention to detail. • Ability to prioritise and navigate environments undergoing significant change. • Collaborative, engaging and motivated to work in cross functional multi-disciplined teams • Understanding of conflicts of interest management • Exemplary behaviours.  Benefits • In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company • A professional, supportive and friendly culture • A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits  The Business  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The Insignia Financial group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. Over the decades, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX: IFL).  To Apply  Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on “Apply Now.”  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.
job_description.509: InfoCentric is currently hiring a GCP Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have proven Data Architecture design and implementation experience utilising innovative data technologies and data science techniques.  This is a full-time, permanent role based out of Melbourne or Sydney.  Qualifications • 6+ years of experience with data engineering • Big Query Data warehousing experience • GCP Cloud Experience • Experience developing with Python, Scripting  Nice to Haves: • Data Flow  Who Are We?  InfoCentric is one of the largest specialist Cloud, Data and Analytics Consulting firms  Data is in our DNA – Harnessing the latest technology, delivering thought leading outcomes in AI, Machine Learning, API development and Cloud Platform delivery  We translate the best ideas into awesome outcomes that make a difference to Australia's largest organisations. • Embrace diversity - We work to understand and celebrate differences to embrace diversity, drive smarter decisions, create new ideas and build a better culture • Thrive together - We work together in innovative teams to share knowledge and help each other grow • Realise opportunity - We offer opportunities to develop skills and leadership with paid certifications and team trainings while offering great career growth • Empower clients - We strive to understand our clients to deliver hands-on solutions to Australia’s largest companies across a diverse industries • Think big picture - We act in fairness to look after our people, our clients and our community  What We Offer • Hands on, onshore experience with Australia’s largest organisations • Paid trainings and certifications on the latest technologies including AWS, Azure and Snowflake • Great on-site support to help you settle in and progress your career • Regular social events and company parties. Previous events include private cinema screenings, bubble soccer, minigolf, bowling and social drinks  Due to the high number of applicants we receive, you will be contacted if you are successful. We thank you for your interest in InfoCentric and working with us. If you're unsuccessful for this role we will keep your details and reach out to you with any suitable roles in the future.
job_description.510: Australian Citizens residing in Australia only respond. • Contract start 16 October 2023 to 12 months. • Australian Citizen, Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth role.  Send your responses to jobs@softtestpays.com  Overview  The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is responsible for the delivery of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). Since it was established, the NDIA has pursued a vision of optimising social and economic independence and full participation for people with disability. The Data & Analytics Branch supports the Agency by providing high quality data and reporting and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions.  Key Responsibilities • Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the organisation. Capture business requirements and identify underlying business needs. • Carry out analysis of present approaches and identify opportunities to enhance processes current and target state. • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business requirements. • Translate subject-matter expert and stakeholder discussion into process flows, procedures and business requirements. • Identify and document instances where existing business processes may be streamlined or improved or do not meet current or potential future business needs. • Develop, maintain and validate business requirements with stakeholders. • Input to the design and implementation of solutions that support the business processes and deliver business insight. • Liaise with management to coordinate process improvement project activities. • Workshop facilitation with business stakeholders to map out processes and elicit business requirements. • Practical Agile Delivery framework experience, developing Initiatives, Epics, User Stories and other documentation. • Ability to work with the business to identify business process issues, improvement opportunities and potential solutions. • Ability to gather, analyse and translate business data to meaningful insights.  Every application requires to address selection criteria as part of application submission.  Essential Criteria  1. Able to translate discussion into process flows, requirements and documentation.  2. Able to understand and capture business requirements relating to use / application of data to business problems.  3. Have experience in as is and to be process mapping.  4. Hands on experience with agile product development process for data products as well as developing detailed User Stories and UAC.  5. Intermediate skills with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, Powerpoint, Word.  6. Showcase good analytical and evaluating skills.  Desirable Criteria  1. Experience as a scrum master.  2. Experience creating wireframes.  3. Data analysis skills.  4. Experience working in data businesses.
job_description.511: • $76.93 per hour + Super | 35hours per week • NSW State Government | WFH + occasionally Parramatta Office • ASAP Start | Estimated 3-month assignment, strong potential to extend  About the Company  Our large NSW State Government client is responsible for the management of the NSW Government’s social housing portfolio.  Why Apply? • Obtain experience to work within NSW State Government • Flexible working conditions • Work / Life balance  About the Role  This is a fabulous opportunity for a Senior Project Officer to join their growing team working remotely from home with the requirement to attend the Parramatta office as required by management. This is an estimated 3-month temporary assignment, with a potential to extend.  Working within the Delivery Office, you will be required to support on 2 projects simultaneously to improve overall accessibility and traceability for reconstruction performance reporting. These 2 projects include devising and implementing project fact sheets within Indesign along with the creation of a seamless image library through the collation of reconstruction phase photographs.  Responsibilities • Manage and oversee multiple data analytics and records management projects simultaneously • Track, monitor and report on project scope, status updates, milestones, budget and deliverables • Generate monthly reports, conducting an audit to assess level of accuracy • Audit and analyse current processes and procedures, identifying gaps and issues • Make recommendations to support informed decision making outcomes • Establish and maintain effective stakeholder relationships facilitating partnerships, cohesion, sharing of information and contribution of ideas • Gather and collate data, records and information • Creation of project fact sheets within InDesign • Construct a seamless and accessible Image Library, accurately referencing and storing all pre, during and post reconstruction photographs • Preparation of high quality written materials to support project deliverables including briefing notes, correspondence and presentation material • Support the annual review of the Delivery Division Register and continuous improvement process • Ensure compliance with best practice and legislative requirements  About You • Impeccable communication skills, both verbal and written • Solid analytical negotiation, negotiation, influencing and problem-solving skills • High attention to detail • Takes initiative with a strong team and task focus • Strong computer literacy and proficiency with MS Office suite and TRIM • Intermediate Excel skills  Requirements • Demonstrated Project Management experience • Experience working on multiple projects simultaneously • Data Analytics and Records Management experience advantageous • Reliable remote internet access with the ability to work independently from home • Flexibility to work in the Parramatta Office at management request • Willingness to undergo a National Police Check • Ability to commence and commit to the duration of the assignment  How to Apply  Applications will be reviewed within 48 hours of the job posting. Please apply by submitting your resume (in Word format) via the “Apply Now” tab to be considered for the role. Only suitable applicants will be contacted.  For other similar roles currently available, please go to our jobs page https://www.alexanderappointments.com.au/job-results  We also encourage you to visit our website and create a job alert that will immediately flag you when new opportunities appear https://www.alexanderappointments.com.au/job-alerts
job_description.512: Senior / Principal Power BI Consultants - Microsoft Data & Analytics  A leading Data & Analytics Professional Services consultancy is looking for two Senior / Principal level Consultants for their practice.  What's In It for You  A competitive permanent salary package with the opportunity to work with large enterprise clients in many verticals including financial services, utilities, government and more!  The role  You will be working exclusively on high level long term projects within the Sydney market and will utilise the Microsoft Fabric and Azure technologies specifically Power BI. You will be a key member of the team assisting with the growth of the Microsoft Practice and will need to have strong client liaison skills as well as a commercial awareness related to client account development.  The skills needed  The ideal candidate for this true technical consulting role will have some or all of the following experience: • Power BI experience • Microsoft Platform knowledge of Azure Data Services, the Microsoft Data cloud stack and on prem Microsoft BI technologies • Knowledge of Azure Data Factory or Databricks is a huge advantage • Data modelling experience • Ideally previous Professional services experience with niche Data consultancies • Previous on prem SSIS, SSAS (tabular and modular) and SSRS, DAX & Power BI experience • High level client liaison skills • Documentation (business focused, technology focused and project focused)  As mentioned salary levels are excellent and remuneration will match your experience.  Visa sponsorship is available
job_description.513: Senior BI Developer ( SQL / SSAS / SSIS / Power BI / DAX )  Sydney (hybrid)  $155k base plus super  Senior BI Developer ( SQL / SSAS / SSIS / Power BI / DAX ) is required to join a leading Wholesale company with expertise in multichannel distribution of electrical products and services for the energy space, covering residential, commercial and industrial.  The company operates with over 1900 branches across 21 countries and has more than 25000 employees.  If you’re an experienced BI Developer with a passion for creating solutions and making impact, this could be for you!  Day to day responsibilities for the Senior BI Developer ( SQL / SSAS / SSIS / Power BI / DAX ) include : • The role is a combination of development and data analysis work, interacting with many cross functional teams and working closely with insights • Working closely with the business to analysis requirements and convert these into building and implementing solutions using the Microsoft BI stack • Support the business with detailed data analysis providing insights and recommended actions • Provide overnight support and maintenance of the BI system on a rota basis • Maintain and provide BAU support of the current platform  Essential skills for the Senior BI Developer ( SQL / SSAS / SSIS / Power BI / DAX ) include : • Strong written and verbal communication skills • Ability to analyse data and confidently present findings and insights to non-technical users • Around 5 plus years of experience managing BI projects, from analysis, design, development, testing and implementation • PowerBI DAX report development, data modelling and visualisation • Data warehousing architecture design and theory • SQL Server DB development, Advanced TSQL querying, SSIS ETL package design, SSAS Tabular and Multi-dimensional, SSRS reports and dashboards • Advanced Excel and PowerPivot skills, data visualization techniques and storytelling • Be outcome driven with strong problem-solving skills • Broad enterprise wide understanded of business processes, such as: Sales, margin, pricing, finance, HR, Customer, Supply chain etc  Desirable skills for the Senior BI Developer ( SQL / SSAS / SSIS / Power BI / DAX ) include : • ETL using Azure Data Factory and understanding of ETL/ELT concepts • Previous experience working for a wholesale company  If you’d like to apply for the above Senior BI Developer ( SQL / SSAS / SSIS / Power BI / DAX ) role, please select apply now!  Please note you must have full working rights to be considered for this role and must be based in Sydney, Australia  Keywords: SSIS / SSAS / Power BI / DAX / SQL / SSRS / Azure Data Factory / BI Development / BI Developer / Data Analytics / Integration / ETL
job_description.514: Job Description  How will I help?  The Group Tech Analytics team supports multiple data analytics platforms that ingest data from a wide range of operational data stores and make it available to end consumers. Unlocking the value of this data is the key to the Westpac transformation journey to a digital bank as well as becoming one of the world’s greatest service companies.  This role is a combination of data architect in the planning of strategic data products/assets and as of technical data modeller for the design and realisation of data Products/Assets over progressive releases which enable higher degree or reusability/scalability, easy maintenance which are highly performing. Working with business user representatives to translate their requirements into robust data structures in both the Westpac Hadoop/Azure Platform as well as the Enterprise Data Warehouse.  Key responsibilities include: • Experience in documenting and designing conceptual, logical, and physical data models with high quality definition. • Publish models using standardised methods and create bespoke communication packs to convey the model content to diverse audiences. • Facilitate workshops to capture the data requirements and design a data model to support the business process/use case • Assess example source content against target models to ensure integrity and alignment with use cases • Communicate the concepts and rules of the data model design and support model users to achieve their goals  What’s in it for me?  You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our purpose is of creating better futures together. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grown, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure. Whatever shape your family takes, we offer generous paid and unpaid parental leave for your nominated primary and support carers. This includes leave to organise adoptions, surrogacy, and foster care arrangements. And we continue to pay your super contributions while you take all the time you need to get your new family settled.  What do I need?  The successful candidate will have: • Logical and physical data modelling in complex environments – spanning Hadoop/Azure and Teradata • Familiarity with Erwin Data Modeler tool, model mart the Web Portal feature. • Experience in banking/financial industry models and designing Data Products, Data Assets and Enterprise data models. • Publish efficient Physical data models based on target data layer which could be Structured, Semi-Structured or Unstructured using Teradata/Hortonworks and Azure Synapse analytics. • Proficient in data analysis, data profiling using SQL or other tools. • Understanding of e2e processing of a data in an analytics environment  What is it like to work there?  We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us achieve our purpose of creating better futures together. With us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility and one where everyone belongs.  How do I apply?  Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.  As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, genders, sexual orientation, cultural backgrounds, people with disability, neurodiverse individuals, and Indigenous Australians to apply. If an adjustment is required to assist you during our recruitment process, please email talentacquisition@westpac.com.au  Do you need reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process?  At Westpac we are committed to providing a supportive culture and creating inclusive and accessible workplaces, branches, products and services for our customers, employees, and community.  We can provide reasonable adjustments for individuals with disability and/or neurodiversity. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process at any stage, please call 1800 655 592 Option 1.2 or email talentacquisition@westpac.com.au
job_description.515: Join the team redefining how the world experiences design. Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,??, hallo, vítejte Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point. Where and how you can work Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work. That means if you want to do your thing in the office (if you're near one), at home or a bit of both, it's up to you. What you'd be doing in this role As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve. About the role At Canva, our mission is to empower the world to design, and we're looking for insightful data analysts who can help us achieve our mission. We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users, and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don't want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it About the team Growing our adoption and expansion in teams & businesses of all sizes is a core company strategy at Canva. Our Growth Supergroup is essential to driving this growth, across free users, and paid users through our subscription products, Canva Pro and Canva for Teams. A key pillar of our Revenue growth engine is ourHigh Velocity Salesmotion. This is our product & data led sales motion, which assists paid teams in businesses to onboard and rapidly experience success on Canva, with a scaled, low-touch growth programmes involving Product Advocate meetings, webinars & in-product chat. Canva already counts many active users from over 85% of Fortune 1000 companies amongst our 100 million+ MAUs, and has over 10 million paid subscribers. These numbers are growing rapidly every day, so we have a huge opportunity in front of us to build a world-class product-led sales motionthat generates hundreds of millions of dollars in subscription revenue . About you As a Senior Data Analyst, you will excel at the intersection of data, commercial achievement and operational excellence. You'll have demonstrated previous success as a Senior Data Analyst, with proven results driving growth metrics, ideally within a scaled SaaS business. The High Velocity Sales motion is in its early stages of impact. As an embedded Senior Data Analyst within the team, your impact will come from collaborating with the cross-functional team to understand how and where they can drive the biggest impact, requiring acute commercial acumen and an eye for early signals and rapid testing. This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions, communicating closely with stakeholders, and maintaining a highly proactive attitude. Role ResponsibilitiesFind insights that help us understand both Canva and our customers - we want you to be creative and insightful, rather than just throwing the usual metrics at the wall to see what sticks. Suggest and run interesting experiments that will actually move our metrics - when we push tests to 100% we want to actually see the bump in the relevant graph. Build and maintain dashboards and make them impactful and intuitive. Own projects, data models, dashboards, and other artifacts and keep them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment. Use our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be challenging (and fun).  Required Skills & ExperienceStrong competency with SQL; experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery is a plus Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas. Stakeholder management skills are vital in this role. Experience with optimising product funnels, running experiments, and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes. Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R.  Preferred (but not required) Skills & ExperienceExperience building and deriving insights from data models relating to organisations, teams and user interactions / product behaviour. Experience working with subscription-based data sets. It would be desirable to have experience with collaborative products as well. Experience in B2B or Product Led Sales, working with tools such as Salesforce and working with teams across Sales, SalesOps, Customer Success, Support, Finance.  #LI-JC1 What's in it for you? Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work. Here's a taste of what's on offer: • Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too • Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers • An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more • Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info. Other stuff to know We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. #J-18808-Ljbffr
job_description.516: Data Analyst / Consultant  A National Data & Analytics consultancy based out of Sydney is looking for Consultants/Analysts, with a strong background in Data & Analytics, machine learning and data science to help grow their practice.  This is an exciting opportunity for someone with 0.5 to 5 years’ experience in the industry, that is looking to further develop their skills and tech capability through training and exposure to project based work. You will need to have exceptionally strong SQL skills and a mathematical logical mind.  In this role, you will gain exposure to Python, Power BI, Azure, Databricks, Tableau, AWS, UiPath and Power Automate, to name a few.  We’d love to hear from you, if you have: • Ability to work with complex data structures • Exceptionally strong SQL skills • Python skills • Strong understanding of Data Visualisation with tools like Power BI or Tableau • Mathematical and logical thinking with an understanding of business processes • Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Science, Engineering, Computing, Business or Finance field • At least 0.5 to 5 years of relevant industry experience • Exceptional critical thinking skills and problem-solving skills • An analytical mind with excellent data collection and analysis skills • A commitment to ongoing learning and development • High attention to detail with excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) - ensuring all communications are clear, succinct and audience appropriate  In this role, you will be responsible for (but not limited to): • Support current and new projects for clients or internally, meeting with clients prior to actual professional engagement to determine requirements • Gathering data from multiple sources and pursuing data that is late in delivery • Cleansing data, troubleshooting, fixing errors and identifying discrepancies in data • Providing input to project planning, status and review meetings • Contributing to the design and development of innovative solutions • Analysing requirements within companies and giving independent and objective advice on the use of technologies • Identifying and evaluating inefficiencies and recommend optimal solutions • Designing, testing, installing and monitoring new systems • Ensuring the conceptual completeness of the technical solutions • Analysing and interpreting data to unearth weaknesses and problems, and comprehend the causes  If you have some of these skills and an enthusiasm for learning then click apply as we want to hear from you.
job_description.517: The role  As a Data Analyst, you will be accountable for: • Taking a lead role in establishing data and reporting models that provide insights and predictive analysis on core regulatory data • Taking a lead role in the development and improvement of the reporting and analysis capability within M&BR • Driving the utilisation of new analytic technology and techniques including the use of data lake/databricks/Power BI • Delivering periodic reporting highlighting trends and insights, including data for public reporting • Preparing adhoc reports and insights for internal stakeholders; identifying needs, data sources and format requirements • Facilitating workshops, interviews and other data collection methods, to prepare requirements that reflect and consider the needs of internal and external clients • Participating in system or process improvement, quality or change initiatives.  About you • A relevant bachelor's degree in law, finance, accounting, or related discipline. • Experience in databases, data warehouses and interrogation techniques e.g. Datalake, Databricks, SQL, Microsoft Dynamics. • Experience in report building and analysing data e.g. Excel, Python, R Studio, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Machine learning. • Experience analysing data and information and drawing appropriate conclusions and presenting in an engaging way. • Experience establishing and maintaining the quality and fitness for purpose of data and information. • Communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage with a variety of audiences utilising written and verbal communication.
job_description.518: See job description for details  Analyst, Data Analytics  Your new company Our client is a Lending & Banking giant.  Your new role As the Analyst, Data Analytics - you will be an integral member of the team for the duration of the Proprietary Home Lending Performance Reporting project. You will support the Manager Home Ownership Analytics in leading the development of an end to end acquisition funnel dashboard for the Retail Distribution business and engaging with key business stakeholders within Home Ownership and Retail Distribution to gather requirements, validate data and showcase development progress. The Home Ownership Analytics team play a significant role in aiding and influencing the strategic direction and decision-making of the Home Ownership businesses with the provision of timely and accurate data a key to ensuring the efficient management of the business day to day. You will receive coaching and development on the job from the Manager and other senior team members, as well as support through individual development plans and training.  What you'll need to succeed • Strong written and verbal communication, adaptable to a range of audiences, ability to clearly and articulately present facts & insights. • Analysis and Problem-Solving skills and sound commercial acumen - sources and use relevant information effectively to identify problems and offer sustainable solutions. Performing simple analysis tasks, initiative and strategic understanding framing up required outcomes from data and insights gathered. • Strategic Focus - Translates the strategy into workable solutions and guides the work of others to ensure alignment with strategy • Strong leadership capabilities and ability to work collaboratively with other team members to execute on key deliverables back to our business stakeholders. • Proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, SQL, PowerBI - performing simple analysis, model development, data sourcing and manipulation What you'll get in return Daily rate: $450 + Super /day 6 months renewable contract  What you need to do now  If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career. #2816074
job_description.519: We are looking for someone who is passionate about optimising data and using their analytical skills to further the mission of Compassion Australia. This role is a full-time temporary 12-month contract and will be performed in a hybrid arrangement...  Compassion Australia's headquarters is in Newcastle but we have offices across Australia. We are open to receiving applications Australia-wide for this position. • Purpose driven organisation • Hybrid work, with a genuine mix of office and work from home • Salary Packaging Options available - maximise your take-home pay!  Our Impact As part of a global network of more than 40 countries, Compassion Australia is a Christian charity with over 70 years’ experience working with children living in extreme poverty. Compassion is Christ-centred, child-focused, and church-based, and exists to release children from poverty in Jesus’ name. With our partners, we serve over 2.2 million children in more than 25 countries around the world.  Compassion Australia has a goal to further maximise our reach and extend to new areas and supporter groups.  About the Role Compassion is a Christian organisation, and it is important that the successful candidate supports our values and Statement of Faith.  Reporting to the Head of Projects, Research and Analytics, the Data Analyst effectively identifies relevant and available data sources and implements methods to gather, interpret and report data. You will contribute significantly by having a strong understanding of data modeling, analysis approaches, and translating complex information into reportable and usable knowlegde. You will also be assisting in ensuring the quality of the systems and tools used and monitoring its effectiveness to ensure decisions at Compassion Australia are data-informed. The role will require strong collaboration and stakeholder management across internal and external groups. You will be adding value to the works of Compassion through being detail-oriented, methodical, and analytical in your approaches.  About You • You are methodical in your thought process and have successfully applied that capability to perform tasks effectively and achieve results. • You are analytical in your approach; you find ease in identifying information or variances and have the ability to translate data and communicate solutions. • You are highly organised and have excellent ability to prioritise work to meet deadlines. • You are passionate about continuous improvement, always seeking to better processes and frameworks to increase efficiency. • You enjoy cross-departmental collaboration and have excellent interpersonal communication. • You have strong knowledge of data modelling techniques, reporting packages and analytical methodologies • Intermediate query skills - SQL, R, Python • Intermediate experience in ETL tools • Experience in database solutions – Azure Synapse, Snowflake • Experience in data visualisation applications – Power BI, Tableau • You have well-developed experience applying knowledge gained through analysis to solving business and process problems.  For a full copy of the Position Description, please contact our People and Culture Team via email at peopleandculture@compassion.com.au  How to Apply  If you would like to be considered for this position, submit your application by clicking “Apply Now”. • You are required to respond to the screening questions • Submit a cover letter outlining why you are interested in this role and how your background, and experience will enable you to successfully fulfill this role • Submit a concise resume outlining your qualifications and employment history.  Applications close at 11:59pm AEST 26 October 2023. Early applications are encouraged, and the position may be filled prior to the closing date.  If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact our People and Culture Team via email at peopleandculture@compassion.com.au.
job_description.520: Introduction At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities We are currently recruiting Data Engineer -Big Data for 18 month fixed term contract, based in Sydney. You will be part of a Data Engineer team that is responsible for supporting Data Ingestion, Data Transformation and data analysis. As a Data Engineer your responsibilities include – • Develop design documents and review technical documents from Solution Architects for projects in the cards and collections domain and manage the alignment of the program’s architecture to the Bank’s Enterprise Architecture and as per Westpac WDP standards. • Define technical user stories and track the development activities of the team members • Lead the technical design process coordinating the various stakeholders from business and towards an agreed solution. • Experience and Knowledge of Agile and Scrum Process and coordinate with distributed teams • Design and build deliverables to ensure traceability of the built solution to the architectural principles and business objectives. • Resolve technical issues during system integration testing and post implementation, address the technical and operational challenges faced by the team. • Participate in client meetings to communicate status or give demos. • Be keenly aware of timelines and budgeting to deliver in a timely manner.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise To ensure success in the role you will possess the following skills – • Minimum 10 years of experience as Data Engineer with expert and leadership level skills in HIVE, Spark, Scala, PySpark, Solr, HBase, Kafka, Spark streaming • Experienced in writing robust and efficient code in HIVE, Spark, Scala, PySpark, Solr, Kafka, HBase, Spark streaming, Unix in Cloudera environment. • Good knowledge and experience in Business lending domain (in Banking) • Should have domain knowledge in personal loans, secured car loans, android pay and mobile wallets. • Good understanding and experience in DevOps – CI/CD tools like Git, Jenkins, Bitbucket • Build using Maven, Gradle tools • Good understanding on schedulers like Control M, Crontab. • Experience on tools like Pycharm, Putty, WinScp, Confluence, Jira • Should be proficient in DevOps methodologies and tools  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise As Above
job_description.521: For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.  At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.  As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.  With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office.  The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.  So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time / full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!  Ideal Candidate • Fluent in English. • Excellent research skills. • Excellent local knowledge of your home country. • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia. • Analytical mindset.  Job Requirements • Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years. • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts. • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability. • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms. • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions. • All work must be of an independent nature.  Technical requirements to perform the work  Access to a laptop or computer which uses : • A logon account unique to you • Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed • Only one member per household may apply  NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.  Benefits • Work up to 20 hours per week. • Earn a competitive rate of pay. • Develop your research skills. • Avoid the long commute. • Work from the comfort of your home office. • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!  Apply Online Today!  This is a freelance, independent contractor position.  Additional information :  Employment type : Part-time
job_description.522: Day-rate, 3-month contract  Immediate start required  Award-winning Digital Agency  We have partnered with a leading Digital Agency who are continuing to scale!  This is a 3-month contract, so we are looking to speak with analysts who are experienced with SQL and Tableau, and that are immediately available.  As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with multiple tech and business teams as you scale the reporting capability and build, tune and embed statistical models, providing real-time data to clients and end users.  What You’ll Do  Deliver robust data analysis and insights for your team, with a focus on the project at hand  Collaborate with other tech teams to ensure the smooth delivery of your models and reports.  Develop consistent metrics to ensure your squad and project are progressing  Build an analytics-led culture that relies and thrives on data to make critical decisions  Provide high-quality statistical models that deliver analytics to drive the success of the platform.  What You’ll Bring  Strong reporting experience with Tableau.  Proven technical skills in database extraction and an ability to solve problems using SQL  Strong experience building relationships with cross-functional business and technical stakeholders  Ability to see the commercial value and drivers behind your analytics  If you have any questions about this role or others we have available you can email our team directly via andrew@thedrivegroup.com.au  For The Latest Jobs, Tech News or to 'Introduce A Friend' for a $1000 Referral Fee - Follow Us On Linkedin:  https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup  TheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry.  We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.  If you have the right skills and attitude we would love to hear from you!
job_description.523: Senior Data Analyst, Product Analytics  12-Month Contract  We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique perspective and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.  Tripadvisor is looking for an experienced data analyst to join our dynamic and fast paced Product Analytics Team on our Viator brand, home to over 300K bookable experiences worldwide. As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of complex and interesting business problems and have access to huge data sets. You will present your finding to Senior Leadership and be able to observe the impact of your work in real time as you help the company grow. This is a great opportunity to make your mark on a growing brand in the Tripadvisor family strongly recovering post Covid-19.  We are seeking a Senior Analyst, Product Analytics who has the analytical skills and business knowledge to support numerous end users from an analytics and measurement perspective and is looking to join a fast-growing all-star team dedicated to providing the highest quality data driven insights. • Lead analysis/reporting of current business operating metrics, focused on developing the capability to provide insight into Tripadvisor's products and improving Tripadvisor's understanding of its market-by-market customer propositions and competitor positioning. • Provide timely insights and analytical support to different internal stakeholders to support effective business decision-making, including Product, Marketing, Supply and Business Development. • Create concepts, justify business cases and manage the implementation of changes to the website experience to improve customer engagement and value metrics. • Employ/automate reporting tools to measure customer interaction (such as acquisition of members, engagement metrics, and member and user value) and competitor positioning. (such as reach and page impression growth, content feature set, and marketing activities) • Lead analysis of consumer and member behavior across the websites, using web analytics tools and internal warehouse data to identify source of traffic and which areas of the site, content and functionality users are engaging in. • Identify key success indicators and determine best practices for measurement and reporting. • Lead product experimental design like A/B or Multi-variate test to identify opportunity for product optimization and improve business KPIs. • Assist with ad hoc queries and provide analytical support to our fast-growing business as it evolves. What we are looking for? • 3-5 years of experience in an analytical role (ideal backgrounds include: a similar business analyst role at a web company, a data-based consulting role, or other data strategy type positions) • Bachelor's Degree in an analytical field (math, economics, engineering, statistics, etc), Master's Degree a plus • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, involving data analysis, experimental design and predictive modeling • Ability to work with large dataset and summarize findings in a clear format • Combine creative and pragmatic use of insight and data with attention to detail • Proficient in Excel, SQL, R/Python, Tableau and a few other useful tools of the data trade • Proactive not reactive, with ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment • Ability to take in loose requirements, work independently, ask smart questions, and produce high quality actionable insights • Confident with learning new tools, technologies, and methodologies • Ability to work at all levels including senior management; and across multiple functions/departments • Small company experience with hands on / can-do mindset is an advantage • Some programming/scripting ability a huge plus • Experience with statistical packages such as SAS, R, SPSS, etc. a plus We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please make sure to reach out to your individual recruiter or our team at recruitment@tripadvisor.com.  #LI-JZ1  #Viator
job_description.524: About Index Exchange:  Index is a global advertising marketplace enabling media owners to grow their revenue by helping marketers reach consumers across every screen. We’re a proud industry pioneer with nearly 20 years of experience accelerating the evolution of ad technology for the world’s leading experience-makers.  We are all in on video this year. We recently rebuilt our platform from the ground up specifically for this new channel, allowing our customers to transact across every device and screen as efficiently as possible. We’re reimagining streaming TV, and it has become one of the fastest growing areas of our business.  Index is an exciting and fast-paced place to work, and our company is built on our values of change, support, learning and teaching, trust, and intention. You will be able to feed your ambition, lean into trust & transparency, and feel genuine support from your colleagues here.  We pride ourselves on our independence and openness, not only in our technology, but in our teams, too. Our diverse and inclusive culture celebrates how we can leverage our unique differences to help drive Index forward.  We have more than 550 Indexers around the globe dedicated to building a safe and transparent marketplace that provides a trusted experience for consumers, and we’re looking for talented professionals to help take us to the next level.  Are you ready to join the programmatic evolution?  Reporting to the Manager, Commercial Insights, the Data Analyst will support and drive objectives of the Commercial Insights team, partnering with our commercial business partners to drive revenue and growth through data insights.  What We’re Looking For: • Critical thinker: Logical and concise with a strong sense of urgency, understanding the larger story behind each release/product. • Problem solver: Experience working with teams and collaborating across groups to achieve desired results. • Independent: Comfort with ambiguity and self-starter with an aptitude for defining new processes. Resourceful. • Passionate: You are curious and love experimenting with different approaches to find the most efficient solution to a problem. • Storyteller: You can find and tell a story when looking at numbers and graphs • Experienced: Minimum 2-3 years working experience; 0-1 years in programmatic advertising preferred.  Here’s What You’ll be Doing: • Become an expert in Index’s data. Build and maintain efficient data solutions for the commercial business, utilising our primary BI tool, Looker. • Drive incremental growth for Index’s customers by uncovering and delivering proactive analysis and meaningful insights to our account management teams for Index’s clients, across publishers, DSPs and buyers. • Provide client-facing analytics for a selection of key premium publisher accounts in APAC, partnering with the account team, attending meetings and quarterly reviews, and identifying revenue growth opportunities via data analysis. • Design and build dashboards to quantify and monitor releases and initiatives • Provide analytics support and empower internal teams with knowledge and resources by delivering a range of analysis, insights, and reporting for commercial teams, via a queue-based system. • Drive initiatives to increase revenue and/or improve operations, utilising Index’s internal software and reporting systems such as Looker, Confluence and Salesforce. • Have a leading role in strategic programs, to drive incremental revenue and improve efficiency for the business. • Provide comprehensive summaries on analysis, releases, and outcomes to key stakeholders • Be inquisitive and explore opportunities for automation of recurring and time consuming tasks, using creativity and programming language skills. • Collaborate and learn from analytics team members across the globe.  Here's What You Need: • Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Finance or a similar quantitative discipline combined with a minimum of 2-3 years of experience performing the responsibilities outlined above, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. • Ability to build consensus and relationships among partners and team members. • Strong ability to organize effectively, solve problems, make confident conclusions quickly, thoughtfully, and communicate clearly • Strong analytical mind and a keen interest in conducting research, interpreting data and translating to insights for various audiences. • Ability to be curious with data and translate it into meaningful insights. • Experience or an interest in working within the ad technology industry. • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel. • Knowledge of SQL for querying databases. • Experience with BI tools such as Redash and Looker considered an asset. • Knowledge of digital advertising industry, participants, technologies, and advertising ecosystems considered an asset • Japanese language skills a plus  Why You’ll Love Working Here: • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans at no cost to you • Time off and flexible work schedules • Stock options and equity packages • Generous parental leave • Monthly wellness stipend plus fitness discounts and quarterly wellness group activities • Community engagement opportunities and donation-matching program • Annual virtual company retreats and regular community-led team events • One day off per year to volunteer • A workplace that supports a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment – learn more here  Notification  Index Exchange is aware that there have been recent scams directed toward candidates regarding job interviews and offers.  Please be vigilant and do not accept interview requests, job offers, or other hiring-related documents from anyone other than our dedicated recruitment team, from the domain of @indexexchange.com. Our interview process consists of several steps, including phone screens and video interviews. We do not conduct interviews via an email questionnaire or request money at any point in the process.  If you do receive these requests, please let us know immediately at: report.scam@indexexchange.com.  Equal employment opportunity  At Index Exchange, we believe that successful products are built by teams just as diverse as the audience who uses them. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunities. We celebrate diversity of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Additionally, we realize that diversity is deeper than any status or classification—diversity is the human experience. For those who show grit, passion, and humility—Index will welcome you.  Accessibility for applicants with disabilities  Index Exchange is committed to working with and providing access and reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Please let us know if you’d like to request a reasonable accommodation.  #LI-MF1  #LI-Hybrid
job_description.525: Data Analysts  About The Company  Our client are one of Australia's best known brands, and are currently undertaking one of the largest ERP Data Migration projects in the country. This is an enterprise level client with a twist, be prepared to work in a fast paced environment!  The Tech Crew  The core team are split into Functional & Technical SME's & you will be working with closely with multiple business stakeholders. The project touches all areas of the business, so you will get to work with a number of different professionals & personalities.  The Gig  You'll be a key individual in one of Australia largest data migration projects, this project is forecasted to last for 5 years. You'll be responsible for analyse and processing large amounts of data.  About You  You are a data expert! You have a passion for all things data & quality related, and aren't afraid to speak your mind. This role suits someone who likes to take on big projects & enjoys being part of the hustle & bustle of enterprise IT projects.  Key Skills • Strong SQL Skills • Informatica or similar data technologies • Agile methods and Atlassian Products (e.g. Jira) • Exposure to working with complex Data • Data discovery and data integration/ETL • Data Warehousing • Best principles / practices • Stored Procedures • Strong Attention to Detail • Exceptional Communicator • Experience in reporting and presenting data visually (Experience in Tableau, R, Python an advantage) Interviews are taking place this week - APPLY NOW.
job_description.526: Macquarie Group Sydney, AustraliaPosted 1 hour ago Permanent CompetitiveJoin the Banking and Financial Services data and analytics team where you will be partnering with a range of stakeholders within the Macquarie ecosystem to own and deliver exciting analytics projects to support our growing Personal Banking business.You will work in a fast-paced environment where you will use your data and analytics capability, to help design and automate analytics solutions, develop interactive metrics and dashboards, to help solve business problems.In this role, you will:Deliver analytical use cases to support our strategic business initiatives in an agile working environment.Use SQL/Alteryx, R/Python to transform data and draw insights from large data setsDesign and automate analytics solutions, develop interactive metrics and dashboards.Apply advanced statistical methods to support decision making and automation. Analysis may include (but not limited to): A/B testing, segmentation, machine learning, regressions and key driver analysis.To excel in this role, you will have:Relevant experience as a Data Analyst (or similar) coupled with a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, applied statistics or a related quantitative discipline and enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment full of complex technical and business challenges.You have extensive experience using SQL plus commercial experience with at least one of the following technologies:Tableau/Power BI, Alteryx/Talend and R/Python.You will also bring good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from non-technical teams, and most importantly a strong interest in the business impact of your work.About Banking and Financial ServicesBanking and Financial Services is Macquarie's retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and InclusionThe diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.
job_description.527: Reporting to the **Head of Operations**, you will play a vital role in optimising the success of our customers on the FoodByUs platform, both buyers and suppliers. You will collaborate with various departments, including sales, operations, and marketing, to identify opportunities for improvement and implement data-driven solutions.
job_description.528: Please note, this Careers website is intended for Internal Candidates already employed by Crown. Please note, this Careers website is intended for Internal Candidate already employed by Crown.  To apply externally please follow this link to theExternal Careers Website. At Crown, our overall success is achieved through a combined team effort, therefore we strive to provide opportunities for our employees to learn, grow and thrive in a positive and supportive work environment which embraces diversity and inclusiveness.  Crown is "a world of entertainment" and we strive to make the ordinary extraordinary through our purpose : Together, we create exceptional experiences with respect and care for our communities.  Due to internal promotions, Crown Resorts have3 x opportunitiesfor an Analyst Data Analytics to join the Financial Crime teams inSydney, Melbourne or Perth.  Reporting to the Senior Manager - Data Analytics, these roles are responsible for supporting with the execution of data analytics and visualisation activities as well as other initiatives across the Financial Crime Operations and Solutions (FCO&S) function including Transaction Monitoring (TM), financial crime modelling, investigations analytics and Management Information (MI) reporting.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to : Work closely with Crown's financial crime and internal technology / data teams to gather requirements Extract, analyse, interpret and understand the data available, translating it to relevant stakeholders Assist in preparing reporting including presentations and updates to senior management and the Board Assist with data analytics and data visualisation activities to support FCO&S priorities Ensure data quality, completeness and accuracy of the data analytics and visualisation activities performed Development and maintenance of dashboarding and reporting to support FCO&S Key selection criteria : 1-2 years experience as an Analyst within financial crime and / or a regulatory environment (Recent graduates will also be considered) Experience or exposure to using data analytics and data visualisation tools (e.  g. SQL, Python, R, Tableau, PowerBI etc.) is desirable (this can be from a university project or personal project) Demonstrated understanding of what is required from a data completeness, accuracy, and quality perspective for reporting purposes Experience in the implementation of financial crime data initiatives within the financial services and / or gaming industry is advantageous Experience in the preparation of management information, metrics reporting and report automation Finishing up or recently finished a degree (or undertaking a Degree) in a relevant discipline (e.  g. Commerce, Information Systems, Computer Science etc.) is desirable Ability to obtain and maintain all required Casino Employee Licences What we offer you : Full-time opportunity, based in Crown's corporate offices Hybrid working flexibility (2 days from home, 3 days from the office) Complimentary meals at our on-site staff restaurant and café Generous discounts across Crown hotels and restaurants Australia wide A rare opportunity to be part of a high performing team Access to discounts with our various corporate partners across travel, insurance, heath & wellbeing, fashion, banking & finance, technology, parking A career in Crown's financial crime, compliance and responsible gaming team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference in the ongoing fight against financial crime and building trust in the community.  Apply now! Please contact for more information Crown conducts pre-employment checks throughout the Recruitment process including police checks .  You may also be subject to further checks including an international police check, working rights check and a pre-employment health assessment.  Crown does not request payment as part of the recruitment process. About Us Crown Resorts is one of Australia's largest tourism and hospitality providers and an employer of choice for thousands of people across Australia.  Crown wholly owns and operates two of Australia's leading integrated resorts - Crown Melbourne and Crown Perth with our third property, Crown Sydney, now open.
