job_description.529: ING, Australia's most recommended bank is on the hunt for an experienced "Data Analysts"to join our high performing Customer Insights team.  You'll be responsible for producing comprehensive deep-dive analyses, and delivering these actionable insights to key stakeholders using impactful visualisation and presentation techniques. Our ideal candidate will be passionate about data, and its ability to strengthen narrative. This love of data and an understanding of how customers tick are essential in this role.  You'll be instrumental across all stages of analysis, including, but not limited to, planning, forecasting, behavioural investigation, research integration, and across all stages of the customer lifecycle and value management.  You'll be an integral part of our Customer Insights team, which is the CoE for the analytics function, for our retail bank.  The CI team is also a strategic partner for the business, equipping our stakeholders with data and insights to help identify, assess and quantify opportunities and outcomes, drive decisions, as well as to understand their impacts. What You'll Do  Integrating internal and external data sources to maximise the insights derived (examples of external data sources include quantitative research; government data sources such as APRA, RBA; external data agencies such as Nielsen; ABS/population).  Working with key stakeholders across the business to understand and clarify their business problems and propose investigative approaches to support decision-making.  Developing analytics to understand behaviours including customer behaviour, channel use, customer segments, product value, social media and lifetime value and presenting these insights and recommended actions in an engaging way.  Managing data discovery and manipulation, working and transforming customer / business data to improve usability and assess the quality and viability of the intended research. What we're looking for Demonstrated experience as Data analyst with hands-on in SQL, PowerBI and reporting. Advanced working knowledge of MS SQL / Teradata, SAS (Enterprise Guide and SAS Macros) and Excel. Experience with Python, the Google Cloud Platform environment and R are desirable, but not essential. Highly analytical, problem solving, lateral thinking and interpretive skills  About Us  At ING, we want to make life simpler and more worthwhile – for everyone who banks with us, for the people who work with us, and the community at large, too.  When you come to work at ING, you're joining a modern and progressive team where individuality isn't just accepted, it's encouraged. You'll be surrounded by people who are friendly, inclusive and respectful, who want you to reach your potential. It's one of the many reasons we're proud to be an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality.  We give people the freedom to take risks, stay curious and think differently, and seek new and better ways to make things happen. We're here to help you get ahead.  And with our global network, there's plenty of scope to take your career in new directions, perhaps even ones you've never considered.  People of all ages, sexual orientations, cultures and backgrounds are welcome to apply – likewise if you're an indigenous Australian, or you're living with a disability, or you have family or caring responsibilities. Sound like the kind of place you'd feel at home? We'd love to hear from you.  (One last thing, ING operates a direct talent sourcing model. So no agency introductions, please.) #J-18808-Ljbffr
job_description.530: Job description  We are looking for a Data Analyst to be part of our Analytics team, whose objective is to help continue the ongoing HelloFresh growth!  Reporting through to the Associate Director, Data Science:  You will... • Provide analytics on a variety of growth and marketing topics, including customer acquisition, marketing mix, retention and monetisation. • Improve our analytics capability: identify inefficiencies and gaps within our analytics process and work to streamline and improve the way the team operates. • Exemplify best practice: develop processes, analysis methodologies and dashboards to increase efficiency and consistency within the wider growth functions. • Enable data-driveness for better decisions making: create innovative solutions that enable colleagues to easily track, report and identify trends and opportunities. • Identify growth opportunities: analyse business performance to identify opportunities to invest marketing budget more efficiently. • Use your technical skills: quickly learn about our data infrastructure, extract and aggregate data with complex SQL queries, and make clear summaries for stakeholders in Google Sheets or apply advanced analytics methodologies using Python/R where appropriate  You have/ are... • Minimum 3 years experience in a similar role. • Excellent analytical skills, including working with large data sets • Excellent knowledge of Google Sheets/Excel, SQL (Tableau is a plus) • Working knowledge of Python • Strong organisational skills with a proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines • An aspiration to drive optimal decision making and maximum productivity • A logical way of working and high attention to detail • The ability to document findings in a clear and concise way, and present them to key stakeholders • An analytical degree; experience in analytics, data science or marketing is a plus • Passion for HelloFresh and the desire to be part of an extremely fast-paced business  What You'll Get In Return... • Heavily discounted HelloFresh boxes (70% off) • High level of responsibility from day one • A position designed with room for evolution • Working with a fun, energetic and supportive team  Start date: Immediately - Can wait notice period  Duration: Full time role. You must have the right to work full-time in Australia.  Location: Chippendale Head Office - Hybrid working model  #LI-Hybrid
job_description.531: Hello. We are EssenceMediacom. GroupM’s newest and largest agency, committed to delivering marketing breakthroughs for brands. We have disrupted the old models across media, creative, innovation and analytics to find new opportunities for advertisers and deliver truly integrated media solutions. Born out of two pioneering agencies, EssenceMediacom fuses Essence’s performance, data, analytics and creative technology DNA with MediaCom’s scaled multichannel audience planning and strategic media expertise.  This role sits at a pivotal crossroads of client and product solutions. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting internal teams on data and analysis projects providing data driven recommendation and insights. This will involve the management of internal stakeholders to drive maximum value of your client’s media mix and new insights developed for smarter planning and business management.  Reporting of the role  This role reports to the Advanced Analytics Manager  3 best things about the job: • An enjoyable environment that combines the best of your skills whilst at the same time being part of the largest marketing services group in the world • Working within a network of 100+ analysts worldwide in areas such as statistics, econometrics, optimisation, machine learning, programming, marketing mix modelling, causal analysis, attribution modelling and predictive modelling or forecasting • Work diversity that involves liaising with internal and external stakeholders across a range of disciplines, solving business problems for clients  Measures of success  In three months, you would have: • You will be up to speed with the Advanced Analytics team value proposition and able to articulate this confidently. • You will have started to build relationships with the key decision makers in the team and agency. • You will be able to build data sets for modelling related work including data manipulation, data cleansing, and organisation.  In six months, you would have: • Provided structured data to your line manager • Be confident using our available range of tools and software to organise and visualise data • Started to work on your own allocated projects and ad hoc requests  In 12 months, you would have: • Become a key support for your line manager and peers • Fully work on a project under your line manager’s guidance from start to end including delivery of results • Nominated champion in your area of expertise  What you will need: • A degree ideally in a STEM related subject. Candidates with relevant degrees and demonstrated coding skills will also be considered. • Experience working across either Media, Marketing, Consultancy, Business Analytics would be beneficial. • Proficiency in SQL, R, Python, data science segmentation/prediction algorithms would be beneficial. • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) • Exceptional verbal, written, communication skills with an analytical mind set. • An excellent work ethic, problem solving and proficient time management skills. • Able to work to deadlines in a fast-paced agency environment. • Have a passion for learning and work effectively in a team environment. • MS Office skills with advance knowledge in Excel. Apply now and send your CV via the link!
job_description.532: Data & Insights Analyst - Fundraising & Marketing • Salary: $90K - $100K + Super + Salary packing • Location: Melbourne, Sydney or remote • Opportunities to continually advance your Data Analytics career. We are seeking candidates with a strong background in proven data and data insights expertise. This role goes beyond merely aggregating data into basic tabular reports; it involves the ability to comprehend and present insights in a compelling manner. These insights will not only significantly impact the donor experience but also go beyond seeking new financial opportunities. We are looking for individuals who are actively dedicated to enhancing our business offerings.  About The Role…  In this role, you will be tasked with pioneering innovative approaches to harness consumer behavioural data. Your goal is to derive descriptive and prescriptive insights that will guide optimal decision-making. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating interactive and automated dashboards that empower our fundraising team to make strategic decisions through proactive in-depth analysis and insights.  Key Responsibilities… • Build and Provide insights for the individual giving team in fundraising. • Develop subject matter expertise in the various channels used by the individual giving team. • Engage with business users to consult and recommend best possible way to answer their business data questions. • Provide rapid answers to business questions using a mix of queries and visualisations. • Support ad hoc data requests from across business areas. • Design and build reporting data models that support user self-serve reporting. • Identify data to integrate with the warehouse to develop actionable insights to drive business decisions. • Build customer segmentation analytics and campaign performance reporting. • Proactively organising training and development activities for business to facilitate adaption. • Design, build, test and present meaningful insights from a complex range of data.  Skills And Experience • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field. • 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field. • 1-2 years’ experience working with fundraising teams • Experience with data visualisation and querying tools such as Power BI and SQL. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes. • Strong ability to work in T-SQL and DAX queries. • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. • Experience in developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualisations. • Knowledge of fundraising and marketing analytics and metrics. • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.  More About The Role…  Furthermore, you will play a vital role in supporting the enhancement of consumer engagement strategies and product-specific initiatives. Leveraging technical solutions and advanced analytics, you will be at the forefront of developing ground breaking solutions for consumer profiling and segmentation.  Through your work in extracting insights from diverse data sources, you will drive strategic and operational initiatives. These initiatives will lead to increased revenue, improved efficiency, cost optimisation, and an elevated supporter experience, ultimately contributing to the organisation's success and sustainable growth.  A Little About Our Client…  Mission Australia, a renowned national charity with over 160 years of dedicated service, is on a mission to help vulnerable Australians find their path to independence. They are committed to tackling homelessness, supporting struggling families, addressing mental health challenges, and fighting substance dependencies. Mission Australia thrives on the support of everyday Australians, corporate partners, and a passionate team of professionals.  Next step is to APPLY…  Ready to embark on an epic journey where your data skills make a real difference? Send us your application, including a cover letter and resume, send it through Beaumont People now! Join Mission Australia and become a data wizard on a mission to end homelessness and help communities thrive! Apply now and be part of something truly magical!  Don’t tick all the boxes? That’s okay, we like thinking outside the box. We value skills, passion, and drive. So, if this job resonates with you, we want to hear from you! If you would like to have a confidential chat, please contact Jack or Dean on 02 9133 9322 or email dean@beaumontpeople.com.au  Beaumont People believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way. We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. job_description.533: swipeJobs is a fast-growing, disruptive, and award-winning on-demand staffing platform that is transforming the way people find work and businesses manage their workforce. Our platform connects job seekers with employers, allowing businesses to easily fill their staffing needs. We are slowly becoming the stand alone market leader in the US market and are looking for the right candidate to join us on this exciting journey.  We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our tech team. As an Analyst at swipejobs, you will help us analyse large amounts of raw information to find patterns, optimise our performance using large data sets, build data products to extract valuable business insights, analyse trends and help us make better decisions.  Responsibilities: • Lead workshops to facilitate product ideation and continuous improvement of our product practice • Delivering insights and analysis for data across our software • Detect valuable data sources and automate collection processes • Perform preprocessing of structured and unstructured data • Review large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns • Create predictive models and machine-learning algorithms • Modify and combine different models through ensemble modelling • Organise and present information using data visualisation techniques • Develop and suggest solutions and strategies to business challenges  Experience: • Hands-on experience in reviewing reports and data to determine if further action is required • Understanding of how to manage risks and issues, dependencies and change in scope • Commercial experience managing multiple data focused projects across multi-disciplinary teams • Good communication, presentation, organisational skills; including the ability to manage changing priorities and meeting deadlines • Significant experience in data mining, machine-learning and operations research • Good knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Spark, Scala, Java or C++ is an asset • Strong math and analytical skills, with business acumen  Why swipejobs: • A chance to work on a market leading US software product • End to end exposure to the full software development life cycle • Working in a start up environment with modern offices located in North Sydney • A flat organisational structure where everyone is always accessible • Operating in a fast paced and dynamic environment that provides exciting challenges daily • A chance to work on modern technology stack which is cutting edge even for the US • Food provided throughout the day whilst working in the office including a free lunch • Regular social events in and outside the office  If you are talented, driven and interested in joining us in our journey; we would like to hear from you.  Note: Only candidates authorised to work in Australia will be considered.
job_description.534: Senior Technical Data Analyst • 03 Oct 2023 • Sydney • Contract  Major leaders in the vocational field here in Sydney CBD, have a major ERP Program underway and they need x 2 Snr Technical Data Analysts who have end-to-end ERP experience with either SAP, Oracle, TechOne or similar (HR and Finance modules ideal).  The ERP program aims to deliver an integrated and standardised suite of business applications enterprise-wide, with significant change improvements and impacts to People (HR) and Finance business processes across the People and Finance Units.  Experience • 5+ years of experience as Data Analyst (SQL, and Python) or related roles. • Strong hands-on experience and technical proficiency with advanced SQL skills (Oracle and SQL Server, advanced SQL analytical queries / scripts, stored procedures, functions, views, performance improvements and optimisation), preferably with experience in data management, warehousing,ETL/ELT data pipelines, API concepts and analysis, data quality, data modelling, reporting and visualisation. • Strong hands-on experience and technically proficient with exploratory data analysis skills using python, python libraries including modular programming. • Strong hands-on experience and technically proficient with business intelligence and visualisation tools like Power BI, Jupyter/Colab notebooks, Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, Google Looker. • Experience with cloud data platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Snowflake preferred. • Experience with cloud databases like Redshift, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Firestore, etc. preferred. • Experience with ETL technologies like SSIS, AWS Glue, AZURE Data Factory, Google Cloud Data Flow, Informatica, Talend, Pentaho preferred. • Experience with data modelling and data modelling tools like dbt, ERStudio, Erwin, Visio preferred. • Experience with DevOps technologies like Git, Jenkins, Azure DevOps preferred. • Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with ERP systems and their integration with other enterprise applications and databases including data migration. • A strong background in ERP system analysis, writing technical specifications, systems management, and issue resolution. • Experience in large-scale Data and Technology Change Programs through delivery and transition to business-as-usual arrangements • Experience within the University / higher education sector is preferred. • Previous experience with implementing multiple ERP software suites is preferred (e.g., Oracle, Workday).  Looking for immediate starters or 2-week notice who are located in Sydney and happy to work onsite at a minimum or 3 days a week. This may fluctuate to 5 days as the project ramps up.

job_description.536: About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.  Get to Know our Team:  The Supply Equity Platform (SEP) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SEP team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including resource and product optimization. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce high quality results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SEP offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.  In this Role, you’ll get to:  • Manage complex analytics processes and algorithms to ensure their continued smooth operation, identifying root causes and debugging them where needed. • Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organization. • Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at improving the operations of our automated systems (e.g. root cause detection, anomaly detection, performance analysis). • Develop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting them. • Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving resource and product optimization.  What you’ll Need to Succeed: • A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping. • Either Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive programming experience. • Experience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must). • Have working experience in Python for data analysis. • A basic understanding of statistics and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations. • The ability to visualize and understand complex data flows, pipelines, and processes.  It’s Great if you have: • Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark. • Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality.  #sanfrancisco #newyork #seattle #boston #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #paris #london #tokyo #dhaka #vienna #edinburgh #manchester #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #singapore #ENG #IT  Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.  We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .  To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
job_description.537: Leading Government client based in Sydney is looking for Data Quality Analyst with Informatica Experience! Initial 20 weeks contract plus potential extension! APPLY NOW!  Primary purpose of the role: The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for understanding data quality as well as supporting the Data Management Tools that manage our metadata management, data lineage and data quality monitoring. As a valued member of the Data Management team you will be part of the transformation of the data quality management capabilities. Key accountabilities: • Work with data owners, stewards and subject matter experts to understand the data quality requirements of the business, document those requirements as data quality specifications, and implement those specifications as data quality rules in the Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS). • Manage data quality issues and keep the master reference data current where necessary to ensure that data is valid, accurate, complete, consistent, timely and suitable for the various needs of the organisation. • Support projects with the required data quality-related functions, such as but not limited to identification of data sources, extraction and transformation of data, data mapping, data reconciliation, data cleansing, data aggregation, data deduplication, data quality assessment, and root cause analysis of data quality issues. • Establish and maintain good collaborative working relationships with stakeholders, both internal and external. • Provide subject matter expert advice and support to stakeholders, both internal and external in relation to data quality. • Help with the continuous improvement of existing data quality management processes and systems, and where necessary, establish effective new ones, leveraging on the analytics industry best practices, tools, and techniques. • Prepare correspondence, briefing documents, and reports for, or present analysis, findings, and summaries to, senior management on data quality-related issues. • Perform such other data analytics-related functions that the Manager, Data Management, may assign from time-to-time or as the exigency of business requires.  Essential requirements: • Pre-employment checks. • Tertiary qualification plus at least 4 years experience in a data role. • Sound knowledge of data analysis, knowing SQL is an advantage, advanced Excel, to cleanse and manipulate data, and/or build reports  Typical experience: • Hands on experience in Data Mining, built or defined Data Quality rules in a line of business either writing SQL Scripts or using tools such as Informatica Data Quality; or • A broad range of experience in data analysis applications in complex information system environments; or • Experience working on and sound understanding of data lakes, data warehouses, and data marts; or • Experience in the creation and maintenance of data dictionaries, management of metadata, and/or maintenance of master and reference data; and • Experience as a workshops contributor with demonstrable experience building strong relationships with peers, stakeholders, and working with them to deliver relevant data analysis and/or actionable business insights and solutions that create value.  If interested APPLY NOW! job_description.538: • APS5 Data Analyst  Overview  Our client in Sydney is seeking APS5 Data Analyst which will be an important analytical role within the Economics and Pricing Branch. The position will support the data extraction and summarization of the internal system repository data required for decision making. The person has also a responsibility to support data analysis process for the Pricing Data and Reporting Unit. Candidates must have experience and strong writing and presentation skills to translate complex information into easily understandable language  Responsibilities may include but are not limited to: • Extracting, cleansing, and summarizing of data from internal / external sources. • Support data scrapping exercises with development of the automatization process. • Support market prices regression analysis and collaborate on pricing recommendations. • Support the Scheme Actuary Division to fulfill statutory requirements of the NDIS Act 2013 including the provision of data and analysis for reporting to the Board, Minister and for the purpose of public data sharing. • Support the Annual Pricing Review with summaries, statistical analysis and presentation writing. • Support SDA quarterly report and analysis. • Update and maintain pricing performance dashboard and continuously work on enhancements. • Support design of statistical and mathematical models to undertake analytical work. • Undertaking ad hoc modelling requests and report production. • Collaborate with internal teams to escalate complex issues and ensure timely resolution. • Contribute to process improvement efforts to enhance the experience for all stakeholders. • Provide additional support across the Branch and Division when and where needed and undertaking specific initiatives when required.  Essential criteria • Two years’ experience with clean / transform / summarise large data sets. • Have demonstrated ability in tools such as excel/VBA and R or other programming language such as Python. • Demonstrated high level of skill working both autonomously and collaboratively in a team. • Detail-oriented, highly analytical, and able to work with large datasets. • Excellent Report Writing skills (including tables & graphics) • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and handle multiple priorities effectively.  Desirable criteria • Understanding of contemporary issues of people with disability • Experience with Dashboards development • Previous experience/exposure with data transformation projects.  Australian Citizens. job_description.540: Hi, we’re PEXA  Every time a house is bought, sold or refinanced in Australia your lawyer, conveyancer and lender will most likely use a digital platform to settle your property, this is where we come in. PEXA’s world-first digital settlement platform has revolutionised the way we exchange property in Australia helping over 20,000 people a week safely settle their homes. And this is just the beginning. Our data and insights are helping organisations unlock the intel they need to drive change and possibilities.  Since starting our journey in 2010, we now employ a team of over 1,000 people working across multiple continents. We’re still growing, innovating and looking ahead, but behind our greatest achievements, there is a team of curious creators and big thinkers. That’s why, we’re looking for ambitious people like yourself to join the team.  About The Role  Are you passionate about sustainability and the environment? Want to be part of a team that is bonded by a common purpose and is involved in solving one of the most complex and pressing issues of our times?? Do you like challenges and learning new things.  What You'll Do • Research climate change at global, regional, and local levels. • Manage, clean, and interpret data sets, ensuring data integrity and adherence to ethical and security standards. • Apply data science techniques like predictive modelling and statistical inference. • Oversee data-driven projects from problem identification to delivery. • Enhance data science processes and best practices within the team to solve business problems. • Conduct research projects and prepare reports for the Executive Leadership Team and Elected Members on sustainability issues related to climate change. • Develop models and methodologies based on industry best practices for climate change scenario analysis and natural hazard modelling.  What You'll Bring • Strong understanding of climate change and risk and resilience concepts. • Experience working with climate and geospatial data. • 3-5 years of industry experience, including proficiency in programming languages for data analysis (e.g., Python, R, Bash, SQL). • Relevant tertiary qualifications in environmental engineering, environmental science, or a related field. • Exceptional analytical skills and the ability to investigate and interpret environmental data. • Proven track record of driving climate resilience and climate change adaptation outcomes in large, complex organizations.  #LI-AN1  A career at PEXA starts with you!  If you think you have the required skills, an appetite to learn and would be a great fit, we’d love to hear from you – even if you don’t tick all the boxes. At PEXA we support your growth and help you discover your full potential.  Why join us  • Flexibility is in our DNA, with no set office days – work from any location in Australia  • Your holistic wellbeing is important to us. Enjoy meditation, yoga, boxing classes and a wellness day each month to recharge!  • We know that work is just one aspect of your life. That’s why we offer up to 12 weeks ‘workcation’ for you to extend personal travel time and work remotely  • Take the opportunity to purchase up to four weeks additional annual leave per year  • Learn from the best and upskill with PEXA Academy certifications and grow your career  Our commitment to our people and a better future  At PEXA we want you to embrace your best self each day, creating an environment where everyone can contribute and participate, so that every person can reach their full potential. We want our people to feel equally valued, supported and celebrated. With market-leading benefits that make a difference, we’re committed to supporting individuals, families and carers. Your culture, gender, sexual orientation, language and other attributes make you unique! We couldn't be prouder to have a team that reflects the richness of our wider community.  We’re a proud ‘Circle Back Initiative’ Employer and commit to responding to every applicant.  Stay Connected  A career at PEXA is exciting, challenging and rewarding, and we’re always on the lookout for talented individuals to join the team. You can learn more about life at PEXA on our website and social channels too.
job_description.541: Are you a driven Data Analyst with a strong IT background and a passion for data analysis? This is an exciting opportunity to work with the largest project in Sydney, a once-in-a-lifetime $5B PPP venture. If you are eager to apply your data integration skills, build APIs, and extract insights from data, we invite you to be a part of our dynamic team.  Main Activities/Responsibilities • Demonstrate strong understanding of the business objectives and the end user deliverables of data integration projects and align the data ingestion and processing solutions accordingly. • Participate in the conceptual phases of identifying and solving business problems and initiatives as a Data Interfaces subject matter expert. • Understand and promote data quality and consistent data definitions to the business users of the BI/Analytics and Interface functions. • Liaise with Leadership, Customers and Joint venture partners to fully understand data context and business objectives to be delivered. • Gather, clarify, validate and document detailed interface requirements using best-practice requirements gathering tools and techniques. Ensure data quality by cleaning and validating datasets to remove errors and inconsistencies. • Understand, analyse and interpret data sets to be ingested from rapidly changing complex source and target data technologies and • Build, test, deploy and monitor automated “Hands-free”, end-to-end application interfaces. • Develop and maintain data models, algorithms, and dashboards for Project requirements. • Provide PowerBI analytics and report development and maintenance backfill support for the other BI/Analytics Developers and Data Interface Developers in the Data Team during periods of reduced staffing or high data team workloads.  Requirements • Minimum 3+ years' experience in a similar role • Relevant tertiary qualification in Computer Science Studies • Industry certifications in BI and Analytics technologies is desirable. • Real life experience with non-Microsoft BI technologies such as Snowflake™ and/or Informatica™ is advantageous. • Demonstrable experience in the development of end-to-end, Hands off, fault tolerant Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) packages between multiple source technologies and target technologies for a diverse set of stakeholders in a fast-paced environment. • Demonstrable experience in using Data Integration technologies for delivering complex, fault tolerant data integrations and data warehouse artefacts. • Thorough understanding of using data manipulation languages in delivering meaningful data aggregations and statistical attributes to data warehouse and Datamart elements during the data ingestion and cleanup process is essential. • Demonstrable experience with common API and associated principles (Rest/Soap, JSON/XML, Stateless, Asynchronous) • Knowledge of Big Data technology such as Hadoop and related BI/Reporting technologies such as SPARK, STORM, Hive, Kafka, HDFS, D3, etc is advantageous. • Knowledge or experience Robotic Process Automation (RPA) tools would be advantageous.  What We Offer • A supportive and collaborative work environment that fosters personal growth and professional development. • The opportunity to work on a landmark project and contribute to its success through data-driven insights. • Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and the chance to enhance your skills in Data warehousing technologies and business intelligence tools. • Competitive remuneration package and attractive benefits.  To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your experience in data analysis, and why you are the ideal candidate for the Reporting Analyst position.

job_description.543: Be at the heart of our business as we innovate and invest for a better future.In Group Treasury, you will work in the financial centre of Macquarie, driving real change for our businesses. You will be part of a rapidly evolving function that is curious and not afraid to ask, ‘how can we do better?’ A team that is bold, always challenging the status quo, seeing solutions where others see obstacles. Join a team that is generous with its skills, knowledge, and expertise, so that we can achieve great things together.We are committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace, where different ideas are embraced. We believe that flexibility is a key driver to our people’s success and welcome the opportunity to discuss what flexibility means to you which can include part time.Group Treasury – CapitalBeing part of Group Treasury means you will provide strategic advice to our businesses, collaborating to ensure Macquarie has the resources needed to meet our ongoing commercial requirements and pursue growth opportunities.The Capital team is responsible for management of the Group’s capital position and credit ratings. The team develops frameworks to determine the appropriate amount and mix of capital, considering regulatory, ratings agency, debt investor and shareholder expectations; and recommends and executes on capital actions.Help transform our Group Treasury function and evolve the future of finance at Macquarie.This unique role involves supporting a business unit aligned team within the Group Treasury Transformation Programme on using data to solve analytical problems primarily in the regulatory capital domain, but with scope to grow into and liquidity risk management too. You will be responsible for:Supporting the implementation of the in-house capital engine and, under the guidance of a SME, using your data handing skillset to prepare extensive test data sets across the full spectrum of business unit productsWith guidance from SMEs, using your coding skills to develop automated test processes that replicate the regulatory capital rules for APS 112 and APS 113 to allow testing of the new capital engineDeveloping a deep understanding of a business units product data and associated source systems, to support the development of data-based solutions to ad hoc queries in the regulatory capital or liquidity risk domain.This is a hands-on role requires the successful candidate to be a self-starter with a problem-solving mindset. You will need to be comfortable analysing and interrogating complex data using appropriate tools and be comfortable discussing your approach with a variety of peers.Exposure to Basel capital or liquidity rules are an advantage but an interest in financial risk is a must as is the ability to work with large data sets.What you will bring to team and the role:Drive with outstanding attention to detail, a learning mindset, flexibility and adaptabilitynumerate with an active interest in understanding data and what is representsfluency in a data management tool such as Alteryx, SQL or R/ PythonComfort communicating your thoughts and opinions to SME and peersability to foster and build a collaborative working relationship with various stakeholdersFinally, you will:be curious, always asking “How can we do this better”be bold, seeing challenges as opportunities that can be overcome as a teamhave a tertiary qualification, preferably in business, finance, a quantitative field or similarhave good communication skills and the ability to explain how you arrived at your conclusionAbout MacquarieA career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 19,200+ employees and offices in 34 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.Job no: FMG-972384Work type: Maximum termLocation: SydneyCategory: Mid-level, Junior, Data & Analytics, Quantitative AnalyticsGroup: Financial Management GroupDivision: Group TreasuryRecruiter: Melinda BullockOpening Date: 10/4/2023

job_description.545: Primary Details Time Type: Full time  Worker Type: Employee  The opportunity • Engage with businesses to help mature their data management practices by fostering development and collaboration amongst data stewards and coaching them in the use of data governance tools and processes. • Sydney, NSW (flexible) • Permanent, full-time position Your new role:  In this role you will work closely with data stewards, senior management and business units to drive the development and adoption of policy and governance processes. This will include assisting with policy formation, raising awareness and education and driving cultural change into the organization.  Primary Responsibilities will include: • Engaging with and supporting business and technical data stewards so that they are clear on their role and how to execute their responsibilities. • Facilitating activities across the data steward network to promote collaboration and address cross-functional issues. • Working with key partners in Risk, Security, Privacy, and other Data Governance colleagues to align communication and coordination of initiatives that affect data stewards. • Organising and running events to promote the data steward community. • Playing a key role in developing data governance processes and guidelines, and in policy formation. • Providing insight on the impact of regulatory, policy and operational change. • Driving cultural change into all parts of the organization. • Keeping abreast of developments, trends and best practices in data governance and management. Your story so far  To be successful in this role you will have a sound understanding of organisation change management and leadership practices in policy, cultural or transformation initiatives, as well as a natural affinity for reaching out and engaging with people across an organisation. An understanding of data management principles and practices and their implementation would help, as well as familiarity with methods and software tools used in governance processes and/or measurement and analysis. Your experience is having worked alongside management to drive and foster a culture of continuous improvement, motivation, collaboration, empowerment and buy-in across the business and other functions.  Required skills and experience: • Knowledge and understanding of implementing data stewardship principles and practices, and dealing with accountability, ownership, classification and roles and responsibilities. • Critical thinking to make data driven decisions backed with strong problem-solving skills to address data related issues and challenges. • Strong verbal, written and visualization skills to communicate effectively with stakeholders, including partner businesses, stewards and other teams, on data processes, practices and having an impact in driving cultural change. • Proficient in conducting audits and ensuring compliance with data governance policies and regulations are followed. • Strong business acumen to understand QBE's businesses and how data governance aligns to and is used to support the same. • Additional experience in the insurance industry will be a plus. • Ability to adapt to the evolving data management needs and requirements, and keeping abreast with changing principles and industry regulations. • Collaboration with other parties to establish and enforce data governance policies and promote cultural change. About QBE  We can never really predict what's around the corner, but at QBE we're asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future - helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.  We're an international insurer that's building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.  And our people will be at the centre of our success. We're proud to work together, and encourage each other enable resilience for our customers, our environment, our economies and our communities.  With more than more than 11,000 people working across 27 countries, we're big enough to make a real impact, but small enough to provide a friendly workplace, where people are down-to-earth, passionate and kind.  We believe this is our moment - what if it was yours too?  Your career at QBE - let's make it happen!  Benefits  QBE is an employer of choice amongst Australian insurers, offering a great range of benefits which enable you to bring your best self to work; including competitive salaries and bonus structures, hybrid working for the flexibility of working from home and the office, super matching and generous leave allowances.  In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and additional support services for our diverse community of employees. We've won many awards highlighting our strong culture and values, reinforcing our family and community focus.  Apply now  APPLY NOW and let's make it happen!  Applications close on 12th October 2023 at 11:55pm AEST.  Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment. QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at recruitment@qbe.com  Application Close Date: 12/10/2023 11:59 PM  How to Apply:  To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.  Equal Employment Opportunity:  QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.
job_description.546: Employment Type: Permanent Full Time  Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3  Remuneration: $122,850 - $139,559  Hours Per Week: 38  Requisition ID: REQ437308  Location: Cumberland Hospital  Where you'll be working  Western Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) is responsible for providing primary and secondary health care for people living in the Auburn, Blacktown, and The Hills Shire, Holroyd and Parramatta Local Government Areas (LGAs) and tertiary care to residents of the Greater Western Region. We are committed to our vision of 'better health services for the people of western Sydney and beyond' and to the delivery of health care or related services in line with our core values of collaboration, openness, respect and empowerment.  What You'll Be Doing  The primary objective of the position is to provide business analysis expertise to translate business data into meaningful insights to support informed decision making by developing innovative data analytics solutions.  The major focus of the position is to work closely with stakeholders as a project lead to manage development projects end-to-end and document and review current processes, gather business requirements, undertake business data analysis and identify opportunities for process improvement.  This role is required to liaise with stakeholders and system owners to understand reporting and analytics needs and document objectives and reporting requirements. The role also involves maintaining functional relationships with all stakeholders to gather information, understand stakeholders interests and manage expectations.  A key focus of this role is to utilise and improve agile project management framework and processes and implement change management initiatives to drive improvements in health services and patient outcomes  This role incorporates project management skills, business analysis skills, change management skills to design and implement analytics solutions.  An important responsibility is to develop and manage the implementation of HL7 (FHIR) real time data sets and other data assets for use in advanced analytics solutions.  Benefits Of Working For Western Sydney Local Health District • Paid Allocated Day Off (ADO) every month, in addition to your annual leave • Salary Packaging - lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees) http://wslhdintranet.wsahs.nsw.gov.au/salary-packaging-with-smartsalary • Meal entertainment lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees) http://wslhdintranet.wsahs.nsw.gov.au/salary-packaging-with-smartsalary • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional counselling and coaching service that offers confidential, short-term support for work-related and personal issues, which you and your immediate family can access • Managers Support - Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional consultative service for all managers, HR or senior staff that is confidential and unlimited for people management support • Fitness Passport - permanent employees and their immediate family members can sign-up for this affordable membership which allows access to an extensive range of gyms, pools and fitness services from multiple providers across NSW, • Generous leave conditions in accordance with NSW Health (State) awards Recognition of prior relevant service may be considered toward commencing salary • Leave may be transferrable from other public sector agencies in accordance with leave mobility provisions  People with disabilities who meet the selection criteria are encouraged to apply; and where required, WSLHD will implement reasonable adjustment consistent with industry standard.  Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal job applicants by providing information about applying for roles in NSW Health organisations. For more information, please visit https://www.steppingup.health.nsw.gov.au/ Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.  Westmead hospital car parking allocation model is changing. There is a waitlist for parking for new staff commencing at Westmead Hospital. This does not apply for staff with disability.  Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.  Selection Criteria • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or advanced degree in related discipline and/or relevant experience. Recent experience working across data or analytics focused roles utilising a consultative approach to solving business problems using PRINCE2 Agile methodology. • Strong knowledge and practical experience in working with Information Strategy, Data Governance & Architecture, Big Data & Analytics, Information Lifecycle Management, Business intelligence visualisation initiatives and experience developing software solutions is a key requirement for this position. • Strong analytical skills including the ability to analyse and interpret health information, experience in data modelling and a background of hands-on experience with ETL, database management, BI dashboards and application development. Significant experience delivering analytics and/or business intelligence projects utilising innovative thinking and the latest technology in data and analytics. • Demonstrated organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise competing demands and achieve results with a customer focused approach. • Proven application of problem-solving skills to address complex health data and analytics challenges. Proven ability to work with data architects, analysts and engineers to deliver solutions that deliver high value insights to business performance. • Demonstrated excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with extensive experience in engaging senior business stakeholders to communicate complex data and analytics concepts and ideas. • Proven effectiveness coaching and advising stakeholders, users and staff on the project management methodology, whilst always fostering a performance based and customer focused work culture. • Proven capacity to develop, implement and promote Business Analytics Services Corporate initiatives, including the capability to plan, manage change, improve performance and project manage.  Need more information? • Click here for the Position Description • Find out more about applying for this position  For role related queries or questions contact David Pryce on David.Pryce@health.nsw.gov.au  Applications Close: 17th October 2023  Agency: Health
job_description.547: As an APS 6 Data Analyst, in our Data Program business area, you’ll use your expertise in data analysis, modelling techniques and business knowledge to address business problems and support data-driven decision making. You’ll use a variety of tools, languages and technical knowledge to research, extract, analyse and interpret data and results with a strong commitment to quality assurance, re-usability and curation of data sources and solutions. You’ll be accountable for organising your workflow and make decisions concerning your work area and team plans. You may be required to lead and manage the work of junior employees and be responsible for reviewing the quality of their work.  Our ideal candidate  • have expertise in using a variety of tools including different dialects of SQL (Teradata, MSSQL, Postgres or similar) and visualisation tools (PowerBI, COGNOS or similar) • are skilled in extracting, analysing and interpreting data, delivering complex and technical results through logical, succinct reports and presentations • have some experience or an understanding in using version control software (Git, GitLab, TFS) • present complex and abstract information in an accessible and effective format suitable for their target audience • exercise sound judgment to provide detailed technical, professional, and policy advice in relation to complex problems and assist in strategic planning, program and project management and policy development • equip team members with their technical expertise and guidance to achieve a positive client experience.  Qualifications in a related discipline (i.e. Computer Science, IT, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.) would be highly regarded but not essential. Certifications in AWS, Azure, Power BI and Teradata would be looked at favourably.  About the area  Our Data Program is the primary data and analytics hub. The scope of our work touches every area of the business, underpinning our activity every day. We are at the forefront of innovation, playing a critical role in organisational change including migration to cloud, compliance activity and the implementation of PowerBI across the agency. We have an ambitious program of work, focused on strengthening our data foundations, transforming the data and analytics experience, and evolving automation and artificial intelligence (AI).  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.  experience  4 years  skills  Data Analyst with SQL (Teradata, MSSQL, Postgres or similar) and visualisation tools (PowerBI, COGNOS or similar)  qualifications • Qualifications in a related discipline (i.e. Computer Science • IT • Mathematics • Statistics • etc.) • would be highly regarded but not essential.  education  Bachelor Degree
job_description.548: Position: Senior Business Data Analyst-Banking  Location: Sydney  Job Description ·  Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities: • Mid/senior level experience in IT software project delivery or business / tech roles • 5+ years experience as an Agile project BA / Sr. BA • 2-3+ years of experience in Banking project as a BA. Out of this, at least 1 year in banking risk related exposure is required. It can be any aspect of banking risk (ops risk, credit risk) but we do need someone who knows banking risk at a high level • Some familiarity with Data analysis, particularly running basic SQL query to check the data source and mapping of where the data is coming from is required • Excellent written and verbal skills - the BAs and Data analysts will heavily be engaged in business meetings, facilitation / elicitation workshops and needing to change manage or influence business to think newer ways of risk reporting • Excellent ability to document analysis of reporting and its underlying layers for ex: excel or word documents that show the history of where data is being sourced and where it is originating etc. Further fine tune these documents with inputs from a variety of stakeholders • A go-getter, curious and analytically minded analyst who does not mind questioning the status quo and understands how to position constructive point of views without making it a conflict • Strong work ethics, self-initiated - someone who is not waiting for the instructions to delivery value • Past experience as a Data analyst, while not a MUST - will be desired • Background in accounting, risk, banking operations (Corp and Commercial) will be highly desired  Job Types: Permanent, Full-time  Salary: $100,000.00 – $140,000.00 per year  Schedule: • 8 hour shift  COVID-19 considerations: Yes

job_description.551: If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?  What's in it for you?  We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.  You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  What We're Looking For  Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.  Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.  Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.  Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.  Run human centred design sessions with end-users.  Communicating and influencing stakeholders.  Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  Skills And Attributes For Success  Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.  Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.  Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.  Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems.  Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.  Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.  Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.
job_description.552: australia sydney contract au$600 - au$800 per day  Due to growth, our Federal Government client is seeking an EL1 Data Analyst to join their team in Richmond. Reporting to the Data Analyst EL2, you will be working in the Chief Risk Office group which provides strategic and operational direction and compliance function to ensure payment integrity and facilitate a reduction of potential fraud and non-compliance to the organisation.  As a Data Analyst you will exercise a considerable degree of independence to engage in very complex problem solving and issues management within the risk functions. The position will exercise sound decision-making and judgement to produce high level policy advice and operational support.  The position will coordinate and assume responsibility to undertake detailed or sensitive projects that may include performing varied activities involving many different and unrelated processes or methods that may impact on the strategic or operational outcomes that support the clients’ objectives.  Responsibilities may include but are not limited to: • Undertaking day-to-day analytical work and project management on a range of tasks including regular and one-off analyses and ad hoc requests. • Maintaining knowledge in understanding business areas with regard to business context, goals and key performance indicators. • Contributing to the development of reporting, assisting in the establishment of quality assurance and governance processes around all Chief Risk Office (CRO) reporting. • Analysing data, interpreting trends, utilising problem solving, an ability to connect analysis and insights to address problems and questions. • Collaborating with key staff within the CRO and across the client to ensure consistent use of data and reporting and internal/external messaging. • Communicating effectively verbally and in writing, presenting the outcomes of work undertaken and tailoring to context. • Monitoring and development of a small group of less experienced team members in the Monitoring Team.  To apply for this opportunity, you will need the following: • Be an Australian citizen • Be able to attend the office 3 days per week in Richmond • Have previous leadership experience • Have strong experience as a Data Analyst analysing data and presenting data, interpreting trends and insights • Previous experience working in a Risk team. • Experience working within a fraud or payments area would be preferred. For more information, please call Shelley on 0418 572 482 or email shelley.harrison@talentinternational.com Shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Successful candidates will need to complete background checks prior to starting. Applications up to the 18th September.
job_description.553: Senior Data Analyst – Enterprise Resource Planning Program  Senior Technical Data Analyst working on the ERP Program as part of the IT and Operations Unit. • Senior Technical Data Analyst • Sydney / Hybrid • 12-month contract • Daily Rate $900-$1000 p/d • SQL, Python, PowerBI, Cloud Data Platform, ETL Technologies preferred • Experience with Waterfall/Agile Methodologies  Seeking a highly technical Senior Data Analyst to join the team working on the Enterprise Resource Planning Program within one of Australia’s top Universities, if you have strong analytical and problem-solving skills related to ERP architecture, this could be the one for you.  About You: • 5+ years’ experience within Data Analytics or related roles. • Strong hands-on experience and technical proficiency in SQL (Oracle and SQL Server), Data warehousing, ETL/ELT pipelining, and visualization. • Experience with cloud data platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure or Snowflake. • ETL technologies such as SSIS, AWS Glue, AZURE Data Factory, Google Cloud. • Hands on experience with ERP system integration and ERP system analysis. • Experience in higher education is preferable.  Key Responsibilities: • Perform ad-hoc, on demand in depth data analysis which includes data profiling, data cleansing and preparation, extraction, exploration, and data visualization. • Create data interface and documentation for ERP integrations. • Contribute to the end-to-end data solution design and strategy. • Collaborate with program stakeholders to design the technical architecture of the new ERP system. • Drive effective and efficient Program and project delivery through Water and Agile methodologies. • Coach and mentor other project team members including proposing ideas for improving the standard of procedures.  HOW TO APPLY:  If you feel like this is the right fit for you, please apply through the above link or reach out to sophieb@charterhouse.com.au

job_description.555: Currently, we are in search of a Senior Data Analyst with exceptional skills and strong analytical insight. This professional will contribute to bolstering our marketing activities.  It's important to highlight that extensive commercial SQL experience is a fundamental requirement for excelling in this role.  Your responsibilities:  ✅ Establishing expertise in customer base and performance marketing channels, involving conversion data, customer journeys, funnel analysis, and attribution. Additionally, becoming well-versed in the modern data and analytics technology stack, particularly focusing on Google Analytics, AppsFlyer, Snowplow, Tableau, and Looker (Data Studio).  ✅ Gathering, refining, and scrutinizing marketing data to extract invaluable insights and detect trends.  ✅ Formulating and managing dashboards and reports that monitor essential key performance indicators (KPIs) pertinent to marketing campaigns.  ✅ Furnishing regular performance reports to stakeholders, accentuating significant discoveries and actionable recommendations.  ✅ Conducting A/B testing and multivariate analysis to optimize ad creatives, targeting approaches, and bidding strategies.  ✅ Analyzing user behaviors spanning marketing channels to pinpoint possibilities for enhancing conversion rates.  ✅ Tracking and reporting funnel performance metrics encompassing acquisition, activation, retention, and revenue.  ✅ Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to implement strategies aimed at enhancing funnel efficiency.  ✅ Safeguarding data precision and integrity by executing data governance procedures and conducting regular data audits.  ✅ Formulating actionable insights and suggestions grounded in data analysis to endorse strategic decision-making.  Qualifications we're seeking:  ✅ A Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. Possessing a postgraduate degree would be highly advantageous.  ✅ Practical experience in a role similar to a Data Analyst within the realm of performance marketing.  ✅ Profound analytical aptitude, showcasing mastery in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization using tools like SQL, Python, R, or Excel.  ✅ Proficiency in utilizing data visualization tools, namely Tableau and Google Looker (Data Studio).  ✅ Familiarity with performance marketing platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, or Adobe Analytics.  ✅ Exemplary attention to detail and a steadfast commitment to maintaining data precision.  ✅ Excellent communication and presentation proficiencies, enabling effective conveyance of intricate information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  ✅ Please be aware that extensive SQL skills are a vital prerequisite as we heavily rely on SQL.  What are the benefits for you?  ✅ An attractive compensation package.  ✅ A premium health and well-being initiative encompassing yearly vaccinations, yoga, meditation, discounted gym memberships, and daily breakfasts and lunches provided four days a week.  ✅ Enjoy a vibrant work atmosphere with Friday afternoon on-site gatherings (wine included!) and monthly programs for celebration and recognition.  ✅ Avail discounted travel, birthday leave, and much more!  If this aligns with your interests and you are confident in your possession of the essential skills and experience to meet the role's demands, we welcome you to apply online today! job_description.558: Do you want your work to make a difference for NSW?Together, we create thriving environments, communities and economies.  Located in NSW - hybrid work from home and office Temporary Full-time role until 30 June 2025 Salary range is $101,850 to $112,530 plus super and leave loading  About the Role Biodiversity Credits Supply Taskforce (the Taskforce) is seeking a Data Analyst to provide data products and reporting services. This will assist the Taskforce in supporting NSW landholders and development proponents with the supply of biodiversity credits across the state. This is an exciting opportunity to actively contribute to the NSW Biodiversity Offsets Scheme by providing data, technical advice and reports to support and inform environmental regulation, environmental programs, associated policies and strategies, often within tight deadlines. The NSW Biodiversity Offset Scheme helps conserve and enhance natural habitats while facilitating development projects, promoting ecological sustainability.  About You You will demonstrate your specialist data knowledge and skills by providing high standards of reporting, technical support and expert advice to internal, front-line operational staff, and external stakeholders. To be successful in the role, you will also have:  Extensive knowledge and experience with Microsoft office software products for data reporting Experience in SQL and spatial visualisation would be beneficial Experience with documenting data flows and metadata Knowledge of natural resource data and ecology would also be beneficial  For more information read the full Role Description: Data Analyst  About Us The Department of Planning and Environment’s (DPE) vision is to create thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department. In our inclusive and accessible workplace, differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging. DPE supports various employee affinity groups, practice flexible working, offer job share and workplace adjustments.  Participation in the NSW Biodiversity Offsets Scheme (BOS) Please read the Biodiversity Offsets Scheme Protocol to understand if it applies to your circumstances. All applicants for this role and new employees with an existing defined interest in the BOS will be required to disclose their personal (or a close family member’s) participation to ensure potential conflict of interests are declared and managed appropriately.  To Apply If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role. DPE strongly recommends all applicants who can be safely vaccinated for COVID-19, to be so.  Applications closes Monday 2 October 2023 at 11:55PM. Should you require further information about the role please contact Felicia Schardin via felicia.schardin@environment.nsw.gov.au. A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months.  Looking for more information or assistance in applying? Our Diversity team can assist to:  provide alternative formats to apply make adjustments to the recruitment process offer information about workplace adjustments and support networks  We encourage people with disability to apply. If you have disability and require more information on adjustments and assistance to apply, contact the Diversity team on Diversity@DPIE.nsw.gov.au (please include reference number). If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander check out Our Mob on Country to see the work we do and get assistance in applying.  Find us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn

job_description.560: The role  We are hiring a Senior Reporting Analyst to join our best-in-the-business Product Planning Team based in our Sydney Head Office.  This is an exciting role and a chance to engage in complex commercial and analytical business questions while building your analytical skills.  You will provide data-driven insights to inform and drive improvements across our business. These insights will lead directly to business outcomes and you will be a central part of improving our product.  As part of a fast-paced team you will have the opportunity to work on a range of projects combining an understanding of various metrics and data sources to help inform decision making. This is an exciting chance to build your technical and analytical skills and have an immediate impact.  What you’ll do • Contribute to the Product Planning roadmap, balancing regular reporting, automation and strategic projects / analysis • Use data extraction programming languages and visualization tools (SQL, Tableau, Excel) to extract the data and provide accurate reporting • Ensure on-time delivery of analysis and follow-up with stakeholders • Own COGS analysis and reporting • Take a logical and forward thinking approach to problem solving • Be confident supporting and challenging team members in the ideation, implementation and review of data-related requests • Work in a cross functional team supporting Product, Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance and other departments  What you’ll bring • Relevant background in Business, Data, Computer Engineering, Science or Economics • Minimum 2 years experience in a hands-on Data Analytics role • A strong analytical and business-oriented mindset • Demonstrated experience using SQL, and Tableau. Excellent knowledge of G Sheets • Excellent interpersonal communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals  What we offer • The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing global food technology companies in an exciting growth phase • Company discount - 70% off HelloFresh boxes • Flexible working arrangements • Egoless environment, constant learning with room for personal growth • Free access to Headspace • HelloFresh Academies - monthly internal learning & development • A diverse and vibrant international environment  Duration: Full time - You must have the right to work full-time in Australia.  Start Date: Immediate - can wait a notice period  Location: Chippendale Head Office  #LI-hybrid
