job_description.562: Data Analyst, Clerk Grade 7/8, NSW • Join a dynamic and innovative agency that uses data to shape the future • Make a difference to the lives of our communities and volunteers through data-driven decision making • Work in a volunteer-based agency supporting communities of NSW • This is a full-time temporary opportunity until 30 June 2024 with the possibility of extension or being made ongoing. • Location: flexible across NSW  About the opportunity  Are you passionate about data and how it can help shape the future of our agency? Do you have the skills and experience to turn data into insights and action? If so, we want to hear from you!  We are looking for a Data Analyst who can help us achieve success through data analysis and insights. You will work closely with the strategy team and use tools like Power BI, Excel, and other solutions to create reports and dashboards that inform our decision making and support our communities and volunteers. You will also be responsible for collecting, cleaning, and visualising data, and identifying long-term trends and opportunities for improvement.  About the NSW SES  Our Mission: NSW SES saving lives and creating safer communities.  Our Vision: A trusted volunteer-based emergency service, working together to deliver excellence in community preparedness and emergency response.  The NSW SES serves the NSW community as the lead agency for floods, storms, and tsunamis as specified by the State Emergency Service Act 1989. We are recognised as the most versatile and widely used emergency service organisation in NSW. Our volunteers are highly skilled, experienced, and well- trained in the wide variety of roles they perform.  Each NSW SES Unit is as unique and varied as the community it serves, reflecting the vast mix of risks faced and roles required in the diverse locations and communities across the state. In addition to flood, storm and tsunami, our Service provides specialist capabilities that include general land rescue, vertical rescue, road crash rescue, and alpine and remote area search and rescue. The NSW SES responded to over 64,000 requests for assistance from the community over the 2021-22 year.  The NSW SES has over 10,000 volunteer members, including reserves, and a  full-time equivalent workforce of over 450. There are 262 volunteer Units across the State and our volunteer Units are either local, community-based Units, State-wide or regional Units established to provide specialist capabilities. They are varied and unique in their capabilities, designed to address specific risks to communities of NSW.  About you  To be successful in this role you will: • Experience in data analysis, modelling, and visualization • Be proficient in Power BI, Excel, and experience with SQL, Python and/or R is desired. • Have relevant tertiary qualification(s) in science, mathematics, computational science or related field and/or equivalent relevant industry knowledge and experience. • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Have excellent communication and presentation skills. • Have a keen interest in learning new technologies and methods. • Have collaborative and proactive attitude.  What we can offer you • Employment with attractive leave entitlements including parental leave, recreation and flex leave and other leave entitlements • Attractive salary package of up to $131,845.59 (salary range $106,025.00 - $117,363.00). Total remuneration package includes salary plus employer's 11% contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading. • Flexible work options working within operational requirements • Mental Health & Wellbeing programs and services • Operational and leadership training and development opportunities via LinkedIn Learning and other training avenues to build and maintain skills • Comprehensive immunisation programs including the flu vaccine • Opportunities to build invaluable relationships across emergency service agencies, emergency service committees and other Government and community organisations.  How to apply  Your application should include as separate attachments: • A cover letter (maximum of one page) briefly responding to the essential requirements and your interest in the role; • An up-to-date resume of no more than four pages detailing your skills and experience relevant to the role  Want to know more?  If you want to know more about this opportunity, please contact Rosie Sluman, NSWSES@hays.com.au  The role description is available here.  Talent Pool  A talent pool may be created through this recruitment process. A talent pool is a group of candidates who have undergone an assessment process and have been identified as suitable for this role or similar roles for a period of 18 months. Being part of a talent pool means that you may be considered for ongoing or temporary employment for a range of similar roles. This offers exciting opportunities for you to gain a wide range of experiences to build your public service career.  For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.  Applications close: Sunday 15th October 2023, 11:59pm.  The NSW State Emergency Service is a proud employer of a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from everyone regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, faith, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity. We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive and flexible workplace. People with disability are supported to access adjustments in recruitment processes and in the workplace, to enable them to demonstrate their skills and capabilities to meet the requirements of the job. As supporters of flexible working, we welcome discussions about how our roles can be undertaken flexibly.
job_description.563: Customer Business Analyst • Incredible room for growth and guaranteed career progression* • 5 weeks annual leave per year* • Office based in Manly, however Cape supports hybrid and remote working*  Who are we  We are a purpose lead tech company founded on the idea that every business should have access to the tools to help them save more money and improve their financial wellbeing. Cape is a fintech servicing small to mid sized businesses with a corporate card offering that is powered up by an expense management platform to allow you to set controls and rules around spend, putting businesses back in control of their cash.  We are a diverse team, made up of Tech Aficionados, Financial Services gurus, FinTech veterans and  Tech Newcomers all with one purpose in mind, we are passionate about what we do, we love to share our ideas and collaboration is our driving force.  Exciting times lie ahead, Cape is currently in the beta testing phase and we are full steam ahead with developing our platform. You’ve caught us at a good time as we have successfully secured a 33.1 million dollar fundraise and are currently in the process of our next round. Our best work is yet to come and we want you to be a part of this journey. Cape is not only product focused, we are also devoted to our people.  We value an impeccable culture, a team who are on a mission to make a real impact, steered by our core values ‘SAVE’,  About the role  As a Customer Business Analyst at Cape, you will assist with the end to end risk assessment of our customers both during the onboarding process and on an ongoing basis.You will see first hand and learn how to develop and implement a sophisticated decision engine. You will help with setting up Underwriting  Cases, inputting data and ensuring Cape has a clean Audit trial of the decisions that we are making. On top of this, you will produce dashboards and reports to drive decisions on process improvements.  On any given day you will • Review cases and ensure all data is available for an UW to complete the case; • Use third party tools and integrations to gather data and ensure our systems are processing them correctly. • Assist in ‘Anti-Money Laundering’ and ‘Know Your Customer’ requirements and escalate matters as needed • Build reports and dashboard on our risk key metrics and present to stakeholders  What you need to be successful • An analytical mindset whereby you use data to inform your decision making process • Design and implement monitoring dashboards to track risk performance and customer experience • An eager to learn about credit underwriting and the fintech industry  Nice to Haves • Graduate or still studying a business, finance or related field • Understanding of excel, SQL and BI tools to build out reports  Benefits: Our people are our number one priority. For this reason, we’re committed to supporting and rewarding our amazing team for their ongoing commitment and contribution. We offer a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your friends and your family: • Flexibility & Balance: Although we love what we do, we also appreciate (and support) the fact that life happens outside of work. We pride ourselves in our forward thinking hybrid working practices and are here to support you in defining what ‘flexible working’ means for you, your family and your lifestyle. • Did someone say an extra week of leave? That’s right! We’re all about supporting you to find the time to do what you love, whether that’s traveling, being with family or just taking a few days to yourself. All full-time employees get to enjoy 25 days of annual leave a year! • Workplace set-up: Regardless of where you’re based we are committed to set you up to do amazing things. This means that we provide you with state of the art technology and equipment to suit your needs from day dot! Obviously this also includes a great collection of Cape merch! • Ongoing Education & Resources: *We’re all about growth mindset and appreciate that individually and as a team we’re always learning. We have partnered with some amazing providers that will support your growth needs. Beyond this, we provide you with designated time in your week to dive into the tools and resources that we have available. • Grow your Career: *Cape’s well and truly found its feet, but it’s still a young company, which means there is plenty of career growth and development for you! Plus we were the winners of  Wealth and Finance International’s Fintech of the Year Award for 2022, in addition to being listed by Fintechmagazine.com as one of the top 5 fintechs to watchout for in 2022 as well as being nominated by HackerNoon for Fintech startup on the year 2022.  Life at Cape:  Cape HQ is located on the beautiful beachfront of Manly. You get the benefits of watching the waves at your desk, eating lunch on the beach and knocking off work to finish your day with a surf.  But hey, if that’s not your vibe or maybe you don’t even live in Sydney, we fully support those who wish to work remotely. In fact we have Cape-iens situated all around the globe. At Cape we encourage you to work in a manner which best suits you and your lifestyle.  Come and Join Our Team  If you’re looking to join a company who are striving for change, passionate about new technologies and get excited about the prospect of building innovative products to change the face of Fintech and challenge incumbent “Big Banks” then come join us!  Cape is an equal opportunity, inclusive company, we are committed to creating a diverse environment for all our employees. We encourage candidates of any nationality, age, background, disability and gender identity to apply. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know, we are happy to adjust the recruitment process to suit your needs. Cape has proudly teamed up with Project F to actively support gender balanced hiring within the tech sector.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $62,569.21 – $85,552.25 per year  Benefits: • Employee stock purchase plan • Extended annual leave • Paid volunteer leave • Professional development assistance • Visa sponsorship • Work from home  Schedule: • 8 hour shift  Ability to commute/relocate: • Manly, NSW 2095: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)  Work Authorisation: • Australia (Preferred)  Getting Down Under Partners with 482jobs.com for our sponsored job listings. 482Jobs.com is the world’s largest job board dedicated to advertising Sponsored Jobs In Australia. Each job advertisement is manually checked to ensure the advertiser is offering Sponsorship so you don’t have to!

The Client: One of the fastest growing superannuation and investment management companies. ASX Listed. Committed to an inclusive, equitable, and forward-thinking workplace culture. Develop and maintain data-driven dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide valuable insights and drive business decisions. • Lead the design and implementation of BI solutions and ensure data integrity and accuracy. • Manage the end-to-end life cycle of BI and Analytics. job_description.566: We are currently seeking a highly skilled Senior Project Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to support project goals and objectives. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, with proven experience in working with large datasets and using tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Power BI for data analysis. As a Senior Project Analyst, your role will include supporting key client projects across various capabilities, including project financials, resource management, and dependency tracking.  In this role, you will coordinate and assist in delivering key project components while ensuring synergy with clients and Agile Management Office (AMO) team members. Your expertise in specific areas of project management and PMO operations will enable you to make an immediate impact. Key Responsibilities: Data Reporting & Analysis: • Collect, analyze, and interpret data to support project and program objectives. • Conduct industry and market research and analysis. • Continuously analyze data to suggest improvements to initiatives and processes. • Develop accurate and reliable reports for management decision-making, adhering to PMO reporting requirements. Project Management: • Develop and maintain project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation. • Monitor and report on project progress, identifying risks and issues that may impact the project. • Assist with developing and tracking project management processes to ensure activities align with established governance. Stakeholder Management: • Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop solutions and strategies addressing project challenges. • Liaise with system vendors and external consultants for process troubleshooting and evaluating new products and processes. • Assist in developing project communications, including PowerPoint decks, Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, and MS Project schedules. • Provide leadership and subject matter expertise to the project community. • Act as a champion and role model for AMO delivery. Compliance & Governance: • Communicate policies and messages to program teams. • Adhere to governance requirements, frameworks, and quality assurance standards for projects. Continuous Improvement: • Collaborate with key users to specify improvements to existing automated business processes and systems. • Document new or revised procedures or workflows. Skills and Experience Required: • Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and interpretation. • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, macros, and complex formulas. • Experience with large datasets and data-driven decision-making. • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is preferred. • Familiarity with database management tools is a plus. • Strong organizational skills, capable of managing multiple priorities and deadlines. • Experience using various project management methodologies, including Agile, PMBOK, and Waterfall. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to influence key stakeholders and produce clear, meaningful reports. Qualifications: • Ideally 5+ years of experience in a project analyst or similar role working on projects and programs. • Knowledge and experience in complex, immature environments. What We Offer: • The opportunity to be involved in significant key projects within AMO. • Experience working with the AMO Way. • A company that prioritizes mental well-being (we have our own not-for-profit). • Learn in a company with entrepreneurial spirit and the discipline of a big business. • Support from a hands-on management team. • Growth opportunities within a company on the rise. • Competitive starting rate with room for growth. • Flexible working arrangements, including days/hours and locations.  This is a full-time contract position offering competitive rates. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects and collaborate with a talented team of professionals. If you possess the required experience and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply today.  At Agile Management Office, we are a boutique consulting firm specializing in finding expert talent. We strive to respond to every candidate who

Job Description • Integrate databases and software into enterprise systems, following our strategy and policies. • Coordinate and conduct comprehensive system tests, ensuring compliance with requirements. • Ensure our applications and databases adhere to best practices in the industry. • Develop system design models, specifications, and diagrams to guide our IT group. • Create and maintain up-to-date documentation related to system configuration, processes, and planning. • Conduct research and make recommendations on products, services, protocols, and standards. • Ensure optimal performance and operational readiness of our core applications. • Collaborate with IT and business staff to seamlessly integrate software and systems. • Take ownership of team projects and drive them towards specific goals. job_description.569: The Senior Health Data Analyst, will support and lead an array of data analysis work of the Data Analytics team, using their skills with BI tools, SQL and SAS coding from a variety of health data sources. The role will undertake iterative data analysis processes with a focus on development of technical solutions, identifying and developing appropriate data sources and insights, based on the needs and advice of internal and external stakeholders.  Duties of the Senior Health Data Analyst will include, but are not limited to, the following: • Conduct analyses and contribute to the interpretation of safety and quality health data, including the identification and advanced analytics using SAS and SQL from a range of data sources. • Analyse and interpret a variety of health data, information and literature, including synthesis into a cohesive narrative. • Identify issues and caveats relating to data sources and analytical methods. • Advise on strategy, risk management and stakeholder engagement in relation to the key program areas. • Undertake the complete range of procurement and project and contract management activities. • Develop reports, briefs, advisory group papers, correspondence, presentations and other documents. • Provide accurate and concise advice to the Data Analytics Manager on methodology and interpretation of outcomes. • Undertake other duties as required.  The successful candidate will have: • Demonstrated technical expertise and experience in data systems, metadata, assessing information requirements, data extraction and analysis. • Demonstrated understanding of the Australian healthcare system and a sophisticated understanding of the key elements of healthcare safety and quality. • Highly developed conceptual and analytical skills, including demonstrated capacity to analyse and interpret healthcare data and information from a range of sources and synthesise these in a coherent, accessible way. • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, and priorities, and identify and manage risks. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a demonstrated ability to consult, liaise, negotiate and develop productive working relationships with a wide range of individuals and interest groups and quality.  To apply for this position, please complete and submit an application form and upload: • A CV summarising your relevant experience and qualifications. • A two-page cover letter broadly addressing your suitability against both the position description and selection criteria.  Candidates must be Australian citizens to be eligible to apply.  In accordance with Commission policy, subject to any valid exemption, it is a condition of engagement that staff have an up-to-date COVID-19 vaccination status and are able to provide evidence of their vaccination status prior to commencing their engagement.  Questions about the role can be directed to Suraj Rasakulasingam (02) 9126 3501.  Closing date for applications is midnight, Monday 23 October 2023.
job_description.570: Marketing Data Analyst  Department: Customer Engineering  Employment Type: Full Time  Location: Sydney  Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000 / year  Description  Our Marketing Data Analysts work with our Customers to get their marketing and sales data into our Product, GrowthOS.  We've built DataOS to help with this process, so you'll learn that product and become a subject matter expert for our Customers. This role is a combination of Customer Success, Marketing Analytics with some project management.  You could come from one of those backgrounds or possibly Digital/Media agency strategy or analyst and want to move into the tech & startup world. The role  When customers with with Mutinex to measure their marketing effectiveness, you'll run the process to get their critical marketing data into our GrowthOS product, leveraging DataOS as the tool for gathering, collecting and ingesting that data. You'll be able to read marketing data and recognise the difference between good and bad marketing data. You can spot problems in datasets and know how to find & extract data from other sources.  Working in the Customer team with other Marketing Analysts, you'll manage multiple customer projects at once which will require good organisational skills. What we are looking for  Around 1 years commercial experience in roles that require analysis of marketing data Exploratory data analysis (EDA) Good SQL & Python knowledge Strong customer facing ability including communication, stakeholder management & time management Highly organised people looking to join and exciting, fast-growing tech start up  #J-18808-Ljbffr

We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You'll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.What role will you play?In this role you will work on analytical projects and deliver use cases to support our strategic initiatives, with a focus on our sales and distribution channels. You will collaborate across a variety of working groups in an agile work environment, apply statistical methods using SQL, R and Python to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets, and assist with driving automation to help deliver new solutions to business problems. You will also own the relationship with internal stakeholders and lead and mentor junior analysts.What you offer5+ years' experience working in a similar Senior Data Analyst/Manager roleExperience working with stakeholders in sales/BDM/account manager functionA degree and/or Masters in a quantitative subject - degree in statistics, mathematics, operations research, engineering (industrial, computer or electrical), or related fieldsExperience working in analytics teams or related functions, especially in sales analytics use casesExperience wrangling data using SQL/Alteryx and Python/R, working with cloud platforms incl. AWS and GCP will be viewed favourablyExperience with data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau/Power BIExperience with CRM tools e.g. Salesforce and familiar with agile principles and practicesStrong communication and presentation skills with all levels of stakeholdersExperience with productionising machine learning model is a plusWe love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.BenefitsHybrid and flexible working arrangementsWellbeing and service bonus leaveUp to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parentPaid volunteer leave and donation matchingRange of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeingAbout Banking and Financial ServicesBanking and Financial Services is Macquarie's retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and InclusionThe diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.
job_description.572: We are looking for an experienced Senior Analytics Engineer to join the growing Enterprise Data Team (MData). MData's aspiration is that data underpins the delivery of exceptional consumer experiences and enables retailers, suppliers and Metcash to better run and grow their businesses. It is a central team that is enabling data to be a strategic, accessible and valued asset across the Metcash Group supporting data & insights, analytics and ML/AI across business units. With the demand for data and insights continuing to grow, we are a looking for an energetic, Senior Analytical Engineer focused delivery of BI Solutions, managing data and ensuring its availability, reliability, and accessibility for use by data analysts, BI developer and other digital solutions.  As a Senior Analytic Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing business intelligence solutions using Microsoft data technologies. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders, business analysts, and Azure Data engineers to understand requirements, gather data from various sources, and transform it into core enterprise standard data models that can be used for self-service datasets, deliver meaningful insights and visually appealing reports and dashboards.  What you'll do • Develop and maintain end-to-end BI Data modelling solutions, including PBI Datasets, Azure Synapse Data Models, deployment pipelines and PBI dashboards and reports • Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specification e.g., conceptual and logical data models. • Contribute to the definition and structure of data extraction, transformation, and loading [ETL] processes to integrate data from diverse sources into Power BI • Develop complex Enterprise data models using DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and optimise performance for large enterprise scale datasets • Implement BI data governance and security best practices, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and confidentiality • Collaborate with the data engineering and solution architect team as well as the broader IT Team to identify and resolve data quality issues and opportunities for optimising BI platforms  What you'll bring • Proven experience as a Senior BI Data Modeller, with a strong portfolio of successful Power BI Projects, data modelling methodologies and data integration • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions • Experience as a Business Intelligence developer or Analytical engineer in data warehousing space • Experience with data governance, security, and compliance best practices • Ability to coach and help develop skills across other team members • Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field • Proficient in Microsoft Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, power automate and Azure synapse Analytics • Advance PBI Data model's optimisation skills using external tools e.g., DAX Studio, Tabular Editor, ALM Toolkit and solid experience on Azure Data & Analytics SaaS technology framework  What we can offer • Hybrid working - flexibility is in our DNA. • Free on-site parking and close to public transport • An extra week of annual leave after your first year as part of our Fifth Week program, and the opportunity to purchase annual leave to help you recharge. • Our Met Health wellbeing program is designed to help you enjoy work/life balance and get the most out of life. • Access to 12 paid weeks of gender-equal parental leave for primary carers, and three weeks for partners  We're all about celebrating success, and we're proud to be a WGEA Employer of Choice for Equity, an accredited Flex Ready workplace, and a Gold Standard Mental Health First Aid skilled workplace.  If you're a tech-savvy thinker with a love for local communities, you'll discover a fulfilling career and an opportunity to redefine the future of independent business.  Make your Mark!  #LN-SO1  #INSO
job_description.573: Job Description  Reporting into our Associate Director of Data Science, as a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst you will play a pivotal role in transforming, analysing, and interpreting our marketing data to inform strategic decisions. This role exists to optimise return on investment (ROI) for each of our marketing campaigns by bridging the gap between marketing initiatives and measurable business outcomes. You will lead a team of analytics professionals, ensuring that data analytics capabilities are leveraged effectively across our in-house marketing department.  We are looking for a dynamic and engaging senior analyst who is passionate about fostering a data-driven culture within HelloFresh to enable more effective decision-making processes through advanced analytics and team leadership whilst you work to transform raw data into actionable insights. These insights contribute to enhancing customer engagement, improving sales performance, and increasing our market share. Ultimately, this role adds value by contributing to the financial sustainability and competitive advantage of The HelloFresh Group. This role is ‘hands-on’ and will individually contribute to delivering outcomes including completing analyses, building tools, and developing models.  What you'll do... • Develop and execute analytics strategies to align with marketing and business objectives • Lead and mentor a team of 3 analytics professionals • Foster cross-functional collaboration with business units and tech teams • Manage the lifecycle of analytics projects, ensuring alignment with business needs • Implement quality measures for data and analytics models • Translate and present complex data insights to senior stakeholders • Regularly assess and report on the impact of analytics initiatives • Provide guidance on A/B testing  What you'll bring... • A Bachelor's Degree in a related field (Data Science, Economics, Marketing Analytics, Engineering, Statistics etc) • Hands on SQL & Python experience • An advanced level of Excel/Google Sheets • Experience in project management, with an ability to manage and prioritise multiple projects simultaneously • Hands on experience using Tableau or other data visualisation tools • Previous experience working with a Marketing Team and A/B testing  What you get in return… • Significant discount on our meal kits, 70% off from your first day • HelloFresh Academies, monthly internal learning & development • Working flexibility available with a work from home hybrid • A diverse and vibrant international environment • A guaranteed steep learning curve & boost for your career • Access to Headspace  Start Date: ASAP  Duration: Full time role. You must have the right to work full-time in Australia/New Zealand.  Location: Chippendale Head Office, Sydney  #LI-hybrid
job_description.574: About Tabcorp  Tabcorp is Australia's leading gambling entertainment company, renowned for our world-class brands including TAB, Sky Racing, and MAX. It’s an exciting moment in our history – a new era of Tabcorp. We’re bringing industry-leading products and services to our customers, leading with integrity, and creating value for our shareholders and industry partners by breaking into new horizons.  What You'll Do  As a Senior Digital Analyst you’ll join our Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence which is a game-changing hub of innovation and insights that is tasked with developing cutting-edge data and analytics solutions that tackle complex business challenges head-on.  Your role will be to partner with our Digital and Product teams to champion digital data analytics, support major digital initiatives and deliver insights that improve performance and create leading products and services. Therefore, you will: • develop digital insights leading to new and improved app and website features; • partner with developers on Adobe and Google Analytics initiatives; • drive digital engagement and growth through personalisation and tagging strategies; • analyze data to identify trends, understand user journeys, improve conversion funnels, and identify drop-off / pain points for customers; and • lead A/B Testing to evaluate effectiveness of digital marketing, web/app changes and conversion rate tests.  What you’ll bring  As a Senior Digital Analyst, you’ll have demonstrated experience in digital analytics role where you have developed a range of skills and experiences including: • strong experience developing strategies to drive digital engagement and growth across websites and apps; • experience in data analytics and exposure to website and mobile app development processes; • strong experience with Adobe Analytics or equivalent software (such as Google Analytics); • experience partnering with a range of stakeholders including product teams and software developers; and • ability to write and develop specifications for web and app tracking implementation.  Beyond technical expertise, you’ll be a passionate and attentive self-starter with a proven ability to deliver results. Operating in our fast-paced, flexible, and team-oriented environment, you'll need excellent communication and relationship management skills to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical audiences.  What You'll Get:  By joining our dynamic team, you will not only be part of redefining the future of our industry but will also enjoy a range of rewards and benefits, including: • Hybrid working environment, offering flexibility and work-life balance. • Comprehensive leave types, including cultural leave, volunteer leave, and 18 weeks of parental leave for all new parents. • Access to The Arena, a comprehensive health and well-being app that supports you and your family's mental and physical health.  Next Steps:  Apply today by clicking on the link above. For any queries, please contact Mark Harrison at mark.harrison@tabcorp.com.au.  Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you require assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au.  Please note that while all roles require background checks, certain positions may require successful candidates to apply for and obtain specific licenses from state-based gambling regulators. This process will involve additional background checks, potentially including providing fingerprint information.
job_description.575: Data Analyst • Market leading number 1 insurance brand • Hybrid work options • $140k package  You as the Data Analyst will play an integral part in the execution of the market leading brand's BI Strategy and ongoing support of the BI requirements, The role covers everything enterprise wide across the number 1 insurance brand in Australia for their sector.  About the company  The number 1 Australian insurance brand in a specific sector. They employ around 5000 Australians, they are a geniune award winning employer of choice. They are Asia pacific wide, dominating global insurance brands on Australian soil.  About the role  You will play an integral part in the company’s Data BI Strategy as a Data Analyst. You will have the opportunity to implement BI data industry best practices in a CD/CI. Working alongside enterprise BI data architects. With recent heavy investment in BI technology now is the best time to join.  Duties/responsibilities • Enterprise-wide BI data analyse • Accountable for daily reporting ensuring stakeholders up to date. • Working in continuous delivery team • Develop BI reporting solutions using enterprise BI technology. • Develop SSIS/SSAS/PBI models • Skills and experience required • Working knowledge of SQL, Tableau, PowerBI. • Knowledge of data modelling PBI, tabular data models in SSAS distinct advantage. • Understanding of ETL/ELT processes. • Analytical skills within a large data driven organisation. • Working with data management and datawarehousing. • Minimum 3 year’s experience in the business intelligence space.  Culture • A company that values career progression • Support with WFH options • A personal career development plan from day 1 • Supportive, open and empowering team culture  Company Benefits • CBD office • Flexible working arrangements • Huge skill up training plans  How to apply  Click APPLY or call Jamie King 0406 901 151 for a confidential discussion
job_description.576: Position: Automation Senior Data Analyst  Location: Sydney  Job Description ·  Core Skills • Understanding of data concepts and processes (DB2, Redshift, DMS, CDC, BIDA, various layers) • Would be beneficial to be able to query DB2 and Redshift to determine if tables exist already etc (not mandatory as engineers have been doing this) • Ability to elicit and understand data requirements from the stakeholder • Experience in working in an agile way, familiar with the ceremonies, culture and concepts • Ability to work well with the team and explain the requirements • Ability to break down the work with the team and create stories with the requirements stated • Ability to groom the backlog in advance of team needing the work including being ready for sprint planning • Ability to engage stakeholders well and keep informed, ability to have difficult conversations when required • Prioritisation of stories for team in sprint • Ability to understand a solution design and how it applies to work required • Ability to work with minimal oversight, self-starter  Nice to Have / Preferrable • Service Transition activities/coordination • Engagement with other teams for lining up external resources or work being done • Release planning – working out when to release, staggering releases so not too much for team etc  Job Types: Permanent, Full-time  Salary: $100,000.00 – $140,000.00 per year  Schedule: • 8 hour shift  COVID-19 considerations: Yes
job_description.577: Background: Working across multiple Lines of Business, you will guide a talented team of Engineers for enabling business goals to be delivered efficiently and effectively keeping our Engineering Delivery Teams at the top of industry evolution in software and data engineering, data science and machine learning concepts, practices, and technologies.  You will also be responsible for: • Providing clear direction and advice on data engineering best practices, standards and guidelines to enable build of collaborating with divisional, data and enterprise Architecture functions to create data product design and engineering roadmaps and promote through the relevant Design Authorities • Working in collaboration with the Chief engineers and Line-of Business Service Owner to engineer and build Enterprise Data Products • Engaging and partnering with the Head of Data Products and Head of Engineering in development and maintenance of a Data Products Framework • Support and monitoring developments in the Data Products, Data Science, Advanced Data Technologies industries presenting findings and recommendations to the Divisional Data Platforms Team and Data Architecture • Coordinating the planning and execution of Proof of Concepts in close collaboration with the Data Platforms Engineering and Data Architecture functions • Creating and updating Capability Maturity assessments across existing and emerging Data Products using the Scorecard to inform when to invest, maintain and when to retire • Demonstrating and communicating with Divisional Technologists and Business Partners the business and customer value of the Data Products and Services offered by Data Platforms • Engaging closely with the Data Engineering Practice and Data Science COE to ensure regular assessment and alignment of process and practise maturity • Assessing and understanding the evolving requirements of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Citizens, and other Data Professionals around the Division to ensure their experience in achieving their day-to-day outcomes is optimal – be an advocate for data professionals • Presenting at Engineering functions, industry events and forums to promote the Data Products and Services on offer What’s in it for you? We’re going through significant change, and this is an opportunity to work closely with our business through the next phase of transformation. You’ll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for over 200 years. So, we’ll back you in the development of your career, and flexible working. You’ll also keep learning to grow, backed by a fantastic team of people within a can-do, supportive structure.  What do I need? • You will be responsible, able to work self sufficiently • Demonstrated engineering experience guiding large teams of Engineers, Data Scientists and technical professionals • Advanced knowledge of Data Products /Data Mesh and modern Data Technologies including relational data, semi/unstructured data, data engineering frameworks and machine learning libraries/technologies • Advanced knowledge and implementation experience of Data Lakehouse on Public Cloud Services (Azure PaaS services preferred) and their usage and implementation across a complex data ecosystem • Excellent proficiency in Data Engineering, Data Science and Machine Learning spanning multiple libraries, languages and technologies • Proven communication and presentation skills in a technology domain delivered to a GM- Level audience • Experience developing Data Models, Architectural Designs, Patterns and Roadmaps in a Data context • Ability to play a mentoring relationship for the wider team • Capability to facilitate and foster stakeholder relationships  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.  key responsibilities • Working across multiple Lines of Business, you will lead a talented team of Engineers for enabling business objectives to be delivered efficiently and effectively keeping our Engineering Delivery Teams at the forefront of industry evolution in softwa  experience  5 years  skills  Data Platforms, Azure, PaaS, Product design  qualifications • Advanced knowledge and implementation experience of Data Lakehouse on Public Cloud • Services (Azure PaaS services preferred) and their usage and implementation across a • complex data ecosystem  education  Bachelor Degree
job_description.578: Employment Type: Permanent Full Time Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3 Remuneration: $122,850 - $139,559 Hours Per Week: 38 Requisition ID: REQ437308 Location: Cumberland Hospital  Where you'll be working Western Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) is responsible for providing primary and secondary health care for people living in the Auburn, Blacktown, and The Hills Shire, Holroyd and Parramatta Local Government Areas (LGAs) and tertiary care to residents of the Greater Western Region. We are committed to our vision of 'better health services for the people of western Sydney and beyond' and to the delivery of health care or related services in line with our core values of collaboration, openness, respect and empowerment.  What you'll be doing The primary objective of the position is to provide business analysis expertise to translate business data into meaningful insights to support informed decision making by developing innovative data analytics solutions.  The major focus of the position is to work closely with stakeholders as a project lead to manage development projects end-to-end and document and review current processes, gather business requirements, undertake business data analysis and identify opportunities for process improvement.  This role is required to liaise with stakeholders and system owners to understand reporting and analytics needs and document objectives and reporting requirements. The role also involves maintaining functional relationships with all stakeholders to gather information, understand stakeholders interests and manage expectations.  A key focus of this role is to utilise and improve agile project management framework and processes and implement change management initiatives to drive improvements in health services and patient outcomes  This role incorporates project management skills, business analysis skills, change management skills to design and implement analytics solutions.  An important responsibility is to develop and manage the implementation of HL7 (FHIR) real time data sets and other data assets for use in advanced analytics solutions.  Benefits of working for Western Sydney Local Health District • Paid Allocated Day Off (ADO) every month, in addition to your annual leave • Salary Packaging - lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees) • Meal entertainment lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees) • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional counselling and coaching service that offers confidential, short-term support for work-related and personal issues, which you and your immediate family can access • Managers Support - Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional consultative service for all managers, HR or senior staff that is confidential and unlimited for people management support • Fitness Passport - permanent employees and their immediate family members can sign-up for this affordable membership which allows access to an extensive range of gyms, pools and fitness services from multiple providers across NSW, • Generous leave conditions in accordance with NSW Health (State) awards Recognition of prior relevant service may be considered toward commencing salary • Leave may be transferrable from other public sector agencies in accordance with leave mobility provisions  People with disabilities who meet the selection criteria are encouraged to apply; and where required, WSLHD will implement reasonable adjustment consistent with industry standard.  Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal job applicants by providing information about applying for roles in NSW Health organisations. For more information, please visit Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.  Westmead hospital car parking allocation model is changing. There is a waitlist for parking for new staff commencing at Westmead Hospital. This does not apply for staff with disability.  Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.  Selection Criteria: • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or advanced degree in related discipline and/or relevant experience. Recent experience working across data or analytics focused roles utilising a consultative approach to solving business problems using PRINCE2 Agile methodology. • Strong knowledge and practical experience in working with Information Strategy, Data Governance & Architecture, Big Data & Analytics, Information Lifecycle Management, Business intelligence visualisation initiatives and experience developing software solutions is a key requirement for this position. • Strong analytical skills including the ability to analyse and interpret health information, experience in data modelling and a background of hands-on experience with ETL, database management, BI dashboards and application development. Significant experience delivering analytics and/or business intelligence projects utilising innovative thinking and the latest technology in data and analytics. • Demonstrated organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise competing demands and achieve results with a customer focused approach. • Proven application of problem-solving skills to address complex health data and analytics challenges. Proven ability to work with data architects, analysts and engineers to deliver solutions that deliver high value insights to business performance. • Demonstrated excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with extensive experience in engaging senior business stakeholders to communicate complex data and analytics concepts and ideas. • Proven effectiveness coaching and advising stakeholders, users and staff on the project management methodology, whilst always fostering a performance based and customer focused work culture. • Proven capacity to develop, implement and promote Business Analytics Services Corporate initiatives, including the capability to plan, manage change, improve performance and project manage.  Need more information? 1) Click here for the Position Description 2) Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact David Pryce on  Applications Close: 17th October 2023
job_description.579: Contract Type Contract Reference BH-370061 Industry IT Salary per annum - Min: AUD 55 - Max: AUD 55  3 Months Contract Position 1 day a week in the office Immediate Start  About the role One of clients government client is looking for a junior data analyst to join their team to join their team in Sydney NSW on 3- month contract position. The Data Projects & System Support Officer(Junior Data Analyst) undertakes a range of project research, analysis, reporting, implementation, and administrative activities to support the development and delivery of projects, in line with established project plans and objectives.
